<p>Ross</b>: Aw, how can you say that? I can&#146;t even get Marcel to stop eating the
bath mat. How am I gonna raise a kid?</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler</b>: You know, Ross, some scientists are now saying that, that monkeys and
babies are actually different.</p>

<p>(Joey tires of this, so he gets up to leave.)</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe</b>: Where&#146;re you going?</p>
<b>

<p>Joey</b>: Out.</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe</b>: With?</p>
<b>

<p>Joey</b>: (Spreading his arms wide) Yes.</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe</b>: Alright, could I just ask you one question?</p>

<p>(Joey nods his head.)</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe</b>: Have you two, you know... like... you know... you know... yet?</p>
<b>

<p>Joey</b>: Well, not that it&#146;s any of your business, but, no, we haven&#146;t,
okay?</p>

<p>(Joey walks toward the door, then hesitates and turns back.)</p>
<b>

<p>Joey</b>: You meant sex, right?</p>

<p>(Phoebe buttons her lip, while the rest of the gang pretend they&#146;re not there.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler's Office, Chandler is working as Nina knocks, then opens the door.]</p>
<b>

<p>Nina</b>: Do you have a sec?</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler</b>: Ah, sure, Nina. What&#146;s up?</p>
<b>

<p>Nina</b>: I don&#146;t know. For the past couple days, people have been <b>avoiding</b>
me and giving me these really strange looks.</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler</b>: Oh, well, ah... maybe that&#146;s because they&#146;re ah... jealous, of
us.</p>
<b>

<p>Nina</b>: Maybe. But that doesn&#146;t explain why they keep taking my scissors.</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler</b>: Ah, well, maybe that&#146;s, ah, because you&#146;re getting a big raise.</p>
<b>

<p>Nina</b>: I am?</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler</b>: Sure, why not?</p>
<b>

<p>Nina</b>: Oh my god! (Rushing over to give him a big hug) You&#146;re amazing!</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler</b>: Oh, you don&#146;t know. (Presses a button.) Helen, could you make sure
we put through the paperwork on Miss Bookbinder&#146;s raise?</p>
<b>

<p>Helen</b>: (Over the intercom) So you still want me to send her psychological profile
to Personnel?</p>
<b>

<p>Nina</b>: What?</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler</b>: Helen drinks. (Insincerely) Will you marry me?</p>

<p>(Nina puts her hands on her hips, then gives Chandler a quizzical look.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel&#146;s, Ross, Rachel, Chandler, and Phoebe are sharing a bowl
of popcorn, while Monica carefully reads the instruction manual for her television set.]</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler</b>: Well, I ended up telling her everything.</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel</b>: Oh, how&#146;d she take it?</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler</b>: Pretty well. Except for the stapler thing. (He holds up a bandaged hand.)
Little tip: if you&#146;re ever in a similar situation, never <b>ever</b> leave your
hand... (he mimes Nina taking her revenge) ..on the desk.</p>
<b>

<p>Monica</b>: Okay, I think I get how to do this.</p>

<p>(Monica points the remote at her TV, and punches out a key combination from the book,
but the dreaded SAP logo remains and Spanish still comes forth.)</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe</b>: Alright, so, can we turn this off? Can we just make it... make them go
away? Because I can&#146;t, I can&#146;t watch.</p>
<b>

<p>Monica</b>: (Remotely turning off the television) okay, Pheebs, they&#146;re gone.</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe</b>: Okay.</p>
<b>

<p>Monica</b>: Are you alright?</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe</b>: Yeah. It&#146;s just, you know, it&#146;s this whole stupid <b>Ursula</b>
thing, it&#146;s...</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel</b>: Okay, Pheebs, can I ask? So, he&#146;s going out with her. I mean, is it
really so terrible?</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe</b>: Um, yeah. Look, I mean, I&#146;m not saying she&#146;s like <b>evil</b> or
anything. She just, you know, she&#146;s always breaking my <b>stuff</b>. When I was
eight, and I wouldn&#146;t let her have my Judy Jetson thermos, so she threw it under the
bus. And then, oh, and then there was Randy Brown, who was like... Have you ever had a
boyfriend who was like your best friend?</p>
<b>

<p>Monica and Rachel</b>: (Wistfully, shaking their heads) No.</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe</b>: Well, but that&#146;s what he was for me. And she you know, kind of stole
him away, and then... broke his heart... and then he wouldn&#146;t even <b>talk</b> to me
any more. Because he said he didn&#146;t wanna be around... <b>anything</b> that looked
like either one of us.</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel</b>: Oh... Oh, Pheebs.</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe</b>: I mean, I know Joey is not my boyfriend, or my thermos, or anything, but...</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler</b>: You&#146;re not gonna lose him.</p>
<b>

<p>Monica</b>: Hon, you gotta talk to Joey.</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe</b>: Yeah. Okay.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross</b>: No, come on, he doesn&#146;t know this stuff. If he knew how you felt.</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe</b>: But he&#146;s falling in <b>love</b> with her.</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel</b>: Oh please, they&#146;ve been going out a week. They haven&#146;t even slept
together yet, I mean, that&#146;s not serious.</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe</b>: Okay... Okay.</p>

<p>(Monica and Ross indicate that they mean right now.)</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe</b>: Oh, okay, oh.</p>

<p>(Phoebe gets up and walks across the hallway, but the door to Chandler and Joey&#146;s
apartment is shut. She knocks, and anxiously waits for Joey to come, but instead her
identical twin sister emerges wearing one of Joey&#146;s shirts.)</p>
<b>

<p>Ursula</b>: (Surprised) Oh.</p>

<p>(Phoebe reels back in shock, while Ursula defiantly leans against the doorpost as
though she owns the place.)</p>
<b>

<p>Ursula</b>: Yeah, um, may we help you?</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Closing Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's Balcony, Rachel is taking down the Christmas lights. Monica
sees her, so she leans out of the small side window.]</p>
<b>

<p>Monica</b>: Rachel, what are you doing? It&#146;s freezing out here. Would you come
back inside?</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel</b>: No no no no no. You wanted me to take them down, so... (she climbs onto the
railing to reach the top of a pole) ..I&#146;m takin&#146; &#146;em down. Okay? Whoa!
(Screams.)</p>

<p>(Rachel slips, loses her balance, and falls over the edge..)</p>
<b>

<p>Monica</b>: Oh-my-god Rachel! (Rushing out to look over the edge) Rachel!</p>

<p>(In the apartment below, Mr.Heckles is trying to relax and read his newspaper, but
Rachel is helplessly dangling upside-down with her ankle wrapped up in the Christmas
lights.)</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel</b>: (To Monica) I&#146;m okay! I&#146;m okay! (She knocks on Mr. Heckles's
window.) Mr. Heckles, Mr. Heckles could you help me please?</p>
<b>

<p>Mr.Heckles</b>: See, this is just the kind of thing I was talking about.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>End</strong></p>
</body>
</html>
117<html>

<head>
<title>The One With Two Parts, Part 2</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="#FFFFFF" link="#008000">

<h1 align="center">The One With Two Parts, Part 2</h1>

<hr>
<font size="3">

<p>Written by: Marta Kauffman &amp; David Crane<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Mindy Mattingly</a><br>
With Minor Adjustments by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Tennant Stuart</a> </p>

<hr>

<p align="center"><b>Opening Credits</b></p>

<p>[Scene: An Emergency Room, Rachel and Monica enter.&nbsp; Rachel is limping and leaning
on Monica for support.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b>: Ow ow ow. Ow ow ow ow. Ow ow ow. Ow. Ow. Ow. Ow.</p>

<p>(They reach the desk. The bored nurse thinks she's heard it all before.)</p>

<p><b>Monica</b>: Hi. Uh, my friend here was taking down our Christmas lights, and and she
fell off the balcony and may have broken her foot or or ankle or something.</p>

<p><b>Nurse</b>: My god. You still have your Christmas lights up?</p>

<p>(Rachel glares at the nurse, who gives Monica a form attached to a clipboard.)</p>

<p><b>Nurse</b>: Fill this out and bring it back to me.</p>

<p>(Monica helps Rachel over to a vacant seat.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b>: Ow ow ow. Ow ow ow. Ow ow ow.</p>

<p>(Monica starts on the form, while Rachel catches her breath and massages her ankle.)</p>

<p><b>Monica</b>: Okay, ooh, alright. Name, address... Okay, in case of emergency, call?</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b>: You.</p>

<p><b>Monica</b>: Really?</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b>: Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Monica</b>: Oh, that is so sweet. (Touched, she puts an arm around her friend and
kisses her.) Oh gosh, love you. Insurance?</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b>: Oh, yeah, check it. Definitely, I want some of that.</p>

<p><b>Monica</b>: (No longer touched) you don't have insurance?</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b>: Why, how much is this gonna cost?</p>

<p><b>Monica</b>: I have no idea, but X-rays alone could be a couple hundred dollars.</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b>: Wel-wel-well what are we gonna do?</p>

<p><b>Monica</b>: Well there's not much we can do.</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b>: (Like a big baby) Um... unless, unless I use yours.</p>

<p><b>Monica</b>: Hah, no no no no no no no no no no.</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b>: (Tapping the clipboard) well, now, wait a second, who did I just put as
my &quot;In case of emergency&quot; person?</p>

<p><b>Monica</b>: (Looking around to check that no-one's listening, then lowering her
voice anyway) That's insurance fraud.</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b>: Well, alright, then, forget it. (Getting up to go) Might as well just go
home. Ow ow ow ow!</p>

<p><b>Monica</b>: (Jumping up to make Rachel sit down) Okay, okay. I hate this.</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b>: Thank you. Thank you. I love you.</p>

<p><b>Monica</b>: (to the nurse) Hi, (tiny laugh) um, I'm gonna need a new set of (tiny
laugh) these forms (tiny laugh).</p>

<p><b>Nurse</b>: Why?</p>

<p><b>Monica</b>: (Tiny laugh) I am really an idiot. (Tiny laugh) you see, I was filling
out my friend's form, and instead of putting her information, (tiny laugh) I put mine.</p>

<p><b>Nurse</b>: You <b>are</b> an idiot. (She hands over a blank form).</p>

<p><b>Monica</b>: (Tiny laugh) yep, that's me, (tiny laugh) I am <b>that</b> stupid (tiny
laugh).</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Chandler, has split up his newspaper so Joey can look at the
funnies, while Ross's inappropriate joke at Lamaze class has come back to haunt him.]</p>

<p><b>Ross</b>: I had a dream last night where I was playing football with my kid.</p>

<p><b>Chandler and Joey</b>: That's nice.</p>

<p><b>Ross</b>: No, no, <b>with</b> him. (He mimes holding the baby like a football.) I'm
on this field, and they, they <b>hike</b> me the baby... and I, I know I've gotta do
something 'cause the Tampa Bay defence is comin' right <b>at</b> me.</p>

<p><b>Joey</b>: Tampa Bay's got a terrible team.</p>

<p><b>Ross</b>: Right, but, it is just me and the baby, so I'm thinkin' they can take us.
And so I uh, hah-hah, I just <b>heave</b> it down field.</p>

<p><b>Chandler</b>: What are you crazy? That's a baby!</p>

<p><b>Joey</b>: He should take the sack?</p>

<p><b>Ross</b>: Anyway, suddenly I'm down field, and I realise that <b>I'm</b> the one
who's supposed to catch him, right? Only I know there is no way I'm gonna get there in
time, so I am running, and running, and that, that is when I woke up. See I, I am <b>so</b>
not ready to be a father.</p>

<p><b>Chandler</b>: Hey, you're gonna be fine. You're one of the most caring, most
responsible men in North America. You're gonna make a great dad.</p>

<p><b>Joey</b>: Yeah, Ross. You and the baby just need better blocking.</p>

<p>(Feeling a little better, Ross fetches more coffee.)</p>

<p><b>Joey</b>: Oh, have either one of you guys ever been to the Rainbow Room? Is it real
expensive?</p>

<p><b>Chandler</b>: Well, only if you order stuff.</p>

<p><b>Joey</b>: I'm takin' Ursula tonight. It's her birthday.</p>

<p><b>Ross</b>: Wo-wo-whoa. What about <b>Phoebe's</b> birthday?</p>

<p><b>Joey</b>: When's that?</p>

<p><b>Ross</b>: Tonight.</p>

<p><b>Joey</b>: Oh, man. What're the odds of that happening?</p>

<p>(Joey begins to contemplate his ill fortune.)</p>

<p><b>Ross</b>: You take your time.</p>

<p>(Joey looks at his friends, thinks a bit more, then realises.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler</b>: There it is! So what're you gonna do?</p>

<p><b>Joey</b>: What can I do? Look, I don't want to do anything to screw it up with
Ursula.</p>

<p><b>Chandler</b>: And your friend Phoebe?</p>

<p><b>Joey</b>: Well, if she's my friend, hopefully she'll understand. I mean, wouldn't
you guys?</p>

<p><b>Chandler</b>: Man, if you tried something like that on <b>my</b> birthday, you'd be
starin' at the business end of a hissy fit.</p>

<p>(Joey gestures to show that he wouldn't dare...)</p>

<p>[Scene: The Hospital, Monica and Rachel are waiting for the doctors to arrive. &nbsp;
They enter and are played by Noah Wyle and George Clooney.]</p>

<p><b>Dr. Mitchell</b>: ..you add a pinch of saffron, it makes all the difference.</p>

<p>(They approach the young ladies. Dr. Mitchell consults Ms.Geller's admissions form.)</p>

<p><b>Dr. Mitchell</b>: Okay, errrr, Monica?</p>

<p><b>Monica</b>: Yes? (jumping as Rachel punches her arm) ..yes, she is.</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b> (as Monica): Hi, this is my friend Rachel.</p>

<p><b>Monica</b> (as Rachel): Hi.</p>

<p><b>Dr. Mitchell</b>: (Smiling) Hi, err Rachel. I'm Dr.Mitchell.</p>

<p><b>Dr. Rosen</b>: (Smiling even more and attempting to take over) And I'm his friend,
Dr.Rosen.</p>

<p>(Monica and Rachel smile back prettily.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b>: Aren't you a little cute to be a doctor?</p>

<p><b>Dr. Rosen</b>: Excuse me?</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b>: I meant er, (struggling to concentrate) young, young, I meant young,
young to be a doctor. Oh good, Rach.</p>

<p><b>Monica</b> (as Rachel): Thank you.</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b> (as Monica): Right.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, everyone but Joey is waiting for Phoebe to arrive for her
surprise birthday party.&nbsp; Rachel and Monica is telling Chandler about Rachel's
incident.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b>: ..so, he said it was just a sprain, and that was it.</p>

<p><b>Monica</b>: Uh, you left out the stupid part.</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b>: Not stupid. The very cute, cute, cute doctors asked us out for tomorrow
night, and I said &quot;yes.&quot;</p>

<p><b>Monica</b>: I think it's totally insane, I mean, they work for the hospital. It's
like returning to the scene of the crime. You know, I say we blow off the dates.</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b>: What? Monica, they are cute, they are doctors, (spelling it out in the
air for her slow friend) cute doctors, doctors who are cute!</p>

<p><b>Chandler</b>: Alright, what have we learned so far?</p>

<p>(There is a knock at the door. Someone turns the music off, then the whole party runs
and hides, except for Monica and Rachel who answer their door. Ross stands in the doorway,
holding a box, but everyone is too keyed up to notice that it's him.)</p>

<p><b>The Whole Party</b>: (Jumping up) <b>SURPRISE!!!</b></p>

<p>(Ross is so startled that he throws his arms up to defend himself. The box takes off,
then lands with a squishy thud, its contents oozing out onto the floor. Ross is not
pleased.)</p>

<p><b>Ross</b>: What the hell are you doing? You scared the crap outta me.</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b>: Was that the cake?</p>

<p><b>Ross</b>: Yeah, yeah. I got a lemon schmush.</p>

<p><b>Monica</b>: Come on, she'll be here any minute.</p>

<p>(The whole party gathers round as Ross puts the box on the coffee table.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b>: I hope it's okay.</p>

<p>(As Ross opens the lid, everybody looks at the mess inside.)</p>

<p><b>Monica</b>: Oh...</p>

<p><b>Chandler</b>: (Reading) &quot;Happy Birthday Peehe.&quot;</p>

<p><b>Monica</b>: Well maybe we can make a, a, a 'B' out of one of those roses.</p>

<p>(Phoebe quietly wanders in, to join the tableau.)</p>

<p><b>Ross</b>: (Still annoyed) Yeah, we'll just use our special <b>cake</b> tools.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe</b>: Hey, what's going on?</p>

<p><b>Ross</b>: Oh, we just...</p>

<p><b>Phoebe's Friends</b>: (Finally noticing the guest of honour) <b>Surprise!</b></p>

<p><b>Phoebe</b>: (Delighted) oh, oh, oh! This is so great! Oh my god! This was not at all
scary. Hi everybody. Hi Betty! Betty, Hi! (Thrilled) You found Betty! Oh my god! (Hugging
people) This is great. Everybody I love is in the same room, (still happy) Where's Joey?</p>

<p>(The party falls flat. Chandler tries to think of a witticism, but even he can't
help...)</p>

<p><b>Chandler</b>: Did you see Betty?</p>

<p>(Betty waggles her fingers to say &quot;Hi&quot;, but Phoebe feels her birthday has
been ruined by her twin.)</p>

<p>[Scene: A Restaurant, Ross is having lunch with his father who is examining his next
forkful.]</p>

<p><strong>Mr. Geller:</strong> I tell you one thing, I wouldn't mind having a piece of
this sun-dried tomato business. Five years ago, if somebody had said to me, here's a
tomato that looks like a prune, I'd say &quot;get out of my office!&quot;</p>

<p><b>Ross</b>: Dad, before I was born, did you freak out at all?</p>

<p><strong>Mr. Geller:</strong> I'm not freaking out, I'm just saying, if somebody had
come to me with the idea andndash;</p>

<p><b>Ross</b>: Dad, dad, dad, I'm talkin' about the whole uh, baby thing. Did you uh,
ever get this sort of... panicky, &quot;Oh my god I'm gonna be a father&quot; kind of a
thing?</p>

<p><strong>Mr. Geller:</strong> No. Your mother really did the work. I was busy with the
business. I wasn't around that much. Is that what this is about?</p>

<p><b>Ross</b>: No, no, Dad, I was just wondering.</p>

<p><strong>Mr. Geller:</strong> 'Cause there's time to make up for that. We can do stuff
together. You always wanted to go to that Colonial Williamsburg. How 'bout we do that?</p>

<p><b>Ross</b>: Thanks, Dad, really, I ju... you know, I just, I just needed to know,
um... when did you start to feel like a father?</p>

<p><strong>Mr. Geller:</strong> Oh, well, I, I guess it musta been the day after you were
born. We were in the hospital room, your mother was asleep, and they brought you in and
gave you to me. You were this ugly little red thing, and all of a sudden you grabbed my
finger with your whole fist. And you squeezed it, so tight. And that's when I knew.</p>

<p>(Ross is so moved by his father's charming story, that he stops eating.)</p>

<p><strong>Mr. Geller:</strong> So you don't wanna go to Williamsburg?</p>

<p><b>Ross</b>: No, we can go to Williamsburg.</p>

<p><strong>Mr. Geller:</strong> Eat your fish.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is just getting off of the intercom and turns off
the TV which is still in the SAP mode.]</p>

<p><b>Monica</b>: Rachel, the cute doctors are here.</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b>: (entering from her room) Okay, coming!</p>

<p>(Monica opens the door for Dr. Mitchell and Dr. Geoffrey.)</p>

<p><b>Monica</b>: Hi, come on in.</p>

<p><b>Dr. Mitchell:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Monica</b>: Hi, Geoffrey.</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b>: Hi.</p>

<p><b>Dr. Rosen:</b> Ah here, we brought wine.</p>

<p><b>Dr. Mitchell:</b> Look at this, it's from the cellars of Ernest and Tova Borgnine,
so how could we resist?</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b>: Oh, that's great. Look at that.</p>

<p><b>Dr. Rosen:</b> So, Monica, how's the ankle?</p>

<p><b>Monica</b>: It's uh...</p>

<p>(Rachel discreetly coughs to warn her.)</p>

<p><b>Monica</b> (as Rachel): ..well, why don't you tell them? After all it, <b>is</b>
your ankle.</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b> (as Monica): You know what, it's feeling a lot better, thank you, um...
Well, listen, why don't you two sit down and, and we'll get you some glasses... okay...
(They don't know what to do with their coats and Monica points to the living room) STAT!</p>

<p>(Rachel joins Monica who is in the kitchen area, opening the wine bottle. Rachel checks
that the doctors aren't listening, then lowers her voice anyway.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b>: Okay, listen, I'm thinking, why don't we just tell them who we really
are? I mean, it'll be fine, I really think it'll be fine.</p>

<p><b>Monica</b>: It will <b>not</b> be fine. We'll get in trouble.</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b>: Oh, Monica! Would you <b>stop</b> being such a <b>wuss</b>?</p>

<p><b>Monica</b>: A wuss? Excuse me for living in the real world, okay?</p>

<p>(Back at the couch, Dr. Mitchell and Dr. Rosen have concerns of their own.)</p>

<p><b>Dr. Mitchell:</b> So?</p>

<p><b>Dr. Rosen:</b> So... they sss-still seem normal.</p>

<p><b>Dr. Mitchell:</b> That's because they are.</p>

<p><b>Dr. Rosen:</b> (Nervously) okay, but you have to admit that every time we go out...
Women we meet at the hospital... It turns into...</p>

<p><b>Dr. Mitchell:</b> Willya relax? Look around. No pagan altars, no piles of bones in
the corners, they're fine. (Baring his teeth to clean them with his finger) Go like this.
(Dr. Rosen obeys.)</p>

<p>(Meanwhile, back at the sink.)</p>

<p><b>Monica</b>: I said we are not going to do it, okay? Sometimes you can be such a, a
big baby.</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b>: (Resenting the truth) I am <b>not a baby!</b> You know what? I swear to
god, just because you get so uptight every time we...</p>

<p><b>Monica</b>: Sure, every time, you're such a princess...</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b>: You know what?</p>

<p><b>Monica</b>: What?</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b>: You know what?</p>

<p><b>Monica</b>: What!?</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b>: You know what?</p>

<p><b>Monica</b>: (getting angry) <b>What!!?</b></p>

<p><b>Rachel</b>: Every day, you are becoming more and more like your mother.</p>

<p>(Rachel brightly limps back across the apartment with glasses of wine for the cute
doctors, leaving an open-mouthed Monica in her wake.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b>: Hello! Here we go!</p>

<p><b>Dr. Rosen:</b> This is a great place. How long have you lived here?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (as Monica) Thanks! I've been here about six years, and Rachel moved in
a few months ago.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (as Rachel) Yeah... (joining the others) ..see, I was supposed to get
married, but, um, I left the guy at the altar.</p>

<p>(Rachel tries to hide her alarm, but she squirms in her chair.)</p>

<p><b>Dr. Mitchell:</b> Really?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (as Rachel) Yeah... Yeah, I know it's pretty selfish, but haha, hey,
that's me. (Indicating a dish on the table) Why don't you try the hummus?</p>

<p><b>Dr. Rosen:</b> So, Monica, what do you do?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (as Monica) Aahh, I'm a... chef at a restaurant uptown.</p>

<p><b>Dr. Rosen:</b> Good for you.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (as Monica) Yeah it is, mostly because I get to <b>boss</b> people
around, which I just <b>love</b> to do.</p>

<p><b>Dr. Rosen:</b> This hummus is great.</p>

<p><b>Dr. Mitchell:</b> God bless the chickpea.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (as Rachel) (Suddenly laughing) Oh, god, I am so spoiled... That's it!</p>

<p>(The doctors don't know what to make of all this.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (as Monica) And by the way, have I mentioned that back in high school, I
was a cow?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (as Rachel) I used to wet my bed.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (as Monica) I use my breasts to get other people's attention.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (as Rachel) (Revealing her anger to point at her best friend) <b>We both
do that!</b></p>

<p>(Rachel lets her anger show too. Hideously embarrassed, the doctors drain their glasses
in the vicious pause which follows. The telephone rings, but the girls just glower at each
other, silently daring the other to move first. Finally both guys jump up, and Michael
wins.)</p>

<p><b>Dr. Mitchell:</b> (on the phone) Monica and Rachel's apartment. Err yeh, aayah, yeh,
just one second... (handing it to Monica) ..ah, Rachel, it's your dad.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (as Rachel) Hi, Dad. No, no, it's me. (Getting up to move further away
from Rachel) li-listen, Dad, I can't talk right now, um, but there's something, um...
there's something that I've been meaning to tell you...</p>

<p>(Monica glares triumphantly across the room, scaring Rachel who also stands up.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b>: Would you excuse me for a second?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (as Rachel) Remember back in freshman year? (Talking fast before Rachel
can catch her) Well, Billy Dreskin and I had sex on your bed.</p>

<p>(Completely undone by Monica's verbal destruction, Rachel almost loses her balance as
she staggers backwards, eyes agog, gasping for breath, and literally not knowing which way
to turn. Finally, she escapes into the bathroom while a resigned Dr. Mitchell looks
philosophically at Dr. Rosen who seems about remind him of the good old days at the pagan
altar.)</p>

<p align="center"><b>Commercial Break</b></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the next morning, Ross, Phoebe, Chandler and Monica sit
round the coffee table, playing Scrabble. Rachel, still in her dressing gown, is pleading
on the phone, her free hand shaking with agitation.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b>: (on phone) Daddy... Daddy... Daddy, why whyyy would I sleep with Billy
Dreskin? His father tried to put you out of business! (Rachel turns to Monica, clasping
the receiver to her bosom so Dr.Green can't hear, while mouthing &quot;You are...&quot;)
...dead!</p>

<p>(Monica smiles a sweet apology of regret, until she's distracted by Marcel as he
clambers all over her nice furniture.)</p>

<p><b>Monica</b>: Ross, he's got the remote again.</p>

<p><b>Ross</b>: Good. Maybe <b>he</b> can switch it back.</p>

<p>(Marcel changes channel to Bugs Bunny, who is speaking in Spanish.)</p>

<p><b>Ross</b>: Maybe not.</p>

<p>(Meanwhile, Rachel has taken another call, from a nurse she'd hoped never to hear from
again.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b>: Hello? (Listens) Um, yeah, uh, (snapping her fingers at Ross who takes
the remote from Marcel, then turns off the TV) Okay ah, hold on a second, lemme lemme just
check and see if see if she's here.</p>

<p>(All animosity forgotten, Rachel holds the receiver out as she limps quickly over to
her friend, who stands up in concern.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b>: It's the woman from the hospital admissions office. She says there's a
problem with the form. Oh, god, oh god...</p>

<p><b>Rachel and Monica</b>: Oh god, waddawe do, waddawe do, waddawe do?</p>

<p><b>Monica</b>: I don't know! Why don't you just explain? What do they want? Find out
what they want!</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b>: Okay (desperately hands the receiver over) no, you do it.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (taking the phone) Hello, this is Monica... Yeah??? Oh... (Smiles at
Rachel to reassure her) Okay, yes, we'll be right, we'll be right down.(Listens) Thank
you. (Hangs up)</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b>: What?</p>

<p><b>Monica</b>: We forgot to sign one of the admissions forms.</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b>: Ohhh... (slumping in relief) Okay, you were right. You were right! This
was just not worth it.</p>

<p><b>Monica</b>: Thank you.</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b>: Okay, let me just change.</p>

<p><b>Monica</b>: Yes.</p>

<p>(Rachel goes to her room.)</p>

<p><b>Joey</b>: (entering quietly) Hey.</p>

<p><b>Ross and Chandler</b>: Hey!</p>

<p><b>Monica</b>: Hi.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe</b>: Trouble?</p>

<p><b>Joey</b>: Your sister stood me up the other night.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe</b>: Oh, no. Don't you <b>hate</b> it when people aren't <b>there</b> for
you?</p>

<p><b>Ross</b>: Well did you try calling <b>her</b>?</p>

<p><b>Joey</b>: I've been trying for two days. When I called the restaurant, they said she
was too busy to talk. I can't believe she's blowin' me off.</p>

<p>(Phoebe wants to be angry with Joey, but as she watches him shaking his head in pain
and disbelief, she knows that it isn't his fault.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Riff's, Phoebe is entering. Ursula returns with two plates of chicken, but she
only has time to set one on the table, when...]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe</b>: Hey.</p>

<p>(Ursula turns in surprise.)</p>

<p><b>Ursula</b>: Oh!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe</b>: Um you, you got a minute?</p>

<p><b>Ursula</b>: Um, yeah, I'm just... (waving dismissively at the concept) ..working.</p>

<p>(Ursula points out a vacant table, so the twins walk over, side by side, to sit down.
Departing customers walk right past the pair. Sitting at the back, a hungry gentleman
looks most annoyed as Ursula sets his meal down in front of her. The girls sit.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe</b>: So.</p>

<p><b>Ursula</b>: Uh-huh.</p>

<p>(Ursula is genuinely pleased that her sister has visited her, after so many years.
Phoebe hesitates over how best to begin.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe</b>: Um, oh, I got you a birthday present.</p>

<p>(Ursula picks up a fork and begins eating the meat, while Phoebe removes a present from
her bag.)</p>

<p><b>Ursula</b>: Oh, wow! You remembered! (Opening it) Oh! It's a Judy Jetson thermos!</p>

<p>(She laughs at the childhood memory. Phoebe smiles at being able to make her point.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe</b>: Right, like the kind you...</p>

<p><b>Ursula</b>: Right... Oh, I got something for you, too.</p>

<p>(Ursula gets up to fetch a box from her bag by the counter.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe</b>: How'd you know I was coming?</p>

<p><b>Ursula</b>: Um, yeah, um, twin thing.</p>

<p>(Ursula puts the box directly into Phoebe's hand. Phoebe brightens.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe</b>: I can't believe you did this.</p>

<p>(Phoebe opens the box, to find something familiar inside.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe</b>: I can't believe you... (holding up Joey's cardigan) ..did this.</p>

<p>(Phoebe's smile hardens as she packs the cardigan away.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe</b>: So... What's the deal with umm, you and Joey?</p>

<p><b>Ursula</b>: Oh, right. He is so great. But that's over.</p>

<p>(Ursula resumes eating her lunch..)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe</b>: Does he <b>know</b>?</p>

<p><b>Ursula</b>: Who?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe</b>: Joey. You know, um, he's really nutsy about you.</p>

<p><b>Ursula</b>: He is? Why?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe</b>: You got me.</p>

<p><b>Ursula</b>: Right.</p>

<p>(A waiter comes over for the stolen chicken. Ursula turns to him.)</p>

<p><b>Ursula</b>: Excuse me. Doesn't this come with a side salad?</p>

<p>(The man gives up, shaking his head.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe</b>: So, um, are you gonna call him?</p>

<p><b>Ursula</b>: What? (Indicating the departing waiter) Do you think he likes me?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe</b>: No, <b>Joey</b>.</p>

<p><b>Ursula</b>: Oh. No, no, he is so smart. He'll figure it out. (Offering to share her
food) Do you want some chicken?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe</b>: No. No food with a face.</p>

<p><b>Ursula</b>: You have not changed!</p>

<p>(Ursula's eyes dance as she laughs and smiles, simply glad to be back with her sister.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe</b>: Yeah, you too.</p>

<p>(Trying not to wrinkle her nose, Phoebe smiles back realising it's down to her to make
up for her negligent sister. Meanwhile, Ursula still hasn't received her side salad, but
when she attempts to attract the waiter's attention, he ignores her.)</p>

<p>[Scene: The Emergency Room. The officious admissions nurse is again on duty. Rachel and
Monica enter, looking worried. As they approach the desk, Rachel adopts a winning smile,
while Monica struggles to smile at all.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (as Monica) Hi, remember us?</p>

<p><b>Nurse</b>: (Grimacing) Mmm hmmm.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (as Rachel) Um, okay. You just called a little while ago about needing a
signature on the admissions form. Well, it turns out we need a <b>whole new one</b>
(little laugh) because uh, you see, I-I, I put the wrong name again. (Little laugh) 'cause
um...</p>

<p><b>Nurse</b>: You're <b>that</b> stupid.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (as Rachel) I am. I'm <b>that</b> stupid. (Little laugh.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (as Monica) Yeah, and and, I'm just gonna pay for this with a check.</p>

<p><b>Nurse</b>: Well, you know your insurance will cover that.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (as Monica) Yeah, I know... (mirroring her friend) ..I'm I'm just not
that bright either.</p>

<p>(The girls escape with a new form.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler is neglecting the game of <em>Scrabble</em>, for
he's busily drawing on his own childhood in an attempt to help Ross. Marcel chitters
about.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler</b>: Okay, worst case scenario. Say you <b>never</b> feel like a father.</p>

<p><b>Ross</b>: Uh-huh.</p>

<p><b>Chandler</b>: Say your son never feels connected to you, as one. Say all of his
relationships are affected by this.</p>

<p><b>Ross</b>: Do you have a point?</p>

<p><b>Chandler</b>: You know, you think I would.</p>

<p>(Instead of scampering, Marcel stretches his neck as much as possible, and makes an
unvoiced noise from his throat.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler</b>: What's up with the simian?</p>

<p><b>Ross</b>: It's just a fur ball.</p>

<p><b>Chandler</b>: Okay... (returning to the board) ..whose turn is it?</p>

<p><b>Ross</b>: Yours, I just got 43 points for 'KIDNEY'.</p>

<p><b>Chandler</b>: No, no, you got <b>zero</b> points for 'IDNEY'.</p>

<p><b>Ross</b>: I had a 'K'. Where's where's my 'K'?</p>

<p>(The unvoiced hissing continues. In alarm, Ross and Chandler look at the monkey, who is
now in some distress.)</p>

<p>[Scene: The Emergency Room, Monica sits with Rachel, who is filling out an honest form
at last. Ross and Chandler hurtle in. Little Marcel, wrapped in a fluffy towel, is cradled
in Ross's arms. They dash up to the admissions desk. Ross is frantic.]</p>

<p><b>Ross</b>: You've got to help me my monkey swallowed a 'K'!</p>

<p>(Hearing her brother's voice, Monica gets up to stand behind Chandler, followed by
Rachel.)</p>

<p><b>Nurse</b>: (angrily) You go get that animal outta <b>here</b>.</p>

<p><b>Ross</b>: No, no you don't understand the animal hospital is way across town he's
choking I don't know what else to do.</p>

<p><b>Monica</b>: What's goin' on?</p>

<p>(Ross and Chandler turn at the voice...)</p>

<p><b>Chandler</b>: Marcel swallowed a <em>Scrabble</em> tile.</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b>: Oh.</p>

<p>(..then turn back to the desk when the surprise hits them, and Ross and Chandler whip
around once more. Monica and Rachel recoil slightly.)</p>

<p><b>Nurse</b>: Excuse me... This hospital is for <b>people!</b></p>

<p><b>Ross</b>: Lady, he <b>is</b> people. He has a name, okay? He watches <em>Jeopardy!</em>
He he touches himself when nobody's watching. Please, please have a heart!</p>

<p>(Ross's vigorous protest is attracting attention.)</p>

<p><b>Dr. Mitchell</b>: I'll take a look at him.</p>

<p>(Rachel, Monica, Ross and Chandler whip around for a second time, in formation.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel and Monica</b>: Oh, thank you.</p>

<p><b>Monica</b>: Michael.</p>

<p><b>Dr. Mitchell</b>: Rachel.</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b>: What?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (as Rachel) Monica.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (as Monica) Oh.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (as Rachel) Hi.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (as Monica) Hi.</p>

<p>(Monica smiles to cover her embarrassment, but Rachel sadly looks away...)</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Joey is playing &quot;She Loves Me, She Loves Me Not&quot; with
the petals of a flower, alternately looking hopeful and annoyed. Phoebe enters, but not as
herself, for she has changed the style of her hair and make-up to match that of her twin
sister. She hangs up her coat, revealing her new cardigan. Nervously, she smooths out the
identifying garment, approaching Joey who sits next to the main sofa.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (as Ursula) Hey.</p>

<p><b>Joey</b>: Urse...</p>

<p>(Phoebe nods as he stands up in delight.)</p>

<p><b>Joey</b>: ..ah, what're you doing here? I've been trying to call you.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (as Ursula) Listen, um...</p>

<p><b>Joey</b>: No, no, no, don't say &quot;listen.&quot; I know that &quot;listen.&quot;
I've said that &quot;listen.&quot;</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (as Ursula) I'm sorry.</p>

<p><b>Joey</b>: I don't get it. What happened? What about everything you said under the
bridge?</p>

<p>(Phoebe is almost thrown by this.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (as Ursula): Yeah, um... (nervously clears her throat) You know you, you
should just forget about what I said under the bridge, I was talkin' <b>crazy</b> that
night, I was so drunk!</p>

<p><b>Joey</b>: You don't drink.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (as Ursula) That's right, I don't... But I was, I was drunk on you!</p>

<p><b>Joey</b>: Oh, Urse... (He tries to take her in his arms, but she fends him off.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (as Ursula) Okay, yeah, so it's not gonna work.</p>

<p><b>Joey</b>: Why? Is it because I'm friends with Phoebe?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (as Ursula) If it was, would you stop hanging out with her?</p>

<p><b>Joey</b>: (Thinking carefully) no. No, I, I couldn't do that.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (as Ursula) Um, then yes, it's 'cause of Phoebe! So, you know, it's
either her or me.</p>

<p><b>Joey</b>: Then, uh, then I'm sorry.</p>

<p>(He sinks to the sofa, saddened by Ursula's ultimatum, while Phoebe follows, touched by
Joey's good heart.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (as Ursula) You know... (unconsciously putting a hand on his knee)
You're gonna be really, really hard to get over.</p>

<p><b>Joey</b>: I know...</p>

<p>(He looks up at her face and Phoebe, slipping out of character, smiles back at him.
Joey's voice becomes soft and warm.)</p>

<p><b>Joey</b>: I don't know whether it's just 'cause we're breakin' up or... what, but
you have never looked so beautiful.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe</b>: Really?</p>

<p>(Phoebe smiles, when Joey takes her face in his hands and kisses her. Joey gets up to
leave but stops suddenly. Phoebe silently shouts &quot;Oh, whoa!!&quot; to herself, and
leans back in the sofa to recover, a hand to her tingling lips. A thoughtful Joey is also
feeling <b>his</b> lips, so he hesitates for a moment, then returns for a better view, he
thinks again, cocking his head from side to side to regard her profile from various
angles, then...)</p>

<p><b>Joey</b>: Pheebs?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe</b>: (Automatically) Yeah. Oooh... (she's sprung.)</p>

<p>[Scene: The Hospital, Marcel lies on the operating table while recovering from the
anaesthetic, tucked up under a sheet like an infant in a huge bed. Ross sits beside him,
as a smiling Chandler, Monica and Rachel look on.]</p>

<p><b>Ross</b>: He looks so tiny.</p>

<p>(The door bursts open, and Joey and Phoebe rush in.)</p>

<p><b>Joey</b>: We just got the message.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe</b>: Is he alright?</p>

<p><b>Ross</b>: Yeah. The doctor got the 'K' out. He also found an 'M' and an 'O'.</p>

<p><b>Chandler</b>: We think he was trying to spell out 'MONKEY.'</p>

<p>(Ross does not approve of Chandler's daft theory.)</p>

<p><b>Ross</b>: Well, the doctor says he's gonna be fine, he's just sleeping now.</p>

<p><b>Chandler</b>: (Tapping Ross on his shoulder) So, you feel like a dad yet?</p>

<p><b>Ross</b>: No, why?</p>

<p><b>Chandler</b>: Hey, come on, you came through, you did what you had to do. That is
very dad.</p>

<p>(Ross does approve of this, but he's still not sure. The tiny figure stirs.)</p>

<p><b>Monica</b>: Oh, look, he's waking up!</p>

<p><b>Ross</b>: (Quietly) hey, fella! How you doing?</p>

<p>(All of a sudden, Marcel grabs Ross's finger with his whole fist, and he squeezes it,
so tight, that Ross finally knows what it is to be a father. He looks up at his friends,
who smile encouragingly, Rachel tenderly resting her chin upon Monica's shoulder. Ross
realises that Chandler was right and he's gonna make a great dad!)</p>

<p align="center"><b>Closing Credits</b></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, everyone except Joey is there.&nbsp; Rachel is looking out
of the window and Ross is handing out some Chinese takeout.&nbsp; There's a small SAP in
the corner of the screen.]</p>

<p><b>Ross</b>: Aqui est. (Here it is!)</p>

<p><b>Monica</b>: A quin pidio el pollo General Tso? (Who ordered General Sal's
chicken?)</p>

<p><b>Chandler</b>: Pudo aver sido General Tso! (It could've been General Sal!)</p>

<p>(Rachel points out of the window.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel</b>: Mira, mira, el viejo desnudo est haciendo el hula hoop! (Look, look,
Ugly Naked Guy is doing the hula!)</p>

<p>(The others rush to the window for a look.)</p>

<p><b>All</b>:Ewww! (Ewww!)</p>

<p>(Joey enters, happy again.)</p>

<p><b>All</b>: Hola, Joey! (Hi, Joey!)</p>

<p><b>Joey</b>: Hola, amigos! (Hey, everybody!)</p>

<p>(Marcel grabs the remote.)</p>

<p><b>Monica</b>: Mira, Ross, Marcel se llevo el control remoto. (Look, Ross, Marcel's got
the remote.)</p>

<p><b>Ross</b>: Lo que sucedio es que no le gusta la tele! (The thing is, he doesn`t
like the program!)</p>

<p>(Everybody laughs.)</p>

<p align="center"><b>End</b></p>
</font>
</body>
</html>
118<html>

<head>
<title>The One With All The Poker</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="white" text="black" link="green" vlink="black" alink="yellow">

<h1 align="center">The One With All The Poker</h1>

<hr align="center">
<font size="3"><i><b>

<p></b></i>Written by: Jeffrey Astrof and Mike Sikowitz. .</font><br>
<font size="3">Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Dan Silverstein</a></font></p>

<hr>
<font size="3">

<p>(The whole gang is helping Rachel mail out resumes while whistling the theme from <i>The
Bridge on the River Kwai.</i>)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Uh, Rach, we're running low on resumes over here.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Do you really want a job with <i>Popular Mechanics</i>?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, if you're gonna work for mechanics, those are the ones to work
for.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hey, look, you guys, I'm going for anything here, OK? I cannot be a
waitress anymore, I mean it. I'm sick of the lousy tips, I'm sick of being called 'Excuse
me...'</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Rach, did you proofread these?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Uh... yeah, why?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Uh, nothing, I'm sure they'll be impressed with your excellent <b>compuper</b>
skills.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (upset) Oh my Goood! Oh, do you think it's on all of them?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh no, I'm sure the Xerox machine caught a few.</p>

<p align="center"><b>Opening Credits</b></p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Ross and Chandler are sitting at a table. Rachel is working.
Monica and Phoebe enter.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey, guys.</p>

<p><b>Chandler and Ross:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hey... hi, ladies... uh, can I get you anything? (to Monica, quietly):
Did you bring the mail?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Lots of responses.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (to Monica): Really? (out loud): Sure, we have scones left! (to Monica):
OK, read them to me.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (reading): Dear Ms. Green, thank you for your inquiry, however... oh...
(crumples up letter)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (out loud): We have apple cinnamon...</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (reading): OK... Dear Ms. Green... yeah... yeah... yeah... No. (crumpes
up letter)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Wow!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (reading): Your Visa bill is huge!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (grabs the bill) Give me that!</p>

<p>(Camera cuts to Chandler and Ross at table.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You know, I can't believe you. Linda is so great! Why won't you go out
with her again?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I don't know.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Is this still about her whole 'The Flintstones could've really
happened' thing?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, it's not just that. It's just&#151;I want someone who... who <b>does</b>
something for me, y'know? Who gets my heart pounding, who... who makes me, uh... (begins
to stare lovingly at Rachel)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> ...little playthings with yarn?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Could you want her more?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Who?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (sarcastically) Dee, the sarcastic sister from <i>Whats Happening</i>.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Look, I am totally, totally over her, OK, I just... (Rachel comes over,
Ross lays head on table): Hiiii!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hi! How are you?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> We're fine, we're fine.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> OK. (walks away) </p>

<p>(Ross keeps staring at her, head on table. Chandler smacks him with a newspaper. Joey
enters, Ross and Chandler laugh at him.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Shut up!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> We're not&#151;we're not saying anything.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Uhhhh... Joey cried last night.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Thank you.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (to the girls) We were playing poker, alright...</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> There was chocolate on the three. It looked like an eight, alright?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, guys, you should've seen him. 'Read 'em and weep.'</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> And then he did.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, now, how come you guys have never played poker with us?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, what is that? Like, some kind of guy thing? Like, some kind of
sexist guy thing? Like it's poker, so only guys can play?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, women are welcome to play.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, OK, so then what is it? Some kind of... you know, like, like... some
kind of, y'know, like... alright, what is it?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> There just don't happen to be any women in our games.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, we just don't happen to know any women that know how to play poker.</p>

<p><b>Girls:</b> Oh, yeah, right.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, please, that is such a lame excuse!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Really.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I mean, that's a typical guy response.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Excuse me, do any of <b>you</b> know how to play?</p>

<p><b>Girls:</b> No.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> But you could teach us.</p>

<p><b>Guys:</b> No.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the guys are teaching the girls how to play poker.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (teaching) OK, so now we draw cards.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> So I wouldn't need any, right? Cause I have a straight.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, good for you!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Congratulations!</p>

<p>(Microwave timer goes off. Monica gets up.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> OK Phoebs, how many do you want?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> OK, I just need two... the, um, ten of spades and the six of clubs.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No. No, uh, Phoebs? You can't&#151;you can't do...</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh wait, I have the ten of spades! Here! (gives it to Phoebe)</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> No, no. Uh... no, see, uh, you-you can't do that.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, no-no-no-no-no-no, that's OK, I don't need them. I'm going for
fours.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, you're... (gives up)</p>

<p>(Monica comes back to the table with plates of food.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Alright, here we go. We've got salmon roulettes and assorted crudites.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe and Rachel:</b> OOooooo!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Whoa, whoa, whoa, Monica, what're you doin'? This is a poker game. You
can't serve food with more than one syllable. It's gotta be like chips, or dip, or
pretz...(look of realization)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (changing subject) OK, so at this point, the dealer...</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Alright, you know, we got it, we got it. Let's play for real. High
stakes... big bucks...</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Alright, now, you sure? Phoebe just threw away two jacks because they
didn't look happy...</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> But... I'm ready, so, just deal.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> OK, alright, last minute lesson, last minute lesson. (holds up two
cards) Joey... three... eight. Eight... three. (Joey is unamused) Alright babe, deal the
cards.</p>

<p>(Time lapse.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (throws down her cards) Dammit, dammit, dammit!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (to Joey): Oh I see, so then, you were lying.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> About what?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> About how good your cards were.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Heh... I was <b>bluffing</b>.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> A-ha! And... what is bluffing? Is it not another word for... lying?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> OK, sorry to break up this party, but I've got resumes to fax before
work tomorrow... (gets up to leave)</p>

<p><b>Guys:</b> Whoa, whoa, whoa!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Rach, Rach, we gotta settle.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Settle what?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> The... Jamestown colony of Virginia. You see, King George is giving us
the land, so...</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> The game, Rachel, the game. You owe us money for the game.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh. Right.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> You know what, you guys? It's their first time, why don't we just forget
about the money, alright?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hell no, we'll pay!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> OK, Monica? I had another answer all ready.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> And you know what? We want a rematch.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well that's fine with me. Could use the money.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (to Ross): So basically, you get your ya-yas by taking money from all of
your friends.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (pause)...Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes, and I get my ya-yas from <i>Ikea</i>. You have to put them
together yourself, but they cost a little less.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Look, Rachel, this is poker. I play to win, alright? In order for me to
win, other people have to lose. So if you're gonna play poker with me, don't expect me to
be a 'nice guy,' OK? Cause once those cards are dealt... (claps hands three times)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (pause)...Yeah?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I'm <b>not</b> a nice guy.</p>

<p>[Scene: Ross' apartment. Chandler and Joey are there. Ross enters with a pizza.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Alright boys, let's eat.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, did you get that from the 'I Love Rachel' pizzeria?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You still on that?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, come on. What was with that whole Black Bart speech? (mimicking):
&quot;When I play poker, I'm not a nice guy!&quot;</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You are way off, pal.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No, I don't think so, see Ross, because I think you love her.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Um.... no. See, I might've had feelings for her at one time&#151;not any
more. I just&#151;I...</p>

<p>(Marcel makes a screeching noise in background.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Marcel! Where are you going with that disc?</p>

<p>(Marcel puts a CD in the player.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You are not putting that on again! Marcel, OK&#151;if you press that
button, you are in very, very big trouble.</p>

<p>(<i>The Lion Sleeps Tonight</i> starts to play. Marcel starts to dance.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel, Monica, and Phoebe are there.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (opening mail) Can you believe what a jerk Ross was being?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah, I know. He can get really competitive.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ha. Ha, ha.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, hello, kettle? This is Monica. You're black.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Please! I am not as bad as Ross.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, I beg to differ. The <i>Pictionary</i> incident?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> That was <b>not</b> an incident! I-I was gesturing, a-and the plate
slipped out of my hand.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oooooh. (reads letter) (surprised): Oh! I got an interview! I got an
interview!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You're kidding! Where? Where?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (in disbelief): Sak's... Fifth... Avenue.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, Rachel!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, it's like the mother ship is calling you home.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well, what's the job?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Assistant buyer. Oh! I would be shopping... for a living!</p>

<p>(Knock on door.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> OK, look. That is Aunt Iris. This woman has been playing poker since she
was five. You gotta listen to every word she says. (opens door) Hi!</p>

<p><b>Aunt Iris:</b> Is Tony Randall dead?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I don't think so.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Why?</p>

<p><b>Aunt Iris:</b> Well, he may be now, because I think I hit him with my car.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh my God!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Really?</p>

<p><b>Aunt Iris:</b> No! That's bluffing. Lesson number one. (walks into kitchen) Let me
tell you something... everything you hear at a poker game is pure crap. (to Phoebe): Nice
earrings.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Thank y... (thinks about it)</p>

<p><b>Aunt Iris:</b> Girls, sit down.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Uh, Aunt Iris? This is Phoebe, and that's Rachel...</p>

<p><b>Aunt Iris:</b> Yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah, listen, I am parked at a meter. Let's
do it.</p>

<p>[Scene: Ross's apartment, everyone but Rachel is seated around his table. <i>The Lion
Sleep Tonight</i> plays in the background.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ross, could we please, please, please listen to anything else?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Alright.</p>

<p>(Ross shuts off the CD player. Marcel runs into the bedroom and slams the door.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I'm gonna pay for <b>that</b> tonight.</p>

<p>(Knock on door. Ross opens it. Rachel enters.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Guys! Guess what, guess what, guess what, guess what!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Um, ok... the... the fifth dentist caved and now they're all
recommending <i>Trident</i>?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Noooo... the interview! She loved me! She absolutely loved me. We talked
for like two and a half hours, we have the same taste in clothes, and&#151;oh, I went to
camp with her cousin... And, oh, the job is perfect. I can do this. I can do this well!</p>

<p><b>All:</b> That's great! That's wonderful!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh God, oh, and then she told the funniest story...</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> OK, great. You'll tell us and we'll laugh. Let's play poker.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Alright now listen, you guys, we talked about it, and if you don't want to
play, we completely understand.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh yes, yes, we could play some other game... like, uh, I don't
know... <i>Pictionary</i>?</p>

<p>(The guys all duck under the table.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Ha, ha, very funny, very funny. But I think we'd like to give poker
another try. Shall we, ladies?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe and Rachel:</b> Yes, we should. I think we should.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Uh, Rach, do you want me to shuffle those?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No, no, thats OK. Y'know, I think I'm gonna give it a go.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Alright.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Alright... (shuffles cards expertly, all the guys stare in amazement)</p>

<p align="center"><b>Commercial Break</b></p>

<p>[Scene: Ross's Apartment, continued from earlier.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> So, Phoebs owes $7.50, Monica, you owe $10, and Rachel, you owe fifteen
big ones.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> But hey, thanks for teachin' us Cross-Eyed Mary. You guys, we gotta play
that at our regular game.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Alright, here's my $7.50. (Hands them the money) But I think you should
know that this money is cursed.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, I cursed it. So now bad things will happen to he who spends it.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> That's alright, I'll take it. Bad things happen to me anyway. This way
I can break 'em up with a movie.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, that just leaves the big Green poker machine, who owes fifteen...</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Mmm-hmmm. Oh, so typical. Ooo, I'm a man. Ooo, I have a penis. Ooo, I
have to win money to exert my power over women. (hands over her money)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You know what? This is not over. We will play you again, and we will
win, and you will lose, and you will beg, and we will laugh, and we will take every last
dime you have, and you will hate yourselves <b>forever</b>.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hmm. Kinda stepped on my point there, Mon.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, everyone is there ready for another poker game.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> So, you gals wanna hand over your money now? That way, we don't have to go
through the formality of actually playing.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ooooh, that's fine. We'll see who has the last laugh there, monkey boy.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> OK, we done with the chit-chat? Are we ready to play some serious poker?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (holding a card and waving it in front of her face) Hey you guys, look,
the one-eyed jack follows me wherever I go. (they look at her) Right, OK, serious poker.</p>

<p>(Ross gets up from the table.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Excuse me, where are you going?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Uh... to the bathroom.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Do you want to go to the bathroom, or do you wanna play poker?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I want to go to the bathroom. (exits)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Alright, well, I'm gonna order a pizza. (gets up)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh no-no-no-no-no, I'm still waiting to hear from that job and the store
closes at nine, so you can eat then.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> That's fine. I'll just have a <i>Tic-Tac</i> to hold me over.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Alright, Cincinnati, no blinds, everybody ante. (deals cards)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (looks at her cards) Yes! (everyone looks at her) .... or no.</p>

<p>(Ross comes back from bathroom.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Alright. (to Rachel): Your money's mine, Green.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Your fly is open, Geller. (he checks it, and zips up)</p>

<p>(Time lapse.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> You guys, you know what I just realized? 'Joker' is 'poker' with a 'J.'
Coincidence?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey, that's... that's 'joincidence' with a 'C'!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Uh... Phoebe? Phoebe?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah. Um... I'm out. (throws in cards)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I'm in.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Me too.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Me too. Alright, whattaya got.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, you better hop outta the shower, cause... I gotta flush. (lays down
cards)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, well, well, hop back in bucko, cause I got four sixes! (lays down
cards) I won! I actually won! Oh my God! Y'know what? (collects chips) I think I'm gonna
make a little Ross pile. (holds up a chip) I think that one was Ross's, and I
think&#151;oh&#151;that one was Ross's. Yes! (Starts singing): <i>Well, I have got your
money, and you'll never see it</i>...</p>

<p>(Ross stands up.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> And your fly's still open...</p>

<p>(Ross looks down.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ha, I made you look.... </p>

<p>(Time lapse.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I couldn't be inner. Monica?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Monica, in or out?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (slams down cards) I hate this game! </p>

<p>(Joey slides a plate away from Monica towards Chandler, who hides it under the table.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> OK Joey, your bet.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ahhh, I fold like a cheap hooker who got hit in the stomach by a fat guy
with sores on his face. (the girls look at him, confused) Oh, I'm out.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ross?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, I am very in.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Chandler?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Couldn't be more out. (throws in cards)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Me too. Rachel.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Uh, I will see you... and I'll raise you. (throws chips in pot) What do
you say... want to waste another buck?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, not this time. (he folds) So... what'd you have?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I'm not telling. (collects chips)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Come on, show them to me. (reaches for her cards, Rachel covers them up)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No..!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Show them to me!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Get your hands out of there! No!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Let me see! Show them!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Y'know, I've had dates like this.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (deals new hand) Boy, you really can't stand to lose, can you? Your
whole face is getting red... little veins popping out on your temple...</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Plus that shirt doesn't really match those pants.</p>

<p>(Ross is visibly upset.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> First of all, I'm not losing...</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, you are losing. Definitely losing. (phone rings)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Let's not talk about losing. Just deal the...</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (answering phone) Hel-lo, Rachel Green.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (mimicking Rachel) Mee mee, mee-mee mee.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (on phone) Excuse me. (covers up phone; to Ross) It's about the <b>job</b>.</p>

<p>(Rachel walks into kitchen to talk on the phone.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Barbara! Hi, how are you? (Listens) Uh-huh. (Listens) No, I understand.
Yeah. Oh, oh, come on, no, I'm fine. Don't be silly. Yeah... oh, but you know, if-if
anything else opens up, plea&#151;Hello? Hello? (hangs up phone, very depressed)</p>

<p>(Rachel goes back and sits down. The rest don't know what to say.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Sorry, Rach.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Y'know, there's gonna be lots of other stuff.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah...(sigh)....OK. Where were we? Oh, OK... five card draw, uh...
jacks or better... nothing wild, everybody ante.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Look, Rachel, we don't have to do this.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yes, we do. (pause)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Alright, check.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Check.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I'm in for fifty cents. (throws it in)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Call.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I'm in.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I see your fifty cents... and I raise you... five dollars. (throws it
in)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I thought, uh... it was a fifty cent limit.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, I just lost a job, and I'd like to raise the bet five bucks. Does
anybody have a problem with that?</p>

<p>(Everyone says no and folds, except for Ross, who thinks about it.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (to Ross): Loser?</p>

<p>(Chandler, Monica, Joey, and Phoebe back their chairs away from the table.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, I fold. (lays cards down, and gets up)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What do you mean, you fold? Hey, come on! What is this? I thought that
'once the cards were dealt, I'm not a nice guy.' I mean, what, were you just full of it?</p>

<p>(Ross thinks it over, finally sits down and picks up his cards.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I'm in. (throws in chips)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> How many you want?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> One. (Rachel gives him the card.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Dealer takes two. (she deals herself two cards) What do you bet?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I bet two dollars. (throws it in)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> OK... see your two... and I raise you twenty. (throws it in)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I see your twenty, raise you twenty-five. (throws it in)</p>

<p>(The other four look amazed at the large pot.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> See your twenty-five...and...uh, Monica, get my purse.</p>

<p>(Monica gets up, looks in Rachel's purse.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Rachel, there's nothing in it.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> OK, then get me your purse.</p>

<p>(Monica gets Rachel her purse.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> OK, here you go. Good luck.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (to Monica): Thank you. (to Ross): I saw your twenty-five, and I raise
you... seven.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> ...teen! (throws in a ten-dollar bill)</p>

<p>(Ross looks in his wallet, pulls out two dollars.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (to Joey): Joey, I'm a little shy.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> That's OK, Ross, you can ask me. What?</p>

<p>(Ross looks at Joey, dumbfounded at his stupidity.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (to Ross): What do you need, what do you need?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Fifteen.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Alright, here's ten. (gives it to him)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Here, I got five, I got five. (Ross takes the money)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Thank you.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Good luck.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (to Rachel): OK, I am calling your seventeen. What do you got?</p>

<p>(Long pause as they both look at each other.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (lays down cards) Full house.</p>

<p>(Ross stares at her. Thinks about it. Puts cards on table, face down.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You got me.</p>

<p>(Monica and Phoebe get up and start celebrating in the kitchen, pouring wine and
singing. Rachel, shocked, goes to join them.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (to Ross): Ahhh, that's alright. Y'know, that's a tough hand to beat.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (to Ross): I thought we had them!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, well, when you don't have the cards, you don't have the cards, you
know. (looks at Rachel) But, uh... look how happy she is. (smiles)</p>

<p>(Chandler and Joey look at her, and then look back at him. They dive for Ross's hand to
see what he had, and he tries to stop them from looking.)</p>

<p align="center"><b>Closing Credits</b></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, all six are playing <i>Pictionary</i> at Monica's
apartment. Monica is drawing a picture, and the three guys are guessing. She draws what
looks like an airplane.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> <em>Airplane</em>! <em>Airport</em>! <em>Airport '75</em>! <em>Airport
'77</em>! <em>Airport '79</em>!</p>

<p>(Timer goes off.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, time's up.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (pointing at the drawing, upset) Bye... bye... <b>BIRDIE</b>.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> <b>That's</b> a bird?</p>

<p>(Monica glares at Phoebe.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> That's a <b>bird</b>!</p>

<p>(Monica sits, Rachel gets up.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> OK, OK, it's my turn. (reads the answer)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Go.</p>

<p>(Rachel starts drawing what looks like a bean.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Uh.... bean! Bean!</p>

<p>(Rachel begins tapping the picture of the bean frantically.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (triumphantly) <em>The Unbearable Likeness of Being</em>!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yes!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> <b>That</b>, you get? <b>That</b>, you get?</p>

<p>(Monica picks up a glass to take a drink, everyone ducks as though she was about to
throw it.)</p>
</font>

<p align="center"><strong><font size="3">End</font></strong></p>
</body>
</html>
119<html>

<head>
<title>The One Where the Monkey Gets Away</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="white" text="black" link="green" vlink="black" alink="yellow">

<h1 align="center">The One Where the Monkey Gets Away</h1>

<hr align="center">

<p>Written by: Jeffrey Astrof &amp; Mike Sikowitz<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">guineapig</a></p>
<font size="3">

<p align="left">{Transcriber's Note: The credits list two characters, Tia and Samantha,
who I assume are the sweaty women Joey and Chandler meet. However, I don't know which is
which, so I've simply called them Woman #1 and Woman #2.}</font></p>

<hr>

<p align="left"><font size="3">[Scene: Central Perk, Rachel is talking to a customer.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, okay, I checked. We have: Earl Grey, English Breakfast, Cinnamon
Stick, Camomile, Mint Medley, Blackberry, and.. oh, wait, there's one more, um.. Lemon
Soother. You're not the guy that asked for the tea, are you? (Guy shakes his head) Okay.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Opening Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Monica enters with some mail.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Mail call, Rachel Green, bunk seven.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Thank you. (Examines it) Oh, cool! Free sample of coffee!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh good! 'Cause where else would we get any?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh. Right. ...Oh great.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What is it?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Country club newsletter. My mother sends me the engagement notices for
'inspiration.' Oh my God! Oh my God, it's Barry and Mindy!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Barry who you almost...?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Barry who I almost.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> And Mindy, your maid of...?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Mindy, my maid of. Oh!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (Takes it) That's Mindy? Wow, she is pretty. (Sees Rachel's look) Lucky.
To have had a friend like you.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel and Ross are eating Chinese.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Marcel. Bring me the rice, c'mon. Bring me the rice, c'mon. Good boy. Good
boy. C'mere, gimme the rice. (Marcel brings the rice) Thank you, good boy. Well, I see
he's finally mastered the difference between 'bring me the' and 'pee in the'. (Rachel
ignores him) 'Bring me the' and- Rach?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hi.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, I'm sorry. Oh, this is so stupid! I mean, I gave Barry up, right? I
should be happy for them! I am, I'm happy for them.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Really.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No. Oh, oh, I guess it would be different if I were- with somebody.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Whoah, uh, what happened to, uh, 'Forget relationships! I'm done with
men!' The whole, uh, penis embargo?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, I don't know. I guess it's not about no guys, it's about the right
guy, y'know? I mean, with Barry, it was safe and it was easy, but there was no heat. With
Paolo, that's all there was, was heat! And it was just this raw, animal, sexual...</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Wait-wait. I, I got it. I was there.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, I mean, do you think you can ever have both? Y'know? Someone who's
like, who's like your best friend, but then also can make your toes curl?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yes. Yes. Yes! Yes, I really do! In fact, it's funny, very often, someone
who you wouldn't think could-could curl your toes, might just be the one who...</p>

<p>(Enter the other four)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hi.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> ...Gets interrupted. Hi!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hi, how was the movie?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Wonderful!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> So good!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Suck-fest.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Toootal chick-flick.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I-I'm sorry it wasn't one of those movies with, like, y'know, guns and
bombs and, like, buses going really fast...</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey, I don't need violence to enjoy a movie. Just so long as there's a
little nudity.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> There was nudity!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I meant <strong>female </strong>nudity. Alright? I don't need to see Lou
Grant frolicking.</p>

<p><strong>Monica and </strong><b>Phoebe:</b> Hugh! Hugh Grant!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Alright, I've gotta go. C'mon, Marcel! C'mon! We're gonna go take a bath.
Yes we are, aren't we? Yes, we are.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> They're still just friends, right?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (To Marcel) And I will see you tomorrow!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> That's right, you're gonna spend tomorrow at Aunt Rachel's, aren't you.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, hang on, hang on. Does Aunt Monica get a say in this?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> 'Pwease, Aunt Monica, pwease?' Oh, unclench. You're not even gonna be
there.</p>

<p>[Scene: Joe-G's Pizza, the guys are there.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I can't believe we are even having this discussion.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I agree. I'm, like, in disbelief.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I mean, don't you think if things were gonna happen with Rachel, they
would've happened already?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I'm telling you, she said she's looking for a relationship with someone
exactly like me.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> She really said that?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, I added the 'exactly like me' part... But she said she's looking for
someone, and someone is gonna be there tonight.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> 'Tonight' tonight?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, I think it's perfect. Y'know, it's just gonna be the two of us, she
spent all day taking care of my monkey...</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I can't remember the last time I got a girl to take care of my monkey.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Anyway, I figured after work I'd go pick up a bottle of wine, go over
there and, uh, try to woo her.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey, y'know what you should do? You should take her back to the
1890's, when that phrase was last used.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is taking care of Marcel and they are watching a
soap opera.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Now, now the one in the feather boa, that's Dr. Francis. Now, she used
to be a man. Okay, now look, see, there's Raven. We hate her. We're glad she's dying.
Okay- (Marcel pushes down a cushion to reveal a shoe) Wh- wh- Marcel, are you playing with
Monica's shoes? You know you're not supposed to pl- whoah. Marcel, did you poo in the
shoe? (Takes the shoe into the kitchen) Marcel, bad monkey! Oh! Oh! (She notices the
newsletter and taps the contents of the shoes onto it, then folds it shut) Sorry, Barry.
Little engagement gift. I'm sure you didn't register for that. (She leaves the apartment
holding the newsletter at arm's length. However, she leaves the door open. Marcel runs out
in the opposite direction. There is a shot from the TV and Rachel runs back in) Who died?
Who died? Roll him over! Oh, c'mon, roll him over! Oh...! Well, we know it wasn't Dexter,
right Marcel? Because- (Looks down and notices he is missing) Marcel? Marc- (Notices the
open door)</p>

<p>[Time lapse. Now everyone but Ross and Phoebe is back at Monica and Rachel's.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> How could you lose him?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I don't know. We were watching TV, and then he pooped in Monica's shoe-</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Wait. He pooped in my shoe? Which one?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I don't know. The left one.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Which <strong>ones</strong>?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh. Oh, those little clunky Amish things you think go with everything.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (Entering) Hey. </p>

<p><strong>All:</strong> Hi.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Whoah, ooh, why is the air in here so negative?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Rachel lost Marcel.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh no, how?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> He- he pooped in my shoe.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Which one?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Those cute little black ones I wear all the time.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, which <strong>one</strong>? The right or left? 'Cause the left one
is lucky...</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> C'mon, you guys, what're we gonna do, what're we gonna do?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Alright alright. You're a monkey. You're loose in the city. Where do you
go?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, it's his first time out, so he's probably gonna wanna do some of
the touristy things. I'll go to <em>Cats</em>, you go to the <em>Russian Tea Room</em>.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, my, God, c'mon, you guys! He's gonna be home any minute! He's gonna
kill me!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay, we'll start with the building. You guys take the first and second
floor, Phoebe and I'll take third and fourth.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, what'm I gonna do? What'm I gonna do?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay, you stay here, and just wait by the phone. Spray <em>Lysol </em>in
my shoe, and wait for Ross to kill you.</p>

<p>(They all leave)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Anybody wanna trade? Oh...</p>

<p>[Cut to a hallway in the building, Monica and Phoebe are knocking on a door. Mr.
Heckles emerges.]</p>

<p><b>Mr. Heckles:</b> Whaddyou want?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Mr. Heckles, our friend lost a monkey. Have you seen it?</p>

<p><b>Mr. Heckles:</b> I left a Belgian waffle out here, did you take it?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Why would you leave your Belgian waffle in the hall?</p>

<p><b>Mr. Heckles:</b> I wasn't ready for it.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> A monkey. Have you seen a monkey?</p>

<p><b>Mr. Heckles:</b> Saw Regis Philbin once...</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, thank you, Mr. Heckles. (They move off)</p>

<p><b>Mr. Heckles:</b> You owe me a waffle.</p>

<p>[Cut to Monica and Rachel's.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (On the phone) Okay, he's a, he's a black capuchian monkey with a white
face... (Enter Ross) ...with, with Russian dressing and, and pickles on the side. Okay.
Thanks.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey. How did, uh, how'd it go today?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Great! It went great. Really great. Hey, is that wine?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah. You, uh, you want some?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, I would love some. But y'know what? Y'know what? Let's not drink it
here. I'm feeling kinda crazy. You wanna go to Newark?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Uh, okay, yeah, we could do that, but before we head off to the murder
capital of the North-East, I was, uh, kinda wanting to run something by you. Y'know how we
were, uh, y'know, talking before about, uh, relationships and stuff? (Uncorks the wine)
Well-</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh God, Ross, I cannot do this.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, quick and painful. (Starts to cork the wine) </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh God... Okay. Alright. Alright. Okay. Ross, please don't hate me.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, what? What-what?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Y'know Marcel?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> ...Yeah?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, I kind of... I kind of lost him.</p>

<p>[Cut to outside the window, with Ross reacting with disbelief. The shot pans back until
we see Marcel sitting on the window ledge.]</font></p>

<p align="center"><strong><font size="3">Commercial Break</font></strong></p>

<p align="left"><font size="3">[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, continued from earlier.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (Angry) I- I- I ca- I can't believe this. I mean, all I asked you to do
was keep him in the apartment.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I know, I know, I'm sorry-</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, y'know what, I guess it's partially my fault. Y'know, I shouldn't've,
uh, asked you to start off with a monkey. I should've started you off with like a pen or a
pencil.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (Tearfully) Ross, I'm doing everything that I can, I've got everybody
looking for him, and I- (Door buzzer goes and she runs to get it) Oh! Who is it?</p>

<p><strong>Intercom:</strong> Animal Control.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> See? I've even called Animal Control!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You called Animal Control?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Uh-huh... why... do you not like them?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Marcel is an <strong>illegal </strong>exotic animal. I'm not allowed to
have him in the city. If they find him, they'll take him away from me.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> O-okay, now see, you never ever ever told us that...</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> That's right, I.. 'cause I didn't expect you were gonna invite them to the
apartment!</p>

<p>(A knock on the door. Rachel swiftly opens it)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hi, thanks for coming.</p>

<p><strong>Luisa: </strong>(Animal Control) Somebody called about a monkey?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, y'know what? That was a complete misunderstanding! (Ross puts his
arms around her and they act all sweetness and light)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, we thought we had a monkey, but we-we didn't.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Turned out it was a hat.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Cat!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Cat! What'm I saying? Cat!</p>

<p>(Luisa nods, but then Monica and Phoebe run in)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hi. We checked the third and fourth floor, no-one's seen Marcel.</p>

<p><b>Luisa:</b> Marcel?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> My uncle Marcel.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, is that who the monkey's named after?</p>

<p><b>Luisa:</b> Oookay. Are you aware that possession of an illegal exotic is, uh,
punishable by up to two years in prison and confiscation of the animal?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh my God. You'd put that poor little creature in jail?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Pheebs, you remember how we talked about saying things quietly to
yourself first?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yes, but there isn't always time!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Look. I'm sure there's some friendly way to reconcile this! Um, have a
seat. First of all, we haven't been introduced, I'm Monica Geller.</p>

<p><b>Luisa:</b> Oh my God, you are! And you're Rachel Green!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah!</p>

<p><b>Luisa:</b> Luisa Gianetti! Lincoln High? I sat behind you guys in home room!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Luisa? Oh my God! Monica! It's Luisa!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> The Luisa from home room!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yes!!</p>

<p><b>Luisa:</b> You have no idea who I am, do you.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No, none at all.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> None.</p>

<p><b>Luisa:</b> Well, maybe that's because you spent four years ignoring me. I mean,
would it have been so hard to say 'Morning, Luisa'? Or 'Nice overalls'?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, I'm- I'm so sorry!</p>

<p><b>Luisa:</b> Ah, it's not so much you, you were fat, you had your own problems. (To
Rachel) But you? What a <strong>bitch</strong>!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Be that as it may, d'you think you could just help us out here on that
monkey thing? Y'know, just for old times' sake? Go Bobcats?</p>

<p><b>Luisa:</b> I could... but I won't. If I find that monkey, he's mine. (Leaves)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Dun-dun-duuuur! Sorry.</p>

<p>[Cut to another part of the building. We see Marcel jump in through a window and run
down some stairs, then Chandler and Joey come down from the upper floor without noticing.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Marcel?</p>
