<p><b>Joey:</b> Marcel?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Marcel?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Marcel?</p>

<p>(They come to a door and silently agree to try it. A very sweaty woman emerges)</p>

<p><b>Woman No. 1:</b> Hi, can I help you?</p>

<p>(Chandler and Joey are dumbstruck for a moment)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Um, we're kind of having an emergency and we-we were looking for
something...</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> A monkey.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes have you seen any?</p>

<p><b>Woman No. 1:</b> No. No, haven't seen a monkey. Do you know anything about fixing
radiators?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Um, sure! Did you, uh, did you try turning the knob back the other way?</p>

<p><b>Woman No. 1:</b> Of course.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh. Then, no.</p>

<p>(Another sweaty woman comes to the door and speaks to her friend)</p>

<p><b>Woman No. 2:</b> Did I put too much rum in here?</p>

<p>(Joey and Chandler shoot each other glances)</p>

<p><b>Woman No. 1:</b> Just a sec. (To Chandler and Joey) Hope you find your monkey. (She
starts to shut the door)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, nononowaitwaitwaitnono! Uh... we may not know anything about
radiators per se, but we do have a certain amount of expertise in the heating and
cooling... mileu.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Uh, aren't we kind of in the middle of something here?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes, but these women are very hot, and they need our help! And they're
very hot.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> We can't, alright? (To the women) We're sorry. You have no idea how sorry,
but... We promised we'd find this monkey. If you see him, he's about yea high and answers
to the name Marcel, so if we could get some pictures of you, you'd really be helping us
out.</p>

<p>(The women quickly shut the door)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, from now on, you don't get to talk to other people.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Marcel?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Marcel?!</p>

<p>[Cut to Monica and Phoebe searching the basement.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Marcel?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Marcel?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Marcel?</p>

<p><strong>Both:</strong> Marcel?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh-my-God!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Whaaat!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Something just brushed up against my right leg!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What is it?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, it's okay, it was just my left leg.</p>

<p>(Marcel makes a monkeyish noise. He is sitting in the corner)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Look, Phoebe!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah! Oh, c'mere, Marcel! Oh, Marcel, c'mere!</p>

<p>(Luisa appears on the stairs)</p>

<p><b>Luisa:</b> Step aside, ladies! (She loads a gun)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What're you gonna do?</p>

<p><b>Luisa:</b> Just a small tranquiliser.</p>

<p>(In slow motion we see Phoebe look at Marcel, then at Luisa. She jumps toward Marcel
just as Luisa fires the gun.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Run, Marcel, run! Run, Marcel! (Marcel runs off and Luisa runs after
him. Monica goes to check up on Phoebe) Are you okay?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, think so. Oh! (She notices the tranquiliser dart has hit her in
the butt and removes it) Huh. (Sways back) Whoah.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh gosh.</p>

<p>[Cut to Marcel walking along a hallway. He notices a banana on the floor and picks it
up. The hand of an unseen person grabs him and carries him away. Then cut to Ross and
Rachel on the street outside.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Marcel?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Marcel?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Marc- oh, this is ridiculous! We've been all over the neighbourhood. He's
gone, he's-he's just gone.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ross, you don't know that.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh come on. It's cold, it's dark, he doesn't know the Village. (Kicks a
sign in frustration) And now I have a broken foot. I have no monkey, and a broken foot!
Thank you very much.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ross, I said I'm sorry like a million times. What do you want me to do?
You want me to break my foot too? Okay, I'm gonna break my foot, right here. (Kicks the
sign) Ow!! Oh! Oh my God, oh my God! There, are you <strong>happy</strong> now?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, yeah. Y'know, now that you kicked the sign, hey! I don't miss Marcel
any more!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Y'know, it is not like I did this on purpose.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, no no no. Nono, this is just vintage Rachel. I mean, things just sort
of happen around you. I mean, you're off in Rachel-land, doing your Rachel-thing, totally
oblivious to people's monkeys, or to people's feelings...</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ross.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I don't even wanna hear it, you're just...</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ross.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, forget it, okay?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ross!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What? What?</p>

<p>(A man carrying a box of bananas walks past them. They stare for a minute and then
hobble after him)</p>

<p><strong>Both:</strong> Hey! Hey, Bananaman!</p>

<p>(Scene 4: Everyone in the hall outside Mr. Heckles' door. Ross is carrying the box of
bananas. He bangs on the door)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, this is so intense. One side of my butt is totally asleep, and the
other side has no idea.</p>

<p>(Mr. Heckles opens the door)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hi, did you order some bananas?</p>

<p><b>Mr. Heckles:</b> What about it?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Gimme back my monkey.</p>

<p><b>Mr. Heckles:</b> I don't have a monkey.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Then what's with all the bananas?</p>

<p><b>Mr. Heckles:</b> Potassium.</p>

<p>(There is a monkey-like noise from within and Ross pushes past Mr. Heckles and enters
his apartment)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Marcel? Marcel? Okay, where is he? Where is he? Marcel? Marcel?</p>

<p>(Marcel jumps into view wearing a pink dress. Everybody gasps)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Marcel! What've you done to him?</p>

<p><b>Mr. Heckles:</b> That's my monkey. That's Patti, Patti the monkey.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Are you insane? C'mere, Marcel, c'mon. (Marcel starts to go to him)</p>

<p><b>Mr. Heckles:</b> C'mere, Patti. (Marcel turns round)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> C'mere, Marcel. (Turns to Ross)</p>

<p><b>Mr. Heckles:</b> C'mere, Patti. (Turns to Mr. Heckles)</p>

<p><b>Luisa:</b> (Out of shot) Here, monkey. Here, monkey! Here, monkey! (Marcel runs to
the door and into Luisa's cage, which she slams shut) Gotcha.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, gimme my monkey back.</p>

<p><b>Mr. Heckles:</b> That's <strong>my </strong>monkey.</p>

<p><b>Luisa:</b> You're both gonna have to take this up with the judge.</p>

<p><b>Mr. Heckles:</b> That's not my monkey. Just the dress is mine, you can send that
back whenever.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Alright, I want my monkey.</p>

<p><b>Luisa:</b> No!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, c'mon, Luisa!</p>

<p><b>Luisa:</b> Sorry, prom queen.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (To Rachel) You had to be a bitch in high school, you couldn't've been
fat.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Alright. In high school I was the prom queen and I was the homecoming
queen and the class president and you... were also there! But if you take this monkey, I
will lose one of the most important people in my life. You can hate me if you want, but
please do not punish him. C'mon, Luisa, you have a chance to be the bigger person here!
Take it!</p>

<p><b>Luisa:</b> Nope.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Alright. Well then how about I call your supervisor, and I tell her that
you shot my friend in the ass with a dart?</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's. Rachel and Ross are there. Ross is trying to get the dress
off Marcel.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> It'll be nice to get this off finally, won't it? Yes it will. (Marcel
resists) Or we can leave it on for now, that's fine.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Y'know, with the right pair of pumps, that would be a great little
outfit.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Listen, I'm- I'm sorry I was so hard on you before, it's just I...</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, Ross, c'mon. It's my fault, I almost lost your...</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, but you were the one who got him back, y'know? You, you were great.
...Hey, we uh, we still have that, uh, that bottle of wine. You in the mood for, uh,
something grape?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> That'd be good.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Alright. (He goes to get the glasses. Then he hesitates and turns off the
main light. Rachel looks round and he acts surprised) The, uh, the neighbours must be
vacuuming. (He sits down and starts to pour the wine) Well, so long as we're here and, uh,
not on the subject, I was thinking about, uh, how mad we got at each other before, and,
um, I was thinking maybe it was partially because of how we, um...</p>

<p>(Barry bursts in)</p>

<p><strong>Barry:</strong> Rachel.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Barry?!</p>

<p><strong>Barry:</strong> I can't. I can't do it, I can't marry Mindy. I think I'm still
in love with you.</p>

<p><strong>Ross and </strong><b>Rachel:</b> Oh!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> We have got to start locking that door!</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Closing Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Monica, Joey, Phoebe, and Chandler are looking through Monica's
high school yearbook]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> This is me in <em>The Sound of Music</em>. See the von Trapp kids?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Nope.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> That's because I'm in front of them.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Eh. I thought that was an alp.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well, high school was not my favourite time.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I dunno, I loved high school. Y'know? It was just four years of parties
and dating and sex.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, well I went to boarding school with four hundred boys. Any sex I
had would've involved a major lifestyle choice.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Gosh, doesn't it seem like a million years ago?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh. Oooh! Ooh! Ooh! (She stands up and starts to dance around) Ooh! My
butt cheek is waking up! Oooh! Ooh!</font></p>

<p align="center"><strong><font size="3">End</font></strong></p>
</body>
</html>
120<html>

<head>
<title>The One With the Evil Orthodontist</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="white" text="black" link="green" vlink="black" alink="yellow">

<h1 align="center">The One With the Evil Orthodontist</h1>

<hr align="center">
<font size="3">

<p>Written by: Doty Abrams<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">guineapig</a></font></p>

<hr>
<font size="3">

<p align="left">[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, everyone is there.]</p>

<p align="left"><b>Chandler:</b> I can't believe you would actually say that. I would much
rather be Mr.Peanut than Mr.Salty.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No way! Mr.Salty is a sailor, all right, he's got to be, like, thetoughest
snack there is.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I don't know, you don't wanna mess with corn nuts. They're craaazy.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (looking out of the window) Oh my God. You guys! You gotta come see
this! There's some creep out there with a telescope!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I can't believe it! He's looking right at us!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, that is so sick.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I feel violated. And not in a good way.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> How can people do that?... (All but Phoebe walk away from the window in
disgust.) Oh, you guys, look! Ugly Naked Guy got gravity boots!</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Opening Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, everyone but Rachel is there.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I am telling you, years from now, schoolchildren will study it as one
of the greatest first dates of all time. It was unbelievable! We could totally be
ourselves, we didn't have to play any games...</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> So have you called her yet?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Let her know I like her? What are you, insane? (The girls make
disgusted noises.) It's the next day! How needy do I want to seem? (To the guys) I'm
right, right?</p>

<p><b>Joey and Ross:</b> Oh, yeah. Yeah. Let her dangle.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I can't believe my parents are actually pressuring me to find one of you
people.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, God, just do it! (Grabbing the phone.) Call her! Stop being so
testosteroney!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Which, by the way, is the real San Francisco treat. (Calls her, then
hurriedly hangs up.) I got her machine.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Her answer machine?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No, interestingly enough her leaf blower picked up.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> So, uh, why didn't you say anything?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, no-no-no-no. Last time I left a spontaneous message I ended up
using the phrase &quot;Yes indeedy-o.&quot;</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Look look! It's Rachel and Barry. No, don't everybody look at once!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, okay, what's going on?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, they're just talking...</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, well, does he look upset? Does he look like he was just told to
shove anything?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, no actually, he's smiling.. and... Oh my God, don't do that!!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What? What? What?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> That man across the street just kicked that pigeon! (Rachel enters.) Oh!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (bluffing) And basically, that's how a bill becomes a law.</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Oh!... Right!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey Rach!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> How'd it go?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Y'know, it was, uh.. it was actually really great. He took me to lunch
at the <em>Russian Tea Room</em>, and I had that chicken, where y'know you poke it and all
the butter squirts out...</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Not a good day for birds...</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Then we took a walk down to <em>Bendall's</em>, and I told him not to,
but he got me a little bottle of <em>Chanel</em>...</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> That's nice... now, was that before or after you told him to stop calling,
stop sending you flowers and to generally leave you alone, hmm?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Right,.. well,.. we never actually got to that... Oh, it was just so
nice to see him again, y'know? It was comfortable, it was familiar... it was just nice!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> That's, that's nice twice!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Rachel, what's going on? I mean isn't this the same Barry who you left
at the altar?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Duh, where've you been?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, but it was different with him today! And he wasn't, like,
Orthodontist Guy, y'know? I mean, we had fun! Is there anything wrong with that?</p>

<p>(Ross 'prompts' Chandler by hitting him on the arm.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Why?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I have my reasons.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay, how about the fact that he's engaged to another woman, who just
happens to be your ex-best friend?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> All right. All right, all right, all right, all right, I know it's
stupid! I will go see him this afternoon, and I will just put an end to it!</p>

<p>[Scene: Barry's Office, the post-coital Barry and Rachel are recovering on the chair.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Wow... Wow!</p>

<p><b>Barry:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I'm not crazy, right? I mean, it was never like that.</p>

<p><b>Barry:</b> Nooo, it wasn't.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ooh, and it's so nice having this little sink here...</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, everyone is there except Rachel.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (on phone, reading from a script) Oh, Danielle! I wasn't expecting the
machine... Give me a call when you get a chance. (Rattles some dishes) Bye-bye. (Hangs
up.) Oh God!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> <strong>That's</strong> what you've been working on for the past two
hours?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey, I've been honing!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What was with the dishes?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, uh.. I want her to think I might be in a restaurant.. y'know? I
might have some kind of life, like I haven't been sitting around here honing for the past
few hours.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (looking out the window) Look look! He's doing it again, the guy with
the telescope!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh my God! (Walks to the window) Go away! (Gesturing.) Stop looking in
here!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Great, now he's waving back.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Man, we gotta do something about that guy. This morning, I caught him
looking into our apartment. It creeps me out! I feel like I can't do stuff!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What kinda stuff?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Will you grow up? I'm not talking about sexy stuff, but, like, when I'm
cooking naked.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> You cook naked?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, toast, oatmeal... nothing that spatters.</p>

<p>(A pause as they look at Chandler.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What are you looking at me for? I didn't know that.</p>

<p>[Scene: Barry's Office, Rachel and Barry are getting dressed.]</p>

<p><b>Barry:</b> What's the matter?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, it's just... Oh, Barry, this was not good.</p>

<p><b>Barry:</b> No, it was. It was very very good.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, what about Mindy?</p>

<p><b>Barry:</b> Oh, way, way better than Mindy.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No, not that, I mean, what about you and Mindy?</p>

<p><b>Barry:</b> Well, if you want, I'll just&#151;I'll just break it off with her.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No. No-no-no-no, no. I mean, don't do that. Not, I mean not for me. </p>

<p><b>Bernice:</b> (over intercom) Dr. Farber, Bobby Rush is here for his adjustment.</p>

<p><b>Barry:</b> (into intercom) Thanks, Bernice. (To Rachel) Let's go away this weekend.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, Barry..! Come on, this is all way too..</p>

<p><b>Barry:</b> We can, we can go to Aruba! When I went there on what would have been our
honeymoon, it was, uh... it was really nice. You would've liked it.</p>

<p>(Pause as Rachel realises...)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I had a bra.</p>

<p>(Barry finds it draped on a cupboard and gives it to Rachel, they kiss as Bobby
enters.)</p>

<p><b>Bobby:</b> Hey, Dr. Farber.</p>

<p>(Rachel and Barry quickly split and pretend Barry is examining Rachel's mouth.)</p>

<p><b>Barry:</b> All right Miss Green, everything looks fine... Yep, I think we're
starting to see some real progress here.</p>

<p>(Bobby looks on, deadpan.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Bobby:</b> I'm twelve, I'm not stupid.</p>

<p>(Rachel glares at him.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler enters clutching his phone.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Can I use your phone?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah.. uh, but for future reference, that thing in your hand can also be
used as a phone.</p>

<p>(Chandler dials his own phone and it rings.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes, it's working! Why isn't she calling me back?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Maybe she never got your message.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Y'know, if you want, you can call her machine, and if she has a lot of
beeps, that means she probably didn't get her messages yet.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Y'don't think that makes me seem a little...</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> ...desperate, needy, pathetic?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Ah, you obviously saw my personal ad.</p>

<p>(He calls and quickly hangs up.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> How many beeps?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> She answered.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Y'see, this is where you'd use that 'hello' word we talked about.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I'm not gonna talk to her, she obviously got my message and is
choosing not to call me. Now I'm needy and snubbed. God, I miss just being needy.</p>

<p>(Rachel enters.)</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Hey! Hi!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> How'd he take it?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Pretty well, actually... (Wandering into the kitchen.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (wandering in after her) Uh, Rach... how come you have dental floss in
your hair?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, do I?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Uh huh.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (in a low voice) We ended up having sex in his chair.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You had <strong>sex</strong> in his <strong>chair</strong>?!... I said
that a little too loudly, didn't I?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You-you had what?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Sex in his chair.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What, uh... what were you thinking?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I don't know! I mean, we still care about each other. There's a history
there. 'S'like you and Carol.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No! No no, it is nothing like me and Carol!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Please. If she said to you, &quot;Ross, I want you on this couch, right
here, right now,&quot; what would you say? </p>

<p>(Ross flounders.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> If it helps, I could slide over.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> It's, it's, it's, uh, a totally diferent situation! It's, it's apples and
oranges, it's, it's orthodontists and lesbi- I gotta go.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Where are you going?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (leaving) I just have to go, all right? Do I need a reason? Huh? I mean I
have things to do with my life, I have a jam packed schedule, and I am late- for keeping
up with it. Okay?</p>

<p>(Ross exits, a phone rings, and Chandler dives for his phone.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hello? Hello?</p>

<p>(Rachel picks up their phone and the ringing stops.&nbsp; As she talks on the phone, an
elaborate visual gag is spun out which is too difficult to describe in words.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (on phone) Hello?(Listens) Mindy! Hi! Hey, how are you? (Listens) Yes,
yes, I've heard, congratulations, that is so great. (Listens) Really? (Listens) Oh.
(Listens) Okay. Okay, well I'm working tomorrow, but if you want you can, you can, you can
come by and... (Listens) Okay... (Listens) Great... (Listens) Great... (Listens) All
right, so I'll, so I'll see you tomorrow! (Listens) Okay.. (Listens) Okay... (Listens)
Bye. (Hangs up and sits down heavily.) Oh God. Oh God. Oh God.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> So how's Mindy?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, she wants to see me tomorrow...Oh, she sounded really weird, I gotta
call Barry... (Does so, on phone) Hi, it's me, I just.. Mindy!! Mindy! Hi! No, I figured
that's where you'd be!</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Commercial Break</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the next morning.&nbsp; Chandler is sitting and staring at
his phone.&nbsp; Monica enters and creeps up next to Chandler.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Brrrrrrr!</p>

<p>(Chandler clutches at his phone before realising.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hell is filled with people like you.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (entering) He's back! The peeper's back!</p>

<p>(Rachel enters from her room.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (ducking) Get down!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Get down?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> ...And boogie!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Thanks, but I gotta go to work and get my eyes scratched out by Mindy.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Relax. Y'know, she may not even know.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Please. I haven't heard from her in seven months, and now she calls me?
I mean, what else is it about? Oh! She was my best friend, you guys! We went to camp
together... she taught me how to kiss..</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (intrigued) Yeah?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> And now, y'know, I'm like... I'm like the other woman! I feel so..</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> ..Naughty!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Right, I'll see you guys later...</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, hold up, I'll walk out with you. Now, Rach, when she taught you to
kiss, you were at camp, and.. were you wearing any kinda little uniform, or- (Rachel exits
and slams the door in his face.) That's fine, yeah...</p>

<p>(Joey exits.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, I'm gonna go to the bathroom. Will you watch my phone?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Why don't you just take it with you?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey, we haven't been on a second date, she needs to hear me pee?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Why don't you just call her?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I can't call her, I left a message! I have some pride.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Do you?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No! (Calls) Danielle, hi! It's, uh, it's Chandler! (Listens) I'm fine.
Uh, listen, I don't know if you tried to call me, because, uh, idiot that I am, I
accidentally shut off my phone. (Listens) Oh, uh, okay, that's fine, that's great.
(Listens) Okay. (Puts down the phone.) (to Monica) She's on the other line, she's gonna
call me back. (He starts doing a little jig.) She's on the other line, she's gonna call me
back, she's on the other line, gonna call me back...</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Don't you have to pee?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> 'S'why I'm dancing...</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Rachel is serving coffee as Mindy enters.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Mindy.</p>

<p><b>Mindy:</b> Hey, you.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hey, you.... So, what's up?</p>

<p><b>Mindy:</b> Um.. we should really be sitting for this.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Sure we should... So.</p>

<p><b>Mindy:</b> Now, I know things've been weird lately, but you're like my oldest friend
in the world... Except for maybe Laurie Schaffer, who I don't talk to anywhere, 'cause
she's all bitter now that she lost the weight and it turns out she doesn't have a pretty
face. ....Okay, I'm just gonna ask you this once, and I want a straight answer.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Mindy:</b> Will you be my maid of honour?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Of course!</p>

<p><b>Mindy:</b> Oh that's so great!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Was that all you wanted to ask me?</p>

<p><b>Mindy:</b> That's all!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ohhhh!! (Mindy starts to sob.) ...What? What?</p>

<p><b>Mindy:</b> That's not all.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh sure it is!</p>

<p><b>Mindy:</b> Oh no, it isn't! No! I think Barry is seeing someone in the city.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Um, what- what would make you think that?</p>

<p><b>Mindy:</b> Well, ever since we announced the engagement, he's been acting really
weird, and then last night, he came home smelling like <em>Chanel</em>.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (draws back) Really. Mindy, if it'll make you feel any better, when I
was engaged to him he went through a whole weird thing too.</p>

<p><b>Mindy:</b> Oh God! You see, that's what I was afraid of!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What? What's what you were afraid of?</p>

<p><b>Mindy:</b> Okay, okay... when Barry was engaged to you, he and I...kind of... had a
little thing on the side.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Mindy:</b> I know. I know, and when he proposed to me, everyone said &quot;Don't do
it, he's just gonna do to you what he did to Rachel,&quot; and now I feel so stupid.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Uh... Oh, Mindy, you are so stupid. Oh, we are both so stupid.</p>

<p><b>Mindy:</b> What do you mean?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (offers her arm to Mindy and she sniffs) Smell familiar?</p>

<p><b>Mindy:</b> Oh no.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, I am so sorry.</p>

<p><b>Mindy:</b> No me, I am so sorry...</p>

<p>(They hug and Joey enters.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (watches them for a while) Oh my.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe and Ross are doing a crossword, Monica is cooking,
and Chandler is still staring at his phone.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Four letters: &quot;Circle or hoop&quot;.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Ring dammit, ring!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Thanks.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (entering) Hey, you know our phone's not working?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I tried to call you from the coffee shop, and there was no answer.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (investigating) I turned it off. Mother of God, I turned it off!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Just like you told her you did! (Chandler glares at her.) ... Just
pointing out the irony.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey, so listen, I went across the street and talked to the doorman- I got
the peeper's name! Can I use the phone?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Nngghhh!!!!!!!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (to Monica) Can I use your phone? (On phone) Yeah, the number for a Sidney
Marks, please.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> &quot;Heating device.&quot;</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Radiator.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Five letters.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Rdtor.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (on phone) Yeah, is Sidney there? (Listens) Oh, this is? (To the gang)
Sidney's a woman.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> So she's a woman! So what?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah. Yeah, so what? (On phone) Look, I live across the street, (walking
to the window) and I know all about you and your little telescope, and I don't appreciate
it, okay? (Listens) Yeah, I can see you right now! (Listens) Hello! (Listens) If I wanna
walk around my apartment in my underwear, I shouldn't have to feel
like&#151;(Listens)&#151;Thank you, but... that's not really the point... (Listens) The
point is that... (Listens) Mostly free weights, but occasionally..</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Joey!!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (on phone) Yeah, my neighbor... (Listens) Yeah, the brunette... (to
Monica) She says you looked very pretty the other day in the green dress.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> The green dress? Really?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, she said you looked like Ingrid Bergman that day.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (waves dismissively to Sidney) Nooo!</p>

<p>[Scene: Barry's Office, Barry is preparing his tools alone as Rachel enters.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hey. Got a second?</p>

<p><b>Barry:</b> Sure, sure. Come on... (Mindy enters) ...in...</p>

<p><b>Mindy:</b> Hello, sweetheart.</p>

<p><b>Barry:</b> Uh... uh... what're'you... what're'you guys doing here?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Uh, we are here to break up with you.</p>

<p><b>Barry:</b> Both of you?</p>

<p><b>Mindy:</b> Basically, we think you're a horrible human being, and bad things should
happen to you.</p>

<p><b>Barry:</b> I'm sorry... I'm sorry, God, I am so sorry, I'm an idiot, I was weak, I
couldn't help myself! Whatever I did, I only did because I love you so much!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Uh- which one of us are you talking to there, Barr?</p>

<p><b>Barry:</b> ....Mindy. Mindy, of course Mindy, it was always Mindy.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Even when we were having sex in that chair?</p>

<p><b>Barry:</b> (to Mindy) I swear, whatever I was doing, I was always thinking of you.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Please! During that second time you couldn't have picked her out of a
lineup!</p>

<p><b>Mindy:</b> (to Rachel) You did it twice?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, the first time didn't really count... I mean, y'know, 's'Barry.</p>

<p><b>Mindy:</b> Okay...</p>

<p><b>Barry:</b> (to Mindy) Sweetheart, just gimme- gimme another chance, okay, we'll
start all over again. We'll go back to Aruba.</p>

<p><b>Bernice:</b> (over intercom) Dr. Farber, we've got a bit of an emergency
here...Jason Costalano is choking on his retainer.</p>

<p><b>Barry:</b> Oh God... (Into intercom) I'll be right there, Bernice. (to Mindy) Look,
please, please don't go anywhere, okay? I'll be, I'll be right back.</p>

<p>(Barry exits)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay. Okay, we'll be here! Hating you! Did you see how he was sweating
when he walked out of there? Listen honey, if I'm hogging the ball too much you just jump
right in there and take a couple punches because I'm telling you, this feels <strong>great</strong>.</p>

<p><b>Mindy:</b> Yeah... I'm pretty sure I'm still gonna marry him.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What are you talking about?! Mindy, the guy is the devil! He's Satan in
a smock!</p>

<p><b>Mindy:</b> Look, I know he's not perfect, but the truth is, at the end of the day, I
still really wanna be Mrs. Dr. Barry Farber, D.D.S.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh God. </p>

<p><b>Mindy:</b> I hope you can find some way to be happy for me. And I hope you'll still
be my maid of honor...?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> And I hope Barry doesn't kill you and eat you in Aruba.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Rachel are there.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You okay?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Really?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah! Y'know, ever since I ran out on Barry at the wedding, I have
wondered whether I made the right choice. And now I know.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Aww... (They hug)</p>

<p>(Joey enters and looks on approvingly.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Big day.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Closing Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, everyone is there.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> All right, I'll give you this, Mr. Peanut is a better dresser. I mean he's
got the monocle, he's got the top hat...</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> You know he's gay?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I just wanna clarify this: are you outing Mr. Peanut?</p>

<p><strong>Danielle:</strong> (entering) Chandler?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Danielle! Hi! Uh- everybody, this is Danielle, Danielle, everybody.</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Hi. Hi.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What are you doing here?</p>

<p><strong>Danielle:</strong> Well, I've been calling you, but it turns out I had your
number wrong. And when I finally got the right one from Information, there was no answer.
So I thought I'd just come down here, and make sure you were okay.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> ...I'm, I'm okay.</p>

<p><strong>Danielle:</strong> Listen uh, maybe we could get together later?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> That sounds good. I'll call you- or you call me, whatever...</p>

<p><strong>Danielle:</strong> You got it.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><strong>Danielle:</strong> G'bye, everybody.</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Bye.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Whoo-hoo!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah, there you go!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Second date!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> ...I dunno.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You <strong>don't know</strong>?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, she seems very nice and everything, but that whole thing about
her coming all the way down here, just to see if I was okay? I mean,... how needy is that?</p>

<p>(They all groan and hit him..)</font></p>

<p align="center"><strong><font size="3">End</font></strong></p>
</body>
</html>
121<html>

<head>
<title>The One With The Fake Monica</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="white" text="black" link="green" vlink="black" alink="yellow">

<h1 align="center">The One With The Fake Monica</h1>

<hr align="center">

<p>Written by: Adam Chase and Ira Ungerleider<br>
Transcribed by <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">guineapig</a></p>

<hr>
<font size="3">

<p align="left">[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, everyone is looking at papers.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> How could someone get a hold of your credit card number?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I have no idea. But look how much they spent!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Monica, would you calm down? The credit card people said that you only
have to pay for the stuff that you bought.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I know. It's just such reckless spending.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I think when someone steals your credit card, they've kind of already
thrown caution to the wind.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Wow, what a geek. They spent $69.95 on a Wonder Mop.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> That's me.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh! The yuk! Ross, he's doing it again! (Points to a lamp which is
shaking behind the sofa)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Marcel, stop humping the lamp! Stop humping! Now Marcel, come back-
(Marcel runs toward Rachel's room) come here, Marcel-</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh no, not in my room! I'll get him.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Ross, you've got to do something about the humping.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What? It's, it's just a phase.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, that's what we said about Joey...</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Would you all relax? It's not that big a deal.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (Out of shot) Stop it! Marcel! Bad monkey!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Let's just say my Curious George doll is no longer curious.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Opening Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, late at night Monica is still examining her bill as Rachel
emerges from her room.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, Monica. You are not still going over that thing.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> This woman's living my life.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> She's living my life, and she's doing it better than me! Look at this,
look. She buys tickets for plays that I wanna see. She, she buys clothes from stores that
I'm intimidated by the sales people. She spent three hundred dollars on art supplies.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You're not an artist.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah, well I might be if I had the supplies! I mean, I could do all this
stuff. Only I don't.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, Monica, c'mon, you do cool things.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh really? Okay, let's compare, shall we.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (Yawning) Oh, it's so late for 'Shall we'...</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Do I go horseback riding in the park? Do I take classes at the New
School?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (Yawning) Nooo...</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> This is so unfair! She's got everything I want, and she doesn't have my
mother.</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Joey and Chandler are discussing stage names.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> How about Joey... Pepponi?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No, still too ethnic. My agent thinks I should have a name that's more
neutral.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Joey... Switzerland?</p>

<p>(The waitress brings their coffee.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Plus, y'know, I think it should be Joe. Y'know, Joey makes me sound like
I'm, I dunno, this big. (Waitress looks at him funny) Which I'm not.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Joe...Joe...Joe...Stalin?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Stalin...Stalin...do I know that name? It sounds familiar.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, it does not ring a bell with me...</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (Writes it down) Joe Stalin. Y'know, that's pretty good.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Might wanna try Joseph.</p>

<p>(Joey visibly thinks 'Of course!' and writes it down.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Joseph Stalin. I think you'd remember that!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh yes! Bye Bye Birdie, starring Joseph Stalin. Joseph Stalin is the
Fiddler on the Roof.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is there as Phoebe and Rachel enter.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hi. (On the phone) Hi, uh, yes, this is Monica Geller. Um, I believe I'm
taking some classes with you and I was wondering what they were.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What are you doing?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (Hushes her) Alright, great. Thanks a lot. (Hangs up) I'm going to tap
class.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What, what, so that you can dance with the woman that stole your credit
card?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> This woman's got my life, I should get to see who she is.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Go to the post office! I'm sure her picture's up! ...Okay, Monica,
y'know what, honey, you're kinda losing it here! I mean, this is really becoming like a
weird obsession thing.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> This is madness. It's madness, I tell you, <strong>for the love of God,
Monica, don't do it</strong>!! ...Thank you.</p>

<p>[Scene: A Tap Class, the girls are standing at the door.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What d'you think?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Lotsa things.</p>

<p>(They go in and sit down.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Which one do you think she is?</p>

<p>(The teacher comes up to them.)</p>

<p><b>Teacher:</b> May I help you?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, no thanks, we're just here to observe.</p>

<p><b>Teacher:</b> You don't observe a dance class. You <strong>dance</strong></font><font
size="5"> </font><font size="3">a dance class. Spare shoes are over there.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What does she mean?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I think she means (Imitates) 'You <strong>dance</strong></font><font
size="5"> </font><font size="3">a dance class'. Oh, c'mon, c'mon. (They put on some spare
shoes)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay, d'y'see anybody you think could be me?</p>

<p><b>Teacher:</b> (To the class) People! Last time there were some empty yoghurt
containers lying around after class. Let's not have that happen again!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> She could be you.</p>

<p>(Music starts)</p>

<p><b>Teacher:</b> Let's get started. Five, six, a-five six seven eight...</p>

<p>(Everyone starts to dance in unison. Monica flounders)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay, I'm not getting this!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (Dancing in a swirly, Phoebe kind of way) I'm totally getting it!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Did you ever feel like sometimes you are just so unbelievably
uncoordinated?</p>

<p>(Rachel taps into view; she is in perfect sync with the rest of the class)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What? You just click when they click.</p>

<p><b>Teacher:</b> Alright people, now everyone grab a partner.</p>

<p>(The girls are unsure how to pair off. Phoebe settles it)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay. And, my, dead, mother, says, you, are, it. I'm with Rachel.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Great. It's gym class all over again.</p>

<p><strong>Phoebe and </strong><b>Rachel:</b> Aww.</p>

<p><b>Teacher:</b> Well that's all right, you can come up to the front and dance with me.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Why don't I just take off my clothes and have a nightmare.</p>

<p>(She starts to walk very slowly toward the front of the room. The teacher grabs her
hand and pulls her. Suddenly a woman bursts in)</p>

<p><b>Woman:</b> It's okay, it's okay, I'm here, I'm here. Sorry I'm late, okay, here I
am. Who's the new tense girl?</p>

<p><b>Teacher:</b> She's your partner.</p>

<p><b>Woman:</b> Hi. I'm Monica.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh. Monica! ...Hi. I'm Mo- ...nana.</p>

<p><strong>Woman:</strong> (Fake Monica) Monana?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah. It's Dutch.</p>

<p><b>Fake Monica:</b> You're kidding! I-I spent three years in Amsterdam. (Asks her
something in Dutch)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Um, Pennsylvania Dutch.</p>

<p><b>Teacher:</b> And we're dancing. A-five, six, seven, eight...</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Ross is entering.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (Mortified) Hi.</p>

<p><strong>Chandler and </strong><b>Joey:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Where've you been?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> At the vet.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> She's not gonna make you wear one of those big plastic cones, is she?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> She says Marcel's humping thing's not a phase. Apparently he's reached
sexual maturity.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (To Chandler) Hey! He beat ya.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> She says as time goes on, he's gonna start getting agressive and violent.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> So what does this mean?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I'm gonna have to give him up.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Commercial Break</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, scene continued from earlier.&nbsp; They guys are sitting there
like the Three Monkeys.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I can't believe it, Ross. This sucks!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I don't get it, I mean, you just got him. How can he be an adult
already?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I know. I know. I mean, one day, he's this little thing, and before you
know it, he's this little thing I can't get off my leg.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Isn't there any way you can keep him?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, no. The vet says unless he's in a place where he has regular access to
some... monkey lovin,' he's just gonna get vicious. I've just gotta get him into a zoo.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> How do you get a monkey into a zoo?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I know that one! ...No, that's Popes into a <em>Volkswagen</em>.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, we're applying to a lot of them. Naturally our first choice would be
one of the bigger state zoos, y'know, like, uh, San Diego... right? But that might just be
a pipe dream, because, y'know, he's out of state. Uh, my vet, uh, knows someone at Miami,
so that's a possibility.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, but that's like two blocks away from the beach. I mean, it's a
total party zoo.</p>

<p>(Phoebe, Monica, and Rachel enters.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey. We found her, we found the girl.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Did you call the cops?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Nope. We took her to lunch.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Ah. Your own brand of vigilante justice.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What?! Are you insane? This woman stole from you. She stole. She's a
stealer.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Y'know what? After you're with this woman for like ten minutes, you
forget all that. I mean, she is this astounding person, with this, with this amazing
spirit.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, which she probably stole from some cheerleader.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> ...Take off their hats!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Popes in a <em>Volkswagen</em>! ...I love that joke.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica, Rachel and Fake Monica are there.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No way. No way did you do this.</p>

<p><b>Fake Monica:</b> Monana was very brave.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> It was so wild. We told them we were the Gunnersens in room six fifteen.
Only to find out the Boston Celtics had taken over the entire sixth floor!</p>

<p><b>Fake Monica:</b> So once they caught on to the fact that we're, y'know, short and
have breasts...</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> ...They threw us out! I was thrown out of a hotel! Me!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Go Monana! Well, you ladies are not the only ones living the dream. I
get to go pour coffee for people I don't know. Don't wait up. (Exits)</p>

<p><b>Fake Monica:</b> Oh, by the way, tomorrow we're auditioning for a Broadway show.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> 'Scuse me?</p>

<p><b>Fake Monica:</b> There's an open call for Cats. I'm thinking we go down there, sing
Memories and make complete fools of ourselves. Whaddya say?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Nononononono. Think who you're dealing with here. I mean, I'm not like
you. I-I can't even stand in front of a tap class.</p>

<p><b>Fake Monica:</b> Well, that's just probably 'cause of your Amish background.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Fake Monica:</b> Well, you're Pennsylvania Dutch, right?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Right. Till I bought a blow dryer, then I was shunned.</p>

<p><b>Fake Monica:</b> I-I used to be just like you. And then one day I saw a movie that
changed my life. Did you ever see <em>Dead Poets' Society</em>?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Uh-huh.</p>

<p><b>Fake Monica:</b> I thought that movie was so incredibly... <strong>boring</strong>.
I mean, that thing at the end where the kid kills himself because he can't be in the play?
What was that?! It's like, kid, wait a year, leave home, do some community theatre. I
walked out of there and I thought, 'Now, that's two hours of my life that I'm never
getting back.' And that thought scared me more than all the other crap I was afraid to do.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Wow. Then I would definitely not recommend <em>Mrs. Doubtfire</em>.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, tiem lapse.&nbsp; Everyone but Joey and Monica are there.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (Reading letters) Oh God. (To Marcel) We didn't get into Scranton. (To the
others) That was like our safety zoo. They take like dogs and cows. See? I don't know who
this is harder on, me or him.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I'd say that chair's taking the brunt.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Marcel! Marcel! Marcel, no! Good boy. See, how can nobody want him?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, somebody will.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (entering) You know there already <strong>is</strong> a Joseph Stalin?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You're kidding.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Apparently he was this Russian dictator who slaughtered all these people.
You'd think you would've known that!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Y'know, you'd think I would've.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Phoebe. Whaddyou think a good stage name for me would be?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> ...Flame Boy.</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Ross is talking to Dr. Baldhara, a zookeeper.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Where exactly is your zoo?</p>

<p><b>Dr. Baldhara:</b> Well, it's technically not a zoo per se, it's more of an
interactive wildlife experience. Let me ask you some questions about, is it, uh, Marcel?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yes.</p>

<p><b>Dr. Baldhara:</b> Does he, uh, fight with other animals?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No-no, he's, he's very docile.</p>

<p><b>Dr. Baldhara:</b> Even if he were... cornered?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well I, I don't know. Why?</p>

<p><b>Dr. Baldhara:</b> Uh, how is he at handling small objects?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> He can hold a banana, if that's whatcha mean...</p>

<p><b>Dr. Baldhara:</b> How about a hammer, or a small blade?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Why- why- why would he need a blade?</p>

<p><b>Dr. Baldhara:</b> Well, if he's up against a jungle cat or an animal with horns,
you've got to give the little guy something. Otherwise it's just cruel.</p>

<p>(Chandler and Joey burst in, with Marcel)</p>

<p><strong>Chandler and </strong><b>Joey:</b> He- he- he got in, he- he got in to San
Diego.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> We, we come back from our walk and the- the phone was ringing...</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> ...He's in.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> He's in! Oh, did you hear that, Marcel? San Diego. San Diego!</p>

<p><b>Dr. Baldhara:</b> You're making a big mistake here. I mean, San Diego's all well and
good, but if you give him to me, I'll start him off against a blind rabbit and give you
twenty percent of the gains.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is dusting. She comes to the table, lifts all the
magazines and wipes under them, then just puts them down again. Monica bursts in,
obviously drunk.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yo- hooo!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Where the hell've you been?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Monica and I just crashed an embassy party.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Are you drunk?!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Noooo! (Comes closer and whispers) I'm lying. I am so drunk.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh God, oh. Great, Monica, y'know what, you could've called, I have been
up here, I've been worried...</p>

<p>(Monica is drinking from the tap)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Monica? Monica!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Water rules!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yes, yes, it does. Okay, look, the restaurant called, they wanna know if
you're gonna be showing up for work?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Nope. Going to the <em>Big Apple Circus</em> today.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay Monica, what are you doing? You're gonna lose your job! This is not
you!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No, it is me! Y'know, I'm not just the person who needs to fluff the
pillows and pay the bills as soon as they come in! Y'know, when I'm with her, I am so much
more than that. I'm- I'm Monana!</p>

<p>(The phone rings and Rachel answers)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hello? Yes, she is, hold on a second, please. Monana, it's for you, the
credit card people.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Helloooo? Yeah. Oh my God. Thanks.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> They've arrested Monica.</p>

<p>[Scene: New York City Department of Correction, Monica is visiting Fake Monica.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hi.</p>

<p><b>Fake Monica:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> How are you?</p>

<p><b>Fake Monica:</b> I'm not too bad. Fortunately, blue's my colour. How-how did you
know I was here?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Because... I'm Monica Geller. It was my credit card you were using.</p>

<p><b>Fake Monica:</b> That I was not expecting.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I want you to know, it wasn't me who turned you in.</p>

<p><b>Fake Monica:</b> Oh. Thanks.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No, thank you! You have given me so much! I mean, if it wasn't for you,
I would never have gotten to sing <em>Memories</em> on the stage at the <em>Wintergarden
Theater</em>!</p>

<p><b>Fake Monica:</b> Well, actually, you only got to sing 'Memo-'.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I just can't believe you're in here. I mean, what am I gonna do without
you? Who's gonna crash the embassy parties with me? Who's gonna take me to the <em>Big
Apple Circus</em>?</p>

<p><b>Fake Monica:</b> Monica, I started my day by peeing in front of twenty-five other
women, and you're worried about who's gonna take you to the <em>Big Apple Circus</em>?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well, not... worried, just... wondering.</p>

<p><b>Fake Monica:</b> There's nothing to wonder about, Monica. You're gonna go back to
being exactly who you were, because that's who you are.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Not necessarily...</p>

<p><b>Fake Monica:</b> Yes necessarily! I mean, I dunno what it is, maybe it's the Amish
thing.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Um, I'm not actually Amish.</p>

<p><b>Fake Monica:</b> Really? Then why are you like that?</p>

<p>[Scene: Tap Class, Monica is standing by the door.]</p>

<p><b>Teacher:</b> You by the door. In or out?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> In. (She joins in the dancing. She still flounders)</p>

<p><b>Teacher:</b> You in the back, you're getting it all wrong!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah, but at least I'm doing it!</p>

<p>[Scene: The Airport, everyone but Monica is there to see off Marcel.]</p>

<p><strong>PA:</strong> This is the final boarding call for flight 67 to San Diego,
boarding at gate 42A.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay. Good-bye, little monkey guy. Alright, I wrote you this poem. Okay,
but don't eat it 'till you get on the plane.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Aww. Thank you, Aunt Phoebe.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, bye, champ. Now, I know there's gonna be a lot of babes in San
Diego, but remember, there's also a lot to learn.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I dunno what to say, Ross. Uh, it's a monkey.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Just, just say what you feel.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Marcel, I'm hungry.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> That was good.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (Brings Marcel a teddy bear) Marcel, this is for you. It's, uh, just,
y'know, something to, um, do on the plane.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Uh, if you guys don't mind, I'd like to take a moment, just me and him.</p>

<p><strong>All: </strong>Oh, sure. Sure, absolutely. (They just stand there, then realise
what he means and go to the other end of the room)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Marcel, c'mere, c'mere. (He sits down and Marcel jumps down and sits
beside him) Well buddy, this is it. There's just a coupla things I want to say. I'm really
gonna miss you, and I'm never gonna forget about you. You've been more than just a pet to
me, you've been more like a be- (Marcel climbs down and starts humping his leg) Okay,
Marcel, please, could you leave my leg alone? Could you just stop humping me for two
seconds?! Marcel, would- okay, just take him away. Just take him.</p>

<p>(Marcel is put in a cage and taken away.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Closing Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: A Theater, there is a casting session going on for a play.]</p>

<p><strong>Actor:</strong> (Very melodramatically, and very badly) Oh, that I were a glove
upon that hand, that I might... touch thy cheek...</p>

<p><strong>Casting Director No. 1:</strong> That's fine, thank you.</p>

<p><strong>Casting Director No. 2:</strong> Next. (Joey walks onstage)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hi, uh, I'll be reading for the role of Mercutio.</p>

<p><strong>Casting Director No. 2:</strong> Name?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Holden McGroin.</font></p>

<p align="center"><strong><font size="3">End</font></strong></p>
</body>
</html>
122<html>

<head>
<title>The One With The Ick Factor</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="white" text="black" link="green" vlink="black" alink="yellow">

<h1 align="center">The One With the Ick Factor</h1>

<hr align="center">
<font size="3">

<p>Written by: Alexa Junge<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Mikael Hedberg</a></font></p>

<hr>
<font size="3"><b>

<p align="left"></b>(Scene: Central Perk. Everyone is there.) </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Tell him.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Tell him, tell him.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Just...please tell him.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Shut up!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Tell me what?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Look at you, you won't even look at him.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (sarcastically) Oh, come on tell me. I could use another reason why
women won't look at me.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> All right, all right, all right. Last night, I had a dream that, uh, you
and I, were...</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Doing it on this table. (points at the table)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Wow!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Exellent dream score.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Why, why, why would you dream that?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> More importantly, was I any good?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, you were pretty damn good.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Interesting, cause in my dreams, I'm allways surprisingly inadequate.
(Monica pats him on his lap)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, last night you seemed to know your way around the table.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I love it, when we share.</p>

<p>(Ross goes over to the counter. Chandler follows him.)</p>

somebody else's subconscious.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Opening Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Young Ethan are sitting in the couch.]</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Closing Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: The Hallway, Ross is eagerly waiting for the others to get ready, to go to the
hospital.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Monica, let's go. Come on now people, woman in labor.</p>

<p>(Chandler struts out from his apartment)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (doing a little dance) Hey Ross, look what I've got going here. </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, save it for the cab, okay.</p>

<p>(Rachel comes out from their apartment with a mirror and a lipstick in her hands)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What are you doing? We're going to a hospital.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What, so I can't lokk nice? There might be doctors there.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Joey, get out of the fridge.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> All right, all right. (he comes out from their apartment with a huge
sandwich in his hand)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What is that? (refering to the sandwich)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> For the ride.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, like in a cab...</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Save it.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, hating this.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Monica, come on now. Let's go, baby coming.</p>

<p>(Monica enters from their apartment, crying)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I can't belive it, I'm gonna be an aunt. I'm gonna have like a nephew.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> That's nice. Get out Let's go, come on.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> All right, I'm going. I'm going.</p>

<p>(They all go down the stairs, but Ross turns around, looking like his in a coma. The
others also turns around to get him.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Here we go, here we go.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Rossy, Rossy.</font></p>

<p align="center"><strong><font size="3">End</font></strong></p>
</body>
</html>
123<html>

<head>
<title>The One With the Birth</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="white" text="black" link="green" vlink="black" alink="yellow">

<h1 align="center">The One With the Birth</h1>

<hr align="center">

<p>Story by: David Crane &amp; Marta Kauffman<br>
Teleplay by: Jeff Greenstein &amp; Jeff Strauss<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Mindy Mattingly Phillips</a><br>
With Minor Adjustments by: Dan Silverstein</p>

<hr>
<font size="3">

<p>[Scene: The hospital, Ross, Rachel, Chandler, Joey, and Monica are in the waiting room,
waiting for Carol and Susan to arrive.] </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> She's not here yet. She's not here. She's having my baby and she's not
here.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I'm sure everything's fine. Has her water broke yet?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I don't know, but when I spoke to her, she said she had already passed the
mucus plug.</p>

<p>(Joey makes a sound of absolute disgust.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Do we have to know about that?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Joey, what are you gonna do when you have a baby?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I'm gonna be in the waitin' room, handing out cigars.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes, Joey's made arrangements to have his baby in a movie from the
50's.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> God, I don't believe this. She could be giving birth in the cab.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, Ross, relax. It's probably like two dollars for the first
contraction, and then fifty cents for each additional contraction.</p>

<p>(Everyone looks at Rachel as though she made a tasteless comment.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What, it's ok when Chandler does it?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You have to pick your moments.</p>

<p>(Phoebe arrives, guitar in hand.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Did I miss it, did I miss it?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> She's not even here yet.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What's with the guitar?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I just thought we might be here for awhile. You know, things might get
musical.</p>

<p>(Carol and Susan arrive.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (to Carol) Where the hell have you been?</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> We stopped at the gift shop.</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> I was looking at stuffed animals, and Susan wanted a <i>Chunky</i>.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Susan wanted a <i>Chunky</i>. We're having a baby, ok, a baby, you don't
stop for <i>Chunky</i>s.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I used to have that bumper sticker.</p>

<p>(Everyone is amused by Chandler's comment.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (to Rachel) You see what I mean.</p>

<p align="center"><b>Opening Credits</b></p>

<p>[Scene: Carol's Hospital Room, Carol is on the bed, Ross and Susan are at her side.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Stopped for a <i>Chunky</i>.</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Let it go, Ross.</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> I got an extra one. You want this? (holds the candy in front of Ross'
face)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (weakly) No.</p>

<p>(Carol's doctor, Dr. Franzblau arrives.)</p>

<p><b>Dr. Franzblau:</b> Hey, how's my favorite parenting team doing?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Dr. Franzblau, hi.</p>

<p><b>Dr. Franzblau:</b> So, I understand you're thinking of having a baby? Well, I see
you're nine months pregnant. That's a good start. How you doing with your contractions?</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Oh, I love them. Each one's like a little party in my uterus.</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> They're every four minutes and last 55 seconds.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> 59 seconds. (holds up his watch) Quartz, ha.</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> Swiss quartz, ha, ha.</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Am I allowed to drink anything?</p>

<p><b>Dr. Franzblau:</b> Ice chips, just ice chips. They're at the nurses' station.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I'll get it.</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> No, I'm getting it. I'll be right back.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I got it&#151;I'm getting it!</p>

<p>(They both leave just as Rachel enters the room, holding a cup.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hi, I thought you might like some ice chips.</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Thanks.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> And if you need anything else, I&#151;(notices the handsome Dr.
Franzblau)&#151;do not believe we've met. Hi. I'm, uh, Rachel Green. I'm Carol's...
ex-husband's... sister's roommate. </p>

<p><b>Dr. Franzblau:</b> It is nice to meet you. I'm Dr. Franzblau. I'm your roommate's...
brother's... ex-wife's obstetrician.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, that's funny!</p>

<p>[Scene: The Waiting Room, Chandler is falling asleep on Monica's shoulder.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I want a baby.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Mmmm. Not tonight, honey. I got an early day tomorrow.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Get up. Come on. Let's get some coffee.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, ok, 'cause we never do that.</p>

<p>(Chandler and Monica leave. Cut to Joey, watching the Knicks/Celtics game on
television.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (to the screen) Shoot! Shoot! Shoot! Shoot, or just fall down. That's good
too.</p>

<p>(A young pregnant woman enters.)</p>

<p><b>Lydia:</b> Knick fan?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, yeah.</p>

<p><b>Lydia:</b> Oh, boy, do they suck.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey, listen, lady....(sees that she's pregnant)...whoa.</p>

<p><b>Lydia:</b> Look, look at your man, Ewing. Nice shot. You know what, he couldn't hit
water if he was standing on a boat.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh yeah? And who do you like?</p>

<p><b>Lydia:</b> The Celtics.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> The Celtics? Ha. They couldn't hit a boat if...wait. They suck, alright?</p>

<p><b>Lydia:</b> Oh, shut up. You know, it's a rebuilding year. You... waah!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Wha? Wha..aa? Let me get the father. Hey, we need a father over here! We
need a father!</p>

<p><b>Lydia:</b> There is no father.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, oh, oh, sorry.</p>

<p><b>Lydia:</b> Ok, that's ok. I'm fine. I'm... oh!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, uh, ok. Right this way. All the other pregnant women seem to be goin'
in here.</p>

<p><b>Lydia:</b> Ok.</p>

<p>(Joey accompanies Lydia to a hospital room.)</p>

<p>[Scene: The Waiting Room, Phoebe is playing a song. Chandler, Monica, and Ross are
there as well.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (singing) </p>

<blockquote>
  <blockquote>
    <i><p>They're tiny and chubby and so sweet to touch,<br>
    and soon they'll grow up and resent you so much. <br>
    Now they're yelling at you and you don't know why, <br>
    you cry and you cry and you cry. <br>
    And you cry and you cry and you cry...</i></p>
  </blockquote>
</blockquote>

<p>(Ross gives Phoebe a dollar.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Thanks, Ross.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah. I'm paying you to stop.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ok.</p>

<p>(A woman passes by, carrying newborn twins.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, look, twins. Hi, guys. Oh, cute, cute.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No fair. I don't even have one. How come they get two?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You'll get one.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh yeah? When?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All right. I'll tell you what. When we're 40, if neither one of us are
married, what do you say you and I get together and have one?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Why won't I be married when I'm 40?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, no, no. I just meant hypothetically.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Ok, hypothetically, why won't I be married when I'm 40?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No, no, no.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What is it? Is there something fundamentally unmarriable about me?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (trapped) Uh, uh.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Dear God! This parachute is a knapsack! (throws himself over the back
of the chair he was sitting in)</p>

<p>(Rachel enters, in a formal dress.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey. Ooh, look at you, dressy-dress.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Did you go home and change?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, well, it's an important day. I wanna look nice. Um, has uh Dr.
Franzblau been by?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No, I haven't seen him.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, where is he? He is supposed to be here. (Pause) What if the baby
needs him?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Rachel, what is the deal with you and doctors, anyway? Was, like, your
father a doctor? </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, why?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No reason. (turns around, makes an 'Oh my God' gesture with his eyes)</p>

<p>[Scene: Joey and Lydia in the hospital room. Lydia is on the phone with her mother.]</p>

<p><b>Lydia:</b> Mom, we've been through this. No, I'm not calling him. I don't care if it
is his kid, the guy's a jerk. No, I'm not alone. Joey's here. (pause) What do you mean,
Joey who? (covers the phone, to Joey) Joey who?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Tribbiani.</p>

<p><b>Lydia:</b> Joey Tribbiani. Yes, ok. Hold on. (to Joey) She wants to talk to you.
Take the phone.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (takes phone) Hi, yeah, it's me. (Listens) Oh, no no no, we're just
friends. (Listens) Yeah, I'm single. (Listens) 25. (Listens) An actor. (Listens) Hello?</p>

<p><b>Lydia:</b> She's not much of a phone person.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, so, uh, so, uh, what's the deal with this father guy, I mean, if
someone was havin' my baby somewhere, I'd wanna know about it, you know?</p>

<p><b>Lydia:</b> Hey, Knick fan, am I interested in your views on fatherhood? Uh, no. </p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ok, look, maybe I should just go.</p>

<p><b>Lydia:</b> Maybe you should.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Good luck, and uh, take care, huh? </p>

<p>(He leaves, but then returns a moment later.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> You know what the Celtics problem is? They let the players run the team.</p>

<p><b>Lydia:</b> Oh, that is so not true.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, it is.</p>

<p><b>Lydia:</b> It isn't.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> It is.</p>

<p><b>Lydia:</b> Isn't!</p>

<p>[Scene: Carol's Hospital Room, Ross and Susan are coaching Carol.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Breathe.</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> Breathe.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Breathe.</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> Breathe.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Breathe.</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> Breathe.</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> You're gonna kill me!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> 15 more seconds, 14, 13, 12...</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Count faster.</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> It's gonna be ok, just remember, we're doing this for Jordie. Just keep
focusing on Jordie.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Who the hell is Jordie?</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> Your son.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No-no-no. I don't have a son named Jordie. We all agreed, my son's name is
Jamie.</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Well, Jamie was the name of Susan's first girlfriend, so we went back to
Jordie.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What? Whoa, whoa whoa whoa, what do you mean,<b> back</b> to Jordie? We
never <b>landed</b> on Jordie. We just passed by it during the whole Jessy, Cody, Dylan
fiasco.</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Ow, ow, ow, ow, leg cramp, leg cramp, leg cramp.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I got it.</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> I got it.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I got it! Hey, you get to sleep with her, I get the cramps.</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> No, you don't.</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> All right, that's it. I want both of you out.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Why?</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> He started it!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, you started it.</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> You did!</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> I don't care. I am trying to get a person out of my body here, and you're
not making it any easier.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> But...</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Now go!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (to Susan) Thanks a lot.</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> (to Ross) See what you did.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (to Carol) Yeah, listen...</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> <b>Out</b>! </p>

<p>(Ross and Susan both angrily leave the hopsital room.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Lydia's Hospital Room, Joey is helping Lydia go through labor, a nurse is now
present in her room as well.]</p>

<p><b>Nurse:</b> Breathe, breathe, breathe...</p>

<p><b>Lydia:</b> Oh, no.</p>

<p>(Joey looks down at Lydia.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ew! What is that? Something exploded!</p>

<p><b>Nurse:</b> It's just her water breaking. Calm down, will you?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (panicked) Water breaking, what do you mean? What's that, water breaking?</p>

<p><b>Nurse:</b> (to Joey) Breathe, breathe, breathe.</p>

<p>[Scene: The Hall, Ross and Susan are arguing.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Please. This is so your fault.</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> How, how is this my fault?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Look, Carol never threw me out of a room before you came along.</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> Yeah? Well, there's a lot of things Carol never did before I came along.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You tryin' to be clever? A funny lady?</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> You know what your problem is? You're threatened by me.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, I'm threatened by you?</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> Yes.</p>

<p>(Phoebe has heard them arguing and comes down the hall, taking them into a broom
closet.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey, hey, ok, all right, that's it! Get in here. Come on. My god, you
guys, I don't believe you. There are children coming into the world in this very building
and your negative fighting noises are not the first thing they should be hearing. So just
stop all the yelling, just stop it!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, Susan.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Don't make me do this again, I don't like my voice like this.</p>

<p>(Phoebe goes to leave the room, but the door is locked.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ok, who wants to hear something ironic?</p>

<p align="center"><b>Commercial Break</b></p>

<p>[Scene: The Broom Closet, Ross and Susan are trying to get out.]</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Help!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I'm having a baby in here! Ok, everyone stand back. (Walks backwards as if
he is going to break down the door, but steps in a bucket and falls) Ow.</p>

<p>[Scene: Carol's room, Rachel and Dr. Franzblau are there with her.]</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Are they here yet?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No, honey, they're not, but don't worry, because we are going to find
them, and until we do, we are all here for you, ok?</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Ok.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ok?</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Ok.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (to Dr. Franzblau) Ok, so anyway, you were telling me about Paris, it
sounds fascinating.</p>

<p><b>Dr. Franzblau:</b> It really was. There was this great little pastry shop right by
my hotel. (Carol sits up in pain, Rachel and Dr. Franzblau casually lay her back down)
There you go, dear. </p>

<p>[Scene: Lydia's Room, Joey is helping her deliver.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Come on, Lydia, you can do it. Push! Push 'em out, push 'em out, harder,
harder. Push 'em out, push 'em out, way out! Let's get that ball and really move, hey,
hey, ho, ho. Let's&#151; (notices the nurse looking at him strangely) I was
just&#151;yeah, right. Push! Push! </p>

<p>[Scene: The Broom Closet, Ross has picked up a vacuum and is holding it at the door.]</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> What're you gonna do, suck the door open?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Help! Help!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (singing) <i>They found their bodies the very next day, they found their
bodies the very next...(sees Ross and Susan staring at her) la la la la la la.</i></p>

<p><b>Susan and Ross:</b> (even louder) Help!</p>

<p>[Scene: The Waiting Room, Monica is on the phone with her mother, Chandler is standing
behind her.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Now, Mom, everything's going fine, really. (Listens) Yeah, Ross is
great. He's uh, he's in a whole other place. (Listens) No, he's gone. (Listens) No no, you
don't have to fly back, really. (Listens) What do you mean this might be your only chance?
(Listens) Would you stop? I'm only 26, I'm not even thinking about babies yet. </p>

<p>(Monica sees a woman pass by with a baby, puts the phone to her chest, and starts to
cry. Chandler takes the phone, makes a noise in it resembling static, and hangs up. Joey
enters.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Where have you been?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, just had a baby.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Mazel tov!</p>

<p>[Scene: The Waiting Room, Rachel and Dr. Franzblau have gone to get coffee.]</p>

<p><b>Dr. Franzblau:</b> I don't know, could be an hour, could be three, but relax, she's
doing great. So, uh, tell me, are you currently involved with anyone?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (anxiously) No, no, not at the moment, no, I'm not. Are you?</p>

<p><b>Dr. Franzblau:</b> No, it's hard enough to get women to go out with me.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Right, yeah, I've heard that about cute doctors.</p>

<p><b>Dr. Franzblau:</b> No, no, really. I suppose it's because I spend so much time, you
know, where I do.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh.</p>

<p><b>Dr. Franzblau:</b> I try not to let my work affect my personal life, but it's hard,
when you... do what I do. It's like uh...Well, for instance, what do you do?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I'm a waitress.</p>

<p><b>Dr. Franzblau:</b> Ok, all right, well aren't there times when you come home at the
end of the day, and you're just like, 'if I see one more cup of coffee'...</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (getting the point) Yeah. Gotcha.</p>

<p><b>Dr. Franzblau:</b> I'm gonna go check up on your friend.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ok. That's fine. (takes her earrings out)</p>

<p>[Scene: The Hall Outside Lydia's Room, Joey is walking up to Lydia's room with
balloons, but before he enters he sees that the baby's father has arrived. He listens at
the door.]</p>

<p><b>Lydia:</b> So how did you know I was even here?</p>

<p><b>Guy:</b> Your mom called me. So is this her?</p>

<p><b>Lydia:</b> No, this is a loaner.</p>

<p><b>Guy:</b> I'm sorry you had to do this by yourself.</p>

<p><b>Lydia:</b> I wasn't by myself. I had a doctor, a nurse, and a helper guy. (Joey
smiles) So, did you see who won the game?</p>

<p><b>Guy:</b> Yeah, the Knicks by 10. They suck.</p>

<p><b>Lydia:</b> Yeah, they're not so bad.</p>

<p>(Joey closes the door and ties the balloons to the knob. Then he walks away, holding
the hand of an inflated balloon animal he had brought.)</p>

<p>[Scene: The Broom Closet, Ross is trying to open the door with a credit card, with no
success.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Come on, come on. Damnit, damnit, damnit, damnit. (to Susan) This is all
your fault. This is supposed to be, like, the greatest day of my life, y'know? My son is
being born, and I should be in there, you know, instead of stuck in a closet with you.</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> The woman I love is having a baby today. I've been waiting for this just
as much as you have.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No no no, believe me. No one has been waiting for this as much as I have,
ok? And you know what the funny thing is? When this day is over, you get to go home with
the baby, ok? Where does that leave me?</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> You get to be the baby's father. Everyone knows who you are. Who am I?
There's Mother's Day, there's Father's Day, there's no... Lesbian Lover Day.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Every day is Lesbian Lover Day.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> This is so great.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You wanna explain that?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I mean, well, 'cause when I was growing up, you know my dad left, and my
mother died, and my stepfather went to jail, so I barely had enough pieces of parents to
make one whole one. And here's this little baby who has like three whole parents who care
about it so much that they're fighting over who gets to love it the most. And it's not
even born yet. It's just, it's just the luckiest baby in the whole world. (pause) I'm
sorry, you were fighting.</p>

<p>[Scene: Carol's Room, she is ready to give birth. Everyone is there except for Phoebe,
Ross, and Susan, who are in the broom closet.]</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Where are they?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I'm sure they'll be here soon.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, honey, they wouldn't miss this.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Relax. You're only at nine centimeters. And the baby's at zero station.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (to Joey) You are really frightening me.</p>

<p>(Carol suddenly screams in pain and grabs Chandler by the shirt.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Somebody wanna help me, tryin' to rip out my heart. (they pull her
hand off of him) Uh, that's great. (looking around) Anybody seen a nipple?</p>

<p><b>Dr. Franzblau:</b> All right, ten centimeters, here we go.</p>

<p><b>Nurse:</b> All right, honey, time to start pushing.</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> But they're not here yet!</p>

<p><b>Dr. Franzblau:</b> I'm sorry, I can't tell the baby to wait for them.</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Oh, god.</p>

<p>[Scene: The Broom Closet, Ross has used a broom to open the air vent in the ceiling.
Phoebe is wearing a janitor's uniform, ready to go up in the vent.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Ok, got the vent open.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (reading the nametag on the uniform) Hi, I'm Ben. I'm hospital worker
Ben. It's Ben... to the rescue!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Ben, you ready? All right, gimme your foot. Ok, on three, Ben. One, two,
three. Ok, That's it, Ben.</p>

<p>(Ross and Susan lift Phoebe up into the vent.)</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> What do you see?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, Susan, I see what appears to be a dark vent. Wait. Yes, it is in
fact a dark vent.</p>

<p>(A janitor opens the closet door from the outside.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Phoebs, It's open! It's open!</p>

<p>(Ross and Susan run to the delivery room, leaving Phoebe dangling from the vent.)</p>

<p><b>Janitor:</b> (to Ross and Susan) Wait! You forgot your legs!</p>

<p>[Scene: Carol's Room, Ross and Susan rush in.]</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Push, push!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> We're here!</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> (irked) Where have you been?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Long story, honey.</p>

<p><b>Dr. Franzblau:</b> All right, Carol, I need you to keep pushing. I
need&#151;(reaches for an instrument, Rachel's hand is on it) Excuse me, could I have
this?</p>

<p><b>Nurse:</b> All right, all right, there's a few too many people in this room, and
there's about to be one more, so anybody who's not an ex-husband or a lesbian life
partner, out you go!</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Good luck!</p>

<p>(Everyone heads for the door.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (to nurse) Let me ask you, do you have to be Carol's lesbian life
partner?</p>

<p><b>Nurse:</b> Out!</p>

<p><b>Dr. Franzblau:</b> All right, he's crowning. Here he comes.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Let me see, I gotta see, I gotta see. Oh, a head. Oh, it's, it's huge.
Carol, how are you doing this?</p>
