<p><b>Carol:</b> (straining) Not.... helping!</p>

<p><b>Dr. Franzblau:</b> You're doing great, you're doing fine. </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (puts his head near the baby) Hello! (to Dr. Franzblau) Oh, sorry.</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> What do you see? What do you see?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> We got a head, we got shoulders, we got arms, we got, oh, look at the
little fingers, oh, and a chest, and a stomach. It's a boy, definitely a boy! All right!
Ok, legs, knees, and feet. Oh, oh. He's here. He's a person.</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> Oh, look at that.</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> What does he look like?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Kinda like my uncle Ed, covered in <i>Jell-o</i>.</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Really?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (from the air vent overhead) You guys, he's beautiful!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, thanks, Pheebs!</p>

<p>(They look up towards the vent and wave at Phoebe.)</p>

<p>[Scene: The Delivery Room, Carol is holding the infant.]</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> No shouting, but we still need a name for this little guy.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (thinking) How 'bout Ben?</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> I like Ben.</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Ben. Ben. Ben's good. How come you never mentioned Ben before?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> We uh, we just cooked it up.</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> That's what we were off doing.</p>

<p>(Monica opens the door.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hi.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Can we come in?</p>

<p>(The whole gang enters.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (to Ben) I know, I know. Everybody, there's someone I'd like you to meet.
Yeah. This is Ben. Ben, this is everybody.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Susan, he looks just like you.</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> Thanks.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, god, I can't believe one of us actually has one of these.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I know, I still am one of these.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Ross, can I?</p>

<p>(Monica holds Ben.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> The head, the head. You gotta...</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (getting choked up) Hi, Ben. Hi. I'm your Aunt Monica. Yes I am. I'm
your Aunt Monica. I...I will always have gum.</p>

<p align="center"><b>Closing Credits</b></p>

<p>[Scene: The Hospital, the camera is placed as though it were Ben's eyes.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Ben, I want you to know that there may be some times when I may not be
around, like this. (walks out of the picture) But I'll still always come back, like this.
(returns) And sometimes I may be away longer, like this. (walks away) But I'll still
always come back, like this. (returns) </p>

<p>(Chandler comes into the picture.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> And sometimes, I'll want you to steal third, and I'll go like this.
(Does a baseball sign.)</p>

<p>(The rest of the group come into the picture.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> He is so amazing.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, I know. Look at him.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ben, Ben, hey Ben. Nothing. I don't think that's his name.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, look, look, he's closing his eyes. (screen goes blank) Look, he's
opening his eyes. (picture comes back) </p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> He doesn't do much, does he?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, this is pretty much it.</p>

<p>(long moment of silence)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You guys wanna get some coffee?</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> All right, I'll see you guys later.</p>

<p>(They all leave but Ross, but they all come back a few seconds later. They make faces
at the baby.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, look, he's closing his eyes again.</p>

<p>(The screen fades to black.)</p>

<p align="center"><b>End</b></p>
</font>
</body>
</html>
124<html>

<head>
<title>The One Where Rachel Finds Out</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="white" text="black" link="green" vlink="black" alink="yellow">

<h1 align="center">The One Where Rachel Finds Out</h1>

<hr align="center">
<i>

<p></i>Written by: Chris Brown<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Dan Silverstein</a></p>

<hr>
<font size="3">

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, the whole gang is there, Ross is showing pictures of his new baby
boy, Ben, to the group.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> And here's little Ben nodding off...</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Awww, look at Aunt Monica's little boy!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, look, he's got Ross's haircut!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, let me see! (grabs picture) Oh, God, is he just the sweetest thing?
You must just want to kiss him all over!</p>

<p>(Ross is practically drooling over Rachel at this point.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (quietly) That would be nice.</p>

<p>(Chandler, annoyed with Ross's fawning, makes a 'pfft' noise.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Pardon?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Nothing, just a little extra air in my mouth. Pffft. Pffffffft. (walks
over to where Joey is seated)</p>

<p>(Joey is looking at his check.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey, Chan, can you help me out here? I promise I'll pay you back.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, yeah, right, OK... inlcuding the waffles last week, you now owe
me... 17 jillion dollars.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I will, really. I'll pay you back this time.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (sigh)... And where's this money coming from? (gives money to Joey)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well... I'm helping out down at the N.Y.U. Med School with some...
research.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (overhearing) What kind of research?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, just, y'know.... science.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Science. Yeah, I think I've heard of that. (everyone's interest is piqued,
they all look over)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (sigh)... It's a fertility study.</p>

<p>(Rachel laughs.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, Joey, please tell me you're only donating your <b>time</b>.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Alright, come on you guys, it's not that big a deal. Really... I mean, I
just go down there every other day and... make my contribution to the project. Hey, hey,
but at the end of two weeks, I get seven hundred dollars.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Wow, ooh, you're gonna be making money hand over fist!</p>

<h3 align="center">Opening Credits</h3>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Phoebe are preparing for a barbecue for
Rachel's birthday.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> OK, we got the cole slaw, we got the buns...</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> We've got the ground-up flesh of formerly cute cows and turkeys, ew...
(hands meat to Monica)</p>

<p>(Chandler and Joey enter with charcoal.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (in a deep voice) Men are here.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> We make fire. Cook meat.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Then put out fire by peeing, no get invited back.</p>

<p><strong>Monica and Phoebe: </strong>Ewww!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh Joey, Melanie called, said she's gonna be late.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, OK.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> So how are things going with you two? Is she becoming your
(provocatively) special someone?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I don't know, she's, uh.... she's pretty great.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah? What does she think of your little science project?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What, you think I'm gonna tell a girl I like that I'm also seeing a cup?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Man's got a point.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, the tough thing is, she <b>really</b> wants to have sex with me.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Crazy bitch.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, well, I still got a week left to go in the program, and according to
the rules, if I want to get the money I'm not allowed to conduct any... ersonal
experiments, if you know what I mean.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Joey... we <b>always</b> know what you mean.</p>

<p>[Time lapse. Chandler and Joey are making the fire, Monica and Phoebe are inside. Ross
enters, carrying luggage.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey. (Phoebe sees his bags)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> How long did you think this barbecue was gonna last?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I'm going to China. </p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Jeez, you say one thing, and...</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You're going to China?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, i-it's for the museum. Someone found a bone, we want the bone, but
they don't want us to have the bone, so I'm going over there to try to persuade them to
give us the bo&#151;it's&#151;it's a whole big bone thing. Anyway, I'm gonna be gone for
like, uh... like a week, so, uh, if you wanna reach me, y-you can't. So here's my
itinerary (hands a sheet of paper to Monica). Um... here's a picture of me... (hands it to
Monica)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, let me see! (takes the picture)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (to Monica): Could you take it to Carol's every now and then, and show it
to Ben, just so he doesn't forget me?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p>(Phoebe puts the picture of Ross up to her face.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hi, Ben. I'm your father. I am... the head. Aaaaaahhhh.... (puts picture
down, sees Ross staring at her) Alright, this barbecue is gonna be very fun.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey, is Rachel here? Um, I wanted to wish her a happy birthday before I
left.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh no, she's out having drinks with Carl.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh. (pause) Hey, who's Carl?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You know, that guy she met at the coffeehouse.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, well, see, there's this guy she met at the...</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> At the coffeehouse, right.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> So you <b>do</b> know who he is! (laughs, Ross stares at her) Sorry.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> OK, I'm gonna go say goodbye to the guys.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, hey, y'know what? Tell them that bone story.</p>

<p>(Ross goes outisde on the balcony.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hi.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (sigh)....I have to go to China.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> The country?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No no, this big pile of dishes in my mom's breakfront. Do you guys know
who Carl is?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Uh, let's see... Alvin... Simon... Theodore.... no.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, Rachel's having drinks with him tonight.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh no! How can she do that when she's never shown any interest in you?!?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> <b>Forget</b> about her.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> He's right, man. Please. Move on. Go to China. Eat Chinese food.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Course there, they just call it food.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah... I guess. I don't&#151;I don't know. Alright, just... just give her
this for me, OK? (gives Chandler a gift for Rachel)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Listen, buddy, we're just looking out for you.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I know.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> We want you to be happy. And I may only have a couple beers in me, but...
I love you, man. (Joey gives Ross a hug)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I'm still on my first. I just think you're nice.</p>

<p>[Time lapse. Melanie, Joey's girlfriend, is there with Joey, Chandler, Monica, Phoebe,
and Rachel. Ross is gone.]</p>

<p><b>Melanie:</b> Anyway, that's when me and my friends started this whole fruit basket
business. We call ourselves 'The Three Basketeers.'</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Like the three musketeers, only with fruit.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (sarcastic) Ooooh. (looks dumbfounded at Joey's stupidity)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (gets up) OK, how does everybody like their burgers?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, no, no, no. Presents first. Food later. (walks into living room)</p>

<p>(Everyone follows Rachel to the living room. Monica pulls Joey aside.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey, hold on there, tiger. How's it going? How you holding up?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, not so good. She definitely thinks tonight is the night we're
gonna... complete the transaction, if you know what I...</p>

<p>(Monica rolls her eyes.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Then you do. Heh, heh.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> So, uh, have you ever thought about being there <b>for her</b>?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What do you mean?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Y'know, just be there <b>for her</b>.</p>

<p>(Long pause... Joey looks confused.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Not following you.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Think about it.</p>

<p>(They both walk over to where Rachel is opening her gifts. Rachel sees her first gift
is a fruit basket.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> OK, I'm guessing this is from...</p>

<p>(Melanie smiles.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, thank you, Melanie.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (pointing out a gift) OK, this one right here is from me.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (picks it up) OK... ah, it's light... (shakes it)...it rattles...
it's... (opens it) <i>Travel Scrabble</i>! Oooohhh, thank you! (she gives it back to him)</p>

<p>(Chandler looks dejected. Rachel picks up another gift.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> This one's from Joey... feels like a book. Thinks it's a book... feels
like a book. And...(opens it)...it's a book!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, it's Dr. Seuss!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (to Rachel): That book got me through some tough times.</p>

<p><b>Melanie:</b> There is a little child inside this man!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes, the doctors say if they remove it, he'll die.</p>

<p>(Rachel picks up the next gift.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Who's this from?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, that's Ross's. </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh... (opens it)... (sees it is a pin) Oh my God. He remembered.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Remembered what?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> It was like months ago. We were walking by this antique store, and I saw
this pin in the window, and I told him it was just like one my grandmother had when I was
a little girl. Oh! I can't believe he remembered!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, sure, but can you play it on a plane? (pats his <i>Travel
Scrabble</i> game)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, it's so pretty. This must have cost him a fortune.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I can't believe he did this.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Come on, Ross? Remember back in college, when he fell in love with
Carol and bought her that ridiculously expensive crystal duck?</p>

<p>(Everyone looks at him. He realizes he just spilled the beans about Ross's crush on
Rachel. You can hear this entire classic scene by clicking here.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What did you just say?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (panicked) ahem... um... Crystal duck.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No, no, no.... the, um, the... 'love' part?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (stuttering incoherently) F-hah.... flennin....</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh.... my God.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (rubbing his temples) Oh, no-no-no-no-no....</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (pats Chandler on the leg) That's good, just keep rubbing your head.
That'll turn back time.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Commercial Break</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, continued from earlier.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I mean, this is unbelievable.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I know. This is really, really huge.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No it's not. It's small. It's tiny. It's petite. It's wee.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Nuh-uh. I don't think any of our lives are ever gonna be the same ever
again.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> OK, is there a mute button on this woman?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I think this is so great! I mean, you and Ross! D-did you have any idea?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No! None! I mean, my first night in the city, he mentioned something
about asking me out, but nothing ever happened, so I just... (to Joey): W-well, what else
did he say? I mean, does he, like, want to go out with me?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, given that he's desperately in love with you, he probably wouldn't
mind getting a cup of coffee or something.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ross? All this time? Well, I've got to talk to him. (gets up to leave)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (quickly) H-He's in China!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> The country.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No, no, wait. (checks Ross's itinerary) His flight doesn't leave for
another forty-five more minutes.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What about the time difference?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> From here to the airport?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes! (Rachel walks towards door) You're never gonna make it!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Rachel, what're you gonna say to him?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I-I-I don't know.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well then maybe you shouldn't go. </p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> He's right, cause if you're just gonna, like, break his heart, that's the
kind of thing that can wait.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah, but if it's good news, you should tell him now.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I don't know. Maybe I'll know when I see him.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Here, look, alright, does this help?</p>

<p>(Phoebe gets up, holds the picture of Ross up to her face.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Noooo... look, all I know is that I cannot wait a week until I see him.
I mean, this is just too big. Y'know, I just, I've just gotta talk to him. I... I gotta...
OK, I'll see you later. (opens door)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Rachel, I love you! Deal with me first! (she leaves)</p>

<p>[Scene: Airport, Ross has headphones on, and is listening to a 'How To Speak Chinese'
tape. Occasionally, he makes an outburst in Chinese in accordance with the tape. He is
getting on the jetway. The flight attendant is there.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (something in Chinese)</p>

<p><strong>Flight Attendant: </strong>Alright!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Ni-chou chi-ma! (walks onto jetway)</p>

<p>(Rachel runs into the airport, trying to catch Ross, moving people out of the way.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ross! Excuse me, pardon me, excuse me....</p>

<p>(Rachel gets up to the jetway.)</p>

<p><strong>Flight Attendant</strong>: Hi!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hi.</p>

<p><b>Flight Attendant:</b> May I see your boarding pass?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, no, no, I don't have one. I just need to talk to my friend.</p>

<p><b>Flight Attendant:</b> Oh, oooh. I'm sorry. You are not allowed on the jetway unless
you have a boarding pass.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No, I know, but I&#151;he just went on. He's right there, he's got the
blue jacket on, I... can I j-just...</p>

<p><b>Flight Attendant:</b> No no no! Federal regulations!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> OK, alright, OK, um... then could you please, uh... just give him a
message for me? Please? This is <b>very</b> important.</p>

<p><b>Flight Attendant:</b> Alright. What's the message?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Uh... I don't know.</p>

<p>[Cut to the Jetway, the flight attendant enters, walks past Ross, and approaches an
older man with his wife who is also wearing a blue jacket.]</p>

<p><b>Flight Attendant:</b> Sir? Sir? Excuse me, sir? Uh... I have a message for you.</p>

<p><b>Man:</b> (confused) What?</p>

<p><b>Flight Attendant:</b> It's from Rachel. She said that she loved the present, and she
will see you when you get back.</p>

<p><b>Man:</b> (to wife): Toby... Oh, for God's sake, I don't know what she's talking
about! There's no Rachel! Don't give me that deep freeze.</p>

<p>[Scene: Joey's Bedroom, he and Melanie are in bed together.]</p>

<p><b>Melanie:</b> Mmmmmm... Oh, Joey, Joey, Joey... I think I blacked out there for a
minute!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Heh, heh. It was nothin'.</p>

<p><b>Melanie:</b> Well, now we've gotta find something fun for you! (she starts kissing
his chest)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (panicked) Uhhh.. y'know what? Forget about me. Let's, uh... let's give
you another turn.</p>

<p><b>Melanie:</b> (surprised) M-Me again?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Sure! Why not?</p>

<p><b>Melanie:</b> Boy, somebody's gonna get a <b>big</b> fruit basket tomorrow.</p>

<p>(Joey starts to kiss her.)</p>

<p><b>Melanie:</b> Oooh, I gotta tell you... you are nothing like I thought you would be.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> How do you mean?</p>

<p><b>Melanie:</b> I don't know, I-I guess I just had you pegged as one of those guys
who're always 'me, me, me.' But you... you're a giver. You're like the most generous man I
ever met. I mean... you're practically a woman.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica, Phoebe, and Rachel are there. Monica is holding
the wrapping paper from one of Rachel's gifts.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Uh, so, uh, Rach, uh... do you wanna save this wrapping paper, I mean,
it's only a little bit torn... so are you gonna go for it with Ross or should I just throw
it out?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I don't know. I don't know... I thought about it all the way there, and
I thought about it all the way back... and, uh, oh, you guys, y'know, it's <b>Ross</b>.
Y'know what I mean? I mean, it's <b>Ross</b>.</p>

<p><strong>Monica and Phoebe:</strong> Sure.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I don't know, I mean, this is just my initial gut feeling... but I'm
thinking... oh, I'm thinking it'd be really great.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh my God, me too! Oh! Oh, we'd be like friends-in-law! Y'know what the
best part is? The best part is that you already know everything about him! I mean, it's
like starting on the fifteenth date!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, but, y'know, it's... it would be like starting on the fifteenth
date.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Another good point.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, I mean, I mean, when you're at the fifteenth date, y'know, you're
already in a very relationshippy place. Y'know, it's... you're committed.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (confused) Huh?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, I mean, then what happens if it doesn't work out?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Why isn't it working out?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I don't know... sometimes it doesn't.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Is he not cute enough for you?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Does he not make enough money?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No, I'm just....</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Maybe there's someone else.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Wha...</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Is there? Is there someone else?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No! There is.. there is noone else!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Then why the hell are you dumping my brother?!?</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is eating breakfast, Joey quietly opens his
bedroom door.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey, big...</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Shhhh!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (quietly) ...spender.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> She's still asleep.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> So how'd it go?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, it was amazing. You know how you always think you're great in bed?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> The fact that you'd even ask that question shows how little you know
me.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, it's like, last night, I couldn't do the thing that usually makes me
great. So I had to do all this other stuff. And the response I got... man, oh man, it was
like a ticker tape parade!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes, I know, as it happens my room is very very close to the parade
route.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> It was amazing! And not just for her... uh-uh. For me, too. It's like, all
of a sudden, I'm blind. But all my other senses are heightened, y'know? It's like... I was
able to appreciate it on another level.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I didn't know you had another level.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I know! Neither did I!</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, one week later. Monica is seated, Rachel comes out of her
bedroom.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey, great skirt! Birthday present?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, from who?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> From you. I exchanged the blouse you got me.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well, it's the thought. Hey, doesn't Ross's flight get in in a couple
hours? At gate 27-B?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Uh, yeah. Uh, Monica, y'know, honey, I've been thinking about it and
I've decided this&#151;this whole Ross thing, it's just not a good idea.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, why?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Because, I feel like I wouldn't just be going out with him. I would be
going out with all of you. Oh, and there would just be all this pressure, and I don't
wanna...</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (gets up) No, no, no, no, no, no pressure, no pressure!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Monica, nothing has even happened yet, and you're already so...</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I am not 'so'! OK, I was a teensy bit weird at first, but... I'll be
good. I promise.</p>

<p>(Door buzzer goes off. Rachel answers it.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Who is it?</p>

<p><b>Intercom:</b> It's me, Carl.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> C'mon up.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Behind my brother's back? (Rachel glares at her) ... is exactly the kind
of crazy thing you won't be hearing from me.</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is seated, and the apartment is filled with
baskets of fruit. Joey enters, check in hand.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Seven hundred bucks!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Alright, you did it! Do we have any fruit?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Man, hell of a two weeks, huh? Y'know what, though? I really feel like I
learned something.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Really? So, you're gonna stick with this 'it's all for her' thing?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What, are you crazy? When a blind man gets his sight back, does he walk
around like this? (Joey closes his eyes and walks around with arms spread.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's Balcony, Rachel is having drinks with her date, Carl.]</p>

<p><b>Carl:</b> I'm just sayin', if I see one more picture of Ed Begley, Jr. in that <b>stupid</b>
electric car, I'm gonna shoot myself! I mean, don't get me wrong... I'm not against
environmental issues <b>per se</b>.... it's just that guy!</p>

<p>(Rachel looks bored. At this point, Ross&#151;a figment of Rachel's imagination&#151;
shows up on the balcony and starts talking to her.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I can't believe you'd rather go out with him than me.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Would you excuse me, please? I'm trying to have a date here.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Fine, just stop thinking about me.</p>

<p>(She tries, and Ross disappears momentarily. He reappears, standing closer to her.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Can't do it, can you?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> So I'm thinking about you. So what?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I don't get it. What do you see in this guy, anyway?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well... he happens to be a very nice... guy....</p>

<p><b>Carl:</b> I mean, come on, buddy, get a <b>real car</b>!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Rachel, come on. Give us a chance.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ross, it's too hard.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, no, no... why, because it might get weird for everyone else? Who cares
about them. This is about us. Look, I-I've been in love with you since, like, the ninth
grade. </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ross, you're like my best friend.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I know.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> If we broke up, and I lost you...</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Whoa, whoa, whoa. What makes you think we're gonna break up?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, have you been involved with someone where you haven't broken up?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (pause) No. But... it only has to happen <b>once</b>. Look, you and I both
know we are perfect for each other, right? I mean... so, the only question is... are you
attracted to me?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I don't know... I mean, I've never looked at you that way before.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, start looking. </p>

<p>(They kiss. Ross walks away, and then fades out.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Wow.</p>

<p><b>Carl:</b> Exactly! And you just know I'm gonna be the guy caught behind this
hammerhead in traffic!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Right! You're right!</p>

<p><b>Carl:</b> Heh... y'know?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You know what?</p>

<p><b>Carl:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I forgot... I am supposed to pick up a friend at the airport. I am so
sorry! I'm so... if you want to stay, and finish your drinks, please do.... (gives him her
drink) I mean&#151;I'm sorry. I-I-I gotta go. I'm sorry. </p>

<p>(Rachel leaves.)</p>

<p><b>Carl:</b> But...</p>

<p>[Scene: Airport. Madonna's <i>Take A Bow</i> plays in the background as Rachel waits at
the gate with flowers.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (sifting through crowd) Excuse me, pardon me, excuse me, excuse me,
sorry. Hi.</p>

<p>[Cut to the jetway, the old man who the flight attendant delivered Rachel's message to
gets off the plane, his wife still upset with him.]</p>

<p><b>Man:</b> For God's sake, will you let it go? There's no Rachel!</p>

<p>(A Chinese woman getting off the plane drops one of her bags. Ross gets off next.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, hey, hey, I got that.</p>

<p>(Ross picks up the bag... then he and the woman kiss.)</p>

<p><b>Julie:</b> Oh, thanks, sweetie.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No problem. I cannot wait for you to meet my friends.</p>

<p><b>Julie:</b> Really?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah. </p>

<p><b>Julie:</b> You don't think they'll judge and ridicule me?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, no, they will. I just... uh...</p>

<p><strong>Ross and <b>Julie:</b></strong> Can't wait.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Come on, they're gonna love you.</p>

<p align="left">[Cut to a close-up of Rachel, eagerly awaiting Ross's arrival... not
knowing he is getting off the plane with another woman.]</font></p>

<p align="center"><b>End</b></p>
</body>
</html>
201<html>

<head>
<title>The One With Ross' New Girlfriend</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="white" text="black" link="green" vlink="black" alink="yellow">

<h1 align="center">The One With Ross' New Girlfriend</h1>

<hr align="center">
<font size="3"><b><i>

<p></i></b>Written by: Jeff Astroff &amp; Mike Sikowitz</font><br>
<font size="3">Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Mindy Mattingly
Phillips</a></font><br>
With Minor Adjustments by: <a href="mailto:eaasen@plains.nodak.edu">Eric Aasen</a></p>

<hr>
<font size="3">

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe is recapping last season, and as she talks we see a
montague of scenes from Ross and Rachel.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ok, so this is pretty much what's happened so far. Ross was in love with
Rachel since, you know, forever, but every time he tried to tell her, something kind of
got in the way, like cats, and Italian guys. Finally Chandler was like &quot;forget about
her&quot; but when Ross was in China on his dig, Chandler let it slip that Ross was in
love with Rachel. She was like, &quot;Oh my god.&quot; So she went to the airport to meet
him when he came back, but what she didn't know was, that Ross was getting off the plane
with another woman. Uh-Oh! So, that's pretty much everything you need to know. But, enough
about us. So, how've you been?</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Opening Credits</strong></p>

<p align="left">[Scene, The Airport, continued from last season, Rachel is waiting for
Ross to come of the plane, when she sees he's coming off with another woman.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh my god. Oh my god. (She decides to make a break for it.) Excuse me.
Move! Move! Emergency! Excuse me! (She tries climbing over a bench and falls down.) </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (seeing her) Rach!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, there you are! Hi! Oh, so, so, how was China, you? (Hits him with
the flowers.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> It was, it was great. Oh, what happened?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You're bleeding. </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I am? Oh, look at that, yes I am. Enough about me, enough about me, Mr.
Back from the Orient. Come on. I wanna hear everything! Everything. (Looks at Julie)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, where do I start? This is Julie. Julie, this is Rachel.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> These are, these aren't for you. (to Julie) These are for you. (Loudly,
thinking she can't speak English.) Welcome to our country.</p>

<p><b>Julie:</b> (Loudly, proving she can speak English.) Thank you. I'm from New York.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ok, well, not a problem. We'll just use them to stop the bleeding. Ok.
Baggage claim? Ok.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the gang is waiting for Rachel to return from the airport
with Ross.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b>&nbsp; No way!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I'm telling you, she went to the airport, and she's gonna go for it with
Ross! </p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh my god. This is huge. This is bigger than huge. This is like, all
right, what's bigger than huge?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Um, this?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yes.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Guys, you got your hair cut.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes, yes, we did, thanks to Vidal Buffay.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> 'Cause, you know, (in that voice) if you don't look good, we don't look
good. I love that voice.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (entering, out of breath) Airport, airport. Ross, not alone, Julie, arm
around her. Cramp, cramp.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Ok, I think she's trying to tell us something. Quick, get the verbs.</p>

<p>(She hits Chandler.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (to Chandler) You, you, you said he liked me. (Ross and Julie enter)
You, you slowpokes!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> That's all right, Rach, we got the bags. Hi, hello. Julie, this is my
sister Monica. This is Chandler.&nbsp; Phoebe.&nbsp; Joey, what up?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What up?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Everyone, this is Julie.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (out of breath) Julie.</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Ohh. (Happily) Hi!</p>

<p><b>Julie:</b> Hi, but I'm not here, you haven't met me. I'll make a much better first
impression tomorrow when I don't have 20 hours of cab and plane on me.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> And bus.</p>

<p><b>Julie:</b> Oh my god.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b>&nbsp; The screaming guy?</p>

<p><b>Julie:</b>&nbsp; And the spitting?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You gotta hear this story.</p>

<p><b>Julie:</b> We're on this bus, that's easily 200 years old...</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> 200 at least.</p>

<p><b>Julie:</b>&nbsp; ...and this guy...</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> And the chicken pooped in her lap. Oh, I'm so sorry. I just gave away
the ending, didn't I? Oh! It's just, I just heard this story in the cab, and it is all I
can think about.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> This is amazing. I mean, how, how did this happen?</p>

<p><b>Julie:</b> Well, Ross and I were in grad school together.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> But we haven't seen each other since then. Well I land in China, guess
who's in charge of the dig. </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Julie! Julie, isn't that great? I mean, isn't that just
kick-you-in-the-crotch, spit-on-your-neck fantastic?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (to Julie) It's an expression.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, we just wanted to say a quick hi, and then we're gonna go see the
baby.</p>

<p><b>Julie:</b> And then we've gotta get some sleep.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, it's really 6:00 tomorrow night our time.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, listen, don't tell us what's gonna happen though, 'cause I like
to be surprised.</p>

<p>(Ross and Julie exit)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Bye. (She closes the door and everyone tries to sympathize with her.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Ross and Chandler enter.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey, Rach, can I get some coffee?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, sure.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Thank you.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey, Rach, can I get...</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Did you talk to him?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Not yet.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Then, no.</p>

<p>(He goes to sit down next to Ross.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> So what the hell happened to you in China? I mean, when last we left
you, you were totally in love with, you know.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I know, I know I was, but there was always this little voice inside that
kept saying it's never gonna happen, move on. You know whose voice that was?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> God?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> It was you, pal.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, maybe it was God, doing me.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Look, you were right. She looks at me and sees a friend, that's all. But
then I met Julie, and I don't know, we're havin' a great time. And I have to say, I never
would've gone for it with her if it hadn't been for you.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, you owe me one, big guy.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (To Ross) Here's your lemonade.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I didn't order lemonade.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh. Well then, you better go take that back because they're gonna charge
you for that. </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> But...</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Go-go-go-go, come on! (Ross goes over to the counte) (to Chandler) So
uh, what did you find out?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> He said...he said, he said that they're having a great time. I'm
sorry. But, the silver lining, if you wanna see it, is that he made the decision all by
himself!&nbsp; Without any outside help whatsoever.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> How is that the silver lining?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You have to really wanna see it.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross and the gang is watching Sumo wrestling on TV.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Ironically, these are the guys who were picked last in gym.</p>

<p>[Cut to Phoebe and Monica in the kitchen.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Pheebes, you know what I'm thinking?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, ok. How, it's been so long since you've had sex, you're wondering if
they've changed it?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No, although now that's what I'm thinking.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> All right, so what were you thinking?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well, I was thinking, that you gave the guys such great haircuts, I
thought, maybe you'd like to do mine?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ohh! No.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Why not?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Because, I'm just, I'm incredibly anal and an unbelievable control
freak.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No you're not.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I know I'm not, but you are, and I was trying to spare your feelings.</p>

<p>(The phone rings.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (answering the phone) Hello? Oh, hi. Yeah, hold on a second. Ross, it's
Julie, for you. (Throws him the phone.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (on phone) Hello? Hi.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (entering) Hi. Anybody know a good tailor?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Needs some clothes altered?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No, no, I'm just looking for a man to draw on me with chalk.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Why don't you go see Frankie? My family's been goin' to him forever. He
did my first suit when I was 15. No wait, 16. No, 'scuse me, 15. (still confused) All
right, when was 1990?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay.&nbsp; You have to stop the Q-tip when there's resistance!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (on phone) Ok, ok, sweetheart, I'll see you later. Ok, bye. What? (Sits
down next to Rachel) Oh, that is so sweet. No, no, ok, you hang up. Ok, ok, one, two,
three. (Doesn't hang up and motions for Rachel to be quiet) Well you didn't hang up
either. </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> She didn't hang up either!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Ok, no, no, you hang up. You, you, y...</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (taking the phone and hanging it up) Sorry, I thought you were talking
to me.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Rachel! I'll just call her back. </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (calls Julie back) Hi?&nbsp; Sorry, we got disconnected... (Walks away.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (to Monica) Ok, ok, ok. How did this happen to me? How did this happen
to me? A week ago, two weeks ago, I was fine. Ross was just Ross, just this guy. Now he's
Rrrooossss, oh, this really great guy that I can't have.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Sweetie, I wanted you to have him too.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I know you did. I'm just gonna deal with it, I'm just gonna deal with
it. (Ross comes by, smoching with Julie on the phone.) I gotta get out of here. (Exits)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Ok, I don't care what you guys say, something's bothering her.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the next morning.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (to Chandler) You know, I think I was sixteen.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (to Phoebe) Please, just a little bit off the back.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I'm still on &quot;no.&quot;</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (poking her head in from her bedroom) Uh, morning. Do you guys think you
could close your eyes for just a sec?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No-no-no-no-no, (grabs his pants) I'm not fallin' for that again.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What's goin' on?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, I sorta did a stupid thing last night.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What stupid thing did you do?</p>

<p><strong>Paulo:</strong> (entering from Rachel's room) Bon giorno tutti!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ewww! (Gets up and walks away.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Commercial Break</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, continued from earlier.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ok, Paulo, why don't you just go get dressed, and then you be on your
way, ok, bye-bye. (Paulo goes into his room.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Rachel, how did this happen?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I don't know, I just kinda ran into him last night.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Where?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> At his apartment. Is this juice?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Whoa, whoa. And the fact that you dumped him because he hit on Phoebe?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh God, I know I'm a pathetic loser.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Honey, you're not pathetic, you're sad.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> People do stupid things when they're upset.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> My god, if I had a nickel for every guy I wish I hadn't...(Everyone
looks at her), but this is about your horrible mistake.</p>

<p>(Ross and Julie enter.)</p>

<p><strong>All:</strong> Hi!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hi. Sorry we're late but we were&#151;well, there was touching.</p>

<p><strong>Paulo:</strong> (entering) Hey, hey Ross.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey, Paulo. What are you doing here?</p>

<p><strong>Paulo:</strong> I do Raquel.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (to Rachel) So, uh, he's back.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, he's back. Is that a problem?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, not a problem.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Good! I'm glad it's not a problem.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (to Paulo) Ok, you're gonna have to not touch my ass.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, in spite of the yummy bagels and palpable tension, I've got
pants that need to be altered.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey, Chandler, when you see Frankie, tell him Joey Tribbiani says hello.
He'll know what it means.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Are you sure he's gonna be able to crack that code?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (to Phoebe) You know it's funny, the last time Paulo was here, my hair
was so much shorter and cuter.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> All right. Ok, but, but!&nbsp; You have to promise that you will not be
all like control-y and bossy and Monica about it.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I promise.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> All right. (Talking to Monica's hair.) Now some of you are gonna get
cut, and some of you aren't. But I promise none of you are gonna feel a thing.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica's bedroom, Phoebe is finishing with her haircut and Monica is whincing.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> All right, that's it, I quit.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What? I didn't say anything.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, but this (makes Monica's face) isn't the face of a person who
trusts a person. Ok, this (makes Monica's face) is the face of a person who, you know,
doesn't trust a person.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I'm sorry. I'm sorry, Phoebe. It's just a little shorter than what we
had discussed.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Would you relax? I know what I am doing. This is how he wears it.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> How who wears it?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Demi Moore.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Demi Moore is not a he.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, he was a he in <em>Arthur</em>, and in <em>Ten</em>.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> That's Dudley Moore. I said I wanted it like Demi Moore.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh.&nbsp; Oh!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh my God!</p>

<p><strong>Phoebe:</strong> Oh my God!</p>

<p><strong>Monica:</strong> Oh my God!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh my God! I'm sorry, I'm sorry. Which one's Demi Moore?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> She's the act<strong>ress</strong> that was in <em>Disclosure</em>, <em>Indecent
Proposal</em>, <em>Ghost</em>!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, she's got gorgeous hair.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> <strong>I know</strong>!</p>

<p>[Scene: Frank's tailor shop, Chandler is getting his pants measured.]</p>

<p><strong>Frankie:</strong> How long do you want the cuffs?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> At least as long as I have the pants.</p>

<p>(Pause as Frankie resumes his work.)</p>

<p><strong>Frankie:</strong> I just got that. Ok, now we'll do your inseam.</p>

<p>(He slowly measures it up his leg, and Chandler makes a rather surprised face.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is recovering from her haircut, Phoebe is playing
her doctor and is coming in from the bedroom.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> How is she?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> It's too soon to tell. She's resting, which is a good sign.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> How's the hair?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I'm not gonna lie to you, Ross, it doesn't look good. I put a clip on
one side, which seems to have stopped the curling.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Can we see her?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Your hair looks too good, I think it would upset her. Ross, why don't
you come on in. </p>

<p><strong>Ross:</strong>&nbsp; Yeah. (Gets up, but then pauses when he realizes what that
meant.)</p>

<p>(They go into the bedroom leaving Joey and Rachel alone.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> How're you doing?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I'm okay.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ooh, that bad, huh? </p>

<p><strong>Rachel:</strong> What?</p>

<p><strong>Joey:</strong> Look, I can sense when women are depressed and vulnerable. It's
one of my gifts.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> When I saw him get off that plane with her, I really thought I hit rock
bottom. But today, it's like there's rock bottom, 50 feet of crap, then me.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> You gotta tell Ross how you feel.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Come on. How can I just tell him? What about Julie?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What about her? They've only been going out for two weeks. Ross has been
in love with you for like 10 years.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I don't know, I don't know.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Look, Rach, Rach! I've been with my share of women. In fact, I've been
with like a lot of people's share of women. The point is, I've never felt about anyone the
way Ross felt about you.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (entering, angry) Yo, paisan! Can I talk to you for a sec? (Pause)
Your tailor is a very bad man!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Frankie? What're you talking about?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (entering from the bedroom) Hey, what's goin' on? (Pats Chandler on the
shoulder which causes him to jump.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Joey's tailor...took advantage of me.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No way. I've been going to the guy for 12 years.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh come on! He said he was going to do my inseam, and he ran his hand
up my leg, and then, there was definite...</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Cupping.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> That's how they do pants! First they go up one side, they move it over,
then they go up the other side, they move it back, and then they do the rear. (Chandler
and Ross stare at him) What? Ross, Ross, would you tell him? Isn't that how they measure
pants?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yes, yes it is. In prison! Whatsa matter with you?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What? That's not? (Realizes) Oh my God.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, later that day.&nbsp; Monica is now out and about.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Even Mary Tyler Moore would've been better.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I like it. I do, I think it's a Ten. (Chandler laughs.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Thank you. My hair is very amused.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Come on, Monica, things could be worse. You could get caught between
the moon and New York City. I know it's crazy, but it's true.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (to Chandler and Ross) Thank you.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, I gotta go. Bye. Bye, Rach.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (sticking her head in from the balcony) Wait, are you leaving?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, that's kinda what I meant by &quot;bye!&quot;</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, can I talk to you for a sec? </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay. (goes out onto the balcony)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey, when the doctor does that hernia test...</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> That's ok.</p>

<p>[Out on the balcony]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What's goin' on?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, first of all, Paulo and I are not back together. It was just a
stupid thing I did, and if I could go back in time and do it again, well, I wouldn't. Um,
second of all (Ross is laughing), what?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Ok. Well, before I say anything, I just need to know, is this one of those
things where you break up with a guy, and then I tell you what I think, and then the next
day you get back together with the guy, and I look like a complete idiot?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No. No-no-no-no.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, then, I think, I think the guy is scum. I hate him. I mean I
actually&#151;I-I physically hate him. I always have. You are way too good to be with a
guy like that. </p>

<p><strong>Rachel:</strong> Really?</p>

<p><strong>Ross: </strong>You deserve to be with someone who appreciates you, and who gets
how funny and sweet and amazing, and adorable, and sexy you are, you know? Someone who
wakes up every morning thinking &quot;Oh my god, I'm with Rachel&quot;. You know, someone
who makes you feel good, the way I am with Julie. (Rachel has moved closer, but hearing
that she starts to back up.) Was there a second of all?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No, I think that was the whole all.</p>

<p><strong>Ross:</strong> Okay.&nbsp; Okay. (They hug.) Okay.</p>

<p>[Cut back inside, Joey is on the phone.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I swear to god, Dad. That's not how they measure pants.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Closing Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Julie is wanting to get her hair cut from Phoebe.]</p>

<p><b>Julie:</b> I was thinking of doing it a little shorter, you know, like Andie
McDowell's new haircut?</p>

<p><strong>Phoebe:</strong> Oh yeah!&nbsp; Oh, I can do that.</p>

<p><strong>Julie:</strong> Really?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> You wanna do it right now?</p>

<p><b>Julie:</b> Great! (Julie leaves)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (to Rachel) Ok, I just wanna be really sure this time. Andie McDowell's
the girl from<em> Four Weddings and a Funeral</em>, right?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No. No no no no no. That's Rodney McDowell. Andie McDowell is the guy
from <em>Planet of the Apes</em>.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, yeah. Ok, thank you.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You're welcome.</p>
</font>

<p align="center"><strong><font size="3">End</font></strong></p>
</body>
</html>
202<html>

<head>
<title>The One With the Breast Milk</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="white" text="black" link="green" vlink="black" alink="yellow">

<h1 align="center">The One With the Breast Milk</h1>

<hr align="center">

<p>Written by: Adam Chase &amp; Ira Ungerleider<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Mindy Mattingly Phillips</a><br>
With Minor Adjustments by: <a href="mailto:eaasen@plains.nodak.edu">Eric Aasen</a><b></p>

<hr>

<p></b>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Carol and Susan are showing off Ben to the gang.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (entering from her bedroom carrying a present) Ok, these were
unbelievably expensive, and I know he's gonna grow out of them in like, 20 minutes, but I
couldn't resist. (There a little pair of Nike shoes.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, look at these! Hey, Ben. Just do it. (Ben starts to cry) Oh my God,
oh, ok, was that too much pressure for him?</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> Oh, is he hungry already?</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> I guess so. (Carol starts to breast feed Ben.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You know, it's... (sees the feeding taking place next to him)
something funny about sneakers. I'll be right back. (Goes into the kitchen)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (joins him) I gotta get one, too.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (following them into the kitchen) What are you guys doing?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> We're just hanging out by the spoons. Ladle?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Look, would you guys grow up? That is the most natural beautiful thing in
the world.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, we know, but there's a baby suckin' on it.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> This is my son having lunch, ok? It's gonna happen a lot, so you'd better
get used to it. Now if you have any problem with it, if you're uncomfortable, just ask
questions. Carol's fine with it, now come on.</p>

<p>(They go back into the living room)</p>

<p><strong>Ross:</strong> Carol?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Carol? I was just wondering if Joey could ask you a question about
breast-feeding?</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Sure.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Uh, does it hurt?</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> It did at first, but not anymore.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Chandler?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> So, uh, how often can you do it?</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> As much as he needs.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ok, I got one, I got one. Uh, if he blows into one, does the other one get
bigger?</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Opening Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, the gang is all there.]</p>

<p><b>Julie:</b> Rachel, do you have any muffins left?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, I forget which ones.</p>

<p><b>Julie:</b> Oh, you're busy, that's ok, I'll get it. Anybody else want one? </p>

<p><b>All:</b> No thanks.</p>

<p><b>Julie:</b> (To Rachel) Oh, you're losin' your apron here, let me get it. There you
go. (Ties it back up for her)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (to Julie) Thank you. (under her breath to Chandler) What a bitch.</p>

<p><b>Julie:</b> Oh, listen you guys. I have this friend at <em>Bloomingdale's</em> who's
quitting tomorrow and he wants to abuse his discount. So, anyone want to come with me and
take advantage of it?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I can't, I have to take my grandmother to the vet.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Ok, um, I'll go with you. </p>

<p><b>Julie:</b> Great.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (enters) Hi, honey.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey, sweetums.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hello to the rest.</p>

<p><b>All:</b>&nbsp; Hi!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Monica what're you doin'? You can't go shopping with her? What about
Rachel?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> It's gonna be a problem, isn't it?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Come on, you're going to <em>Bloomingdale's</em> with Julie? That's
like cheating on Rachel in her house of worship.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> But I'm...</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Monica, she will kill you. She will kill you like a dog in the street.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (to Monica) So, uh, Jules tells me you guys are going shopping tomorrow?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah, uh, it's actually not that big a deal.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> It's a big deal to me. This is great, Monica. I really appreciate this.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You're welcome.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Woof, woof. </p>

<p>[Scene: A Department Store, Joey is selling men's cologne.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (A guy walks by) Bijan for men? (Another guy walks by) Bijan for men?
(Another guy walks by) Bijan for men? (An attractive woman walks by.) <font size="3">Hey
Annabelle.</p>

<p><b>Annabelle:</b> Hey, Joey. So did you hear about the new guy?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Who?</p>

<p><b>Annabelle:</b> Nobody knows his name. Me and the girls just call him the Hombre man.</p>

<p>(The Hombre man enters.)</p>

<p><strong>Hombre Man:</strong> (to a customer) Hombre? (The guy says yes, and gets his
sample.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What's he doin' in my section?</p>

<p><b>Annabelle:</b> I guess he doesn't know.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, he's gonna. I'll see you a little later, ok? (To the Hombre Man)
Hey, how ya doin'?</p>

<p><b>Hombre Man:</b> Mornin'. </p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Listen, I know you're new, but it's kinda understood that everything from
Young Men's to the escalator is my territory.</p>

<p><b>Hombre Man:</b> Your territory, huh?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah. Bijan for men?</p>

<p><strong>Guy:</strong> No thanks.</p>

<p><b>Hombre Man:</b> Hombre?</p>

<p><strong>Guy:</strong> Yeah. All right. (They guy gets his sample and leaves.)</p>

<p><b>Hombre Man:</b> (To Joey) You were saying?</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe is there as Monica enters.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Phoebe, listen. You were with me, and we were shopping all day.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> We were shopping, and we had lunch.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, all right. What did I have?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You had a salad.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, no wonder I don't feel full.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (entering) Hey, guys, what's up.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I went shopping with Monica all day, and I had a salad.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Good, Pheebs. What'd you buy?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Um, we went shopping for um, for, fur.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You went shopping for fur?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yes, and then I realized I'm against that, and uh, so then we bought
some, (sees Monica pointing at her chest) uh, boobs.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You bought boobs?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (Monica is yanking on her bra strap) Bras! We bought bras! We bought
bras. </p>

<p>[Scene: The Department Store, Joey is trying to sell some cologne.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (to a guy) Bijan for men? (to a guy) Bijan for men? (To a woman) Bijan
for... (Sees it's a woman and stops.) (To Annabelle who walks up.) Hey, Annabelle, Uh,
listen, I was wondering if maybe after work you and I could go maybe grab a cup of coffee.</p>

<p><b>Annabelle:</b> Oh, actually I sorta have plans.</p>

<p><b>Hombre Man:</b> (entering) Ready, Annabelle?</p>

<p><b>Annabelle:</b> You bet. (to Joey) Maybe some other time?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (To a co-worker) Hey, it's not the first time I lost a girl to a cowboy
spraying cologne. (A customer walks by.) Bijan for men? (The customer ignores him, and
Joey starts to chase him) Bijan for men?! </p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Carol is dropping Ben off for Ross to watch.]</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Ok, and this is Funny Clown. Funny Clown is only for after his naps, not
before his naps or he won't sleep.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Carol, we've been through this before, ok? We have a good time. We laugh,
we play. It's like we're father and son.</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> Honey, relax. Ross is great with him. (Ross looks at her.) Don't look so
surprised. I'm a lovely person.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, this is so cute.</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> Oh, I got that for him.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> My mommies love me. That's clever.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hello? Oh, Hi, Ju&#151;(Sees Rachel is watching)&#151;Hi, Jew! (Walks
into the kitchen.) (Listens.) Uh huh? (Listens.) Uh huh? (Listens) Ok. (Listens) Um, sure,
that'd be great. See ya then. Bye. (Hangs up.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Did you just say Hi, Jew?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yes. Uh, yes, I did. That was my friend, Eddie Moskowitz. Yeah, he likes
it. Reaffirms his faith.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler, Rachel, and Joey are eating, and Phoebe is
preparing Ben's milk.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ben, dinner!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Thanks Aunt Pheebs. Hey, you didn't microwave that, did you, because it's
breast milk, and you're not supposed to do that.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Duh, I think I know how to heat breast milk. Ok. (Squirts some on her
wrist and tastes it.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What did you just do?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I licked my arm, what?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> It's breast milk.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> So?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Phoebe, that is juice, squeezed from a person.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What is the big deal? (Tastes the breast milk.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What did you just do?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Ok, would people stop drinking the breast milk?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> You won't even taste it?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Not even if you just pretend that it's milk?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Not even if Carol's breast had a picture of a missing child on it.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, time lapse.&nbsp; Rachel is entering the living room from
her bedroom as Monica enters.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey, where is everybody?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> They took Ben to the park. Where've you been?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Just out. Had some lunch, just me, little quality time with me. Thanks
for your jacket.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, no problem. You can borrow it, by the way. (Puts her hand in the
pocket) Here are your keys, hon. (She takes the keys out, sets them on the counter, and
notices she also grabbed a receipt.)</p>

<p><strong>Monica:</strong> Okay.</p>

<p><strong>Rachel:</strong> Mon, if uh you were at lunch alone, how come it cost you uh 53
dollars?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You know what probably happened? Someone musta stolen my credit card.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> And sorta just put the receipt back in your pocket?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> That is an excellent excellent question. That is excellent.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Monica, what is with you? Who'd you have lunch with?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Judy.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Who?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Julie.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Jody!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You were with Julie?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Look, when it started I was just trying to be nice to her because she
was my brother's girlfriend. And then, one thing led to another and, before I knew it, we
were...shopping.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh. Oh my God. </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Honey, wait. We only did it once. It didn't mean anything to me.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, right.&nbsp; Sure!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Really, Rachel, I was thinking of you the whole time. Look, I'm sorry,
all right. I never meant for you to find out!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, please, you wanted to get caught. (Waves the receipt)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> That is not true!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, so you just sort of happened to leave it in here?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Did it ever occur to you that I might just be that stupid?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ok, Monica. I just have to know one thing. Did you go with her to <em>Bloomingdale's</em>?
(Monica looks away.) Oh! Ok, ok, ok, I just really, uh, I just really need to not be with
you right now. (Exits.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Commercial Break</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ben is playing in his crib while Chandler and Ross are
leaning against the rim and are completely asleep.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (on the phone) Hi, who's this? (Listens) Hi, Joanne. Is Rachel working?
It's Monica. (Listens) Yes, I know I did a horrible thing. (Listens) Joanne, it's not as
simple as all that, ok? (Listens) No, I don't care what Steve thinks. (Listens) Hi, Steve.</p>

<p>(There's a knock on the door which is answered by Phoebe.)</p>

<p><strong>Carol and Susan:</strong> Hey! (This wakes Chandler and Ross up)</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> How did we do?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, I tasted Ben's milk, and Ross freaked out.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I did not freak out. </p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Why'd you freak out?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Because it's breast milk. It's gross.</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> My breast milk is gross?</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> This should be fun.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, no, Carol. There's nothing wrong with it. I just, I just don't think
breast milk is for adults.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Of course the packaging does appeal to grown-ups and kids alike.</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Ross, you're being silly. I've tried it, it's no big deal. Just taste it.
(Holding out a bottle.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (jumping away) That would be no.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Come on. It doesn't taste bad.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, it's kinda sweet, sorta like, uh...</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> Cantaloupe juice.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Exactly.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (staring at Susan) You've tasted it? You've tasted it.</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> Uh huh.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, you've tasted it.</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> You can keep saying it, but it won't stop being true.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (he rolls up his sleeve) Gimme the bottle. (Joey hands him the bottle and
Ross squirts some on his arm.) Gimme the towel. (Joey gives him the towel and he wipes it
off.) </p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is wiping down the peninsula counter as Joey
enters dressed like a cowboy.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Howdy.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (sitting on the otherside of the counter from Chandler) Gimme a box a
juice. Well, they switched me over to Hombre.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, maybe it's because of the way you're dressed.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Or maybe it's because this guy's doing so good they wanna put more people
on it. (Chandler pours some juice in a glass.) You should see this guy, Chandler, he goes
through two bottles a day.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (slides the juice across the counter which Joey catches) What do you
care? You're an actor. This is your day job. This isn't supposed to mean anything to you.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I know, but, I was the best, you know? I liked being the best. (He downs
the glass of juice in one swig.) I don't know. Maybe I should just get outta the game.
They need guys up in housewares to serve cheese.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (pours more and slides the refill to Joey) All right, say you do that.
You know sooner or later somebody's gonna come along that slices a better cheddar. And
then where're you gonna run?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah I guess you're right.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You're damn right I'm right. I say you show this guy what you're made
of. I say you stand your ground. I say you show him that you are the baddest hombre west
of the lingerie.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I'm gonna do it. (He downs the juice in one swig again.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All right. Now go see Miss Kitty and she'll fix you up with a nice
hooker.</p>

<p>[Scene: Outside Central Perk, Rachel is cleaning up and Monica is pleading with her.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I don't know what else to say.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well that works out good, because I'm not listening.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I feel terrible, I really do.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, I'm sorry, did my back hurt your knife?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Rachel, (they go back inside) say that I'm friends with her, we spend
some time together. Is that so terrible?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yes.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> It's that terrible?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yes. Monica, you don't get it. It's bad enough that she's stolen the guy
who might actually be the person that I am supposed to be with, but now, she's actually
(starting to cry), but now she's actually stealing you.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Me? What are you talking about? Nobody could steal me from you. I mean,
just because I'm friends with her doesn't make me any less friends with you. I mean,
(starting to cry) you're my...We're, we're...Oh, I love you.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I love you too. (They hug.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> You guys, um I know that this really doesn't have anything to do with
me, but um I love you guys too. (Joins in on the hug.) Oh, I really needed that. (Goes and
sits down.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Look, I know that you're in a place right now where you really need to
hate Julie's guts, but she didn't do anything wrong. I mean, she was just a girl who met a
guy, and now they go out. I really think that if you gave her a chance, you'd like her.
Would you just give that a chance, for me?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (crying) I'd do anything for you, you know that.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (crying) I'd do anything for you. (They hug again.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Wait, wait, wait, wait! (Runs over and joins in on the hug again.)</p>

<p>[Scene: The Department Store, Joey and the Hombre man are facing off in Joey's
section.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Mornin'. (The Hombre man ignores him) I said, mornin'.</p>

<p><b>Hombre Man:</b> I heard ya.</p>

<p><b>Store Guy:</b> All right, everybody, I'm openin' the doors. You boys ready?</p>

<p><b>Hombre Man:</b> Ready.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, I'm ready.</p>

<p>(An old West style showdown starts with Joey and the Hombre Man staring each other down
as the store guy slowly lets in the first customer while Joey and the Hombre Man get ready
to draw.&nbsp; In slow motion they spot the customer, eye each other, draw, and as the
customer walks into the middle Joey's bottle misfires but the Hombre Man spays it into the
customer's eyes.)</p>

<p><b>Customer:</b> You idiot, you stupid cowboy, you blinded me, I'm suing!</p>

<p><b>Store Guy:</b> Oh my god, Todd! What the hell did you do?</p>

<p><b>Hombre Man:</b> I'm sorry. I am such a doofus. I'm so sorry, I'm so sorry.</p>

<p><b>Annabelle:</b> (seeing the end result) My god, what happened?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> These new kids, they never last. Sooner or later, they all...stop lastin'.
Listen, uh, what do you say I buy you that cup of coffee now?</p>

<p><b>Annabelle:</b> Sure.</p>

<p>(They walk off into the sunset, at least a picture of one.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Julie and Rachel are sitting on the couch.]</p>

<p><b>Julie:</b> So.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> So. I just thought the two of us should hang out for a bit. I mean, you
know, we've never really talked. I guess you'd know that, being one of the two of us,
though, right?</p>

<p><b>Julie:</b> I know, I probably shouldn't even tell you this, but I'm pretty much
totally intimidated by you.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Really? Me?</p>

<p><b>Julie:</b> Yes. Oh my god, are you kidding? Ross is so crazy about you, and I really
wanted you to like me, and, it's probably me being totally paranoid, but I kinda got the
feeling that maybe you don't.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, you're not totally paranoid.</p>

<p><b>Julie:</b> Oy.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Um, ok, uh, oh god, um, when you and uh Ross first started going out, it
was really hard for me, um, for many reasons, which I'm not gonna bore you with now, but
um, I just, I see how happy he is, you know, and how good you guys are together, and um,
Monica's always saying how nice you are, and god I hate it when she's right.</p>

<p><b>Julie:</b> Thanks. Hey, listen, would you like to go to a movie sometime or
something?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, that'd be great. I'd love it.</p>

<p><b>Julie:</b> I'd love it too. Shoot, I gotta go. So, I'll talk to you later.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> All right, Julie.</p>

<p><strong>Julie:</strong> Bye. (Gets up.)</p>

<p><strong>Rachel:</strong> Bye. (After Julie exits.) What a manipulative bitch.</p>

<p align="center"><b>Closing Credits</b></p>

<p align="left">[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, another showdown is occuring, only this time
its between Ross, a plate of cookies, and the breast milk.&nbsp; They've been eyeing each
other for a while now, and Chandler and Joey are getting bored.&nbsp; He checks his Ross
and in frustration, shoves his watch in front of Ross's eyes as if saying, &quot;Hurry it
up already!&quot;&nbsp; Finally, Ross scratches his head, does that again, itches his
nose, scratches his head, grabs the bottle, takes a big swig, and piles several cookies
into his mouth.]</p>

<p align="left"><strong>Ross:</strong> (with a mouthful) That's not bad. </p>

<p align="center"><b>End</b></p>
</font>
</body>
</html>
203<html>

<head>
<title>The One Where Mr. Heckles Dies</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="white" text="black" link="green" vlink="black" alink="yellow">

<h1 align="center">The One Where Mr. Heckles Dies</h1>

<hr align="center">
<font size="3"><b><i>

<p>Originally written by Michael Curtis and Greg Malins<br>
Trascribed by <a href="mailto:mmatting@indiana.edu">Mindy Mattingly Phillips</a> <br>
With Minor Adjustments by: <a href="mailto:eaasen@plains.nodak.edu">Eric Aasen</a></i></b></font></p>

<hr size="5">

<p>CHANDLER: Hey.</p>

<p>MONICA: So how was Joan?</p>

<p>CHANDLER: I broke up with her. </p>

<p>CHANDLER: They were huge. When she sneezed, bats flew out of them.</p>

<p>RACHEL: Come on, they were not that huge.</p>

<p>CHANDLER: I'm tellin' you, she leaned back, I could see her brain.</p>

<p>MONICA: How many perfectly fine women are you gonna reject over the most superficial
insignificant things?</p>

<p>JOEY: Hold it hold it. I gotta side with Chandler on this one. When I first moved to
the city, I went out a couple of times with this girl, really hot, great kisser, but she
had the biggest Adam's apple. It made me nuts.</p>

<p>CHANDLER: You or me?</p>

<p>ROSS: I got it. Uh, Joey, women don't have Adam's apples.</p>

<p>JOEY: You guys are messin' with me, right?</p>

<p>ALL: Yeah.</p>

<p>JOEY: That was a good one. For a second there, I was like, &quot;whoa.&quot;</p>

<p>PHOEBE: You name one woman that you broke up with for a real reason.</p>

<p>CHANDLER: Maureen Rosilla.</p>

<p>ROSS: Not hating Yanni is not a real reason.</p>

<p>(knock)</p>

<p>MONICA: Hello, Mr. Heckles.</p>

<p>MR. HECKLES: You're doing it again.</p>

<p>MONICA: We're not doing anything.</p>

<p>MR. HECKLES: You're stomping. It's disturbing my birds.</p>

<p>RACHEL: You don't have birds.</p>

<p>MR. HECKLES: I could have birds.</p>

<p>MONICA: Ok, Mr. Heckles, we'll try to keep it down.</p>

<p>MR. HECKLES: Thank you. I'm going to rejoin my dinner party.</p>

<p>RACHEL: All right, bye-bye.</p>

<p>CHANDLER: Ok, Janice. Janice. You gotta give me Janice. That wasn't about being picky.</p>

<p>ROSS: We'll give you Janice.</p>

<p>PHOEBE: I miss Janice though. &quot;Hello, Chandler Bing.&quot;</p>

<p>RACHEL: &quot;Oh, my, god.&quot;</p>

<p>JOEY: &quot;Oh, Chandler, now, now, that's it. There, faster!&quot;</p>

<p>MONICA: Stop with the broom, we're not making noise.</p>

<p>RACHEL: We won. We won!</p>

<p>MONICA: Mr. Heckles.</p>

<p>RACHEL: How did this happen?</p>

<p>MR. TREEGER: He musta been sweepin'. They found a broom in his hand.</p>

<p>MONICA: That's terrible.</p>

<p>MR. TREEGER: I know. I was sweepin' yesterday. It coulda been me.ROSS: Sure, sweepin'.
You never know.</p>

<p>MR. TREEGER: You never know.</p>

<p>PHOEBE: Ok, it's very faint, but I can still sense him in the building. Go into the
light, Mr. Heckles!</p>

<p>CHANDLER: Ok, Phoebe.</p>

<p>PHOEBE: I'm sorry, but sometimes they need help. That's fine. Go ahead and scoff. You
know, there're a lot of things that I don't believe in, but that doesn't mean they're not
true.</p>

<p>JOEY: Such as?</p>

<p>PHOEBE: Like crop circles, or the Bermuda triangle, or evolution?</p>

<p>ROSS: Whoa, whoa, whoa. What, you don't, uh, you don't believe in evolution?</p>

<p>PHOEBE: Nah. Not really.</p>

<p>ROSS: You don't believe in evolution?</p>

<p>PHOEBE: I don't know, it's just, you know...monkeys, Darwin, you know, it's a, it's a
nice story, I just think it's a little too easy.</p>

<p>ROSS: Too easy? Too...The process of every living thing on this planet evolving over
millions of years from single-celled organisms, too easy?</p>

<p>PHOEBE: Yeah, I just don't buy it.</p>

<p>ROSS: Uh, excuse me. Evolution is not for you to buy, Phoebe. Evolution is scientific
fact, like, like, like the air we breathe, like gravity.</p>

<p>PHOEBE: Ok, don't get me started on gravity.</p>

<p>ROSS: You uh, you don't believe in gravity?</p>

<p>PHOEBE: Well, it's not so much that you know, like I don't believe in it, you know,
it's just...I don't know, lately I get the feeling that I'm not so much being pulled down
as I am being pushed.</p>

<p>(knock)</p>

<p>CHANDLER: Uh-Oh. It's Isaac Newton, and he's pissed.</p>

<p>MR. TREEGER: There she is. And over there, that's the other one. This is Mr. Buddy
Boyle, Mr. Heckles' attorney. He'd like to talk to you.</p>

<p>MONICA: What can we do for you?</p>

<p>MR. BOYLE: All right, kids. Here's the deal. According to my client's will, he wants to
leave all his earthly possessions to &quot;the noisy girls in the apartment above
mine&quot;.</p>

<p>MONICA: Well, what about his family?</p>

<p>MR. BOYLE: He didn't have any.</p>

<p>RACHEL: Ok, so let's talk money.</p>

<p>MR. BOYLE: All right, there was none. Let's talk signing. You be noisy girl number one,
you be noisy girl number two.</p>

<p>MONICA: I can't believe that this whole time we thought he hated us. I mean, isn't it
amazing how much you can touch someone's life, without even knowing it?...Would you look
at this dump? He hated us. This is his final revenge!</p>

<p>RACHEL: Have you ever seen so much crap?</p>

<p>CHANDLER: Actually, I think this apartment sullies the good name of crap</p>

<p>JOEY: Check this out. Can I have this?</p>

<p>ROSS: How can you not believe in evolution?</p>

<p>PHOEBE: Just don't. Look at this funky shirt!</p>

<p>ROSS: Pheebs, I have studied evolution my entire adult life. Ok, I can tell you, we
have collected fossils from all over the world that actually show the evolution of
different species, ok? You can literally see them evolving through time.</p>

<p>PHOEBE: Really? You can actually see it?</p>

<p>ROSS: You bet. In the U.S., China, Africa, all over.</p>

<p>PHOEBE: See, I didn't know that.</p>

<p>ROSS: Well, there you go.</p>

<p>PHOEBE: Huh. So now, the real question is, who put those fossils there, and why?</p>

<p>CHANDLER: Hey, look at this. &quot;My Big Book of Grievances.&quot;</p>

<p>JOEY: Hey, there's me! April 17th. Excessive noise. Italian guy comes homes with a
date. Hey Chandler, look, you're in here too.</p>

<p>CHANDLER: April 18th, excessive noise. Italian guy's gay roommate comes home with the
dry-cleaning. Well that's excellent.</p>

<p>RACHEL: Monica, Monica, look at this lamp. Is this tacky or what? We have to have this.</p>

<p>MONICA: Rache, I think we have enough regular lamps.</p>

<p>RACHEL: What? Come on, it's not like I'm asking for this girly clock or anything,
which, by the way, I also think is very cool.</p>

<p>MONICA: It doesn't go with any of my stuff.</p>

<p>RACHEL: Well, what about my stuff?</p>

<p>MONICA: You don't have any stuff.</p>

<p>RACHEL: You still think of it as your apartment, don't you?</p>

<p>MONICA: No.</p>

<p>RACHEL: Yes you do. You think of it as your apartment, and I'm just somebody who rents
a room.</p>

<p>MONICA: Mmmmm.</p>

<p>RACHEL: Ok, while you &quot;mmm&quot; on it for awhile, I'm gonna go find a place for
my new lamp.</p>

<p>ROSS: Ok, Pheebs. See how I'm making these little toys move? Opposable thumbs. Without
evolution, how do you explain opposable thumbs?</p>

<p>PHOEBE: Maybe the overlords needed them to steer their spacecrafts.</p>

<p>ROSS: Please tell me you're joking.</p>

<p>PHOEBE: Look, can't we just say that you believe in something, and I don't.</p>

<p>ROSS: No, no, Pheebs, we can't, ok, because--</p>

<p>PHOEBE: What is this obsessive need you have to make everyone agree with you? No,
what's that all about? I think, I think maybe it's time you put Ross under the microscope.</p>

<p>ROSS: Is there blood coming out of my ears?</p>

<p>JOEY: Check it out, check it out. Heckles' high school yearbook.</p>

<p>CHANDLER: Wow, he looks so normal.</p>

<p>PHOEBE: He's even kind of cute.</p>

<p>JOEY: &quot;Heckles, you crack me up in science class. You're the funniest kid in
school.</p>

<p>CHANDLER: Funniest? Heckles? </p>

<p>JOEY: That's what it says.</p>

<p>CHANDLER: Wow, Heckles was voted class clown, and so was I. He was right. Would you
listen to that?</p>

<p>PHOEBE: I'd call that excessive.</p>

<p>CHANDLER: Whoa! </p>

<p>JOEY: What?</p>

<p>CHANDLER: Heckles played clarinet in band, and I played clarinet. And he was in the
scale modeler's club, and I was, well, there was no club, but I sure thought they were
cool.</p>

<p>JOEY: So, you were both dorks. Big deal.</p>

<p>CHANDLER: I just think it's weird, you know? Heckles and me, Heckles, and me, me and
Heckles...Would you knock it off?</p>

<p>JOEY: Have you been here all night?</p>

<p>CHANDLER: Look at this. Pictures of all the women that Heckles went out with. Look what
he wrote on them. Vivian, too tall. Madge, big gums. Too loud, too smart, makes noise when
she eats. This is, this is me. This is what I do. I'm gonna end up alone, just like he
did.</p>

<p>JOEY: Chandler, Heckles was a nut case.</p>

<p>CHANDLER: Our trains are on the same track, ok? Yeah, sure, I'm coming up 30 years
behind him, but the stops are all the same. Bitter Town. Aloneville. Hermit Junction.</p>

<p>JOEY: All right, you know what we gotta do? We gotta get you outta here. Come on, I'll
buy you breakfast, let's go.</p>

<p>CHANDLER: What if I never find someone? Or worse, what if I've found her, but I dumped
her because she pronounced it &quot;supposably&quot;?</p>

<p>JOEY: Chandler, come on, you're gonna find somebody.</p>

<p>CHANDLER: How do you know that? How?</p>
