210<html>

<head>
<title>The One With Russ</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="white" text="black" link="green" vlink="black" alink="yellow">

<h1 align="center">The One With Russ</h1>

<hr align="center">
<i>

<p>Written by Ira Ungerlieder.</i><br>
<i>Transcribed by Josh Hodge.</i><br>
<i>Minor additions and adjustments by Dan Silverstein.</i><br>
</p>

<hr>
<font size="3">

<p>[The gang is walking to a newsstand late at night. Joey is anxiously in the lead.]</p>

<p>RACH: Joey, would you slow down? They're not gonna be sold out of papers at one o'clock
in the morning.</p>

<p>JOEY: I'm excited! I've never gotten reviewed before.</p>

<p>MNCA: You were so amazing as the king. I was really impressed, I was.</p>

<p>PHOE: Although, you know what? You might want to consider wearing underwear next time.
Yeah, cause when you sat down on your throne you could kind of see your... royal subject.</p>

<p>JOEY: Here it is, here it is. [reading from newspaper] <i>The only thing worse than the
mindless, adolescent direction was Joseph Tribbiani's disturbingly unskilled portrayal of
the king.</i></p>

<p>CHAN: OK, look, that is one guy's opinion, alright. Phoebs, read yours.</p>

<p>PHOE: OK. [reading] <i>The only thing worse than the mindless, adolescent direction...</i></p>

<p>CHAN: Does anyone have one from a <b>different</b> paper? Ross, read yours.</p>

<p>ROSS: I don't want to.</p>

<p>RACH: Joey, honey, they don't know what they're talking about.</p>

<p>ROSS: Yeah.</p>

<p>JOEY: Maybe they do. I've been doin' this ten years and I haven't gotten anywhere.
There's gotta be a reason.</p>

<p>ROSS: Oh c'mon. Maybe you're just, uhhh... paying your dues.</p>

<p>JOEY: No, no, no, it.. it's too hard. It's not worth it. I quit.</p>

<p>MNCA: Wait, wait, wait, wait, wait one minute. Wait a minute. I believe <b>this</b>
will change your mind. [Reads from paper] <i>In a mediocre play, Joseph Tribbiana was able
to achieve brilliant new levels of...</i> continued on page 153...[turns it]<i> sucking.</i></p>

<h2 align="center">Credits</h2>

<p>[Scene: Chandler, Phoebe, Rachel, Monica comforting Joey at Monica and Rachel's
apartment.]</p>

<p>JOEY: When I was little, I wanted to be a veteranarian, but then I found out you had to
put your hands into cows and stuff.</p>

<p>[Ross enters, depressed.]</p>

<p>ROSS: [sullenly] Hiiiiii.</p>

<p>PHOE: Are... are you OK?</p>

<p>ROSS: Yeah, yeah, just a tough day at work. A stegosaurus fell over and trapped a kid.
Whoa, whoa, I know this jacket, this is, th--Fun Bobby's jacket! Where is he, what. He,
he's here, isn't he?</p>

<p>MNCA: Maybe.</p>

<p>ROSS: Don't toy with me.</p>

<p>[Fun Bobby (FBOB) enters from Monica's bedroom.]</p>

<p>FBOB: Geller!</p>

<p>ROSS: Hey, Fun Bobby!</p>

<p>FBOB: Hey. Whoa, hey, you've been working out, huh?</p>

<p>ROSS: Not at all! I love this guy. Hey, I was so psyched to hear you're back with my
sister!</p>

<p>MNCA: You and me both.</p>

<p>FBOB: Hey, so what'd I miss, what'd I miss, c'mon?</p>

<p>PHOE: Oh, we were just trying to make Joey feel better.</p>

<p>FBOB: Hey, do you need me to pick you up?</p>

<p>JOEY: No, I'm alright man. Really.</p>

<p>FBOB: No, I'm picking you up.</p>

<p>JOEY: Hey no, seriously, I don't need you to pick me... [Fun Bobby picks Joey up off
the ground, bounces him. Joey laughs.] Alright! It still works.</p>

<p>FBOB: OK, now before I go, does anybody else need to be picked up? [everyone raises
their hands] I'm still gonna go.</p>

<p>MNCA: OK, I'll see you later babe.</p>

<p>FBOB: Uh, public display of affection coming up. You can avert your eyes. [kisses
Monica]</p>

<p>[Chandler and Joey are watching, Rachel turns their heads away from Monica.]</p>

<p>FBOB: See ya. [exits]</p>

<p>ALL: Bye! See you later!</p>

<p>PHOE: Fun Bobby is so great.</p>

<p>MNCA: Oh, isn't he? Oh, you know, I really think this time it may work with him. I
mean, he just makes me feel so good and I've been feeling so lousy this last couple of
months, no job, no boyfriend. Well, at least my cup is half full.</p>

<p>PHOE: Half full of <b>looooovvvvve</b>.</p>

<p>MNCA: And for our two-week anniversary, he's gonna take me to his cousin's cabin for
the weekend.</p>

<p>PHOE: Cabin of <b>loooooovvvvve</b>.</p>

<p>RACH: We went through a <b>lot</b> of wine tonight, you guys. [walks over to table,
holding five empty wine bottles]</p>

<p>MNCA: Really? I only had two glasses.</p>

<p>JOEY: I just had a glass.</p>

<p>PHOE: Two.</p>

<p>RACH: I had one glass.</p>

<p>CHAN: I had about a mugful in this lovely 'I got boned at the Museum of Natural
History' mug.</p>

<p>RACH: OK, so that's... that's what, two bottles? And yet somehow we went through five?</p>

<p>[All look towards door Fun Bobby left through.]</p>

<p>ROSS: Oooooh.</p>

<p>JOEY: [realizing what everyone else did a minute ago] Ooooooh.</p>

<p>MNCA: So what. So he drank a lot tonight.</p>

<p>ROSS: Yeah but, you know, now that I think about it, I don't think I've ever seen Fun
Bobby without a... a drink in his hand.</p>

<p>PHOE: Yeah. Oh, OOOH, yeah, you know, did you notice how he always starts his stories
with, um, OK, 'I was soooo wasted,' or, 'Oh, we were soooo bombed,' or, ummm, ooh, ooh,
'So I wake up, and I'm in this dumpster in Connecticut.'</p>

<p>JOEY: Monica, have you ever been with him when he <b>wasn't</b> drinking?</p>

<p>MNCA: Well, we just happen to go to alot of places where you might drink. I mean, how
do you go to a wine tasting without having a drink? Or... or to a club, or to the... zoo.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica, Fun Bobby, and Phoebe sitting in <i>Central Perk</i> Rachel is serving
them. She brings a mug to Monica.]</p>

<p>MNCA: Rach, does this have nonfat milk?</p>

<p>RACH: Ehhhummmm, I don't know, why don't you taste it.</p>

<p>MNCA: [takes a sip] Mmmm, no.</p>

<p>RACH: Oh well, too late, sorry, you already had some.</p>

<p>FBOB: [pulls out a flask] Whattaya say we make these, uh, coffees Irish?</p>

<p>[Phoebe and Rachel look uncomfortable.]</p>

<p>PHOE: Um, cake.</p>

<p>RACH: Yeah, we're gonna... we're gonna get some cake. [Phoebe and Rachel go to
counter.]</p>

<p>MNCA: You know what? It seems like you've been making an awful lot of stuff Irish
lately.</p>

<p>FBOB: Well, I would make them Belgian, but the waffles are hard to get into that flask.</p>

<p>MNCA: Bobby.</p>

<p>FBOB: Yeah, OK.</p>

<p>MNCA: Look, maybe this is none of my business, or maybe it is, I don't know... but, uh,
I'm kind of worried about you.</p>

<p>FBOB: OK, look, this isn't the first time somebody's said something to me about this,
but, I don't know... I always made excuses about it, like... uhhh... 'I'm just a social
drinker,' or, 'C'mon, it's Flag Day.'</p>

<p>MNCA: So, what are you saying now?</p>

<p>FBOB: I guess I'm saying, I'll try and quit. I kinda like that you worry about me.
[they hug]</p>

<p>PHOE: [comes back to couch, with cake] Sooo, what's goin' on, huh?</p>

<p>FBOB: I am gonna try and quit drinking.</p>

<p>PHOE: [sad] Ooohh, why?</p>

<p>[Chandler and Joey enter.]</p>

<p>CHAN: Hey.</p>

<p>JOEY: Hey.</p>

<p>MNCA: Hey.</p>

<p>PHOE: Hey.</p>

<p>CHAN: Guess who's back in show business.</p>

<p>PHOE: Ohh, ohh, Lorne Green?</p>

<p>CHAN: No, no, Phoebs. You know why? Cause he's dead.</p>

<p>PHOE: Oh, no.</p>

<p>CHAN: OK, I guess this is gonna seem kinda bittersweet now, but... Joey, that's who.</p>

<p>JOEY: Yeah, my agent just called me with an audition for <i>Days of Our Lives</i>!</p>

<p>PHOE: Oh, well, we have to celebrate. You know what we should do? We should do, like, a
soap opera theme.</p>

<p>CHAN: Hey, yeah... we could all sleep together and then one of us could get amnesia.</p>

<p>PHOE: Hey Rach, what time do you get off? We're all gonna do something tonight.</p>

<p>RACH: Ummmm.... well, actually I'm already done, but I...I kinda got plans.</p>

<p>MNCA: [gasps] You have other friends?</p>

<p>RACH: Yeah... I, uhh... I have a... I have a date.</p>

<p>MNCA: What?</p>

<p>JOEY: With a man?</p>

<p>RACH: What? What is so strange about me having a date?</p>

<p>JOEY: What about Ross? I mean, are you still mad at him cause he made that list about
you?</p>

<p>RACH: Noooo, no, I'm not mad at him. I'm.. I'm not really <b>anything</b> at him
anymore.</p>

<p>MNCA: What are you talking about?</p>

<p>RACH: I don't know. Whatever I was feeling, I'm... not.</p>

<p>PHOE: But you guys came so close.</p>

<p>RACH: Oh, I know, I'm sorry you guys. You're just gonna have to get used to the fact
that I will not be dating Ross.</p>

<p>[Russ enters <i>Central Perk</i>. He looks like Ross, except for his chin and hair (it
is David Schwimmer in a dual role).]</p>

<p>RACH: Here he is. Hi. Guys, this is Russ.</p>

<p>RUSS: [sounding like Ross] Hhhhiiiii.</p>

<p>[Everyone looks at each other in amazement.]</p>

<p>[Scene: <i>Estelle Leonard Talent Agency</i>. Estelle (ESTL) is speaking on the phone.]</p>

<p>ESTL: Stop saying you're not talented, you're very talented. It's just with the bird
dead and all, there's very little act left. Oh, honey, give me a break, will ya? [a knock
on the door] Oooh, ooh, I'll talk to you later.</p>

<p>[Joey enters.]</p>

<p>ESTL: Well, there's my favorite client. So tell me darling, how was the audition?</p>

<p>JOEY: Well, I think it went pretty well. I.. I got a callback for Thursday.</p>

<p>ESTL: Joey, have you ever seen me ecstatic?</p>

<p>JOEY: No.</p>

<p>ESTL: Well, here it is. [She almost smiles.]</p>

<p>JOEY: OK, uh.... listen, there's something I want to talk to you about. The network
casting lady...</p>

<p>ESTL: Oh, isn't Lori a doll?</p>

<p>JOEY: Oh yeah, yeah, she's great, but... I kinda got the feeling that she was sort
of... coming on to me. And I definitely would get the part if I would've... you know... if
I would have sent the Little General in.</p>

<p>ESTL: Oh, I see. Well, I'm just gonna put in a call here and we'll find out what's
goin' on and straighten it out. [picks up the phone] Yeah, hi, Lori please. [pause] Hi
darling. So how 'bout Joey Tribbiani for the part of the cab driver, isn't he terrific?
[pause] Uh-huuuuh. [pause] Uh-huuuuh. OK, doll. Talk to you later. [hangs up] [to Joey]
Yeah, you're gonna have to sleep with her.</p>

<p>[Scene: <i>Central Perk</i>. Monica and Rachel at counter, Phoebe, Chandler, and Fun
Bobby at the couch.]</p>

<p>RACH: What's the matter?</p>

<p>MNCA: It's Fun Bobby.</p>

<p>RACH: What, isn't he sober?</p>

<p>MNCA: Oh, he's sober alright. Just turns out that Fun Bobby was fun for a reason.</p>

<p>RACH: Ohhh, OK.</p>

<p>[Monica returns to couch next to Fun Bobby.]</p>

<p>MNCA: Alright, here you go, sweetie. [hands Fun Bobby his coffee]</p>

<p>FBOB: Thanks. You wanna hear something funny?</p>

<p>MNCA: Oh God, yes!</p>

<p>FBOB: There are no hardware stores open past midnight in the Village.</p>

<p>PHOE: That <b>is</b> funny.</p>

<p>FBOB: I needed to buy a hammer the other night, and I'm out walkin' around the
neighborhood but apparently there are no hardware stores open past midnight in the
Village.</p>

<p>MNCA: Ahhh, hey honey? Don't you have to be at your interview now?</p>

<p>FBOB: Oh yeah. See you guys. [leaves]</p>

<p>CHAN: Bye..... ridiculously dull Bobby.</p>

<p>MNCA: Oh.... my... God.</p>

<p>PHOE: It's not that bad.</p>

<p>MNCA: Not that bad? Did you <b>hear</b> the hammer story?</p>

<p>PHOE: OK, OK, don't get all squinky.</p>

<p>RACH: Maybe it was just the kind of story where you have to be there.</p>

<p>MNCA: But I'm gonna be there... for the rest of my life. I mean, I can't break up with
him. I'm the one who made him quit drinking. He's dull because of me.</p>

<p>PHOE: Alright, don't say that. He's probably always been dull. You just, you know, set
it free.</p>

<p>[Russ enters, walking in behind Chandler.]</p>

<p>RUSS: Hi.</p>

<p>CHAN: [turning around] Hey Ross.... bahhhh!</p>

<p>RACH: Hi Russ, I've just got two more tables to clean and then we'll go, OK?</p>

<p>RUSS: OK, I'll just sit here and... uh... chat with your, uh.... friend-type....people.</p>

<p>[Phoebe walks up to Rachel, cleaning tables.]</p>

<p>PHOE: Rachel? Um, hi.</p>

<p>RACH: Hi.</p>

<p>PHOE: OK, so, you know what you're doing, right?</p>

<p>RACH: Uhh.... waitressing?</p>

<p>PHOE: Well, yeah, but... no. I mean, umm... doesn't.... doesn't Russ just remind you of
someone?</p>

<p>RACH: [looks at him] Huh, Bob Saget?</p>

<p>PHOE: [looks at Russ] Oh, yeah! No, no, no, no, oh, oh.</p>

<p>[Phoebe turns back around but Rachel is gone. Ross enters.]</p>

<p>PHOE: Oh, my, oh!</p>

<p>ROSS: What? What's wrong?</p>

<p>PHOE: I, OK....</p>

<p>MNCA: She's just upset because she, uh, she buttered a spider into her toast this
morning.</p>

<p>ROSS: Alright.</p>

<p>CHAN: [to Phoebe] Listen, Phoebs, this is gonna be OK. [introducing Russ and Ross]
Ross, Russ. Russ, Ross.</p>

<p>RUSS: Hi.</p>

<p>ROSS: Hi.</p>

<p>RUSS: Are you a, uh, friend of Rachel's?</p>

<p>ROSS: Yes, yes I am. Are you a, uh, a friend of Rachel's?</p>

<p>RUSS: Actually, I'm a... kind of a.... you know, a... date-type... thing... of
Rachel's.</p>

<p>ROSS: A date.</p>

<p>RUSS: Yeah, I'm her date.</p>

<p>ROSS: Oh, oh, you're... uh... you're, oh <b>you're</b> the date.</p>

<p>CHAN: You know, this is actually good, because if we ever lose Ross, we have a spare.</p>

<p>RUSS: Oh, you are the, uh... paleontologist.</p>

<p>ROSS: Yes, yes I am. And you are a....</p>

<p>RUSS: Periodontist.</p>

<p>MNCA: See? They're as different as night and... later that night.</p>

<p>ROSS: Well, I am going to, uh... get a beverage. It was nice, nice... uh... meeting
you.</p>

<p>RUSS: Ditto.</p>

<p>[ROss approaches Rachel at counter.]</p>

<p>ROSS: I, uh, well... I... I met Russ.</p>

<p>RACH: Oh.</p>

<p>ROSS: Hey, I didn't know we were, uh, seeing other people.</p>

<p>RACH: Well, we're not seeing each other, so....</p>

<p>ROSS: Well, uh, for your information, there's a woman at the museum, who's curator of
moths and other... uh... winged things... who's, uh, let it be known that she is drawn to
me much like a... well, you know. But so far I've been keeping her at bay, but, uh, if
this is the deal...</p>

<p>RACH: Well, yeah, this is the deal.</p>

<p>ROSS: OK, well, um, have a nice evening.</p>

<p>RACH: Um, Russ, you ready?</p>

<p>RUSS: Yeah.</p>

<p>RACH: Bye.</p>

<p>MNCA: Bye.</p>

<p>PHOE: Bye.</p>

<p>[Russ and Rachel leave together.]</p>

<p>ROSS: [upset] She's dating. <b>She's dating.</b></p>

<p>CHAN: Yes, yes, but did you see <b>who</b> she was dating?</p>

<p>ROSS: What do you mean?</p>

<p>MNCA: Do you not see it?</p>

<p>ROSS: See what? I don't know what she sees in... innn that goober. And it takes him,
what? Like... like... I don't know, uhh... uhhh, hello.... a... week, to get out a
sentence.</p>

<p>CHAN: Yeah, it's annoying, isn't it?</p>

<p>ROSS: ....................Yeah.</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's apartment. Joey is making marinara sauce and filling every
container in sight. Chandler enters.]</p>

<p>CHAN: Hey.</p>

<p>JOEY: Hey.</p>

<p>CHAN: Whoa, whoa, so I'm guessing you didn't get the part, or... uh, Italy called and
said it was hungry.</p>

<p>JOEY: Well, the part's mine if I want it.</p>

<p>CHAN: Oh my God!</p>

<p>JOEY: Yeah, if I'm willing to sleep with the casting lady.</p>

<p>CHAN: [not knowing how to react] Oh my... God?</p>

<p>JOEY: Ten years I've been waiting for a break like this Chandler, ten years! I mean, <i>Days
of Our Lives</i>. That's actually on television.</p>

<p>CHAN: So, what're you gonna do?</p>

<p>JOEY: Well, I guess I could sleep with her... I mean, how could I do that?</p>

<p>CHAN: Well, I... I've got a pop-up book that told me everything I need to know.</p>

<p>JOEY: I've never slept with someone for a part.</p>

<p>CHAN: Well is she... [reaches into the cookie jar for a cookie, takes his hand out,
covered with pasta sauce]</p>

<p>JOEY: Sorry.</p>

<p>CHAN: It's alright. Is she good-looking?</p>

<p>JOEY: Yeah, she's totally good looking. I mean, if I met her in a bar, or something,
I'd be buying her breakfast. [pause] You know, after having slept with her.</p>

<p>CHAN: Y'know, maybe this isn't such a big deal. Y'know, I mean, the way that I see it
is you get a great job <b>and</b> you get to have sex. Y'know, I mean, throw in a tree and
a fat guy and you've got Christmas.</p>

<p>JOEY: I just... I just don't think that I want it that way though, y'know? I mean,
let's say I do make it, alright? I'm always gonna look back and wonder if it was because
of my talent or because of.. y'know, the Little General.</p>

<p>CHAN: Didn't you used to call it the Little Major?</p>

<p>JOEY: Yeah, but after Denise DeMarco, I had to promote it.</p>

<p>[Scene: A restaurant. Fun Bobby and Monica are ordering.]</p>

<p>WAITER: Can I get you something from the bar?</p>

<p>MNCA: Yes, I would like something. [looks at Fun Bobby, changes her mind] No, no thank
you.</p>

<p>FBOB: If... if you want to drink, it's OK with me, I've got to get used to it.</p>

<p>MNCA: No, no really. I.. I wouldn't feel right about it. [to waiter] Just some water.</p>

<p>FBOB: So the light went out in my refrigerator...</p>

<p>MNCA: [grabs waiter as he's leaving] I'd like a scotch on the rocks with a twist.</p>

<p>[Scene: <i>Central Perk</i>. Chandler is sitting on the couch between Russ and Ross,
doing a crossword puzzle.]</p>

<p>CHAN: Hey, we're having some fun now, huh, Ross? Wanna do another one, huh Russ? OK...
eleven letters, atomic element number 101... ends in <i>ium</i>.</p>

<p>RUSS: Dysprosium.</p>

<p>ROSS: [condescendingly] Dysprosium? Try mendelevium.</p>

<p>CHAN: And weenie number two has it. Unless, of course, nine-down, <i>Knights in White
Satin</i> was sung by the Doody Blues.</p>

<p>[Phoebe and Rachel are at the counter talking.]</p>

<p>PHOE: You don't see it? You actually don't see it?</p>

<p>RACH: What?</p>

<p>PHOE: OK honey, you're dating Ross.</p>

<p>RACH: No, Phoebs. I'm dating <b>Russ</b>.</p>

<p>PHOE: Russ is Ross. Russ... Ross!</p>

<p>RACH: Steve... sleeve!</p>

<p>PHOE: OK, noone is named Sleeve.</p>

<p>RACH: Phoebe, what the hell are you talking about? Other than their names being
similar, I'm sorry, I do not see what you're seeing.</p>

<p>[They look over at Russ and Ross.]</p>

<p>ROSS: [to Russ] For your information, it's a card sharp, not a card shark.</p>

<p>RUSS: You could not be more wrong. You could try... but you would not be successful.</p>

<p>CHAN: OK, I'm gonna get some more coffee before the pinching and eye-poking begins.</p>

<p>RUSS: I know what your problem is.</p>

<p>ROSS: Oh you do, do you?</p>

<p>RUSS: Um-hum, you're jealous.</p>

<p>ROSS: Of... of what?</p>

<p>RUSS: You're jealous because I'm a real doctor.</p>

<p>ROSS: Hey, you're a doctor of <b>gums</b>. That's the smallest body part you can major
in. It's like day one, floss. Day two, here's your diploma.</p>

<p>RUSS: Hey, you listen.</p>

<p>ROSS: No, no, let me finish.</p>

<p>RUSS: No, let me finish.</p>

<p>ROSS: No, you let me fini...</p>

<p>[Rachel walks up behind them.]</p>

<p>ROSS: Hi.</p>

<p>RUSS: Hi.</p>

<p>RACH: Ewww, ewww, ewww, ewww! [turns away]</p>

<p>[Scene: Ross, Phoebe, Rachel, and Chandler at Monica and Rachel's apartment.]</p>

<p>RACH: Did Joey say what he was gonna go when he left?</p>

<p>CHAN: No, I don't even think he knew. Hey, would you sleep with somebody to get a great
job?</p>

<p>RACH: I don't know. Who would I have to sleep with?</p>

<p>CHAN: Me.</p>

<p>RACH: Why would I have to sleep with you?</p>

<p>CHAN: It's my game. You want the job or not?</p>

<p>[Monica enters from her bedroom.]</p>

<p>CHAN: Hey.</p>

<p>MNCA: Morning.</p>

<p>ROSS: Where ya goin'?</p>

<p>MNCA: Bobby and I are going away for the weekend, remember?</p>

<p>ROSS: Ooooohhhh.</p>

<p>[Monica pulls out a bag full of airline bottles of liquor.]</p>

<p>PHOE: What's with all the bottles of liquor?</p>

<p>ROSS: What's going on, is... uh, Bobby drinking again?</p>

<p>MNCA: Oh no no, this is not for him, this is for me. That way he's still sober but I
find his stories about shoelaces much more amusing.</p>

<p>[Three slow knocks on the door.]</p>

<p>RACH: Oh God, even his knock is boring.</p>

<p>[Monica answers the door. Its Fun Bobby.]</p>

<p>MNCA: Hi. I'll be ready in just a second.</p>

<p>FBOB: Uh, can I talk to you a minute?</p>

<p>MNCA: Sure.</p>

<p>[They both step out into the hall.]</p>

<p>FBOB: This is really hard for me to say.</p>

<p>MNCA: Oh God, you fell off the wagon.</p>

<p>FBOB: Oh, no, no, it's about you.</p>

<p>MNCA: What about me?</p>

<p>FBOB: I think you may have a drinking problem.</p>

<p>MNCA: What these? [holding up liquor bottles] Oh, these are, um, for.. cuts and
scrapes.</p>

<p>FBOB: Look, I am just not strong enough to be in a codependent relationship right now,
OK?</p>

<p>MNCA: Oh... shoot.</p>

<p>FBOB: Well, anyway, I hope we can be friends.</p>

<p>MNCA: OK.</p>

<p>[They hug and kiss.]</p>

<p>MNCA: Take care.</p>

<p>FBOB: You too.</p>

<p>[Fun Bobby leaves and Monica goes back inside.]</p>

<p>RACH: What happened?</p>

<p>MNCA: Well we... we kinda broke up.</p>

<p>GANG: Awwwwwwww.</p>

<p>[Ross, Phoebe, Chandler, and Rachel all exchange money.]</p>

<p>MNCA: [holding bottles] Does anybody want these?</p>

<p>CHAN: I'll take one. Sometimes I like to hold stuff like this and pretend I'm a giant.</p>

<p>[Joey enters.]</p>

<p>JOEY: Hey.</p>

<p>GANG: Hey!</p>

<p>ROSS: How'd the callback go?</p>

<p>JOEY: It was unbelievable! I walked in there and she was all over me.</p>

<p>CHAN: So what'd you do?</p>

<p>JOEY: Well, I couldn't do it. I told her I didn't want to get the part that way.</p>

<p>ROSS: Good for you.</p>

<p>JOEY: But wait, wait, wait. Then, after I left her office, she caught up with me at the
elevator and offered me an even bigger part.</p>

<p>PHOE: So... and?</p>

<p>JOEY: Soooooo... you are now looking at Dr. Drake Ramore, neurosurgeon, recurring in at
least four episodes!</p>

<p>GANG: Allright!</p>

<p>JOEY: Alright... I've got to go shower. [leaves]</p>

<p>[Phoebe, Ross, Rachel, Chandler exchange money again.]</p>

<p align="center"><b>Credits</b> [Scene: <i>Central Perk</i>. Russ enters. Chandler and
Phoebe are sitting on the couch.]</p>

<p>RUSS: Hi.</p>

<p>CHAN: Oh, hey.</p>

<p>PHOE: Hi.</p>

<p>RUSS: I guess you guys heard, Rachel dumped me.</p>

<p>CHAN: Yeah, I'm sorry man.</p>

<p>RUSS: Oh, all she said was that I remind her too much of somebody. You have any idea
who she's talking about?</p>

<p>[Chandler and Phoebe feign ignorance.]</p>

<p>PHOE: Oh I do, it's.... it's Bob Saget. She hates him.</p>

<p>RUSS: Oh.</p>

<p>[Julie... Ross's ex-girlfriend... enters.]</p>

<p>JULIE: Hey.</p>

<p>CHAN: Hey!</p>

<p>PHOE: Hey, Julie! Hey, how are you doing?</p>

<p>JULIE: Um, oh, I don't know. I mean, it's definitely weird not being with Ross, but I
guess I'm doing OK. Actually I've got some of his stuff that he, um....</p>

<p>[Russ and Julie look at each other with love in their eyes. The music builds...]</p>

<p align="center"><font size="4"><b>END</b></font> </font></p>

<hr>

211<html>

<head>
<title>The One With the Lesbian Wedding</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="white" text="black" link="green" vlink="black" alink="yellow">

<h1 align="center">The One With the Lesbian Wedding</h1>

<hr align="center">
<font size="3"><b><i>

<p>Originally written by Doty Abrams<br>
Transcribed by <a href="mailto:mmatting@indiana.edu">Mindy Mattingly Phillips</i></b></font></a><br>
</p>

<hr>
<font size="3">

<p><i>[at Ross's. Carol and Susan are picking Ben up]</i></p>

<p>ROSS: Ok. Here's his diaper bag, and his uh, Mr. Winky, and uh...oh, him. Hi!</p>

<p>CAROL: So how did everything go?</p>

<p>ROSS: Oh, great. Great. There was a projectile, uh, throwing up incident, but he
started it.</p>

<p>CAROL: Well, we've gotta go.</p>

<p>ROSS: Ok.</p>

<p>SUSAN: <i>[clears her throat]</i></p>

<p>CAROL: Oh, right. Um, I've got some news. It's about us.</p>

<p>ROSS: Oh, you and me?</p>

<p>CAROL: Uh, no, Susan and me.</p>

<p>SUSAN: The other us.</p>

<p>ROSS: Ok.</p>

<p>CAROL: We're uh, we're getting married.</p>

<p>ROSS: As in, &quot;I now pronounce you wife and wife&quot; married?</p>

<p>CAROL: Anyway, we'd like you to come, but we totally understand if you don't want to.</p>

<p>ROSS: Why wouldn't I want to come? I had fun at the first wedding.</p>

<p>CAROL: Look I just thought that...</p>

<p>ROSS: No no no, I mean, hey, why shouldn't I be happy for you? What would it say about
me if I couldn't revel in your joy? I'm revelling baby, believe me!</p>

<p>SUSAN: Is your finger caught in that chair?</p>

<p>ROSS: Mmm hmmm.</p>

<p>CAROL: Want us to go?</p>

<p>ROSS: Uh-huh.</p>

<p><i>[at Rachel and Monica's]</i></p>

<p>ROSS: This is so cool. You're actually gonna be on television.</p>

<p>JOEY: It really hit me last night. I'm gonna be on Days of our Lives. And then I
started thinkin' about all of u, and how these are the days of our lives..</p>

<p>MONICA: Yes! Carol and Susan's caterer had a mountain bike accident this weekend, and
she's in a full body cast.</p>

<p>ROSS, CHANDLER &amp; JOEY: Yes!</p>

<p>MONICA: They want me to do it, which is really cool, seeing as I've never catered
before, and I really need the money, and this isn't a problem for you, is it?</p>

<p>ROSS: Would it matter?</p>

<p>MONICA: Oh, you are so great! <i>[kisses him]</i> Thank you!</p>

<p>JOEY: Are you really not going?</p>

<p>ROSS: I am really not going. I don't get it. They already live together, why do they
need to get married?</p>

<p>MONICA: They love each other, and they wanna celebrate that love with the people that
are close with them.</p>

<p>ROSS: If you wanna call that a reason.</p>

<p>CHANDLER: <i>[singing to the tune of Mister Rogers' Neighborhood]</i> Who's the
bitterest man in the living room, the bitterest man in the living room? Hi, neighbor.</p>

<p>MONICA: Ross, I thought you were over this.</p>

<p>ROSS: Look, that has nothing to do with this, ok? She's my ex-wife. If she were
marrying a guy, none of you'd expect me to be there.</p>

<p>JOEY: Hey, if she were marrying a guy, she'd be like the worst lesbian ever.</p>

<p>RACHEL: <i>[entering hurriedly]</i> Did I miss it? Did I miss it?</p>

<p>JOEY: No, I'm on right after this guy shoots himself.</p>

<p>CHANDLER: Whoa, she's pretty.</p>

<p>JOEY: Yeah, and she's really nice too. She taught me all about how to work the cameras,
and smell-the-fart acting.</p>

<p>RACHEL: I'm sorry, what?</p>

<p>MONICA: What?</p>

<p>JOEY: It's like, you got so many lines to learn so fast, that sometimes you need a
minute to remember your next one. So while you're thinkin' of it, you take this big pause
where you look all intense, you know, like this. </p>

<p>CHANDLER: Oh, ok.</p>

<p>JOEY: There's my scene, there's my scene. <i>[Joey on tv]</i> &quot;Mrs. Wallace, I'm
Dr. Drake Ramoray, your sister's neurosurgeon. </p>

<p>MRS. WALLACE: Is she gonna be all right?</p>

<p>JOEY: I'm afraid the situation is much worse than we expected. Your sister is suffering
from a..subcranial hematoma. Perhaps we can discuss this over coffee.</p>

<p>CHANDLER: Nice!</p>

<p>RACHEL: That's great!</p>

<p>ROSS: Excellent!</p>

<p>CHANDLER: For a minute there I thought you were actually tryin' to smell something.</p>

<p><i>[Monica and Rachel's]</i></p>

<p>ROSS: That is so good! Do it again!</p>

<p>JOEY: All right, all right. &quot;Damnit Braverman, it's right there on the
chart!&quot;</p>

<p>CHANDLER: That's great. All right, I gotta get to work, I got a big dinosaur bone to
inspect.</p>

<p>ROSS: No no, that's me.</p>

<p>CHANDLER: Oh, yeah. </p>

<p>ROSS: Oh, hello.</p>

<p>PHOEBE: Oh, thanks. I couldn't uh...</p>

<p>ROSS: Is everything ok?</p>

<p>PHOEBE: Um, no, huh-uh. One of my clients died on the massage table today.</p>

<p>ROSS: Oh my god.</p>

<p>CHANDLER: That's a little more relaxed than you want them to get.</p>

<p>PHOEBE: Yeah, um, she was 82 years old. Her name was um, Mrs. Adelman.</p>

<p>MONICA: Oh, honey.</p>

<p>PHOEBE: Yeah, it's just so strange. I mean, she probably woke up today and thought,
&quot;ok, I'll have some breakfast, and then I'll take a little walk, and then I'll have
my massage.&quot; Little did she know God was thinking, &quot;Ok, but that's it.&quot; Oh,
but the weirdest thing was, ok, I was cleansing her aura when she died, and when the
spirit left her body, I don't think it went very far.</p>

<p>RACHEL: What do you mean?</p>

<p>PHOEBE: I think it went into me.</p>

<p><i>[Everyone takes a step back from Phoebe]</i></p>

<p><i>[Central Perk]</i></p>

<p>MONICA: God, this is so hard. I can't decide between lamb or duck.</p>

<p>CHANDLER: Well, of course, lambs are scarier. Otherwise the movie would've been called
Silence of the Ducks.</p>

<p>RACHEL: Ok, who ordered what?</p>

<p>ROSS: Oh, I believe I had the half-drunk cappuccino with the lipstick on the rim.</p>

<p>CHANDLER: Yes, and this with the cigarette butt in it, is that decaf?</p>

<p>RACHEL: Oh god.</p>

<p>JOEY: I can't believe you're so uptight about your mom comin'.</p>

<p>RACHEL: I know, but it's just it's the first time, and I just don't want her to think
that because I didn't marry Barry, that my life is total crap, you know?</p>

<p>PHOEBE: <i>[Mrs. Adelman's voice]</i> Talk about crap. Try listening to Stella Niedman
tell the story of her and Rod Steiger for the hundredth time.</p>

<p>JOEY: Uh, Pheebs, how long do you think this lady'll be with us?</p>

<p>PHOEBE: I don't know. I mean, she obviously has some kind of unfinished business. <i>[Mrs.
Adelman's voice]</i> Sit up!</p>

<p>MRS. GREEN: <i>[entering]</i> There she is.</p>

<p>RACHEL: Mom!</p>

<p>MRS GREEN: Sweetie! So this is where you work? Oh, it's wonderful! Is it a living room?
Is it a restaurant? Who can tell? But I guess that's the fun.</p>

<p>RACHEL: Pretty much.</p>

<p>MRS GREEN: Monica! You look gorgeous! Last time I saw you, it was eat or be eaten.</p>

<p>RACHEL: This is Joey, and Phoebe, and this is Chandler, and you remember Ross.</p>

<p>MRS GREEN: Oh hello, Ross. </p>

<p>ROSS: Hi, Mrs. Green. <i>[He gets up to shake her hand, but she ignores him.]</i></p>

<p>MRS GREEN: So, what do you think of my daughter in the apron with the big job?</p>

<p>RACHEL: Oh Mom!</p>

<p>MRS GREEN: If you didn't pour the coffee, no one would have anything to drink.</p>

<p>CHANDLER: Believe me, sometimes that happens.</p>

<p>MRS GREEN: This is just so exciting. You know, I never worked. I went straight from my
father's house to the sorority house to my husband's house. I am just so proud of you.</p>

<p>RACHEL: Really?</p>

<p>MRS GREEN: Yes.</p>

<p>PHOEBE: I know who it is you remind me of. Evelyn Dermer. 'Course, that's before she
got the lousy face lift. Now she looks like Soupy Sales.</p>

<p>JOEY: Pheebs, who's Evelyn Dermer?</p>

<p>PHOEBE: I don't know. Who's Soupy Sales?</p>

<p><i>[at Rachel and Monica's</i></p>

<p>MRS GREEN: Oh my god, there's an unattractive nude man playing the cello.</p>

<p>RACHEL: Yeah, well just be glad he's not playing a smaller instrument.</p>

<p>MRS GREEN: <i>[laughing]</i> You have some life here, sweetie.</p>

<p>RACHEL: I know. And Mom, I realize you and Daddy were upset when I didn't marry Barry
and get the big house in the suburbs with all the security and everything, but this is
just so much better for me, you know?</p>

<p>MRS GREEN: I do. You didn't love Barry. And I've never seen you this happy. I look at
you and I think, oh, this is what I want.</p>

<p>RACHEL: For...me.</p>

<p>MRS GREEN: Well, not just for you.</p>

<p>RACHEL: Well, what do you mean?</p>

<p>MRS GREEN: I'm uh, considering leaving your father.</p>

<p>MONICA: <i>[entering]</i> All right. Tell me if this is too cute. Lesbian wedding,
chicken breasts.</p>

<p>RACHEL: Oh god. I think I'm gonna be sick.</p>

<p>MONICA: Why? It's not like I'm putting little nipples on them.</p>

<p>ROSS: And you had no idea they weren't getting along?</p>

<p>RACHEL: None.</p>

<p>JOEY: They didn't fight a lot?</p>

<p>RACHEL: No! They didn't even talk to each other. God, how was I supposed to know they
were having problems?</p>

<p>PHOEBE: <i>[Mrs. Adelman's voice]</i> In my day, divorce was not an option.</p>

<p>JOEY: Hey, look who's up.</p>

<p>RACHEL: I just can't believe this is happening. I mean, when I was little, everybody's
parents were getting divorced. I just figured as a grownup I wouldn't have to worry about
this.</p>

<p>MONICA: Is there any chance that you can look at this as flattering? I mean, she's
doing it because she wants to be more like you.</p>

<p>RACHEL: Well, then, you know, couldn't she have just copied my haircut?</p>

<p>CHANDLER: You know, it's funny when my parents got divorced, they sent me to this
shrink, and she told me that all kids have a tendency to blame themselves. But in your
case it's actually kinda true.</p>

<p>PHOEBE: That's him.</p>

<p>CHANDLER: Damn. My mail order grandfather hasn't come yet.</p>

<p>MR A: Phoebe?</p>

<p>PHOEBE: Yes, hi, Mr. Adelman. Thanks for meeting me.</p>

<p>MR A: Oh, that's all right, although you did cut into my busy day of sitting.</p>

<p>PHOEBE: Um, do you wanna sit?</p>

<p>MR A: Oh, no, please, I spent most of mid-morning trying to stand up. Now uh, what can
I do for you, my dear?</p>

<p>PHOEBE: I don't know how to say this, but I think when your wife's spirit left her
body, it um, kind of stuck around in me.</p>

<p>MR A: You're saying, my wife is in you?</p>

<p>PHOEBE: Yeah. Ok, you don't have to believe me but um, can you think of any unfinished
business she might have had, like any reason she'd be hanging around?</p>

<p>MR A: Well, I don't know what to tell you dear. The only thing I can think of is that
she always used to say that before she died, she wanted to see everything.</p>

<p>PHOEBE: Everything?</p>

<p>MR A: Everything.</p>

<p>PHOEBE: Whoa, that's a lot of stuff.</p>

<p>MR A: Oh, wait, I remember, she also said she wanted to sleep with me one last time.</p>

<p>PHOEBE: I'm sorry, there's laughing in my head.</p>

<p>MR A: <i>[to Joey]</i> Worth a shot, huh?</p>

<p><i>[Joey nods and shrugs.]</i></p>

<p>MRS GREEN: Look at this.</p>

<p>RACHEL: These are from Halloween three years ago.</p>

<p>MRS GREEN: Oh, look, here's Barry. Did he have to come straight from the office?</p>

<p>RACHEL: No, that was his costume. See, he's actually an orthodontist, but he came as a
regular dentist.</p>

<p>MONICA: Um, you guys, you know when I said before, &quot;thank you, but I don't really
need your help&quot;?</p>

<p>RACHEL: Actually, what I think you said was, &quot;don't touch that, and get the hell
out of my kitchen.&quot;</p>

<p>MONICA: Really? Weird. Anyway, see, I planned everything really well. I planned and I
planned and I planned. It just turns out, I don't think I planned enough time to actually
do it.</p>

<p>RACHEL: Hey, Mon, you want some help?</p>

<p>MONICA: If you want.</p>

<p>PHOEBE: <i>[enters]</i> Hey. What a day. I took her everywhere. The Museum of Modern
Art, Rockefeller Center, Statue of Liberty.</p>

<p>RACHEL: She's still with you?</p>

<p>PHOEBE: Yeah. I guess she hasn't seen everything yet. I'll be right back, she has to go
to the bathroom again. <i>[Takes Mrs. Green's chin in her hand and says, in Mrs. Adelman's
voice]</i> Oh, such a pretty face.</p>

<p>MRS GREEN: This is so much fun, just the girls. You know what we should do? Does
anybody have any marijuana?</p>

<p>RACHEL: God!</p>

<p>MONICA: All right, look, nobody's smoking pot around all this food. </p>

<p>MRS GREEN: That's fine. I never did it. I just thought I might. So, what's new in sex?</p>

<p>RACHEL: Oh! What's new in sex?</p>

<p>MRS GREEN: The only man I've ever been with is your father.</p>

<p>MONICA: I'm dicing, I'm dicing, I don't hear anything.</p>

<p>MRS GREEN: I mean, this is no offense to your dad, sweetie, but I was thinking there
might be more.</p>

<p>RACHEL: Oh, I'm sorry. You know what? I cannot have this conversation with you. I mean,
god, you just come in here, and drop this bomb on me, before you even tell Daddy. What?
What do you want? Do you want my blessing?</p>

<p>MRS GREEN: No.</p>

<p>RACHEL: You want me to talk you out of it?</p>

<p>MRS GREEN: No.</p>

<p>RACHEL: Then what? What do you want?</p>

<p>MRS GREEN: I guess I just figured of all people you would understand this.</p>

<p>RACHEL: Why on earth would I understand this?</p>

<p>MRS GREEN: You didn't marry your Barry. I did.</p>

<p>RACHEL: Oh.</p>

<p>MONICA: All right people, we're in trouble here. We've only got 12 hours and 36 minutes
left. Move, move, move!</p>

<p>CHANDLER: Monica, I feel like you should have German subtitles.</p>

<p>MONICA: Joey, speed it up!</p>

<p>JOEY: I'm sorry, it's the pigs. they're reluctant to get in the blankets!</p>

<p>PHOEBE: Monica, how did this happen? I thought you had this all planned out.</p>

<p>MONICA: Do you want me to cry? Is that what you want? Do you wanna see me cry?</p>

<p>PHOEBE: Sir! No sir!</p>

<p>MONICA: <i>[to Ross]</i> All right, you!</p>

<p>ROSS: No. Look, I told you I am not a part of this thing.</p>

<p>MONICA: All right, look, Ross. I realize that you have issues with Carol and Susan, and
I feel for you, I do. But if you don't help me cook, I'm gonna take a bunch of those
little hot dogs, and I'm gonna create a new appetizer called &quot;pigs in Ross&quot;. All
right, ball the melon.</p>

<p>CHANDLER: Hey! How come I'm stuck dicing, when he gets to ball the melon.</p>

<p><i>[knock at the door]</i></p>

<p>MONICA: Hi.</p>

<p>CAROL: How's it going?</p>

<p>MONICA: It's goin' great. Right on schedule. Got my little happy helpers.<i>[everyone
groans]</i></p>

<p>CAROL: Fine, whatever.</p>

<p>ROSS: What's the matter?</p>

<p>CAROL: Nothing. Ok, everything. I think we're calling off the wedding.</p>

<p>ROSS: What?</p>

<p>MONICA: You're still gonna pay me, right? Or something a little less selfish.</p>

<p>ROSS: Carol, what's the matter? What happened?</p>

<p>CAROL: My parents called this afternoon to say they weren't coming.</p>

<p>ROSS: Oh my god.</p>

<p>CAROL: I mean, I knew they were having trouble with this whole thing, but they're my
parents. They're supposed to give me away and everything.</p>

<p>ROSS: It's ok. I'm sorry.</p>

<p>CAROL: And then Susan and I got in this big fight because I said maybe we should call
off the wedding, and she said we weren't doing it for them, we were doing it for us, and
if I couldn't see that, then maybe we should call off the wedding. I don't know what to
do.</p>

<p>ROSS: I uh can't believe I'm gonna say this, but I think Susan's right.</p>

<p>CAROL: You do?</p>

<p>ROSS: Look, do you love her? And you don't have to be too emphatic about this.</p>

<p>CAROL: Of course I do.</p>

<p>ROSS: Well then that's it. And if George and Adelaide can't accept that, then the hell
with them. Look, if my parents didn't want me to marry you, no way that would have stopped
me. Look, this is your wedding. Do it.</p>

<p>CAROL: You're right. Of course you're right.</p>

<p>MONICA: So we're back on?</p>

<p>CAROL: We're back on.</p>

<p>MONICA: You heard the woman. Peel, chop, devil! I can't believe I lost 2 minutes.</p>

<p><i>[at the wedding]</i></p>

<p>JOEY: It just seems so futile, you know ? All these women, and nothing. I feel like
Superman without my powers, you know? I have the cape, and yet I cannot fly.</p>

<p>CHANDLER: Well now you understand how I feel every single day, ok? The world is my
lesbian wedding.</p>

<p><i>[Wedding music starts, Phoebe noisily unwraps a piece of candy.]</i></p>

<p>PHOEBE: <i>[Mrs. Adelman's voice]</i> Butterscotch? No one? All right, you'll be sorry
later.</p>

<p><i>[Monica pushes Ben down the aisle in a stroller. Susan is escorted by both her
parents. Carol is escorted by Ross.]</i></p>

<p>CAROL: Thank you.</p>

<p>ROSS: Any time. <i>[He doesn't want to let her go]</i></p>

<p>CAROL: Ross. <i>[He lets her go]</i></p>

<p>MINISTER: You know, nothing makes God happier than when two people, any two people,
come together in love. Friends, family, we're gathered here today to join Carol and Susan
in holy matrimony.</p>

<p>PHOEBE: <i>[Mrs. Adelman's voice]</i> Oh my god. Now I've seen everything! <i>[Phoebe's
voice]</i> Whoa, she's gone. She's gone. She's gone! Go ahead, get married. Go, go.</p>

<p><i>[At the reception, Monica and Ross watch Carol and Susan getting their picture
taken.]</i></p>

<p>MONICA: Would you look at them?</p>

<p>ROSS: Yeah, can't help but.</p>

<p>JOEY: <i>[to a wedding guest]</i> How's that pig-in-the-blanket workin' out for you? <i>[the
guy nods]</i> I wrapped those bad boys.</p>

<p>PHOEBE: I miss Rose. </p>

<p>CHANDLER: Oh, yeah? </p>

<p>PHOEBE: I know it's kind of weird, but I mean, she was a big part of my life there, you
know, and now I just feel kind of alone.</p>

<p>WOMAN: You know, I uh, I couldn't help but overhear what you just said, and I think
it's time for you to forget about Rose, move on with your life...how 'bout we go get you a
drink?</p>

<p>PHOEBE: Ok, that's so nice.</p>

<p><i>[Chandler tries to warn Phoebe that the woman is coming on to her, but Phoebe
doesn't see him.]</i></p>

<p>CHANDLER: <i>[to an attractive woman]</i> I shouldn't even bother coming up with a
line, right? <i>[The woman walks away]</i></p>

<p>RACHEL: Hey, Mom? Having fun?</p>

<p>MRS GREEN: Oh, am I! I just danced with a wonderfully large woman. And three other
girls made eyes at me over the buffet. Oh, I'm not saying it's something I wanna pursue,
but it's nice to know I have options.</p>

<p>RACHEL: There's more alcohol, right?</p>

<p><i>[Susan approaches Ross, who's looking lonely]</i></p>

<p>SUSAN: How you doin'?</p>

<p>ROSS: Ok.</p>

<p>SUSAN: You did a good thing today.</p>

<p>ROSS: Yeah.</p>

<p>SUSAN: You wanna dance?</p>

<p>ROSS: No, that's fine.</p>

<p>SUSAN: Come on. I'll let you lead.</p>

<p>ROSS: Ok.</p>

<p><i>[They dance; Carol looks on lovingly.]</i></p>

<p>CHANDLER: <i>[to the woman who just rejected him]</i> All right look. Penis schmenis.
We're all people. <i>[She walks away again.]</i></p>

<p><i>[at Monica and Rachel's]</i></p>

<p>MONICA: Ok, which one of us do you think is gonna be the first one to get married?</p>

<p>ROSS: Well, Mon, I was married.</p>

<p>PHOEBE: Yeah, me, too, technically.</p>

<p>RACHEL: I had a wedding.</p>

<p>MONICA: All right, just trying to start an interesting discussion.</p>

<p>JOEY: I got one. Which one of us do you think will be the last to get married? <i>[They
all look at Chandler]</i></p>

<p>CHANDLER: Isn't Ben in this?</p>

<p>ALL: Oh, yeah!</p>
<font size="4"><b>

<p align="center">END</b></font> </font></p>

214<html>

<head>
<title>The One With the Prom Video</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="white" text="black" link="green" vlink="black" alink="yellow">

<h1 align="center">The One With the Prom Video</h1>

<hr align="center">
<font size="3"><i>

<p>Originally written by <b>Alexa Junge</b>.<br>
Trascribed by <b>Josh Hodge</b>.</i></font> </p>

<hr>
<font size="3">

<p align="left">NOTE: For this episode, I'm using italics to signify portions contained in
the prom video.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's apartment. Chandler is playing foosball by himself, Joey
enters]</b><br>
<br>
JOEY: Hey.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Hey. Hold on a second. [shoots a goal] Huh?<br>
<br>
JOEY: Nice, nice. Hey I got somethin' for you. [hands Chandler an envelope.<br>
<br>
<a name="line07"></a> CHANDLER: What's this?<br>
<br>
JOEY: Eight hundred and twelve bucks.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Well, I don't know what Big Leon told ya but it's an even thousand if you want
me for the whole night. What is this for?<br>
<br>
JOEY: Well, I'm makin money now and this is payin' you back for head shots, electric
bills, and so many slices of pizza I can't even count. I love ya man.<br>
<br>
<a name="line08"></a> CHANDLER: Well, thanks man. Now I can get my pony.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Hey, this is a little extra somethin' for uh, ya know, always bein' there for me.
[hands Chandler a jewelry box]<br>
<br>
<a name="line09"></a> CHANDLER: Wow, I don't know what to say. [opens the box and pulls
out an incredibly gaudy gold bracelet] Wow, I, I don't know what to say.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Heh, what d'ya say?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: I don't know. It's a bracelet.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Isn't it? And it's engraved too, check it out.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: [reads] To my best bud. [puts it back in the case] Thanks best bud.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Put it on.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Oh, now? [puts it in his desk drawer] No, no, I think something this nice should
be saved for a special occasion. [sets a chair in front of the drawer]<br>
<br>
<a name="line10"></a> JOEY: Oh, no no, that's the beauty part, it goes with everything.
[gets the bracelet from the drawer] You put this on, you're good to go. [puts the bracelet
on Chandler] Ohhh man, you are so wearin' that bracelet.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: I so am.<br>
<br>
<a name="line11"></a> JOEY: You have any idea what this'll do for your sex life?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Well, it'll probably slow it down at first but, once I get used to the extra
weight, I'll be back on track.<br>
<br>
<font size="4"><b>OPENING TITLES</b></font> <br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: A kitchen somewhere. Monica is interviewing for a job]</b><br>
<br>
INTERVIEWER: Well, this all looks good.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Great.<br>
<br>
<a name="line01"></a> INTERVIEWER: And if I want to call for a reference on your last job?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Oh, that's there on the bottom, see the manager, Chandler Bing.<br>
<br>
INTERVIEWER: Alright, lets see if you're as good in person as you are on paper. Make me a
salad.<br>
<br>
MONICA: A salad? Really I, I could do something a little more complicated if you like.<br>
<br>
INTERVIEWER: No, just a salad will be fine.<br>
<br>
MONICA: You got it.<br>
<br>
INTERVIEWER: Now, I want you to tell me what you're doing while you're doing it.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Alright, well I'm tearing the lettuce.<br>
<br>
INTERVIEWER: Uh-huh. Is it dirty?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Oh-oh, no no don't worry, I'm gonna wash it.<br>
<br>
INTERVIEWER: Don't, I like it dirty.<br>
<br>
MONICA: That's your call.<br>
<br>
INTERVIEWER: So, uh, what are you going to do next?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Well, I thought that I would cut up the tomatos.<br>
<br>
INTERVIEWER: Are they, uh, firm?<br>
<br>
MONICA: They'r alright.<br>
<br>
INTERVIEWER: You sure they haven't gone bad? You're sure they're not very, very bad?<br>
<br>
MONICA: No really, they're OK.<br>
<br>
INTERVIEWER: You gonna slice them up real nice?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Actually, I was gonna do them jullienne.<br>
<br>
INTERVIEWER: Aaaahhhhhhh.<br>
<br>
MONICA: I'm outa here. [Monica leaves]<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Chandler and Phoebe are sitting at the couch.
Ross is sitting at the table and answers the phone.]</b><br>
<br>
<a name="line25"></a> ROSS: Y-ello. No, Rachel's not here right now, can I take a message?
Alright, and how do we spell Casey, is it like at the bat or and the Sunshine Band? OK,
bye-bye. Hey, who's this uh, this Casey?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Oh, some guy she met at the movies.<br>
<br>
<a name="line12"></a> ROSS: Oh really? What uh, what does he want with her?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Well, I'm guessing he wants to do a little dance. . . ya know, make a little
love. . . well pretty much get down tonight.<br>
<br>
ROSS: [puts the message in the cupboard] I don't know, I don't get, I don't get it, I
mean, wh, wh, two months ago Rachel and I were like, this close. Right now, what, I'm
takin messages from guys she, she meets at the movies? I mean this, this Casey should be
takin' down my messages, ya know, or, or, Rachel and I should be together and, and we
should get some kind of me, message service.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Hang in there, it's gonna happen.<br>
<br>
<a name="line13"></a> ROSS: Wha, OK, now how do you know that?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Because she's your lobster.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Oh, she's goin' somewhere.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: C'mon you guys. It's a known fact that lobsters fall in love and mate for life.
You know what, you can actually see old lobster couples walkin' around their tank, ya
know, holding claws like. . .<br>
<br>
[Monica enters from bathroom after taking a shower]<br>
<br>
<a name="line02"></a> CHANDLER: Hey, you feelin' better?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Yeah, I think that fifth shower actually got the interview off me.<br>
<br>
<a name="line03"></a> PHOEBE: So, do you have any other possibilities?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Oh yeah, well there's the possibility that I won't make rent.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Monica, if you want, I can lend you some money.<br>
<br>
MONICA: No no no, if I couldn't pay you back right away then I'd feel guilty and tense
every time I saw you.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Oh OK. Well then why don't you, uhh, why don't you borrow it from mom and dad? You
feel guilty and tense around them already. You might as well make some money off of them.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Ya know, the man's got a point. [gestures with his arm and the bracelet falls
off]<br>
<br>
<a name="line04"></a> PHOEBE: What is that sparkly thing?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: That thing, it's a uhh. . . yeah it's, it's a little flashy.<br>
<br>
ROSS: No no, no no, it's not flashy, not for a Goodfella.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Man, man that is sharp. It must have cost you quite a few debloons.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Monica answers the door and lets her parents in.
They are carrying boxes.]</b><br>
<br>
MONICA: Hi.<br>
<br>
MR. GELLER: Hi.<br>
<br>
MRS. GELLER: Hi darling.<br>
<br>
MONICA: So, what's this.<br>
<br>
MR. GELLER: Some of your old stuff.<br>
<br>
MRS. GELLER: Well sweetie, we have a surprise for you. We're turning your room into a gym.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Wow, that is a surprise. Just one little question, uh, why not Ross's room?<br>
<br>
MR. GELLER: Gosh, we talked about that but your brother has so many science trophies and
plaques and merit badges, well we didn't want to disturb them.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Oh, God forbid.<br>
<br>
[Rachel enters with a laundry basket]<br>
<br>
MRS. GELLER: Oh, hi Rachel.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Hi.<br>
<br>
MRS. GELLER: Oh, we were so sorry to hear about your parents splitting up, dear.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Oh, well, you know, they're just separated so, you know, never know, we'll see.<br>
<br>
MR. GELLER: Well, I can't say any of us were surprised. Your parents have been unhappy
ever since we've known them. Especially after that incident in Hawaii.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: What, what incident?<br>
<br>
MR. GELLER: Uhh, naa, no no no, I, I must be thinking of someone else, uh, maybe me. Don't
you have some folding to do? Go fold dear. Fold. You fold. [shuffles her into her room]<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Central Perk. Chandler and Phoebe are sitting on couches. A beautiful woman is
looking at Chandler.]</b><br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Do you want a refill?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: No, I'm alright, thanks.<br>
<br>
<a name="line06"></a> PHOEBE: OK. Ooh, OK, you gotta give me a second, I wanna get this
just right. [she sticks out her gut, clears her throat and sniffs her nose and then in her
best male voice. . .] Dude, 11 o'clock, totally hot babe checkin' you out. That was really
good, I think I'm ready for my penis now.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: [walks over to the woman] I know what you're thinking, Dave Thomas, founder of
Wendy's.<br>
<br>
GAIL: I'm Gail.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Chandler. [waves his arm around, exposing the bracelet]<br>
<br>
GAIL: I, I really have to be somewhere but it was nice meeting you.<br>
<br>
<a name="line14"></a> CHANDLER: What? [realizes it was the bracelet] Oh this is excellent.
You know he coulda gotten me a VCR, he coulda gotten me a set of golf clubs, but no, he
has to get me the woman repeller, the eyesore from the Liberace house of crap.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: It's not that bad.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Oh, yeah, easy for you to say, you don't have to walk around sporting some
reject from the Mr. T collection. [Joey walks in behind Chandler]<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Chandler, Chandler.<br>
<br>
<a name="line15"></a> CHANDLER: I pity the fool who puts on my jewelry, I do, I do. I pity
the fool that. . . [turns around and sees Joey] Hi. Hey man, we were just doin' some uhh,
impressions over here. Do your Marcel Marceau. [Joey turns around and walks out without
saying anything] That's actually good.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Central Perk. Rachel is talking to a man at the counter. Ross and Phoebe are
sitting at the couches.]</b><br>
<br>
ROSS: Would you look at that guy, I mean how long has he been talking to her. It's like,
back off buddy she's a waitress not a geisha.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: I think she's OK.<br>
<br>
ROSS: [Rachel, laughing, puts a hand on the guy's shoulder] Look at that, look at that,
see how she's pushing him away and he won't budge. Alright, I'm gonna do something. [walks
up in the middle of their conversation] Excuse me, are you Rachel?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: What?<br>
<br>
ROSS: I'm Ross Geller. Wha, I'm, God in your add you said you were pretty but wow.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: What are you, what are you doin'?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Oh, oh my God, is this the wrong day? I don't believe it, uh, well, hey, I guess if
it works out we'll, we'll have something to tell the grandkids.<br>
<br>
MAN: Sure will. I've uh, gotta go. Take care.<br>
<br>
ROSS: OK, see ya later, nice meeting you. [man leaves] You're welcome.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: What?<br>
<br>
ROSS: I was saving you.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Saving, saving, saving me from the pleasant conversation with the interesting man,
saving me?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Oh, see from where I was sitting I uh. . .<br>
<br>
RACHEL: OK, Ross, listen to me, I am not yours to save.<br>
<br>
ROSS: But, you are.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: What?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Uh, uh, well you're, umm, you're my lobster.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: OK, you know what, are, are you being like, the blind date guy again?<br>
<br>
ROSS: No no, you're uh, you're my lobster. See um, lobsters, uhh, in the tank when, when
they're old, uhh, they get with, uhh, they walk around holding the claws. In the tank, ya
know, with, with the holding and. . . Uhh, Phoebs you wanna help me out with the, the
whole lobster thing?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Do the claws again.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Rach. OK, forget, forget the lobsters OK. We're, let's talk, what about us?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Ross, there is no us, OK.<br>
<br>
ROSS: No, but. . .<br>
<br>
RACHEL: No, listen to me. I fell for you and I get clobbered. You then fall for me and I
again, somehow, get clobbered. I'm tired of being clobbered, ya know, it's, it's just not
worth it.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Well, but, but. . .<br>
<br>
RACHEL: NO but Ross. We are never gonna happen, OK. Accept that.<br>
<br>
ROSS: E-except, except that what?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: No, no, ACC-cept that.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Oh.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's apartment. Chandler is there. Joey enters.]</b><br>
<br>
<a name="line16"></a> CHANDLER: Hey man, look it's my best bud. How ya doin? [Joey doesn't
respond] Wow, you are really gettin' good at that Marcel Marceau thing. Hey, whaddya say
uh, we play some ball, you and me, huh, whaddya say? [Throws a basketball to Joey. Joey
doesn't move to catch it and the ball takes out a lamp] OK, that's my bad.<br>
<br>
JOEY: If you hated the bracelet so much, Chandler, you should have just said so.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Well, doesn't the fact that I wore the bracelet even though I hated it say
something about our friendship and how much it means to me?<br>
<br>
<a name="line17"></a> JOEY: Well, what about the fact that you insulted the bracelet and
you made fun of me?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: OK, well that's the part where I'm a wank. But I was hoping we wouldn't focus on
that. [Joey goes to his room and shuts the door] Hey, c'mon man, I said I was sorry like a
hundred times, I promise I will never take it off my. . . [notices the bracelet is missing
from his wrist] wrist. But if, if you want to stay in there and be mad, you know, you just
uh, you stay in there. [he starts searching the room, lifting up the couch cushions]<br>
<br>
JOEY: You know what the. . . [sees Chandler on his knees, holding the couch cushions]<br>
<br>
<a name="line18"></a> CHANDLER: I am here, on my knees, holding up these couch cushions as
a symbol of my sorrow and regret, much like they did in biblical times. Though you may
haveth anger now. . . [Joey returns to his room]<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Mr. and Mrs. Geller are watching tennis on TV,
Monica is sitting at the table]</b><br>
<br>
MR. GELLER: You know, that Steffi Graf has quite a tush. I'm just saying, it's right
there.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Hey guys.<br>
<br>
MRS. GELLER: Hi, darling. Where's my grandson, you didn't bring him?<br>
<br>
ROSS: No, he's at uh, Carol's and Susan's today.<br>
<br>
MR. GELLER: A woman in my office is a lesiban. I'm just saying.<br>
<br>
MRS. GELLER: Oh, Jack look, there's that house paint commercial that cracks you up. [the
Gellers return to watching TV and Ross goes over to Monica]<br>
<br>
<a name="line26"></a> MONICA: Where have you been?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Emotional hell. So, did they lend you the money yet?<br>
<br>
MONICA: No, but that's probably 'cause I haven't asked them yet.<br>
<br>
ROSS: C'mon Monica, do it. Hey, you guys, um, Monica has some news.<br>
<br>
<a name="line05"></a> MONICA: Um, yeah, so uh, uhh, listen, I'm sorry I didn't tell you
this before but umm, I, I'm no longer at my job, I, I had to leave it.<br>
<br>
MRS. GELLER: Why?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Because they made me.<br>
<br>
MRS. GELLER: You were fired? What're you gonna do?<br>
<br>
MR. GELLER: Judy, Judy, relax, this is our little harmonica we're talking about. We taught
her well. Ten percent of your paycheck, where does it go?<br>
<br>
MONICA and ROSS: In the bank.<br>
<br>
MR. GELLER: There you go. So she dips into her savings, that's what it's there for. She's
gonna be fine, and if you need a little extra, you know where to find it. [pulls a quarter
from behind her ear]<br>
<br>
MONICA: Anything larger back there?<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Central Perk. Chandler and Phoebe enter.]</b><br>
<br>
CHANDLER: I can't believe it.<br>
<br>
<a name="line27"></a> PHOEBE: Would you stop already? Get out of the bitter barn and play
in the hay.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Oh, you're right I, I should play in the hay. Forget about the fact that I just
dropped 400 dollars to replace a bracelet that I hated to begin with. Bring on the hay.
[sits down at the bar]<br>
<br>
RACHEL: [comes up from behind the bar and startles Chandler] Hey. I've got something
that's gonna make you happy. Guess what Gunther found? [holds up Chandler's bracelet]<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Hey now you have two. [Chandler looks annoyed] Oh, now you have two.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: What am I gonna do, huh? [Joey walks in behind him]<br>
<br>
JOEY: Hey.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Hey.<br>
<br>
JOEY: How come you have two?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Well this one's for you.<br>
<br>
<a name="line19"></a> JOEY: Get out.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: No, I can't. No no, listen, I, I know how much this means to you and I also know
that this is about more than just jewelry, [puts bracelet on Joey] it's about you and me
and the fact that we're [reading bracelet] best buds.<br>
<br>
<a name="line20"></a> JOEY: Wow, is this friendship? I think so. Check it out, we're
bracelet buddies.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: That's what they'll call us.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Monica and Ross are standing in the kitchen.
Ross is filling out a check]</b><br>
<br>
ROSS: Here you go, you can pay me back whenever you like.<br>
<br>
MONICA: You have dinosaur checks?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Yeah, yeah I mean, you get your money and you learn a little something, what's wrong
with that?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Nothin', nothin', hey you're a cheapasaurus. I'm kidding, I'm kidding, thank you,
I'm very greatful.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: [Standing in living room with Chandler and Joey. She pulls a huge bathing suit out
of a box] Hey, Mon, what is this?<br>
<br>
<a name="line21"></a> MONICA: Oh, um, that was my bathing suit from high school. I was uh,
a little bigger then.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Oh, I thought that's what they used to cover Connecticut when it rained.<br>
<br>
JOEY: [pulls out a VCR tape] Hey Monica, what's on this video tape?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Hey, you got me, put it in.<br>
<br>
ROSS: [Rachel enters] Oh.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Hi.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Hi.<br>
<br>
<i>MRS. GELLER: Over here Jack. OK. I see, Rachel's coming up the path. Oh doesn't she
look pretty. Jack, get this. [Rachel enters with a huge nose]</i><br>
<br>
<a name="line22"></a> RACHEL: Oh my God.<br>
<br>
JOEY: What is with your nose?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: They had to reduce it because of, of my deviated septum.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: OK, I was wrong, that's what they used to cover Connecticut.<br>
<br>
MONICA: You know what this is, this is us getting ready for the prom.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Oh.<br>
<br>
ROSS: You know what, you guys, we don't have to watch this.<br>
<br>
ALL: Oh yeah we do. C'mon.<br>
<br>
<i>MRS. GELLER: Get a shot of Monica. Where's Monica.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Over here dad. [he pans over and we see a torso taking up the whole screen]<br>
<br>
MR, GELLER: Wait, how do you zoom out? [zooms out and we see an extremely overweight
Monica eating a big sandwich] There she is.</i><br>
<br>
<a name="line23"></a> JOEY: Some girl ate Monica.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Shut up, the camera adds ten pounds.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Ahh, so how many cameras are actually on you?<br>
<br>
<i>MONICA: Oh, you look so great.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Ahh, so do you, beautiful. [they hug]<br>
<br>
MONICA: Oops.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: What?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Shoot, I think I got mayonaise on you.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Oh, that's OK, it's just the shoulder, it's not my dress.<br>
<br>
MR. GELLER: Everybody smile.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Oh, dad, turn it off.<br>
<br>
MR. GELLER: It is off.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Dad, it is not. What's with the red light?<br>
<br>
<a name="line29"></a> MR. GELLER: It's the off light. Right Ross? [pans over to see Ross
with an afro and moustache]</i><br>
<br>
JOEY: Lookin' good Mr. Cotter.<br>
<br>
<i>ROSS: You look pretty tonight.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Oh, thanks. So, uh, what are you gonna do this summer?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Oh, you know, I'm just gonna, I'm gonna hang out, work on my music.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: [the shoulders of her dress keep falling off her shoulders] Is my hook unhooked?
These things keep falling down, I can't. . .<br>
<br>
ROSS: Uh, hold, let me see, I don't know. So what're you gonna do. . . [doorbell rings]<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Oh, the guys are here.<br>
<br>
ROSS: this summer?</i><br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Work on your music?<br>
<br>
<i>[Ross is sitting on the stairs with a laptop keyboard playing 'Axel-F']</i><br>
<br>
RACHEL: Oh my God, look there's Roy Gublik.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Ya know, Roy saw Star Wars 317 times. His name was in the paper.<br>
<br>
<i>RACHEL: Where's Chip, why isn't he here yet?<br>
<br>
ROY: He'll be here OK, take a chill pill. [Chip pins Monica's corsage on, Monica then
turns and whispers to Rachel]</i><br>
<br>
<a name="line24"></a> MONICA: I just told Rachel that Roy touched my boob.<br>
<br>
<i>RACHEL: I can't go to my own prom without a date, I can't, it's too late.<br>
<br>
MONICA: If you're not going then I don't want to go either.<br>
<br>
ROY: Oh, I'm gonna kick Chip's ass.<br>
<br>
MRS. GELLER: [to Ross on the stairs] I have a wonderful idea. You should take Rachel to
the prom.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Doubtful.<br>
<br>
MRS. GELLER: Jack, give me that. Talk to your son.<br>
<br>
MR. GELLER: Your mother's right. Take her, you can wear my tux.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Dad, she won't want to go with me.<br>
<br>
MR. GELLER: Of course she would, you're a college man.<br>
<br>
ROSS: I don't know.<br>
<br>
MR. GELLER: Well, c'mon. Don't ya want to find out?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: I can't believe I don't get to go to my own prom, this is so harsh.<br>
<br>
ROSS: OK. Hold my board.<br>
<br>
MR. GELLER: Atta boy. [Ross scrambles upstairs to change]</i><br>
<br>
ROSS: OK, you guys, ya know, I think we've seen enough, let's turn it off.<br>
<br>
ALL: No, no, no.<br>
<br>
ROSS: OK, fine, well I'm not gonna watch, alright.<br>
<br>
<i>MR. GELLER: C'mon kid, let's go.<br>
<br>
MRS. GELLER: Ahh, are you hadsome.<br>
<br>
MR. GELLER: Let's show 'em.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Uh, just a sec dad. [to himself] OK, be cool, just be cool. [walks down the stairs
and grabs the flowers out of the vase on the endtable] OK dad.<br>
<br>
MR. GELLER: [going downstairs] Rachel, ready or not, here comes your knight in shining. .
. oh no. [Chip has shown up and the four are leaving]<br>
<br>
RACHEL, MONICA, ROY, and CHIP: Bye.<br>
<br>
MRS. GELLER: Oh, dear. Jack, how do I turn this off?<br>
<br>
MR. GELLER: Press the button.<br>
<br>
MRS. GELLER: Which one? Which button, Jack.<br>
<br>
MR. GELLER: The button, the button.</i><br>
<br>
<a name="line28"></a> MONICA: I can't believe you did that.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Yeah, well.<br>
<br>
[Rachel, seeing what he did for her, gets up, walks across the room, and kisses Ross]<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: See, he's her lobster.<br>
<br>
<font size="4"><b>CLOSING CREDITS</b></font> <br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Monica is watching the rest of the tape]</b><br>
<br>
<i>MRS. GELLER: Dance with him.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Mom, I'm hungry.<br>
<br>
MRS. GELLER: Dance with your father.<br>
<br>
MR. GELLER: I may not know any of your flash dances but I'm no slouch on the dance floor.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Alright.<br>
<br>
[the tape cuts to Monica's parents under the covers]<br>
<br>
MRS. GELLER: Oh, Jack.<br>
<br>
MR. GELLER: Oh, Judy. Oh, Judy.<br>
<br>
BOTH: Oh, ohhhhh.<br>
<br>
[Monica is visibly upset]</font></p>
</i>

<p align="center"><strong>END</strong></p>
