215<html>

<head>
<title>The One Where Ross and Rachel...You Know</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="white" text="black" link="green" vlink="black" alink="yellow">

<h1 align="center">The One Where Rachel and Ross... You Know</h1>

<hr align="center">
<font size="3"><i>

<p>Originally written by <br>
Transcribed by Joshua Hodge</i></font><br>
<i>Minor additions and adjustments by Dan Silverstein.<br>
</i></p>

<hr>
<font size="3">

<p align="left">[Scene: Chandler and Joey's apartment. Joey and Chandler enter with
Chandler covering his eyes and Joey leading him.]<br>
<br>
JOEY: Alright, no peeking. No peeking, no peeking, no peeking.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Alright, alright, but you better be wearing clothes when I open my eyes.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Alright open your eyes. [opens his eyes to see two black leather recliners and a big
screen TV]<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Sweet mother of all that is good and pure.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Huh? <i>Days of our Lives</i> picked up my option.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Congratulations!<br>
<br>
JOEY: I know.<br>
<br>
<a>chandler</a>: Now we can finally watch <i>Green Acres</i> the way it was meant to be
seen.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Uh-huh.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: So uh, which one is mine?<br>
<br>
JOEY: Whichever one you want, man. Whichever one you want. [Chandler starts to sit in one
of the chairs] Not that one.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: [sits down] Ohh yes.<br>
<br>
JOEY: [sits down] Ohh yeah, that's the stuff.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: [reaches for the footrest lever] Do we dare?<br>
<br>
JOEY: We dare.<br>
<br>
BOTH: [both extend the footrests] Aaahhhh. [both recline their chairs] AAAAHHHHHH.<br>
<br>
<font size="4"><b>OPENING TITLES</b></font><br>
<br>
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's apartment. Chandler and Joey are sitting in their recliners
watching TV. Monica, Ross, and Phoebe are there.]<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: I can't believe two cows made the ultimate sacrifice so you guys could watch TV
with your feet up.<br>
<br>
<a>CHANDLER</a>: Well they were chair-shaped cows. They never would have survived in the
wild.<br>
<br>
ROSS: This screen is amazing, I mean Dick Van Dyke is practically life-size.<br>
<br>
ALL: Woah!<br>
<br>
MONICA: Rose Marie really belongs on a smaller screen, doesn't she?<br>
<br>
[Rachel enters]<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Hi you guys.<br>
<br>
ALL: Hey.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Hey you.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Hey you. [they stand together in front of the TV.]<br>
<br>
CHANDLER and JOEY: Woah, hey, yo. [Rachel and Ross move]<br>
<br>
RACHEL: So, uh, how was your day?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Oh you know, pretty much the usual, uh, sun shining, birds chirping.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Really? Mine too.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Hey cool, mine too.<br>
<br>
ROSS: [beeper goes off] Yeah, yeah, yeah. I got to get to the museum. So um, I'll see you
tonight.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: OK. [they go to kiss but everyone's watching so Ross just kisses her on the top of
her head and leaves]<br>
<br>
ROSS: Bye guys.<br>
<br>
ALL: Bye.<br>
<br>
MONICA: [walks up to Rachel in front of the TV] Tonight?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER and JOEY: Hey, yo. [they move from out of in front of the TV]<br>
<br>
MONICA: What's tonight?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: It is our first official date. Our first date.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Uh, hello.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Hi.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Tonight you're supposed to waitress for me, my catering thing, any of those words
trigger anything for you?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: God, oh God Monica, I forgot. This is our first date.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Yes but my mom got me this job.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: OK, I can be a waitress, I can be a waitress.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Oh, thank you, thank you, thank you, thank you. See Phoebe, Phoebe.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Really Phoebs? Because, you know, you'd have to be an actual waitress. This can't
be like your 'I can be a bear cub' thing.<br>
<br>
<a>PHOEBE</a>: I can <i>be</i> a waitress. OK watch this. Um, gimme two number ones, 86
the bacon, one Adam and Eve on a raft and rick'em, la-la-la-la-la, la-la-la-la-la.<br>
<br>
[Scene: Dr. Burke's apartment. Dr. Burke answers the door for Phoebe and Monica.]<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: It's James Bond.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Sorry we're late.<br>
<br>
DR. BURKE: Ah, that's OK, come on in. Um, I'm sorry, is Monica Geller coming? I was told
she was.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Dr. Burke, it, it's me.<br>
<br>
DR. BURKE: Monica? My God you used to be so. . . I mean you, you, you, you must have lost
like. . . You look great.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Thank you. This is my friend Phoebe. She's gonna be helping me tonight.<br>
<br>
DR. BURKE: Hi Phoebe, nice to meet you. [Phoebe just giggles when they shake] So, how ya
been?<br>
<br>
MONICA: I've been great, just great. How have you been? [tilting her head]<br>
<br>
DR. BURKE: Oh, well obviously you know Barbara and I split up, otherwise you wouldn't have
done the head tilt.<br>
<br>
MONICA: The head tilt?<br>
<br>
DR. BURKE: Yeah, since the divorce, when anybody asks me how I am, it's always with a
sympathetic head tilt. [demonstrating] 'How ya doin'? You OK?'<br>
<br>
MONICA: I'm sorry.<br>
<br>
DR. BURKE: No no, it, it's fine, believe me. I do it too. I always answer with the 'I'm
OK' head bob. [demonstrates] 'I'm OK.' [tilts head] 'You sure?' [bobs head] 'Yeah, I'm
fine.' Hey listen, I've got to set up the music. I got a new CD changer, of course the
divorce only left me with 4 CD's to change.<br>
<br>
MONICA: [her and Phoebe tilt their heads] Oh, that's too bad.<br>
<br>
DR. BURKE: [bobbing his head] I'll survive.<br>
<br>
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's apartment. They're still in their chairs watching TV. Chandler
is ordering a pizza.]<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Uh, two larges, extra cheese on both. But listen, don't ring the buzzer for 19,
ring 20, Geller-Green, they'll let you in, OK. If you buzz our door, there's no tip for
you. OK, thanks. Pizza's on the way. I told you we wouldn't have to get up.<br>
<br>
JOEY: What if we have to pee?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: I'll cancel the sodas.<br>
<br>
[Scene: Dr. Burke's apartment. Monica and Dr. Burke are in the kitchen.]<br>
<br>
MONICA: You've got to get back out there, it's your party.<br>
<br>
DR. BURKE: But they're so dull, they're all opthamologists.<br>
<br>
MONICA: You're an opthamologist.<br>
<br>
DR. BURKE: Only because my parents wanted me to be, I wanted to be a sherrif.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: [entering the kitchen from the party] That's funny, no. Cadillac, cataract, I get
it, no I get it, you stay out there.<br>
<br>
DR. BURKE: See.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Alright, I'll tell you what. I'll come get you in 5 minutes with some sort of um,
kabob emergency.<br>
<br>
DR. BURKE: OK. You better. Oh God, here we go. Hey wanna see 'em go nuts? Watch this.
[grabbing some wine glasses and opening the door to the party] Who needs glasses?
[everyone laughs]<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: You are so smitten.<br>
<br>
MONICA: I am not.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Oh, you are so much the smitten kitten. You should ask him out.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Dr. Burke? I don't think so. I mean, like, he's a grown up.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: So. You two are totally into each other.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Phoebe, he's a friend of my parents. He's like 20 years older than me.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: OK, so what, you're just never gonna see him again?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Not never. I mean, I'm gonna see him tomorrow at my eye appointment.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Didn't you like, just get your eyes checked?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Well yeah, but, you know, uh, 27 is a dangerous eye age.<br>
<br>
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Ross and Rachel are returning from a movie.]<br>
<br>
RACHEL: C'mon, I'm not saying it was a bad movie, I'm just saying, you know, it was a
little. . . hard to follow.<br>
<br>
ROSS: I told you there was going to be sub-titles.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: I know, I just didn't want to wear my glasses on my first date.<br>
<br>
[They start kissing.]<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Monica.<br>
<br>
ROSS: It would really help when I'm kissing you if you didn't shout out my sister's name.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Honey, I'm just checking.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Oh.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Monica.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Mon.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Monica.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Mon.<br>
<br>
[Since they're alone they start kissing and Ross's hands work their way down until they're
on Rachel's butt. Rachel starts laughing.]<br>
<br>
ROSS: What, what.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: I'm sorry. Oh God, I'm sorry, it's just that when you moved your hands down to my
butt, it was like woah, Ross's hands are on my butt. Sorry.<br>
<br>
ROSS: And that's, that's funny why?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Well it's not, honey I'm sorry, I guess I'm just nervous. I mean, it's you, ya
know, it's us. I mean, we're crossing that line, sort of a big thing.<br>
<br>
ROSS: I, I know it's big, I just didn't know it was uh, ha-ha big.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: OK. [start kissing again and Rachel starts lauging again]<br>
<br>
ROSS: OK, my hands were no where near your butt.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: I know, I know, I know, I know. I was just thinking about when they were there the
last time, I'm sorry. I'm sorry, I'm sorry. OK, OK, look, woah, I promise, I'm good, I'm
not gonna laugh anymore. OK put your hands back there.<br>
<br>
ROSS: No see now, now I can't because uh, I'm feeling too self conscious.<br>
<br>
</p>

<p>RACHEL: Just one cheek.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Nuh, uh, the moment's gone.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Alright, just put your hands out and I'll back up into them.<br>
<br>
ROSS: That's romantic.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: C'mon touch it.<br>
<br>
ROSS: No.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Oh, come on squeeze it.<br>
<br>
ROSS: No.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Rub it.<br>
<br>
ROSS: No.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Oh, come on, would you just grab my ass.<br>
<br>
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's apartment. They are watching a Miracle Wax info-mercial.]<br>
<br>
JOEY: Wow, look at that. The car is on fire, yet somehow it's expensive paint job is
protected by the Miracle Wax.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: You got a Cheeto on your face man.[Joey removes the Cheeto and eats it]<br>
<br>
[Ross enters]<br>
<br>
JOEY: Hi.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER and JOEY: Hey.<br>
<br>
JOEY: What're you doin' here? Aren't you supposed to be out with Rachel?<br>
<br>
ROSS: That was 14 hours ago.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: So how'd it go?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Oh. Listen, have you ever been uh, you know, foolin' around with a girl and uh, she
started laughin'?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Yeah, but uh, it was 1982 and my flock of seagulls haircut was tickling her
chin.<br>
<br>
JOEY: She laughed at you?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Yeah. I don't know, I've been wanting this since like ninth grade typing, ya know.
And I just want it to be perfect and right and. . . why isn't that laser beam cutting
through the paint?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: It's the Miracle Wax.<br>
<br>
JOEY: It certainly is a miracle.<br>
<br>
[Rachel enters]<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Hi you guys.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER and JOEY: Hey.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Hey.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Hi. Listen, I was um, thinkin' about. . .<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Listen can you guys uh, speak up, it's harder for us to hear you when you lower
your voice.<br>
<br>
[Rachel and Ross go out in the hall]<br>
<br>
RACHEL: OK, listen, I'm sorry about last night and I really want to make it up to you.<br>
<br>
ROSS: No, you, ya know there's no need to make it u. . . how?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Well, I was thinking maybe a um, a romantic dinner with um, candles and wine and
then uh, maybe going back to my place for um, dessert.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Humm, that sounds, I don't, perfect.<br>
<br>
[there's a loud bang at the door so Ross opens it back up to find a shoe has been thrown
at it]<br>
<br>
RACHEL: What's this.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Could you get us a couple of beers?<br>
<br>
[Scene: Dr. Burke's office. Monica is there for her eye appointment.]<br>
<br>
DR. BURKE: I'm going to look into your eyes now.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Really.<br>
<br>
DR. BURKE: Yeah, that's my job. Alright, look up. . . look down, now open your eyes, now
look down. That's right, look into the light. Now look at me. . . OK. Your eyes look good.
Those are good eyes.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Good, they feel good, in my head.<br>
<br>
DR. BURKE: So, it's great to see ya.<br>
<br>
MONICA: You too.<br>
<br>
DR. BURKE: You too.<br>
<br>
MONICA: OK, um. Goodbye.<br>
<br>
DR. BURKE: Drops!<br>
<br>
MONICA: What?<br>
<br>
DR. BURKE: Drops. Here, they're free.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Thanks. So, I guess I better be going.<br>
<br>
DR. BURKE: Oh, OK, yeah. I'll see ya later.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Thanks again.<br>
<br>
[He kisses her on the cheek, she returns the kiss, then they embrace in a full on kiss]<br>
<br>
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's apartment. They're still watching TV. Phoebe stands in front
of the TV.]<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: We have got to get you lazy boys out of these chairs.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER and JOEY: Hey, woah, hey, woah.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: You know you should go outside and be with the three-dimensional people.<br>
<br>
JOEY: No, inside good, outside bad.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: You guys are so pathetic, I, oh, OH, XANADU! OH.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: She's one of us now.<br>
<br>
[Rachel and Ross enter]<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Hi you guys.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Hey.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER, JOEY, and PHOEBE: Hey.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Well we just wanted to stop by and uh, say goodnight.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER, JOEY, and PHOEBE: Goodnight.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Look at that, they won't even turn their heads.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Alright you guys, I'm takin' off my shirt.<br>
<br>
JOEY: [uses a dentist mirror to see] Naa, she's lyin'.<br>
<br>
[Monica enters carrying food that's been delivered]<br>
<br>
MONICA: Stop sending food to our apartment.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Well, why're you all dressed up?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: You're not the only one who has a date tonight.<br>
<br>
ROSS: What? You have a date? Who with?<br>
<br>
MONICA: No one.<br>
<br>
ROSS: C'mon, what's his name?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Nothing.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Come on, tell me.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Alright, but I'm very excited about this OK, so you gotta promise you won't get
all big-brothery and judgmental.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Oh, I promise, what.<br>
<br>
MONICA: It's Richard Burke.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Who's Richard Burke? Doc, Doctor Burke? You have a date with Doctor Burke? Why, why,
why should that bother me? I, I love that man, he's like a uh, brother to dad.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Well for your information he happens to be one of the brightest, most
sophisticated, sexiest men I've ever been with.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Doctor Burke is sexy?<br>
<br>
RACHEL and PHOEBE: Oh God, absolutely.<br>
<br>
ROSS: [his beeper goes off] It's the museum again, can I, oh.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Ya know, Dr. Burke kissed me once.<br>
<br>
MONICA: When?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: When I was um, 7, I crashed my bike right out in front of his house and to stop me
from crying he kissed me right here. [points to the tip of her nose]<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Oh you are so lucky.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: I know.<br>
<br>
ROSS: [on the phone] Woah, woah, woah australopithicus isn't supposed to be in that
display. No. No. No, n, homo-habilus was erect, australopithicus was never fully erect.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Well maybe he was nervous.<br>
<br>
[Scene: Museum of Natural History. Ross is fixing a display, Rachel is waiting patiently.]<br>
<br>
ROSS: Oh look, I can't believe this. Look, homo-habilus hasn't even learned how to use
tools yet and they've got him here wi, with clay pots. Why don't, why don't they just give
him a microwave? I'm sorry, I'm sorry this is taking so long, ya know, I, I, it's just
it's longer than I expected, we will have dinner.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: It's OK, it's fine.<br>
<br>
ROSS: KARL!<br>
<br>
[Ross leaves to find Karl. Rachel takes a peek under the loincloth of one of the display
models.]<br>
<br>
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Monica and Dr. Burke are sitting on the couch. He's
showing her the pictures in his wallet.]<br>
<br>
MONICA: Wow, is that Michelle?<br>
<br>
DR. BURKE: Yep.<br>
<br>
MONICA: I've not seen her since high school graduation. Oh my God, that night she got so
dru. . . motional.<br>
<br>
DR. BURKE: Ya know, she's having another baby.<br>
<br>
MONICA: I thought she just had one.<br>
<br>
DR. BURKE: No no. Henry's almost two and he's talking and everyting. Here. You know, the
other day he told me he liked me better than his other grandpa. Now in all fairness his
other grandpa's a drunk but still. . .<br>
<br>
MONICA: Oh, you're a grandpa.<br>
<br>
DR. BURKE: Yeah. Are we nuts here?<br>
<br>
MONICA: I don't know, maybe. I mean I'm dating a man who's pool I once peed in.<br>
<br>
DR. BURKE: I didn't need to know that. I guess 21 years is a lot. I mean, hell, I'm a
whole person who can drink older than you.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Yeah.<br>
<br>
DR. BURKE: So.<br>
<br>
MONICA: So maybe we should just. . .<br>
<br>
DR. BURKE: Yeah, yeah, maybe.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Wow, this really sucks.<br>
<br>
DR. BURKE: Yeah, it sure does. [they hug and it turns into a passionate kiss]<br>
<br>
MONICA: Well, we don't really have to decide anything right now, do we?<br>
<br>
DR. BURKE: No, no, there's no rush or anything.<br>
<br>
[knock at the door]<br>
<br>
DELIVERY GUY: Pizza delivery.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Oh, I'm gonna kill those guys.<br>
<br>
[Scene: Museum of Natural History. Ross enters the display where Rachel is waiting.]<br>
<br>
ROSS: Rach.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Oh.<br>
<br>
ROSS: I'm done.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Yeah well, you know what, so is uh, Sorentino's.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Wha, OK, I'm sorry, let's uh, why don't we find someplace else.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: No, you know what, it's late, everything's gonna be closed. Why don't we just do
it another night?<br>
<br>
ROSS: No, no, we won't.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: We won't?<br>
<br>
ROSS: [grabs a fur pelt] C'mon.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: OK, that's dead right?<br>
<br>
[Scene: The museum planetarium. Ross and Rachel enter on stage.]<br>
<br>
RACHEL: What is this? What are we doing?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Shh. Do you want cran-apple or cran-grape?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Grape.<br>
<br>
ROSS: [spreads the pelt on the floor] OK, now, sit. OK. [he starts the music system]<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Oh, God.<br>
<br>
[The stereo system booms out 'Billions of years ago. . .'. Ross gets up and changes it to
music.]<br>
<br>
ROSS: Sorry.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Ah, so what are we looking at?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Well uh, you see that, that little cluster of stars next to the big one? That is
Ursa Major.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Really?<br>
<br>
</p>

<p align="left">ROSS: I've no idea, could be. Listen, I'm sorry I had to work tonight.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Oh it's OK. You were worth the wait, and I don't just mean tonight. [they kiss]<br>
<br>
ROSS: You're not laughing.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: This time it's not so funny.<br>
<br>
[They kiss and start undressing. As Rachel tries to pull off Ross's tie she catches it in
his mouth. Then they roll across the fur rug.]<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Ah, oh God. Oh, honey, oh that's OK.<br>
<br>
ROSS: What. Oh no, you just rolled over the juice box.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Oh, thank God.<br>
<br>
[Scene: Museum of Natural History. The next morning Rachel and Ross are sleeping in the
display under a fur.]<br>
<br>
ROSS: Hi.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Hi you. I can't believe I'm waking up next to you.<br>
<br>
ROSS: I know it is pretty unbelievaaaaah.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: What?<br>
<br>
ROSS: We're not alone. [A church youth group is outside the display watching them]<br>
<br>
<font size="4"><b>CLOSING CREDITS</b></font><br>
<br>
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's apartment. They are still in their chairs, watching <i>Beavis
and Butthead</i>.]<br>
<br>
[they're laughing along with the show when an alarm goes off]<br>
<br>
JOEY: Is that the fire alarm?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Yeah. [feels the floor] Oh it's not warm yet, we still have time.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Cool. </font></p>

<p align="center"><strong><font size="3">END</font></strong></p>

216<html>

<head>
<title>The One Where Joey Moves Out</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="white" text="black" link="green" vlink="black" alink="yellow">

<h1 align="center">The One Where Joey Moves Out</h1>

<hr align="center">
<font size="3"><i>

<p>Originally written by Betsy Bornes<br>
Transcribed by Joshua Hodge.<br>
Minor additions and adjustments by Dan Silverstein.</i></font><br>
</p>

<hr>
<font size="3">

<p align="center"><b>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's apartment. Chandler and Joey are sitting
at the bar, in their bathrobes, eating cereal]</b><br>
<br>
JOEY: Man this is weird. You ever realize Captain Crunch's eyebrows are actually on his
hat?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: That's what's weird? Joey, the man's been captain of a <b>cereal</b> for the
last 40 years.<br>
<br>
[Joey finishes his cereal, licks his spoon, and puts it back in the silverware drawer.]<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Waaa-aaah.<br>
<br>
JOEY: What?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: The spoon. You licked and-and you put. You licked and you put.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Yeah, so.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Well don't you see how gross that is? I mean that's like you using my
toothbrush. [Joey gets a sheepish look] You used my toothbrush?<br>
<br>
JOEY: Well, that was only 'cause I used the red one to unclog the drain.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Mine is the red one! Oh God. Can open, worms everywhere.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Hey, why can't we use the same toothbrush, but we can use the same soap?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Because soap is soap. It's self-cleaning.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Alright, well next time you take a shower, think about the last thing I wash and the
first thing you wash.<br>
<br>
<font size="4"><b>OPENING TITLES</b></font><br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Monica and Phoebe are sitting at the table, Joey
and Chandler enter.]</b><br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Hey.<br>
<br>
MONICA and PHOEBE: Hey.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Hey.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Ooh, look at you fancy lads. What's the occasion?<br>
<br>
JOEY: Well, you know that guy that's on my show that's in a coma? He's havin' a brunch.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Ahh.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: [enters from her room] OK, ready when you are.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Okey-doke.<br>
<br>
MONICA: I can't believe you guys are actually getting tattoos.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Excuse me, you guys are getting tattoos?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Yes, but you can not tell Ross 'cause I want to surprise him.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Wow, this is wild. What're you gonna get?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Um, I'm getting a lily for my Mom. 'Cause her name's Lily.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Wow, that's lucky. What if her name was Big Ugly Splotch?<br>
<br>
JOEY: So where you gettin' it?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: I think on my shoulder. [Ross enters]<br>
<br>
ROSS: What? What's on your shoulder?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Um, a chip. A tattoo, I'm getting a tattoo.<br>
<br>
ROSS: A tattoo? Why, why would you want to do that? [to Rachel] Hi.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Hi. Well hey, you don't - you don't think they're kind of cool?<br>
<br>
ROSS: No, sorry I don't. Tell me why would anyone pay someone to scar their body for life?
What if it doesn't come out right Phoebe? Then it's like, I don't know, havin' a bad hair
cut all the time. Why's everyone staring at me?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Ross, come sign this birthday card for dad. Rich is gonna be here any minute.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Oooh, Rich is goin' to the party too, huh?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Well, he's my parents' best friend, he has to be there.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Oh, is today the day you're gonna tell them about you two?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Yeah. It's my dad's birthday, I decided to give him a stroke.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: No, I think you should tell them.<br>
<br>
MONICA: No, I don't even know how serious he is about me. Until I do, I'm not telling them
anything.<br>
<br>
ROSS: I don't know, I don't think mom and dad would mind. Remember when you were 9 and
Richard was 30, how dad used to say, 'God I hope they get together.'<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: The Gellers' house. Monica, Ross, and Richard are arriving to Mr. Gellers
birthday party.]</b><br>
<br>
ROSS: Alright, shall we?<br>
<br>
MONICA: OK, wait, wait, wait, wait. You know what? Ross, let's - let's switch places. You
get in the middle. No un-, ya know, unless this looks like we're trying to cover something
up.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Monica, Monica, you could come in straddling him, they still wouldn't believe it.
[opens door] We're here.<br>
<br>
MRS. GELLER: Oh hi kids. Hi darling.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Happy birthday dad.<br>
<br>
MR. GELLER: Oh thank you.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Hi ma.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Happy birthday.<br>
<br>
MRS. GELLER: Well, you kids thank Dr. Burke for the ride?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Uh, actually mom, I think Monica thanked him for the both of us.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: The Gellers' kitchen. Monica, Mrs. Geller and one of Mrs. Geller's friends are
preparing the cake.]</b><br>
<br>
FRIEND: Well, you kids take the train in?<br>
<br>
MRS. GELLER: No, Richard Burke gave them a ride.<br>
<br>
FRIEND: Oh. Speaking of whom, I hear he's got some 20-year-old twinkie in the city.
[Monica sprays whipped cream all over the place]<br>
<br>
MONICA: Finger cramp. Oh God, sorry. Here, let me get that mom.<br>
<br>
MRS. GELLER: Sooo, Richard's shopping in the junior section.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Are we still on that?<br>
<br>
MRS. GELLER: We just know she's got the IQ of a napkin.<br>
<br>
FRIEND: She's probably not even very pretty, just young enough so that everything is still
pointing up. [Monica folds her arms over her breasts]<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Joey's co-star's apartment. Chandler and Joey are at the brunch.]</b><br>
<br>
JOEY: Can you believe this place?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: I know, this is a great apartment.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Ah, I was just in the bathroom, and there's mirrors on both sides of you. So when
you're in there it's like you're peein' with the Rockettes.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Wow, there's my fantasy come true. No, seriously.<br>
<br>
JOEY'S CO-STAR: Hey.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Hey! We were just sayin', great apartment man.<br>
<br>
JOEY'S CO-STAR: Thanks. You want it?<br>
<br>
JOEY: Huh?<br>
<br>
JOEY'S CO-STAR: Yeah, I'm movin' to a bigger place. You should definitely take this one.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Yeah, can you see me in a place like this?<br>
<br>
JOEY'S CO-STAR: Why not? You hate park views and high ceilings? C'mon I'll show you the
kitchen.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: [being left behind] Oh that's all right fellas, I saw a kitchen this morning -
on TV. Stop talking. OK.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Mr. Geller's party. Mr. Geller and a friend are questioning Richard while Ross
observes.]</b><br>
<br>
MR. GELLER: C'mon, tell us.<br>
<br>
FRIEND: Yeah, is she really 20.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: I am not telling you guys anything.<br>
<br>
MR. GELLER: C'mon Rich, it's my birthday, let me live vicariously.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Dad, you really don't want to do that.<br>
<br>
MR. GELLER: Ahh, what's a little mid-life crisis between friends?<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Jack, would you let it go?<br>
<br>
MR. GELLER: Look, I know what you're going through. When I turned 50 I got the Porsche.
You... you got your own little speedster.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Guys. Seriously, it is <b>not</b> like that.<br>
<br>
MR. GELLER: Tell you what, maybe one of these weekends you can borrow the car and I cou. .
.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Dad, I beg you not to finish that sentence.<br>
<br>
MR. GELLER: What? I'm kidding. You know I'd never let him touch the Porsche.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Tattoo parlor. Phoebe and Rachel are deciding on tattoos.]</b><br>
<br>
PHOEBE: OK Rach, which, which lily? This lily or that lily?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Well I. . .<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: I like this lily. It's more open, ya know, and that's like my mom. She had a more
open, giving spirit. Ooh, Foghorn Leghorn, ooh.<br>
<br>
TATTOO ARTIST: Alright, blonde girl, you're in room two, not so blonde girl, you're with
me.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Here we go.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: [reluctantly] Uh-huh.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: You're not going?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Uh-huh.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: What? Is it - is this 'cause of what Ross said?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: No. Well, yeah, maybe.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: I don't believe this. Is this how this relationship's gonna work? Ross equals
boss. I mean, c'mon what is this, 1922?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: What's 1922?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Just, you know, long time ago. Well, when men used to tell women what to do - a
lot. And then there was suffrage, which is a good thing but is sounds horrible. Do you
want to get this tattoo?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Yes I do, it's just that Ross is. . .<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: OK, hey, HEY. Is your boyfriend the boss of you?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: No.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: OK, who is the boss of you?!!<br>
<br>
RACHEL: You?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: No. You are the boss of you. Now you march your heinie in there and get that heart
tattooed on your hip. <b>GO</b>!!<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Mr. Geller's birthday party. Monica is in the bathroom and Richard comes in.]</b><br>
<br>
RICHARD: How ya doin'?<br>
<br>
MONICA: I'm a twinkie.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Really? I'm a hero.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Oh, this is so hard.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Yeah, I know. I hate it too. Look, maybe we should just tell them.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Maybe we should just tell your parents first.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: My parents are dead.<br>
<br>
MONICA: God, you are so lucky. I mean, I mean. . . you know what I mean.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: I know, I know. Just hang in there, OK. OK, I'll go out first, alright.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Alright.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: [walks out of the bathroom and runs into Mrs. Geller who is going to the
bathroom] Judy, <b>going to the bathroom</b>, good for you.<br>
<br>
MRS. GELLER: Thank you Richard, I appreciate the support.<br>
<br>
[Monica jumps in the shower. Right after Mrs. Geller enters the bathroom, Mr. Geller peeks
his head in.]<br>
<br>
MR. GELLER: Honey. Honey, have you seen my Harmon Kilerbrew bat? Bob doesn't believe I
have one.<br>
<br>
MRS. GELLER: I have no idea. Did you know Richard has a twinkie in the city?<br>
<br>
MR. GELLER: I know. He's like a new man. It's like a scene from <i>Cocoon</i>.<br>
<br>
MRS. GELLER: I just never would have pictured Richard with a bimbo.<br>
<br>
MR. GELLER: Apparently, he told Johnny Shapiro that she's quite a girl. In fact, he told
Johnny that he thinks he's falling in love with her.<br>
<br>
MRS. GELLER: Really.<br>
<br>
MR. GELLER: I tell you, I've never seen him this happy.<br>
<br>
MRS. GELLER: So Jack, you ever think about trading me in for a younger model?<br>
<br>
MR. GELLER: Of course not. With you it's like I've got two 25-year-olds.<br>
<br>
MRS. GELLER: [they start kissing] Oh Jack stop.<br>
<br>
MR. GELLER: C'mon, it's my birthday.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's apartment. Chandler and Joey are returning from their
brunch.]</b><br>
<br>
JOEY: Can we drop this? I am not interested in the guy's apartment.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Oh please, I saw the way you were checking out his mouldings. You want it.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Why would I want another apartment, huh? I've already got an apartment that I love.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Well it wouldn't kill you to say it once in a while.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Alright, you want the truth? I'm thinkin' about it.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: What?<br>
<br>
JOEY: I'm sorry. I'm 28 years old, I've never lived alone, and I'm finally at a place
where I've got enough money that I don't need a roommate anymore.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Woah, woah, woah. I don't need a roommate either, OK? I can afford to live here
by myself. Ya know, I may have to bring in somebody once a week to lick the silverware.<br>
<br>
JOEY: What're you gettin' so bent out of shape for, huh? It's not like we agreed to live
together forever. We're not Bert and Ernie.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Look, you know what? If this is the way you feel, then maybe you should take it.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Well that's how I feel.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Well then maybe you should take it.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Well then maybe I will.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Fine with me.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Great. Then you'll be able to spend more quality time with your real friends, the
spoons.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Mr. Geller's birthday party. Mr. and Mrs. Geller enter looking particularly
refreshed. Monica follows looking rather pale.]</b><br>
<br>
MR. GELLER: Who's drink can I freshen?<br>
<br>
MRS. GELLER: Almost time for cake.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Mon, Mon, are you OK?<br>
<br>
MONICA: You remember that video I found of mom and dad?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Yeah.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Well, I just caught the live show.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Eww.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Mr. Geller's birthday party. Monica and Richard are alone in the kitchen.]</b><br>
<br>
MONICA: Hey there.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: What?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Nothing, I just heard something nice about you.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Humm, really?<br>
<br>
[Mrs. Geller and Ross both enter]<br>
<br>
MRS. GELLER: Richard. Richard. Your son isn't seeing anyone is he?<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Uhh, not that I know of.<br>
<br>
MRS. GELLER: Well, I was thinking, why doesn't he give Monica a call?<br>
<br>
RICHARD: That - that's an idea.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Well, actually, I'm already seeing someone.<br>
<br>
MRS. GELLER: Oh?<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Oh?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Ohh.<br>
<br>
MRS. GELLER: She never tells us anything. Ross, did you know Monica's seeing someone?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Mom, there are so many people in my life. Some of them are seeing people and some of
them aren't. Is that crystal?<br>
<br>
MRS. GELLER: So, who's the mystery man?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Well, uh, he's a doctor.<br>
<br>
MRS. GELLER: A real doctor?<br>
<br>
MONICA: No, a doctor of meat. Of course he's a real doctor. And he's handsome, and he's
sweet, and know you'd like him. [she puts her arm around Richard]<br>
<br>
MRS. GELLER: Well that's wonderful. . . I<br>
<br>
MONICA: Mom, it's OK.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: It is Judy.<br>
<br>
MRS. GELLER: Jack. Could you come in here for a moment? NOW!<br>
<br>
MR. GELLER: [enters with his bat] Found it.<br>
<br>
ROSS: I'll take that dad. [grabs the bat]<br>
<br>
MRS. GELLER: It seems your daughter and Richard are something of an item.<br>
<br>
MR. GELLER: That's impossible, he's got a twinkie in the city.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Dad, I'm the twinkie.<br>
<br>
MR. GELLER: You're the twinkie?<br>
<br>
RICHARD: She's not a twinkie.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Al-alright, l-look you guys, this is the best relationship I've been in. . .<br>
<br>
MRS. GELLER: Oh please, a relationship.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Yes, a relationship. For your information I am crazy about this man.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Really?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Yes.<br>
<br>
MR. GELLER: Am I supposed to stand here and listen to this on my birthday?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Dad, dad this is a good thing for me. Ya know, and you even said yourself, you've
never seen Richard happier.<br>
<br>
MR. GELLER: When did I say that?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Upstairs in the bathroom right before you felt up mom.<br>
<br>
[Everyone else enters and all start singing <i>Happy Birthday</i>.]<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Tattoo parlor. Rachel is showing Phoebe her tattoo.]</b><br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Oh that looks so good, oh I love it.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: I know, so do I. Oh Phoebe, I'm so glad you made me do this. OK, lemme se yours.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Ahh. OK, let's see yours again.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Phoebe we just saw mine, let me see yours.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Oh OK. [pulls over her shirt and shows a bare shoulder] Oh no, oh it's gone,
that's so weird, I don't know how-where it went.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: You didn't get it?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: No.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Why didn't you get it?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: I'm sorry, I'm sorry.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Phoebe, how would you do this to me? This was all your idea.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: I know, I know, and I was gonna get it but then he came in with this needle and
uh, di-, did you know they do this with needles?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Really? You don't say, because mine was licked on by kittens.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's apartment. Chandler is at the bar and Joey enters.]</b><br>
<br>
JOEY: Hey.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Hey.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Hey listen, I'm sorry about what happened. . .<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Yeah me too.<br>
<br>
JOEY: I know. Yeah.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Yeah. So do we need to hug here or. . .<br>
<br>
JOEY: No, we're alright.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: So I got ya something. [tosses Joey a bag of plastic spoons]<br>
<br>
JOEY: Plastic spoons. Great.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Lick away my man.<br>
<br>
JOEY: These'll go great in my new place. You know, 'till I get real ones.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: What?<br>
<br>
JOEY: Well, I can't use these forever. I mean, let's face it, they're no friend to the
environment.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: No-no, I mean what, what's this about your new place?<br>
<br>
JOEY: I'm movin' out like we talked about.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Well I didn't think that was serious. [grabs the spoons back] Ya know I thought
that was just a fight.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Well, it was a fight. . . based on serious stuff, remember. About how I never lived
alone or anything. I just think it would be good for me, ya know, help me to grow or. . .
whatever.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Well, there you go.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Hey, are you cool with this. I mean, I don't want to leave you high and dry.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Hey, no, I've never been lower or wetter. I'll be fine. I'll just turn your, uh,
bedroom into a game room or somethin', you know, put the foosball table in there.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Woah. Why do you get to keep the table?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: I did pay for half of it.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Yeah. And uh, I paid for the other half.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Alright I'll tell you what, I'll play you for it.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Alright, you're on. I can take two minutes out of my day to kick your ass.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Your little men are gonna get scored on more times than your sister.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Woah, woah, woah, woah. Which sister?<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Monica and Richard are setting the table.]</b><br>
<br>
MONICA: So, are you sorry that I told them?<br>
<br>
RICHARD: No, it's been a long time since your dad and I went running.<br>
<br>
[Rachel and Phoebe enter]<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Oh.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Oh. Well did you get it? Let me see.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Is Ross here?<br>
<br>
MONICA: No he went out to get pizza.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Oh really, OK. [shows Monica her tattoo]<br>
<br>
MONICA: That's great.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Very tasteful.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Wanna see mine, wanna see mine?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Yes.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: What? You didn't get one.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: OK, well then what is this? [shows her bare shoulder]<br>
<br>
RICHARD: What're we looking at? That blue freckle?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: OK, that's my tattoo.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: That is not a tattoo, that is a nothing. I finally got her back in the chair,
bairly touched her with a needle, she jumped up screaming, and that was it.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: OK, hi. For your information this is exactly what I wanted. This is a tattoo of
the earth as seen from a great distance. It's the way my mother sees me from heaven.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Oh, what a load of crap. That is a dot. Your mother is up in heaven going, 'Where
the hell is my lily, you wuss?' OK, Phoebe, that is not a tattoo, this is a tattoo. [she
bends over and bears her tattoo right when Ross returns]<br>
<br>
ROSS: You got a tattoo?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Maybe. But just a little one. Phoebe got the whole world.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Lemme see. [looks]<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Well?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Well it's really. . . sexy. I wouldn't have thought it would be but. . . wow.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Really?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Yeah, so uh, is it sore or can you do stuff?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: I guess.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Hey, save us some pizza. [they go off to Rachel's room]<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Chandler's apartment. Chandler and Joey are playing foosball for the table.]</b><br>
<br>
JOEY: Get out of the corner. Pass it, pass it.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Stop talkin' to your men. [Joey scores]<br>
<br>
JOEY: Yes! And the table is mine.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Congratulations. [Chandler leaves]<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Chandler's apartment. The whole gang is helping Joey pack.]</b><br>
<br>
JOEY: Hey, you guys are still gonna come visit me, right?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Oh yeah, you got the big TV. We'll be over there all the time. . . [Chandler
gives him a look] except when we are here.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: I know you're just moving uptown but I'm really gonna miss you.<br>
<br>
MONICA: I know, how can you not be accross the hall anymore.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Yeah, who's gonna eat all our food, and tie up our phone lines, and - is that my
bra? What the hell you doin' with my bra?<br>
<br>
JOEY: Oh no-no, it's uh, it's not what you think. We uh, we used it to, you know, fling
water balloons off the roof. Remember that, those junior high kids couldn't even get
theirs accross the street.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: [quietly] Yeah, I remember.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Hey, let's bring the rest of these down to the truck.<br>
<br>
[Everyone except Joey and Chandler leave.]<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: So, uhh, em, you want me to uh, give you a hand with the foosball table?<br>
<br>
JOEY: Naa, you keep it, you need the practice.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Thanks.<br>
<br>
JOEY: So, I guess this is it.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Yeah, right, yeah, I guess so.<br>
<br>
[Joey walks to the door. He stops, turns around.]</p>

<p align="center"><br>
<br>
JOEY: Listen, uh, I don't know when I'm gonna see you again.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Well, I'm guessing uh, tonight at the coffee house.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Right, yeah. OK. Um, take care.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Yeah.<br>
<br>
[Joey walks out and after a few seconds comes back in and gives Chandler a big hug. He
then leaves for good and Chandler is left alone in his apartment.]<br>
<br>
<b><font size="4">CLOSING CREDITS</font></font></b></p>

<p align="center"><font size="4"><font size="3"><b>END</b></font> </font></p>

217<html>

<head>
<title>The One Where Eddie Moves In</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="white" text="black" link="green" vlink="black" alink="yellow">

<h1 align="center">The One Where Eddie Moves In</h1>

<hr align="center">
<font size="3"><i>

<p>Originally written by <b>Adam Chase</b>.<br>
Transcribed by <b>Joshua Hodge</b>.</i></font><br>
</p>

<hr>
<font size="3"><b>

<p align="left">[Scene: Joey's new apartment. Everyone but Chandler is there. Joey has
decorated the place with tons of tacky stuff.]</b><br>
<br>
JOEY: Huh? So whaddya think? Casa de Joey. Huh? I decorated it myself.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Get out.<br>
<br>
ALL: No.<br>
<br>
MONICA: [looking at some kind of glass sculpture thing] Wow Joey, this is, uhh...<br>
<br>
JOEY: Art.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Art it is.<br>
<br>
ROSS: [looking at a glass table with a panther shaped base] Look, check this out. Is it a
coffee table, is it a panther? There's no need to decide.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: [holding a pillow made out of 4 inch red fur] Hey, nice pillow. So now tell me, is
this genuine Muppet skin?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: [looking at a water sculpture that looks like a window with rain running down it]
Hey, excellent, excellent water-table thing. <br>
<br>
JOEY: Thanks, yeah. I love this but ya know what, it makes me wanna pee.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Yeah, well me too, yeah. I think that's the challenge.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Hey, how come, uhh, Chandler didn't come?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Well uh, it's cause he had a thing with, wi-, with the thing.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Right, I go-, I got it.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: So why don't ya show us the rest of your casa?<br>
<br>
JOEY: Yeah. Uh, oh, OH, the best part, c'mon. [leads them to the bathroom, gestures
towards toilet, everyone stares, uncomprehending] Heh?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Hey, nice toilet.<br>
<br>
JOEY: No no no, behind it.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Wha-, you have a phone in here?<br>
<br>
JOEY: That's right, I have a phone <i>in here</i>.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Joey, promise me something.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Yeah.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Never call me from that phone.<br>
<br>
<font size="4"><b>OPENING TITLES</b></font> <br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Central Perk. Monica, Chandler, and Ross are seated. Rachel is walking over
with coffee and a piece of pie.]</b><br>
<br>
[Someone bumps into Rachel and she drops the pie in a guy's hood that's seated at the
table. She improvises by using the plate as a saucer for the coffee.]<br>
<br>
RACHEL: OK, here we go. Honey, I'm sorry, they were all out of apple pie, someone just got
the last piece.<br>
<br>
[Phoebe enters]<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Oh my God, oh my God, oh my God, oh my God. You are not gonna believe this. I have
just been discovered.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Now wait a minute, I claimed you in the name of France four years ago.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Anyway, OK, now promise you won't like, freak out and say how great this is until
I'm done, OK.<br>
<br>
ALL: OK.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: OK. I just met this producer of this like, teeny record company, who said that I
have a very fresh, offbeat sound and she wants to do a demo of <i>Smelly Cat</i>.<br>
<br>
ALL: [congradulating her and celebrating]<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: I told you not to do that yet. And, she wants to do a video.<br>
<br>
ALL: [celebrating more]<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: I'm not done yet, OK. God. OK, if that goes well, they may even want to make an
album.<br>
<br>
[everyone is quiet, unsure if she's done or not]<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: I'm done now.<br>
<br>
ALL: [celebrating]<br>
<br>
[the guy with the pie in his hood get up to leave]<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Oh God. Ross, OK, if you care about me at all, you will get the pie out of the
man's hood.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Get the what?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Pie in the hood, pie in the hood. Go.<br>
<br>
[Ross goes over behind the guy and grabs the pie out of his hood as he leaves]<br>
<br>
GUY: What're you doing?<br>
<br>
ROSS: I'm sorry, my pie was, was in your hood. Now I just have to get the coffee out of
that guy's pants and I'll be back in the hospital by 7. [swats at an imaginary insect by
his head, guy leaves promptly]<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Monica is outside the bathroom yelling at Ross
who's in the bathroom.]</b><br>
<br>
MONICA: Damnit Ross, get your butt out of the bathroom.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Calm down, I'm blow drying.<br>
<br>
[Rachel enters with laundry and starts folding]<br>
<br>
MONICA: Blow drying what, you have no hair.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: What's goin' on?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Your boyfriend has been in there for over an hour. I can't believe it, it's like
I'm living with him again. He's here when I go to sleep, he's here when I wake up, he's
here when I want to use the shower, ughh. It's like I'm sixteen all over again .<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Well, you're not sixteen, you're both adults now.<br>
<br>
MONICA: GET OUT YOU DUFUS!!<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Or ya know, he's rubber and you're glue.<br>
<br>
ROSS: [comes out] All yours.<br>
<br>
MONICA: I hope you cleaned your hair out of the drain.<br>
<br>
ROSS: [in a childish voice] I hope you cleaned your hair out of the drain.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Shut up.<br>
<br>
ROSS: [childish voice] Shut up.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Cut it out.<br>
<br>
ROSS: [childish voice] Mi-mi-mii.<br>
<br>
[Monica goes in the bathroom]<br>
<br>
RACHEL: [sarcastically] I've never wanted you more.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Chandler's apartment. Chandler is sitting on the bar wearing huge dog-slippers]</b><br>
<br>
CHANDLER: So, whaddya say boys, should I call him? [squeezes the ear of one of the
slippers and it barks] Well, ya know what they say. Ask your slippers a question... you're
going crazy.<br>
<br>
[Joey's apartment, phone rings]<br>
<br>
JOEY: Hello.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Hey.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Hey!<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Listen, I'm, I'm sorry I didn't make it over there today.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Oh, that's OK. You uh, you had a thing.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Yeah well, I hear the place looks great.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Ahh, forget about it, I'm havin' a ball. How's the apartment doin'<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Oh hey, it's, it's terriffic. I mean it's a regular space... fest.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Oh, well great.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Yeah I just... wanted to call and say hey.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Well OK then. [oven timer goes off behind Chandler] Was that the oven timer?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: That's right my friend. It's time for...<br>
<br>
BOTH: Baywatch!! [both turn on TV's]<br>
<br>
JOEY: Oh, can you believe they gave Stephanie skin cancer?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: I still can't believe they promoted her to lieutenant.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Naa, you're just sayin' that 'cause you're in love with Yasmine Blepe.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Well, how could anyone not be in love with Yasmine Blepe?<br>
<br>
JOEY: Hey, hey, they're runnin'<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: See, this is the brilliance of the show. I say always keep them running. All the
time, running. Run. Run Yasmine, run like the wind.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Central Perk. Joey is sitting between Monica and Phoebe.]</b><br>
<br>
MONICA: But I thought you wanted to live by yourself.<br>
<br>
JOEY: I did. I thought it'd be great. I figured I'd have like, time alone with my thoughts
but, ya know, it turns out I don't have as many thoughts as you'd think.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Joey, why don't you talk to Chandler about moving back?<br>
<br>
JOEY: You really think he'd take me? I mean, we had a pretty good talk last night but,
when I moved out, I hurt him bad.<br>
<br>
MONICA: I promise you, he would definitely want you back.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Chandler's apartment. Chandler is sitting between Rachel and Ross.]</b><br>
<br>
ROSS: I'm telling you, there's no way he's moving back.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: But we had one of the greatest talks we ever had last night. I mean it was, it
was like when we first started living together.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Look, I know you don't want to hear this right now but, we've seen him in his new
place, alright. And he's happy, he's, he's decorated.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Look, Chandler, he has moved on, OK, you have to too.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: But...<br>
<br>
ROSS: No. You're just gonna have to accept the fact that you're just friends now, OK,
you're not... rommmates anymore.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Recording studio. Phoebe is getting ready to record <i>Smelly Cat</i>.]</b><br>
<br>
PRODUCER: OK Phoebe, you ready to try one?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: OK. [singing] <i>Smelly cat, smell-ly cat, what are they feeding you? Smelly cat</i>
[back up singers start singing <i>smelly, smelly, smelly, smelly</i> behind her] Oh woah,
oh my God. I mean like, who was that?<br>
<br>
PRODUCER:They're your backup singers... beind you.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: OH!! Oh I thought they were just watching me. You know, like at, like at an
aquarium, ya know.<br>
<br>
PRODUCER: Alrighty. From the top.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: OK. [singing] <i>Smelly cat, smell-ly cat, what are they feeding you? Smelly cat</i>
[back up singers - <i>smelly, smelly, smelly, really bad smelly cat, it's not your fault</i>]
OK, sorry. I'm just, I'm just not getting that everyone um, gets how smelly this cat
acually is. I just think that maybe if we could talk about this, 'cause I need to feel
that you really care about the cat.<br>
<br>
PRODUCER: Honey, uh we, we can talk about this. It's just that it's costing about a
hundred dollars a minute to be in here.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Oh OK. So, um, the cat stinks but you love it, let's go.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Monica and Chandler's apartment. Ross is on the phone.]</b><br>
<br>
ROSS: No, there is no way he was a velociraptor. No Tony, look at the cranial ridge, OK.
If Dino was a velociraptor, he would have eaten the Flintstones. Yeah, yeah. [Monica comes
out of her room] Oh, were you takin' a nap?<br>
<br>
MONICA: I <i>was</i>.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Oh I-, Oh wait, Tony can you hang on? That's the other line. [gets the other line]
Hello. Oh yeah she's here but uh, can she call you back? OK thanks. [hangs up the other
line] Call Joanna. [back on with Tony] Hi.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Did she leave a number?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Did you see me write one down?<br>
<br>
MONICA: I don't have her number, butt-munch.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Well, she'll call back, don't be such a baby.<br>
<br>
MONICA: I'm not a baby, you're the baby.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Look, you wanna get off my back?<br>
<br>
MONICA: You wanna get out of my face?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Wait hold on Tony, hold on. [answers second line] Hello. Hi, yeah no, she's right
here. Um hold on. [gets first line] Hi Tony, can I call you back? That's uh, that's my
sister's boyfriend.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Give me that.<br>
<br>
ROSS: OK.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Hi sweetie, look before I forget, did I leave my diaphram at your place? Hi mom.
[she starts throwing oranges at Ross who's looking pleased with himself]<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Chandler's apartment. Chandler is sitting on the bar, bouncing a ball against
the door. Joey walks in right as he throws the ball and catches it.]</b><br>
<br>
JOEY: Hey.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: So uhh, how's the palace?<br>
<br>
JOEY: You know it's funny you should mention that 'cause I was thinkin'... what's with the
boxes?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Oh, uhh, actually I uh, have some news.<br>
<br>
EDDIE: Hey Chan, is that Joey guy gonna come by and pick up his moose hat or should I just
toss it out?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Well, uh, why don't you ask him yourself. Joey, this is my new roommate Eddie.<br>
<br>
EDDIE: Nice to meet ya.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Likewise. Uh, I'll take that. [grabs moose hat] It's what I came for. So, this is
new. Where'd you two meet?<br>
<br>
EDDIE: At the uh, supermarket, in the uh, ethnic food section. I helped him pick out a
chorizo.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Wow.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Well you know, we got to talking and uh, he said he needed a place and I had a
spare room.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Oh, now it's a spare room?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Well yeah, in that it's not being used and I... have it to spare.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Well I uh, got what I came for. [puts on moose hat] I'll uh, I'll see you guys.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Hey Jo. When'd you start usin' mousse in your hair?<br>
<br>
EDDIE: [annoying laugh] Is this guy great or what?<br>
<br>
JOEY: Yeah, yeah he is. [leaves]<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Monica, Rachel, and Ross are there.]</b><br>
<br>
MONICA: I can't believe he has a new roommate. Who is this guy?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Uh, Eddie something. He just met him.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: It'll never last, he's just a rebound roommate.<br>
<br>
[Pheobe enters]<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Hey.<br>
<br>
ALL: Hey.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Oh, check it out, oh check it out. It's <i>Smelly Cat</i> the video.<br>
<br>
ALL: [cheer]<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Now OK, I haven't seen it yet so, if you don't like it, well, so what, none of you
ever made a video. [puts the tape in] OK.<br>
<br>
[The video is a very dramatic episode with an obviously dubbed voice for Phoebe. Everyone
watches in disbeliefe]<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Oh my God.<br>
<br>
ROSS: I know.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: I sound amazing. I, I, I've never heard myself sing before. I mean, except in my
own head. Oh, this is so cool, now I can hear what you hear.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Pretty uhm, different huh?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Oh, I am sorry but I am incredibly talented.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Chandler and Eddie's apartment. Joey stops by. Chandler is reading the paper
and Eddie is fixing eggs.]</b><br>
<br>
EDDIE: Hi Joey, what's goin' on man?<br>
<br>
JOEY: Eddie.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Morning.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Morning. I just uh, came by to pick up my mail. [looks for the mail on the table by
the door, it's not there] Where's the mail?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Oh it's uh, over there on the table.<br>
<br>
JOEY: You don't keep it over here on this table any more?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: No, Eddie likes to keep it over there.<br>
<br>
EDDIE: Alright, here you go my friend. Eggs a-la Eddie, huh?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Oh, ooh.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Huh.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: What?<br>
<br>
JOEY: No I just uh, thought you liked your eggs with the bread with the hole in the
middle, a-la me.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Well I do, but uh, Eddie makes them this way and, well they're pretty darn good.<br>
<br>
EDDIE: Well you guys, I'm outta here. See ya pals.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: See ya. [Eddie leaves]<br>
<br>
JOEY: So how you two gettin' along?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Oh, I couldn't be happier.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Great, well, I'm happy for ya. [picks up the orange juice carton and it's empty]
Alright that's it. He just comes in here, Mr. Jonny Neweggs, with his, his, his movin' the
mail and his, his 'see ya pals'. And now there's no juice. There's no juice f or the
people who need the juice and want the juice. I need the juice.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: There's another carton right over there.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Hey, this isn't about juice anymore, alright man.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Alright, so what's it about?<br>
<br>
JOEY: Eggs. Who's eggs do you like better, his or mine, huh?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Well I like both eggs equally.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Oh come on. Nobody likes two different kinds of eggs equally. You like one better
than the other and I wanna know which.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Well what's the difference? Your eggs aren't here anymore, are they? You took
your eggs and you left. You really expect me to never find new eggs?<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Ross and Monica are fighting over the remote.]</b><br>
<br>
MONICA: I wanna watch <i>Entertainment Tonight</i>.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Tough noogies, we're watching Predators of the Serengetti.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Would you guys stop.<br>
<br>
MONICA: It's my TV.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Wha-, oh, quit it.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Bite me.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Oh my God.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Well, Monica keeps changin' the channel.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Oh that's great, why don't you tell mommy on me.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Now I'm mommy in this little play? Alright look, I refuse to get sucked into this
like, weird little Geller dimension thing OK. So I'm gonna go and take a nice long hot
bubble bath because you kids are driving me crazy. [goes in the bathroom]<br>
<br>
MONICA: OK, what're we gonna do about this?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Well, I guess we could tape <i>Entertainment Tonight</i>.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Not that, this, US. Oh my God, Ross, you-re, you're, it's jus-, you-, ever sin-
you been here.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Ow, ow, OK. Alright, alright, Mon, Mon, you've gone ultrasonic again, alright.<br>
<br>
MONICA: I just can't stand you being here all the time.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Why, why, why can't you stand me being here? I don't, I, we're just, ya know, we're
just havin' fun.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Fun? Fun, you think this is fun?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Yeah, c'mon I mean I though, you know, I thought we're just foolin' around. Like
when, uh, when we were kids.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Ross, I hated you when we were kids.<br>
<br>
ROSS: You hated me when we were kids?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Yes. I hated you. I mean I, I, loved you in a 'you're my brother so I have to'
kind of way, but basically, yeah, I hated your guts.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Why did you hate me?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Because, you were mean to me and you, you teased me and you always, always got
your way.<br>
<br>
ROSS: And that wasn't fun for you?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Duh-huh!<br>
<br>
ROSS: I can't believe you hated me.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Now I love you. And not just 'cause I have to.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Really?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Yeah. You're just gonna have to stop pissing me off.<br>
<br>
ROSS: I can do that.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Then I won't have to kill you.<br>
<br>
ROSS: So you wanna watch uh, <i>Entertainment Tonight</i>?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Yeah, thanks. You know what?<br>
<br>
ROSS: What?<br>
<br>
MONICA: If you really want to watch that Serengetti thing, you can.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Ohh... OK. [changes the channel]<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Central Perk. Ross, Rachel, and Monica are hanging out.]</b><br>
<br>
[Phoebe enters]<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Hey.<br>
<br>
ALL: Hey.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Listen. You are not going to believe this but, that is not me singing on the
video.<br>
<br>
ALL: No.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Yes.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Well, how did you find out?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Well, OK, the record company sent over this piece of paper for me to sign, saying
that it's OK for someone else to sing for me. That was my first clue.<br>
<br>
MONICA: So what're you gonna do?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Well, I can't work with people who would do this.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Sure.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: I mean this poor woman.<br>
<br>
ROSS: What woman?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: The voice woman. Ya know, I mean, she has a great voice but she doesn't have a
video.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: OK, Phoebs. But what about you?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Well I have a video, you have to pay attention. No this, this voice woman, she's
so talented but, according to the producer people, they said she doesn't have like the
right look or something, ya know. I mean, it's like, she's like one of those an imals at
the pound who like nobody wants 'cause they're not pretty enough or you know. Like, like
some old dog who's just kind of like stinky and. Huuuuh, oh my God, she's smelly cat. Oh,
oh that song has so many levels.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Chandler and Eddie's apartment.]</b><br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Hey Eddie, you uh, wanna play some foosball?<br>
<br>
EDDIE: No thanks man, I'm not uh, I'm not really into sports.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: [stares in disbeliefe] Yeah o-, OK, alright. [oven timer goes off] Doesn't
matter, time for <i>Baywatch</i>.<br>
<br>
EDDIE: Y-, y-, you like that show?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: You don't like that show?<br>
<br>
EDDIE: Wha-, n-, no. I mean it's just a bunch of pretty people runnin' around on the
beach, ya know.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Well that's the brilliance of it. The pretty people... and the running.<br>
<br>
EDDIE: I tell ya, I-, I'm gonna go read in my room for a little while.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Oh o-, OK man.<br>
<br>
[Joey's place. He's watching Baywatch, lauging. He goes to say something to Chandler in
the other chair but no one's there. He goes to call Chandler but decides not to.]<br>
<br>
[Chandler's. He's playing foosball by himself.]<br>
<br>
[Joey's. Playing ping pong by himself.]<br>
<br>
[<i>All by myself</i> is playing. Chandler is sitting in front of a window while it's
raining outside. We see Joey through a rainy window. The camera zooms out to show it's
just his tabletop water sculpture.]<br>
<br>
<font size="4"><b>CLOSING CREDITS</b></font> <br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Central Perk. Phoebe is performing <i>Smelly Cat</i>.]</b><br>
<br>
PHOEBE: [singing] <i>Smelly cat, smell-ly cat, what are they feeding you?</i> Everybody.<br>
<br>
ALL: <i>Smelly cat, smell-ly cat, it's not your fault.</i><br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Monica.<br>
<br>
MONICA: [sings] <i>They won't take you to the vet.</i><br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Chandler.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: [reluctantly sings] <i>You're obviously not their favorite pet.</i><br>
<br>
MONICA: Joey.<br>
<br>
JOEY: [sings] <i>It may not be a bed of roses.</i><br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Rachel.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: [sings] <i>And you're no friend to those with noses.</i><br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Uh, Ross, those are the only lines we have, sorry. OK, you guys, once more.</font></p>

<p align="center"><strong><font size="3">END</font></strong></p>
