218<html>

<head>
<title>The One Where Dr. Remore Dies</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="white" text="black" link="green" vlink="black" alink="yellow">

<h1 align="center">The One Where Dr. Remore Dies</h1>

<hr align="center">
<font size="3"><i>

<p>Originally written by <b>???</b>.</i></font><br>
<font size="3"><i>Transcribed by <b>Josh Hodge</b>.</i></font><br>
</p>

<hr>
<font size="3"><b>

<p align="left">[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Everyone except Ross is there
watching <i>Days of Our Lives</i>.]</b><br>
<br>
<i>AMBER: Oh Drake.<br>
<br>
DR. REMORE: I'm sorry Amber. It's just like Brad to have to have the last word.</i><br>
<br>
[Ross enters]<br>
<br>
ROSS: I'm sorry I'm late, what happened?<br>
<br>
MONICA: We, we just wanna see the end.<br>
<br>
<i>AMBER: I want you Drake.<br>
<br>
DR. REMORE: I know you do but you and I can never be together that way.<br>
<br>
AMBER: What?<br>
<br>
DR. REMORE: There's something I never told you Amber. I'm actually your half- brother.</i><br>
<br>
[Everyone gasps. The show ends.]<br>
<br>
RACHEL: So what happens next?<br>
<br>
<a name="line01"></a> JOEY: Well, I get the medical award for separating the siamese
twins. Then Amber and I go to Venezuela to meet our other half-brother, Ramone. And that's
where I find the world's biggest emerald. It's really big but it's cursed.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: God that is good TV.<br>
<br>
<font size="4"><b>OPENING TITLES</b></font><br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Chandler and Eddie's apartment. Chandler is at the foosball table trying to get
Phoebe to play a game with him.]</b><br>
<br>
<a name="line02"></a> CHANDLER: Phoebs, play with meeee.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: No. This game is grotesque. Twenty armless guys joined at the waist by a steel
bar, forced to play soccer forever. Ahh, hello, human-rights violation.<br>
<br>
<a name="line03"></a> CHANDLER: Ya know Phoebs, don't feel so bad for 'em. After they're
done playing, I break out the little plastic women and everybody has a pretty good time.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Why don't you play with your roommate?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Ah he's a, he's not a big fan of foosball.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Uh oh, ooh, are we not getting along with the new boy?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: No he's, he's alright, just uh, he spends most of his time in his room.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Maybe that's because you haven't taken the time to get to know him. Let's remedy
that, shall we?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: We don't need to remedy that.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Oh yeah, it'll be fun. [throws a tennis ball at Eddie's bedroom door]<br>
<br>
EDDIE: What was that?<br>
<br>
<a name="line04"></a> PHOEBE: Hi, um, I just thought that it would be fun if the three of
us had some beers and got to know each other.<br>
<br>
EDDIE: Yeah alright, that sounds alright.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Oh good, ok. Oh nooo, I have to go because I'm late for my um, Green Eggs and Ham
discussion group. Um tonight it's why he would not eat them on a train. Have fun bye.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: That was so lame.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: I know, yeah. Ok, talk to him. [leaves]<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: So, you uh, you think that Speed Racer guy gets a lot of tickets er?<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Chandler and Eddie's apartment. Chandler and Eddie are talking.]</b><br>
<br>
EDDIE: That's good, that's good. So, so, so who broke up with who?<br>
<br>
<a name="line05"></a> CHANDLER: What're you kidding? I broke up with her. She actually
thought that Sean Penn was the capital of Cambodia.<br>
<br>
EDDIE: That's good man, when everybody knows that the uh, the capital of Cambodia is uh...<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Well it's not Sean Penn.<br>
<br>
<a name="line06"></a> EDDIE: Not Sean Penn. Alright, I, I've got a funny one, alright. My
last girlfriend Tilly. Ok, we're eating breakfast, right, and I made all these pancakes,
there was like 50 pancakes right. And all of the sudden she turns to me, alright, and she
says, 'Eddie.' I say, 'yeah,' she says, 'Eddie, I don't want to see you anymore.' And it
was literally like she had reached into my chest, ripped out my heart, and smeared it all
over my life, ya know. And now there's like this incredible abyss, ya know, and I'm
falling and I keep falling and I don't think I'm ever gonna stop. [finishes laughing] That
uh, wasn't such a funny story, was it?<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Central Perk. Phoebe is singing. Monica, Richard, Ross, and Rachel are
listening.]</b><br>
<br>
<a name="line07"></a> PHOEBE: <i>And a crusty old man said I'll do what I can and the rest
of the rats played moroccas.</i> That's it, thanks, good night.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Phoebe's got another job, right?<br>
<br>
<a name="line08"></a> RACHEL: Great set tonight Phoebs.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: I know.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Well, we should probably get going.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Um, we should go too, I got patients at 8 in the moring.<br>
<br>
<a name="line09"></a> MONICA: Ya know, I was thinking. Ya know how we always stay at your
apartment? Well, I thought maybe tonight we'd stay at my place.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: I don't know, I don't have my jammies.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Well, maybe you don't need them.<br>
<br>
ROSS: My baby sister, ladies and gentlemen.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Shut up, I'm happy.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Oh, this is so nice. Alright I have to make a speech. I just wanna say that of all
the guys that Monica has been with, and that is a lot, I like you the best.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Oh, thank you Phoebs. That's very sweet.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Ok.<br>
<br>
<a name="line10"></a> RICHARD: Hear that? She likes me best, and apparently there've been
a lot.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Not a lot, Phoebe's kidding, Phoebe's crazy.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Phoebe's dead.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Chandler and Eddie's apartment. Chandler is there. There's a knock at the door.
He answers it to see a young woman holding a fishtank.]</b><br>
<br>
TILLY: Hi.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Hi.<br>
<br>
<a name="line11"></a> TILLY: I'm looking for Eddie Minowick.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Oh, uh, he's not here right now, uh, I'm Chandler, can I take a message, or, or
a fishtank?<br>
<br>
TILLY: Thanks.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Oh, oh, c'mon in.<br>
<br>
<a name="line12"></a> TILLY: I'm Tilly.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Oh.<br>
<br>
TILLY: I gather by that oh that he told you about me.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Oh yeah, your uh, name came up in a uh, conversation that terrified me to my
very soul.<br>
<br>
<a name="line13"></a> TILLY: He's kind of intense huh?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Yes. Hey, can I ask you, is Eddie a little...<br>
<br>
EDDIE: [walks around corner] A little what?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Bit country? C'mon in here you roomie.<br>
<br>
EDDIE: Hello Tilly.<br>
<br>
TILLY: Eddie, I just came by to drop off your tank.<br>
<br>
EDDIE: That's very thoughtful of you. It's very thougtful.<br>
<br>
TILLY: Well, ok then. I'm gonna go. Bye.<br>
<br>
EDDIE: Bye-bye.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Bye.<br>
<br>
[Tilly leaves]<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: So, we gettin' a fish?<br>
<br>
EDDIE: You had sex with her didn't you?<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Central Perk. Joey enters with several magazines and runs up to Phoebe.]</b><br>
<br>
JOEY: Phoebs, check it out, check it out, check it out, check it out.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Oh, ooh, Soap Opera Digest, oh that's one of my favorite digests.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Page 42, page 42, page 42.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Ok, ok, ok. Ooh, hey 'new doc on the block, Days of Our Lives' Joey Tribbiani.'
Ooh, cool picture.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Ooh, I look good.<br>
<br>
<a name="line14"></a> PHOEBE: Hey is this true, that you write a lot of your own lines?<br>
<br>
JOEY: Uh, well, kinda yeah. Like, remember last week when Alex was in the accident? Well
the line in the script was, 'If we don't get this woman to a hospital, she's going to
die.' But I made it, ' If this woman doesn't get to a hospital, she's not gonna live.'<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Ohh, ok, I see what you did there. Aren't you afraid though, that the writers are
gonna be kinda mad when they read this?<br>
<br>
JOEY: Huh? Never really thought about the writers. The scripts just kinda come to my
house. But you know what? This makes me look good, which makes the show look good, which
makes the writers look good so how could they be mad about that?<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: At a writer's desk. The writer is working on a script for Days of Our Lives.]</b><br>
<br>
WRITER: Makes up most of his lines. Son-of-a-. Yeah, well, write this jerkweed.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Joey's apartment. The next script is being delivered.]</b><br>
<br>
JOEY: I fall down an elevator shaft? What the hell does this mean, I fall down an elevator
shaft?<br>
<br>
DELIVERY GUY: Uhh, I don't know, I just bring the scripts.<br>
<br>
JOEY: They can't kill me, I'm Francesca's long lost son.<br>
<br>
<a name="line15"></a> DELIVERY GUY: Right. Could you sign this?<br>
<br>
JOEY: No. No way, I'm not signing that.<br>
<br>
DELIVERY GUY: I don't think that's gonna affect the plot of the show.<br>
<br>
JOEY: How can they do this to me?<br>
<br>
DELIVERY GUY: Er, uh, I'm just gonna go. Sorry.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Monica, Richard, Ross, and Rachel are
returning.]</b><br>
<br>
<a name="line16"></a> MONICA: Well it wasn't that many guys. I mean, if you consider how
many guys there actually are, it's a very small percentage.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Hey, it's not that big a deal, I was just curious.<br>
<br>
ROSS: G'night.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Night Richard. Good luck Mon.<br>
<br>
<a name="line17"></a> MONICA: Alright, before I tell you, uh, why don't you tell me how
many women you've been with.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Two.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Two? TWO? How is that possible? I mean, have you seen you?<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Well, I mean what can I say? I, I was married to Barbara for 30 years. She was my
high school sweetheart, now you, that's two.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Two it is. Ok, time for bed, I'm gonna go brush my teeth. [goes in the bathroom]<br>
<br>
<a name="line18"></a> RICHARD: Woah, woah, no wait a minute now. C'mon it's your turn. Oh
c'mon. Ya know, I don't need the actual number, just a ballpark.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Ok, it is definitely less than a ballpark.<br>
<br>
[Rachel's bedroom]<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Wow, I am so glad I'm not Monica right now.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Tell me about it. So what, what's your magic number?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Uhhhooo.<br>
<br>
<a name="line19"></a> ROSS: C'mon, you know everyone I've been with. All, both of them.<br>
<br>
<a name="line20"></a> RACHEL: Well, there's you.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Better not be doin' these in order.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Ok, uh, Billy Dreskin, Pete Carney, Barry, and uh, oh, Paolo.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Oh yes, the weenie from Torrini.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Oh honey, are you jealous of Paolo? Oh, c'mon, I'm so much happier with you than I
ever was with him.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Really?<br>
<br>
<a name="line21"></a> RACHEL: Oh please. That Paolo thing was barely a relationship. All
it really was was just, ya know, meaningless animal sex. Ok, ya know, that sounded soooo
much better in my head.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Chandler and Eddie's apartment.]</b><br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Eddie, I didn't sleep with your ex-girlfriend.<br>
<br>
EDDIE: That's very interesting, ya know, 'cause that's exactly what someone who slept with
her would say.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: This is nuts. This is crazy. She came over for like two minutes, dropped off a
fish tank, and left, end of story.<br>
<br>
EDDIE: Where's Buddy?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Buddy?<br>
<br>
EDDIE: My fish, Buddy.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: There was no fish when she dropped it off.<br>
<br>
EDDIE: Oh, this is, this is unbelievable. I mean, first you sleep with my ex-girlfriend
then you insult my inteligenct by lying about it and then you kill my fish, my Buddy?<br>
<br>
<a name="line22"></a> CHANDLER: Hey I didn't kill your fish. Look Eddie...[puts his hand
on Eddie's shoulder] Would you look at what I'm doin' here. That can't be smart. So we're
just gonna take this guy right off ya and put him here in Mr. Pocket. Tangellon? [picks up
the fruit an tosses it to Eddie, it hits Eddie in the chest and falls]<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Monica and Richard are in Monica's bedroom.]</b><br>
<br>
RICHARD: That's it? That's the giant number you were afraid to tell me?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Well yeah.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Well, that's not bad at all. I mean, you had me thinkin it was like a fleet.<br>
<br>
MONICA: You really ok with it?<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Oh honey, I'm fine.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Oh, yay. Ok about that two.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: What? Alright, what about my two?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Well, it just seems like a really small number.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Right, and...<br>
<br>
MONICA: And, well, don't you have a lot of wild oats to sew? Or is that what you're doing
with me? Oh my God, am I an oat?<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Honey, you are not an oat. I, I mean I don't know, I, I guess I'm just not an oat
guy. I've only slept with women I've been in love with.<br>
<br>
MONICA: But you've only slept with two people.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Right.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Wow. Oh wow. You know I love you too, right.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Now I do. [they kiss and fall to the bed]<br>
<br>
[Ross and Rachel are in Rachel's bedroom]<br>
<br>
<a name="line23"></a> RACHEL: Ross, Ross, please listen to me. Ross, you are so much
better for me than Paolo ever was. I mean you care about me, you're loving, you make me
laugh.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Oh, hey, if I make you laugh, here's an idea, why don't you invite Paulo over and
have a little romp in the sack and I'll just stand in the corner and tell knock-knock
jokes.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: God, Ross, look, what you and I have is special, all Paolo and I ever had was...<br>
<br>
<a name="line24"></a> ROSS: Animal sex, animal sex? So what're you saying, I mean, you're
saying that like, there's nothing between us animal at all. I mean there's not even like,
uhm, a little animal, not even, not even like, like chipmunk sex?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Ok, Ross, try to hear me. Ok, I, hey, I'm not gonna lie to you. Ok, it was good
with Paolo.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Knock-knock.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: But, what you and I have is so much better. Ok, we have tenderness, we have
intimacy, we connect. Ya know, I swear, this is the best I have ever had.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Until now. [jumps on Rachel on the bed]<br>
<br>
[later in the bathroom Monica is looking in the drawer, Rachel runs up]<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Oh, hi.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Hi. Richard just told me he loves me.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Oh my God, honey that's great.<br>
<br>
MONICA: I know. I just can't find...<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Oh they're in the top drawer. Hurry.<br>
<br>
MONICA: You need one too?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Ooooh yeah.<br>
<br>
[they pull out the box of condoms but there's only one left]<br>
<br>
MONICA: There's only one.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Monica.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Hi. Uh, we'll be right there, we're just trying to decide something. [shuts the
bathroom door]<br>
<br>
ROSS: [comes out of the bedroom] Rachel. [growls then sees Richard standing there] Hey.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Hey. They're just trying to decide somehting.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Good, good, good. So, is uh, was your moustache, did, used to be different?<br>
<br>
RICHARD: No.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Oh. How do you uh, ya know, keep it so neat?<br>
<br>
RICHARD: I have a little comb.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Oh. And what do you call that?<br>
<br>
RICHARD: A moustache comb.<br>
<br>
<a name="line25"></a> RACHEL: Ok, I, I will do your laundry for one month.<br>
<br>
MONICA: No.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Ok, ok, ok, I will, I will, I, hey, I will clean the apartment for two months.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Alright, I tell you what, I'll give this to you now if you can tell me where we
keep the dustpan.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Agghhh.<br>
<br>
ROSS: So were you in Nam?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Rock-paper-scissors?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Yeah.<br>
<br>
RACHEL and MONICA: One two three. [Rachel picks rock, Monica picks scissors]<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Yeesss.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Fine, go have sex.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: No. You have got it completely wrong. John Savage was deerhunter, no legs, John
Voit was coming home, couldn't feel his legs.<br>
<br>
ROSS: No, no way. You've got it totally the other way around my friend. John Voit was...<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Honey.<br>
<br>
ROSS: What, what oh....[Ross and Rachel go into her room]<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Shall we?<br>
<br>
<a name="line26"></a> MONICA: It's not gonna happen. They're doing it tonight, we can do
it tomorrow.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Uh, in the future, if I could see the schedule beforehand...<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. All but Joey are present.]</b><br>
<br>
CHANDLER: So, when I woke up this morning, he'd stolen all the insoles out of my shoes.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Why?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Because he thinks I slept with his ex-girlfriend and killed his fish.<br>
<br>
<a name="line27"></a> PHOEBE: Why would you kill his fish?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Because sometimes, Phoebe after you sleep with someone, you have to kill the
fish.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Chandler honey, I'm sorry. Ok, can we watch Joey's show now please? [they turn on
the TV]<br>
<br>
ROSS: Yeah.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Wait, he's not here yet.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: So, he's on the show, he knows what happens.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Yeah.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Alright.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Oh, I'm fine about my problem now, by the way.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Oh good.<br>
<br>
<i>DR. REMORE: Amber, I want you to know that I'll always be there for you, as a friend
and as your brother.<br>
<br>
AMBER: Oh Drake.<br>
<br>
DR HORTON: Hard day huh? First the medical award, this.<br>
<br>
DR. REMORE: Some guys are just lucky I guess.<br>
<br>
INTERCOM: Dr. Remore, report to first floor emergency, stat.<br>
<br>
DR. REMORE: Well then, uh, I uhh, guess that's me. Anyone else need to go on the elevator?
Dr. Horton, Dr. Wong?<br>
<br>
DR. HORTON: No, no, they only said you.<br>
<br>
DR. REMORE: Oh, ok. Alright.<br>
<br>
AMGER: I love you Drake.<br>
<br>
DR. REMORE: Yeah, whatever. Oh no.<br>
<br>
AMBER: Drake, look out.<br>
<br>
DR. REMORE: Ahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh.</i><br>
<br>
<a name="line28"></a> MONICA: Did they just kill off Joey?<br>
<br>
ROSS: No. [sound of Dr. Remore's body hitting the bottom of the shaft] Now maybe.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Joey's apartment. Everyone is outside knocking.]</b><br>
<br>
ROSS: C'mon.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Joey.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Open up. We want to talk to you.<br>
<br>
JOEY: I don't feel like talkin.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Oh c'mon Joey, we care about you.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: We're worried about you.<br>
<br>
MONICA: And some of us really have to pee.<br>
<br>
[Joey opens the door]<br>
<br>
MONICA: Sorry Joey [runs to the bathroom]<br>
<br>
JOEY: Hey.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Listen, sorry about your death, that really sucks.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: We came over as soon as we saw.<br>
<br>
ROSS: How could you not tell us?<br>
<br>
JOEY: I don't know, I was kinda hopin' no one would ever find out.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Well, maybe they can find a way to bring you back.<br>
<br>
<a name="line29"></a> JOEY: Naa, they said that when they found my body, my brain was so
smashed in that the only doctor that could have saved me was me. Supposed to be some kind
of irony or somethin.<br>
<br>
<a name="line30"></a> PHOEBE: But Joey, you're gonna be fine. You don't need that show, it
was just a dumb soap opera.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Phoebe, this was the greatest thing that ever happened to me.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Yes, I was going to incorporate that. Oh good, here's Monica, she'll have
something nice to say.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Um, I straightened out your shower curtain so you won't get mildew. What? To me
that's nice.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: It's gonna be ok. You know that?<br>
<br>
JOEY: No, I don't. It's like, ya know, you work your whole life for somethin' and you
think that when you get it it's never gonna be as good as you thought it would be. But
this so was. Ya know, it changed everything. Like the other day, I got this credit card
application, and I was pre- approved. Huh? I've never been pre-approved for anything in my
life.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: I'm sorry man.<br>
<br>
<a name="line31"></a> RACHEL: Yeah, Joey honey, I don't know if this'll mean anything to
you but you'll always be pre-approved with us.<br>
<br>
JOEY: No, that means nothin to me.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Chandler and Eddie's apartment.Chandler walks in to see Eddie holding a tray of
cookies.]</b><br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Uhhhaahh.<br>
<br>
<a name="line32"></a> EDDIE: Pecan sandy, just made em.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Yeah alright. What're these, raisins?<br>
<br>
EDDIE: Uh, sure, why not.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: [throws it across the room while Eddie's not looking] Listen Eddie, um, I've
been thinking about our current living situation and uh, why are you smiling?<br>
<br>
<a name="line33"></a> EDDIE: I got a little surprise, look. There's a new fishie. I named
him uh, Chandler, you know, after, after you.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: [looks in the fish bowl to see a fish cracker] Well that's not an, even a real
fish. No, that's a goldfish cracker.<br>
<br>
EDDIE: What's you point man?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Ok, good night. [walks towards his room] You big freak of nature.<br>
<br>
<font size="4"><b>CLOSING CREDITS</b></font><br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment.]</b><br>
<br>
[Ross comes out of Rachel's bedroom in her bathrobe and heads for the bathroom. On his way
back, Richard comes out of Monica's bedroom in her bathrobe.]<br>
<br>
ROSS: Hey.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Hey.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Hey.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Ohh, brisk tonight.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Oh man.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Let's never speak of this.<br>
<br>
ROSS: You got it. </font></p>

219<html>

<head>
<title>The One Where Eddie Won't Go</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="white" text="black" link="green" vlink="black" alink="yellow">

<h1 align="center">The One Where Eddie Won't Go</h1>

<hr align="center">
<font size="3"><i>

<p>Originally written by <b></b>.</i></font><br>
<font size="3"><i>Transcribed by <b>Joshua Hodge</b>.</i></font><br>
</p>

<hr>
<font size="3"><b>

<p align="left">[Scene: Chandler's bedroom. Chandler is sleeping and Eddie is there
watching him.]</b><br>
<br>
[Chandler wakes up]<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Hey Eddie. Daahh!! What're you doin' here?<br>
<br>
EDDIE: Nothin' roomie, just watchin' you sleep.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Why?<br>
<br>
EDDIE: Makes me feel um, peaceful, heh-heh, please.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: I can't sleep now.<br>
<br>
EDDIE: You want me to sing?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: No, look, that's it, it's over, I want you out, I want you out of the apartment
now.<br>
<br>
<a name="line01"></a> EDDIE: Woah, woah, woah, what're, what're you talkin' about man.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Hannibal Lecter...better roommate than you.<br>
<br>
<a name="line02"></a> EDDIE: No. See now I don't think you're being fair. I mean one night
you see me and you get scared, I mean, what about all the other nights when you don't see
me, huh? What about last night when you went and got a drink of water and I was nice
enough to hide behind the door, what's that about, huh?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: I didn't realize that.<br>
<br>
EDDIE: Yeah.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: GET OUT NOW!!<br>
<br>
EDDIE: Ok, you really want me out?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Yes please.<br>
<br>
<a name="line03"></a> EDDIE: Ok, then I want to hear you say it, I, I want to hear you say
you want me out.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: I want you out.<br>
<br>
EDDIE: No no no, I wanna hear it from your lips.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Where did you hear it from before?<br>
<br>
EDDIE: Oh, right, all right, you know what pallie I understand, consider me gone, you know
what, I'll be out by the time you get home from work tomorrow.<br>
<br>
[Eddie leaves the room and Chandler mouths &quot;Thank you&quot; to himself]<br>
<br>
EDDIE: I heard that.<br>
<br>
<font size="4"><b>OPENING TITLES</b></font> <br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Central Perk. Monica and Rachel are there, Joey enters wearing an old looking
hat.]</b><br>
<br>
JOEY: Hey.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Hey.<br>
<br>
<a name="line04"></a> RACHEL: Hey. Whe-ell, look at you, finally got that time machine
workin' huh?<br>
<br>
<a name="line05"></a> JOEY: Seriously, you like it? This guy was sellin' them on 8th
avenue and I looked at 'em and I though, you know what I don't have?<br>
<br>
MONICA: A mirror?<br>
<br>
JOEY: Fine, make fun. I think it's jaunty.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Wow, for a guy who's recently lost his job, you're in an awfully good mood.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Hey, I'll be alright. I mean it's not like I'm starting from sqare one. I was Dr.
Drake Remoray on <i>Days of Our Lives</i>. Heh? I mean that's gotta have some kind of
cache.<br>
<br>
<a name="line06"></a> MONICA: Cache? Jaunty?<br>
<br>
JOEY: Chandler gave me word of the day toilet paper. I'm gonna get some coffee.<br>
<br>
[Phoebe enters]<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Hey.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Hey.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Hey.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Oooh, so so so, did you read the book?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Oh my God, it was incredible.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Didn't it like totally speak to you?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Woah, woah, woah, what book is this?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Rachel you have to read this book. It's called <i>Be Your Own Windkeeper</i>. It's
about how women need to become more empowered.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Yeah and oh, and but there's, there's wind and the wind can make us Goddesses. But
you know who takes out wind? Men, they just take it.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Men just take out wind?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Ya-huh, all the time, cause they are the lightning bearers.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Wow.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Yeah.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Well that sounds kinda cool, kinda like <i>The Hobbit</i>.<br>
<br>
MONICA: It is nothing like the Hobbit. It's like reading about every relationship I've
ever had, except for Richard.<br>
<br>
<a name="line07"></a> PHOEBE: Oh yes, no, Richard would never steal your wind.<br>
<br>
MONICA: No.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: No, 'cause he's yummy.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Yes. But all the other ones.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Oh yes. Oh and, the part about how they're always like drinking from out pool of
inner power, but God forbid we should take a sip.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Anybody want a croan.<br>
<br>
<a name="line08"></a> PHOEBE: Ok, this is a typical lightning-bearer thing. Right there,
it's like, um, 'Hello, who wants one of my fallic shaped man cakes?'<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Estelle Leonard Talent Agency.Joey is there.]</b><br>
<br>
ESTELLE: Don't worry about it already. Things happen.<br>
<br>
JOEY: So, you're not mad at me for getting fired and everything?<br>
<br>
ESTELLE: Joey, look at me, look at me. Do I have lipstick on my teeth?<br>
<br>
JOEY: No, can we get back to me?<br>
<br>
ESTELLE: Look honey, people get fired left and right in this business. I already got you
an audition for <i>Another World</i>.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Alright. Cab driver number two?<br>
<br>
ESTELLE: You're welcome.<br>
<br>
JOEY: But I was Dr. Drake Remoray. How can I go from bein' a neurosurgeon to drivin' a
cab?<br>
<br>
ESTELLE: Things change, roll with em.<br>
<br>
JOEY: But this is a two line part, it's like takin' a step backwards. I'm not gonna do
this.<br>
<br>
ESTELLE: Joey, I'm gonna tell you the same thing I told Al Minser and his pyramid of dogs.
Take any job you can get and don't make on the floor.<br>
<br>
JOEY: I'm sorry. See ya.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Central Perk. Monica, Phoebe, and Rachel are there. Rachel has just finished
reading the book.]</b><br>
<br>
RACHEL: Oh, God, oh, God, I mean it's just so.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Isn't it.<br>
<br>
<a name="line09"></a> RACHEL: Uhh, I mean this is like reading about my own life. I mean
this book could have been called 'Be Your Own Windkeeper Rachel'.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: I don't think it would have sold a million copies but it would have made a nice
gift for you.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Hey you guys.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Hey.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Uh, sweetie we've gotta go.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: NO!<br>
<br>
ROSS: No?<br>
<br>
<a name="line10"></a> RACHEL: No, why do we always have to do everything according to your
time table?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Actually it's the movie theatre that has the time schedule. So you don't miss the
beginning.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: No, see this isn't about the movie theatre, this is about you stealing my wind.<br>
<br>
<a name="line11"></a> MONICA: You go girl. I can't pull that off can I?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Excuse me, your, your, your wind?<br>
<br>
<a name="line12"></a> RACHEL: Yes, my wind. How do you expect me to grow if you won't let
me blow?<br>
<br>
ROSS: You, you know I, I don't, have a- have a problem with that.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Ok, I just, I just really need to be with myself right now. I'm sorry.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Um-um, um-um.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: You're right, I don't have to apologize. Sorry. Damnit!<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Joey's apartment. Joey and Ross enter.]</b><br>
<br>
JOEY: What is it?<br>
<br>
<a name="line13"></a> ROSS: I, I don't know, it's got all this stuff about wind and trees
and there's some kind of sacred pool in it. I mean, I don't really get it but she's, she's
pretty upset about it.<br>
<br>
JOEY: See, this is why I don't date women who read. Uh-oh.<br>
<br>
<a name="line14"></a> ROSS: What, what's that?<br>
<br>
JOEY: It's my VISA bill. Envelope one of two. That can't be good.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Open it, open in.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Oh my God.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Woah.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Look at this, how did I spend so much money?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Uh Joey, that's just the minumum amount due, that's your total due.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Ahh.<br>
<br>
<a name="line15"></a> ROSS: What, woah, woah, $3500 at porcelain safari?<br>
<br>
JOEY: My animals. Hey the guy said they suited me, he spoke with an accent, I was all
confused. I don't know what I'm gonna do.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Well I guess you can start by drivin a cab on <i>Another World</i>.<br>
<br>
JOEY: What?<br>
<br>
ROSS: That audition.<br>
<br>
JOEY: That's a two line part.<br>
<br>
<a name="line16"></a> ROSS: Joey, you owe $1100 at I Love Lucite.<br>
<br>
JOEY: So what.<br>
<br>
ROSS: So suck it up man, it's a job, it's money.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Hey, look, I don't need you getting all judgemental and condescending and pedantic.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Toilet paper?<br>
<br>
JOEY: Yeah.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Look, I'm not being any of those things, ok, I'm just being realistic.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Well knock it off, you're supposed to be my friend.<br>
<br>
ROSS: I am your friend.<br>
<br>
<a name="line17"></a> JOEY: Well then tell me things like, 'Joey you'll be fine,' and,
'Hang in there,' and, and, 'Somethin' big's fonna come along, I know it.'<br>
<br>
ROSS: But I don't know it. What I do know is that you owe $2300 at Isn't it Chromantic.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Hey Ross, I'm aware of what I owe.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Ok, well then get some sense. I mean it took you what, 10 years to get that job, who
knows how long it's gonna be till you get another.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Look, I don't wanna hear this right now.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Huh, I'm just saying...<br>
<br>
JOEY: Well don't just say.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Ya know, maybe, maybe I should just go.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Ok.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Ok. I'll see ya later. Just think about it, ok.<br>
<br>
JOEY: I don't need to think about it. I was Dr. Drake Remoray. That was huge. Big things
are gonna happen, you'll see. Ross, you still there?<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Chandler's apartment. Chandler peeks in the door. He doesn't see Eddie so he
enters, breathing a sigh of relief. Eddie pops up from behind the bar.]</b><br>
<br>
EDDIE: Hey pal.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Ahhhh-gaaaahhh. Eddie what're you still doin' here?<br>
<br>
EDDIE: Ah, just some basic dehydrating of a few fruits and vegetables. MAN ALIVE this
thing's fantastic!<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Look Eddie, aren't you forgetting anything?<br>
<br>
<a name="line18"></a> EDDIE: Oh yeah, that's right, look I got us a new goldfish. He's a
lot fiestier that the last one.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Maybe 'cause the last one was made by Pepperidge Farm. Look Eddie, isn't there
something else you're supposed to be doing right now?<br>
<br>
EDDIE: Well, not unless it's got something to do with dehydrating my man because right now
I'm a dehydrating maniac!<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Look you have to help me out here. I thought we had a deal. I thought by the
time...<br>
<br>
<a name="line19"></a> EDDIE: Ah-ah-ah, you know what that is?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Your last roommate's kidney?<br>
<br>
EDDIE: That's a tomato. This one definitely goes in the display.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Central Perk. Joey goes up to the bar to order.]</b><br>
<br>
JOEY: Hey Gunther, let me get a lemonade to go.<br>
<br>
GUNTHER: Lemonade? You ok man?<br>
<br>
JOEY: Ah, it's career stuff. I don't know if you heard but they killed off my character on
the show.<br>
<br>
GUNTHER: Oh, that's too bad. How'd they do it?<br>
<br>
JOEY: I fell down an elevator shaft.<br>
<br>
GUNTHER: That sucks. I was buried in an avalanche.<br>
<br>
JOEY: What?<br>
<br>
GUNTHER: I used to be Bryce on <i>All My Children</i>.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Chandler is sleeping on the couch. Monica walks
by and starts watching him.]</b><br>
<br>
[Chandler wakes up]<br>
<br>
<a name="line20"></a> CHANDLER: Daaahhhh!<br>
<br>
MONICA: Aaahhhhhhh! Aaahhhh!<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Why must everybody watch me sleep? There'll be no more watching me sleep, no
more watching.<br>
<br>
MONICA: I wa-<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Uuuh.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Chandler's apartment. Chandler is returning from Monica and Rachel's with his
bedding. Eddie is standing at the bar with his dehydrator and loads of fruit.]</b><br>
<br>
<a name="line21"></a> EDDIE: Hey man, check it out, I got some great stuff to dehydrate
here. I got some grapes, got some apricots, I thought it would be really cool to see what
happens with these water balloons.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Get out. Get out, get out, get out, get out, get out, get out.<br>
<br>
EDDIE: What?<br>
<br>
<a name="line22"></a> CHANDLER: You, move out. Take your fruit, your stupid small fruit
and GET OUT!<br>
<br>
EDDIE: You, you want, you want me to move out?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Uh-huh.<br>
<br>
EDDIE: I uh, I gotta tell you man, I mean, that's uh, it's kinda out of the blue, I mean
don't you think?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: This is not out of the blue, this is smack dab in the middle of the blue.<br>
<br>
EDDIE: Ohhhh. Relax, take it easy buddy. Tell me twice, you want me to go? Alright,
alright, guess I'll be back for my stuff. [walks out the door and after a pause comes back
in] But if you think for one second I'm leaving you alone with my fish, you're insane
Jack!<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: You want some help.<br>
<br>
EDDIE: No help required Chico. [reaches into the tank and grabs the fish and puts it in
his pocket]<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Joey is at the cab driver interview.]</b><br>
<br>
JOEY: <i>All the way to the airport huh? You know that's over 30 miles, that's gonna cost
you about so bucks.</i><br>
<br>
CASTING GUY: Excuse me, that's 50 bucks.<br>
<br>
JOEY: What?<br>
<br>
CASTING GUY: Five oh dollars.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Ohh, you know what it is? It's smudgy 'cause they're fax pages. Now when I was on <i>Days
of Our Lives</i> as Dr. Drake Remoray, they'd send over the whole script on real paper and
everything. <br>
<br>
CASTING GUY: That's great.<br>
<br>
<a name="line23"></a> JOEY: And, and just so you know, if you wanted to expand this scene
like, like have the cab crash or somethin', I could attend to the victims 'cause I have a
background in medical acting.<br>
<br>
<a name="line24"></a> CASTING GUY: Ok, listen, thanks for coming in.<br>
<br>
JOEY: No no, uh, don't thank me for comin' in. Uh, at least let me finish. <i>Uh, we could
take the expressway but uh, this time of day you're better off taking the budge.</i> You
were goin' for the word bridge there weren't ya. I'll have a good day. [gets up and
leaves]<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Monica, Rachel, and Phoebe are sitting around
the coffee table.]</b><br>
<br>
<a name="line25"></a> PHOEBE: Ok, question number 28, have you ever allowed a lighning
bearer to take your wind? I would have to say no.<br>
<br>
MONICA: And I would have to say pah-huh.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: What?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Do you not remember the puppet guy?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Yeah you like totally let him wash his feet in the pool of your inner power.<br>
<br>
MONICA: And his puppet too.<br>
<br>
<a name="line26"></a> PHOEBE: Yeah ok, well at least I didn't let some guy into the forest
of my righteous truth on the first date.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Who?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Paul.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Oh.<br>
<br>
<a name="line27"></a> RACHEL: Ok, ok, ok, moving on, moving on, next question. Ok number
29, have you ever betrayed another goddess for a lightning bearer? Ok, number 30.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Woah, woah, woah, let's go back to 29.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Not uh, not to my recollection.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Huuh, alright, Danny Arshak, ninth grade. Oh, c'mon Rach, you know the bottle was
totally pointing at me.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Only 'cause you took up half the circle.<br>
<br>
<a name="line28"></a> PHOEBE: Listen to you two. It's so sad. Looks like I'm gonna be
going to the goddess meetings alone.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Well not when they find out you slept with Jason Hurley an hour after he broke up
with Monica.<br>
<br>
MONICA: One hour? You are such a leaf blower.<br>
<br>
[Monica goes into her room and slams the door. Rachel does the same. Phoebe, without a
door to slam, opens a small chest and slams the lid.]<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Joey's apartment. Joey is watching movers take all his stuff away.]</b><br>
<br>
JOEY: Oh hey uh, be careful with that 3-D last supper, Judas is a little loose.<br>
<br>
ROSS: [enters] Oh my God, what's goin' on?<br>
<br>
JOEY: They're takin all my stuff back. I guess you were right.<br>
<br>
<a name="line29"></a> ROSS: No look I wasn''t right, that's what I came here to tell you.
I was totally hung up on, on my own stuff. Listen, I'm someone who needs the whole
security thing, ya know. To know exactly where my next paycheck is coming from buy you,
you don't need that and that's amazing to me. I could never do what you do Joey.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Thanks Ross.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Yeah. And you should hold out for something bigger. I can't tell you how much
respect I have for you not going to that stupid cab driver audition.<br>
<br>
JOEY: I went.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Great, how did it go?<br>
<br>
JOEY: I didn't get it.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Good for you.<br>
<br>
JOEY: What?<br>
<br>
ROSS: You're livin' the dream.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Huh?<br>
<br>
ROSS: All right then.<br>
<br>
JOEY: [movers removing a glass parrot] Oh, not my parrot.<br>
<br>
ROSS: What?<br>
<br>
JOEY: I can't watch this.<br>
<br>
ROSS: [approaching the mover holding the parrot] Hey hold on, hold on. How much for the
uh, how much to save the bird?<br>
<br>
MOVER: 1200.<br>
<br>
<a name="line39"></a> ROSS: Dollars? You spent $1200 dollars on a plastic bird?<br>
<br>
JOEY: Uhhh, I was an impulse buyer, near the register.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Go ahead, go ahead with the bird. Ok, do you have anything for around 200?<br>
<br>
MOVER: Uh, the dog. [points to a big poecelain greyhound]<br>
<br>
ROSS: Huh.<br>
<br>
MOVER: Yeah.<br>
<br>
ROSS: I'll take it. My gift to you man.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Thanks Ross. I really like that bird though...I'll take the dog though.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Central Perk. Monica and Phoebe are sitting ignoring each other. Rachel walks
up with two pieces of cake.]</b><br>
<br>
RACHEL: Here are your cakes.<br>
<br>
MONICA: We didn't order cake.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: No, I know, they're from me. Look you guys this is not good. I mean we have enough
trouble with guys stealing our wind without taking it from each other.<br>
<br>
MONICA: You're right.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: You know.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: I love you goddesses. I don't ever want to suck your wind again.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Thank you. So are we good?<br>
<br>
MONICA: We're good.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: We're good?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Yeah.<br>
<br>
<a name="line30"></a> RACHEL: Ok, let me take these cakes back 'cause they're gonna take
that out of my paycheck.<br>
<br>
<a name="line31"></a> CHANDLER: [enters] Ding dong, the psycho's gone.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Are you sure this time?<br>
<br>
<a name="line32"></a> CHANDLER: Yes, yes I actually saw him leave. I mean that guy is
standing in the window holding a human head. He is STANDING IN THE WINDOW HOLDING A HUMAN
HEAD!<br>
<br>
<a name="line33"></a> EDDIE: [enters] Check it out man, I tore it off some mannaquin in
the alley behind Macy's.<br>
<br>
MONICA: There is no alley behind Macy's.<br>
<br>
EDDIE: So I got it in the junior miss department, big diff. Anyway check it out man, it's
gonna make a hell of a conversation piece at out next cocktail party, huh pal?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Our next cocktail party?<br>
<br>
EDDIE: Yeah, you know, put chips in it, we'll make like a chip chick.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Eddie, do you remember yesterday?<br>
<br>
EDDIE: Uh yes, I think I vaguely recall it.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Do you remember talking to me yesterday?<br>
<br>
EDDIE: Uh, yes.<br>
<br>
<a name="line34"></a> CHANDLER: So what happened?<br>
<br>
EDDIE: We took a road trip to Las Vegas man.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Oh sweet Moses.<br>
<br>
MONICA: So on this road trip, did you guys win any money?<br>
<br>
EDDIE: Naah, I crapped out, but Mr. 21 over here he cleans up, 300 bucks, check it out he
buys me these new shoes, sweet huh?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Nice.<br>
<br>
EDDIE: Yeah. Well see ya upstairs. See ya pals.<br>
<br>
<a name="line35"></a> PHOEBE: Is anyone else starting to really like him?<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Hallway outside Chandler and Joey's apartment. Eddie walks up.]</b><br>
<br>
[Eddie tries his key and it won't work. He knocks and Chandler answers the door. He's got
the door chained.]<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: May I help you?<br>
<br>
EDDIE: Why doesn't my key work and what's all my stuff doin' downstairs?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Well, I'm, I'm sorry...[Eddie forces his head in the door] Ahhh. Have we met?<br>
<br>
EDDIE: It's Eddie you freak, your roommate.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: I, I'm sorry, I uh [unchains the door and opens it all the way] I already have a
roommate. [Joey turns around in the leather recliner]<br>
<br>
JOEY: Hello.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Yeah, he's lived here for years, I don't, I don't know what you're talking about
man.<br>
<br>
EDDIE: No he, he moved out and I moved in.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Well I, I think we'd remember something like that.<br>
<br>
JOEY: I know I would.<br>
<br>
EDDIE: Well that's uh, that's a good point. Um ok, well, uh, I guess I got the wrong
apartment then. I, I'm, look, I'm, ya know, I'm sorry, I'm terriably sorry.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Hey no problem.<br>
<br>
<a name="line38"></a> CHANDLER: See ya. [shuts the door] Goodbuy you fruit drying
psychopath. So you want me to help you unpack your stuff?<br>
<br>
JOEY: Na, na I'm ok. Oh and uh, just so you know, I'm not movin' back in 'cause I have to.
Well, I mean, I do have to. It's just that that place wasn't really, I mean, this is...<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Welcome home man. [they hug and jump around]<br>
<br>
JOEY: A little foos?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Absolutely.<br>
<br>
JOEY: What happened to the foosball?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Ah that's a cantelope.<br>
<br>
<font size="4"><b>CLOSING CREDITS</b></font> <br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's apartment. They are hauling out the porcelain dog from
Joey's room. Chandler is holding the dog by the rear in a rather interesting position.]</b><br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Hey look, are we gonna have to bring this out every time Ross comes over?<br>
<br>
JOEY: He paid a lot of money for it.<br>
<br>
<a name="line36"></a> CHANDLER: I'm gonna hold him a different way. Look I don't
understand, if you hated it so much, why did you buy it in the first place?<br>
<br>
JOEY: Well, I had a whole ceramic zoo thing goin' over there but now, without the other
ones, it just looks tacky.<br>
<br>
<a name="line37"></a> CHANDLER: So is he housetrained or is he gonna leave little bathroom
tiles all over the place? Stay. Good, STAY! Good fake dog.</font></p>

<p align="center"><strong><font size="3">END</font></strong></p>

220<html>

<head>
<title>The One Where Old Yeller Dies</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="white" text="black" link="green" vlink="black" alink="yellow">

<h1 align="center">The One Where Old Yeller Dies</h1>

<hr align="center">
<font size="3"><i>

<p>Originally written by <b></b>.</i></font><br>
<font size="3"><i>Transcribed by <b>Joshua Hodge</b>.</i></font><br>
</p>

<hr>
<font size="3"><b>

<p align="left">[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Phoebe enters to see Monica,
Richard, Ross, and Rachel tearfully watching TV.]</b><br>
<br>
<a name="line01"></a> PHOEBE: Hey. Watcha guys doin?<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Monica's making us watch <i>Old Yeller</i>.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Why are you guys so upset? It's <i>Old Yeller</i>, it's a happy movie.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: What?<br>
<br>
ROSS: What're you talkin' about?<br>
<br>
<a name="line02"></a> PHOEBE: C'mon, happy family gets a dog, frontier fun.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Yeah but Phoebs, what about the end?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: What when Yeller saves saves the family from the wolf and everyone's happy?<br>
<br>
<a name="line03"></a> RACHEL: That's not the end.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Yu-huh. That's when my mother would shut off the TV and say 'The end'.<br>
<br>
MONICA: What about the part where he has rabies?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: He doesn't have rabies, he has babies. That's what my mom said.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Uh, Phoebe, I don't think your mom would want you to see what's about to happen.<br>
<br>
<a name="line04"></a> PHOEBE: What, what's about to happen? [starts watching] I've never
seen this part before. Hey, Travis, watcha doin' with that gun? Oh no, no no Travis, put
down the gun. No no no no, he he's your buddy, he's your Yeller, no, no no, the end, THE
END. [hear the gunshot from the TV] <br>
<b>[Scene:Monica and Rachel's apartment. Richard is on the balcony smoking and Monica is
on the phone.]</b><br>
<br>
<a name="line05"></a> MONICA: Hey, have you guys eaten, because uh, Richard and I just
finished and we've got leftovers... Chicken and potatoes... What am I wearing?...Actually,
nothing but rubber gloves.<br>
<br>
[Chandler and Joey come sprinting in]<br>
<br>
JOEY: Ya know, one of these times you're gonna really be naked and we're not gonna come
over.<br>
<br>
<a name="line06"></a> MONICA: Alright, I've got a leg, three breasts and a wing.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Well, how do you find clothes that fit?<br>
<br>
<a name="line07"></a> JOEY: Oh, hey, Monica, we've got a question.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Alright, for the bizillionth time, yes I see other women in shower at the gym, and
no I don't look.<br>
<br>
JOEY: No, not that one. We're trying to figure out who to bring to the Knicks game
tonight, we have an extra ticket.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Yeah, Ross can't go so it's between my friend Eric Prower who has breath issues
and Dan with the poking. [starts poking Monica in the shoulder] 'Did you see that play? Do
you want some more beer? Is that Spike Lee?'<br>
<br>
<a name="line08"></a> MONICA: Ok. [Richard walks in] Hey, why don't you ask Richard?<br>
<br>
JOEY: Ok, uh, hey Richard, if you had an extra ticket to the Knicks game and you had to
choose between a friend who smells and one who bruises you who would you pick?<br>
<br>
<a name="line09"></a> RICHARD: Wow. Well being a huge Knicks fan myself, I think you
should take someone who's a huge Knicks fan.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Ok, that's Eric.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Glad to be of help. Matches. [walks out to the balcony]<br>
<br>
MONICA: I meant, why don't you take Richard to the game? What?<br>
<br>
JOEY: I don't know.<br>
<br>
MONICA: C'mon. Keeps his fingers to himself and he's always minty fresh.<br>
<br>
<a name="line10"></a> CHANDLER: I don't know, Richard's really nice and everything, uh,
it's just that we don't know him really well, ya know, and plus he's, ya know, old [Monica
gives him a glare] -er than some people, but, uh, younger than some buildings.<br>
<br>
MONICA: So what, he's a little older, big deal, I mean he's important to me. Ya know if
you ask him, he might take you on his Jag. [walks off]<br>
<br>

so. Ok, here we go. [starts the tape again]<br>

moment ago. Oh no, my old friend Bert is lost.</i><br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Oh, I'm so glad you're here.</font></p>

<p align="center"><strong><font size="3">END</font></strong></p>

221<html>

<head>
<title>The One With the Two Bullies</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="white" text="black" link="green" vlink="black" alink="yellow">

<h1 align="center">The One With the Two Bullies</h1>

<hr align="center">
<font size="3"><b>

<p><em>Originally written by Sebastian Jones and Brian Buckner.</b></font><br>
<font size="3"><b>Transcribed by Joshua Hodge.</em></b></font><br>
</p>

<hr>
<font size="3"><b>

<p align="left">[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Everyone is there. Monica is
watching stock prices on a business channel.]</b><br>
<br>
<a name="line01"></a> JOEY: Hey Monica, why are we watchin' the business channel?<br>
<br>
MONICA: 'Cause I was going by it the other day and I saw that there was a stock with my
initials, MEG, on it and, well, sometimes I have to watch for two or three hours before it
comes up again but when it does, it's pretty exciting.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Ok honey, you really need a job.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Mon, speaking of which, dad says he knows someone you can call for an interview.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Really.<br>
<br>
<a name="line02"></a> PHOEBE: Ok, right there. That, that's the third sign today. Right
there.<br>
<br>
ROSS: On behalf of everyone, I'd just like to say behuh.<br>
<br>
<a name="line03"></a> PHOEBE: No, 'cause you just said dad and everywhere I go today I
keep getting signs telling me to go see my father. Like when I was walking over here and I
passed a buffet...which is my father's last name.<br>
<br>
EVERYONE: Ahh.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: And they were serving franks which is his first name minus the s at the end. And
there was a rotisserie with spinning chicken.<br>
<br>
MONICA: His indian name?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: No because I chickened out the last time when I tried to meet him. So I mean
coincidences? I don't think so.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Freakish.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Wow.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Freaky.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Weird, weird.<br>
<br>
<a name="line04"></a> RACHEL: Ok, so uh, who wants the last hamburger?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Oh, alright, that's it, now I have to go see him.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Why?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Hamburger. McDonald's. Old MacDonald had a farm, my dad is a pharmacist.<br>
<br>
<font size="4"><b>OPENING TITLES</b></font><br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Central Perk. Chandler and Ross enter in sweats carrying rackets.]</b><br>
<br>
<a name="line05"></a> CHANDLER: Man, I am so beat.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Oh yeah.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Hey, you just wanna forget about raquetball and hang out here?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Yeah alright.<br>
<br>
[they sit at the couch]<br>
<br>
<a name="line06"></a> BIG BULLY: [walks back from the counter] Hey you're in our seats.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Oh, sorry we didn't know.<br>
<br>
LITTLE BULLY: [walks back from the counter] Hey, we were sitting there.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Ok, there is one more way to say it, who knows it?<br>
<br>
<a name="line07"></a> LITTLE BULLY: Is that supposed to be funny?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: No actually, I was just going for colorful.<br>
<br>
BIG BULLY: What's with this guy?<br>
<br>
LITTLE BULLY: What's with you?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Uh, nothing, nothing's with him. Enjoy your coffee.<br>
<br>
<a name="line08"></a> [as they're walking off, little bully grabs Chandlers hat from
behind and puts it on himself]<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: What just happened?<br>
<br>
LITTLE BULLY: I just took your hat. See, I can be funny too. My, my joke is that I, I took
your hat.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: That, that is funny. Can I have it back?<br>
<br>
LITTLE BULLY: No.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: No?<br>
<br>
BIG BULLY: No.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Ok, ok, you know what? I think you're very funny. Kudos on that hat joke. But, come
on guy just, just give him back the hat.<br>
<br>
BIG BULLY: Why should we?<br>
<br>
ROSS: <a name="line09"></a>Because it's a special hat. [Chandler looks at Ross funny] See
he bought it 'cause he was feeling really down one day so he got the hat to cheer himself
up, ya know. Now Chandler...<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Stop talking, stop talking now. Let me just get this straight. You're actually
stealing my hat?<br>
<br>
BIG BULLY: You got a problem with that?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: No, just wanna make sure we're on the same page.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Joey and Rachel are sitting there and Monica
walks in.]</b><br>
<br>
RACHEL: Hey, how'd the interview go?<br>
<br>
MONICA: It bit. It was a 50's theme restraunt. I have to cook in a costume and dance on
the counter. <a name="line10"></a>I mean I was a chef at Cafe des Artistes. I mean how
could I take a job where I have to make something called Laverne and Curly Fries?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: So don't do it.<br>
<br>
MONICA: How can I not do it? I have $127 in the bank.<br>
<br>
<a name="line11"></a> JOEY: Monica, relax, go get a beer.<br>
<br>
MONICA: I don't want a beer.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Who said it was for you?<br>
<br>
ROSS and CHANDLER: [both enter looking down] Hhhiiii.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: What's the matter with you?<br>
<br>
<a name="line12"></a> CHANDLER: The mean guys at the coffee house took my hat.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Noo.<br>
<br>
JOEY: You're kiddin'.<br>
<br>
ROSS: It was ridiculous. Ya know, these guys, they were bullies, actual bullies, ya know. <a
name="line13"></a> We're grown ups, this kinda stuff isn't supposed to happen anymore.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Oohhh.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Hi.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Hi. [Ross turns to Rachel and they hug]<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Ohhh [turns as if to hug someone] Oh no, wait a minute, I have no one.<br>
<br>
<a name="line42"></a> JOEY: Hey, woah, let's go down there and get your hat back.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Na, forget it, it's probably stripped and sold for parts by now.<br>
<br>
MONICA: [seeing TV] Hey, I went up.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: What?<br>
<br>
MONICA: My stock, MEG, it went up 2 points. Hey guys, do you realize that if I had
invested my $127 in myself yesterday that I'd like have...a lot more than that today. Ya
know what, I'm gonna do it.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Do what?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Put all my money in me.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Monica, what are you talking about? You don't know the first thing about the stock
market.<br>
<br>
<a name="line14"></a> MONICA: What's to know? Buy sell, high low, bears bulls...[on the
phone] Yes Manhattan...yeah telephone number of the stock...selling store.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Phoebe's dad's house. Phoebe pulls up in the cab with Rachel and Joey in the
back.]</b><br>
<br>
[Phoebe slams on the breaks. Joey and Rachel are thrown forward into the pillows in their
laps.]<br>
<br>
JOEY: See, didn't I tell ya these pillows would be a good idea?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Oh God, here we go. For the first time in my life I'm gonna say 'Hi birthfather'.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: We love you, we're here for you.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Yeah good luck, good luck.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Thanks. [gets out of the cab]<br>
<br>
<a name="line15"></a> JOEY: Hey Rach, you uh, you want some sandwich?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Ohh, what is in that?<br>
<br>
JOEY: Olive loaf and ham spread, no mayo.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: No no, 'cause mayo, that would make it gross.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: [a little dog starts attacking her leg] Hey, hey, no, oh oh.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Run Phoebe run.<br>
<br>
<a name="line16"></a> PHOEBE: No no no, doggie please. Oh, I do so wanna love all animals,
please no.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Get him a bone, get a bone. You gotta bone?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Are you kidding me?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Look kibbles, bits. Oh God, alright, get the hell off my leg you yippity piece of
crap. [Flings the dog off and jumps in the cab. The dog keeps jumping up to the window.]
Ok, alright, we have a problem.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Well why don't you just reach out and take his trampoline.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Ok, here, I know what we can do. [grabs Joey's sadwich and throws it out the
window]<br>
<br>
JOEY: Hey, hey, hey no.<br>
<br>
<a name="line17"></a> RACHEL: Ok, doggie get the- aahhh. Ok go get the sandwich, get the
sandwich doggie. [dog ignores the sandwich] Good doggie get the sandwich, get the...ok,
Joey, the dog will lick himself but he will not touch your sandwich, what does that say?<br>
<br>
JOEY: Well if he's not gonna eat it, I will.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Are you crazy?<br>
<br>
JOEY: Phoebs, he's just a little dog. [turns back to the car window and the dog is halfway
through it.] Ahhh.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Central Perk. Chandler and Ross are sitting at the couch.]</b><br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Hey.<br>
<br>
ROSS: What?<br>
<br>
<a name="line18"></a> CHANDLER: Do you have to be a Century 21 real-estate agent to get to
wear those really cool jackets?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Do you say this stuff to girls?<br>
<br>
BIG BULLY: Hehehehey, isn't that the guy who used to wear your hat?<br>
<br>
LITTLE BULLY: And look where they're sitting.<br>
<br>
ROSS: You're joking, right? You guys just walked through the door.<br>
<br>
BIG BULLY: Maybe we didn't make it clear enough.<br>
<br>
LITTLE BULLY: Yeah.<br>
<br>
<a name="line19"></a> BIG BULLY: This couch belongs to us.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Alright, I'll tell you what, you call the couch and then, and then we'll call
the couch, and we'll see who it comes to.<br>
<br>
BIG BULLY: You know what I keep wondering? Why you two are still sitting here.<br>
<br>
<a name="line43"></a> ROSS: Alright, that's it. I've had enough of this, alright. Gunther,
these guys are trying to take our seat.<br>
<br>
GUNTHER: Fellas, these guys were here first.<br>
<br>
BIG BULLY: Oh, sorry, I didn't realize.<br>
<br>
LITTLE BULLY: Sorry.<br>
<br>
GUNTHER: There you go.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Thank you Gunther. We didn't want to have to go and do that.<br>
<br>
<a name="line20"></a> LITTLE BULLY: He told on us?<br>
<br>
BIG BULLY: You told on us?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Well pal, you didn't give me much of a choice. [flicks the ends of the big bully's
tie]<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Don't play with his things.<br>
<br>
ROSS: I know.<br>
<br>
<a name="line21"></a> BIG BULLY: Alright, let's take this outside.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Let's, let's take this outside? Who talks like that?<br>
<br>
BIG BULLY: The guy that's about to kick your ass talks like that.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: You had to ask.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Yeah.<br>
<br>
[the bullies grab the back of the couch that Ross and Chandler are sitting in and tip
back]<br>
<br>
<a name="line22"></a> ROSS: Ok, ok look, see, the thing is we're, we're not gonna fight
you guys.<br>
<br>
LITTLE BULLY: Well then here's the deal, you won't have to so long as never ever show your
faces in this coffee house ever again.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: I think you played the Gunther card too soon.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Back in the cab in front of Phoebe's dad's house.]</b><br>
<br>
JOEY: Hey Phoeb's, I think you're good to go.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Yeah, I don't know.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: What's the matter?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: I just think that this was a really bad sign, ya know. I mean, like the beast at
the threshold, you know. It's just like, I have no family left, ya know. I mean except for
my grandmother, you know, but let's face it, she's not gonna be around forever, despite
what she says. And I have a sister who I've barely spoken to since we like shared a womb.
I don't know, this is my real father and I just, I want things to be like just right.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Yeah Phoebe, I completely understand.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Yeah, whatever you need. Hey, you wanna go home?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Ok, thanks. Sorry, again<br>
<br>
[She starts the cab and pulls forward. We hear a squish and a dog yelp.]<br>
<br>
<a name="line23"></a> PHOEBE: [innocently] What was that?<br>
<br>
JOEY: Uhh, I'm guessing the threshold's clear now.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Joey is eating breakfast, Rachel has just gotten
up, and Monica is on the phone.]</b><br>
<br>
MONICA: I wanna buy 5 shares of SGJ and <a name="line24"></a>I wanna buy them now. C'mon
time is money my friend. Thank you. Wooo.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Time is money my friend?<br>
<br>
JOEY: Yeah, you missed, 'Takes money to make money,' and uh, 'Don't make me come down
there and kick your wall street butt.'<br>
<br>
<a name="line25"></a> MONICA: Hey, I made $17 before breakfast, what have you done?<br>
<br>
JOEY: Well uh, I had breakfast here so technically I saved $3.50.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: How did you make $17.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Well, my financially challenged friends, <a name="line44"></a> I split my money
and I bought some shares of CHP and ZXY.<br>
<br>
JOEY: How come those?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Well, CHP because I used to have a crush on Eric Estrada. And ZXY becuase I think
it sounds zexy.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: What happened to uh, MEG.?<br>
<br>
<a name="line26"></a> MONICA: MEG was good for me but I dumped her. Ya know, my motto is
get out before they go down.<br>
<br>
JOEY: That is so not my motto.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: [enters] Hey.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Hey Phoebs. Oh hey, how's the dog?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Ok, I talked to the vet, people are so nice upstate. Anyway, he said that the
little fella's gonna be ok and I can pick him up tomorrow.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Good.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Oh, thank God.<br>
<br>
<a name="line27"></a> PHOEBE: Yeah, but he did have to have a bunch of stitches and he
said that only once in a blue moon does a dog's ear grow back so...still hoping.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Ok, so Phoebe, now are you gonna call your dad and let him know that his dog is
ok?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: I, I don't wanna meet my father over the phone. <a name="line45"></a> What am I
gonna say, like 'Hi, I'm Phoebe, the daughter you abandoned. Oh, by the way, I broke your
dog.'<br>
<br>
JOEY: Hey Phoebs, if you want, I'll do it.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Ok. Listen, just don't say anything about me, ok. [goes over and grabs the phone
that's sitting by Monica]<br>
<br>
<a name="line28"></a> MONICA: <b>DON'T</b>...be too long with the phone.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: She'll be a much better friend when the market closes.<br>
<br>
JOEY: [dials the phone] It's a woman.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: So talk to her.<br>
<br>
<a name="line29"></a> JOEY: [in a fake voice] Uhh, hello Miss Buffay. I know where your
dog is. I want you to know that he'll be returned to you, almost as good as new, within,
within 24 hours. Uh, goodbye. [hangs up]<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Why the voice.<br>
<br>
JOEY: [in the voice] Hard to say.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's apartment. Ross is sitting at the bar, Chandler serves up
two mugs of hot water.]</b><br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Your cappucino sir.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Thank you.<br>
<br>
[they both pour in packets of cappucino mix]<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Ya know I think this is much better than the coffee house.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Absolutely.<br>
<br>
[they both stir thier coffee and proceed to stare into the mugs]<br>
<br>
<a name="line30"></a> ROSS: How come it's not mixing with the water?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER:Well the package says you have to uh, constantly keep it moving. Stir and drink,
stir and drink, never let it settle.<br>
<br>
[they both try to drink while continuously stirring]<br>
<br>
JOEY: [walks out of his room] Hey, this is ridiculous. I'll tell you what. After I get
back from my neice's christening, I'll go down to the coffee house with you and we'll all
have a nice cup of coffee alright. No problem, Joey's there.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Ok.<br>
<br>
ROSS: No.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: No?<br>
<br>
<a name="line31"></a> ROSS: No. Man I don't wanna have to have Joey with me every time I
wanna descent cup of coffee. Ya know, and I don't wanna spend the rest of my life drinking
cappucino with a 'K'. I say you and I go back down there and stand up to those guys.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Alright, hang on a second there Custer.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Yeah really, Ross, have you ever been beaten up before?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Yeah, sure.<br>
<br>
JOEY: By someone besides Monica?<br>
<br>
<a name="line32"></a> ROSS: No. So what. So what if we get beaten up, maybe that's just
something every man has to go through once in his life. Ya know, like a, like a right of
passage or somethin'.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Well, couldn't we just lose our virginities again? Ya know, because I think
actually mine's growing back.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Outside Monica and Rachel's apartment. Rachel is returning.]</b><br>
<br>
MONICA: [Opens the door] I need to borrow a hundred bucks.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: What?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Hi, welcome home. [pulls Rachel inside] I need to borrow a hundred bucks.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: For what?<br>
<br>
MONICA: I've gotta get back in the game.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Why, when did you get out of the game?<br>
<br>
MONICA: I don't know, I lost it all ok. I lost it.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Oh no.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Hey, I've come to terms with it, you have to too.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Ok. Look uhh, Mon I'm, I'm really sorry.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Yeah, yeah, yeah, where are we on the hundred bucks?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: I, I don't have it.<br>
<br>
<a name="line33"></a> MONICA: But I need it. Otherwords I'm gonna have to take that
horrible diner job. You know, with the dancing and the costumes. I don't wanna have to
wear flame retardant boobs.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Nobody does honey.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Phoebe's dad's house. Phoebe is returning the dog who is bandaged up and has a
plastic cone around it's neck.]</b><br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Hi.<br>
<br>
<a name="line34"></a> MRS BUFFAY: Schnoodle. Oh my God, what the hell happened to my dog?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: It was an accident, and, and the woman who did this would never ever hurt a dog on
purpose. She's a vegetarian.<br>
<br>
MRS BUFFAY: What are these, stitches?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Yeah, eight of them. That's 56 to him. You know also, if, if it's raining, you
can't let him look up too long 'cause that cone'll fill up really really fast.<br>
<br>
MRS BUFFAY: Yeah well, thanks for bringing back what's left of him.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Sure, oh, is, is Frank home.<br>
<br>
MRS BUFFAY: How do you know Frank?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Just from a, from a long time ago. Is he here?<br>
<br>
MRS BUFFAY: Yeah. Frank.<br>
<br>
FRANK: Yeah. What? [a young guy comes around the corner]<br>
<br>
<a name="line35"></a> PHOEBE: Oh, ok, um, I mean Frank senior.<br>
<br>
MRS BUFFAY: He went out for groceries.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Ok so will he be back soon?<br>
<br>
MRS BUFFAY: Well he left four years ago so we're expecting him back any minute now.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Alright, I'm, I'm gonna go. I'm sorry about the dog, everything. I'm sorry.<br>
<br>
[she turns to leave, Frank follows]<br>
<br>
FRANK: Hey lady. Hey wait up. How do you know my dad?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Um well I don't really. Just genetically. He's kinda my dad too.<br>
<br>
FRANK: Heavy.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Yeah. So um, did he ever talk about me, Phoebe?<br>
<br>
FRANK: No but he didn't really talk about anything.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Oh.<br>
<br>
FRANK: Except stilts.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Stilts?<br>
<br>
FRANK: Yeah, he loved stilts. One time I was upstairs, I was stealing cigarettes out of my
mom's purse, and uh, all of a sudden I look over and there's my dad's head bobbing past
the window. He just had this big smile on his face and he was waving 'cause he was always
happiest when he was on his stilts.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Wow.<br>
<br>
FRANK: Yeah.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: I don't know what to do with that.<br>
<br>
<a name="line36"></a> FRANK: Me neither. So you're like my big sister.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Yeah.<br>
<br>
FRANK: This is huge, you can buy me beer.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: I'm not gonna. But you know what's cool though? Ok, if you had a friend named
Pete, then I could say, 'Oh yeah, I know Pete, he's friends with my brother.'<br>
<br>
FRANK: I gotta friend named Mark.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: That'll work too.<br>
<br>
FRANK: Cool, alright. So maybe, ya know, I could give you a call sometime, we could talk
or somethin'.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Yeah, that'd be ok.<br>
<br>
FRANK: Alright.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Ok, I'm in the book.<br>
<br>
FRANK: Ok, yeah.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Alright. So um, stilts huh?<br>
<br>
FRANK: Yeah hey, you know if you want I can take you around back and show you where he hit
his head on the rain gutter.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Ok.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Central Perk. Chandler and Ross are sitting on the couch nervously.]</b><br>
<br>
<a name="line37"></a> ROSS: Well we did it, we're here. We are standing our ground. How
long does a cup of coffee take?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Would you come on! Come on! [waitress brings their coffee] Thank you.<br>
<br>
[They rush to put the cream and sugar in their cups and gulp down a few drinks]<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Ah, there we go.<br>
<br>
ROSS: I think we proved our point.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: You burn your mouth?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Cannot feel my tounge.<br>
<br>
[They leave. As they're walking out, the bullies are walking in.]<br>
<br>
<a name="line38"></a> CHANDLER: Bullies, big bullies.<br>
<br>
LITTLE BULLY: Oh, look who's here, it's the weenies.<br>
<br>
BIG BULLY: Did we not make ourselves clear the other day.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Yes, and that's why we're here.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Yes, we're standing out ground...apparently.<br>
<br>
LITTLE BULLY: Let's do this alright.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Woah, ho-ho, whad'ya got there, a weapon?<br>
<br>
LITTLE BULLY: It's a nice watch, I don't wanna break it on your ribs.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Alright, let's do this.<br>
<br>
LITTLE BULLY: Alright.<br>
<br>
[they all put up their fists and prepare to fight]<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Question. If I don't care about my watch, can I use it as a weapon?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Whad'ya mean?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Well, it's sharp, it's metal, I think I can do some, you know, serious damage
with it.<br>
<br>
BIG BULLY: No, you can't use your watch.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Ok. [reaches in his pocket]<br>
<br>
BIG BULLY: Or your keys.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Ok.<br>
<br>
LITTLE BULLY: Look, here's what we'll do. We'll put all keys and watches in the hat over
there. Alright. [they all put their keys and watches in the hat and put it on a mail box]
Alright, c'mon man, let's do this.<br>
<br>
[they all jump in the street and prepare to fight]<br>
<br>
ROSS: Before I forget, are we hitting faces?<br>
<br>
BIG BULLY: Of course we're hitting faces, why wouldn't you hit faces?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Well because I have to work on Monday, I have a big presentation.<br>
<br>
LITTLE BULLY: Actually, you know, uh, I gotta show this apartment tomorrow and uh, you
know, this no faces thing might not be a bad idea.<br>
<br>
BIG BULLY: Ok, nothing from the neck up. [everyone gets ready for the fight] Or the waist
down. Dana's ovulating.<br>
<br>
LITTLE BULLY: Oh really, you guys tryin' again?<br>
<br>
BIG BULLY: Yeah.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Ok, so let me just get this straight. So we're uh, strictly talking about the
middle?<br>
<br>
<a name="line39"></a> BIG BULLY: C'MON!<br>
<br>
ROSS: Hey, hey, woah, you want some of this, huh? You want a piece of this, huh? I'm
standin here, huh.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Hey, hey, those guys are takin our stuff! [some guy runs off with the hat]<br>
<br>
ROSS: Hey.<br>
<br>
BIG BULLY: Hey.<br>
<br>
[they all run off after the guy]<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Central Perk. The four guys are returning after getting the hat back.]</b><br>
<br>
<a name="line40"></a> ROSS: God, that was, that was amazing, that was incredible. You
guys, you guys kicked butt.<br>
<br>
LITTLE BULLY: Us, what about you guys? Man you really, bing, gave it to old Mr. Clean back
there. He was a big guy.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Yeah he was wasn't he.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Yeah, I wouldn't know having missed everything.<br>
<br>
BIG BULLY: Don't do that to yourself. Any one of us could have tripped over that little
girls jump-rope.<br>
<br>
ROSS: So, listen guys, are we uh, are we ok here?<br>
<br>
LITTLE BULLY: We're ok.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Alright.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Ok so, can I have my hat back?<br>
<br>
LITTLE BULLY: No.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Huh. [reaches over and grabs the hat and bolts for the door but slips and falls
behind the couch]<br>
<br>
<font size="4"><b>CLOSING CREDITS</b></font><br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: The 50's theme cafe. Monica is working the grill, the rest are at a table.]</b><br>
<br>
<a name="line41"></a> RACHEL: Look at her.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Hi Monica.<br>
<br>
JOEY: He-he-he, how's it goin'?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Hey nice boobs.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Guys guys, check this out.<br>
<br>
[Chandler puts a coin in the mini jukebox at the table. YMCA starts playing and Monica and
the rest of the staff have to get on the counter and start singing along and dancing.
After a couple of couruses, Chandler pulls out a handful of coins and drops them on the
table.]<br>
<br>
JOEY: Excellent.</font></p>

<p align="center"><strong><font size="3">END</font></strong></p>
