222<html>

<head>
<title>The One With the Two Parties</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="white" text="black" link="green" vlink="black" alink="yellow">

<h1 align="center">The One With the Two Parties</h1>

<hr align="center">
<font size="3"><b>

<p>Originally written by <i>Alexa Junge</i>.</b></font><br>
<font size="3"><b>Transcribed by <i>Joshua Hodge</i>.</b></font><br>
</p>

<hr>
<font size="3"><b>

<p align="left">[Scene: Moondance Diner. Ross, Phoebe, Joey, and Chandler are sitting at
the counter, Monica is working. Monica is wearing her costume, including big fake
breasts.]</b><br>
<br>
MONICA: So, I'll get candles and my mom's lace tablecloth, and since it's Rachel's
birthday, I mean, we want it to be special, I thought I'd poach a salmon.<br>
<br>
ALL: Ohhh.<br>
<br>
MONICA: What?<br>
<br>
<a name="line01"></a> ROSS: Question. Why do we always have to have parties where you
poach things?<br>
<br>
MONICA: You wanna be in charge of the food committee?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Question two. Why do we always have to have parties with committees?<br>
<br>
JOEY: Really. Why can't we just get some pizzas and get some beers and have fun?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Yeah.<br>
<br>
<a name="line02"></a> PHOEBE: Yeah, I agree. Ya know, I think fancy parties are only fun
if you're fancy on the inside and I'm just not sure we are.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Alright. If you guys don't want it to be special, fine. You can throw any kind of
party you want.<br>
<br>
[Joey is staring at Monica's breasts]<br>
<br>
<a name="line03"></a> MONICA: Joey they're not real. I start miles beneath the surface of
these things, ok, they're fake. See [squeezes her breast] honk honk.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Wow, it's, it's like porno for clowns.<br>
<br>
<font size="4"><b>OPENING TITLES</b></font><br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Central Perk. Chandler, Ross, Joey, Phoebe, and Monica are planning Rache's
birthday party.]</b><br>
<br>
ROSS: I talked to Rachel's sisters, neither of them can come.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Ok, um so, I still have to invite Dillon and Emma and Shannon Cooper.<br>
<br>
<a name="line04"></a> JOEY: Woah, woah, woah, uh, no Shannon Cooper.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Why not her?<br>
<br>
JOEY: Cause she uh, she steals stuff.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Or maybe she doesn't steal stuff and Joey just slept with her and never called
her back.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Joey that is horriable.<br>
<br>
<a name="line05"></a> JOEY: Hey I liked her, alright. Maybe, maybe too much. I don't know
I guess I just got scared.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: I'm sorry, I didn't know.<br>
<br>
JOEY: I didn't think anyone'd buy that, ok.<br>
<br>
[Rachel enters]<br>
<br>
<a name="line06"></a> ROSS: Hi honey, how did it go?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Agh, it was the graduation from hell.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Ya know, my cousin went to hell on a football scholarship.<br>
<br>
<a name="line07"></a> RACHEL: Ya know, I mean this is supposed to be a joyous occasion. My
sister's graduating from college, nobody thought she would. It's a true testament to what
a girl from long island would do for a Celica.<br>
<br>
MONICA: So what happened?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: My parents happened. All they had to do was sit in the same stadium, smile
proudly, and not talk about the divorce. But nooo, they got into a huge fight in the
middle of the commencement address. Bishop Tutu actually had to stop and shush them. But
you know what, you know what the good news is? I get to serve coffee for the next 8 hours.<br>
<br>
<a name="line08"></a> PHOEBE: Ok, so I guess we don't invite her parents.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Well, how bout just her mom?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Why her mom?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Cause I already invited her.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Ooh, ooh, did you ask Stacy Roth?<br>
<br>
JOEY: Oh no, can't invite her. She also steals.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Chandler, Joey, Monica, and Phoebe are setting
up for the party.]</b><br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Ok, here are the birthday candles. Where's the birthday cake?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Ok, we're not having birthday cake, we're having birthday flan.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Excuse me?<br>
<br>
<a name="line09"></a> MONICA: It's a traditional Mexican custard dessert.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Oh that's nice. Happy birthday Rachel, here's some goo.<br>
<br>
[knock at the door]<br>
<br>
MONICA: [answers the door] Dr. Greene. Oh my God it's Rachel's dad. What're you doing
here?<br>
<br>
MR. GREENE: What? The father can't drop by to see the daughter on her birthday?<br>
<br>
MONICA: No no, the father can, but um, since I am the roommate I can tell you that she's
not here and I'll pass along the message, ok. So bye-bye.<br>
<br>
MR. GREENE: Ohhh, you're having a parteee.<br>
<br>
MONICA: No, no, not a party. Just a surprise gathering of some people Rachel knows. Um,
this is Phoebe and Chandler and Joey.<br>
<br>
<a name="line10"></a> MR. GREENE: I'll never remember all of that. So uh, what's the deal?
Rachel comes home, people pop out and yell stuff, is that it?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: This isn't your first surprise party, is it sir?<br>
<br>
[knock at the door, Monica answers to see Mrs. Greene]<br>
<br>
MRS. GREENE: Hi Monica.<br>
<br>
[Monica slams the door back shut]<br>
<br>
<a name="line11"></a> MONICA: Chinese menu guy. Forgot the menus.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: So, basically just a Chinese guy.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Uh, hey, Dr. Greene, why don't you come with me, we'll put your jacket on Rachel's
bed.<br>
<br>
MR. GREENE: Alright, that sounds like a two person job. [they walk into Rachel's bedroom]<br>
<br>
MRS. GREENE: Well, my goodness, what was that?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Sandra, I am so sorry, I thought you were Rachel and we just weren't ready for you
yet.<br>
<br>
<a name="line12"></a> MRS. GREENE: You thought I was Rachel?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Yes because uh, you look so young.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: And because you're both, you know, white women.<br>
<br>
MRS. GREENE: Oh, I missed you kids. Well, should I put my coat in the bedroom?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: NO! No, I'll take that for ya.<br>
<br>
MRS. GREENE: Oh well thank you. Such a gentleman. Thank you. [Chandler takes the hot pink
coat and grimaces at it] Ahh, it all looks so nice, so festive, all the balloons...
[Chandler, remembering that Joey and Mr. Greene are in the bedroom, throws her coat in a
cupboard] The funniest thing happened to me on the way here. I was...[Joey peeks out]<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: [cutting Mrs. Greene off] Ha-ha, that's great, ha-ha. I can't wait to hear the
rest of it, ya know, but I really have to go to the bathroom so... Hey, come with me.
Yeah, yeah, it'll be like we're gal pals, ya know, like at a restraunt. Oh, it'll be fun,
c'mon. [they go in the bathroom]<br>
<br>
MONICA: Oh my God, oh my God, oh my God.<br>
<br>
<a name="line13"></a> CHANDLER: Ok, think, what would Jack and Chrissy do?<br>
<br>
JOEY: [peeks back out] Ok, now that your coat is safely in the bedr-, [sees that the coast
is clear] oh, ok we can come back out in the living room.<br>
<br>
MONICA: So uh, Joey and Chanlder, I, I think it's time that you take Dr. Greene over to
your place.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Uhh, yes, absdolutely, um. Why again?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Because that's where the party is you goon. See this is just the staging area.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Right this is staging.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Yeah, this more than anything else, is the staging area.<br>
<br>
JOEY: [as they're walking out, Dr. Greene questioningly gestures at the Happy Birthday
sign over the door] This is clearly in the wrong apartment. [they all walk across the
hall]<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Later on in the hallway between the apartments. Chandler is showing people to
the parties.]</b><br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Alright you guys are off to party number one [ushers 3 guys into Monica's
apartment] and you, you are off to party number two [ushers four women into his apartment.
Two guys try to follow and Chandler blocks them and shoos them off to Monica's apartment]
Alright fellas, let's keep it movin', let' keep it movin.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Chandler could you at least send some women to my party? [buzzer goes off] Alright
that's Ross.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Ok, they're coming, shhh. [Runs into Monica's apartment and grabs one last girl
to take to his apartment]<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Ohh, thank you for the wonderful dinner.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Thanks for being born.<br>
<br>
<a name="line14"></a> RACHEL: Ohh, thank you for my beautiul earrings, they're perfect. I
love you.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Oh, now you can exchange them if you want, ok.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Now I love you even more.<br>
<br>
[they kiss and Ross backs her into her apartment and turns on the lights]<br>
<br>
ALL: Surprise.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Oh my gosh, wow. Monica. Oh my god. Mom. This is so great.<br>
<br>
MRS. GREENE: Happy birthday sweetie.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Wow you, you. I had no idea.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Really?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: No, I knew.<br>
<br>
ROSS: All right.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Ok, everybody, there's food and drinks on the table. Go across the hall.<br>
<br>
ROSS: What?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: What?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Right now, Joey and Chandler's, go now.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Why.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Just go.<br>
<br>
[they walk across the hall]<br>
<br>
ALL: Surprise.<br>
<br>
MR. GREENE: Happy birthday sweetpea.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Daddy.<br>
<br>
<b>[Ad break. Time lapse. Still at party at Chandler and Joey's. Rachel is talking to
Chandler and Ross.]</b><br>
<br>
<a name="line15"></a> RACHEL: Both of them are here, both of them, both of them are here?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Well, we could count again.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: I can't believe this is happening.<br>
<br>
<a name="line16"></a> ROSS: You know what, this is ridiculous, ok. This is your birthday,
this is your party. I say we just put 'em all together and if they can't deal with it, who
cares.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: I do.<br>
<br>
ROSS: That's who.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Look, are you gonna be ok?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Well, I have to be, I don't really have a choice, I mean, you know, I could look
at the bright side, I get two birthday parties and two birthday cakes.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Well, actually just one birthday flan.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: What?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: It's a traditional Mexican custard dessert...Look talk to Monica, she's on the
food committee.<br>
<br>
<b>[Time lapse. Chandler runs out of the bathroom.]</b><br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Joey, Joey. Hey, some girl just walked up to me and said, 'I want you Dennis,'
and stuck her tounge down my throat. I love this party.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Quick volleyball question.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Volleyball.<br>
<br>
<a name="line17"></a> JOEY: Yeah, we set up a court in your room. Uh, you didn't really
like that grey lamp, did you?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Joey, a woman just stuck her tounge down my throat, I'm not even listening to
you.<br>
<br>
GIRL'S VOICE: Dennis.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Ok, that's me. [runs back]<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Listen honey, can you keep dad occupied, I'm gonna go talk to mom for a while.<br>
<br>
<a name="line18"></a> ROSS: Ok, do you have any ideas for any openers?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Uhh, let's just stay clear of 'I'm the guy that's doing you daughter' and you
should be ok.<br>
<br>
<b>[Back in Monica's party]</b><br>
<br>
MONICA: Ok people, I want you to take a piece of paper, here you go, and write down your
most embarassing memory. Oh, and I do ask that when you're not using the markers, you put
the caps back on them because they will dry out.<br>
<br>
<b>[Back in Chandler and Joey's party]</b><br>
<br>
<a name="line19"></a> ROSS: Hi Dr. Greene. So, uh, how's everything in the uh, vascular
surgery....game?<br>
<br>
MR. GREENE: It's not a game Ross, a woman died on my table today.<br>
<br>
ROSS: I'm sorry. See that's the good thing about my job. All the dinosaurs on my table are
already dead.<br>
<br>
<b>[Back in Monica's party]</b><br>
<br>
MONICA: Listen you guys, I don't mean to be a pain about this but, um, I've noticed that
some of you are just placing them on. You wanna push the caps until you hear them click.
[she demonstrates, Gunther starts to walk to the door] Gunther, where're you going?<br>
<br>
GUNTHER: I um, was sorta thinking about maybe...<br>
<br>
MONICA: No. No you can't go. No this is fun. Come on we're just getting started. Here,
here's your marker.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Listen if you wanna go, just go.<br>
<br>
GUNTER: No, she'll yell at me again.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Alright, I can get you out.<br>
<br>
GUNTHER: What?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Shh. In a minute, I'm gonna create a diversion. When I do, walk quickly to the
door and don't look back.<br>
<br>
<b>[Back at Chandler and Joey's party]</b><br>
<br>
MR. GREENE: I think I need a drink.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Oh, here, I, I'll get it for ya. Whad'ya want?<br>
<br>
MR. GREENE: Scotch.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Scotch. Alright, I'll be back in 10 seconds with your scotch on the rocks in a
glass.<br>
<br>
MR. GREENE: Neat.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Cool.<br>
<br>
MR. GREENE: No no no, no no no, neat, as in no rocks.<br>
<br>
ROSS: I know.<br>
<br>
<b>[Back at Monica's party]</b><br>
<br>
MR. GREENE: Oh hello Ross, where have you been?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Hi. Uh, I have been in the bathroom. Stay clear of the salmon mousse.<br>
<br>
MRS. GREENE: Oh, scotch neat. Ya know, that's Rachel's father's drink.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Oh, mine too. Isn't that neat, scotch neat. Would you excuse me? [walks out in the
hallway, Mr. Greene is walking out of Chandler and Joey's apartment] Hey, hey, where you
uh, sneakin off to mister?<br>
<br>
MR. GREENE: I'm getting my cigarettes out of my jacket.<br>
<br>
ROSS: No. no.<br>
<br>
MR. GREENE: Whad'ya mean no?<br>
<br>
ROSS: No, um, see 'cause that, that is, that is the staging area. If you go in there,
it'll ruin the whole illusion of the party. Yeah, I think you take your scotch back in
there and I will get your cigarettes for you sir.<br>
<br>
<a name="line20"></a> MR. GREENE: Get my glasses too.<br>
<br>
ROSS: All righty roo. [closes the door] What a great moment to say that for the first
time. [goes to get the cigarettes and glasses]<br>
<br>
MONICA: Ok, the first person's most embarassing memory is, 'Monica, your party sucks.'
Very funny.<br>
<br>
<a name="line21"></a> PHOEBE: Oh no, ooh, ooh, did somebody forget to use a coaster?<br>
<br>
MONICA: What? [she runs over to where Phoebe is, Phoebe signals for Gunther to go] I don't
see anything.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Great, I'm seeing water rings again.<br>
<br>
MRS. GELLER: Ross, whose glasses are those?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Mine.<br>
<br>
MRS. GREENE: You wear bi-focals?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Um-hmm. [puts them on] I have a condition, apparently, that I require two different
sets of focals.<br>
<br>
MRS. GREENE: Did you know my husband has glasses just like that?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Well those are very popular frames.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Neil Sedaka wears them.<br>
<br>
GUY: [to Phoebe] I hear you can get people out of here.<br>
<br>
MRS. GREENE: Rachel, you didn't tell me your boyfriend smoked.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Yeah, like a chimney.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Ohh, big smoker. [Packs the cigarettes and flings one on Mrs. Greene in the process.
Finally gets one in his mouth and it look really out of place] Big big smoker. In fact I'm
gonna go ou into the hallway and fire up this bad boy. [as he walks into the hall, he
comes face to face with Mr. Greene]<br>
<br>
<a name="line22"></a> MR. GREENE: Are you wearing my glasses?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Yes. [pulls them off and hands them to Mr. Greene] I was just warming up the
earpieces for you.<br>
<br>
MR. GREENE: Thank you. Is that one of my cigarettes?<br>
<br>
ROSS: [pulls the cigarette off his upper lip and hands it to Mr. Greene] Yeah, yes it is,
I was just moistening the tip.<br>
<br>
<b>[Back in Monica's party. Phoebe is talking to a guy and two girls at the party.]</b><br>
<br>
<a name="line23"></a> PHOEBE: Ok, ok, she's taking the trash out so I can get you out of
here but it has to be now, she'll be back any minute.<br>
<br>
GIRL 1: What about my friend Victor?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: No, only the three of you, any more than that and she'll get suspicious.<br>
<br>
GIRL 1: Alright, let me just get my coat.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: There isn't time. You must leave everything. They'll take care of you next door.<br>
<br>
GIRL 1: Is it true they have beer?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Everything you've heard is true.<br>
<br>
<b>[Back at Chandler and Joey's party. Everyone is dancing and having fun.]</b><br>
<br>
MONICA: Could you guys please try to keep it down, we're trying to start a Boggle
tournament.<br>
<br>
[Chandler and Joey stop dancing and laugh at her]<br>
<br>
MONICA: You, and you, you're supposed to be at my party. And Gunther! What are you doing
here?<br>
<br>
GUNTHER: Um [gestures to dance floor]<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: [enters with the three people she got out] Ok, welcome to the fu-oh.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Phoebe.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Alright, I'm sorry but these people needed me. They work hard all week, it's
Saturday night, they deserve to have a little fun. Go.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Ya know, my party is fun. I mean, maybe it's a little quieter, less obvious sorta
fun but, you know, if people would just give it a chance... [volleyball hits her in the
head from behind]<br>
<br>
<b>[Back at Monica's party]</b><br>
<br>
RACHEL: You want me to see a therapist?<br>
<br>
MRS. GREENE: Sweetheart, you obviously have a problem. You've chosen a boyfriend exactly
like your father.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Ok mom, you know what, fine, I'll make an appointment ok, but you know what, right
now, I gotta go, I gotta go do a thing.<br>
<br>
<b>[Chandler and Joey's party]</b><br>
<br>
MR. GREENE: Did you know your mother spent $1200 dollars on bansai trees. I felt like
Gulliver around that place.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Daddy, daddy, you know what, I really wanna hear more about this, I really do, but
I just have, I just have to do a, some stuff.<br>
<br>
[Monica's party]<br>
<br>
MRS. GREENE: You work and you work and you work at a marriage but all he cares about is
his stupid boat.<br>
<br>
[Chandler and Joey's party]<br>
<br>
MR. GREENE: You work and you work and you work on a boat...<br>
<br>
MRS. GREENE: He always ridiculed my pottery classs...<br>
<br>
MR. GREENE: ...and you sand it and you varnish it...<br>
<br>
MRS. GREENE: ...but when all is said and done, he still drinks out of the mugs.<br>
<br>
MR. GREENE: ...and her yoga and her Bridges of Madison County...<br>
<br>
MRS. GREENE: ...the scotch and the cigarettes...<br>
<br>
MR. GREENE: ...and the bansai's and the chiuaua...<br>
<br>
MRS. GREENE: ...I may have only been in therapy for three weeks now dear but...<br>
<br>
MR. GREENE: ...what the hell does she want with half a boat...<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: The hallway after the party. Rachel is sitting there.]</b><br>
<br>
CHANDLER: [running out of his apartment after a girl] Ok, ok, you can be shirts and I'll
be skins. I'll be skins. [sits down beside Rachel] Hey, how you holdin' up there, tiger?
Oh, sorry, when my parents were getting divorced I got a lot of tigers. Got a lot of
champs, chiefs, sports, I even got a governor.<br>
<br>
<a name="line24"></a> RACHEL: This is it, isn't it? I mean, this is what my life is gonna
be like. My mom there, my dad there. Thanksgiving, Christmas. She gets the house, he's in
some condo my sister's gonna decorate with wicker. Oh, Chandler how did you get through
this?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Well, I relied on a carefully regimented program of denial and, and wetting the
bed.<br>
<br>
<a name="line25"></a> RACHEL: Ya know, I just, so weird. I mean I was in there just
listening to them bitch about each other and all I kept thinking about was the fourth of
July.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Becasue it reminded you of the way our forefathers used to bitch at each other?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: It's just this thing. Every year we would go out on my dad's boat and watch the
fireworks. Mom always hated it because the ocean air made her hair all big. My sister Jill
would be throwing up over the side and my dad would be upset becasue nobody was helping
and then when we did help he would scream at us for doing it wrong. But then when the
fireworks started, everybody just shut up, you know, and it'd get really cold, and we
would all just sort of smush under this one blanket. It never occured to anybody to bring
another one. And now it's just...<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: I, I know. [Hugs her. Ross walks out and Chandler puts her in his arms.]<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Monica's party. She is seeing off the last of the guests.]</b><br>
<br>
MONICA: Ok, thanks for coming, I hope you guys had fun.<br>
<br>
MRS. GREENE: Alright, Monica dear, I'm gonna hit the road. Now I've left my 10 verbs on
the table. And you be sure and send me that finished poem.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Ok will do. So glad you came.<br>
<br>
MRS. GREENE: I think I saw Rachel out in the hall.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Ok, let me go check. Your mom want's to say goodbye.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Oh ok.<br>
<br>
MRS. GREENE: Happy birthday sweetie.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Ok.<br>
<br>
[Mr. Greene opens the door to Chandler and Joeys apartment. Ross sees him and runs to the
door forcing him back in then holds onto the door knob.]<br>
<br>
JOEY: Ahh, you drive safe.<br>
<br>
MRS. GREENE: Ross, what're you doing.<br>
<br>
ROSS: I'm getting ready for the water skiing. [Mr. Greene opens the door which pulls Ross
in] How are you doing?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Well, uh, Dr. Greene, where are you going?<br>
<br>
MR. GREENE: To get my coat.<br>
<br>
GUYS: No no no.<br>
<br>
MR. GREENE:Alright, alright, I can get my own coat.<br>
<br>
[the guys form a wall between Mrs Geller and Mr Geller and dance across the hall as he
walks across]<br>
<br>
<a name="line26"></a> CHANDLER: Sorry, we're on a major flan high.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Oh no, you're not supposed to be here. This is the staging area, you should, it's
all wrong, you should leave, ya know, get out. [opens the door, the guys are right there]
Or perhaps you'd like a creme d'menthe.<br>
<br>
MR. GREENE: I have to be heading to my chateau, thank you.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Oh all right, then I guess we're going back into the hallway.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Thanks for coming Mrs. Greene. [grabs her and kisses her to distract her. She goes
limp in his arms. Mr. Greene leaves.] Well, ok, you take care.<br>
<br>
MRS. GREENE: Oh, you kids [she caresses his face and chest] Well, this is the best party
I've been to in years.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Thank you.<br>
<br>
<font size="4"><b>CLOSING CREDITS</b></font><br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Close up of the flan on the table with birthday
candles.]</b><br>
<br>
<a name="line27"></a> MONICA: Ok everybody, it's time for flan.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Yup, get ready for the gelatenous fun.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Kinda looks like that stuff you get when you get a bad infection.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Ok, that's enough.<br>
<br>
<a name="line28"></a> PHOEBE: Ok Rachel, make a special flan wish.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Ok, I've got one. [blows out the candles. Somebody calls out 'heads up' and the
volleyball lands in the flan] Wow, those things almost never come true.</font></p>

<p align="center"><strong><font size="3">END</font></strong></p>

223<html>

<head>
<title>The One With the Chicken Pox</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="white" text="black" link="green" vlink="black" alink="yellow">

<h1 align="center">The One With the Chicken Pox</h1>

<hr align="center">
<font size="3"><b>

<p>Originally written by <i>Brown Mandell</i>.</b></font><br>
<font size="3"><b>Transcribed by <i>Joshua Hodge</i>.</b></font><br>
</p>

<hr>
<font size="3"><b>

<p align="left">[Scene: Central Perk. Rachel, Monica, Joey, and Chandler are there.]</b><br>
<br>
[Rachel brings a muffin to Chandler and Monica who are sitting on the couch.]<br>
<br>
<a name="line01"></a> RACHEL: Ok, Chandler, Mon, there's only one bananna nut muffin left.<br>
<br>
[Rachel holds the tray between them. Chandler grabs the muffin before Monica can.]<br>
<br>
MONICA: Oh, I ordered mine first.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Yeah, but I'm, I'm so much faster...<br>
<br>
MONICA: Give it to me.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: No.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Give it to me.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Ok, you can have it. [He licks it and offers it to her.]<br>
<br>
<a name="line02"></a> MONICA: [She grabs the coffee cup on the table and licks the rim.]
There you go, enjoy your coffee.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: That was there when I got here. [Takes a bite of his muffin.]<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: [enters] Hey you guys, you will never guess who's coming to New York.<br>
<br>
MONICA: [Chandler tries to come back with a smart-ass remark but can't swallow the
muffin.] Quick, Phoebe, tell us before he can swallow.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Oh ok, Ryan, that guy I went out with, who's in the Navy.<br>
<br>
[Chandler is visibly upset]<br>
<br>
RACHEL: You went out with a guy in the Navy?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Yeah, I met him when I was playing guitar in Washington Square Park. Ryan threw in
salt water taffy 'cause he didn't have any change.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Hey, is that when you wrote salt water taffy man?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: No. No, he is my submaring guy. He resurfaces like every couple years and we have
the most amazing three days together. Only this time he's coming for two weeks. Two whole
weeks, which means yay.<br>
<br>
<a name="line03"></a> RACHEL: So wait, this guy goes down for like two years at a time?<br>
<br>
[Once again, Chandler has a bite in his mouth and can't come back.]<br>
<br>
MONICA: That'll teach you to lick my muffin.<br>
<br>
ROSS: [enters] Hiii.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Oh no, what happened?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Well, I just spoke to Carol. Ben's got the chicken pox.<br>
<br>
ALL: Oh no.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Yeah, so if you haven't already had it, chances are you're gonna get it.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Well I've had it.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Yeah, I've had it.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Had it.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Had it.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Well, I've never had it, I feel so left out. [Sees a red bump on her arm.] Oh
look!<br>
<br>
<font size="4"><b>OPENING TITLES</b></font><br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Monica and Richard are in her bedroom.]</b><br>
<br>
<a name="line04"></a> MONICA: Honey, you made the bed again. I told you, you don't have to
do that. This isn't camp.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Ooh, then I guess the panty raid last night was totally uncalled for. Ok, I am
going to take a shower and today I will be singing Jim Crochee's Leroy Brown.<br>
<br>
[He walks out of the bedroom and Monica starts to remake the bed.]<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Monica... [He re-enters the bedroom and Monica jumps on the bed, trying to cover
it.] Hey Mon, I have a question. Is Leroy the baddest man in the whole damn town or the
fattest man in the whole damn town?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Baddest. Otherwise the song would be Fat Fat Leroy Brown.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: What're you doing?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Just waiting for you sweetie.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Are you remaking the bed?<br>
<br>
MONICA: I'm sorry, I'm sorry. You know what, the way you did it was just fine.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Then, you're redoing it because...<br>
<br>
<a name="line05"></a> MONICA: If I tell you, you'll think I'm crazy.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: You're pretty much running that risk either way.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Ok, you see, the tag shouldn't be at the top left corner, it should be at the
bottom right corner.<br>
<br>
<a name="line06"></a> RICHARD: Oh, well that's not so crazy.<br>
<br>
MONICA: I'm just easing you in.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Oh, alright.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Alright, you see these little flower blossoms? They should be facing up, not down,
because, well, the head of the bed is where the sun would be. You don't love me any more
do you.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Actually, if it's possible, I love you more.<br>
<br>
<a name="line07"></a> MONICA: Really? Wow, well then come on, I wanna show you how to fold
the toilet paper into a point.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Chandler's office. Joey is there.]</b><br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Hey, look Joey, I'm just saying if you need something to hold you over, I can
get you a job right here as an entry level processor.<br>
<br>
JOEY: But don't you need experience for a job like that?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: It's not that hard to learn. And as for people realizing you have no idea what
you're doing, hey, you're an actor. Act like a processor, people will think you're a
processor.<br>
<br>
SCOTT: [enters] Hey Chandler, here's this morning's projections.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Hey thanks. Scott Alexander, Joey Tribbianni. Joey is a uh, fellow processor.<br>
<br>
SCOTT: No kidding.<br>
<br>
<a name="line08"></a> JOEY: Oh yeah yeah. I process. People want the processing, I'm the
one they call.<br>
<br>
SCOTT: Where do you work?<br>
<br>
JOEY: Uhh, well, right now I'm in between things. You know how it is. One day you're
processing, the next day you're not so much... processing any more.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: I was just telling Joey about the opening in Fleischman's group.<br>
<br>
SCOTT: Fleischman's group. Whatever you do, don't touch his sandwiches. Ha-ha-ha...<br>
<br>
JOEY: Ha-ha. [Scott leaves] Are all you processors dorks?<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Monica and Rachel are doing Phoebe's makeup.]</b><br>
<br>
RACHEL: Oh, this lipstick looks just great on you.<br>
<br>
MONICA: You look fabulous honey, you really do.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Yeah? Are you sure, really. [She picks up a mirror and sees the white splotches
all over her face.]<br>
<br>
<a name="line09"></a> RACHEL: You see, you look beautiful. For god sakes, dim the lights.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: I, I, I'm hideous.<br>
<br>
<a name="line10"></a> MONICA: It's gonna be ok. Ryan's been under water. He's just gonna
be so glad that you don't have barnicles on your butt.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Ryan is walks up to the door and knocks.]</b><br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Come in.<br>
<br>
RYAN: Hey baby, I'm back... [Phoebe is sitting by the window in a veil.]<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Hey Ryan, what's up?<br>
<br>
RYAN: What's goin' on?<br>
<br>
<a name="line11"></a> PHOEBE: Well, no no, you have to stay back. I, I have the pox.<br>
<br>
RYAN: Chicken or small?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Chicken. Which is so ironic considering I'm a vegetarian.<br>
<br>
RYAN: Why aren't you at home in bed?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: 'Cause my, my grandmother's never had chicken pox. Please, please tell me you
have, 'cause oh my God, I forgot how cute you are.<br>
<br>
RYAN: I'm sorry, I never had 'em.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Ohh, ohh.<br>
<br>
<a name="line12"></a> RYAN: If I had one wish, it would be to build a time machine, go
back to when I was 7, when Jimmy Hauser had the chicken pox. I would grab that kid and rub
him all over my face.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Yeah, or you know, you could just wish that I didn't have them now.<br>
<br>
RYAN: Can I please see your face?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Nope. You don't want to see a face covered with pox.<br>
<br>
RYAN: Your face could be covered with lochs, I wouldn't care.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: And you hate fish. Oh. That's so sweet, alright. Ok, alright, you can see. This is
me... [she unveils herself right as a huge lightning bolt crashes outside. Ryan screams in
terror.] Oh, I am scary.<br>
<br>
RYAN: Sorry, the lightning. Lightning was an unfortunate incidence. You look lovely,
lovely.<br>
<br>
<a name="line13"></a> PHOEBE: I hate this. 'Cause I tell you, I had the most amazing two
weeks planned for us, and almost everything I had in mind, we had to be a lot closer than
this.<br>
<br>
RYAN: Phoebe, I have spent the last eight months in a steel tube with men, thinking about
this moment. I am not gonna let a bunch of itchy spots stand between us. [He walks to her
and kisses her.]<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Ok, this is the most romantic disease I've ever had.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Chandler's office. Joey enters.]</b><br>
<br>
JOEY: Hey.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Hey, how's the first day goin'?<br>
<br>
JOEY: Pretty good. It's like you said. It's mostly just putting numbers from one column
into another column.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Well there you go.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Hey and everbody is so nice. I just had a good talk with that lady with the red
hair, Jeannie.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Jeannie, the head of east coast operations Jeannie?<br>
<br>
<a name="line14"></a> JOEY: Yeah, turns out our kids go to the same school. Small world
huh?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Weird world. Your kids?<br>
<br>
<a name="line15"></a> JOEY: I figure my character has kids.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Ya know there isn't a part of that sentence I don't need explained.<br>
<br>
<a name="line16"></a> JOEY: Well, see when you're acting you need to think about stuff
like that. My character, Joseph the processor guy, has two little girls, Ashley and
Brittany. Ashley copies everything Brittany does.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Well, invisible kids can be that way sometimes.<br>
<br>
<a name="line17"></a> JOEY: Yeah. Joseph and his wife, Karen, are thinking of having a
third kid... Ya know what? Just did.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Really? Wow. That's some pretty powerful imaginary sperm you must have there.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Phoebe and Ryan are playing Monopoly.]</b><br>
<br>
RYAN: You know what makes the itching even worse?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: That you don't stop talking about it.<br>
<br>
RYAN: Fine.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Let's just play, ok. Good, ok. [She picks up the dice.] Here we go, double sixes,
here we go... [She starts to rub the dice all over herself.] Here we go, come to mama,
just getting ready to roll the dice...<br>
<br>
RYAN: What're you doing? Are you scratching?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: No. This is what I do for luck, ok.<br>
<br>
RYAN: You're scratching. Give me the dice.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: No.<br>
<br>
RYAN: Give me the dice.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: No. Here. [Throws them on the table.] There. Ooh, double sixes.<br>
<br>
RYAN: We can't scratch. You know we can't, we'll scar.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Uhh, I can't stop thinking about it. It's just so hard. I just wanna grab all
these houses and rub 'em all over my body. [Grabs a handful of the houses.]<br>
<br>
RYAN: No.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Give it.<br>
<br>
RYAN: No.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Yeah, come on. You know you want it, you know you want it too, come on. Let's just
be bad, it'll feel so good. [She starts scratching him.]<br>
<br>
RYAN: Oh God help me.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Now do me, do my back. Oh come on, harder.<br>
<br>
[They get back to back and start rubbing against each other. Ross and Rachel enter.]<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Oh, stop that, stop that right now.<br>
<br>
ROSS: You know, I might have expected this of you Phoebe, but Ryan, you're a military man.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Chandler's office building. Joey and Jeannie are talking.]</b><br>
<br>
JOEY: You and Milton have to join us on the boat. Karen'll pack a lunch, you'll bring the
kids, we'll make a day of it.<br>
<br>
JEANNIE: Oh, that sounds lovely. We're gonna have to set that up. Oh, I better get back.
Hope the baby feels better.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Oh, thanks, thanks. Bye bye Jeannie.<br>
<br>
<a name="line18"></a> JEANNIE: Bye bye Joey.<br>
<br>
JOEY: What a phony.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Well, I'm sure you'll teach her a lesson when she steps off the dock onto
nothing. Hey Mr. Douglas.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Sir.<br>
<br>
MR. DOUGLAS: Uh, listen Bing, I received your memo. So, we're not gonna receive the
systems report until next Friday?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Well the people in my group wanna spend the holiday weekend with their families.<br>
<br>
MR. DOUGLAS: I have a family, I'm gonna be here.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Yeah Bing, what's that about?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: It's about cutting my people a little slack, ya know, for morale. Look, if you
wanna see some rough numbers, I can get them to you by Wednesday.<br>
<br>
MR. DOUGLAS: Rough numbers?<br>
<br>
JOEY: This company was not built on rough numbers. Am I right Mr. Douglas.<br>
<br>
MR. DOUGLAS: Have the final numbers on my desk by Tuesday.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Uh, if you say so sir.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Joseph's good, isn't he?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Well, I'm going to kill you.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Hey, hey, I just figure Joseph's the kinda guy that likes to mix it up. Ya know, get
in there, ruffle some feathers.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Why?<br>
<br>
JOEY: Look, I'm sorry but that's what Joseph does, ok. If you try to pull somethin', he'll
call you on it. 'What're you tryin' to pull,' he'll say.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Monica enters her bedroom with a roll of duct
tape. Richard is sitting on the bed.]</b><br>
<br>
RICHARD: Ooh, duct tape. Was I supposed to bring something too?<br>
<br>
MONICA: This is for the scratchy twins out there. I taped oven mits to their hands.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: You're strict.<br>
<br>
MONICA: It's for their own good.<br>
<br>
<a name="line19"></a> RICHARD: You know, I like the way you have efficiently folded this
tab under. See in a tape emergency you could shave valuable seconds off your time.<br>
<br>
<a name="line20"></a> MONICA: Exactly. Oh, I love that I can be totally neurotic around
you now. <a name="line21"></a>Tell me the truth. Don't you like it better now that
everything on your desk is perpendicular?<br>
<br>
RICHARD: If it's not a right angle, it is a wrong angle.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Very good.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Thank you.<br>
<br>
MONICA: You know what. Tomorrow I'm gonna do your clocks.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: You're gonna do what to my clocks.<br>
<br>
MONICA: I'm gonna set them to my time.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Well, I'm confused. I thought we shared time.<br>
<br>
<a name="line22"></a> MONICA: No no. See, in my bedroom I set my clock six minutes fast.
You wanna know why?<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Because it's in a slightly different time zone than the kitchen.<br>
<br>
MONICA: No forget it, I'm not gonna tell you now.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: No come on. Come on tell me.<br>
<br>
MONICA: No. See you don't understand.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Come on.<br>
<br>
MONICA: No. You don't have any of these cute little obsessive things.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: No that's not true. That is not true.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Oh yeah.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Yeah.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Alright, well tell me one of yours.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Ok. Ahh. One of my things is, I always separate my sweat socks from my dress
socks.<br>
<br>
MONICA: What if they get mixed up?<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Boy I would just uh, I would freak out.<br>
<br>
<a name="line23"></a> MONICA: You would not. I can't believe this. I hate this, you're too
normal. I can't believe my boyfriend doesn't have a thing. My boyfriend doesn't have a
thing.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: See, if anyone overheard that, I didn't come off well.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Chandler's office. Chandler is asleep in his chair holding a paper in one hand
and a pen in the other. Joey walks in, waking up Chandler who covers by pretending to
write on the paper.]</b><br>
<br>
JOEY: Hey. Mr. Douglas is looking for you.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Why? Wh- wh- why is Mr. Douglas looking for me?<br>
<br>
JOEY: 'Cause he has a strong suspicion that you dropped the ball on the Lender project.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Wha- wh- why, why, why does he suspect that?<br>
<br>
JOEY: Becasue at first he thought it was Joseph. But after he asked Joseph about it, turns
out it was you. Anyway, I just thought you should know.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Alright, that's it. Look Joey, I'm sorry, I realize this is the role of a
lifetime for ya, and if I could just fire Joseph, I would, but unfortunately that's not
possible so I'm gonna have to let both of you go.<br>
<br>
JOEY: What're you talking about, everybody loves Joseph.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: I don't, I hate Joseph, ok. I think he's a brown-nosing suck up.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Oh yeah. Well you can't fire Joseph. You know why, 'cause he's not in your
department.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Alright, ok, alright. So I can't fire Joseph but uh, I can sleep with his wife.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Karen.<br>
<br>
<a name="line24"></a> CHANDLER: Yeah, Karen. I'm thinking about having an affair with her.
Oh, you know what? I just did.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Ahh. What the hell are you doing to me man.<br>
<br>
<a name="line25"></a> CHANDLER: Oh well it's not me, it's my character, Chandy. Yeah the
rogue processor who seduces his co-worker's wives for sport and then laughs about it the
next day at the water cooler. In fact, I have her panties right there in my drawer.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Really?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: No freakshow, she's fictional.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Take it easy. If it means that much to you, I'll uh, I'll go find something else.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Thank you.<br>
<br>
JOEY: It's just that, I, I'm gonna miss Joseph. I liked him. His wife, she was hot.
[Chadler pushes him out the door by the face.]<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Rachel and Ross are in the kitchen. Phoebe is
sitting at the couch with oven mits on her hands.]</b><br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Can I please take these off? I swear I won't scratch.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: No sorry hon, Monica's orders.<br>
<br>
RYAN: [Comes out of the bathroom, also with oven mits on his hands.] Well that wasn't
easy.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Ok, dinner's on.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: And there's a peach cobbler warming in the oven so the plate's gonna be hot but
that shouldn't be a problem for you.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Alright you kids, bye now.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE and RYAN: Bye. [waving]<br>
<br>
<a name="line26"></a> ROSS: Oh look, a low budget puppet show.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: It's such a shame you can't see which finger I'm holding up.<br>
<br>
[Ross and Rachel leave.]<br>
<br>
RYAN: Wine?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Please. [Ryan pulls the cork with his teeth and spits it into Phoebe's mits.]<br>
<br>
RYAN: Oh, I spilled some.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: I got it. [Wipes it up with her mits.]<br>
<br>
RYAN: [Puts his hands over Phoebe's ears.] I must tell you, you look beautiful tonight.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: What?<br>
<br>
RYAN: Sorry. You look beautiful.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Oh.<br>
<br>
[They start to kiss. They try to get each other's shirts off but can't get the buttons
undone.]<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: You know what, that's it, that's it. [She rips off the mits, Ryan follows her
lead.]<br>
<br>
[They keep kissing and start scratching each other. Ross enters, takes one look, and goes
right back out the door.]<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Richard and Monica are in bed.]</b><br>
<br>
RICHARD: Monica, wake up. Monica.<br>
<br>
MONICA: What's up?<br>
<br>
RICHARD: I thought of a thing.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Yeah?<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Yeah. I have to sleep, have to, on this side of the bed.<br>
<br>
MONICA: No honey. You have to sleep on this side of the bed because I have to sleep on
this side of the bed.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Or so I would have you believe.<br>
<br>
MONICA: No. Big deal, so you have a side of the bed, everybody has a side of the bed.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Hey come on, you haven't heard my reason yet.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Alright, go on.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Ok, I have to sleep on the west side because I grew up in California and
otherwise the ocean would be on the wrong side.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Oh my God, you're a freak.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Yeah. How 'bout that.<br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Central Perk. Phoebe, Rachel, Ross, and Ryan are there. Ryan is in uniform,
getting ready to leave.]</b><br>
<br>
<a name="line27"></a> RACHEL: So uh, Ryan, were you shipping off to?<br>
<br>
RYAN: I really can't say.<br>
<br>
ROSS: So do you have like any nuclear weapons on board?<br>
<br>
RYAN: I can't say.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Well do you get to look through one of those like, those periscope thingys.<br>
<br>
RYAN: I'm sorry, but I can't say.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Wow, it, it's neat learning about submarines.<br>
<br>
RYAN: I better get out of here, I'm gonna miss my flight.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Ok, I'll walk you out.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Bye Ryan.<br>
<br>
RYAN: Pleasure.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: It was nice to meet you.<br>
<br>
RYAN: Take care.<br>
<br>
[Phoebe and Ryan walk outside.]<br>
<br>
RACHEL: So do you uh, think we can get you one of those uh, uniform things?<br>
<br>
ROSS: You like that do ya?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Oh yeah.<br>
<br>
ROSS: I'll make some calls. [Runs off.]<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Ok.<br>
<br>
[Outside with Phoebe and Ryan.]<br>
<br>
RYAN: Can you believe how we spent our two weeks together?<br>
<br>
<a name="line28"></a> PHOEBE: I know. We didn't do any of the romantic things I had
planned, like having a picnic at Central Park and ya know, coffee at Central Perk. Oh I
just got that. [They kiss.]<br>
<br>
RYAN: Taxi.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Bye you. [Ryan's cab drives off. As Phoebe is going back in, she sees the Central
Perk sign in the window and laughs.]<br>
<br>
<font size="4"><b>CLOSING CREDITS</b></font><br>
<br>
<b>[Scene: Central Perk. Rachel is closing. Ross walks in in a uniform.]</b><br>
<br>
RACHEL: Oh I'm sorry, we're clo-... Hey sailor.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Is this what you had in mind?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: I'll say.<br>
<br>
[Ross picks her up.]<br>
<br>
ROSS: I'm shipping out tomorrow.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Well then uh, we better make this night count. [He starts to carry her out.] Oh
wait, I forgot to turn off the cappucino machine. [He carries her over to turn it off.]
Anchors away. Oh no no, my purse, my purse, my purse, my purse, my purse, my pu rse. [He
carries her to the counter to pick up her purse.] Oh, you know what. I forgot to turn off
the bathroom light.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Alright you know, why don't I just meet you upstairs. [Drops her on the couch and
walks out holding his lower back.]</font></p>

<p align="center"><strong><font size="3">END</font></strong></p>

224<html>

<head>
<title>The One With Barry and Mindy's Wedding</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="white" link="green" text="black" vlink="black" alink="yellow">

<h1 align="center">The One With Barry and Mindy's Wedding</h1>

<hr align="center">

<p>Originally written by <i>Ira Ungerleider</i>.<br>
Teleplay by <i>Brown Mandell</i>.<br>
Transcribed by <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric B Aasen</a>.<br>
HTMLed by <a href="mailto:shadelet@easynet.co.uk">guineapig</a>. </p>

<hr>
<font size="3">

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, the whole gang is there as Joey enters]<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Hey Joey, how'd the audition go?<br>
<br>
JOEY: Incredible! I met the director this time and you'll never believe who it was.<br>
<br>
ALL: Who?<br>
<br>
JOEY: All right. I'll give you one hint. Warren Beatty.<br>
<br>
ALL: Wow!<br>
<br>
JOEY: Yeah, there's just one thing that might be kind've a problem. See, I, uh, had to
kiss this guy.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: 'Cause he was just so darn cute.<br>
<br>
JOEY: No, as part of the audition. See, I'm up for this part of this guy, who the main guy
kisses.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Well, hey. You're an actor, I say you just suck it up and do it. (Rachel looks at
him in disbelief) Or you just do it.<br>
<br>
JOEY: I did do it, I'm a professional.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Then what's the problem?<br>
<br>
JOEY: See after the scene, Mr. Beatty comes up to me and says 'good actor, bad kisser'.
Can you believe that, me not a good kisser, that's like, like Mother Theresa, not a good
mother. <br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Well, come on, who cares what that guy thinks. What does Warren Beatty know about
kissing (Chandler and Monica, give her a look that says 'think about it') Ooh.<br>
<br>
OPENING CREDITS<br>
<br>
[Scene: continued from earlier]<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Hey, what did your agent say?<br>
<br>
JOEY: Yep, this kiss thing is defiantly a problem, Mr. Beatty wants to see it again on
Monday. Man, I gotta figure out what I'm doing wrong. Oh, okay, one of you girls come over
here and kiss me.<br>
<br>
MONICA: What, forget it!<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Yeah, right.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Come on, I need your help here.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: All right. I'll do it, I kissed him before I can do it again.<br>
<br>
JOEY: You see this, this is a friend.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Uh-huh, let's go. (they move in to kiss) Oh, wait I have gum. Okay. (they kiss
rather passionately) Good, very good, firm but tender. I'd recommend you to a friend.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Then I don't know what it is. What's the problem?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Joey, you know, maybe your just not used to kissing men, maybe you just tensed up
a little, maybe that's what you need to work on.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Yeah, that makes sense. (looks at Ross)<br>
<br>
ROSS: Over my dead body! (Joey looks at Chandler)<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: And I'll be using his dead body as a shield.<br>
<br>
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe, Monica, and Richard are there]<br>
<br>
ROSS: (entering from Rachel's bedroom) Come on out, honey! I'm telling you look good!
(turns around, and under his breath, to the rest of the guys) Tell her she looks good,
tell her she looks good.<br>
<br>
(Rachel enters in this hideous pink bride's maid dress, with a huge silver bow on her
chest, and a big, huge skirt, kinda like the one's women wore in the 1800s, Monica and
Richard both stare in shock)<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: (laughing) Oh my God, you look so good!<br>
<br>
RACHEL: I can not believe I have to walk down the aisle in front of 200 people looking
like something you drink when your nauseous.</p>

<p>ROSS: So don't, I don't see why we have to go to this thing anyway, it's your
ex-fiancee's wedding.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Because I promised Mindy I would.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Yeah, well you promised Barry, you'd marry him. (Rachel glares at her, and she
retreats to safety between Richard's legs)<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Look you guys, I have to go, I'm the Maid-of-Honor. And besides you know what I
just need to be in a room again with these people and feel good about myself.<br>
<br>
(Chandler enters, sees Rachel in the dress and starts laughing)<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Ooh-oh! Someone's wearing the same clothes they had on last night. Someone get a
little action?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: I may have.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Woo-hoo, stuud!<br>
<br>
ROSS: What's she look like?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Well, we haven't exactly met, we just stayed up all night talking on the
internet.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Woo-hoo, geeek!<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: I like this girl, okay, I seriously like this girl, you now how sometimes I tend
get a little defended and quipy...<br>
<br>
ROSS: Get out!<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Nooo!<br>
<br>
MONICA: Please!<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Well she totally called me on it, okay. She said, 'cut it out, get real', and I
did.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Wow! What's that like?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: It's like this, me, no jokes.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: All right, stop it, you're freaking me out.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Oh, yeah, I don't like you this way. All right, I'll see you guys later.<br>
<br>
ALL: Bye, Richard.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Bye sweetie, (kisses him) I love you.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: I love you, too.<br>
<br>
(Monica stares longingly at the door, after Richard leaves)<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: I think my boyfriend ever so dreamy, I wonder what our wedding's gonna be like.<br>
<br>
MONICA: What are you talking about? What wedding?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Come on, like you never talk that.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Nooo! Never! I mean, we're living in the moment. God, it is so nice for once to
not have to get all hung up on 'Where is this going?'<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Afraid to ask him?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Could not be more terrified.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Well, I think you should seriously consider the marriage thing, give Rachel
another chance to dress up like Princess Bubble Yum.<br>
<br>
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Richard and Monica are playing with Ben.]<br>
<br>
MONICA: (holding up a blanket) Where's Benny? (drops the blanket) There he is! (does it
again) Where's Benny, there he is.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Awww! You know that's probably why babies learn to talk, so they can tell grown
ups to cut it out.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Hey, you know I got a question for ya. Just a little thing, no pressure. <br>
<br>
RICHARD: Okay.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Did you ever, uh, like, think about the future?<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Sure I do.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Yeah, am I in it?<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Honey, you are in it.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Oh God, you are about to get sooo lucky.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Oh, yeah!<br>
<br>
MONICA: Keep talkin'.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Well, uh, sometimes I think about selling my practice, we could move to France,
make French toast.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Okay, so, uh, we're in France, we're making the toast. Do you see a little
bassinet in the corner?<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Like a hound?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Not a basset, a bassinet.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: You really need the bassinet?<br>
<br>
MONICA: Well, I just think the baby would keep falling off the dog. Do you, uh, do you ,
do you not see kids in our future.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Oh, hey. I love children, I have children. I just don't want to be 70 when our
kids go off to college, and our lives can finally start.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Uh-huh.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Look I want you, now.<br>
<br>
MONICA: That's Great. You know we don't need to talk about this now. Really, I mean this
is, is so way, way, way, in the future, I'm talkin' hovercrafts and apes taking over the
planet.<br>
<br>
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler, Joey, and Phoebe are there, Chandler is talking to
his new friend on the internet.]<br>
<br>
JOEY: Come on, Chandler, I want this part soo much. (Chandler ignores him) Just one kiss,
I won't tell anyone.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Joey, no means no!<br>
<br>
[Rachel, in her bridesmaid dress, complete with hat, which makes her look like Little Bo
Peep, and Ross enter]<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Hey!<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: I'm sorry we, we don't have your sheep.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Aww, Rach, I think you look cute (kisses her on the cheek, then looks at Ross) And
you, uh, you, you I could eat with a spoon (goes to kiss him).<br>
<br>
ROSS: Get away from me I said no!<br>
<br>
MONICA: (entering) Richard buzzed. He's waiting downstairs.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Oh, Richard's here. I should run down say bye to him (runs out)<br>
<br>
ALL: Bye.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Bye, good luck.<br>
<br>
(Rachel, Ross, and Monica exit)<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: So how's your date with your cyberchick going. Ooh, hey, what is all that (points
at the computer screen).<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Oh, it's a website, it's the, uh, the Guggenheim <i>(sp?, I'm not an art guy)</i>
museum. See, she likes art, and I like funny words.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: What does she mean by HH?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: (shyly) It means we're holding hands.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Are you the cutest?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: I'm afraid I might just be.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: You know, what I think is so great that you are totally into this person and yet
for all you know she could be like 90 years old, or have two heads, or. It could be a guy.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Okay, it's not a guy, all right, I know her.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: It could be like a big giant guy.<br>
<br>
JOEY: (entering) Man, I got this close to him (holds up his fingers) and Monica kneed me
in the back. What's going on?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: We were just wondering if Chandler's girlfriend is a girl.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Oh, well. Just ask her how long she's gonna live. Women live longer than men.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: How do you not fall down more?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Okay, ask her 'What is her current method of birth control?'<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: All right. (reading her answer) &quot;My husband is sleeping with his
secretary.&quot; She's married! <br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Well at least we know she's a woman.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: I can't believe she's married.<br>
<br>
JOEY: Aw, man I'm sorry (starts rubbing Chandler's shoulder). This must be very tough for
ya, huh (and starts comfroting him looking for a kiss).<br>
<br>
[Scene: Barry and Mindy's wedding, Monica and Richard are standing in the lobby]<br>
<br>
MONICA: So, I read this article in the paper the other day that says you're not supposed
to throw rice at weddings, because when pigeons eat rice it kills them.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Oh, that's why you never see pigeons at sushi bars.(they both start laughing at
Richard's poor joke) See, we're having fun.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Oh, absolutely. Yeah, you know I'm not even thinking about that thing that we're
not supposed to think about.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Neither am I.<br>
<br>
[Scene: later the bridesmaids and ushers are getting ready to start, Ross is looking for
Rachel]<br>
<br>
ROSS: Hey, there. <br>
<br>
RACHEL: Hi.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Are you all right?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Yeah, when I was in the bathroom I saw the window that I crawled out of at my
wedding, and God, I just started thinking that I shouldn't be here, you know I shouldn't,
people are going to be looking at me and judging me and, and thinking about the last time.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Sweetie, it's be gonna okay, all right. It's a wedding, generally people focus on
the bride.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: God I know, you're right.<br>
<br>
(Annoying wedding planner enters)<br>
<br>
WEDDING PLANNER: All rightie, everybody look at me. Good. All right, its time. Bridesmaids
and ushers let's see two lines, thank you.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Okay, I'll see you after the thing.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Okay, good luck (kisses her and leaves)<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Thank you, Okay, Okay. <br>
<br>
[Starts to walk down the aisle, unfortunately she doesn't realize that her dress is
bunched up in her underwear and her butt is showing.]<br>
<br>
COMMERCIAL BREAK<br>
<br>
[Scene: after the wedding, Ross and Rachel are in the lobby]<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Why the hell didn't you tell me!<br>
<br>
ROSS: I'm sorry. What was I supposed to do stand up and shout 'Hey, Rachel, your butt is
showing!'<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Oh my God this is sooo humiliating. I think the only thing that tops that was,
was, was when I was in the eight grade and I had to sing the Copa Cabana in front of the
entire school. I think I got about two lines into it before I ran and freaked out. Oh my
God, my entire life is flashing before my eyes.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Rach, hey look, I remember that, it wasn't so bad.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Oh Ross, would you stop, you got me, I'm dating you.<br>
<br>
MR. WINEBURG: Rachel!<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Oh hi, Mr. Wineburg, hi Mrs. Wineburg.<br>
<br>
MR. WINEBURG: It's so wonderful to see you again, my dear, in fact I hardly expected to
see so much.<br>
<br>
MRS. WINEBURG: You told me you didn't see anything.<br>
<br>
MR. WINEBURG: I tell ya a lot things!<br>
<br>
MRS. WINEBURG: Well it's wonderful to have you up and about, again, dear.<br>
<br>
MR. WINEBURG: Stay well.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Okay, now that is the third time someone has said something like that to me today.<br>
<br>
MINDY: (entering) Rach! Rach!<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Oh, hi!<br>
<br>
MINDY: Oh my God, I'm married!<br>
<br>
RACHEL: I know.<br>
<br>
MINDY: I'm Mrs. Dr. Barry Hunter hyphen Farber.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Oh honey, I'm so proud of you, Min.<br>
<br>
BARRY: (entering) Min. Oh Rach, you're still here, at our wedding, they were packing up
the chopped liver about now.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Yeah, I love that story. Um, I got a question for you guys. Why do people keep is
saying that is good to see me up and about?<br>
<br>
MINDY: Well uh, after you ran out on your wedding, Barry's parents told people that you
were sort of....insane.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Insane!<br>
<br>
MINDY: ...from the syphilis.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: What?!<br>
<br>
BARRY: Yeah, what are they gonna say you didn't love me anymore. Come on.</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Phoebe, Chandler, and Joey are there, Joey is on the
phone.]<br>
<br>
JOEY: Angela? Joey Tribiani. Listen, what are ya doing tonight. I know your seeing that
guy I was thinking maybe you could bring him.....Hello? Hello? (picks up a statue of an
Indian and walks into <br>
his room)<br>
<br>
(the computer bing, bongs)<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Aren't you gonna answer her, that's like the tenth bing-bong message she sent. She
wants to know what's wrong?<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: What's wrong? What's wrong? You're married that's what's wrong.<br>
<br>
(bing, bong)<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Oh, my.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: What?<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: She wants to meet you in person.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Hey, look, Phoebe I wanted to meet her in person too, okay, but she's married,
she has a husband.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: What if the husband person is the wrong guy, and you are the right guy. I mean you
don't get chances like this all the time, if you don't meet her now, you're gonna be
kicking yourself when your 80, which is hard to do, and that's how you break a hip.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Okay, I'll do it!<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Oh, yeah! Okay! Great! Go, man, go put on your shoes, and, and march out there and
meet her! (Chandler runs and picks up his shoes) Oh, wait, no, no you have to take a
shower, 'cause, eww. (Chandler runs to the bathroom, as the computer bing-bongs) No, you
know what you have to answer her, answer her first. (Chandler runs to the computer) No,
no, you know what make some coffee 'cause its too much. (Chandler walks slowly into the
kitchen)<br>
<br>
[Scene: at Barry and Mindy's reception, Monica and Richard are sitting at a table, and
Monica is trying to throw a piece of candy into his mouth.]<br>
<br>
MONICA: Okay, one more, please. Come on, I'm gonna get it in this time, I will.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Okay, last chance. (Monica throws the candy and hits some woman in the back of
the head, Richard turns around and says) Again, I'm sorry.<br>
<br>
MONICA: You know what, maybe I don't need to have children. You know maybe I just think I
do because that is what society, and by that I mean my mom, has always convinced me that
I...(sees two little girls dancing together) I do, I have to have children, I'm sorry, I
just do.<br>
<br>
BEST MAN: (standing up) Yo! Can I have your attention, please, Best Man, making a toast
here. Thank you. (clears throat, and starts reading his toast) I remember when Barry got
home from his first date with Rachel...<br>
<br>
ALL: What?!<br>
<br>
BEST MAN: What, (to Barry) you hired the same band I can't use the same speech. (gets a
'da-doom-chesh' from the drummer) Thank you, thank you very much. Anyway, I wish you both
a wonderful life together. And Rachel...<br>
<br>
RACHEL: What.<br>
<br>
BEST MAN: No, no, no now in all seriousness, its not a lot of women would've had the guts
to come back here tonight, and even fewer, who would do it with their asses hanging out!
(da-doom-chesh)<br>
<br>
ROSS: (standing up) Uh, I like to, uh, to add something to that...<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Why are you adding, why are you adding, why are you adding, why are you adding?<br>
<br>
ROSS: Most of you don't know me, I'm Rachel's boyfriend.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Oh dear God.<br>
<br>
ROSS: Ross, uh and uh, I'd just like to say that it did take a lot of courage for Rachel
to come here tonight. And, uh, for the record she did not run out on Barry because she had
syphilis. (da-doom-chesh) (to drummer) What are you doing I'm serious. Uh, the reason she
walked out on, on Barry is simply that she didn't love him, which incidentally worked out
pretty well for me (looks for the da-doom-chesh, and doesn't get one) Cheers.<br>
<br>
RACHEL: (to Ross) She you in the parking lot.<br>
<br>
ROSS: (runs after her) No, Rach!<br>
<br>
BARRY: And once again she is out of here. Okay who had 9:45? Um?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: (after a pause with everyone staring at her, she goes up to the microphone) Ya,
know what Barr, I'm not gonna leave. I probably should, but I'm not, see 'cause I promised
myself that I would make it through at least *one* of your weddings (da-doom-chesh). See
now, tonight, all I <br>
really wanted was to make it though this evening with a little bit of grace and dignity.
Well (laughing), I guess we can all agree that's not gonna happen. There's nothing really
left to say except....(starts singing) &quot;Her name was Lola. She was a showgirl. With
yellow feathers (band joins in), feathers in her hair, and a dress cut down to there. She
would...&quot;<br>
<br>
ROSS: Marenge,<br>
<br>
RACHEL: (singing) &quot;...marenge, thank you honey, and do the cha-cha. And while she
like to be a star, Tony always tended bar. At the, wait, wait, everybody..&quot;<br>
<br>
ROSS: Everybody!<br>
<br>
RACHEL: At the Copa, Copa Cabana (everyone joins in) The hottest spot north of Havana. At
the Copa, Coo-pa Ca-ban-a, music and fashion were always the passion, at the Copa....<br>
<br>
[Scene: later, Richard and Monica are dancing]<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Okay, I'll do it.<br>
<br>
MONICA: You'll do what?<br>
<br>
RICHARD: If kids is what I takes to be with you then kids it is.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Oh my God!<br>
<br>
RICHARD: If I have to I'll, I'll do all again , I'll do the 4 o'clock feeding thing, I'll
go to the P.T.A. meetings, I'll coach the soccer team.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Really?<br>
<br>
RICHARD: Yeah, if I have to. Monica, I don't wanna lose you, so if I have to do it all
over again, then I will.<br>
<br>
MONICA: You're the most wonderful man. And if you hadn't of said 'if I have to' like
seventeen times, then I'd be saying 'okay, let's do it.'<br>
<br>
RICHARD: But you're not.<br>
<br>
MONICA: Oh my God, I can't believe what I'm getting ready to say. I wanna have a baby, but
I don't wanna have one with someone who doesn't really wanna have one.<br>
<br>
RICHARD: God. I love you.<br>
<br>
MONICA: I know you do. Me too. (pause) So what now?<br>
<br>
RICHARD: I guess we just keep dancing.<br>
<br>
[Scene: Central Perk, Chandler, Rachel, Ross, Joey, and Phoebe are there waiting for
Chandler's cyberchick to arrive]<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Where is she, Where is she? (grabs Rachel) Oh, hey, I have a question, where is
she?<br>
<br>
RACHEL: Chandler, relax, Chandler, she'll be here.<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: (noticing a beautiful blond walking in) Ooh, oh, oh, that's her.<br>
<br>
ROSS: (seeing her also) Yeah, 'cause life's just that kind.<br>
<br>
PHOEBE: Chandler, you gotta stop staring at the door. It's like a watched pot, you know if
you keep looking at it then the door is to, never gonna boil. I think what you have to do
is try not to...<br>
<br>
(Chandler's date walks in)<br>
<br>
CHANDLER: Oh my God! (it's Janice)<br>
<br>
JANICE: OH.....MY.....GAWD!! (Chandler rushes over and kisses her)<br>
<br>
ALL: OH.....MY.....GOD!!<br>
<br>
CLOSING CREDITS<br>
<br>
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is reading a script as Ross enters]<br>
<br>
ROSS: All right I've been feeling incredibly guilty about this, because I wanna be a good
friend, and dammit I am a good friend. So just, just shut up and close your eyes (kisses
Joey).<br>
<br>
JOEY: Wow, you are a good friend, 'course the audition was this morning, and I didn't get
it. But that was a hell of a kiss. Rachel is a very lucky girl.<br>
</p>
<font size="4"><b>

<p align="center">END</b></font> </font></p>
