301<html>

<head>
<title>The One With the Princess Leia Fantasy</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="white" text="black" link="green" vlink="black" alink="yellow">

<h1 align="center">The One With the Princess Leia Fantasy</h1>

<hr>
<i>

<p></i>Written by: Michael Curtis and Gregory S. Malins<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a> </p>

<hr>
<font size="3">

<p align="left">[Scene Central Perk, the whole gang is entering]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I'm tellin' ya that girl totally winked at me.</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Did not, she did not wink at you...(sees that their sacred couch is
occupied by strangers).</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Huh. (They all leave, dejected)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Opening Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Rachel and Monica's, Phoebe, Ross, and Rachel are eating breakfast.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I have to say <em>Tupolo Honey</em> by Van Morrison.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Nooo Way! The most romantic song ever is <em>The Way We Were</em>.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> See, I-I think that one that Elton John wrote for, um, that guy on <em>Who's
The Boss</em>.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What song was that, Pheebs?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (singing) <em>Hold me close, young Tony Dan-za</em>.</p>

<p>(Monica enters from her bedroom)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hi Monica!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey Mon!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hey Mon!</p>

<p>(she just walks straight into the bathroom)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh my God, has she slept at all?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Nope.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No, it's been three nights in a row.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, she finally stopped crying yesterday, but then she found one of
Richard's cigar butts out on the terrace, so.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, okay that explains it. I got a call at two in the morning, but all I
could hear was, like, this high squeaky sound, so I thought okay its like a mouse or a
opossum. But then I realized where would a mouse or a opossum get the money to make the
phone call.</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is coming in from the bedroom]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Morning.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Morning, hey, you made pancakes?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, like there's any way I could ever do that.</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> (entering and singing) Monica and Rachel had syrup, now I can get my man
to cheer up. (laughs hysterically) Good morning Joey.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (sarcastically) Good morning.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey, you know what, here's a thought. Why don't you stay home from
work today and just hang out with me.</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Oh, I wish. Look, honey, you have that report to finish, and I gotta go
see my lawyer. </p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I can not believe that I am going out with someone that is getting
divorced. I'm such a grown up.</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> (laughs) I-I-I gotta go, I gotta go. Okay, not without a kiss.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, maybe I won't kiss you, and then you'll have to stay.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (under his breath) Kiss her! Kiss her!</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> I'll see you later, sweetie. Bye Joey.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> B-bye Janice. So when ya' dumpin' her.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Nope, not this time.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Come on, quite yankin' me.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I'm not <b>yanking</b> you.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> This is Janice.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, I know. She makes me happy.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay. All right. You look me in the eye and tell me, without blinking,
that you're not breaking up with her. No blinking.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (looks him in the eye) I'm not breaking up with her! (they stare at
each other for a while, then Joey blows in his face)</p>

<p>[Scene: Rachel and Monica's, Monica is entering from the bathroom.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> God, look what I found in the drain.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> It's some of Richard's hair! (holds it close to Ross) What do I do with
this?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Getting it away from me would be job one.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> It's weird, but you know what I don't wanna throw this away. I mean this
is like all I have left of him, gross, drain hair. Ooh! (drops it in Ross's cereal)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ooh. Oh. It looks like, like a tiny little person drowning in your
cereal. (Ross gives her this look, like 'Yeah, doesn't it', and gets up to dump it down
the drain.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> God, what is wrong with me.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You need to get some sleep.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I need to get some Richard.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Monica, you broke up with him for a reason.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I know, I know. I'm just so tired of-of missing him. I'm tired of
wondering why hasn't he called. Why hasn't he called!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Maybe, because you told him not to.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What are you the memory woman?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (entering) Their not breaking up. Chandler and Janice. Their not breaking
up. He didn't blink or anything.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, you know I'm not surprised. I mean have you seen them together,
they're really cute.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Cute! This is Janice! You remember Janice?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yes, Joey, I remember, she's annoying, but you know what she's-she's his
girlfriend now. I mean what can we do?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> There you go! That's the spirit I'm looking for! What can we do? Huh? All
right who's first? Huh? Ross?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well I'm thinking that Chandler's our friend and Janice makes him happy,
so I say we just all be adult about it and accept her.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, we'll call that Plan B. All right?</p>

<p>[Scene: Ross's bedroom, Ross is working and Rachel is reading a book in bed]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (she leans over and kisses him on the cheek) Honey, I was wondering....</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hmm?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Do you still have that, um, Navy uniform?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Nooo, I had to return it to the costume place.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hmm.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I think I have an old band uniform from high school.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You remember not having sex in high school, right?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well honey, what about you?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I mean do you have any fun, you know, fantasy type things?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Come on you gotta have one!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Nope.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ross, you know what...</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> ...if you tell me, I might do it.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, umm. Did you ever see, um, <em>Return Of The Jedi</em>?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Do you remember the scene with, um, Jabba the Hut? Well Jabba had as, as
his prisoner, um, Princess Leia. </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oooh!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Princess Leia, was wearing this, um, gold bikini thing. It was pretty
cool.</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe and Rachel are there]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, oh, Princess Leia and the gold bikini, every guy our age loved
that.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Really!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Um, um. It's huge. Yeah, that's the moment, when-when, you know she
stopped being a princess, and became, like, a woman, you know.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Did you ever do the-the Leia thing?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, yeah, um-mm. Oh!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Really! That-that great huh?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No it's just that I got this new pager and I have it on vibrate. See ya!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (entering with Monica in tow) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hi you guys!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Look who I found standing outside of the Szechwan Dragon staring at a
parking meter.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Mon. Hi! </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hi.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Why aren't you at work?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, they-they sent me home.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Why?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Because I don't work at the Szechwan Dragon.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You really, really need to get some sleep, honey.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I know I do.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hi.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hi.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Guess what?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> They published my paper.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, really, let me see, let me see.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Rach, look! (she holds two buns up to her ears to make her hair look
like the Princess Leia 'do.) Oh, hi! Where is my strong Ross Skywalker to come rescue me.
(Ross stands up horrified) There he is.</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is watching Wheel of Fortune, the puzzle is showing
_oun_ Rush_ore.]</p>

<p>[Chandler enters]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Wheel!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Of!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Fortune! This guy is so stupid. (yelling) It's Count Rushmore!!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You know, you should really go on this show. All right, listen, I got
three tickets to the Rangers tonight. What'd ya' say?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I say, 'I am there!' Cool! Aw, is Ross going to?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No, Janice.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Jan-ice. 'Cause I, just, I feel bad for Ross, you know, we-we always go
together, we're like the three hocke-teers.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You know, I may be way out on a limb here, but do you, do you, have a
problem with Janice?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No, Yeeees. God, how do I say this. (walks into the kitchen, Chandler
follows closely, he turns around and gets startled). Oh, hi, you know that girl from the
Greek restaurant with the hair (holds his hands up to signify she has big hair)?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Ooh, that girl that I hate, eww, drives me crazy, eww, eww, oh!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Look, I don't hate Janice, she's-she's just a lot to take, you know.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, there you go.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, hey. Come on man, don't look at me like that, she used to drive you
nuts before too, remember?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, I'm crazy about her now. I think this could be the real thing.
Capital 'R'! Capital 'T'! (Joey stares at him) Don't worry, those are the right letters.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Look, what do you want me to say?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I want you to say that you like her!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I can't. It's like this chemical thing, you know. Every time she starts
laughing, I just wanna (grimaces and tenses up) pull my arm off just so that I can have
something to throw at her. </p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Thanks for trying. (grabs the ticket and starts to leave) Oh, and by
the way there is no Count Rushmore!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, then-then who's the guy that painted the faces on the mountain?
(Chandler gives him a look like 'You stupid idiot!')</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Commercial Break</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel and Ross are entering]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> How could you have told her? </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ross, I didn't think it would that big of a deal.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, she didn't think it would be that big of deal.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, who are you talking to when you do that?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Look, that was supposed to be like a private, personal thing between us.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, Ross, Phoebe is my girlfriend, okay, we tell each other
everything. You know, I mean, come on, guys do the same thing, I mean, what about all that
locker room stuff.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> That's different, okay. That's like, uh 'Who dated a stripper?' or 'Who
did it on the back of the Staton Island Ferry?'.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Were both of those Joey?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah. Look, you don't, you don't talk about like, you know, your
girlfriend and the intimate stuff you, you do with her.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Not even with your best friend.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Noo!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> That is so sad. Your missing out on so much, Ross. I mean, the bonding
and the sharing, you know. And-and knowing that someone else is going through the same
thing you are.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hmph. So what you, you tell each other everything?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Pretty much.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Did you talk about the night of five times? Do you tell people about the
night of five times? </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Uh, honey, yeah that was with Carol.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I know, but it's still worth mentioning, I think.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica's bedroom, Phoebe is trying to relax her.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> ( in a soothing voice) Relax every muscle in your body. Listen to the
plinky-plunky music. Okay, now close you eyes, and think of a happy place. Okay, tell me
your happy place.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Richard's living room, drinking wine.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> All right. No, no, no, not a Richard thing, just put down the glass. And
get out!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I'm sorry, but that's my happy place.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, okay, fine, use my happy place. Okay, I'm just gonna, I have to
ask that you don't move anything.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> All right, I'll try not to.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, all right, so, your in a meadow, millions of stars in the sky....</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Do you think breaking up with him was a huge mistake?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> All right, there are no questions in the happy place. Okay, just, the
warm breeze, and the moonlight flowing through the trees....</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I'll bet he's totally over me, I'll bet he's fine.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> All right, betting and wagering of any kind, are, I'm sure, not
permitted in the happy place. Okay. Just-just, you know, the-the lovely waterfalls, and
the, the trickling fountains. And the-the calming sounds of the babbling brook....</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay, this isn't working. I'm still awake and now I have to pee.</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's]</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> So, I hear, you hate me!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I, ah, I never said hate, I was very careful about that.</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> A little birdie told me something about you wanting to rip your arm off
and throw it at me.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> And you got a 'hate' from that?! Your taking a big leap there...</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> All right, fine, fine, fine, fine, fine, we've got to do something about
our little situation here Joey. So, this is my idea: you and me spending some quality time
together.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> But what does that gonna do...</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> For Chandler!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay. I'm in.</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Okay. All right. This is what we're gonna call it: 'Joey and Janice's <b>DAY
OF FUN!</b>'</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Does it have to be a whole day?</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Yes, because that's how long it takes to love me.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, I know, I sleep in the next room.</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Rachel and Monica are entering]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (crying) So, I went down to the post office, and it turns out it was
those videos that I ordered for Richard about the Civil War. He loved the Civil War.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Monica, do you want us to take you home?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Uh, huh. (to Ross) Or maybe to a galaxy far, far away. (Rachel, Monica,
and Phoebe leave)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Women tell each other everything. Did you know that?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Umm, yeah.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No Chandler, everything! Like stuff you like, stuff she likes, technique,
stamina, girth....</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Girth? Why, why, why, wh-why, why, why, why would they do this? </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Rachel says sharing's great and supposedly, you know, we outta be doing
it. Do you wanna?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> We're not gonna talk about girth are we?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Nooo!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, okay.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah! All right! You go first.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, okay, I'll go first.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> So, uh, the other night Rachel and I are in bed talking about fantasies,
and I happened to describe a particular Star Wars thing....</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Princess Leia in the gold bikini.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yes! </p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I know!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yes! Wow, well, that-that was easy. Okay, you-you go.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, you know, you know when your in bed, with a woman.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hmph.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> And, ah, you know, your fooling around with her. And you get all these
like, mental images in your brain, you know, like Elle MacPherson, or that girl at the
Xerox place....</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> With the belly-button ring? Oh, muhawa!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I know, And then all of the sudden your Mom pops into your head. And
your like 'Mom, get outta here!' You know, but of course, like, after that you can't
possibly think of anything else, and you can't, you know, stop what your doing. So it's
kinda like, you're, you know. You know...(Ross just stares at him). You don't know!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Your Mom, your telling me, your telling me, about your Mom, what is the
matter with you?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You said...</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I said '<b>share</b>' not '<b>scare</b>'. Go sit over there! (Chandler
goes over and sits at a table and puts his head down).</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey and Janice are returning from their DAY OF FUN!]</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> We're baack!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What are you guys doing together?</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Joey and Janice's <b>DAY OF FUN</b>!!! (laughs)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Really.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, yeah. We went to a Mets game, we got Chinese food, and you know, I
love this woman. You have got competition buddy.</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> I just came by to give you a kiss, I have to go pick up the baby, so.
I'll see you later sweetheart, you too Chandler. (laughs)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You still can't stand her can you?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I'm sorry man, I tired, I really did.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, you know, I appreciate you giving it a shot.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> But, hey, look, you know the good thing is, is that we spent the whole day
together and I survived, and what's even more amazing, so did she. It was bat day at Shea
Stadium.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, I guess that's something.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No man, that's huge! Now, I know I can stand to be around her, which means
I get to hang out with you, which is kinda the whole point, anyway.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, hey, Chandler, we, ah, we stopped by the coffee shop and ran into
Ross.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh God!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey, if it makes you feel any better, I do it too.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Really?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh yeah, I always picture your Mom when I'm having sex.</p>

<p>[Scene: Rachel and Monica's, Monica is watching the Civil War videos]</p>

<p><strong>Video:</strong>April Twelve, Eighteen hundred, Sixty-One (Monica lights
Richard's cigar butt), 4:30 A.M. on Tuesday, the United States garrison at Fort Sumter was
fired upon (knock on door) it is now under bombardment by.... </p>

<p>(Monica answers the door)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hi, Dad, what are you doing here?</p>

<p><b>Mr. Geller:</b> Well, it's your mother's bridge night so I thought that I would come
into the city for a little Monicuddle. (hugs her) Since when did you start smoking cigars?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I don't, I just, I just like the smell of them. So, uh, what are you
really doing here Dad?</p>

<p><b>Mr. Geller:</b> Well, I just wanted to make sure you were okay.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What makes you think that I might not be okay?</p>

<p><b>Mr. Geller:</b> I saw Richard.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh.</p>

<p><b>Mr. Geller:</b> So, how are you doing?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I'm fine, just a little tired, I'm okay. How's Richard doing?</p>

<p><b>Mr. Geller:</b> You don't wanna know.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No, I really, really do.</p>

<p><b>Mr. Geller:</b> Well, he's doing terrible!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Really!</p>

<p><b>Mr. Geller:</b> Worse than when he broke up with Barbara.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You're not just saying that are you?</p>

<p><b>Mr. Geller:</b> No, the man is a mess.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Was he crying?</p>

<p><b>Mr. Geller:</b> No.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well, do you think he was waiting 'til after you left, so he could cry?</p>

<p><b>Mr. Geller:</b> Maybe.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I think so.</p>

<p><b>Mr. Geller:</b> Honey, relationships are hard. Like with your Mom and me. You know
after we graduated college we broke up for a while. It seems her Father, your Grandfather,
wanted her to travel around Europe, like he did. Of course, he got to do it on Uncle Sam's
nickel, because he was also strafing German troop trains at the time. However, (turns
around and sees that Monica is sleeping and puts a blanket around her, kisses her, picks
up the cigar, and starts watching the video)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Closing Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Ross's bedroom, Ross is humming the Star Wars theme. Rachel enters, with her
hair done up like Princess Leia's, and wearing a belly dancer's outfit, to simulate the
gold bikini thing.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, here we go. I'm Jabba's prisoner, and you have a really weird look
on your face. What? Honey, what is it? Did I get it wrong? Did I get the hair wrong? What?
Did you just picture it differently? What? What?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, no it's, um, it's not you, um, it's um, it's (turns and sees his Mom
standing where Rachel is)</p>

<p><strong>Mrs. Geller:</strong> Well what is it? Come on sweetie, your like, freaking me
out here.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I hate Chandler, the bastard ruined my life. (Rachel starts looking around
and down, with a 'What the hell is going on?' look on her face.)</p>
</font>

<p align="center"><strong><font size="3">End</font></strong></p>
</body>

<head>

<title>The One Where No-one's Ready</title>
</head>

<body TEXT="#000000" LINK="#008000" VLINK="#000000" BGCOLOR="#ffffff" alink="yellow">

<h1 ALIGN="CENTER">The One Where No-one's Ready</h1>

<hr>

<p>Written by: Ira Ungerleider<br>
Transcribed by: <a HREF="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a> </p>

<hr>

<p>[Scene: Rachel and Monica's, everyone is getting ready to go to a banquet]</p>
<b>

<p>Joey:</b> All right they got water, orange juice, and what looks like cider. (takes a
glass from the fridge.)</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> Taste it.</p>
<b>

<p>Joey:</b> (drinks from the glass and puts it back in the fridge) Yep, it's fat. I drank
fat!</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> Yeah, I know, I did that two minutes ago.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> (entering) Hey!</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> Hey, mister tux!</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Why aren't you guys dressed?</p>
<b>

<p>Joey:</b> We have a half hour.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> No, four minutes ago you had a half hour, we have to be out the door at
twenty to eight. </p>
<b>

<p>Joey:</b> Relax Ross, we'll be ready. It only takes us two minutes to get dressed.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Well, you know, I'd feel a whole lot better if you got dressed now.</p>
<strong>

<p>Chandler and </strong><b>Joey:</b> Okay. (they don't move)</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> (entering from bathroom) Hey-hey! Oh, look at you, all sexy.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Really.</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> Ooooh! Wow!! Oh, hi.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Hi.</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> How come you didn't come over earlier?</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> 'Cause, I'm a stupid, stupid man.</p>
<b>

<p>Joey:</b> Hey, Ross, want some cider?</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> No. (to Rachel) So, um, let's see your pretty close, huh. Make-up's on,
hair's done. </p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> Yeah, I just have to get dressed.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Yay! And that takes what? Just six or seven minutes.</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> Yeah! Once, I figure out what I'm wearing.</p>
<b>

<p>Joey:</b> Glass of fat?</p>
<strong>

<p ALIGN="CENTER">Opening Credits</p>
</strong>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's. Ross is acting nervous]</p>
<b>

<p>Joey:</b> What's a matter Ross? What you're nervous about your speech?</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> No! Do you wanna hear it?</p>
<b>

<p>Joey:</b> Am I in it?</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Uh, huh. Yeah, right after I thank everyone for giving money to the museum, I
sing a song about the wonder that is Joey.</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe:</b> (entering) Hello.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Hey!</p>
<b>

<p>Joey:</b> Whoa!</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Wow, hello! You look great!</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe:</b> Thank you! I know, though.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> You see this, this is a person who is ready to go. Phoebe you, oh, you are my
star.</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe:</b> Ohh, well, you're my lucky penny.</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> (entering from bathroom, with an issue of Cosmo) All right, I took the
quiz, and it turns out, I do put career before men. (to Joey) Get up.</p>
<b>

<p>Joey:</b> What?</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> You're in my seat.</p>
<b>

<p>Joey:</b> How is this your seat?</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> 'Cause I was sitting there.</p>
<b>

<p>Joey:</b> But then you left.</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> Well, it's not like I went to Spain. I went to the bathroom, you knew I
was coming back.</p>
<b>

<p>Joey:</b> What's the big deal, sit somewhere else.</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> The big deal is I was sitting there last, so, that's my seat.</p>
<b>

<p>Joey:</b> Well, actually the last place you were sitting was in there (points to the
bathroom). Soo...</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> You guys, you know what, you know what, it doesn't matter, because you both
have to go get dressed before the big vain in my head pops. So..</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> All right, Ross, I just have to do one thing, really quickly, it's not a
big deal. (yells at Joey) GET UP!!</p>
<b>

<p>Monica:</b> (entering) Hi.</p>
<strong>

<p>All:</strong> Hey.</p>
<b>

<p>Monica:</b> Ooh, Phoebe, you look great!</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe:</b> All right all ready.</p>
<b>

<p>Monica:</b> (to Ross) Ooh, are you gonna do magic?</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> That's, that's funny. Change!</p>
<b>

<p>Monica:</b> Hang on a second I just got in.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Look, I don't care it starts at eight, we can't be late.</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe:</b> We could not, would not want to wait.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Look, our table is down in front, okay, my boss is gonna be there, everyone
will see if we arrive after it starts.</p>
<b>

<p>Monica:</b> Has somebody been drinking my fat? (Joey and Chandler look at each other)</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> (entering from her bedroom) You guys, (holds up an outfit) does this look
like something the girlfriend of a paleontologist would wear?</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe:</b> I don't know, you might be the first one.</p>
<b>

<p>Monica:</b> Rach, did you check the machine?</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> Uh, no. Wait, you know what, this is the outfit that makes my calves look
fat. Nevermind.</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> Well, Joey, I wrote a little song today. It's called: Get Up.</p>
<b>

<p>Joey:</b> All right! You can have the chair.</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> Really!</p>
<b>

<p>Joey:</b> Oh my, would you look at that! (holds up crossed fingers)</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe:</b> (on machine) &quot;Hi, it's me, I'm coming over now. Hey, what if I'm
already there when your playing this message?&quot; (to the guys) Is that too spooky?</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> (on machine) &quot;Hi Rach, are you there? It's me, pick up. Rachel.
Rach!&quot;</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> (entering from her bedroom) What?!</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Nevermind.</p>
<strong>

<p>Richard:</strong> (on machine) &quot;Monica, it's Richard. Call me.&quot;</p>
<b>

<p>Monica:</b> Is-is-is that message old or new? (yelling) Old or new?! Old or new?!</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> It's old, it's definitely old. Didn't you hear the, the double beep?</p>
<b>

<p>Monica:</b> What if it's new? I mean, we agreed not to talk again, unless we had
something really important to say. Shouldn't I call him back?</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> Honey, you did call him back. 'Cause, it's, it's really old.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Yeah, see Mon, listen, listen. When Carol and I broke up, I went through the
same thing. And you know what I did?</p>
<b>

<p>Monica:</b> Huh?</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> I.....got.....dressed. Really, really quickly. Okay, okay. (Rachel starts to
follow Monica into her room, but Ross stops her and sends her back to her room.) There we
go, there we go.</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> You know what, okay, fine. Don't get up, you just sit right there. I just
hope, you don't mind, you know, my hand right here. (holds his hand a couple of inches in
front of Joey's face) Op, not touching, can't get mad! Not touching can't get mad! Not
touching can't get mad! (Joey flings some dip onto Phoebe's dress)</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe:</b> Ah! Oh my God! You r-r-rotten boys!</p>
<strong>

<p>Chandler and </strong><b>Joey:</b> Sorry Phoebe.</p>
<b>

<p>Joey:</b> I'm so sorry.</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe:</b> What am I gonna do?</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> No, no, don't, don't, rub it! Don't! (clapping) What gets out hummus?! What
gets out hummus?!</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe:</b> Monica, Monica, you know what gets out hummus.</p>
<b>

<p>Monica:</b> If it is a new message, what is he calling to say?</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe:</b> Okay, thanks. Yeah, I'll try that.</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> Maybe he's calling to say your obsessive and crazy.</p>
<b>

<p>Monica:</b> So, should I call him back?</p>
<strong>

<p>The Guys:</strong> Noo! (Monica starts to go back into her room and stops) NO!</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> All right, fine, you know what, we'll both sit in the chair. (sits on
Joey's lap) I'm soooo, comfortable.</p>
<b>

<p>Joey:</b> Me too. In fact, I think I might be a little too comfortable.</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> All right! (jumps up)</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Okay, look, we have nineteen minutes. Okay, Chandler, I want you to go and
change! Okay. And then, when you come back, Joey will go change, and he'll have vacated
the chair. Okay. Okay.</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> All right! Fine! I'm going. But when I get back it's chair sitting, and
I'm the guy who's....sitting in a chair! (leaves)</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> (entering from her room) Is this a little too... (sees Phoebe) Pheebs, what
happened?</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe:</b> Hummus. I got the hummus.</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> Ooooh! Honey, well we'll find you something. Do you wanna wear my black
jacket? </p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe:</b> That won't go with this dress though.</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> No, you're right. Well, we'll find something. Let's just get you out of
that. Come on.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> No, no, no, no, no, no, not out of that, not out of clothes.</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> Monica, can Phoebe borrow your green dress?</p>
<b>

<p>Monica:</b> I called him.</p>
<strong>

<p>All:</strong> Nooo.</p>
<b>

<p>Monica:</b> Yes. Well I got his machine and I left a message. But it's okay, it's okay,
it's okay, because you know it was like a casual, breezy message. It was breezy! Oh God,
what if it wasn't breezy? </p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe:</b> Well, how could it not be breezy, no, 'cause, you're, you're in such a
breezy place.</p>
<b>

<p>Monica:</b> Here, I got it. I'll will play my message for you guys, and you can tell me
if it's breezy enough.</p>
<b>

<p>Joey:</b> Monica, how are you gonna do that?</p>
<b>

<p>Monica:</b> I know the code to his answering machine.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Okay, Mon, I really don't think this is the... Okay, you're dialing, you are
dialing.</p>

<p>(Chandler enters, and Joey is standing near the chair, they have a show down to see who
gets the chair and Joey wins)</p>
<strong>

<p>Richard:</strong> (on machine) &quot;Hi, this is Richard. Please, leave a message at
the tone.&quot;</p>
<b>

<p>Machine:</b> &quot;You have two new messages.&quot;</p>
<b>

<p>Joey:</b> Wow, what a cool job. (in a machine voice) 'You have two new messages.'
'Please, pass the pie.'</p>
<b>

<p>Monica:</b> (on machine) &quot;Hi, it's Monica. I'm just checking in 'cause I got this
message from you and I didn't know if it was old or new or what. So, I'm just checkin'. So
let me know, or don't, whatever. I'm breezy.&quot;</p>
<b>

<p>Joey:</b> Hey, you can't say you're breezy, that, that totally negates the breezy.</p>
<strong>

<p>Woman's Voice:</strong> (on machine) Hola, it's me, yesterday was really fun. Call me
about this weekend, okay.</p>
<b>

<p>Joey:</b> Now she sounded breezy.</p>
<strong>

<p ALIGN="CENTER">Commercial Break</p>
</strong>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, continued from earlier]</p>
<b>

<p>Monica:</b> He's seeing someone. I can't believe he's seeing someone.</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe:</b> Monica, you don't know that.</p>
<b>

<p>Monica:</b> Well, who's voice was that?</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> Maybe it was his sister's. You know, maybe it was his daughter's.</p>
<b>

<p>Monica:</b> Michelle! Of course, it was Michelle! Did it sound like Michelle?</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Oh, great. It's starting to rain, that will make it easy to get a cab.</p>
<b>

<p>Monica:</b> It was Michelle. It was definitely Michelle.</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> Pheebs, you go with Monica and try on her green dress. If that doesn't
work, you can wear my gray silk one. Oh, gosh, what am I wearing?!</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> You don't, you don't know what your wearing?</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> Well, hon-ey. I'm just trying to look nice for your big night.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Yeah, which, which we have to leave for in exactly twelve minutes. All right,
come on, I'll just pick something out for you.</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> All right, you will notice that I am fully dressed. I, in turn, have
noticed that you are not. So in the words of A. A. Milne, &quot;Get out of my chair,
dillhole!&quot;</p>
<b>

<p>Joey:</b> Okay. (he gets up and takes the cushions with him, as he starts to leave)</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> What are you doing?</p>
<b>

<p>Joey:</b> You said I had to give you the chair, you didn't say anything about the
cushions.</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> The cushions are the essence of the chair!</p>
<b>

<p>Joey:</b> That's right! I'm taking the essence.</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> Oh-ho, it'll be back. Oh-ho, there's nobody in the room.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Look, I'm sorry, I thought it looked pretty.</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> Ross, that was a Halloween costume, unless you would like me to go to this
thing as Little Bo Peep.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Look, I didn't recognize it without that inflatable sheep.</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> Yeah, which, by the way Chandler, I would like back one of these days.</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe:</b> Oh Rach, good, listen isn't this perfect for me! (she's wearing another
dress on a hanger around her neck)</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> Oh, it's perfect! But not for tonight.</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe:</b> Well, of course not for tonight. Yeah, hi!</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Not for tonight. Not for tonight! Wh-what, what, what, are you doing?</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> No honey, we're sorry, we didn't mean it. I love you. I love you.</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> We used them as pillows when we went camping.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> What?</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> (shyly) The sheep.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Hey, what you do on your own time...</p>
<b>

<p>Joey:</b> (entering) Where's my underwear?!</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Whoa, whoa, whoa. Come on, come on, what. You took his underwear?</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> He took my essence!</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Okay, now hold on. Joey, why, why can't you just wear the underwear you're
wearing now?</p>
<b>

<p>Joey:</b> Because, I'm not wearing any underwear now.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Okay, then why do you have to wear underwear tonight?</p>
<b>

<p>Joey:</b> It's a rented tux. Okay. I'm not gonna go commando in another man's fatigues.</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> Well, then it looks like somebody is gonna have to give back somebody his
cushions.</p>
<b>

<p>Joey:</b> Okay, you hide my clothes. I'm gonna do the exact opposite to you.</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> What are you, what are you gonna <b>show</b> me my clothes?</p>
<b>

<p>Joey:</b> Hey, opposite, is opposite! (leaves)</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> He's got nothing!</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe:</b> (entering from Rachel's room, wearing a huge bow to cover the stain) Okay,
I'm ready.</p>
<strong>

<p>Ross and </strong><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, aaaah!</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe:</b> Rachel, didn't have anything that I liked, so, but she had this Christmas
ribbon, and I thought, 'All right, fine I'll be political.'</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> What are you supporting?</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe:</b> Duh!! Christmas!</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Okay, hey, that's okay with me. Two down and I have exactly twelve
minutes.... Wha, my watch stopped. My watch. (shows Chandler) Okay, see, the, the dinosaur
tail isn't going around any more. (grabs Chandler's watch) What time is it? It's 7:33, I
have seven minutes. I have seven minutes!!</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> (entering from her room) Okay, Pheebs, quick, what shoes should I wear? The
black or the purple?</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Just, just, just pick one!</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe:</b> Okay, okay, okay, the black. But, oh, do you have black, with the little
strappys?</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> Yeahh, but, but those really go better with pants. Maybe I should wear
pants?</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Yeah, pants, what, what an idea. Or better yet, um, how 'bout you go without
any pants. Look, I don't know what you're trying to do to me, but just get your butt in
there and pick out any shoes that fit your feet, okay. No, no I don't care if they match.
I don't care if they make your ankles or your knees or your earlobes look fat. Okay.</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> But I...</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> No, no, no just do it. Go in there and pick something out so we can go.</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> All right.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Thank you!</p>
<b>

<p>Monica:</b> (entering from her room) Okay. I gotta call Michelle. I gotta see if that
was her voice or not. I'm sorry, I just have to.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> It was, it was her voice.</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> Monica, I think you've gone over to the bad place.</p>
<strong>

<p>Michelle:</strong> Hola! Hello. Hello?</p>
<b>

<p>Monica:</b> Okay. That was her right?</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe:</b> Definitely.</p>
<b>

<p>Monica:</b> See there you go. Woo! We're out of the woods. Okay, I'll get dressed now.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Yay!</p>

<p>(phone rings)</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe:</b> I'll get it, okay. (answers phone) Hi, Monica and Rachel's. (listens) Yeah,
just a second, can I ask who's calling. (to Monica) Oh, ew, it's Michelle! Ew! She, she
must have that Caller Id thing. You should get that. </p>
<b>

<p>Monica:</b> (on phone) Uh, Michelle. Yeah, that was me, I-I dialed your number by
mistake. (listens) Oh, you're so sweet. Yeah, we were a great couple. I know I really miss
him. Well, you know how it is, it's that....</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> (to Phoebe) You know what's weird. Donald Duck never wore pants. But
whenever he's getting out of the shower, he always put a towel around his waist. I mean,
what is that about?</p>
<b>

<p>Monica:</b> (on phone) Michelle, I only beeped in so I could hear my message. I mean
that's allowed. Yeah-huh! I mean look, yeah, you know what I would really appreciate it if
you didn't tell your Dad about. What do you mean, you're not comfortable with this? Come
on we're friends!! (Michelle hangs up) That bitch always hated me. I'm calling her back.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> No, no, no, no. Tick, tick, tick, tick.</p>
<b>

<p>Monica:</b> Okay, fine. (runs to her room)</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> They got a phone in there, right?</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe:</b> Okay, we're on it. We're on it.</p>

<p>(Rachel comes out from her room wearing sweat pants and a sweatshirt)</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Um. I know it says black tie optional, but, um this may be pushing it a
little, um.</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> I'm not gonna gooo.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> You're not going to go.</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> No, I think I'm gonna catch up on my correspondence.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> How, how, um how can you not be going?</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> I'm not gonna gooo, so I think that will accomplish the not going.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Um, you know, just out of curiosity...</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> Well, ever since I was humiliated and yelled at in front of my friends, I'm
just, I don't know, not in a museum benefitty kind of mood.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Right. Right, okay, okay. I'm sorry. I'm sorry I yelled.</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> It's fine.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> No, but, your-your mad.</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> I'm not mad. </p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> No.</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> I'm just not going.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Your not going.</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> Right.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Okay. You know that I-I have to go.</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> Um, hum.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Right. So is it gonna be like 'I'm abandoning you while your upset.'</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> No.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> No, because your not upset.</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> Right.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> About the yelling.</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> Right, and the humiliating.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Oh, well of course, the humiliating. So, so wee, we're okay.</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> Um, hum.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> We're good.</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> Right.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Okay. Honey?</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> Yes, Ross. (turns toward him)</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> I love you. (goes to kiss her and she turns away.)</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe:</b> (yelling from the bedroom) Get away from that! No! (she comes into the
living room carrying the phone) She's just getting dressed.</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> Is it wrong that I was totally aroused by that?</p>

<p>(Joey enters wearing a lot of clothes)</p>
<b>

<p>Joey:</b> Okay, buddy-boy. Here it is. You hide my clothes, I'm wearing everything you
own.</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> Oh my God! That is so not the opposite of taking somebody's underwear!! </p>
<b>

<p>Joey:</b> Look at me! I'm Chandler! Could I <b>be</b> wearing any more clothes? Maybe
if I wasn't going commando...</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> Oooo-ooh!</p>
<b>

<p>Joey:</b> Yeah. Whew, it's hot with all of this stuff on. I ah, I better not do any, I
don't know, lunges. (starts doing lunges)</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Okay, okay. Enough, enough with the lunging. No! I'm sick of this. Okay. I've
had it up to here with you two! Neither you can come to the party!</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> Jeez, what a baby.</p>
<b>

<p>Joey:</b> Yeah, Ross, way to ruin it. I was just going to get dressed.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> You know what I don't care. The only person I cared about getting dressed, is
the one person that says she's not even gonna go. Look Rach, I'm sorry. Okay. Look, I-I
wa, I was a jerk. I'm sorry I yelled. I want you there, I need you there. Look, what, what
can I do that can show you how much, how much I want you to be there.</p>
<b>

<p>Joey:</b> You could drink the fat.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Hi, welcome, to an adult conversation.</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> No, no, no, now wait, wa, wa, waa-it a minute, wait a minute, wait a
minute, wait a minute. That actually, uh, that sounds interesting.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> What?</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> I think you <b>should</b> drink the fat.</p>
<b>

<p>Joey:</b> Yaaaay!</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Okay, okay. If that is what it takes to show you how much you mean to me, and
how much I want you there. Then that's what I'll do.</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe:</b> Oh, wait, let me get you another glass. That's been sitting out.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> I think this will be fine. Okay, vanilla milkshake, just a vanilla milkshake,
with chicken bits floating in it. Cheers. (starts to drink, but Rachel stops him just
before he starts drinking)</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> No, no, no, wait! Okay, okay. Don't! I'll go, I'll go!</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> You will?!</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> You were really gonna do that, weren't you?</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Well, yeah.</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> You were gonna drink the fat.</p>
<b>

<p>Joey:</b> Let's see what else he'll do!</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> (to Joey) How 'bout instead you, go get changed! (to Chandler) You, give him
back his underwear! I'm gonna go get a cab, and I want everyone down stairs in two
minutes! Monica! </p>

<p>(Joey and Chandler start to leave, Joey is lunging as he is walking)</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> Stop it. Stop it!</p>

<p>(Monica runs into the living room, and starts dialing the phone)</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe:</b> Ross, went to get a cab so we can all... No, wh-what are you doing! No,
Monica, no!</p>
<strong>

<p>Richard:</strong> (on machine) Hi, this is Richard.</p>
<b>

<p>Machine:</b> You have three new messages.</p>
<b>

<p>Monica:</b> Not any more!</p>
<b>

<p>Machine:</b> Message erased. To record a message begin speaking at the tone.</p>
<b>

<p>Monica:</b> Hi, uh, Richard it's Monica, um, listen I did something kind of crazy
tonight, um, maybe I'm getting my period or something, I don't know. Um, anyway, I, I, I
beeped into your machine and I heard a message that, that freaked me out, and um, you know
what Michelle will tell you the rest. I, I, um, I'm sorry, okay, I, I hope that we can
forget the whole thing. Okay, bye.</p>
<b>

<p>Machine:</b> Your outgoing message has now been changed.</p>
<b>

<p>Monica:</b> Outgoing! Did that say outgoing?! Not, outgoing!!!</p>
<b>

<p>Monica:</b> (on machine) &quot;Hi, uh, Richard it's Monica, um, listen I did something
kind of crazy tonight, um, maybe I'm getting my period or something, I don't know.&quot;
Nooo!!</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe:</b> How did you do that?</p>
<b>

<p>Monica:</b> I don't know!</p>
<b>

<p>Machine:</b> Good-bye.</p>
<b>

<p>Monica:</b> Noooo!!!!</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> (entering) Okay, okay, okay, I've got two cabs and no people. Go! Go! Go!</p>
<b>

<p>Monica:</b> Maybe we could call the phone company. Maybe they could change the message.
Maybe they can change his number. </p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, after this, I think he'll be doing that himself.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Rachel!! (she enters) Wow! You, uh, you look, wow!</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> And I still have about five seconds to spare. (kisses him) Okay, that was
about seven seconds.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> So we're a little late.</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> Come on. (they start to leave) Oh! And, uh, by the way....</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> What?</p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> I'm going commando, too.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Awwww!!!</p>
<strong>

<p ALIGN="CENTER">Closing Credits</p>
</strong>

<p>[Scene: At the banquet]</p>
<b>

<p>Sherman Whitfield:</b> Dr. Geller, Sherman Whitfield, London Institute.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Wow! What a pleasure.</p>
<b>

<p>Whitfield:</b> (sits down) Well, I have to tell you, I was quite impressed with your
paper on Pre-Cretaceous fossils. Yeah, it confirmed everything that I have written.</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> Excuse me. Hi.</p>
<b>

<p>Whitfield:</b> Yes?</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> Well, your kind of sitting in my seat.</p>
<b>

<p>Whitfield:</b> What do you mean, your seat?</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> I mean, I was sitting there.</p>
<b>

<p>Whitfield:</b> But, you got up!</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> But, I never left the room!</p>
<b>

<p>Whitfield:</b> But, you left the chair area.</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> All right, that's it, give me your underwear.</p>
<strong>

<p ALIGN="CENTER">End</p>
</strong>
