303<html>

<head>
<title>The One With the Jam</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="white" text="black" link="green" vlink="black" alink="yellow">

<h1 align="center">The One With the Jam</h1>

<hr align="center">
<i>

<p></i>Written by: Wil Calhoun<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a></p>

<hr>
<font size="3">

<p align="left"><br>
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is sitting reading a book and hears the bed in
Joey's room creaking, and does a 'Oh no, not again' look on his face.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (from bedroom) WHOAA!!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (going to the bedroom) See Joe, that's why your parents told you not
to jump on the bed.</p>

<p align="center"><b>Opening Credits</b></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross and Rachel are entering]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey, look at me. I'm making jam, been at it since 4 o'clock this
morning.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Where'd you get fruit at four in the morning?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Went down to the docks. Bet ya didn't know you could get it wholesale.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I didn't know there were docks.</p>

<p>[Joey and Chandler enter]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Aww, is it broken?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No, I gotta wear this thing for a couple weeks. (points to the sling he is
wearing)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Did you tell the doctor you did it jumping up and down on your bed?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Nooo. I had a story all worked out but then Chandler sold me out.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, I'm sorry Joe. I didn't think the doctor was gonna buy that it
just *fell* out of the socket.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What is this? Fruit?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Monica's making jam.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Whoa, jam! I love jam! (to Chandler) Hey, how come we never have jam at
our place?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Because the kids need new shoes.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I'm going into business people. I'm sick and tired of being depressed
about Richard. I needed a plan, a plan to get over my man. What's the opposite of man?
Jam. (sees Joey trying some jam from the pot) Oh Joey don't! It's way to hot. (Joey
realizes this and spits what he had in his mouth back into the pot.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> This will just be my batch.</p>

<p>[Scene: Street, Phoebe is being followed by some guy, as they pass a flower vendor.
Phoebe turns around and the guy quickly picks up some flowers and continues following
her.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (turns around) Um, that's it. No. Hey! You! J. Crew guy. Yeah. Why have
you been following me? I mean, all week long everywhere I look there's you.</p>

<p><b>Guy:</b> You wouldn't return my calls, you sent back my letters....</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Guy:</b> One more chance Ursula, please?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oooh. Oh, well this is awkward. </p>

<p><b>Guy:</b> Wh..</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Um, yeah, you want Ursula, and I'm Phoebe. Twin sisters! Seriously.</p>

<p><b>Guy:</b> Oh, that's great. I'm stalking the wrong woman. I am such a dingus!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, you're not a dingus.</p>

<p><b>Guy:</b> I just, I want you to know I didn't used to be like this. Before I meet
your sister I was like this normal guy who sold beepers and cellular phones.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, I mean look it's, it's not your fault, you know. I mean this is
just what, what she does to guys, okay.</p>

<p><b>Guy:</b> Well thanks. (starts to leave)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Wait, (grabs him) you know what, I got a little story. When I was in
Junior High School I went through this period where I thought I was a witch. And there was
this guidance counselor who said something to me, that I think will help you a lot. He
said okay, 'you're not a witch you're just an average student.' See what I'm saying?</p>

<p><b>Guy:</b> Not really.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Um, well, get over it. So, I mean you, you just seem to be a really nice
guy, you know. Don't be so hard on yourself okay.</p>

<p><b>Guy:</b> Wait. You're right. I know you're right. And, thanks for being so nice.
Here (gives her the flowers he bought.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, thanks a lot. Do you want to get a cup of coffee?</p>

<p><b>Guy:</b> Yeah, okay.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay. (they start to leave, he is still following her) Okay, you don't
have to walk behind me any more.</p>

<p><b>Guy:</b> Sorry.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross and Rachel are entering]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Mon?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Mon?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (reading) 'Gone for more jars. Back later. Monica Geller.'</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Wait a minute, look.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Look, look, look.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What, what, what?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> It's an empty apartment.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oooh.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> We're all alone in an empty apartment.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Honey, come on, I have to be at work in like ten minutes (Ross starts
kissing her neck) Oh, all right, well it's not like I'm employee of the year or anything.
(they fall onto the couch)</p>

<p>(Chandler enters and they both jump up and pretend that Ross is showing her something
in the couch.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> There it is.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, oh, that's what you're talking about. (to Chandler) Hey.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Do I look fat?</p>

<p><strong>Ross and </strong><b>Rachel:</b> Noo.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, I accept that. When Janice asked me and I said no, she took that
to mean that I was calling her a cow. </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, walk us through it, honey, walk us through it.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, well. Janice said 'Hi, do I look fat today?' And I, I looked at
her....</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Whoa, whoa, whoa. You looked at her. You never look. You just answer, it's
just a reflex. Do I look fat? Nooo! Is she prettier than I am? Noo! Does size matter?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Nooo!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> And it works both ways.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, so you both just know this stuff?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well you know, after about thirty or forty fights, you kinda catch on.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, for instance. Let's say, Janice is coming back from a trip and she
gives you two options. Option number 1 she'll take a cab home from the airport. Option 2
is you can meet her at baggage claim. Which do you do?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> That's easy, baggage claim.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (buzzes) Wrong! Now you're single. It's actually secret option number
three, you meet her at the gate. That way she knows you love her.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, this is good, this is good. All right listen, I have one. Janice
likes to cuddle, at night, which, you know I'm all for. But, uh, you know when you want to
go to sleep, you want some space. So, uh, how do I tell her that without, you know,
accidentally calling her fat or something.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh honey, I'm sorry we can't help you there, 'cause we're cuddlily
sleepers. (Chandler makes an 'Ewww' face) Okay, I'm late for work.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> All right are you guys gonna come down?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Uh, yeah, yeah I'll, I'm right behind you.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Good luck Chandler.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Thank you Rachel.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Bye sweetie.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Bye hon.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (blows her a kiss) Okay the sleeping thing. Very tricky business, but
there is something you can do.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, I thought you guys were cuddlily sleepers.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Noo! No, not cuddlily, not me, just her. I'm like you, I need the room.
Okay, come here. (they sit on the couch and Ross puts his hands on Chandler's shoulder and
thigh.) Okay, you're in bed...</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah. (they both notice where his hands are)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I'm gonna use the cushion.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, you're in bed. She's over on your side, cuddling. Now you wait for
her to drift off, and then you hug her (demonstrates on the cushion) and roll her back
over to her side of the bed. And then you rollll a-way. Hug for her! Roll for you.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, the old hug and roll.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yep.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, one question.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Shoot.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You're pretending the pillow's a girl right?</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Joey is putting jam on his muffin, lots of jam]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Remember when you where a kid and your Mom would drop you off at the
movies with a jar of jam and a little spoon?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (Looks at him) You're so pretty.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (entering) Hi!</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Hey, Phoebe.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey, oh, you know that guy who's been following me? I talked to him
today.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (with food in his mouth) You talked to him. Are you crazy?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, first I'm not crazy. And second, say it don't spray it. Anyway his
name is Malcom, and he wasn't following me, I mean he was, but 'cause he thought I was
Ursula, ick. And, that's why, that's why he couldn't just come up and talk to me. 'Cause
of the restraining order.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Umm, not feeling better 'bout Malcom.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ooh! No, no, no, no, he's not like a kook, no. He's just like this, this
very passionate, incredibly romantic guy, that got like a tinsy bit carried away, you
know. And we just get along really well, and he's so cute.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh my God, you've got a crush on your sister's stalker.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, I'm just gonna help him, you know, get 'de-Ursula-ized', like you
know, like I did for Joey after he went out with her.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (with his mouthful) Hey, I didn't stalk her. I mean (he sprays Phoebe with
crumbs) </p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, I asked for the news, not the weather.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (entering) Hey guys.</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Hey Mon.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Joey, this is for you. (gives him a jar of jam) It's blackberry curin.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Aww. (tastes it) Ohh!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey, Joe, I gotta ask. The girl from the Xerox place buck naked (holds
up one hand), or, or a big tub of jam. (holds up the other hand)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Put your hands together.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Joey, take your time with that. That's my last batch.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No more jam?!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, what happened to your jam plan?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I figured out I need to charge seventeen bucks a jar just to break even.
So, I've got a new plan now. Babies.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, your gonna need much bigger jars.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What are you talking about?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I'm talking about me having a baby.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Are you serious?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah. The great thing about the jam plan was, I was taking control of my
life. So I asked myself, what is the most important thing to me in the world and that's
when I came up with the baby plan. </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, aren't you forgetin' something? What, what, what is uh, what is that
guy's name? Dad!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> It took me 28 years to find one man that I wanna spend my life with, if
I have to wait another 28 years then, I'll be 56 before I can have a baby, and that's just
stupid.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> That, that's what's stupid.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I don't need an actual man, just a couple of his best swimmers. And
there, there are places you can go to get that stuff.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Down at the docks again?</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler's bedroom, Janice and him are cuddling]</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Night-night Bing-a-ling.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Night-night.....Janice. (he starts thinking to him self)<i> 'Look at
all that room on her side, you good fit a giant penguin over there. That would be weird
though. Okay, hug and roll time. I'm huggin', I'm huggin', your rollin', and....yes!
Freedom! (his one arm is still under her) Except for this arm! I'm stuck. Stuck arm! Okay,
time for the old table cloth trick, one fluid motion. Quick like a cat, quick like a cat!
And 1...2...3!'</i> (Pulls his arm out from under her and she is spun off of the bed.)</p>

<p align="center"><b>Commercial Break</b></p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Malcom is giving Phoebe all of his spy stuff]</p>

<p><b>Malcom:</b> Here's my binoculars.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, great. Great. You're doing great, you know real strong. Going
strong. Keep going.</p>

<p><b>Malcom:</b> These are my night vision goggles. This is the book I pretend to read
when I'm watching her in the park. And these are Mad Lips, they're just for fun.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, yeah. What's this? (picks up a book)</p>

<p><b>Malcom:</b> Oh, this is log I kept, recording her every movement. Do you wanna here
something from it?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Um, not even a little bit.</p>

<p><b>Malcom:</b> It's about you.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, okay then.</p>

<p><b>Malcom:</b> (reading) I met Phoebe today. She was really nice to me eventhough I'm
such a loser. And, then when I was walking home I thought about her a lot, it was weird,
but kinda cool.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Good. So what were you thinking?</p>

<p><b>Malcom:</b> I was thinking what it would be like to kiss you.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Really?</p>

<p><b>Malcom:</b> No.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh.</p>

<p><b>Malcom:</b> See that's just something I said now, so that maybe I could kiss you.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, okay. (he kisses her)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Joey is eating jam straight out of the jar, and Chandler
is staring at him in amazement. Joey offers him some.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No, that's all right. I just had a jar of mustard.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (entering from her bedroom) Okay, sperm donor number 03815, come on
down! Okay, he's 6'2&quot;, 170 pounds, and he describes himself as a male Geena Davis.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You mean there's more than one of us.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Look, you can't do this Mon. All right, if you do this, I'm, I'm gonna,
I'm, I'm gonna.....</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You're gonna what?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I'm gonna tell Mom.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Honey, I'm sorry, but he's right. I love you, but you're crazy.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Crazy.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What?! Why? Why is this crazy? So this isn't the ideal way to
something....</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (interrupting her) Oh, it's not the ideal way...</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Lips moving, still talking. I mean it may not be ideal, but I'm so
ready. No, I-I-I see the way Ben looks at you. It makes me ache, you know?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Check it out!! Jam crackers!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay, all right, how's this? 27. Italian-American guy. He's an actor,
born in Queens. Wow, big family, seven sisters, and he's the only....boy. (they all turn
and look at Joey) Oh my God, under personal comments: 'New York Knicks, rule!'</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, the Knicks rule!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Joey, this is you!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Let me see. (goes over and looks at the form) Oh, right.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> When did you go to a sperm bank?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, right after I did that sex study down at NYU. (to Chandler) Hey,
Remember that sweater I gave you for your birthday?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> And that's how you bought it?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Noooo, that's what I was wearing when I donated. I'm kinda surprised
there's any of my boys left.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well, honey, it is pretty competitive. I mean I've got an actual rocket
scientist here.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Maybe, I should call this place and get them to put my 'Days of Our Lives'
on here. You know, juice this puppy up a little.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (entering) Hellooo!</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> How's the maniac?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, well he's yummy. We did a little kissin'.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Phoebe, what are you doing?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, no, no, no, no. You know what, he's not into that stuff anymore. He
quit for me.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Pheebs, this guy has been obsessed with your sister, for God knows how
long, okay, you don't just give up something like that.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Look, he gave me his night vision goggles and everything.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You're taking the word of a guy who has night vision goggles?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What, he's not still following her. Do you think he is still following
her?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Pheebs, wake up and smell the restraining order.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What are you saying I should do?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I think, that if you really like this guy, you should just trust him.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Thank you, Monica.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Orrr, you could follow him and see where he goes.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, that's what I would do, forget mine.</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh my God, what happened? (points to the cast on Janice's wrist)</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Oh. God, crazy Chandler. He spun me...off...the...bed!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Wow! Spinning that sounds like fun.</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Oh, (laughs) I wish. No, you know he was just trying Ross's Hug and Roll
thing. </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (turns around, not amused) Ross's what?</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> You know what, where he hugs you and kinda rolls you away and... Oh...
my....God.</p>

<p>[Scene: Subway station, Phoebe is following Malcom by finding behind the pillars until
she comes up to one with a wire mesh garbage can next to it. Malcom stops and starts
walking the other way and passes Phoebe, who quick tries to hide behind the garbage can.
But, Malcom sees her.]</p>

<p><b>Malcom:</b> Phoebe?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yes? Yes! Oh.</p>

<p><b>Malcom:</b> What are you doing?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, I was just here looking for, um, my um, my part of an old sandwich.
Oh, here it is! Oh. (picks one up out of the garbage can.)</p>

<p><b>Malcom:</b> Were you following me?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Um, perhaps. Yes! Yes, I'm sorry, I'm sorry. I was just afraid that you
were still hung up on my sister.</p>

<p><b>Malcom:</b> So you spied on me. I can't believe you don't trust me. (Ursula walks
past, and Malcom finds behind the pillar)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh well, what do you know, there goes my identical twin sister. Just
walkin' along looking like me. What, is this just like a freakish coincidence, or did you
know she takes this train?</p>

<p><b>Malcom:</b> I'm sorry. I'm sorry. I tried to stop, but I couldn't. I'm so pathetic.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, no, it's not your fault. You know it's partly my fault, 'cause I
made you quit cold turkey. Sorry, no. Okay, well, I mean, I can't date you anymore, 'cause
your, you know (in a high pitched voice) Wow! But um, but I will definitely, definitely
help you get over my sister. Okay, stalk me for a while. Huh? Yeah, and, and, and, I'll be
like an Ursula patch.</p>

<p><b>Malcom:</b> Uh-huh, I don't know.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, just, okay, look I'm going. Um, come on. Op, op, behind the
pillar, which way am I gonna go? </p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Joey is entering]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Where you going?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> To the bank.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Sperm or regular?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Sperm.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> So you're really doing this, huh?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh yeah, picked a guy, 37135. </p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Sounds nice.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> 'Fraid so. Brown hair, green eyes...</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No kiddin', hmm. </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No, I-I figured you would've picked a blond guy.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Really? Why?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I don't know, I just always pictured you ending up with one of those tall,
smart blond guys, name like.... Hoyt.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hoyt?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> It's a name, yeah. I saw you, you know, in this great house with a big
pool.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Really, is he a swimmer?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> He's got the body for it.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I like that. (Joey starts laughing) What?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> You guys have one of those signs that says: 'We don't swim in your toilet,
so don't pee in our pool.', you know.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> We do not have one of those signs.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Sure you do, it was a gift from me. Oh! And you have these three great
kids.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Two girls and a boy?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> And, and, and they wear those little water wings, you know. And they're,
they're running around on the deck. Then Hoyt wraps this big towel around all three of
them.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Sure! (Monica gets very depressed) But hey, you know this way sounds good
too. </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh Monica. (goes over and hugs her, then looks at the form and stops
hugging her.) Wow, this guy's an astronaut. That would've been cool, (sees Monica) for
like a day. (hugs her again).</p>

<p align="center"><b>Closing Credits</b></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Joey is finishing off the last of the jam]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I called the sperm bank today, they haven't sold a single unit of
Tribianni. Nobody wants my product. I mean, I-I-I don't get it (tries to drink the rest of
the jam out of the jar and gets it all over his face, on his chin, nose, etc.) Maybe if
they met me in person.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Honey, you got a little thing on your...(points to her whole face)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (wipes a little jam from the corner of his mouth) Did I get it?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (entering) Hello. </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hello.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (sees Joey) Hey. (walks into the living room) Uh, Chan, can I uh, can I
talk to you for a second?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Sure. What's up?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Just one uh, one additional relationship thought. Probably something your
already familiar with, uh, women talk! (smacks Chandler over the head with a magazine)</p>
</font>

<p align="center"><strong><font size="3">End</font></strong></p>
</body>
</html>
304<html>

<head>
<title>The One With The Metaphorical Tunnel</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="white" text="black" link="green" vlink="black" alink="yellow">

<h1 align="center">The One With The Metaphorical Tunnel</h1>

<hr align="center">
<i>

<p></i>Written by: Alexa Junge<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a> </p>

<hr>
<font size="3">

<p align="left">[Scene: Monica and Rachel's: everyone is there and they are watching an
info-mercial that stars Joey.]</p>

<p><i><b>Host:</b> Welcome everybody, welcome to Amazing Discoveries!</p>

<p></i><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, oh! It's on again!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> You guys, can we please not watch this all right.</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Shhhh!</p>

<p><i><b>Host:</b> Folks, has this ever happened to you. You go to the refrigerator to get
a nice glass of milk, (Joey is in the background struggling to open a cartoon of milk) and
these darn cartons are so flingin'-flangin' hard to open.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (on tv) Oh, you said it Mike. (rips open the carton and spills milk on the
counter) Aw! There's got to be a better way!</p>

<p><b>Mike:</b> And there is Kevin.</p>

<p></i><b>Joey:</b> Can we please turn this off?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Noo way, Kevin.</p>

<p><i><b>Mike:</b> There is a revolutionary new product that guarantees that you'll never
have to open up milk cartons again. Meet the Milk Master 2000.</p>

<p></i><b>Ross:</b> (to Chandler) Are you intrigued?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You're flingin'-flangin' right I am!</p>

<p><i><b>Mike:</b> Keep in mind, he's never used this product before, you're gonna see how
easy this is to do. (to Kevin) Go ahead. ('Kevin' starts using the product, it is a spout
that you jab into a paper milk carton so that you don't have to rip it open.) This works
with any milk carton.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (on TV, finishing installing the Milk Master 2000) Wow, it is easy.
(starts to poor the milk) Now, I can have milk everyday.</p>

<p></i>(They all start laughing at him)</p>

<p align="center"><b>Opening Credits</b></p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Chandler, Monica, Janice are sitting on the couch, and Phoebe is
sitting next to them in the chair.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, it's official there are no good movies.</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Well, let's go to a bad one and make out. (they start to kiss and lean
back into Monica.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Perhaps, you would like me to turn like this, (turns sideways on the
couch) so that you can bunny bump against my back.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (entering) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey, man. What's up?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Maybe you can tell me. My agent would like to know why I didn't show up at
the audition I didn't know I had today. The first good thing she gets me in weeks. How
could you not give me the message?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, I'll tell ya I do enjoy guilt, but, ah, it wasn't me.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yes, it was! It was him! Uh huh! (they all stare at her) Okay, it was
me! </p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> How is it you?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, it was just, it was all so crazy, you know. I mean, Chandler was
in the closet, counting to 10, and he was up to 7 and I hadn't found a place to hide yet.
I-I-I meant to tell you, and I wrote it all down on my hand. See, all of it. (shows him
her hand)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yep, that's my audition.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> See, now this is why I keep notepads everywhere.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yep, and that's why we don't invite you to play.</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> What is the great tragedy here? You go get yourself another appointment.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, Estelle tried, you know. The casting director told her that I missed
my chance.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> That is unfair. I'll call her and tell her it was totally my fault.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Pheebs, you can't do that. The casting director doesn't talk to friends,
she only talks to agents.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What a sad little life she must lead. Okay, ooh (starts dialing). </p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What, what are you doing? What are you doing?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, no, no, I know, I know, ooh. (on the phone in a different voice)
'Hi, this is Katelynn, from Phoebe Buffay's office. Um, is um, Ann there for Phoebe,
she'll know what it's about.'</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hang up, hang up. (reaches with his good arm, but Phoebe grabs it and he
tries to reach the phone with his other arm but can't because of the sling.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (on phone) 'Annie! Hi. Listen we got a problem with Joey Tribbiani,
apparently he missed his audition. Who did you speak to in my office? Estelle, no, I don't
know what I'm going to do with her. No. All right, so your husband leaves and burns down
the apartment, the world does not stop.'</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Is anybody else scared?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (on phone) 'Right, well look, um, if Joey loses this audition, that is
it for Estelle. I don't care! Annie you are a doll, what time can you see him?' (to
Monica) I need a pen. (Chandler hands her one, but she needs something to right on, so she
tilts Chandler's head over and writes on the back of his neck)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Get the woman a pad! Get the woman a pad! A pad! A pad!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, now you want a pad.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Carol and Susan are dropping off Ben]</p>

<p><strong>Carol and </strong><b>Susan:</b> (entering) Hey!!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> There's my boy! Here's my boy! And here's his Barbi (Ben is holding a
Barbi doll) What's ah, what's my boy doing with a <em>Barbi</em>?</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> He picked it out of the toy store himself, he loves it.</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> He carries it everywhere, it's like a security blanket, but with ski
boots and a kicky beret.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, it's, it's, it's cute. Why, why, why does he have it, again?</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> So he's got a doll? So what? Unless you're afraid he's gonna grow up and
be in show business.</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> This doesn't have anything to do with the fact that he is being raised by
two women, does it?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You know what it's fine. If you're okay with the <em>Barbi</em> thing, so
am I.</p>

<p>(cut to later in the day)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Give daddy the <em>Barbi</em>! Ben, give, give me the <em>Barbi</em>.
Okay, how 'bout, don't you want to play with the monster truck? (makes a monster truck
sound) No. Okay, oh, oh, how about a Dino-soilder? (squawks like a dinosaur)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ross, you are so pathetic. Why can't your son just play with his doll?
(uses the Milk Master 2000 to pour milk into her cereal)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (entering from her bedroom) I gotta go to work. Has anybody seen my left
boob?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I love that movie. (Joey is using it as a pillow)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> There it is. Joey, what are you doing?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I'm sorry, it just felt nice.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (entering with his ringing phone) Joe. Joe! Answer the phone.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey, I only got one good arm, you know. You should be doing stuff for me.
Go get me a sweater.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Just do it! Okay, it's Janice and if I get it I'm going to have to see
her tonight. (phone stops ringing) Oh, that's great I'm gonna have to see her tonight.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What's the big deal? Why don't you wanna see Janice?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, last night at dinner, when the meals came, she put half her
chicken piccata on my plate and took my tomatoes.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> And that's bad because..., you hate chicken piccata?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Noo.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You didn't want to share your tomatoes, tomatoes are very important to
you.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No, it's like all of the sudden, we were this couple. And this alarm
started going off in my head: 'Run for your life! Get out of the building!'</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Men are unbelievable.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What is it with you people! I mean, the minute you start to feel
something, you have to run away?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I know, that, (looks at her fake chest, and loses his train of
thought, temporarily) that's why I don't want to go tonight, I'm afraid I'm going to say
something stupid.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, you mean like that guy thing where you act mean and distant until
you get us to break up with you.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey, you know about that?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Look what do I do? I wanna get past this, I don't wanna be afraid of
the commitment thing. I wanna go through the tunnel, to the other side! </p>

<p>(Joey looks quizzically at Ross)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (to Joey) Where there is no fear of commitment.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Do we have any...(turns around and bumps Monica's fake chest) Do we
have any thoughts here?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, I've never been through the tunnel myself, 'cause as I understand
it, you're not allowed to go through with more than one girl in the car, right. But, it
seems to me it's pretty much like anything else, you know, face your fear. It have a fear
of heights, you go to the top of the building! If you're afraid of bugs.....get a bug.
Right. In this case, you have a fear of commitment, so I say you go in there and be the
most committed guy there ever was.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Amazingly, that makes sense.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You think?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, yeah. Go for it man, jump off the high dive, stare down the barrel of
the gun, pee into the wind!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, Joe, I assure you if I'm staring down the barrel of a gun, I'm
pretty much peeing every which way.</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe's beeper is going off]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, it's your audition from this morning. Can I use the phone again?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Sure Pheebs, you know, that's what it's there for, emergencies and
pretend agents.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Come on baby, come on!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (on phone, in 'Katelynn's' voice) 'Hi, I have Phoebe Buffay returning a
page. Okay, well, um, she's in her car I'll have to patch you through.'</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Very nice touch.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (in voice, on phone) 'Okay, go ahead.' (in normal voice on phone) Um, hi
Annie. (listens) Fantastic! (to Joey) You got it. (on phone) Oh, okay, um, 'Will he work
for scale?' you ask me. Well, I don't know about that, (Joey clears his throat to signify
yes) except that I do and he will. Great, oh you are such a sweetheart. I would love to
have lunch with you, how about we have lunch next....(hangs up phone) Op, went through a
tunnel.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Unbelievable.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Thank you so much.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> It was really fun, I mean I've never talked on a car phone before.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> You were amazing, could you just do me this huge favor, you see there's
this one other audition that I really, really want, and Estelle couldn't get me in.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, I don't know. I mean it was fun one time.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Come on, please, it'll be just this one more, well actually it's two.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Two?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah! Well, well really it's three. Please. You're so good at it. I love
you.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, I'll do it, but just these three, right</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Nooo, four.</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler and Janice are having dinner]</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> So, how come you wanted to eat in tonight?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> 'Cause, I wanted to uh, give you this. (hands her a present)</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Ohhh, are you a puppy! (opens it) Contact paper! I never really know
what to say when someone you're sleeping with gives you contact paper.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, wait there's, there's more. See the contact paper is to go into
your brand new drawer. (gives her a drawer) See, the drawer actually goes in my dresser.</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Oh, you didn't have to do this.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes, I did. Yes, I did. Because, you're my girlfriend, and that's what
girlfriends should, should get. </p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Well, I gotta buy a vowel. Because, oh my Gawd! Who, would've thought
that someday, Chandler Bing would buy me a drawer.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, not me. But that's what's happened, and, ah, and, and there's
more. We should take a trip.</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> We should?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yep, we're a couple and that's what couples do. And, I wanna meet your
parents. We should take a trip with your parents!</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> (laughs) I don't think we need to, because you're tripping me out right
now! Are you okay?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I am, I actually am. I mean this is amazing. My entire life I have
feared this place, and now that I'm here it's like what was the big deal. I could probably
say 'Let's move in together.' and I'd be okay.</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> You probably want us to move in together?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> It doesn't scare me!</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Yeah, well, it scares me! I mean I not even divorced yet, Chandler. You
know, you just invited me over here for pasta, and all of the sudden you're talking about
moving in together. And, and I wasn't even that hungry. You know what, it's getting a
little late, and I-I should just, um...(starts to leave)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, no, no, no, don't go! I've scared ya'! I've said too much! I'm
hopeless, and awkward, and desperate for love!! (Janice leaves, Chandler then calls Janice
to leave a message on her machine) Hey, Janice! It's me. Um, yeah, I-I-I just wanna
apologize in advance for having chased you down the street. (runs out the door)</p>

<p align="center"><b>Commercial Break</b></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Rachel are comforting Chandler]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Honey, this will help. (hands him a tub of ice cream)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> So, I finally catch up to her and she says this relationship is going
to fast and we have to slow down.</p>

<p><strong>Rachel and </strong><b>Monica:</b> Uff.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> That is never good.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Then I got all needy and clingy.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, wait a minute, wait a minute, wait a minute. Maybe it's not so
bad. How did you leave it?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> She said she'd call me.</p>

<p><strong>Rachel and </strong><b>Monica:</b> Ohh! (both grab there stomachs in pain)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh God.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Welcome to our side of the tunnel.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> This ice cream tastes like crap by the way.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, well that's that lo-cal, non dairy, soy milk junk. We sort of, we
save the real stuff for those really terminal cases.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You know, when you start get screwed over all the time, you gotta switch
to low-fat.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, you do.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> So, you don't think I'm terminal?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well, no, not at all, you're not terminal, you just, you just need some
damage control.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, okay. So, should I call her?</p>

<p><strong>Rachel and </strong><b>Monica:</b> Nooo!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> This is a very critical time right now. If you feel yourself reaching
for that phone, then you go shoe shopping, you get your butt in a bubble bath. You want
her back you have to start acting aloof.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> She has to know that your not ready.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Right. So, what you have to do is, you have to accidentally run into her
on purpose. And then act aloof.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> So I'm not, not gonna lose her?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oooh, honey, you're not a total loser.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I said, 'So I'm not gonna lose her?'</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross is still trying to get Ben to play with something
other than the Barbi doll.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Guess who's here. It's the toughest guy in toy land, Ben. (singing) 'A
real American hero. I'm <em>G.I. Joe</em>!' Drop the <em>Barbi</em>, drop the <em>Barbi</em>.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> <em>G.I. Joe</em>? Do you really think he's gonna fall for that?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (entering) <em>G. I. Joe</em>! Cool! Can I play?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Look Ben, it's a toy that protects U.S. oil interests overseas!</p>

<p><strong>Joey and </strong><b>Ross:</b> Go Joe!!!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (entering) Helloo! Oh! (sees Joey and starts to leave)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Pheebs! There you are!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No it's not, sorry.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> But Phoebe, wait! Wait! Phoebe. Phoebe! (catches her in the hallway)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, Joey! Oh, okay, see I didn't recognize you wearing, in
those....pants.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Look listen, that TV movie I went in for? Did you hear anything? I think I
got a shot at it.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yes! They called and you didn't get it! Okay, I mean you didn't get it,
I'm sorry, I'm sorry.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> It's okay, these things happen.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> But they shouldn't happen, you know what, you're, you're in a terrible,
terrible business. Oh God, I don't wanna be the person who makes your face look like that.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I'm, I'm okay. See. (tries to smile, but fails horribly)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, now you're sad and creepy, oh. You know what, I, I'm sorry I quit,
okay, I just quit.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No! No, no you can't quit! You're the best agent I ever had! Look Pheebs,
rejection is part being an actor, you can't take it personally.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Not personal, really, well they said that they never met an Italian
actor with a worse Italian accent.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> They actually said that?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah. Ooh God, there's that face again! See I can't do this job! I...</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No, no, no, see that's why you have to do this job, agents always lie. You
know, Estelle just says stuff like 'They went another way', but this, I can use this. (in
a very bad Italian accent) I canna work on a new accent.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah okay, no if it helps you okay. Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (running into the hall, in slow motion) You'll never get me, Joe!!! (he
then pretends that he gets shot repeatedly and falls back against Joey and Chandler's
door, dead.)</p>

<p>[Scene: A grocery store that Janice shops in. Chandler is on purpose, accidentally
bumping into her.]</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> (to butcher) No, thank you. (Chandler makes a sound and she notices him)
Chandler!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (in a British accent) Hello, Janice.</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> What are you doing here?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (in accent) Oh, just a bit of shopping. How've you been?</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Are you being British?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (normal voice) No. Not anymore.</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Why are you shopping here? You don't live in this neighborhood. Were you
here waiting for me?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, huh. I'm just uh, you know I'm just picking up some things for a
party. (grabs a bag off of the shelf)</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Barley? What kind of party serves barley?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, I'm sorry if my friends aren't as sophisticated as yours.</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Where is this party?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Here in Chelsea.</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Who's party is it?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> A woman's</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> What woman?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (shyly) Chelsea.</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Okay, you know, one of two things is happening here. Either you're
seeing somebody behind my back, which would make you the biggest jerk on the planet. Or,
else you're pretending that you're seeing somebody, which just makes you so pathetic that
I could start crying right here in the cereal aisle. So like which of these two guys do
you want to be? (another guy walks by)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Can I be that guy?</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Joey and Phoebe are there]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, so we got some more good rejections, lots of stuff to work on. </p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay, shoot.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, um, oh, the zoo commercial.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I didn't get it?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No. They said you 'Weren't believable as a human being.' So, you can
work on that. </p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay, what else?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Um, the off-Broadway play people said 'You were pretty but dumb.'</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh no wait, I'm sorry, that's 'pretty dumb.'</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Look, it's okay, no, no, no, really, look um, I really appreciate this
Pheebs, but I think I'm gonna have to go back to Estelle.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, well don't get me wrong, you're a better agent than she is, but at
least with her I don't want to blow my pretty dumb brains out.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, no, I understand.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> You do, thanks.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah. Sorry. (she starts to leave)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Wait a minute.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Wait a minute, did you just make up all that stuff just to get out of
being my agent.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (in a coy tone) Oh, you caught me. I am so busted.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (in a really, really bad Italian accent) That's-ah what I suspected-ah.</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is laying on the counter and Rachel and Monica
are comforting him again.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> ....And then I just, you know, threw the bag of barley at her, and ran
out of the store.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> My God! Chandler, we said be 'aloof' not 'a doof'.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I've actually ruined this haven't I? It's time for the good ice cream
now, right?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, it is.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You know what, everything's gonna be okay. </p>

<p>(phone rings)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (answering phone) Hello. Hi, Janice! Can you hold on for a second?
Okay. (to Monica and Rachel) Okay, what do I do?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Shhh...I don't know what to do, this is totally unprecedented.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> If-if-if we ever did what you did a man would never call.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hello!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh wait, you know what, I got it, I got it, pretend like you just woke
up, okay, that will throw her off. Be sleepy.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yes, and grumpy.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What are you, stop naming dwarves! (on phone) Hello, Janice. Hi, I'm
so glad that you called, I know I've been acting a really weird lately. And, it's just
because I'm crazy about you, and I just got...stupid, and, and scared, and....stupid a
couple of more times. I'm sorry. (listens) Really?! (listens) Really?!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> He's soo lucky, if Janice were a guy, she'd be sleeping with somebody
else by now.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (on phone) I love you too.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Aw, it's soo unfair. (they both start digging into the 'good' ice cream)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Carol and Susan are picking up Ben, while Monica is
pouring chocolate syrup, lots of it, into her ice cream.]</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> <em>G. I. Joe. G. I. Joe</em>?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey, I don't know what to tell you guys that's the doll he chose.</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> What'd you do, dip it in sugar?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Look, <em>G. I. Joe</em>'s in, <em>Barbi</em>'s out. And if you guys can't
deal with it, that's your 'too bad.'</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What are you being such a weenie for? So he has a Barbi, big deal. You
used to dress up like a woman.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well, you used to dress up in Mom's clothes all the time.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What are you talking about?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> The big hat, the pearls, the little pick handbag.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, you are totally making this up.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> How can you not remember? You made us call you...Bea. </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (remembering) Oh God.</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> I've literally never been this happy.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Wasn't there a little song?</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Oh please God, let there be a song.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> There was no song. (to Monica) There was no song!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (singing) '<em>I am Bea.</em>'</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> '<em>I drink tea.</em>'</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, that's, that's enough. (retreats to the bathroom)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> '....<em>Won't you, won't you, won't you</em>.... '</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (coming out of the bathroom) Won't you dance around with me. </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> A-ha!!! (they all start laughing, as Ross hides in the bathroom)</p>

<p align="center"><b>Closing Credits</b></p>

<p>[Scene: It's an old home movie of the Geller's backyard, young Ross is dressed up as
Bea, and pouring himself/herself some tea.]</p>

<p><strong>Young </strong><b>Ross:</b> (singing) 'I am Bea. I drink tea. Won't you dance
around with....' (spills some tea and it drips onto his/her dress) Ohhh! (runs away
crying)</p>

<p><strong>Young</strong> <b>Monica:</b> (entering the shot) Ross!!! (starts to wipe up
the spill)</p>
</font>

<p align="center"><strong><font size="3">End</font></strong></p>
</body>
</html>
305<html>

<head>
<title>The One With Frank Jr.</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="white" text="black" link="green" vlink="black" alink="yellow">

<h1 align="center">The One With Frank Jr.</h1>

<hr align="center">
<i>

<p></i>Written by: Scott Silveri &amp; Shana Goldnerg-Meehan.<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a> </p>

<hr>
<font size="3">

<p align="left">[Scene: Chandler and Joey&#146;s, there is lumber all over the apartment]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (entering) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey-hey-hey. So what happened? A forest tick you off?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No. Y'know how we&#146;re always saying we need a place for the mail.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, I started building one. But then I decided to take it to the next
step.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You&#146;re building a post office?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No, an entertainment unit, with a mail cubby built right in. It&#146;s a
one day job, max.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay. (notices that Joey is wearing some really tight jeans) My word!
Those are snug.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh yeah. These are my old work pants, Sergio Valente&#146;s.</p>

<p>(Chandler goes to his bedroom and opens the door. However, only the top half opens, and
he trips into his bedroom over the bottom half.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Power saw kinda got away from me there.</p>
<b>

<p align="center"><b>Opening Credits</b></p>
</b>

<p>[Scene: Outside Central Perk, Phoebe is pacing back and forth waiting for someone.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (joining Phoebe outside) Hey Pheebs. </p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Any sign of your brother?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, but he&#146;s always late.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I thought you only met him once?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, I did. I think it sounds y'know big sistery, y'know,
&#145;Frank&#146;s always late.&#146;</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well relax, he&#146;ll be here.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, I know, I&#146;m just nervous. Y'know it&#146;s just y'know
Mom&#146;s dead, don&#146;t talk to my sister, Grandma&#146;s been sleeping a lot lately.
It&#146;s like the last desperate chance to have a family, y'know, kinda thing.
You&#146;re so sweet to wait with me.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, actually Gunther sent me. You&#146;re not allowed to have cups out
here, it&#146;s a thing. (takes her cup and goes back inside)</p>

<p>[Scene: inside Central Perk]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Does anyone else think David Copperfield is cute?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No, but he told me, he thinks your a fox.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All right, Janice, likes him. In fact she likes him so much she put
him on her freebie list.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Her what?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, we have a deal, where we each get to pick five celebrities that
we can sleep with, and the other one can&#146;t get mad.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Ah, the heart of every healthy relationship. Honesty, respect, and sex
with celebrities.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> So, Chandler, who&#146;s on your list?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Ah, Kim Basinger, Cindy Crawford, Halle Berry, Yasmine Bleeth, and ah,
Jessica Rabbit.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Now, you do realize that she&#146;s a cartoon, and way out of your
league?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I know, I know, I just always wondered if I could get her eyes to pop
out of her head.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey, Monica, who would yours be?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> First, I need a boyfriend, then I can have a list.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> It&#146;s just a game Mon. (makes a &#145;Can-you-believe-her&#146; face
to the rest of the gang.) Rach, how about you?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, I don&#146;t know, I guess, Chris O&#146;Donnel, John F. Kennedy,
Jr., Daniel Day Lewis, Sting, and Parker Stevenson.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Spiderman?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hardy Boy.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Peter Parker.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Thank you.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What about you honey, who would be on your list?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well I-I-I, that kind of thing requires some serious thought. First,
I&#146;ll divide my perspective canidates into catergories....</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (coughing) What a geek!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (entering) Everbody this is Frank! This is my half-brother Frank.</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Oh, hi.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> This is everybody. This is Ross.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> How are you?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Chandler.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hi.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Hi.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Joey.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey-hey!</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> This is Monica.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Whoa!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> And this is Rachel.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Whoa!!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I&#146;m gonna get coffee.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Hey, how do you guys get anything done?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> We don&#146;t, really.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, so, now, do you guys have a lot of big plans?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh yeah! Yeah, no, we&#146;re gonna connect, y'know bond, and
everything.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Yeah, I was thinking that maybe we could go down to Time Square and pick
up some ninja stars. And, oh, um, my friend Larry, he wants me to take a picture of a
hooker.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You know, we don&#146;t really take advantage of living in the city.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I know.</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey&#146;s, Joey is drilling a hole in the wall and the drill
comes out the other side really close to Chandler&#146;s head. Chandler then rushes out to
talk to Joey.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, I&#146;m sorry. Did I get &#145;ya?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No, you didn&#146;t get me!! It&#146;s an electric drill, you <b>get</b>
me, you <b>kill</b> me!!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Calm down, do you want this unit or not?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I do <b>NOT</b> want this unit!!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, you should&#146;ve told me that before, I&#146;m not a mind reader.
Hey, we&#146;re out of beer. I&#146;m going to Monica&#146;s.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Fine! (goes into his room and slams the door, then he slams the bottom
half of the door.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel&#146;s, Joey is entering]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey! Where &#145;ya headin&#146; in those pants? 1982?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh Monica, listen, I ah, I saw down at the hardware store, they got those
designer tiles on sale. If you ever want to redo the bathroom floor.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Why, what&#146;s wrong with my bathroom floor?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Nothing. It&#146;s just old and dingy, that&#146;s all.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I highly doubt that. (they both go to the bathroom)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh yeah. If you ah, move your hamper, you see what color the tile used to
be. (Monica gasps) Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I can&#146;t live like this! What are we gonna do? What are we gonna do?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Relax. Here hold this (hands her his beer). This old stuff just comes
right off. (he bends down to try and lift some tile right in the middle of the floor, in
his tight pants.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> That&#146;s a little more than I wanted to see.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (manages to pry off only a small piece) Aw! Look at that, every inch of
this stuff is glued down. It&#146;d take forever to pry this up. You should ah, you should
just leave it. (starts to walk away, but Monica grabs him)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I can&#146;t leave it! You gouged a hole in my dingy floor.</p>

<p>(Joey places the toliet brush and holder over the hole, which is in the middle of the
floor.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Eh! There you go.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You know that&#146;s nice, y'know we could put it back there after the
surgeons remove it from your colon!</p>

<p>[Scene: Phoebe&#146;s, Frank and her, are sitting on the counh, watching TV]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (sits up) Oh, ew!</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah I know what I wanted to ask you. Um, can you roll your tongue?
Because I can, and my Mom couldn&#146;t, and I thought y'know, I figured that was
something I got from our Dad.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> What, wait, you mean like this? (does it)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, yeah. You can do it to. (tries to do it, but can&#146;t)</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Your not doing it.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh right, yeah okay, my Mom could, and I can&#146;t. We don&#146;t have
that....</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> When&#146;s your birthday?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Feburary 16th.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> I know a guy who&#146;s the 18th.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Wow, that&#146;s close. When&#146;s yours?</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> October 25th.</p>

<p><strong>Phoebe:</strong> That&#146;s the same month as Halloween. So, um, what kinda
things do you like to do at home?</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Melt stuff.</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Ross is working on his list]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, I&#146;ve got three of my five.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Three of your five, what?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Celebrities I&#146;m allowed to sleep with.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh my God! You are giving this a lot of thought.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, it&#146;s hard okay, I only have two spots left.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All right, so who do you got it narrowed down to?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, Elizabeth Hurely....</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oooh-hoo, very attractive, forgiving.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Susan Sarandon.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Eh, y'know what, she&#146;s to political, she probably wouldn&#146;t
let you do it, unless you donated four cans of food first.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> And!! Isabella Rosselini.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Ooh-hoo. Very hot, very sexy. But ah, y'know she&#146;s too
international, y'know she&#146;s never gonna be around.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> So?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> So, you gotta play the odds, pick somebody who&#146;s gonna be in the
country like all the time.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, &#145;cause that&#146;s why you won&#146;t get Isabella Rosselini,
geography.</p>

<p>[Scene: Phoebe&#146;s, Frank is melting a plastic spoon.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay so, by melting, you meant melting.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> So is it like art?</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Yeah, you can melt art. Hey, can I use your phone?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Um, yeah sure. Why you wanna call your Mom?</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> No, I wanna melt it.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, well um, not right now. Y'know I&#146;m just gonna go to bed, I
think the fumes are giving me a headache.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> (starts laughing) Yeah!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> G&#146;night, bro.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> G&#146;night.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Here. (gives him a fire extinguisher) Y'know, just in case.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Oh, excellent. (starts to melt the fire extinguisher&#146;s hose.)</p>
<b>

<p align="center"><b>Commercial Break</b></p>
</b>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel&#146;s, Phoebe is eating breakfast with Monica while Frank is
playing with num-chucks on the balcony]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What kind of karate is that?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No kind. He just makes it up.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> So how&#146;s it going with you guys?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> So far, it kinda blows. I don&#146;t know, I just thought y'know that
he&#146;d feel more like a brother y'know, like you and Ross, just like close and
connected and....</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh honey, we&#146;re close now but you-you wouldn&#146;t believe the
years of-of nugies, and wedgies, and flying wedgies, and atomic wedgies, and....(Phoebe
shakes her head like she doesn&#146;t understand) That&#146;s where the waistband actually
goes over your head. </p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ah!!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, we used to drive each other crazy playing the shadow game.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, how do you play the shadow game?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, how do you play the shadow game?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I just asked you.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I just asked you.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I don&#146;t have time for this.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No, that is what the game is.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Which you just gave up really quickly.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (entering) Have you seen Joey?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What&#146;s the matter?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, just this! (turns around and has a paint lid stuck to the back of
his pants.) Y&#146;know what it&#146;s my fault really, because the couch is usually where
we <b>keep</b> the varnish.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (yelling from bathroom) Hey, does somebody wanna hand me one of those
tiles.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What&#146;s going on?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> He&#146;s retiling my floor. (they both run to the bathroom)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yo!! Spackel boy! Get up!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Ah-ah-ah, now you started this, you will finish it.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> He started mine first!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Build the unit Cinderelly, lay the tile Cinderelly.</p>

<p>[Scene: Phoebe&#146;s, Phoebe and Frank are watching TV.]</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Whoa! Big octopus.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah. (phone rings and Phoebe answers it) &#145;Hello. (listens) Oh my
God, I totally forgot! (listens) Well can&#146;t someone else do it. (listens) But, I have
company. (listens) Yeah, no look, that&#146;s all right I&#146;ll come in.&#146; (hangs up

of my regulars and he&#146;s insisting that I do &#145;um.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh! I&#146;m a masseuse. I give people massages and stuff.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> You-you work at one of those massage parlors?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, y'know we don&#146;t call it that, but yeah!</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> (starts laughing) Wow! That&#146;s wild! No, I had no idea.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> All righty. I&#146;ll be back in-in a little bit. Unless you wanna come
with me?</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> You mean like watch?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, no, you can get one yourself. It&#146;ll be on the house! Y'know
what are big sisters for?</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Well, I don&#146;t think this, y'know.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, no, no, I wouldn&#146;t do you myself, I mean that would be weird.
Yeah, no, I&#146;ll get one of the other girls to do it. Oh, this will be so much fun!
Hey! Are you excited?</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Yeah! Hey, do Monica and Rachel work there?</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel&#146;s bathroom, Joey and Monica are admiring the new floor.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> It&#146;s beautiful! It&#146;s like the first bathroom floor there ever
was. (Chandler tries to go to the bathroom) Whoa! Are you going in there for?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What, like a number?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (entering) Hey! </p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hi! Bye! (runs to the bathroom)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, I&#146;m done with my choices, these are final. (holds up a little
card)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, it&#146;s about time.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ooh, very official.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, yeah, well y'know Chandler printed it up on his computer.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> And who laminated it?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> That would be me.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> All right let me see. (grabs the card) Uma Thurman, Winona Ryder,
Elizabeth Hurely, Michelle Pfieffer, and Dorothy Hammel? </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey, it&#146;s my list.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay honey, you do realize she only spins like that on ice.</p>

<p>[Scene: Healing Hands Inc. (Phoebe&#146;s work), Frank is being ushered in, by the arm,

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey!-Hey! What&#146;s going on?</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> She broke my arm.</p>

<p><b>Girl:</b> He touched my fanny.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> No, she touched mine first!</p>

<p><b>Girl:</b> That&#146;s my job!</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> So wait, what&#146;s the deal here, I can have sex with you, but I
can&#146;t touch you?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe and Girl:</b> Ewww!!!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> You can&#146;t have sex with her!</p>

<p><b>Girl:</b> What&#146;d you think I was, a hooker?</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> No, your a masseuse, it&#146;s cool, I&#146;m not a cop.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, Jasmine, can you, can you ask Mr. Whiffler if he can wait for like
five minutes.</p>

<p><b>Jasmine:</b> Fine. (starts to leave, and points at Frank) I don&#146;t like you!!
(leaves)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (turns around and hits Frank) So that&#146;s what you thought I did!!
God! That&#146;s not what I do!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Nooo! Why would you think that?</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> I don&#146;t know, I mean, y'know, this is the city y'know, I just, I
mean, I don&#146;t know.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Whatever, it&#146;s the perfect end to the perfect weekend anyways.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Oh, wait, no your right, no it was perfect and I can&#146;t believe that
I screwed it up so bad.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> You really thought it was perfect?</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Well, no, maybe-maybe it wasn&#146;t perfect, but y'know it was pretty
cool, y'know, &#145;cause we had all those great talks y'know.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, um, which ones in particular were great for you?</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Well y'know about the tongue thing, y'know, and how I told you about my
likes and my dislikes...</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I don&#146;t....</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> How-how I like to melt stuff, and how I dislike stuff that doesn&#146;t
melt.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Right, okay, um-mm.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Yeah, y'know I feel like I can really talk to you &#145;cause y'know
you&#146;re my sister, y'know.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Uh-huh.</p>

almost got arm broken by a hooker...</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, I coulda counted to three like four times without all this

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay!! Okay!!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Come on!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Heavy thing, not getting lighter!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, one...two...</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> So we are going on two?</p>

<p><b>All:</b> All right!! (they lift it into place, however there is one small problem,
the unit is so long that it blocks some of both of their bedroom doors.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah-yeah, so big that it actually makes our doors look smaller! </p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Maybe, my ruler&#146;s wrong.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Maybe all the rulers are wrong.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Look it&#146;s not that bad. So what, it blocks a little of your door, a
little of my door.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, y'know what I got a better idea. How-how &#145;bout it blocks
none of mine door and a lot of yours? (throws his shoulder into the center to try and move
it, but it doesn&#146;t move.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, listen, before I forget that side is still wet.</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Rachel is serving some guy coffee.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay sir, um-mm, let see if I got this right. Ah, so this is a half-caf,
double tall, easy hazel nut, non-fat, no foam, with whip, extra hot latte, right? (the guy
nods) Okay, great. (she starts to walk away and under her breath) You freak.</p>

<p>(Isabella Rosselini enters)</p>

<p><strong>Ross:</strong> (to Gunther) Thank you.</p>

<p><b>Isabella:</b> (to Gunther) Um, coffee to go, please.</p>

<p>(Ross recognises her and goes over to the couch, mouthing &#145;Oh my God&#146;</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Isabella Rosselini. (points to her)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Are you serious? (they all look) Oh my God.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Damn! I can&#146;t believe I took her off my list.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Why? &#145;Cause otherwise you&#146;d go for it?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, maybe.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh-oh, you lie.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What you don&#146;t think I&#146;d go up to her?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ross, it took you ten years to finally admit you liked me.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, well missy, you better be glad that list is laminated.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You know what honey, you go ahead, we&#146;ll call her an alternate.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, hold my crawler.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Rach, are you really gonna let him do this?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Honey, he&#146;s about to go hit on Isabella Rosselini. I&#146;m just
sorry we don&#146;t got popcorn.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (to Isabella) Hi! Hi, I&#146;m Ross, you don&#146;t know me, but I&#146;m
a big, big fan of yours. I mean, <i>Blue Velvet</i>, woo-oo hoo! Um, I was wondering if I
could um, maybe buy you a cup of coffee? (Gunther hands her change) Or maybe reimburse you
for that one? </p>

<p><b>Isabella:</b> Aren&#146;t you with that girl over there? (points at Rachel, who
waves back)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, yeah, kinda. Um, but that&#146;s okay, see we have an understanding,
um, see we each have this list of five famous people, (gets his out) so I&#146;m allowed
to sleep with you. No, no, no, it&#146;s flattery.</p>

<p><b>Isabella:</b> I&#146;m sorry. (starts to leave)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh no, no, no, wait, wait, Isabella. Don&#146;t, don&#146;t just dismiss
this so fast. I mean this is a once in a lifetime opportunity...</p>

<p><b>Isabella:</b> Yeah, for you. Is that the list?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Um, yeah.</p>

<p><b>Isabella:</b> May I see it?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Um, no.</p>

<p><b>Isabella:</b> Come on! (grabs the list)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> But, okay.</p>

<p><b>Isabella:</b> (reading it) I&#146;m not on the list!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Um, see, but that&#146;s not the final draft.</p>

<p><b>Isabella:</b> It&#146;s laminated!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, um, okay see, you were, you were on the list but my friend, Chandler
(Chandler waves) brought up the very good point that you are international, so I bumped
you for Wynona Rider, local.</p>

<p><b>Isabella:</b> Y'know it&#146;s ironic...</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Isabella:</b> ...because I have a list of five goofy coffee house guys and yesterday
I bumped you for that guy over there. (points at a guy and leaves)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (to the rest of the gang) We&#146;re just gonna be friends.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Closing Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey&#146;s, they are admiring the entertainment center]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Y'know what?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Umm?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I bet &#145;ya ya I could fit in there. (points to a hole in the center)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I&#146;ve got five bucks says you can&#146;t.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Get out your checkbook, mister.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, I think I have the cash.</p>

<p>(Joey successfully enters the entertainment center, and Chandler closes the door on
Joey.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> You are dogged man! I totally fit!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, you got me. (picks up a 2x4 and puts it through the handles so
that the doors won&#146;t open) I&#146;m out five big ones! (puts the money in the crack
between the door and frame) Here you go.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Thank you. Cha-ching! (Chandler starts to leave) Oh, well hello Mr.
Lincoln. Better luck next time buddy. (Chandler leaves and closes the door) And the drinks
are on me!</p>
</font>

<p align="center"><strong><font size="3">End</font></strong></p>
</body>
</html>
306<html>

<head>
<title>The One With The Flashback</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="white" text="black" link="green" vlink="black" alink="yellow">

<h1 align="center">The One With The Flashback</h1>

<hr align="center">
<i>

<p></i>Written by: Marta Kauffman &amp; David Crane<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a></p>
<font size="3">

<p>{Transcriber's Note: Rachel has two friends that are not named, so I referred to them
as Friend No. 1 and Friend No. 2.}</p>
</font>

<hr>
<font size="3">

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, the whole gang is there including Janice.]</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Janice has a question. Who of the six of you has sleep with the six of
you?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Wow, it&#146;s like a dirty math problem.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I&#146;m sorry the answer there would be...none of us.</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Come on over the years none of you ever y'know, got drunk and stupid.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, that&#146;s really a different question.</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> I&#146;m sorry I find it hard to believe that a group of people who
spends as much time together as you guys do has never bumped uglies.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, there was that one time that Monica and Rachel got together.</p>

<p><b>Monica and Rachel:</b> What?!!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Excuse me, there was no time!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay, but let&#146;s say there was. How might that go?</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Okay, okay, well then answer me this. Has any of you ever.... almost?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Does anybody need more coffee?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, I&#146;ll take some.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey, there&#146;s a dog out there!</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Opening Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Phoebe&#146;s, three years earlier, Phoebe, Monica, and Ross are
there]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, that is so unfortunate.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Cute naked guy is really starting to put on weight.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (entering from bedroom) Okay, I&#146;ll be back in just a minute. Oh,
Phoebe I&#146;m sorry that I left lipstick marks on the phone.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> You didn&#146;t leave lipstick marks on the phone.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, then it must&#146;ve been you. Bye. (leaves)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (angrily) Bye-bye! (to Ross) That&#146;s why I moved out.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey, y'know while we&#146;re on that, when are you gonna tell my sister
that you don&#146;t live here anymore.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I think on some levels she already knows.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Phoebe, she doesn&#146;t know that you sneak out every night, she
doesn&#146;t know that you sneak back every morning, and she doesn&#146;t know that
you&#146;ve been living with your Grandmother&#146;s for a week now.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, well maybe not on those levels.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (entering, with a goatee) Hey.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I&#146;m never gonna find a roommate, ever.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Why, nobody good?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well let&#146;s see, there was the guy with the ferrets, that&#146;s
plural. The spitter. Oh-ho, and yes, the guy that enjoyed my name so much he felt the need
to make a little noise every time he said it. Nice to meet you, Chandler Bing <i>Bing!</i>
Great apartment Chandler Bing, <i>Bing!</i></p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> So how many more do you have tomorrow?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Two. This photographer, who seemed really dull. And this actor guy,
who I&#146;m not sure about, because when he called and I answered the phone
&#145;Chandler Bing,&#146; he said &#145;Whoa-whoa, short message.&#146;</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (entering) Ross (who has his foot on the coffee table), foot on the
floor or come over no more!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (to Phoebe) Sure, your dresser is missing but this she notices.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I have to go. Yeah, Carol should be home by now, soo...</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Umm, how&#146;s it going with you guys?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, better, actually. Y'know I-I-I think I finally figured out why we were
having so much trouble lately.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, really?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, y'know how I have you guys, well she doesn&#146;t really have any
close friends that are just hers, but last week she meet this woman at the gym, Susan
something, and they really hit it off, and I-I-I think it&#146;s gonna make a difference</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler&#146;s, Chandler is interviewing a potential roommate.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Soo, ah, Eric, what kind of photography do ya do?</p>

<p><b>Eric:</b> Oh, mostly fashion, so there may be models here from time to time, I hope
that&#146;s cool.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes, that is cool. Because I have models here y'know......never.</p>

<p><b>Eric:</b> Oh, yeah, during the summer, I spend most weekends at my sister&#146;s
beach house, which you are welcome to use by the way. Although, I should probably tell
you, she&#146;s a porn star. (Chandler breaks his pencil in half)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, listen I ah, still have one more person to ah meet, but unless
it turns out to be your sister, I think you&#146;re chances are pretty good. (Eric offers
to shake hands) All right. (Chandler hugs him.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler&#146;s, Chandler is interviewing Joey.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (running around the apartment pointing out things) Bedroom. Bathroom.
Living room. This right here is the kitchen, and thanks for coming by, (opens door)
Bye-bye.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Don&#146;t you ah, don&#146;t you wanna ask me any questions?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Sure. Ummm. What&#146;s up?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, ah, I&#146;m an actor. I&#146;m fairly neat. I ah, I got my own TV.
Oh, and don&#146;t worry I&#146;m totally okay with the gay thing.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What gay thing?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ah, y'know just in general people being gay, thing. I&#146;m totally cool
with that.</p>

<p>[Scene: the hallway, Monica is coming up the stairs.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well okay Jerry, thanks for stopping by.</p>

<p>(Joey is leaving and notices Monica, as Monica notices him)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hi.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey!</p>

<p>(Joey leaves and Monica mouths to Chandler &#145;Oh my God!&#146;)</p>

<p>[Scene: A bar, Chandler is entering.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey, Mon.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey-hey-hey. You wanna hear something that sucks.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Do I ever.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Chris says they&#146;re closing down the bar.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No way!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah, apparently they&#146;re turning it into some kinda coffee place.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Just coffee! Where are we gonna hang out now?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Got me.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (to bartender) Can I get a beer.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey, did you pick a roommate?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You betcha!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Is it the Italian guy?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Um-mm, yeah right!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> He&#146;s so cute.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh yes, and that&#146;s what I want a roommate that I can walk around
with and be referred to as the funny one.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh look, the pool table&#146;s free. Rack &#145;em up. I&#146;ll be back
in just a minute. Get ready for me to whip your butt.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, but after that, we&#146;re shootin&#146; some pool.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (sitting at a table with some of her friends) (to waitress) Oh, um, no,
no, no, no excuse me, hello. Hi. My friend ordered an onion, not an olive, and uh I
ordered a rum and <i>Diet Coke</i>, which I don&#146;t think this is.</p>

<p><b>Waitress:</b> I am so sorry.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> That&#146;s all right. (to her friends) I mean hard is it to get a
couple drinks right, huh?</p>

<p><b>Friend No. 1:</b> Well, I would like to propose a toast to the woman, who in one
year from today, become Mrs. Dr. Barry Farber DDS</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ummm, I think it&#146;s time to see the ring again. (holds her hand out
and they all scream)</p>

<p><b>Friend No. 2:</b> Oh, isn&#146;t it exciting, I mean it&#146;s like having a
boyfriend for life.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, I know.</p>

<p><b>Friend No. 1:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, I don&#146;t know. Well maybe it&#146;s just the idea of Barry for
the rest of my life. I don&#146;t know I think I feel like I need to have one last fling,
y'know, just to sorta get it out of my system. (Chandler is listening in very intensely)</p>

<p><b>Friend No. 1:</b> Rachel stop!</p>

<p><b>Friend No. 2:</b> You&#146;re so bad!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I&#146;m serious, I really, I think I need just to have
some...meaningless, sex y'know, with the next guy that I see.</p>

<p>(Chandler throws the cue ball under there table.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Excuse, I seem to have dropped my ball.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, so?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (picks it up) And now I&#146;ve picked it up again. (walks over to
Monica.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh my God, I went to high school with her. (to Rachel) Rachel! Hi!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Monica! Look! Hi! What do ya think? (shows her, her ring)</p>
