that. All right look, you're going to have to go there yourself now, okay, make a few
surprise visits. </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I don't know you guys. </p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All right fine, don't do anything, just sit here and talk to us,
meanwhile she is talking to him about you. And he's being Mr. Joe Sensitive, and she
starts thinking 'Maybe this is the guy for me, because he understands me.' </p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> And before you know it, she's with him. And you'll be all, 'Ohh, man!' And
he'll be all, 'Yes!' And us, we'll be like, 'Wh-whoa, dude.' And pretty soon you'll be
like, (sadly) 'Hhiii,' and, and, and, 'I can't go, Rachel and Mark might be there.' And
we'll be like, 'Man get over it, it's been four years!!' </p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> He paints quite a picture doesn't he? </p>

<p>[Scene: Rachel's office.] </p>

<p><b>Woman:</b> (walking up to Mark) Here's the Shelly Siegal stuff from December. </p>

<p><b>Mark:</b> (turning around) And wait, I've got something for you. (kisses her) </p>

<p><b>Woman:</b> Mark!! </p>

<p><b>Mark:</b> It's okay, Rachel knows. </p>

<p><b>Woman:</b> Yeah, but even soo. </p>

<p>(Ross appears in the hallway just outside of Rachel's office.) </p>

<p><b>Mark:</b> I can't help it, I'm just, I'm just crazy about you. </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ohhh! That is soo sweet! (gets up to get herself a cup of coffee) </p>

<p>(Ross is eavesdropping in the hallway.) </p>

<p><b>Mark:</b> Okay, okay look, I know I'm being Mr. Inappropriate today, but it's just
so tough, I mean see you walking around and I just wanna touch you and hold you, come on
no one's around, just, just kiss me. </p>

<p>(They start to kiss, and Ross rushes into the office to break it up.) </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> All right that's, that's it!! Get off her! </p>

<p><b>Mark:</b> What is going on? </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What's going on?! (throws the love bug at him) That's what's going on!! </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (now standing behind Ross) Ross! </p>

<p>(Ross finally looks at the woman kissing Mark.) </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I have been down in your store for twenty minutes trying to get a tie!
What do I have to do to get some service?! (turns to Rachel) Hi Rach. (He's puts his hand
on her shoulder and she knocks it away.) </p>

<p>[Scene: Joey's dance audition, Joey is warming up.] </p>

<p><b>Director:</b> Ah Joey. Joey Tribbiani. Listen Joey, I got a problem, I just got a
call from my dance captain, he's having a relationship crisis and can't get out of Long
Island. </p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> So, does that mean the audition is off? </p>

<p><b>Director:</b> Listen Joey, seeing as you've got the most experience, I want you to
take these dancers and show them the combination. </p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What?! </p>

<p><b>Director:</b> Aw come on Joey, it's easy. Y'know, it's hand, hand, head, head, (very
quickly, Joey watches stunned) up, pas de bouree, pas de bouree, big turn here, grand
sissone, sissone, sissone, slide back, step, step, step, and jazz hands! </p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> It's ah, step-ity, step and jazz hands. </p>

<p><b>Director:</b> Have fun. </p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Bye. (does the jazz hands) </p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is tying a ribbon to a vase.] </p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (entering) Hey! </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey. </p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What are you wrapping? </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh-ho, look what I got Julio. </p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, it's a vase. </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah, just like the one in the poem. </p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well not exactly like the one in the poem. </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What do you mean? </p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Remember how you said you were really dense about poetry? Oh. (hugs her)
</p>

<p>[Scene: The Moondance Diner.] </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (to Julio) So! I'm just an empty vase, huh? </p>

<p><b>Julio:</b> What? </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Y'know, so I don't read as many important books as you do, and I don't
write trick poems that seem to be about one thing but are actually about something else.
And y'know what, I get excited about stupid stuff, like when I my <i>People</i> magazine
comes on Saturday, and the new <i>Hold Everything</i> catalog. Y'know but that does not
mean that I'm empty, I care about things. I care about my friends and family. You have no
right to make that kind of judgment about me. </p>

<p><b>Julio:</b> Whoa, whoa, whoa. </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You don't even know me... </p>

<p><b>Julio:</b> Whoa, whoa, whoa, the poem is not about you. </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What? </p>

<p><b>Julio:</b> The Empty Vase is not about you. My baby, you make me so sad that you
would think this. </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I'm sorry, my friend Phoebe... </p>

<p><b>Julio:</b> No, it's about all women. Well, all American women. You feel better now? </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (sarcastically) Oh yeah. </p>

<p>[Scene: Joey's audition, the director has returned and wants to see the combination.] </p>

<p><b>Director:</b> All right, let's do it! </p>

<p>(The group does the same horrible dance that Joey did earlier in the show, except
they're all out of sync and they do the jazz hands at the end.) </p>

<p><b>Director:</b> No, no, no. What was that? </p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I know, it was the best I could get out of them. </p>

<p><b>Director:</b> Well, people! </p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> People, people, people. </p>

<p><b>Director:</b> Let's try it again, and this time let's watch everybody watch Joey.
(to Joey) Show 'em how it's done. (to the pianist) Count it off. </p>

<p>(The pianist starts to play, and Joey readies himself, and then runs out of the
audition.) </p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Chandler and Rachel are there.] </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> So ah, did you have fun at the bachelor party last night? </p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh yeah, yeah! Look what I got, look what I got. (holds up a pen) See,
she's fully dressed, right? </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Right. </p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> And then you click it and, uh-oh, she's naked. And then, and then you
click it again and she's dressed. She's a business woman, she's walking down the street,
she's window shopping, and (clicks pen) whoa-whoa-whoa, sh-she's naked! (Rachel just
stares at him.) </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (entering) Hi. </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hello. </p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Y'know what, I'm, I'm gonna spend some alone time with the pen. </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (sits down next to her) I'm sorry, I was an idiot. </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> A big idiot. </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> A big idiot. Just you have to realize is, this whole Mark thing is kinda
hard for me. </p>

<p>(Gunther is eavesdropping in the background.) </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Honey, why is it hard, I mean we've been together for almost a year now?
</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, I was with Carol for like eight years and I lost her. And now if
it's possible I think I love you even more. So, it's hard for me to believe that I'm not
gonna, well that someone else is not going to take you away. </p>

<p><b>Gunther:</b> Let it be me! Let it be me! </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Honey, that's very sweet, it just seems to me though, that if two people
love each other and trust each other, like we do, there's no reason to be jealous. (she
kisses him) </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I gotta get going. Bye Chandler. </p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, okay Ross. Listen, this pen is kinda getting boring, so can you
pick me up some porn? </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Where ya going? </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, I've got to go pick up Ben, we've got a play date this afternoon. </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ohh, with who? </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, just this woman that I met last night at the party. </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> There was a woman at the... (realizes) The stripper?! </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah. </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You have a play date with a stripper?! </p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Man, I gotta get a kid. (looks at the pen and starts laughing) </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Ah, yeah, yeah. Umm, we started talking after she y'know, did her thing.
And it turns out she's got a boy about Ben's age, so we're taking them to a gym-boree
class. Why, is that okay? </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Sure, is she married? </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Ahh, no. </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh. (starts shaking the sugar down in a packet really hard.) </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Are you jealous? </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Noo, I y'know I don't see why she has to play with you, that's all. I
mean doesn't she have any y'know other stripper moms friends of her own? </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You are totally jealous. </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I'm not jealous. All right this is about, umm, people feeling certain
things y'know about strippers. And y'know, and um, I... </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Honey, I love you too. </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ugh. Wait, wait, wait. </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What? </p>

<p>(She runs over and gives him a very passionate kiss.) </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Huh. </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (to Chandler) Well, there's a kiss that he won't forget for a couple of
hours, y'know. </p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah. Either that, or you just turned him on and sent him off to a
stripper. </p>

<p align="center"><b>Closing Credits</b> </p>

<p>[Scene: The Moondance Diner.] </p>

<p><b>Man:</b> (entering) Is there a Julio here? </p>

<p><b>Julio:</b> (to him) I am Julio. </p>

<p>(The rest of barbershop quartet enters, and joins him.) </p>

<p><b>Man:</b> (singing) Mister Pretensous, (Monica stands up in the background) you think
there's no one finer, well but your poems are unpublished, and you work in a diner. </p>

<p><b>Quartet:</b> Your no God's gift to women, that's all in your headdddd. You are just
a buttmunch. </p>

<p><b>Bass Singer:</b> No one likes a buttmunch. </p>

<p><b>Quartet:</b> And your also bad in bedd-edd-edd!. </p>

<p>(Monica waves at Julio.) </p>

<p align="center"><b>End</b></p>
</font>
</body>
</html>
313<html>

<head>
<title>The One Where Monica and Richard Are Friends</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="white" text="black" link="green" vlink="black" alink="yellow">

<h1 align="center">The One Where Monica and Richard Are Friends</h1>

<hr align="center">

<p>Written by: Michael Borkow<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a> </p>

<hr>
<font size="3">

<p align="left">[Scene: A Video Store, Monica is running in to return a video.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (to clerk) Hi.</p>

<p>(The clerk enters the video into the computer.)</p>

<p><b>Clerk:</b> Six dollars, please.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Six? I just had it for one night. It&#146;s three.</p>

<p><b>Clerk:</b> Eight o&#146;clock is the cut-off and, (looks at his watch) aww,
it&#146;s 8:02.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Y'know in a weird way, you have too much power. Look, you&#146;re gonna
have to help me out here, &#145;cause I only have three.</p>

<p><b>Richard:</b> (standing behind her, without his moustache) I can help with that.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh my God. Richard? (turns around) Hi!</p>

<p><b>Richard:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Wow! Your lip went bald. (Richard pays the clerk) Hey, thanks.</p>

<p><b>Richard:</b> So, you look great.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Right.</p>

<p><b>Richard:</b> No you do. You... just...</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Richard:</b> You&#146;ve got panties stuck to your leg.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (removes them) That&#146;s because I-I was just grabbing some things out
of the dryer, and it&#146;s static cling. Or maybe it&#146;s just that God knew I&#146;d
be running into you and saw an opportunity.</p>

<p><b>Richard:</b> It&#146;s good to see you.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> It&#146;s good to see you too.</p>

<p>(They hug, and Richard notices a stocking stuck to Monica&#146;s back, which he removes
for her.)</p>

<p align="center"><b>Opening Credits</b></p>

<p>[Scene: continued from earlier.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You see that guy? He&#146;s in classics now, but y'know as soon as we
leave he&#146;s going straight to the porn.</p>

<p><b>Richard:</b> He&#146;s gonna go up to the counter with <i>Citizen Kane</i>, <i>Vertigo</i>,
and Clockwork Orgy. (they both laugh) This is nice.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Richard:</b> I missed this.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Me too.</p>

<p><b>Richard:</b> So, you wanna get a hamburger or something?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, um, I don&#146;t know if that&#146;s a good idea.</p>

<p><b>Richard:</b> Oh. Look, just friends, I won&#146;t grope you. I promise.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No, I just I think that it&#146;s too soon.</p>

<p><b>Richard:</b> No it&#146;s not too soon, I had lunch at a eleven.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler, Ross. Joey, and Rachel are eating breakfast.
Chandler is holding a bottle of <i>Hersey&#146;s Syrup</i>.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, baby!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What are you doing?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Making chocolate milk. Do you want some?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No thanks. I&#146;m 29.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (looking at her watch) Oh my God, I gotta go to work!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh sweetie, when do you think you&#146;re going to get off tonight?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh I don&#146;t know honey. It&#146;s gonna be really late.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh come on, not again.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I know. I&#146;m sorry. Look, I&#146;ll make a deal with you all right?
Okay?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hmm.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> For every night that you&#146;re asleep before I get home from work...</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I will wake you up in a way that&#146;s proved very popular in the past.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Now, if you need to stay late, I want to be supportive of that.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Right.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (entering, holding a pair of Roller Blades) Hi.</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (to Phoebe) Look at you. Since when do you roller blade?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh! Since tomorrow. I met this really cute guy in the park and he like
y'know, jogs, and blades, and swims, and so y'know we made a deal that&#146;s he&#146;s
going to teach me all sorts of jock stuff.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> And what are you going to do for him?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I&#146;m going to let him.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Cool.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (entering from her bedroom) Morning.</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Somebody got in late last night.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah well, I ran into Richard. </p>

<p>(They all gasp)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> When did this happen?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, um, around 8:02. We ah, talked for a little while, and then um, we
went out for an innocent burger.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, there&#146;s no such thing as an innocent burger.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> So, are you gonna see him again?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Tomorrow night.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Monica, what are you doing?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, she spent the last six months getting over him, and now
she&#146;s celebrating that by going on a date with him.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> It&#146;s not a date, okay. I&#146;m just gonna teach him how to make
lasagne for some pot luck dinner he has.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, you might wanna make a little extra, y'know you&#146;ll probably be
hungry after the sex.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> We&#146;re not gonna have sex! Okay, nothing&#146;s changed here. He
still doesn&#146;t want children and I still do, so that&#146;s why we&#146;re just gonna
be friends.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Naked friends.</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is watching TV.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (entering) Hey.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Do you have any ice?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Check the freezer. If there&#146;s none in there, then we&#146;re probably
out. Are you just getting in from work? It&#146;s late.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, I know. I had the greatest day though, I got to sit in on the
meeting with the reps from <i>Calvin Klien</i>. I told my boss I liked this line of
lingerie, she ordered a ton of it. How was your day?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I discovered I&#146;m able to count all of my teeth using just my tongue.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hmm. (she opens the freezer) Umm, why do you have a copy of <i>The
Shining</i> in your freezer?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, I was reading it last night, and I got scared, so.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> But ah, you&#146;re safe from it if it&#146;s in the freezer?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, safer. Y'know, I mean I never start reading <i>The Shining</i>,
without making sure we&#146;ve got plenty of room in the freezer, y'know.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> How often do you read it?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Haven&#146;t you ever read the same book over and over again?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, umm, I guess I read <i>Little Women</i> more than once. But I mean
that&#146;s a classic, what&#146;s so great about <i>The Shining</i>?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> The question should be Rach, what is <b>not</b> so great about <i>The
Shining</i>. Okay? And the answer would be: nothing. All right? This is like the scariest
book ever. I bet it&#146;s way better than that classic of yours.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay. Ah, well we&#146;ll just see about that, okay. I will read <i>The
Shining</i>, (she tries to take the book away from him but he doesn&#146;t want to let it
go) and you will read <i>Little Women</i>. </p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> All right, you got it.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> All right.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ah, now Rach, these ah, these little women.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> How little are they? I mean, are they like scary little?</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Chandler and Ross are there, Phoebe is entering with her date
Robert.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Um, Chandler, Ross, this is Robert.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, hey.</p>

<p><b>Robert:</b> Hi.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (to Robert) You&#146;ve have lipstick right here (points to her cheek).
That&#146;s okay, it&#146;s mine, we just kissed.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (to Robert) So ah, isn&#146;t a bit cold out for shorts?</p>

<p><b>Robert:</b> Well, I&#146;m from California.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Right, right. Sometimes you guys just burst into flames.</p>

<p>(Robert leans back on the arm of the chair and allows Chandler to see up his shorts and
sees &#145;little Robert.&#146; Chandler is horrified by this view.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (standing up) I&#146;m up! I&#146;m up, I&#146;ve gotten up now!
Anybody ah, want anything?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I&#146;ll have coffee.</p>

<p><b>Robert:</b> Yeah, me too.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, make that three.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay Ross, why don&#146;t you come with me?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay. (goes over to the counter) (to Chandler) What ah, what is the matter
with you? What&#146;s going on?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Robert&#146;s coming out.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What, what do you mean, what? Is he gay?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No. He.....he&#146;s coming out of his shorts.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> The man is showing brain.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Are you sure? (Chandler nods: Yes!) Hold on. (walks over behind the couch)
I&#146;m sorry you guys, that was a coffee and a....</p>

<p><b>Robert:</b> Coffee.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Robert:</b> We could write it down for you?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, no, that won&#146;t be ah, that won&#146;t be necessary (leans down
and looks up Robert&#146;s shorts, seeing Robert&#146;s package.) </p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (to Ross) Wellll?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, yeah, yeah!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What do we do? What do we do?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, I suppose we just try to not look directly at it.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Like an eclipse.</p>

<p>(Ross nods his head.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is teaching Richard how to make lasagne.]</p>

<p><b>Richard:</b> So when people complement me on my cooking should I, what do I say?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You say &#145;Thank you very much,&#146; and then you buy me something
pretty. Come on, we&#146;re gonna put are hands in this bowl, and we&#146;re gonna start
squishing the tomatoes.</p>

<p>(They both start squishing the tomatoes.)</p>

<p><b>Richard:</b> Ew, this feels very weird.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You touch people&#146;s eyeballs every day and this feels weird.</p>

<p><b>Richard:</b> Yeah, well, sure I touch them, but I spent years learning not to squish
them. (Monica grabs his hand in the tomatoes.) That&#146;s my hand.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oops.</p>

<p><b>Richard:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Gotta keep squishing.</p>

<p><b>Richard:</b> Tomatoes are squishing.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay.</p>

<p>(Richard squishes a little too hard and some lands on his shirt.)</p>

<p><b>Richard:</b> Op.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, gosh, you got some on your shirt. </p>

<p><b>Richard:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hold on a second, just put a little club soda on it (does so) and it
should umm, be..... </p>

<p>(She is rubbing his chest and her voice trails off into silence, a long pause follows.)</p>

<p><b>Richard:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Umm, you&#146;ve got some on your pants.</p>

<p><b>Richard:</b> I&#146;ll just throw them out.</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Chandler is watching Joey read <i>Little Women</i>, Ross is also
there.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> These little women. Wow!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Your liking it, huh?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh yeah! Amy just burned Jo&#146;s manuscript. I don&#146;t see how he
could ever forgive her.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Umm, Jo&#146;s a girl, it&#146;s short for Josephine.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> But Jo&#146;s got a crush on Laurie. (Ross nods his head) Oh. You mean
it&#146;s like a girl-girl thing? &#145;Cause that is the one thing missing from <i>The
Shining</i>.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No, actually Laurie&#146;s a boy.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No wonder Rachel had to read this so many times.</p>

<p>(Enter Phoebe and Robert)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey! How&#146;d the ah, basketball go?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, okay, I learned how to shoot a lay-up, a foul shot, and a
twenty-three pointer.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You mean a three pointer?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, I get more because I&#146;m dainty.</p>

<p><b>Robert:</b> So um, is there a phone here, I can check my messages?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, in the back. You want a quarter?</p>

<p><b>Robert:</b> Oh, no thanks. I always carry one in my sock. </p>

<p>(He puts his leg up on the couch to get the quarter, once again exposing himself to
Chandler and Ross. In horror, Chandler, slides over and leans against Joey on the couch.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (noticing Chandler) What are you doing? (he pushes Chandler back to his
side of the couch) Get back over on your side of the... (sees Robert in all his glory)
Hello!! (to Robert) Hi, I&#146;m Joey, we haven&#146;t met.</p>

<p><b>Robert:</b> Ah, good to meet you. Robert.</p>

<p>(Robert walks away and the guys all start laughing in front of Phoebe.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What? (the guys keep laughing.) What? You guys, what is going on? You
not like Robert? (the guys keep laughing.) Why are you laughing?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Calm down. There&#146;s no reason to get testy.</p>

<p>(The guys start laughing harder.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> You guys!! Come on!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I&#146;m sorry, I&#146;m sorry, it just seems that Robert isn&#146;t
as concealed in the shorts area, as ah, one may have hoped.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What do you mean?</p>

<p><b>Robert:</b> Hey. (sits down)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey Robert, could you ah, ha, pass me those cookies?</p>

<p><b>Robert:</b> Sure.</p>

<p>(He puts his leg up on the table to pass Joey the cookies, and Phoebe sees what the
guys are laughing at, and gasps.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is talking to Richard on the phone.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> So, how&#146;d the lasagne go over? (listens) Really?! Good. So you owe
me three pretty things. (listens) Yeah, I&#146;ve been thinking a lot about you too.
(listens) I know. It&#146;s hard this whole platonic thing. (listens) It&#146;s a word!</p>

<p>(There&#146;s a knock on the door.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah, I do think it&#146;s better this way. (listens) Yeah, we&#146;re
being smart. (gets up to answer the door) (listens) Yes, I&#146;m sure.(she opens the door
and it&#146;s Richard)</p>

<p><b>Richard:</b> You really sure?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I&#146;ll call you back. (starts kissing him)</p>

<p align="center"><b>Commercial Break</b></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica&#146;s bedroom, she&#146;s in bed with Richard.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> So we can be friends who sleep together.</p>

<p><b>Richard:</b> Absolutely, this will just be something we do, like racquetball.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Sounds smart and healthy to me. So um, just out of curiosity, um, do you
currently have any other racquetball buddies?</p>

<p><b>Richard:</b> Just your dad. (pause) Although that&#146;s actually racquetball. You
know I-I do have a blind date with my sister&#146;s neighbour next Tuesday.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh.</p>

<p><b>Richard:</b> You want me to cancel it?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No! (pushes him) No! </p>

<p><b>Richard:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> &#145;Cause if you do that means you&#146;d be cancelling it for me, and
we&#146;re just friends.</p>

<p><b>Richard:</b> Exactly. (pushes her back)</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Robert is picking up Phoebe for a date.]</p>

<p><b>Robert:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey. Ooh! Don&#146;t sit down! </p>

<p><b>Robert:</b> You ready to go to the batting cage?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah. And, first here&#146;s a gift.</p>

<p><b>Robert:</b> Oh! Wow! Hey!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Stretchy pants! Why, those are the greatest things in the world! If I
were you I would wear them every day, every day!</p>

<p><b>Robert:</b> Jeez, thank you really that is so nice. But um, to be honest, I
don&#146;t think I can wear these, they&#146;re so tight, I feel like I&#146;m on display.
I&#146;m sorry.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> That&#146;s all right, that&#146;s well, I figured.... (they start to
leave as Joey enters.)</p>

<p><b>Robert:</b> (to Joey) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey! (starts to laugh.) How&#146;s it going?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Good.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey, Rach, how you doing with <i>The Shining</i>?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, Danny just went into room 217.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oooh, the next part&#146;s the best, when that dead lady in the bathtub...</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, no, meh-nah-nah-nah, come on you&#146;re gonna ruin it!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> All right I&#146;ll talk in code. (to Ross and Chandler) Remember when the
kid sees those two blanks in the hallway?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hmmm, that&#146;s very cool.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, all blank, and no blank, make&#146;s blank a blank blank. Oh no-no-no,
no, the end when Jack almost kills them all with that blank, but then at last second they
get away. Aww!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Joey! I can&#146;t believe you just did that!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I can&#146;t believe she cracked your code!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> All right, okay, Laurie proposes to Jo, and she says no, even though
she&#146;s still in love with him, and then he ends up marring Amy.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey! Mine was by accident! All right, the boiler explodes and destroys the
hotel, and kills the dad.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Eh. Beth dies.</p>

<p>(Joey recoils and gasps in horror.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Beth, Beth dies?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Um-hmm.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Is that true? If I keep reading is Beth gonna die?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No, Beth doesn&#146;t die, she doesn&#146;t die. Does she Rachel?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Joey&#146;s asking if you&#146;ve just ruined the first book he&#146;s
ever loved that didn&#146;t star Jack Nicholson?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No. She doesn&#146;t die.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Then why would you say that?!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Because, I wanted to hurt you.</p>

<p><b>Robert:</b> (running in) Oh, there they are! I-I dropped my keys.</p>

<p>(He bends over to pick them up, right in front of Rachel, who then gets a free peep
show.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (gasps) Oh my....</p>

<p><b>Robert:</b> Got &#145;em.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is reading <i>The Shining</i>, as Monica enters.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hi.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (screams and grabs a potato masher to defend herself) Sorry. I&#146;m
sorry.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You would not believe my day! I had to work two shifts, and then to top
it off, I lost one of my fake boobs, (opens her coat revealing a large burn mark over her
left breast.) in a grill fire.</p>

<p>(Rachel starts laughing.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What are you smiling at?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I&#146;m sorry, I was just thinking you&#146;re day could still pick up.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah, right.</p>

<p>(She goes into her bedroom, and sees Richard who has covered the room in roses and has
two glasses of wine and a rose between his lips.)</p>

<p><b>Richard:</b> Hello.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I love this friend thing!</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe, Chandler, and Ross are there.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Listen, Robert&#146;s gonna be here any second so, will one of you just
tell him?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Please, right now, no, every time I see him it&#146;s like &#145;Is it
on the lose?&#146; &#145;Is it watching me?&#146;</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> We can&#146;t tell him, you can&#146;t go up to a guy you barely know
and talk about his.... stuff.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> He&#146;s right, even if it&#146;s to say something complementary. (He
stops and thinks about what he just said.)</p>

<p><b>Robert:</b> (entering) Hey! </p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Robert:</b> (to Phoebe) So are ready for the gym? They&#146;ve got this new rock
climbing wall, we can spot each other.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, I can spot you from here.</p>

<p><b>Robert:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, listen Robert...</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (to Chandler) Hey, don&#146;t we have to...</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, we got, um-hmm.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Umm, I think you&#146;re really, really great...</p>

<p><b>Robert:</b> Oh God! Here we go again. Why does this keep happening to me? (spreads
his legs) Is it something I&#146;m putting out there? Is this my fault? Or am I just nuts?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I-I-I-I-I don&#146;t know, I don&#146;t know what to say.</p>

<p><b>Gunther:</b> (cleaning up the table) (to Robert) Hey buddy, this is a family place,
put the mouse back in the house.</p>

<p>(Robert looks down and realises the problem.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Richard&#146;s bedroom, Monica has covered it in rose pedals and candles. We
hear Richard come in to the apartment, and Monica frantically throws the rest of the
pedals on the bed, and jumps onto the bed and puts a rose in her mouth, and bites a
thorn.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Ow!</p>

<p><b>Richard:</b> (outside the bedroom) Really?! Well, it&#146;s just like everyone
else&#146;s apartment. It&#146;s got rooms, walls, and ceilings.</p>

<p><b>Richard&#146;s Date:</b> Well, I just wanted to see where you lived. Now, give me
the tour.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh my God! Oh my God! (She frantically tries to clean up the bedroom as
Richard starts the tour.)</p>

<p><b>Richard:</b> Ah well, this is the living room.</p>

<p><b>Richard&#146;s Date:</b> Impressive.</p>

<p><b>Richard:</b> All right. This is the kitchen.</p>

<p><b>Richard&#146;s Date:</b> Oh, that&#146;s real pretty. Wait a minute, don&#146;t I
get to see the bedroom?</p>

<p><b>Richard:</b> The bedroom. Well it&#146;s pretty much your typical... (opens the door
as Monica hides under the covers, and quickly closes the door before his date can see the
room.) bedroom.</p>

<p><b>Richard&#146;s Date:</b> We&#146;re still on this side of the door.</p>

<p><b>Richard:</b> Um-hmm.</p>

<p><b>Richard&#146;s Date:</b> Yeah, but I didn&#146;t get to see it.</p>

<p><b>Richard:</b> Oh shoot! Maybe next time. (yawns) Thanks for a lovely evening. (shows
her out)</p>

<p>[Cut to into the bedroom, with Monica still hiding under the covers. Richard enters and
sits down next to her.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (still hiding under the blankets) So um, who was she?</p>

<p><b>Richard:</b> Oh, (laughs) that was the blind date that I told you about, she called
and switched it to today.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (still hiding under the blankets) Did you like her? And I&#146;m just
asking as a friend, because I am totally fine with this.</p>

<p><b>Richard:</b> Well, you seem fine.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (gets up) Okay, y'know what, I&#146;m not fine, I&#146;m not. I mean how
can I be fine, hearing you come in with her, she wants to see your bedroom.... (pause)
Y'know what, what if we&#146;re friends who don&#146;t see other people?</p>

<p><b>Richard:</b> You mean like exclusive friends?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Why not?! I mean this has been the most amazing week. Would it be so
terrible? Even if we were friends who lived together. Or, maybe someday friends who stood
up in front of their other friends, and vowed to be friends forever.</p>

<p><b>Richard:</b> Wow. Y'know we&#146;re back where we were. Honey, I would love to do
all that, but nothing&#146;s changed.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> That&#146;s not true, you don&#146;t have a moustache.</p>

<p><b>Richard:</b> Okay, okay, one thing&#146;s changed. But we still want different
things and we know how this is gonna end.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Y'know what, I&#146;ve got to walk out of here right now, &#145;cause
getting over you is the hardest thing that I have ever had to do. I don&#146;t think I
could do it again.</p>

<p><b>Richard:</b> I know I couldn&#146;t. So....</p>

<p>(Monica kisses him.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> How &#145;bout one last game of racquetball?</p>

<p>(They both kiss, and Richard picks her up and goes over to the bed and starts to lie
down.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Watch the thorns!</p>

<p><b>Richard:</b> (lying down) Ow!!</p>

<p align="center"><b>Closing Credits</b></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Joey is entering, and he&#146;s very dejected.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Beth is really, really sick.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Awwww.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Jo&#146;s there, but I don&#146;t think there&#146;s anything she could
do.</p>

<p>(Rachel hugs him)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Joey?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Do you want to put the book in the freezer?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (nodding his head) Okay.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay.</p>

<p>(Joey hands her the book and she puts it in the freezer.)</p>
</font>

<p align="center"><strong><font size="3">End</font></strong></p>
</body>

314<html>

<head>
<title>The One With Phoebe's Ex-Partner</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="white" text="black" link="green" vlink="black" alink="yellow">

<h1 align="center">The One With Phoebe&#146;s Ex-Partner</h1>

<hr align="center">

<p>Written by: Wil Calhoun<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a> </p>

<hr>
<font size="3">

<p align="left">[Scene: Central Perk, the gang, except Rachel, is watching a new singer.]</p>

<p><b>Singer:</b> (singing) &#145;Cause every time I see your face, I can&#146;t help but
fall from grace. I know.....</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Wow! This girl is good.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh-ho yeah! A song with rhyming words. Oo, I never thought of that
before.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I like her.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (to Chandler) Why? Because she can sing and play guitar and do both at
the same time?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, that&#146;s pretty much all I&#146;m looking for from these
people.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (to Phoebe) Look at you. All jealous.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah Pheebs, come on, you two have completely different styles. Y'know,
she&#146;s more..(shakes his shoulders, like he&#146;s dancing) y'know, and you&#146;re
more (sees the look from Phoebe and stops)</p>

<p><b>Singer:</b> (singing) beside meeeee-eeee-ee. (everyone applauds her).</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, see, see, everyone else is happy she&#146;s done.</p>

<p><b>Singer:</b> Okay, my next song&#146;s called: Phoebe Buffay, What Can I Say. I
Really Loved When We Were Singing Partners, And I Shouldn&#146;t Have Left You That Way.</p>

<p>(The gang all looks at Phoebe.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh no, one of those &#145;look for the hidden meaning&#146; songs.</p>

<p align="center"><b>Opening Credits</b></p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, later.]</p>

<p><b>Singer:</b> Hey Phoebe.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey Leslie, how&#146;d you know I&#146;d be here?</p>

<p><b>Leslie:</b> I ran into Vlad at the place where they sell the big fish, and he said
you played here a lot, so umm....</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (to Ross) All right listen, I have to go to the bathroom, but if the
place with the big fish comes up again. I&#146;d like know whether that&#146;s several big
fish or just one big fish.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (to Leslie) So ah, Phoebe tells us you write jingles.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Actually I said she abandoned me to write jingles.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (to Leslie) Ah, anything we might of heard of?</p>

<p><b>Leslie:</b> Ah, yeah, umm. (singing) Home is never far away..</p>

<p><b>Monica, Ross, and Joey:</b> (joining in) Home is Home Star stew.</p>

<p><b>Leslie:</b> Yeah, but, I don&#146;t do that anymore. I got kinda sick of it, and
then I couldn&#146;t come up with anything good, so they fired me.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hmm, bummer.</p>

<p><b>Leslie:</b> Well, I y'know, I was just, umm, I was just thinking and hoping, that
umm, maybe you&#146;d want to get back together?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No. But thanks.</p>

<p><b>Leslie:</b> Aw come on Phoebe would you just think about it?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay. No. But thanks.</p>

<p><b>Leslie:</b> Okay, ah, see ya Pheebs. (leaves)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (to Phoebe) Wow, that was kinda brutal.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well okay, let this be a lesson to all of you, all right. Once you, once
you betray me, I become like the ice woman, y&#146;know. Very cold, hard, unyielding,
y'know nothing, <b>nothing</b> can penetrate this icy exterior. (to Monica) Can I have a
tissue, please?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah, sure.</p>

<p>[Scene: Outside the bathroom, Chandler is pacing back and fourth, waiting is use it.]</p>

<p><b>Gunther:</b> (to Chandler) Someone in there?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No. This is just part of a dare devil game that I play called
&#145;wait until the last moment before I burst and die.&#146;</p>

<p>(The door opens.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Jeez, man did you fall..(sees it&#146;s a beautiful woman coming out
of the men&#146;s room) Hi! So ah, did ya, did-did-did ya fall high?</p>

<p><b>Woman:</b> Someone was in the lady's room, I couldn&#146;t wait. I left the lid up
for ya though.</p>

<p>(Gunther walks up)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (to Gunther) Y'know what Gunther, go ah, go ahead, I&#146;m-I&#146;m
talking to ah, (tries to get her to say her name). (to her) This is the part where you say
your name.</p>

<p><b>Woman:</b> Ginger.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Ginger. I&#146;m talking to Ginger, so.... </p>

<p><b>Ginger:</b> Don&#146;t you have to use the bathroom?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Nope, nope, I&#146;d just ah, I&#146;d rather talk to you. (pause)
Yes, I do. Yes, I do have to go to the bathroom. (knocks on the door)</p>

<p><b>Gunther:</b> Someone in here.</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, the gang&#146;s putting their coats on to leave.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Where&#146;s Chandler?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ah, he can&#146;t make it, he said he had to his... (sees Ginger) Whoa-oh!
(hides behind the coat rack.)</p>

<p><b>Ginger:</b> Joey? Joey Tribbiani? </p>

<p>(She walks over behind the coat rack, but Joey picks it up and moves it so that
he&#146;s still behind it, and she can&#146;t see him.) </p>

<p><b>Ginger:</b> Joey I can see you okay? You&#146;re hiding behind the coats.</p>

<p>(Joey puts his finger over his mouth to tell Ross to keep quiet. Ginger looks at Monica
who looks away and leave.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Phew, close one.</p>

<p>[Scene: Rachel&#146;s office, Mark is packing his stuff into a box.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hi.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hi, sweetie!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hello. </p>

<p><b>Mark:</b> Hi, Ross.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, huh. </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I&#146;ve got some bad news.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I can get a quick bite to eat, but then I have to come back up here.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Come on sweetie! You&#146;ve had to work late every night for the past two
weeks, what is it this time?</p>

<p><b>Mark:</b> Actually, it&#146;s kinda my fault. I-I quit today.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (to Rachel) But work comes first! (to Mark) Oh hey, but that&#146;s sad
about you though, what happened? Burn out? Burn all out, did ya?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Nooo, he&#146;s leaving for a better job.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh well that&#146;s great, so I guess this is ah, this is good bye then.
Huh? (picks a pad up off Rachel&#146;s desk and tosses it into his box) Good bye.</p>

<p><b>Mark:</b> Okay, then.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well we&#146;re gonna miss you around here.</p>

<p><b>Mark:</b> Yeah, me too.</p>

<p>(Rachel goes to hug him but Ross is holding one of her hands and doesn&#146;t let go,
so she can only put one arm around him.)</p>

<p><b>Mark:</b> So, see ya on Saturday.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, you bet.</p>

<p>(Ross is shocked, but Rachel drags him out of the office.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe and Monica are playing with a Ouija board,
Phoebe&#146;s beeper goes off and Monica screams.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh. (takes her beeper puts in a pot, covers it, and puts the pot in the
oven)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Y'know those are a delicacy in India.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, that was Leslie calling again to see if we can get back together.
That&#146;s the twentieth time today! And good luck Leslie!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Wow, she must have hurt you pretty bad, huh?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, yeah. Y'know, we were best friends, ever since we were little, our
Moms worked on the barge together.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, you two must have been so cute running around on a barge.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> You <b>never</b> run on a barge!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (entering) Hey.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe and Monica:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Is ah, is Chandler around?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No, umm, he met some girl at the coffee house.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oooh.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah, Ginger something.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Nooo. No, no, ah, are you sure it wasn&#146;t something that sounded like
Ginger, like ah, Gingeer?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No, it was Ginger. I remember, because when he told me, I said,
(singing) &#145;the movie star.&#146;</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Aww, man. That&#146;s the girl I was hiding from. When she finds out
he&#146;s my roommate, she&#146;s gonna tell him what I did.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well, what did you do?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What, oh, oh, oh, no, no, I can&#146;t, I can&#146;t tell you that,
it&#146;s like the most awful, horrible thing I&#146;ve ever done my whole life.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Y'know what, don&#146;t tell us. We&#146;ll just wait until Chandler
gets home, (to Phoebe) because it&#146;ll be more fun that way.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> All right!! Okay, it was like four years ago. Okay, Ginger and I had gone
out a few times, and then this one weekend, we went up to her Dad&#146;s cabin. Just me,
her, and her annoying little dog Pepper. Well that night, I cooked this really romantic
dinner....</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You gave her food poisoning!?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I wish. No. After dinner, me, her, and Pepper all fell asleep in front of
the fire. Well I woke up in the middle of the night and I saw that the fire was dying out.
So, I picked up a log and threw it on. Or, at least what I thought was a log.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh my God!! You threw Pepper on the fire!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I wish. See, I guess another thing I probably should&#146;ve told you
about Ginger is that she kinda has a ah, artificial leg.</p>

<p>(Phoebe and Monica both stand up and gasp.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh my God! Joey, what did you do after you threw her leg on the fire?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I ran!!</p>

<p>[Scene: A street, Chandler is kissing Ginger.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, that&#146;s the best kiss I&#146;ve had with anyone I&#146;ve
ever met in a men&#146;s room.</p>

<p><b>Ginger:</b> Actually, me too.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (sees her foot is in a slush puddle) Op, foot in a puddle, foot all in
a puddle.</p>

<p><b>Ginger:</b> Oh damn, I hate that.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, we&#146;re gonna have to get you out of those shoes.</p>

<p><b>Ginger:</b> Oh, don&#146;t worry about it.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No, really you&#146;re gonna freeze.</p>

<p><b>Ginger:</b> No, I&#146;m not.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You&#146;re not, what do you, what do you got a bionic foot?</p>

<p><b>Ginger:</b> Some day, maybe.</p>

<p>[Scene: Ross&#146;s bedroom, Rachel getting into bed while Ross is reading and laughs.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Funny book?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hmmm. Oh, no, no, I just thinking about something funny I heard today.
Umm, Mark, Mark saying &#145;I&#146;ll see you Saturday.&#146;</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, at the lecture, I told you that last week, you said you
didn&#146;t mind.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, no, no, no, it&#146;s-it&#146;s not the lecture ah, I mind, umm....</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, please tell me it&#146;s not because I&#146;m going with Mark.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, well...</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh my God!!! Ross!!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, I&#146;m sorry, but ah, look if you&#146;re not working with him
anymore, why do you have to still do stuff with him?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Because, he&#146;s my friend.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, but do you really need another friend? I mean...</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, well if I stop playing with Joey and Chandler, can I play with
Mark?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Is that funny? Am I supposed to be laughing?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I don&#146;t know, you thought &#145;See you Saturday&#146; was funny.
Look honey, Mark is in fashion okay, I like having a friend that I can share this stuff
with. You guys would never want to go to a lecture with me.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Pa-haa!! I would love to go with you.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Really!?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, hey I-I have clothes, I even pick them out. I mean for, for all you
know I could be a fashion..... monger.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay. Honey, I would love for you to go with me. (Ross has a worried
look on his face) What?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What should I wear, now I&#146;m all nervous.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe is looking at her beeper still in the pot. She
takes it out, shakes it, and puts it back in.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Y'know they say a watched pot never beeps.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> It&#146;s just y'know, been a couple of hours, and she hasn&#146;t
called. Not that I even care, y'know.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Phoebe why don&#146;t you just call her? You obviously want to.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> You think you know me so well.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well, don&#146;t &#145;cha wanna?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay, well I do know you.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> That&#146;s what I said.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well so?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I can&#146;t. I can&#146;t. She dumped me, I mean I totally trusted her
and then one day it was &#145;Okay, bye Pheebs&#146; gone. Y'know what the saddest part
is, when we were playing together, that was like the most fun I&#146;ve ever had in like
all my lives.</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Leslie is singing.]</p>

<p><b>Leslie:</b> (singing) My best shoes, so good to me. I wear them everyday. Down at
the heel, holes in the toes. Don&#146;t care what people say. My feet&#146;s best friends,
pals to the end. With them I&#146;m one hot chicky. Though late one night, not much light,
I....</p>

<p>(Phoebe runs in and joins her.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (singing) I stepped in something icky.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe and Leslie:</b> (singing) Sticky shoes, sticky shoes, always make me smile.
Sticky shoes, sticky shoes, next time I&#146;ll.... avoid the..... pillleeeee.</p>

<p align="center"><b>Commercial Break</b></p>

<p>[Scene: The lecture, Rachel is listening closely, Ross is bored out of his mind.]</p>

<p><b>Lecturer:</b> We&#146;re beginning to see a lot of layering of sheer fabrics and
colours. For instance a sheer navy blouse over a pink....</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (to Rachel) I&#146;m really glad we came. (Rachel smiles and rubs his arm)
You&#146;re so pretty. I love you.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh. (puts her hand over his mouth)</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe is teaching Leslie how to sing Smelly Cat.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (singing) Smelly cat, smelly cat, what are they feeding you? Smelly cat,
smelly cat, it&#146;s not your fault.</p>

<p><b>Leslie:</b> Wow, that&#146;s great.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, yeah!</p>

<p><b>Leslie:</b> Y'know you could totally sell this. It&#146;d be perfect for like umm, a
kitty litter campaign.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I..., a jingle? No, no-no-no, no.</p>

<p><b>Leslie:</b> What? Why not? You could make a ton of money.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, well if I was in this for the money, I&#146;d be a millionaire by
now, y'know. You just got to get out of that jingle head sweetie.</p>

<p><b>Leslie:</b> Aw, you&#146;re right, you&#146;re right. I&#146;m sorry.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> That&#146;s okay. All right, I&#146;m gonna play song that&#146;s
really, really sad. It&#146;s called Magician Box Mix Up. (she turns her guitar upside
down to play it.)</p>

<p>[Scene: The lecture, Ross is passed out against Rachel&#146;s shoulder.]</p>

<p><b>Lecturer:</b> ....oversized bracelets, oversized earrings, oversizing of accessories
in general are very popular now.</p>

<p>(Ross wakes up with a start and startles Rachel. The guy next to him starts laughing,
which starts Ross laughing, Rachel gives him a look and he stops.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is reading the newspaper.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (entering) Hi!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, can I borrow this? (points to his milk) My milk&#146;s gone bad.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, I hate that. I once had a thing of half and half, stole my car.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> So umm, how was your date with Ginger?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Great. It was great. She&#146;s ah, she&#146;s great, great looking,
great personality, she&#146;s greatness.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Sounds like she&#146;s got the ah, whole package.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Joey told you about the leg, huh?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Uh-huh.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh God, it freaked me out. Okay, I know it shouldn&#146;t have, but it
did. I mean I like her, I don&#146;t want to stop seeing her, but every so often it&#146;s
like &#145;Hey, y'know what, where&#146;s your leg?&#146; I mean I&#146;m the smallest
person in the world aren&#146;t I? I&#146;m the smallest person in the world.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (entering from his bedroom) Morning.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (to Monica) Actually he&#146;s the smallest person in the world.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (to Chandler) Heard about the leg burnin&#146; huh?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> It came up.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Listen, I ah, I know it&#146;s a longshot. But, by any chance did she find
that funny?</p>

<p>(Both Chandler and Monica walk away in disgust.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross and Rachel are getting back from the lecture.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (entering) So I nodded off a little.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Nodded off!! Ross you were snoring. My father&#146;s boat didn&#146;t
make that much noise when it hit rocks!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Come on! Forty-five minutes! Forty-five minutes the man talked about
strappy backed dresses.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well okay, how about four hours in a freezing museum auditorium
listening to Professor Pitstains and he&#146;s &#145;Hey everybody! Remember that thing
that&#146;s been dead for a gazillion years. Well there&#146;s this little bone we
didn&#146;t know it had!&#146;</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> First of all it&#146;s Professor Pittain! And second of all, that little
bone, proved that, that particular dinosaur had wings, but didn&#146;t fly.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, see now, what I just heard: blah-blah-blah,
blah-blah-blah-blah-blah, blah-blah-blah, blah, blah.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Y'know what, 100 million people went to see a movie about what I do, I
wonder how many people would go see a movie called, Jurassic Parka.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, that is so...</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No-no-no, a bunch of out of control jackets take over an island. (Makes an
unusual sound, then he realises that he still has his jacket on and quickly tries to shake
it off, thinking it&#146;s alive and attacking him.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Y'know if what I do is so lame, then why did you insist on coming with
me this morning? Huh? Was it so I just wouldn&#146;t go with Mark?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No. I... I wanted to be with you. I don&#146;t know, I feel like lately, I
feel like you&#146;re slipping away from me, y'know. With this new job, and all these new
people, and you&#146;ve got this whole other life going on. I-I-I know it&#146;s dumb, but
I hate that I&#146;m not a part of it.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> It&#146;s not dumb. But, maybe it&#146;s okay that you&#146;re not a
part of it. Y'know what I mean? (Ross looks confused) I mean it&#146;s like, I-I-I like
that you&#146;re not involved in that part of my life.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> That&#146;s a little clearer.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Honey see, it doesn&#146;t mean that I don&#146;t love you. Because I
do. I love you, I love you so much. But my work it&#146;s-it&#146;s for me y'know,
I&#146;m out there, on my own, and I&#146;m doing it and it&#146;s scary but I love it,
because it&#146;s mine. I, but, I mean is that okay?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Sure, I-I-I... (hugs her and mouths No!!)</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler and Ginger are eating dinner.]</p>

<p><b>Ginger:</b> Your thinking about my leg aren&#146;t you?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No. No. Actually I forgot, what is the deal with that again?</p>

<p><b>Ginger:</b> It&#146;s okay if it bothers you. Really. I mean the only thing I need
to know is: &#145;How much it bothers you?&#146; because I don&#146;t like wasting my
time. Am I wasting my time?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No. No. I don&#146;t think so.</p>

<p><b>Ginger:</b> Okay. It&#146;s just like anything else, you just have to get used to
it.</p>

<p>(They start making out. She opens his shirt and feels inside and stops.)</p>

<p><b>Ginger:</b> What&#146;s that?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> That&#146;s-that&#146;s my nubbin.</p>

<p><b>Ginger:</b> What&#146;s a nubbin?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> It&#146;s kinda a ah, a third nipple kinda thing.</p>

<p><b>Ginger:</b> You have three nipples?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, y'know two regulars. And ah one that barely qualifies as...
(starts to kiss her again, but she gets up.) Ahh, what?</p>

<p><b>Ginger:</b> Nothing. I, I just remembered I have to leave.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You ah, you have, you have to leave, now? How come?</p>

<p><b>Ginger:</b> Ah well, it&#146;s nubbin. Nothing! Umm. Y'know what, I&#146;ll see you
later. Okay. (She leaves and in the hall we see her shake her shoulders like when someone
runs their fingernails across a blackboard.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe is getting ready to sing as Leslie enters.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (to Leslie) Oh, I thought you weren&#146;t coming. What? Where were you?</p>

<p><b>Leslie:</b> Come here, come here. (they go to the side of the stage) Okay,
don&#146;t get mad, okay.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, don&#146;t give me a reason to get mad, okay</p>

<p><b>Leslie:</b> I played Smelly Cat for the people at my old ad agency, they went nuts.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, look, I told you that I didn&#146;t want you to try and sell it, and
you just, you big fat did it anyway. God, y'know what, I think five years ago I probably
would&#146;ve done anything to play with you but, I can do it by myself. And if I
can&#146;t trust you then just forget it. </p>

<p><b>Leslie:</b> No, no, I don&#146;t want to forget it.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay y'know what you have to choose. All right, if-if the most important
thing on the planet to you is this cat poopy thing then, okay you can have Smelly Cat, but
we won&#146;t be partners. So what&#146;s it gonna be?</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe, Monica, and Joey are watching TV.]</p>

<p><b>Commercial:</b> (in the background their singing Smelly Cat) Problem odour in the
litter box? Don&#146;t change your kitty, change your kitty litter.</p>

<p>(Monica gets up and shuts off the TV.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Sorry, Pheebs.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah. You okay?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah. I actually am, yeah. Y'know life-life&#146;s gonna had you all
kinds of stuff, y'know you learn your little lessons and hopefully you grow. Wanna hear a
new song?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> We&#146;d love too.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay. (singing) &#145;Jingle bitch screwed me over! Go to hell jingle
whore! Go to hell Go to hell. Go to hell-hell-hell.&#146; That&#146;s all I have so far.</p>

<p align="center"><b>Closing Credits</b></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the whole gang except Chandler is there.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (entering, happily) Well hello!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Where have you been?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> The doctor.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Is everything okay?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh yes! Just had me a little nubbin-ectomy. Yep! Two nipples, no
waiting.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Wow! It&#146;s like Rachel in High School.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?!!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Come on! Come on, I was kidding! It was such an obvious joke!</p>

<p align="left"><b>Chandler:</b> That was an obvious joke, and I didn&#146;t think of it.
Why didn&#146;t I think of it? The source of all my powers. Oh dear God, what have I done!</p>
</font>

<p align="center"><strong><font size="3">End</font></strong></p>
</body>
</html>
315<html>

<head>
<title>The One Where Ross and Rachel Take A Break</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="white" text="black" link="green" vlink="black" alink="yellow">

<h1 align="center">The One Where Ross and Rachel Take A Break</h1>

<hr align="center">

<p>Written by: Michael Borkow<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a> </p>

<hr>
<font size="3">

<p align="left">[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Joey is taking a jar of olives out of the
fridge.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (to Monica) Hey, how much will you give me to eat this whole jar of
olives?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I won&#146;t give you anything, but you&#146;ll owe me 2.95.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Done.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (entering) Hey. I need an atlas! I need an atlas!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Why? (in a motherlike tone) Do you have a report due?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I have a date with this diplomat I met while I was giving free massages
outside the UN and, I don&#146;t know where his country is.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay, let&#146;s start with the free messages outside the UN.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh!! That&#146;s my new thing. I figure bodies at peace, make peace.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Wow! You might just get the first Nobel prize in rubbing. So what
country is this guy from?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ick-neck-tree-anis..... There&#146;s a &#145;g&#146; in there.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Where&#146;s that?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> In your atlas!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I don&#146;t have an atlas.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, but wait I do have a globe.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hold on.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> So Pheebs what&#146;s this guy like?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Umm, well he&#146;s very dashing, y'know, and umm, very, very
sophisticated, and he doesn&#146;t speak any English, but according to his translator, he
totally gets me.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> &#145;Kay, here you go. (Hands her this tiny little globe.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What is this?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> It&#146;s a globe and, a pencil sharpener.</p>

<p>(Phoebe puts the globe right up next to her eye to try and find the country.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (entering) Hey, does anybody need anything copied? I&#146;m going down
to the Xerox place.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, no thanks.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay listen, just give me anything I can make two of.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well, if you don&#146;t have anything to copy, why are you going down
there?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, are you just going down there to gawk at that hot girl with the
belly button ring again?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah! You wanna come?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah!</p>

<p align="center"><b>Opening Credits</b></p>

<p>[Scene: The Xerox place, Chandler and Joey are waiting in line.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Come on Chloe! Finish up with your customer first. Come on Chloe! Come
on Chloe!!</p>

<p><b>Issac:</b> (to Chandler and Joey) Can I help you?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Uh-oh.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Uh, y'know what, we&#146;re having second thoughts about our copying
needs. And we&#146;ll need a little more time to think about it.</p>

<p><b>Issac:</b> Chloe, switch with me, there&#146;s some guys here that got a crush on
you.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (to Joey) Okay, that hurt us.</p>

<p><b>Chloe:</b> Hi guys. I haven&#146;t seen you since this morning.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well ah, ........y'know.</p>

<p><b>Chloe:</b> Hey, what are you guys doing tomorrow night?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Both of us? (points to Chandler and himself)</p>

<p><b>Chloe:</b> Maybe. Does that scare ya?</p>

<p>(They both start laughing. They look at each other, stop and step apart a little bit.)</p>

<p><b>Chloe:</b> Relax. It&#146;s just Issac&#146;s D.J.-ing at the Philly. You should
come.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> We&#146;ll be there.</p>

<p><b>Chloe:</b> Great. I&#146;ll ah, see ya then.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All right, rock on. (Does the &#145;Hang 10&#146; sign, then hides his
face in shame.)</p>

<p>[Scene: A Street, Phoebe is walking along with the diplomat (Sergei) and his translator
(Mischa).]</p>

<p><b>Sergei:</b> (something in Russian or Polish)</p>

<p><b>Mischa:</b> He&#146;s says, &#145;Walking with you makes this strange city, feel
like home.&#146;</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Me too. Although this city is my home, so. So that&#146;s dumb what I
said, don&#146;t tell him I said that. Umm, you make something up. (Mischa does so and
Sergei kisses her hand.) Nice, (to Mischa) thank you. This is me. Here.</p>

<p>(Sergei goes up to her at her door and says something.)</p>

<p><b>Mischa:</b> (leaning in) Your eyes are very pretty.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (to Mischa) Thank you, very much! Oh! (to Sergei) Thank you!</p>

<p>(Sergei says something and leans in to kiss her, but just as he&#146;s about to....)</p>

<p><b>Mischa:</b> (leaning in) He would like to kiss you.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (to Mischa) Okay, y'know what, you don&#146;t have to do that now.
(Mischa translates that to Sergei) No-no-no-no!! Not him, you don&#146;t! (Mischa tells
Sergei he can proceed and steps away) Well the moment&#146;s over.</p>

<p>(Sergei says something and kisses her.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh.</p>

<p><b>Mischa:</b> Oy!</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe is showing Monica where Sergei&#146;s country is.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (pointing to the globe) See there it is right there.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Wow! It&#146;s small.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah. But Sergei said it took the Germans six weeks to get all the way
across it.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> So you had fun, huh?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah. Except for, y'know when you&#146;re on a date and you&#146;re
getting along really great but the guy&#146;s translator keeps getting in the way.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (entering) Hey.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe and Monica:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What is ah, Rach in her room?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh no, she&#146;s still at work, but she told me to tell you to call
her.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh what?! Is she gonna cancel on me again?! How can she do this?
Doesn&#146;t she know it&#146;s our anniversary?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> All right ah, Ross, this is the extent of my knowledge on the subject.
(holds up a notepad) Call Rachel.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What&#146;s that on the bottom?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh that&#146;s my doodle of a ladybug, with a top hat. (to Phoebe)
She&#146;s fancy.</p>

<p>(Ross calls Rachel)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (answering her phone at work) Hello.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey, honey.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, hi.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey, what&#146;s going on?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, there was a disaster in shipping and I&#146;ve got to get this
order in. Honey, I&#146;m so sorry, but it looks like I&#146;m gonna be here all night.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What, do you, well umm, oh how about I come up there?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No-no-no, no, honey please, I&#146;ve got, I&#146;ve just have so much
to deal with.</p>

<p>[Cut to kitchen.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (to Monica) Anyway, I&#146;m going out with Sergei again tonight, and
um, could you come and be the translator&#146;s date? So that when we, it&#146;s time for
our alone time, you two could split off. Y'know, he&#146;s really, he&#146;s kinda cute.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah, well kinda cute, like really kinda cute, or kinda cute like your
friend Spackel Back Larry?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey, don&#146;t call him that! His name is Spackel Back Harry!</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Chandler and Joey are sitting on the big couch.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey, y'know what, maybe we should get going. I mean what time did
Chloe say we should be there?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Uh, 10:30.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What time is it now?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> 4:30.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah all right, so we&#146;ll hang out.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah. Hey, remember when she brought up that thing about the three of us?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes. Vividly.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> She was kidding about that right?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, I-I-I think so. (Pauses and thinks about it for a second) Yeah,
I-I think so...</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> God, that would be weird it that situation presented itself tonight, huh?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah. Yeah, I mean what, what would we do?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Dude, I don&#146;t know.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> She was kidding.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> She was.... But y'know what, just in case, maybe we should come up
with a set of ground rules.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, for sure. Okay. Probably want the first thing to be, never open your
eyes. Y'know, because you don&#146;t want to be doing something and then look up and see
something you don&#146;t want to be seeing.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah. Good call, nice one. Hold it!! Hold it! What if me eyes are
closed, and, and my hand is out there.... (holds his arm out and pretends to grab
something with his hand.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ah!! Okay! Eyes open at all times! Oh, hey, how do we decide where we...
(clears throat) y'know each would, (clears throat again) y'know (pause) be?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Right. Right. Well ah, y'know we could flip for it.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, I guess, but what&#146;s like heads and what&#146;s tails?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well it you don&#146;t know that, then I don&#146;t want to do this
with you.</p>

<p>[Scene: Rachel&#146;s office, Rachel and a co-worker (Sophie) are dealing with the
crisis.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (on the phone) No, no, no, I&#146;m looking at a purchase order right
here and it clearly states that we ordered the Rivera bikini in a variety of sizes and
colours. And.... (listens) What does it matter, what I&#146;m wearing?! Can I please speak
to your supervisor? (listens) Thank you. (to Sophie) We&#146;re holding.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (entering, carrying a basket) Hi!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (startled) Oh!! My God, what are you doing here?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well you said you couldn&#146;t go out so.... (pulls the cover off of the
basket)</p>

<p><b>Sophie:</b> You brought a picnic, oh, what a boyfriend. That&#146;s it, on Monday I
start wearing make-up.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ross honey, this is very nice, but, but I-I got a crisis.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, but I got cous-cous!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Honey, honey, I&#146;m sorry, I know it&#146;s our anniversary but I
told you on the phone I don&#146;t have time to stop.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, you don&#146;t have to stop, I&#146;m invisible, I&#146;m not here.
(lights a candle)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> But I don&#146;t, hmm... (on phone) Oh, who approved that order?!
(listens) Well there is no Mark Robbinson in this office. (to Sophie) Get me Mark on the
phone!</p>

<p><b>Sophie:</b> I love Mark. (to Ross) Do you know Mark?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah!!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, let me just check that with what I got here, all right see 038 is
not the number for (Ross starts making a lot of noise with a handheld pepper grinder) this
store, 038 is Atlanta. And I...(stops and looks at Ross)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (stopping grinding) Pepper?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (angrily) None for me.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay sorry, whew.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I&#146;m sorry, as I was saying the store number is wrong, and I&#146;m
sorry but that&#146;s... (notices a fire that Ross&#146;s candle has started) Oh my God!! </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (putting out the fire with a squeeze bottle of water) Okay, that&#146;s a
fire. Oh yeah. Oh yeah.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (on phone) Excuse me, I&#146;m sorry, I&#146;m gonna have to call you
back, I&#146;ve got a Schemp in my office. (hangs up) (to Ross) What are you doing?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I&#146;m sorry. But ah, hey, oh, somebody&#146;s off the phone, how
&#145;bout a glass of wine by the fire, I could get it going again.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ross you&#146;re not listening to me, I don&#146;t have time to stop.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Come on Rach, you don&#146;t have what, ten minutes?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I don&#146;t have ten minutes!!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What? (to Sophie) Sophie, does she have ten minutes?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hey, Ross!!! I told you I don&#146;t!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Don&#146;t yell at me okay, this is the most I&#146;ve seen you all week.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Look, I cannot do this right now, okay, I&#146;ve got a deadline, would
you just go home, I&#146;ll talk to you later. (storms out) </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, but wait...</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Good bye!</p>

<p>(Ross starts to pack up the picnic in anger, and throws a three hole punch in the
basket.)</p>

<p><b>Sophie:</b> Actually, that&#146;s our three hole punch.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross is eating the picnic as Rachel comes home from work.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hi. Look um, about what happened earlier...</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, hey, well, I-I completely understand. You were, you were stressed.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (throws her stuff down) I was gonna give you a chance to apologise to
me.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> For what? For letting you throw me out of your office?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You had no <b>right</b> coming down to my office Ross. You do not bring
a picnic basket to somebody&#146;s work! Unless maybe they were a park ranger!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, well excuse me for wanting to be with my girlfriend on our
anniversary, boy what an ass am I. </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> But I told you, I didn&#146;t have the time!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, well you never have the time. I mean, I don&#146;t feel like I even
have a girlfriend anymore, Rachel.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Wh, Ross what do you want from me? You want me, you want me to quit my
job so you can feel like you have a girlfriend?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, but it&#146;d be nice if you realised, it&#146;s just a job!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> <b>Just</b> a job!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yes.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ross do you realise this is the first time in my life I&#146;m doing
something I actually care about. This is the first time in my life I&#146;m doing
something that I&#146;m actually good at. I mean. if you don&#146;t get that...</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, hey, I get that, okay, I get that big time. And I&#146;m happy for ya,
but I&#146;m tired of having a relationship with your answering machine! Okay, I
don&#146;t know what to do anymore.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well neither do I!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Is this about Mark?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (shocked) Oh my God.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, it&#146;s not, it&#146;s not.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh my God. I cannot keep having this same fight over and over again,
Ross, no, you&#146;re, you&#146;re, you&#146;re making this too hard.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh I&#146;m, I&#146;m making this too hard. Okay, what do you want me to
do.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I don&#146;t know, I don&#146;t know. Urrrgh! Look, maybe we should take
a break.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, okay, fine, you&#146;re right. Let&#146;s ah, let&#146;s take a
break, (goes to the door) let&#146;s cool off, okay, let&#146;s get some frozen yogart, or
something.. (opens the door)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No. (Ross is standing in the doorway.) A break from us.</p>

<p>(Ross looks at her, then leaves slamming the door behind him.)</p>

<p align="center"><b>Commercial Break</b></p>

<p>[Scene: The Philly, Chandler and Joey are talking to Chloe.]</p>

<p><b>Chloe:</b> And the advances in collating in the past five years, I mean we just got
in an X-5000, y'know. The X-5000 makes the X-50 look like a T-71. </p>

<p>(Chandler agrees in an absolutely bored way.) </p>

<p><b>Chloe:</b> (seeing Ross enter) Hey, it&#146;s the dinosaur guy. (runs over to Ross)
Hi, Ross.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, hi Chloe.</p>

<p><b>Chloe:</b> I want you to met some friends of mine. (Introduces him to Chandler and
Joey) This guy is my hero, he comes in with some stuff he wants it blown up 400%, we said
we don&#146;t do that, and he says you gotta. And y'know what, we did it. And now anytime
anybody wants 400, we just say &#145;let&#146;s Ross it!&#146;</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> And that&#146;s the only colour that comes in.</p>

<p><b>Issac:</b> Yo, Chloe, do you have a quarter for the condom machine?</p>

<p><b>Chloe:</b> Oh! (storms off)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> So, what are you doing here? I thought tonight was your big
anniversary dinner.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, little change in plans. Ahh, we&#146;re gonna break-up instead.</p>

<p>(Chandler and Joey stare at each other in shock.)</p>

<p>[Scene: A Restaurant, Monica and Phoebe are on their dates with Sergei and Mischa.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, and I can also speak a little French. Voulez-vous coucher avec moi
ce soir? (Mischa laughs) Why? What did I say?</p>

<p><b>Mischa:</b> Well, you just asked if I wanted to go to bed with you tonight.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh my God! No wonder I get such great service at Cafe Maurice.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (laughing and banging her spoon on the table) Knock, knock, knock,
knock, hi. Um, could you please tell Sergei that um, I was fascinated by what Boutros
Boutros Gali said in the New York Times.</p>

<p>(Mischa does so.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> You didn&#146;t say Boutros Boutros Gali.</p>

<p><b>Mischa:</b> (to Sergei) Boutros Boutros Gali.</p>

<p>(Sergei responds.)</p>

<p><b>Mischa:</b> He says he was too.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Interesting.</p>

<p><b>Mischa:</b> (to Monica) So I was wondering....</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, ah, before you get all talky again, umm, could you also please
tell Sergei that I really like his suit.</p>

<p>(Mischa does so, and Sergei complements Phoebe, and says it slowly)</p>

<p><b>Mischa:</b> (to Phoebe, very quickly) Eh, he said, thank you very much, he thinks
you look very pretty tonight, your hair, golden like the sun. (to Monica) So you're a
chef?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I&#146;m also thinking about opening up my own restaurant.</p>

<p><b>Mischa:</b> Oh, really.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Monica, can I talk to you behind my menu, please. (Behind the menu) What
are you doing?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well, I was having a conversation.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah but, Mischa is so interested in you, that Sergei and I haven&#146;t
been able to say two words to each other.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What do you want me to do? Just sit here silently while you three have a
conversation?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> That would be great. Thank you.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is lying in front of the bay window, and the phone
rings.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (jumping up to answer the phone) Hello!</p>

<p><b>Mark:</b> Oh, hi. It&#146;s Mark.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (disappointed) Oh.</p>

<p><b>Mark:</b> What? Is it my breath?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No! Sorry, I just thought you were somebody else. Hi!</p>

<p><b>Mark:</b> Hi. Well, look, I was just gonna leave a message, isn&#146;t tonight your,
your big anniversary dinner?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah. Well, umm.....</p>

<p><b>Mark:</b> Rach, are you okay?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (on the verge of tears) Yeah, I&#146;m fine.</p>

<p><b>Mark:</b> You wanna talk, I mean I can come over?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No! Really, no, please, please, that&#146;s, that&#146;s okay.</p>

<p><b>Mark:</b> All right, all right, I&#146;m coming over, and I&#146;m bringing Chinese
food.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, yeah, I&#146;m not, I&#146;m not hungry.</p>

<p><b>Mark:</b> It&#146;s for me.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh. Okay, bye.</p>

<p>[Scene: The Philly.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> So what are you gonna do?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What can I do? One person wants to break-up, you break-up.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey, no way! Come on, this is you guys, call her and work it out.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh come on, we just had this huge fight, all right, don&#146;t I have to
wait a while?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey, this isn&#146;t like swimming after you eat, pick up the phone!!</p>

<p>(Ross goes to call her.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Y'know that whole swimming thing is a myth.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, tell that to my Uncle Lenny.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Why? What happened to him?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Nothing, he&#146;s just really believes in that.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Mark is there, opening Chinese food boxes.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, and then, we got into this big, stupid fight. I just, it was awful.
I told him he treats me like a park ranger, or something, oh and then I told him I wanted
to take a break, I don&#146;t want to take a break.</p>

<p><b>Mark:</b> Wow. I&#146;m sorry. Eggroll?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No. (grabs an eggroll) And then I called him, and he wasn&#146;t there.</p>

<p><b>Mark:</b> Well, then he&#146;s, he&#146;s probably just, out.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, thank you that&#146;s very helpful, I&#146;m glad you came over.</p>

<p>(The phone rings and Rachel answers it.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hello.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hi! It&#146;s me.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hi! Oh, I&#146;m so glad you called.</p>
