<p><b>Ross:</b> Really? I&#146;ve been thinking, this is crazy, I mean don&#146;t,
don&#146;t you think we can work on this? </p>

<p><b>Mark:</b> Hey, what do you want to drink?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Who&#146;s that?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Nobody.</p>

<p><b>Mark:</b> Is it okay if I finish the apple juice?</p>

<p>(Rachel mouths &#145;Shoot!&#146; or something similar.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Is that Mark?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Umm, honey, look he just came over to....</p>

<p>[Cut to The Philly.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah! Got it! (slams the phone down, and walks back to the bar.)</p>

<p><b>Chloe:</b> Hey, dinosaur guy, look at you, so sad. Come dance.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Ah, that&#146;s okay, thanks.</p>

<p><b>Chloe:</b> Hey, you don&#146;t have to smile. You just have to dance.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Look, I don&#146;t feel like dancing, I feel like having a drink. Okay?</p>

<p><b>Chloe:</b> Oh, okay. (to the bartender) Hey, two beers. (sits down next to him) </p>

<p>[Scene: The Restaurant, after dinner.]</p>

<p><b>Mischa:</b> (to Monica) And the vet said it was time. And so from half a world away,
while my Mother held the phone to his ear, I said good bye to my dog,. In seven languages.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh. (to Phoebe) Can I have a tissue?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, yeah, sure. I just hope you, hope you don&#146;t accidentally suck
it up through your nose and choke on it.</p>

<p>(Sergei says something to Mischa.)</p>

<p><b>Mischa:</b> (to Phoebe) Sergei, would like to apologise for my behaviour tonight.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, tell him, apology accepted.</p>

<p>(Mischa does so.)</p>

<p><b>Mischa:</b> (to Monica) Oh, he&#146;s unbelievable. I mean for the first time in
three years somebody wants to actually want to talk to me, but do you think he would let
me enjoy that, no!! (to Sergei) You silly diplomat, why don&#146;t you learn some English,
Sergei?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Excuse me, but umm, isn&#146;t he paying for your dinner?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey, the man&#146;s dog just died.</p>

<p>(Sergei insults Mischa, and they get into a huge fight, in Russian.)</p>

<p><b>Mischa:</b> (to Monica) I have just resigned my post. Would you care to accompany me
to the Rainbow Room? I have diplomatic coupons.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> It will be my pleasure. (to Phoebe) My guy has diplomatic coupons. Your
guy can&#146;t even say coupons. (they leave)</p>

<p><b>Sergei:</b> Uh, (picks up a plate) plate?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Plate! Yes, plate.</p>

<p><b>Sergei:</b> Plate. Plate. Plate.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> See, we don&#146;t need them.</p>

<p><b>Sergei:</b> (picking up a cup) Plate?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p>[Scene: The Philly, <i>With or Without You</i> is playing. (Which is the same song Ross
played for Rachel in TOW the List.)]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (to Chloe) I like this song.</p>

<p><b>Chloe:</b> Well, you&#146;re practically dancing already. Why don&#146;t you just do
it over here?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, no, no.</p>

<p><b>Chloe:</b> What? Are you married? &#145;Cause that&#146;s okay.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is next to the bay window again, Mark has left.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (picks up the phone and calls Ross) Oh, be home, be home, be home, be
home, be home, be home. Be home. Be home, be home, be home. Oh, you&#146;re not home.</p>

<p>[Scene: The Philly, Ross is dancing with Chloe.]</p>

<p><b>Chloe:</b> Still no smile?</p>

<p>(She kisses him. Ross leans back for a second, and then they both kiss, more
passionately this time as U2's <em>With or Without You</em> plays in the background.)</p>

<p align="center"><b>To Be Continued......</b></p>

<p align="center"><b>Closing Credits</b></p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Sergei is teaching Phoebe how to sing <i>American Pie</i>, by Don
Maclean.]</p>

<p>(Both Phoebe and him are singing along and they get to the chorus.)</p>

<p><b>Sergei:</b> (singing) Touchet, touchet, Miss Americccan pie. (stops to correct
Phoebe) Ameri-ccan.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ameri-can.</p>

<p><b>Sergei:</b> Ameri-ccan.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ameri-can. Y'know it&#146;s a <b>very</b> hard language. Let&#146;s do
it again.</p>

<p>(They start singing, and Phoebe covers her mouth at the American part.)</p>

<p><b>Sergei:</b> (to the rest of Central Perk) Everybody!! (In his language, and
continues.)</p>
</font>

<p align="center"><strong><font size="3">End</font></strong></p>
</body>
</html>
316<html>

<head>
<title>The One The Morning After</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="white" text="black" link="green" vlink="black" alink="yellow">

<h1 align="center">The One The Morning After</h1>

<hr align="center">

<p>Written by: Marta Kauffman &amp; David Crane<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a> </p>

<hr>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (Voice Over) Previously on Friends.</p>

<p>[A montage of scenes from <a href="season3/315rrtb.htm">The One Where Ross and Rachel
Take A Break</a> follows.]</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross is eating the picnic as Rachel comes home from work.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I mean, I don&#146;t feel like I even have a girlfriend anymore.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You want me to just quit my job so that you can feel like you&#146;ve
got a girlfriend?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Is this about Mark?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (shocked) Oh my God.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, it&#146;s not, it&#146;s not.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh my God. I cannot keep having this same fight with you Ross! Look,
urrgh, maybe we should take a break.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Fine, you&#146;re right. Let&#146;s ah, let&#146;s take a break, (goes to
the door) let&#146;s cool off, okay, let&#146;s get some frozen yoghurt, or something..
(opens the door)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No. A break from us.</p>

<p>(Ross looks at her, then leaves slamming the door behind him.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Mark is there, opening Chinese food boxes.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Then, we had this big, stupid fight, and I said I wanted to take a
break, I don&#146;t want to take a break.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (on the phone) I&#146;ve been thinking, this is crazy, I mean don&#146;t,
don&#146;t you think we can work on this? </p>

<p><b>Mark:</b> Hey, what do you want to drink?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Who&#146;s that?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Nobody.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Is that Mark?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Umm, honey, look he just came over to....</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah! Got it! (slams down the phone)</p>

<p>[Scene: The Philly.]</p>

<p><b>Chloe:</b> Hey, come dance. What? Are you married? &#145;Cause that&#146;s okay.</p>

<p>[Cut to Chloe and Ross dancing, and their kiss.]</p>

<p align="center"><b>The Next Morning</b></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is making a fruit drink in the blender, Rachel has
just finished her shower and is coming out of the bathroom.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> How&#146;s the big anniversary dinner?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, we never actually got to dinner.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Ohhh, nice.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No, we kinda broke up instead.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What?! (She accidentally starts the blender without the lid on it and
fruit flies everywhere.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (looking up at the ceiling) God, Monica it&#146;s on the ceiling.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> That&#146;s okay, this is more important than fruit (pause) (angrily) on
my ceiling! You broke up?!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, but it&#146;s okay, because when Ross left Mark came over.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh no!! </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Rachel, you and Mark?!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No, no-no, it&#146;s okay, calm down. Mark and I talked, and I realised
how much I love your stupid brother, and, yeah, we got our problems, but I really want to
make it work.</p>

<p>[Scene: Ross&#146;s Bedroom, Ross is waking up. He straightens himself out on the bed
and puts the covers over his head.]</p>

<p><b>Chloe:</b> (entering from bathroom) Morning!</p>

<p>(Ross sits bolt upright, without moving the covers.)</p>

<p align="center"><b>Opening Credits</b></p>

<p>[Scene: Ross&#146;s Kitchen, Ross is taking some aspirin and checking his messages.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (on answering machine) Hi, it&#146;s me. I&#146;ve been trying to reach
you all night. I feel awful. Please, Ross, you gotta know there is nothing between me and
Mark. This whole break-up thing is just stupid. </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah!!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Eh, I&#146;m just so sorry I put you through it. And, I y'know, I
don&#146;t want to get back together over a machine.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Na-huh.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> So, I love you.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I love you.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> And y'know what, I&#146;m gonna, I&#146;m gonna go to bed now, but ah,
on my way to work tomorrow morning, I&#146;m gonna stop by around 8:30.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay. (Ross starts frantically looking for a clock.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Bye.</p>

<p>(Ross finds a clock, sees it&#146;s almost 8:30, and silently screams.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Chloe, Chloe how&#146;s it coming?!!</p>

<p><b>Chloe:</b> (entering from bedroom) Hey, what kind of puppy do you think I should
get?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Umm, oh, hey, I don&#146;t know. How about a big one?</p>

<p><b>Chloe:</b> But my apartment is so...</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well then a small one!! Listen, let&#146;s, we kinda have to get going!</p>

<p><b>Chloe:</b> Wait! Where&#146;s my shoes?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You, you sure you need shoes? (Chloe nods her head) Okay. (reaches down
and picks up a shoe)</p>

<p><b>Chloe:</b> Do I know why we&#146;re rushing?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, y'know the ah, the girlfriend I told you about last night?
(He&#146;s frantically throwing the cushions off of the couch looking for her other shoe)
Well it turns out she ah, she wants to get back together with me. Oh, I found it!! </p>

<p><b>Chloe:</b> That&#146;s so great for you guys!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah! </p>

<p><b>Chloe:</b> You must be so happy!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yes, yes I am, one of the many things I&#146;m feeling. Well.... (picks up
her coat)</p>

<p><b>Chloe:</b> Good luck, with your girlfriend. </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, thank you. (She goes to kiss him, but he holds her coat up between
their faces to stop her.) Hey, hey. (opens the door, sees Rachel, and hides Chloe behind
the door) Rachel!!!!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hi. Ohhh, you got my message.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, oh hey, you are right on time.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> So what do you say? Can I be your girlfriend again?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yes, you can, very much.</p>

<p>(Chloe gives Ross the thumbs up while still standing behind the door.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (seeing the thumbs up) Ahhhh!! (Hugs Rachel tighter.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe is entering carry a large box, Monica is mopping
the ceiling.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey, why are you mopping your ceiling?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, there&#146;s banana on it.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Wow, I have the spirit of an old Indian women living in mine.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> So then you know? (Phoebe nods her head)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> The mailman was downstairs, so I brought up your mail.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, good. Thanks.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Now what is Fabutec?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay, all right don&#146;t judge me to much. Okay? Um, but I saw this
info-mercial, and um, I swear to you I have never-ever bought anything on TV before,
except for this mop. But there was this stuff on leg waxing, it just, it looked so
amazing....</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Waxine!!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yes! Have you seen it?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, it&#146;s incredible! I so want to be a Waxine girl.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I know!!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> God. Do think it really doesn&#146;t hurt? &#145;Cause how can they do
that?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hello! Organic substances recently discovered in the depths of the rain
forest!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> They have the best stuff in there.</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Ross has told Chandler and Joey his terrible act.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh my God! Oh my God!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah. We figured when we couldn&#146;t find you, you&#146;d gone home to
make up with Rachel. Which is probably what you shoulda done. Huh?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You think?! God, I, ah, I&#146;m in hell. I mean what, what am I gonna do?
Rachel&#146;s all like, &#145;I love you and, and let&#146;s work on this.&#146; And all I
can think about is, &#145;What is she gonna do? What is she gonna say?&#146; when I tell
her what I did.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, before we answer that, I think we should address the more
important question. How dumb are you?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What?! Look, we&#146;re trying to rebuild a relationship here, right. How
am I supposed to do that here, without being totally honest with each other?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Look, Ross look, I&#146;m on board about this totally honesty thing, I am,
just not about stuff that&#146;s gonna get you in trouble.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> He&#146;s right. Nobody&#146;s gonna benefit, and you&#146;re just
gonna hurt her.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, and there won&#146;t be a relationship left to rebuild.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, but don&#146;t you think....</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All right look, if you absolutely have to tell her, at least wait
until the timing&#146;s right. And that&#146;s what deathbeds are for.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, okay. (he plops down into one of the leather chairs, with the
footrest extended.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> All right, okay, now, we just have to make sure she doesn&#146;t find out
some other way. (spins the chair around so that Ross is facing him) Did you think about
the trail?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What trail?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (stomps on the footrest which pops Ross up into a sitting position) The
trail from the woman you did it with to the woman you hope never finds out who did it!
(slapping his hands with each word) You always have to think about the trail!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, I-I don&#146;t think there&#146;s any trail.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, okay-okay, ah, Chloe works with that guy Issac. Issac&#146;s
sister is Jasmine. And Jasmine works at that message place with Phoebe. And Phoebe&#146;s
friends with Rachel. And that&#146;s the trail, I did it!</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica's Bedroom, Monica and Phoebe are waxing their legs.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (reading from the instructions) After applying the Waxine and linen
strips to leg number one, </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Did that!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Grasp one of the linen strips by its &#145;easy grab tab&#146; and pull
it off in one quick pain free motion.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay. (Does so.) Ow!!!!! Ow-oh-oh!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Was it not pain-free?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No. It was painful. Oh my God , they should call it Pain-zine, now with
a little wax.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Huh, well, the girls in the satin nighties on the commercial don&#146;t
seem to think it&#146;s that bad.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> That&#146;s because their nerves are probably deadened from being so
stupid. But hey, y'know if you don&#146;t believe me, please, by my guest.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (Removing one of the strips) Ow-ow-ow-ow! Oh my God!!!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Now, are you glad we didn&#146;t start with the bikini strips?</p>

<p>[Scene: The Xerox Place, Ross is trying to break the trail.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (entering) Chloe? Hi.. </p>

<p><b>Chloe:</b> Is this about me taking your watch?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You took my watch?</p>

<p><b>Chloe:</b> I&#146;m sorry, I do that.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Just you keep it, listen did you, did you tell anyone about us?</p>

<p><b>Chloe:</b> Oh no. I feel it isn&#146;t really anybody&#146;s business, y'know.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Exactly. So you didn&#146;t, didn&#146;t mention anything to Issac right?</p>

<p><b>Chloe:</b> Oh, well I tell Issac everything.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You tell, of course you do. Issac. Issac. Hey, Issac. Issac, hi! Y'know we
haven&#146;t actually met...</p>

<p><b>Issac:</b> You dog!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yes, I suppose I am a dog. But Issac, see I-I happen to have a girlfriend.</p>

<p><b>Issac:</b> Oh right, that Rachel chick from the coffee place.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, that&#146;s the one. Listen, I don&#146;t want to hurt her.</p>

<p><b>Issac:</b> Oh, hey, man I know, doesn&#146;t matter how much we love &#145;em,
monogamy is too cruel a rule.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah. Listen, can you keep this information to yourself?</p>

<p><b>Issac:</b> Aw, no problem dude. Y'know we got to look out for each other. We&#146;re
the same, you and me.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Actually, no, we&#146;re not.</p>

<p><b>Issac:</b> Yeah, we are.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, we&#146;re not.</p>

<p><b>Issac:</b> Yeah, we are.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, we&#146;re not!!</p>

<p><b>Issac:</b> Okay, we&#146;re not.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Right.</p>

<p><b>Issac:</b> But, we are.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Fine. I just need to know that you&#146;re not gonna tell your sister.</p>

<p><b>Issac:</b> I can promise not to tell her again.</p>

<p>[Scene: Phoebe&#146;s Work, Ross is now trying to stop Jasmine from telling Phoebe.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (entering out of breath) Jasmine? </p>

<p><b>Jasmine:</b> Uh-huh.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> We met at Phoebe&#146;s birthday party, I&#146;m, I&#146;m Ross Geller.</p>

<p><b>Jasmine:</b> You did a bad thing!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yes, I did.</p>

<p><b>Jasmine:</b> Very bad!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Very bad.</p>

<p><b>Jasmine:</b> Very, very bad.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I&#146;m agreeing with you. Did you, listen, did you happen to tell Phoebe
yet?</p>

<p><b>Jasmine:</b> No.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, Jasmine, please, please don&#146;t. I love my girlfriend very much,
and I want more than anything to just work it out with her. Okay?</p>

<p><b>Jasmine:</b> All right.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Thank you, thank you.</p>

<p><b>Jasmine:</b> But you should probably talk to my roommate, because I told him and he
knows Phoebe too.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (angrily) Who&#146;s your roommate?</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Gunther is wiping down the counter as Ross rushes in.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Gunther! Gunther. Gunther, please tell me you didn&#146;t say anything to
Rachel about me and the girl from the Xerox place.</p>

<p><b>Gunther:</b> I&#146;m sorry. Was I not supposed to?</p>

<p>(Ross turns around and sees Rachel sitting by the window. She is just glaring at him.)</p>

<p align="center"><b>Commercial Break</b></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica&#146;s Bedroom, Monica and Phoebe are removing the rest of their wax
strips.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Ow!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh!!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Ow!! Ow!!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ow!!!</p>

<p><b>Monica and Phoebe:</b> Ow!!!!!!! Ow-ow-ow-ow!</p>

<p>(Hearing the screaming Chandler and Joey rush in. Joey has a pan, Chandler has a tea
kettle.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> We&#146;re all right.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> It&#146;s okay, it&#146;s okay.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> We&#146;re all right.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> We were just waxing our legs.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Off?!!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> For your information, this happens to be a pain like no man will ever
experience.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, well I don&#146;t think you can make that statement, unless
you&#146;ve been kicked in an area that God only meant to be treated nicely.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, I-I think that women just have a lower threshold of pain than men,
that&#146;s all. I mean, come on, it&#146;s just a little wax.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh yeah, come here. (Puts a little wax on Joey&#146;s arm and puts a
strip on it.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, that&#146;s mature.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay, fine, so now what, I just pull it off?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Uh-huh.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> That&#146;s right.</p>

<p>(Joey laughs, pulls it off, then does a high-pitched whine.)</p>

<p>[Cut to Living Room, Rachel is trying to close the door on Ross.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (forcing the door open) Come on, Rachel, come on! Talk to me! Please!!</p>

<p>[Cut to Monica's bedroom, Chandler slowly closes the door, and we hear Rachel from the
living room.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I can&#146;t talk to you. I can&#146;t even look at you right now!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Nothing, nothing.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (going over to listen at the door) Rachel said everything was okay.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (to Joey) What, what are they talking about?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Rachel?</p>

<p>[Cut to Living Room]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Just get away from me!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, it was a mistake! I made a mistake! Okay?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> A mistake?! What were you trying to put it in? Her purse?!</p>

<p>[Cut to Monica's bedroom]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Whe-where did he put it?!</p>

<p>[Cut to Living Room]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ross, you had sex with another woman!</p>

<p>[Cut to Monica's bedroom, both Monica and Phoebe gasp.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh my God.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, I knew something had to be wrong, because my fingernails did not
grow at all yesterday.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, well, I guess they had a fight, and he got drunk....</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh!! (hits Chandler and Joey in the head) You guys knew about this and
you didn&#146;t tell us?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (to Joey) He has sex, and we get hit in our heads.</p>

<p>[Cut to Living Room]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (opening the door) Y'know what, I want you to leave! Get outta here! </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No!!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Just get out! Now!!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No!! No!! I wanna stay. I wanna talk about this.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay! All right! How was she?</p>

<p>[Cut to Monica's bedroom]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Uh-oh.</p>

<p>[Cut to Living Room]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Was she good?</p>

<p>[Cut to Monica's bedroom]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Don&#146;t answer that.</p>

<p>[Cut to Living Room]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Come on Ross! You said you wanted to talk about it, let&#146;s talk
about it!! How was she?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> She was...</p>

<p>[Cut to Monica's bedroom]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Awful! Horrible!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> She was not good. Not good.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> She was nothing compared to you.</p>

<p>[Cut to Living Room]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> She, she was different.</p>

<p>[Cut to Monica's bedroom]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ewwwww!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Uh-oh.</p>

<p>[Cut to Living Room]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Good different?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Nobody likes change.</p>

<p>(Rachel picks up a newspaper and starts beating him with it.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What? Okay, okay, okay, okay.</p>

<p>[Cut to Monica's bedroom]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Should we do something?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, never cheat on Rachel.</p>

<p>[Cut to Living Room]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I&#146;m sorry, okay, I&#146;m sorry. I wa-I was disgusted with myself,
and this morning I was so, I was so upset and then I got your message and I was so happy,
and all I wanted was to get her out of my apartment as fast as possible.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Whoa!! Whoa, whoa, wait a minute. What time did your little friend
leave? (Ross can&#146;t answer that) Oh my God. She was there? She was still there? She
was in there, when I was in there?!</p>

<p>(Ross hands Rachel back the newspaper, and she starts beating him with it again.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Listen. Oh hey, hey, the important thing was that she meant, she meant
nothing to me!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> And yet she was worth jeopardising our relationship!! </p>

<p>(She throws the paper at him, misses and hits Monica&#146;s door, they all jump back at
the sound.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Look, I didn&#146;t think there was a relationship to jeopardise. I
thought we were broken up. </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> We were on a break!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> That, for all I knew would, could last forever. That to me is a break-up.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You think you&#146;re gonna get out of this on a technicality?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Look, I&#146;m not trying to get out of anything, okay. I thought our
relationship was dead!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, you sure had a hell of a time at the wake!</p>

<p>[Cut to Monica's bedroom]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Y'know what, I don&#146;t think we should listen to this anymore. (Goes to
open the door)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (stopping him) What, what are you doing? You can&#146;t go out there.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Why not?! (to Chandler) I&#146;m hungry.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Because they&#146;ll know we&#146;ve been listening.</p>

<p>[Cut to Living Room]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> God! And to have to hear about it from Gunther!!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Come on! Like I wanted him to tell you, I ran all over the place trying to
make sure that didn&#146;t happen!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, that is so sweet. I think I&#146;m falling in love with you all over
again.</p>

<p>[Cut to Monica's bedroom]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Y'know what, I think we can go out there. I mean they have more
important things to worry about.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, we&#146;ll be fine.</p>

<p>[Cut to Living Room]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Look Rachel, I wanted to tell you, I thought I should, I-I did, and then
Chandler and Joey convinced me not to.</p>

<p>[Cut to Monica's bedroom]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (handing Monica the wax) Wax the door shut, we&#146;re never leaving,
ever.</p>

<p>[Later, Phoebe is on the phone, they&#146;re all still trapped in Monica&#146;s
bedroom.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hi, it&#146;s Phoebe. Listen someone&#146;s gonna have to take my 9:00
with Mr. Rehack, &#145;cause it&#146;s like 9:15 now, and I&#146;m not there.</p>

<p>[Cut to Living Room]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Don&#146;t you realise none of this would&#146;ve ever happened if I
didn&#146;t think at that same moment you weren&#146;t having sex with Mark?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> All right. Let&#146;s say I had slept with Mark. Would you have been
able to forgive me?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (pause) Yes I would.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You&#146;d be okay if you knew that Mark had kissed me, and been naked
with me, and made love to me?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (less sure) Yes.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You knew that our hot, sweaty, writhing bodies were....</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (covering his ears and screaming) La-la-la-la-la-la-la-la-la-la! Okay,
okay, yeah, I would have been devastated but, I would still want to be with you. Because
it&#146;s, I mean it&#146;s you.</p>

<p>[Cut to Monica's bedroom]</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Ohhhhh!</p>

<p>[Later, Ross and Rachel are sitting in the kitchen.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What? Come on Rach, tell me what you&#146;re thinking?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I&#146;m thinking, I&#146;m gonna order a pizza.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Order a pizza like, &#145;I forgive you?&#146;</p>

<p>(She turns around and glares at him, he turns away.)</p>

<p>[Cut to Monica's bedroom]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh man, pizza? I like pizza. (makes like he is trying to send a telepathic
message to Rachel) Put olives on the pizza.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> We could eat the wax! It&#146;s organic.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh great, food with hair on it.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, not the used wax.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Because <b>that</b> would be crazy?</p>

<p>[Cut to Living Room]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey, can I, can I get in on that? Because I&#146;m kinda hungry myself.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Fine. (on phone) Hi! Yes, I&#146;d like to order a large pizza.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No anchovies.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> With ah, extra anchovies.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> That&#146;s okay, I&#146;ll just pick &#145;em off.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, and could you please chop some up and just put it right there in
the sauce?</p>

<p>[Cut to later, they are finishing up the pizza, there&#146;s one piece left.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You can have the last piece, if you want.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, I should think so. You slept with someone.</p>

<p>[Cut to Monica's bedroom, they&#146;re all eating the wax, Chandler and Phoebe,
don&#146;t like it. Joey tries some and makes a face like: &#145;Hey, that&#146;s not so
bad.&#146;]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> They&#146;re gonna get through this, aren&#146;t they?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, come on, it&#146;s Ross and Rachel, they&#146;ve got too.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What if they don&#146;t?</p>

<p>(Long pause.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> You think I need a new walk?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well y'know, I&#146;ve been walking the same way since high school.
Y'know, y'know how some guys they walk into a room and everybody takes notice. I think I
need a &#145;take notice&#146; walk.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Are you actually saying these words?</p>

<p>[Later, in the living room, Rachel is sitting on the couch, Ross is on the chair.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What, now you&#146;re not even taking to me? (moves over to the coffee
table) Look Rachel, I-I&#146;m sorry, okay, I&#146;m sorry, I was out of my mind. I
thought I&#146;d lost you, I didn&#146;t know what to do. Come on! Come on, how insane
must I have been to do something like this? Huh? I-I don&#146;t cheat right, I,
that&#146;s not me, I&#146;m not Joey!</p>

<p>[Cut to Monica's bedroom]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Whoa-ho-ho! (He looks at Chandler, who gives him a &#145;come on&#146;
look.) Yeah, okay.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey. It&#146;s three in the morning. They don&#146;t know that I&#146;ve
come home yet. You notice how neither one of them are wondering where I am.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, y'know, people can be so self-involved.</p>

<p>[Cut to Living Room]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Y'know what, y'know what, I&#146;m-I&#146;m not the one that wanted that,
that break, okay. You&#146;re the one that bailed on us. You&#146;re the one that, that
ran when things got just a little rough!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> That&#146;s....</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> That&#146;s what?!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> That is neither here nor there.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, well here we are. Now we&#146;re in a tough spot again, Rach. What
do you want to do? How do you want to handle it? Huh? Do you wanna fight for us? Or, do
you wanna bail? (sits down next to her) Look, I, (on the verge of tears) I did a terrible,
stupid, stupid thing. Okay? And I&#146;m sorry, I wish I could take it back, but I
can&#146;t. (We see Monica and Phoebe are almost in tears.) I just can&#146;t see us
throwing away something we know is so damn good. Rachel, I love you so much.</p>

<p>(He kisses her on her shoulder, then her neck, then the side of her face, then just
before he kisses her on the lips....)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No Ross!! (stands up and moves away from him) Don&#146;t! You can&#146;t
just kiss me and think you&#146;re gonna make it all go away, okay? It doesn&#146;t work
that way. It doesn&#146;t just make it better. Okay?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, okay, okay.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (softly) I think you should go.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (softly) I really think you need to go now.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (moving over to stand in front of her) Okay, okay. This morning you said
there was nothing so big that we couldn&#146;t work past it together...</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, what the hell did I know!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Look, look, there&#146;s got to be a way we can work past this. Okay,
(takes a hold of one of her arms.) I can&#146;t imagine, I can&#146;t imagine my life
without you. (Both of them are starting to cry.) Without, without these arms, and your
face, and this heart. Your good heart Rach, (drops to his knees and hugs her around her
waist) and, and....</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (crying) No. I can&#146;t, you&#146;re a totally different person to me
now. I used to think of you as somebody that would never, ever hurt me, ever. God, and now
I just can&#146;t stop picturing with her, I can&#146;t, (Ross stands up and backs away)
it doesn&#146;t matter what you say, or what you do, Ross. It&#146;s just changed,
everything. Forever.</p>

<p>[We see the rest of them are now crying.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (crying) Yeah, but this can&#146;t be it, I mean.</p>

<p>(Pause)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Then how come it is?</p>

<p align="center"><b>Closing Credits</b></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica&#146;s bedroom.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> They&#146;ve been quiet for a long time.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Maybe she killed him?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Let&#146;s go.</p>

<p>[Cut to Living Room, Rachel is sleeping on the couch, Ross is gone, the rest of them
can finally emerge from their cell. They all wave good bye, and start to walk quietly out,
as Monica goes and puts a blanket on Rachel. Joey starts walking all hunched over and
bobbing his shoulders as he goes.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (to Joey) Is that your new walk?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (whispering) No, I really have to pee.</p>

<p align="center"><b>End</b></p>
</body>
</html>
317<html>

<head>
<title>The One Without The Ski Trip</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="white" text="black" link="green" vlink="black" alink="yellow">

<h1 align="center">The One Without The Ski Trip </h1>

<hr align="center">

<p>Written by: Scott Silveri &amp; Shana Goldberg-Meehan<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a> </p>

<hr>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Chandler and Joey are sitting on the couch reading.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Can I see the comics?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> This is the <i>New York Times</i>.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay, <b>may</b> I see the comics?</p>

<p>[Monica and Phoebe enter.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Guys. I thought you were taking Ross to the game?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> We are. He&#146;s meeting us here.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No! Rachel is meeting <b>us</b> here.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh come on, they can be in the same room.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, you shoulda been there last night.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Why? What happened now?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well Ross was hangin&#146; out over at our place, Rachel comes over to
borrow some moisturiser from Chandler....</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah y-you, how hard is it to say something? Rachel came over to
borrow something.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Anyway! Her and Ross just started yelling at each other.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Wait. Why was he yelling at her? He&#146;s the one who slept with
someone else. </p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, I guess he says that because they were on a break when it happened,
that she should of forgiven him by now.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Whoa!! He is soo unreasonable! God, although I think I understand what
he means. Oh my God, this is like <i>60 Minutes</i>, okay, when, when, at first
you&#146;re really mad at that pharmaceutical company for making the drug and then y'know
you just feel bad for the people because they needed to make their hair grow.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Y'know what this is like? This is like when my parents got divorced.
Man, I hope Ross doesn&#146;t try to kidnap me after Cub Scouts.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Y'know I had a dream where Ross and Rachel were still together, they
never broke up. And we were all just like hanging out, and everyone was happy....</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I had the same dream!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, and nobody slept with that Xerox girl. </p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, I had the opposite dream.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Y'know what maybe it&#146;s gonna be okay, I mean it&#146;s been a
week.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, I mean it&#146;s never taken me a week to get over a relationship.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> It&#146;s never taken you more than a <b>shower</b> to get over a
relationship.</p>

<p>[Rachel enters.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (seeing her) Okay, let&#146;s go!! Let&#146;s hit the road!!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Let&#146;s get the show on it! </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, let me just get a cup of coffee.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh Rachel, I know the best coffee house and it&#146;s sooo close.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Closer than here?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (turning around and picking a cup off of a table) Oh, hey, look, I found
coffee! (handing her the cup) Okay, let&#146;s skedaddle.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Wait, I&#146;m not just gonna drink somebody&#146;s old coffee.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, your highness.</p>

<p>[Ross enters behind Rachel, and look at each other for a moment.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (in a deep voice, imitating Ross) Um, Rachel I&#146;m really sorry.
(imitating Rachel) That&#146;s okay, do you wanna get back together? (imitating Ross)
Yeah, okay. (in her normal voice) Did anyone else hear that?!</p>

<p align="center"><b>Opening Credits</b></p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, the whole gang is there, except for Ross and Rachel. Joey
is trying to eat Chinese with chopsticks and fails miserably. There&#146;s a knock on the
door, and Chandler answers it to reveal Rachel]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (softly) Is he here?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh. (smiles) Here&#146;s your moisturiser. Hi! </p>

<p><b>Monica and Phoebe:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You guys are gonna love meee! Okay, check it out, Thursday night, five
tickets, <i>Calvin Klein</i> lingerie show, and you guys are coming with me. (they&#146;re
all silent and look away) Okay, I said that out loud right?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes, yes, it&#146;s just that we ah, we kinda all ready, made plans
with Ross.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, well okay. Well, there you go.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, it&#146;s just that he got this new like home theater dealie, and he
wants y'know, us to check it out.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hm-mm.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, he&#146;s really excited about it too, he even recorded show
times on his answering machine.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ohh!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> We&#146;re sorry honey.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, it&#146;s okay. (starts to leave)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Rach, it&#146;s, it&#146;s ah, it&#146;s not that we don&#146;t want to,
really. (quietly) Are we talking models in their underwear?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> And heels.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (He turns around to Chandler looking for approval to go with Rachel,
Chandler mouths &#145;Come on!&#146;) (turning back to Rachel) Ross, did ask us first, and
we set that night aside.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No, hey, come on, if he asked you first, that&#146;s only fair. (leaves)</p>

<p>[Chandler makes a noise of absolute disgust and heads into the living room.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ohhh boy, do I feel bad.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh yeah.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Very bad.</p>

<p>[We see Chandler lighting up a cigarette.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Chandler what are you doing?!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Chandler!!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (jumps back and points at the cigarette) Oh my God!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> You&#146;re smoking again?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, actually, yesterday I was smoking again. Today, I&#146;m,
I&#146;m smoking still.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Why would you start again after chewing all that quitting gum?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Look, I&#146;m telling you this is just like my parents divorce, which
is when I started smoking in the first place.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Weren&#146;t you nine?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeahhh. I&#146;m tellin&#146; ya something, that ah, first smoke after
nap time....</p>

<p>[There&#146;s a knock on the door.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh that&#146;s great, with my luck, that&#146;s gonna be him.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Him? Him, Ross?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Nope, hymn 253, His Eyes Are On The Sparrow! When my parents got
divorced is when I started using humour as a defence mechanism. (answers the door and
it&#146;s Rachel again.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hi! Uhh, do you guys have plans for the weekend? Because I have my
sister on hold, and she said that we could use her cabin for the weekend and go skiing.
Huh? I&#146;m asking you first, right?!. I mean I&#146;m playing by the rules.</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Absolutely, yeah!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Chandler! You&#146;re smoking? What are you doing?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey, shut up!! You&#146;re not my real Mom!!</p>

<p>[Scene: Ross&#146;s, the gang, minus Rachel of course, is there. Chandler is forced to
smoke by an open window.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (obviously cold) Hey, can you close that window Chandler? My nipples can
cut glass over here!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Wait. Really?! &#145;Cause mine get me out of tickets.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Look, you guys I just wanna say, I really, really appreciate you spending
this time with me. It&#146;s been a pretty hard time right now, so I just wanna say
thanks.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Can somebody else hug him? I have to stay by the window.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh hey, hey, huh, how about this weekend we have a laser disc marathon
okay, and maybe a tournament on my new dart board? Huh, huh, what do you think? (in an
Irish accent) Two days of darts, it&#146;ll be great!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> It&#146;ll be great for next weekend.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, no, no, this weekend guys!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> It&#146;ll be great for next weekend. I mean, (in an Irish accent)
it&#146;ll be grrreat.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What&#146;s going on?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, we were um, sorta invited to go skiing, y'know Rachel&#146;s
sister&#146;s cabin. (Chandler goes back to the window to smoke again.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> So, for the whole weekend?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> We&#146;re really sorry, but um, she did ask us first.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, that&#146;s okay, I mean if you guys <b>all</b> have to go away for
the first weekend I&#146;m alone by myself, y'know then I totally, totally understand.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Y'know what, I can stay, I&#146;m gonna stay. &#145;Cause the last time
I went skiing I was to afraid to jump off the chair lift, I just went around and around.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Uh, Pheebs we kinda need you to drive us all up there in your
grandmother&#146;s cab, but y'know what, I&#146;ll stay.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Noo! I&#146;ll stay. He&#146;s my brother.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What a pity stay?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No! We&#146;re gonna have fun. We can make fudge!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Pity food? Y'know what that&#146;s okay, all right, I don&#146;t need any
of you to stay, okay nobody stays.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, then, I might as well offer to stay.</p>

<p>[Scene: In Phoebe&#146;s Grandmother&#146;s cab, driving up to the cabin. Phoebe&#146;s
driving, Rachel&#146;s sitting shotgun, Chandler, Monica, and Joey are in the back seat.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (to Chandler and Monica) Hey, does anybody else feel bad about Ross?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Why? Do you think he&#146;s still mad at us?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (to Joey) Well he&#146;s probably mad after you called him this
morning to borrow his goggles.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What? Mine aren&#146;t tinted.</p>

<p>[Chandler starts to light a cigarette.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Chandler!!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What does the sign say?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Beam me up Jesus.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, the &#145;No Smoking&#146; sign. There&#146;s no smoking in my
Grandmother&#146;s cab.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, well, then, I-I have to go to the bathroom.</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Oh!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Please!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No Chandler no! No unscheduled stops. You can go when we stop for gas.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, come on, there&#146;s a rest stop right up there! Come on, I
really have to goooooooooo.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, now I have to go!!</p>

<p>[Scene: The rest stop, Phoebe&#146;s pulling in.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Here we go. Okay, brace yourselves.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What?</p>

<p>[Both Chandler and Joey put their feet up against the glass, Monica doesn&#146;t and
gets thrown up against the glass.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Ow!</p>

<p>[Joey gets out and sprints to the bathroom and Chandler follows with a cigarette in his
hands.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (to Rachel, who&#146;s staying in the cab.) Aren&#146;t you gonna go?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No. Thank you.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (getting out) No, Rachel never pees in public restrooms.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, they never have any paper in there y'know. So my rule is &#145;no
tissue, no tuschy.&#146; (Phoebe laughs and gets out.) Well, if everybody&#146;s going.
(She gets out and starts to close the door.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, y'know what don&#146;t close it (Rachel slams the door shut locking
themselves out.) &#145;cause the... keys...are in there.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, no-no-no-no-no-no!!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What&#146;s going on?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (to Joey) My lighter&#146;s in there! (points to the cab)</p>

<p align="center"><b>Commercial Break</b></p>

<p>[Scene: The rest stop, the gang is still stuck, Chandler is kneeling at the rear
bumper.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Damn! (stands up) The tailpipe&#146;s not hot enough to light this!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Relax okay, I-I-I can get this open. Anybody have a coat hanger?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh I do! Op, no, wait a minute, I took it out of my shirt when I put
it on this morning.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> So, if you&#146;re parents hadn&#146;t got divorced, you&#146;d be able
to answer a question like a normal person?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Look, I just need a wire something to jimmy it. Oh hey, one of you guys
give me the underwire from your bra!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Come on! Who has the biggest boobs?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Please!!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Whoever has the biggest boobs, has the biggest bra, therefore has the
biggest wire.</p>

<p><b>The Girls:</b> No, not getting my bra!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> If you wanna get back in the car, we need the wire, your call.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, Monica&#146;s are the biggest.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> These tiny, little non-breasts?! Please, it&#146;s gotta be Rachel.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What, no, no, no, mine are deceptively small I mean, I-I-I actually
sometimes, st-stuff my bra.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> All right then, your bra would still be big.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No, I stuff outside the bra.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Ladies, ladies, let&#146;s just compromise okay? Phoebe, Rachel take
off Monica&#146;s bra.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> All right, forget it, nevermind, you can have mine.</p>

<p>[Chandler crumples up his cigarette pack and throws it on the ground.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (seeing him) Chandler, what are you doing? There is a trash can right
there.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, I thought if I littered, that crying Indian might come by and
save us.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (finishing removing her bra) Okay, there.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Thank you Phoebe, that is very, very generous.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, now let&#146;s decide who has the nicest ass.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (opening the door) And there you go!</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Oh, yeahhhhh!!!</p>

<p>[They all run to get in the cab, and Chandler pulls out a smoke.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Chandler!!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> At least let me smoke it to the good part.</p>

<p>[Phoebe puts the car in gear and starts to back out.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay. (The car moves a few feet and sputters to a stop.) Oh, no!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What, what&#146;s it, what&#146;s going on?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, this has happened before.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> So you know how to fix it?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yep. Put more gas in.</p>

<p>[Scene: Carol and Susan&#146;s, Carol is setting a romantic dinner for Susan as there
is a knock on the door.]</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> (answering the door) Hi! </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (entering) Hey.</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Hey, what are you doing here?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, oh just ah, I was just wondering, when you and I split up, did you
get the tape that was half the last episode of <em>M*A*S*H</em> and half the hostages
coming home?</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Ah yeah, but now it&#146;s Susan and me in Mexico and the hostages coming
home.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Where&#146;s Ben?</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> He&#146;s sleeping.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Ahh. (notices the table) Ooh, is this a ah, is this a bad time?</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Umm, yeah, actually, Susan&#146;s gonna be home any minute, it&#146;s
kinda an anniversary.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh! I thought you guys got married in uh, January?</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> It&#146;s not that kind of anniversary.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Ah! (realises) Oh.</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Sooo!! Anyway...</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Umm, candles, champagne, yeah anniversaries are great. &#145;Cause you
know love lasts forever, y'know. Nothing like it in this lifetime, money in the bank, so
Rachel and I broke up.</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Oh God, Ross I am so sorry.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, well.</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Y'know what, I want to talk to you about this so much, but we should
probably do it when we could really get into it, are you free for dinner tomorrow night?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh yeah, I&#146;d love that.</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Oh, great! Me too.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I guess it all started when Rachel got this new job. (he sits down at the
table.)</p>

<p>[Scene: The rest stop, Phoebe is on the phone to the motor club.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, yeah. (to Monica and Rachel) Triple A can pick us up.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Great!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, what town are we near?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Freemont. West-Westmont, ah Westburg?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (to Monica) Then why are you answering? Do you at least know what route
we&#146;re on?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, we are definitely on Route 27.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay. (on phone) We are at a rest stop on Route 27. Okay. (to Rachel)
There is no Route 27. (listens) (to Rachel) Okay, either 93 or 76?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I don&#146;t know, I&#146;m sorry, I always slept in the back when we
drove up here.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay. (on phone) Hey, can you send somebody up and down 76 and check
every rest stop, and, and also 93? (listens) Okay! (hangs up) Yeah, no they don&#146;t do
that.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ugh, okay, well somebody will come and save us.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Who? I mean have you seen a car come by here in the last hour and a
half? I think we should call Ross, maybe he can get a car and come pick us up.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No! No, I am not getting in a car with Ross, we will just have to live
here! </p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> But if...</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No you guys, I am not getting in a car with him, you&#146;ll have to
think of something else.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh good, oh Joey and Chandler are back.</p>

<p>[Joey walks up helping Chandler.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> So the going for help went well?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh yeah, Smokey Joe here got half way to the highway and collapsed.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I have the lung capacity of a two year old. (starts to light another
cigarette.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Then why are you smoking?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well it&#146;s very unsettling.</p>

<p>[Scene: Carol and Susan&#146;s, Ross is eating the dinner Carol made for Susan.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> ....right? Right? I mean it&#146;s pretty unbelievable y'know, I mean they
just took off, took off without even looking back. Y'know I don&#146;t, I don&#146;t need
them, huh, I&#146;ve got you guys now as friends, you and Susan.</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Ah, Susan will be so pleased.</p>

<p>[Ross&#146;s beeper goes off.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (looking at the page) 717? (to Carol) Where&#146;s 717? (He gets up to
return the page, Carol starts to take the last of the food into the kitchen, but Ross
grabs the last piece.) Hey, you&#146;ve have more of these for Susan right?</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> No. But it&#146;s okay, I&#146;ll just put out pickles or something.</p>

<p>[Cut to the rest stop, Monica and Phoebe are waiting anxiously by the phone as it
rings.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (answering the phone) (whispering) Ross, thank God.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Pheebs? What, why are you whispering?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I ate a bug.</p>

<p>[Rachel starts to walk up.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (running over to stop Rachel) Hey Rach, the tampons here are only a
penny. Let&#146;s stock up. (takes her into the bathroom)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Listen Ross, we ran out of gas, and we don&#146;t know where we are, so
we can&#146;t get a tow truck.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, now you want a favour?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yes, please.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, oh, I&#146;m sorry your car broke down Pheebs, but I&#146;m a little
too busy with some of my real friends right now, but please call to let me know you got
home safely okay?</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> (running over and grabbing the phone away from Ross) (on phone) Phoebe,
hang on a second. (Hands Ross her keys) Here, take my car, go pick up your friends.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, I&#146;m not gonna pick them up.</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Listen, we both know you&#146;re gonna do it &#145;cause you&#146;re not
a jerk. Okay? So you can either sulk here for a half hour and then go pick them up, or
save us both time and sulk in the car.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, Rachel doesn&#146;t want me to....</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Look, I-I-I am sorry that Rachel dumped you &#145;cause she fell in love
with that Mark guy, and you are the innocent victim in all of this, but don&#146;t punish
your friends for what Rachel did to you.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, you&#146;re right.</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> (on phone) Phoebe hang on a second Ross wants to say something. (listens)
What? (listens) (to Ross) You slept with someone else?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> We were on a break!!! Okay!! (grabs the phone) We were, we were..., (calms
down) yeah. Where are you? I&#146;ll find you. (hangs up)</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> You slept with another woman?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, you-you&#146;re-you&#146;re one to talk.</p>

<p>[Scene: The rest stop, Joey is making a sign.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay, done.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (reading the sign) What&#146;s &#145;pleh&#146;?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> That&#146;s &#145;help&#146; spelled backwards so that the helicopters can
read it from the air!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Huh. What&#146;s doofus spelled backwards?</p>

<p>[Ross drives up.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (all excited) Op, op, car! Car!! (sees it&#146;s Ross) Ugh!!!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, it&#146;s Ross on one of his drives!</p>

<p><b>Chandler and Joey:</b> Hey!!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What is he doing here?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> <b>He</b> is saving your butt, ah, unless of course I&#146;m stepping on
some toes here, in which case I can just mosey on, I&#146;ve got plenty of people to help
on the Interstate.</p>

<p><b>All:</b> No! Come on!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> All right!! Fine! Fine.</p>

<p>[Ross grabs the gas can he brought along, and walks through Joey&#146;s sign destroying
it.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Arrrghh!!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh no, now it&#146;s not gonna make any sense!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (to Chandler and Monica) You guys, what, what do we do about Ross who
drove all the way up here? What do we do? Just like send him back and we&#146;re then
gonna go skiing?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, this is horrible, it&#146;s just horrible.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Guys, do you think we should ask Ross to come along?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I know, what about Rachel? I mean how are we even gonna ask her?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ask me what?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Umm, if ah, it might be okay if Ross came skiing?</p>

<p><b>Chandler, Phoebe, and Joey:</b> No, I wasn&#146;t gonna ask you that, no.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You guys are unbelievable. No! He cannot come.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Excuse me?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> It&#146;s horrible.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (sarcastic) Oh please, can&#146;t I come to your special, magical cabin?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Why would you even want to come Ross? You&#146;re a horrible skier.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh-oh, hitting me where it hurts, my ski skills.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Here we go again.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I-I can&#146;t handle this, you guys.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Y'know what, I can handle it, handle&#146;s my middle name. Actually
it&#146;s the ah, middle part of my first name.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> All right Pheebs, your cab&#146;s ready.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> All right, let&#146;s go!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You&#146;re welcome.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, I&#146;m sorry, were you speaking to me or sleeping with someone
else?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> We were on a break!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Y'know Ross why don&#146;t you put <b>that</b> on your answering
machine!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey-hey, it&#146;s valid okay? And I&#146;m not the only one who thinks
so, Monica agrees with me.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (to Monica) What?!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (shyly) I don&#146;t know.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> That&#146;s what you said last night.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What I said was, was that I understood. Joey&#146;s the one who agreed
with you!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Really Joey?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (pause) What?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Y'know what, but there is, there is no right or wrong, here.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No, I think it&#146;s very obvious who&#146;s wrong here.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Obviously not to Joey.</p>

<p>[They all turn around and look at Joey.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (pause) What?</p>

<p>[They all start fighting with each other.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (to Rachel) Look both, Joey and Monica feel the same way that I do.
No-no-no-no.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Guys, guys, guess who I am?! (starts dancing around in an effort to
stop the fighting.)</p>

<p>[They stop briefly to look at Chandler, but then start fighting again.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey! Hey! Hey! Hey!! Hey!!! (they all stop fighting, Chandler continues
to dance.) Look what you&#146;re doing to Chandler!! (Chandler finally stops) (to Ross and
Rachel) Yeah, look, we know this is really, really hard for you guys. Okay? (Ross starts
to leave) You don&#146;t, all right you don&#146;t have to love each other, okay? You
don&#146;t, you don&#146;t even have to like each other much right now. But please, you
have to figure out a way to be around each other.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, and not put us in the middle.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, otherwise, I mean that&#146;s, that&#146;s, that&#146;s just it
for us hanging out together. Y'know is that what you want? (they both look away) Can you
be civil?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I can.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay. Good, all right, let&#146;s get back in the car, &#145;cause
it&#146;s freezing, and my chest is unsupported.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh what, wait, wait a second, I mean, what are we doing? Who&#146;s going
with who?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Look, you guys, you guys should go. (Joey tries to say something, but Ross
cuts him off.) No, I&#146;m, you, you planned this all out, and I don&#146;t want to ruin
it, so you guys should just go.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Come on man, you drove all the way up here.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, no, really, I&#146;ve got to take the car back anyway, I&#146;m
spending all day tomorrow with Ben, It&#146;s fine, no guilt I promise.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Thank you.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> All right, we&#146;ll call you when we get back.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Maybe we can like go to a movie or something. </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Or, or the rodeo!!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> That would be great.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I was being Shelly Winters from <i>The Poseidon Adventure</i>.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I know!</p>

<p>[They all get in the cab and drive away.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Bye!!!</p>

<p>[Ross tries to start the truck, and discovers the battery&#146;s dead.]</p>

<p align="center"><b>Closing Credits</b></p>

<p>[Scene: Carol and Susan&#146;s, Carol is running to answer the door.]</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> (looking through the peephole) Ugh. (opening the door) Ross!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (entering) Hi! Sorry I&#146;m late. Were you sleeping?</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Ahh, nooo!!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, great! Listen, oh I had to get you a whole new battery. I got you the
best one I could, &#145;cause that&#146;s not where you want to skimp.</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> You&#146;re a genius, Ross.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, well it came to about $112, but what the hell, just call it an even
110?</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Okay, I&#146;ll pay you tomorrow. (pushes him out the door)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Okay, bye!!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> So they ah, they all took off, it was pretty hard watching them go,
y'know?</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Yeah, okay, bye. (closes the door, turns out the lights, and runs back to
the bedroom)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (outside the door) So I&#146;m gonna take off then!</p>

<p align="center"><b>End</b></p>
</body>
