<head>
<title>The One With The Hypnosis Tape</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="white" text="black" link="green" vlink="black" alink="yellow">

<h1 align="center">The One With The Hypnosis Tape</h1>

<hr align="center">

<p>Written by: Seth Kurland<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a></p>

<hr>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, all but Chandler are there, Joey laughs for no apparent reason.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (to Joey) What&#146;s so funny?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, nothing, no. It&#146;s an acting exercise, I&#146;m practising my fake
laugh.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh. (she laughs)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What-what&#146;s so funny?</p>

<p>(Chandler enters with a cigarette.)</p>

<p><b>Gunther:</b> (to Chandler) Oh, no-no, no-no-no, there&#146;s none of that in here.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh come on man! At least let me finish this last one.</p>

<p><b>Gunther:</b> Okay, but only if you give me a drag.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay.</p>

<p>(Chandler hands him the cigarette, and he takes a long drag.)</p>

<p><b>Gunther:</b> Oh dark mother, once again I suckle at your smokey tit. (hands Chandler
back the cigarette.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No-no, why don&#146;t you hang on to that one.</p>

<p>(He goes and sits down next to Rachel and puts a cigarette in his mouth, which Rachel
takes away from him. He puts another cigarette in his mouth, and Rachel takes it away
again.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, that&#146;s like the least fun game ever.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, I&#146;m really sick of your smoking, so I brought something that
is going to help you quit. (hands him an audio cassette)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh. (takes the cassette and puts it on his arm like the stop smoking
patch, and it falls off.) Nope, that patch is no good. (Joey and Monica both do their fake
laughs.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Come on, it&#146;s a hypnosis tape. This woman at work used it for two
weeks straight and she hasn&#146;t smoked since.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Pffhah.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (to Ross) What&#146;s your problem?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Nothing, it&#146;s just that hypnosis is beyond crap.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ross, I watched you get hypnotised in Atlantic City.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey, that guy did not hypnotise me! Okay.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh right, &#145;cause you always pull your pants down at the count of
three and play Wipe-out on your butt cheeks.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> All right, y'know forget hypnosis. The way to quit smoking is you have
to dance naked in a field of heather, and then bath in the sweat of six healthy young men.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Or what my Father called Thursday night.</p>

<p align="center"><b>Opening Credits</b></p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, continued from earlier, Ross is handing Rachel a cup of coffee.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Here you go.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, y'know what, I didn&#146;t want cinnamon on this.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Sorry. (To remedy that, Ross scoops the cinnamon off of the top with his
hand.)</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> (entering) Hi!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh my God!! </p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Frank! Hi!</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> How are you?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What are you doing here?</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Oh, well y'know, I would&#146;ve called but I lost your phone number and
then ah, my Mom locked me out of the house so I couldn&#146;t find it. And then, I tried
to find a pay phone, and ah, the receiver was cut off. So...</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What happened?</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Ah, oh, the ah, vandalism.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> But, also, what happened between you and your Mom?</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Well, we got into a fight &#145;cause ah, she said I was to immature to
get married.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Your getting married?!</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Oh, yeah!</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Wow!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> My little brother&#146;s getting married!!</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Oh, I knew you&#146;d be so cool about this. All right, ah, hey, do you
want to meet her?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Do I?</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Do you?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, I do, yeah.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Okay, cool, all right, she just ah, parking the truck. (to Joey) I&#146;m
gonna, I&#146;m gonna get my ah, my fiance man!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Y'know, I would&#146;ve bet good money that he&#146;d be the first one
of us to get married.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, isn&#146;t it fantastic?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah, ah, but Pheebs don&#146;t you think he&#146;s a little young to
get married?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What, he&#146;s 18.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Exactly, it&#146;ll be illegal for him to drink at his own bachelor party.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, or-or to get a hooker.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Always illegal Joe.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> (entering with his fiance Alice, who is obviously much, much older than
he is) Hey! Hey! This is ah, my fiance, Mrs. Knight. (he points out Phoebe to her)</p>

<p><b>Alice:</b> Y'know it-it&#146;s funny, um, Frank told me so much about you, but your
not how I pictured you at all.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, I&#146;m a big surprise.</p>

<p>(Ross lets them both sit in his chair.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> So, um, how-how did you guys meet?</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Well um, I was in ah Mrs. Knight&#146;s ah, I mean Alice, sorry, Alice, I
always do that. I was in her ah, Home Ec class.</p>

<p><b>Alice:</b> And he was my best student.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Yeah, she was my best teacher. </p>

<p><b>Alice:</b> Ohhh. (They embrace in a very passionate kiss.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> If that doesn&#146;t keep kids in school, what will?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> And so now you guys are gonna be married?</p>

<p><b>Alice:</b> Yeah. Y'know we-we talked about just living together, but um, we want to
have kids right away.</p>

<p>(Both Chandler and Phoebe have shocked looks on their faces.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh my God!! Great!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Wow, kids. Frank, are you sure you&#146;re ready for that?</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> I mean, how hard can it be? Y'know, I mean, y'know, babies, y'know who
doesn&#146;t want babies right? And besides y'know, I never had a Dad around, and ah,
now-now I always will, &#145;cause y'know, it&#146;ll be me. Right?</p>

<p><b>Alice:</b> Y'know, I mean, really we do realise that there&#146;s an age difference
between us.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh good! Okay. &#145;Cause you were acting like you didn&#146;t.</p>

<p><b>Alice:</b> Oh no, but when it comes to love, what does age matter?</p>

<p>(They both growl and hiss at each other and then kiss passionately again.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler&#146;s bedroom, Chandler is listening to the hypnosis tape.]</p>

<p><b>Hypnosis Tape:</b> You are falling fast asleep. Deeper. Deeper. Deeper. You are now
completely asleep. You don&#146;t need to smoke. Cigarettes don&#146;t control you. You
are a strong, confident woman, who does not need to smoke. A strong, confident woman.</p>

<p>[Scene: The Moondance Diner, Monica is working, Rachel is having lunch.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> And y'know what, I just realised, in the last year I&#146;ve only gone
out with two guys, Richard and Julio. You gotta help me out here, you gotta set me up, you
gotta get me back in the game.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, that shouldn&#146;t be a problem. I mean I work in fashion and all
I meet are eligible straight men.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (to a customer) Pete, can I get you something else?</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Yeah, a slice of cheesecake and-and a date if you&#146;re given&#146;
&#145;em out.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Haven&#146;t you and I covered that topic?</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Hmm, come on, you just said to her that you&#133;.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Aww, the only reason you want to go out with me because my blond wig,
and the big boobs, and the fact that I serve you food.</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Well, if that were true, I&#146;d dating my Aunt Ruth. And the two times
we went out were just plain awkward. (to Rachel) Come on, you think she should go out with
me, don&#146;t you?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (laughs) Well, I mean, are you sure you want to go out with her? I mean
that ain&#146;t a pretty picture in the morning, y&#146;know what I mean. That wig all in
disarray, and boobs flung over the night stand, y'know. </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I mean really, think about it.</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Ho-ho, I will.</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Ross and Joey are being lectured by Phoebe.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, I know, I know, that this is Frank&#146;s life, (walks behind them,
they turn around in the leather chairs to face her) y'know. Y'know, I don&#146;t want to
be all judgmental, y'know, but this is sick, it&#146;s sick and wrong!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Pheebs, what, is it the age thing?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No-no, oh, I&#146;m fine with the age thing y'know, until it starts
sticking it&#146;s tongue down my little brother&#146;s throat! </p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Pheebs, he seems to enjoy it.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> But, I mean, do you think he&#146;s gonna enjoy it when he&#146;s up to
his elbows in the diapers from all the babies they have to have right away?! This is not
fair to Frank, (she walks behind them again, and hey again turn to follow her) and
it-it&#146;s not fair to the babies, and y'know what, it&#146;s not good home economics.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, have-have you told him how you feel?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yes. Not out loud.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Pheebs, if you don&#146;t tell him, soon he&#146;s gonna be married, and
then you&#146;re gonna hate yourself.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, but if I do tell him, then he&#146;s gonna hate myself. I mean
look at him and his Mom, I can&#146;t. (pause) But, you guys can, please you gotta talk
him out of it.</p>

<p><b>Ross and Joey:</b> No-no-no-no-no. (They start to turn away, but Phoebe stops them,
and turns them back to face her.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Come on, you guys, you have nothing to lose, I have everything to lose.
Do you want me to lose everything? Everything?!</p>

<p><b>Ross and Joey:</b> No.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, I&#146;m gonna go get Frank. (exits)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> So, we&#146;re walking down the street and I turn to you and I say,
&#147;Hey, let&#146;s go hang out at Totally Nude Nudes,&#148; remember? And then, and
then, you turn to me and say, &#147;Nah, let&#146;s just hang out at your place.&#148;
Well, that was a nice move dumb ass. </p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel and Monica are entering.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I think you should definitely go out with this guy.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Nah, he doesn&#146;t do anything for me.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Monica, last Saturday night, what happened on <i>Walker: Texas Ranger</i>?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well, umm, Walker was looking for this big bus load of kids&#133;.
(realises) All right, I get your point.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> All right.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (entering, carrying a briefcase) Hi.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Y'know, I forgot the combination to this about a year ago? I just
carry it around. Do you have any Chap Stick?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Uh, yeah.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hey, how are those tapes working out for ya?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Y'know what, pretty good.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Good! I haven&#146;t smoked yet today, I feel great, and-and-and
confident, that is a stunning blouse.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Thank you.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Here you go.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Thanks</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hey Mon, let&#146;s give Pete a chance Come on, he was funny, he seems
really nice, and that check thing was adorable.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What check thing?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> As a joke, this customer at work who has a crush on me gave me a $20,000
tip. His number is on the check, he just did so I&#146;d call him.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (reading the check) Pete Becker. Pete&#133; (quickly grabs a magazine
and opens it up to show her a picture) (pointing to the picture) Is this him?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> That&#146;s Bill Clinton.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Who&#146;s he huggin&#146;?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh my God! That&#146;s Pete! But why is Bill huggin&#146; Pete?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> This guy invented Moss 865! Every office in the world uses that
program!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> We use it!!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> There you go!!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh my God, Monica&#146;s gonna go out with a millionaire. </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I&#146;m not gonna go out with him.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh my God, I can&#146;t believe this is a real $20,000 check, oh this is
just so exciting.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Or incredibly offensive.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh yeah, sure, that too.</p>

<p>(Chandler is putting on the Chap Stick the same way that women put on lipstick,
including the bit with the piece of tissue.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (to the girls who are staring at him) What?</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Ross and Joey are talking to Frank.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> All we&#146;re saying is don&#146;t rush into anything.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, come on, think about it. You&#146;re 18, okay, she&#146;s 44, when
you&#146;re 36, she&#146;s gonna be 88.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> What, you don&#146;t think I know that?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Look, the point is, there&#146;s a lot of women out there you haven&#146;t
even had sex with yet!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, he-he&#146;s right, he&#146;s right. This is your time y'know, yeah,
you&#146;re young, you&#146;re-you&#146;re weird, chicks dig that.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Okay, but isn&#146;t sex better when it&#146;s with one person that you
really, really care about.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, in a poem maybe.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No the man&#146;s right, that&#146;s what I had with Rachel.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> You don&#146;t have it anymore?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, I ah, I slept with someone else.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Okay, so wait, all right, so how does that make things better?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> It didn&#146;t.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Okay, so what you used to have with Rachel, is what I&#146;ve got with
Alice.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Now, wh-what, what is that like?</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> It&#146;s so cool man, it&#146;s so, it&#146;s just &#145;cause being
with her is so much better than like not being with her.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, yeah.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (to Ross) Why can&#146;t I find that?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Don&#146;t ask me, I had it and I blew it!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, I want it!</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> You can have it!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I don&#146;t know, maybe I can&#146;t. I mean, maybe there&#146;s
something wrong with me.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, no! No!</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> It&#146;s out there man! I&#146;ve seen it! I got it!!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Then you hold on to it!!</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> All right, man!!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> All right, congratulations you lucky bastard! (hugs him)</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, it&#146;s after Ross and Joey&#146;s talk with Frank, and
Phoebe&#146;s is finding out what happened.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (to Joey) You&#146;re Frank&#146;s best man?!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I couldn&#146;t help it, there love is so pure.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well then, (to Ross) what about you?! Huh?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I&#146;m the ring bearer.</p>

<p>(As Phoebe stands there in shock and disbelief, Chandler comes out of the bathroom and
walks to his bedroom. He&#146;s just got out of the shower and has the towel wrapped
around himself high across his chest, and another towel wrapped around his head, like
women wear towels. Joey watches Chandler wondering what the hell he&#146;s doing.)</p>

<p align="center"><b>Commercial Break</b></p>

<p>[Scene: Phoebe&#146;s, Phoebe is opening the door.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hi! Oh, Alice, hi! Thanks. I&#146;m so glad you could come, &#145;cause
I&#146;ve got a real umm, Home Ec emergency. (Points to the table cloth, which has a huge
mustard stain on it.)</p>

<p><b>Alice:</b> Oh my God, who died on this?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, I know. It&#146;s a real mustard-tastrophe. Can you help me?</p>

<p><b>Alice:</b> Absolutely. Okay, first we&#146;ll start with a little club soda and
salt, and then if that doesn&#146;t work we can go back to&#133;</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Y'know what, forget it. It&#146;s ruined. </p>

<p><b>Alice:</b> Oh no-no, never say that. If we can&#146;t get it out then we can cut
around the stain, add a little lace, you make a stylish throw.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Or instead, maybe you could just not marry my brother Frank.</p>

<p>[Scene: Pete&#146;s office, he is participating in a conference call with three other
employees, each of whom are on a different TV screen that he controls with a remote.]</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Okay, that&#146;s great, but can we make it smaller? Can we make it fit on
the head of a pin? I love when we make things fit on the head of a pin.</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Got it. Yeah all right. Yeah, okay.</p>

<p>(The intercom buzzes.)</p>

<p><b>Secretary:</b> You have a Miss Monica Geller here.</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Uh, absolutely, yeah, sEnd her in. (Monica enters) Hi.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What the hell is this? (holding up the check)</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Hang on a second. (to the employees) I&#146;ll-I&#146;ll talk to you in
the morning. (turns two of the three off) I&#146;m sorry what?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Seriously, what is this supposed to mean?</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Well, y&#146;know, I never know how much to tip.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You&#146;re supposed to double the tax. Not double the tax of Romania. I
mean, what&#146;s-what&#146;s the deal? Are you, are you trying to buy me? Is this the way
you get girls to go out with you?</p>

<p><b>Employee:</b> Umm, I&#146;m still here.</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> (turns off the TV) You&#146;re taking this all wrong. Because, if I
didn&#146;t leave you that tip, you wouldn&#146;t of come down here, we wouldn&#146;t be
having this argument, and there wouldn&#146;t be this ah, heat between us.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Come on, you gotta admit that our relationship is ah, is hitting a new
level now. &#145;Cause you used to be like the chef, and I was the customer, and now
we&#146;re like this-this couple that fights.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay, umm, you&#146;re a loon.</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Look, forget the check, okay. (rips up the check) I like you. I think
you&#146;re great. Come on, what do you say?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I don&#146;t know.</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Why not?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> &#145;Cause I don&#146;t want to encourage this kind of behaviour.</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> One meal! That&#146;s all I&#146;m asking for. Please? We go out, we eat,
and if you don&#146;t have a good time, I give you ten grand, we call it even.</p>

<p>[Scene: Phoebe&#146;s, she is coming home. She turns on the lights, and sits down on
the couch.]</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> (hiding under a pile of clothes) Hi. (She jumps up screaming.) Wait, no!
Just put the mail down. It&#146;s-it&#146;s me!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay. Whoa, sorry. Why were you just like all in the dark?</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Oh well, um, your, your laundry just smelled so good, that I thought
I&#146;d curl up in it. Is that all right?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, yeah, sure. So, how was your day?</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Oh, well just probably the worst one since I&#146;ve been alive.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What umm, what happened?</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Umm, Alice ah, she ah, called it off.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh no. Did umm, did she say why?</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Uh, no, not really, just that I was too young, y'know, but I don&#146;t
see how I could all of the sudden be too young, &#145;cause I&#146;m older than I was when
we first got together.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, yeah, no, I don&#146;t, I don&#146;t know. But, y'know what, maybe
it&#146;s just all for the best?</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Yeah, if the best is like unbelievable pain!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, sweetie, oh. (hugs him)</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Y'know, I just was finally happy y'know. For the first time in my life!
After my Dad left me, and then, and then getting arrested for stealing those birds, and
then, and then the whole punctured lung thing! I can, it&#146;s still really hard to take
deep breaths in cold weather, but with Alice all that stuff kinda went away. And now
it&#146;s, and now it&#146;s gone and I don&#146;t know why!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Uh, well I can tell you why. It&#146;s, it&#146;s because of me. But,
y'know what, I only did it because I love you. Okay?</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Umm, well I, I kinda had a little chat with Alice, and I sort of made
her see why you two shouldn&#146;t be together, y'know. And you&#146;re gonna see it to,
one day, you really, really will.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Wait a minute, wait, this is because of you?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Well, you, wait no, my Mother didn&#146;t want us to be together, but the
worst thing she ever did was tie me to the porch. </p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, but.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Wait, y'know what, I-I came to you because I thought you&#146;d
understand! Oh no!! Y'know, I would storm out of here right now if-if I had some money, or
a place to go&#133;</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is getting Monica ready for her date. The guys are
also there. The door buzzes.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh my God! The millionaire&#146;s here!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (in a feminine way) Oh my God! (and he jumps all around)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Guys, please, I&#146;m just gonna have dinner with him. Okay?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, okay, just because he buys you dinner, does not mean you owe him
anything.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I know!!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, then get the lobster!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (opening the door) (to Pete) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Hi.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hi!!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hi!</p>

<p>(They&#146;re all staring at him, with big, huge smiles on their faces.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey, how much cash do you got in your pocket right now?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> And that&#146;s why, I&#146;m not inviting you in for a drink. (starts
to leave) Bye.</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Oh-no-no-no-no&#133;.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Just one drink?!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (in the hallway) So, where do you want to go?</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Hey, you like pizza?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, that&#146;s sounds great.</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> I know a great little place.</p>

<p>[Cut to a shot of the coliseum in Rome, Italy.]</p>

<p>[Scene: A restaurant in Rome, Monica is paying for the pizza.]</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> You&#146;re, hey, you&#146;re not paying for the pizza!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh come on, it&#146;s only fair, you paid for the flight. Now is, is
that enough lire?</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Ahh, I&#146;d throw another thousand on that.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Why, how much is that?</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> That&#146;s about 60 cents.</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, it&#146;s the middle of the night. Joey is walking into
the living room, and runs into the entertainment centre.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Every night!! </p>

<p>(He starts to walk to the bathroom and hears the hypnosis tape from Chandler&#146;s
bedroom.)</p>

<p><b>Hypnosis Tape:</b> You do not need to smoke. Cigarettes don&#146;t control you. You
are a strong, confident woman, who does not need to smoke. A strong, confident woman, who
does not need to smoke. (Joey walks out smiling to himself.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Phoebe&#146;s, Frank is watching TV, and he&#146;s very depressed as Phoebe
enters.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey, Frank. Look, okay, I know that you think I did like this totally
evil thing, but I so didn&#146;t. There&#146;s someone here who can explain this better
than I can.</p>

<p><b>Alice:</b> Hi Frank.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Hi, Mrs. Knight.</p>

<p><b>Alice:</b> Phoebe&#146;s right Frank. I know it&#146;s hard to hear, but it
would&#146;ve been wrong to go through with it. I-I-I was being selfish, even though we,
we want the same things now, in the future we may not. (to Phoebe) Is that it, is that
what it is?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, but not just that.</p>

<p><b>Alice:</b> Right, not just that. Umm, even though we love each other as much as we
do, none the less&#133;</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> None the less.</p>

<p><b>Alice:</b> None the less. Umm, you&#146;re too young to, to really know what you
want. (They embrace in a passionate kiss.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> That&#146;s right, exactly. (sees them) All right, it&#146;s a good bye
kiss, that&#146;s good. (Frank picks Alice up and they move to the couch) Bye-bye. (They
both lie down on the couch and start to make out.) Okay, no, the important thing is that
you see what I&#146;m saying, y'know, just y'know, this is clearly wrong. (They ignore
her) Okay, I&#146;ve decided I&#146;m gonna let this happen! Okay, can I just get my
purse? (She reaches in and Alice moans) Okay, all right, good. (leaves).</p>

<p align="center"><b>Closing Credits</b></p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler&#146;s bedroom, he&#146;s listening to the hypnosis tape again.]</p>

<p><b>Hypnosis Tape:</b> Cigarette&#146;s don&#146;t control you. You are a strong,
confident woman, who does not need to smoke. </p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (He&#146;s recorded his voice on the tape) Joey&#146;s your best friEnd.
You want to make him a cheese sandwich everyday. (he laughs) And you also want to buy him
hundreds of dollars worth of pants. </p>

<p>(Chandler wakes up and stares at the tape.)</p>

<p align="center"><b>End</b></p>
</body>
</html>
319<html>

<head>
<title>The One With The Tiny T-shirt</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="white" text="black" link="green" vlink="black" alink="yellow">

<h1 align="center">The One With The Tiny T-shirt</h1>

<hr align="center">

<p>Written by: Adam Chase<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a> </p>

<hr>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Gunther is pouring Rachel coffee.]</p>

<p><b>Gunther:</b> Here you go.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Thank you.</p>

<p><b>Gunther:</b> (In his head) <i>Say Rachel, I was wondering if you&#146;d like to go
to a movie with me sometime. As my lover! Nnnsch, to out there. Maybe you&#146;d just like
to ah, get something to eat with me sometime? As my lover.</i></p>

<p><b>Mark:</b> (entering) Hi!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hi! All right, let&#146;s go shoppin&#146;!!</p>

<p><b>Mark:</b> Um, y'know, before we go ah, there&#146;s something I need to say.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, okay.</p>

<p><b>Mark:</b> I&#146;ve kinda of had this ah, this crush on you. (Rachel is shocked) But
since you were with Ross, I-I didn&#146;t do anything about it. But, now that you&#146;re
not, I&#146;d really like to ask you out sometime. So-so that&#146;s-that&#146;s what
I&#146;m doing, now.</p>

<p>(Gunther gets this hurt expression on his face and goes into the back room)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Wow! Umm....</p>

<p>(She&#146;s interrupted by a loud crash and the sound of braking dishes. Followed
quickly by another crash. Everyone turns and looks at the back room, as Gunther emerges.)</p>

<p><b>Gunther:</b> I dropped a cup.</p>

<p align="center"><b>Opening Credits</b></p>

<p>[Scene: The hallway between the two apartments, Pete and Monica are returning from
their date.]</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> ...so y'know, that&#146;s why, within a few years, that voice recognition
is gonna be pretty much standard on any computer you buy. Y'know, so you could be
like-like, &#145;Wash my car.&#146; &#145;Clean my room.&#146; It&#146;s not gonna be able
to do any of those things, but it&#146;ll understand what you&#146;re saying.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, this is so great.</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Yeah, it was.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> All right then. (He leans in to kiss her goodnight, but she quickly
kisses him on the cheek and pats his shoulder.) Bye.</p>

<p>(She goes into her apartment and sees Chandler, Phoebe, and Ross sitting there.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hello, people who do not live here.</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Hi! Hello!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I gave you a key for emergencies!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> We were out of <i>Doritos</i>.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey, how&#146;d the date go with Mr. Millionaire?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Mr. Millionaire, new from Snooty Playthings! Third wife sold
separately.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> He&#146;s great! I mean we have such a good time together! He&#146;s so
funny, and sooo sweet, and I&#146;m not attracted to him at all!!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Still?!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Noo!! It&#146;s driving me crazy. I mean every other way he&#146;s like
the perfect guy, he has everything. Plus! He actually has everything.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Life-sized Imperial Storm Troopers from <i>Sharper Image</i>?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Two.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Wow!! Can Joey and I put them on and fight?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (entering, dancing and singing) Oh mommie, oh daddie, I am a big old
baddie! Oh mommie, oh daddie, I am a big old baddie! (He dances around the dinner table
and exits)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I guess he musta gotten the part in that play.</p>

<p><b>Monica and Phoebe:</b> Oh.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, either that, or Gloria Estefan was right, eventually, the rhythm
is going to get you.</p>

<p>[Scene: A Theatre, Joey is arriving to rehearse the play he&#146;s in.]</p>

<p><b>The Director:</b> Joe. How&#146;s it going?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Good. (He sets his stuff down and starts talking to Kate, another cast
member.) Hey.</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> Hi.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, so you&#146;re playing Adrienne, huh?</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> Yes. Are you one of the retarded cousins?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, no. Ah, I playing your husband, Victor. I&#146;m Joey Tribianni.</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> Hi, nice to meet you. Kate Miller. </p>

<p>(She goes over to the snack table, and Joey quickly runs over and pours her a cup of
coffee.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> So the ah, play&#146;s pretty great, huh?</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> Oh, yeah. I love Jennifer Van Murray&#146;s work. She&#146;s so
brilliantly incisive when it comes to deconstructing the psyche of the American middle
class.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, forget about it. She rocks!</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> Where do I know you from?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Dr. Drake Remoray. <i>Days of Our Lives</i>. Voted most datable
neurosurgeon by <em>Teen Beat</em>.</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> No, that&#146;s not it. So, you&#146;re a soap actor? Well this must be
pretty exciting for you to be in a real play, hmm?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey, I&#146;ve done plays before. I&#146;m a serious actor.</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> That info-mercial! For the milk carton spout thing!
You&#146;re-you&#146;re-you&#146;re the guy that doesn&#146;t know how to pour milk!!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> See, I actually <b>can</b> pour milk, but I got you believing that I
couldn&#146;t. Now, see, that&#146;s acting.</p>

<p align="left"><b>Kate:</b> Right, at the end, you choked on a cookie.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, that was real.</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Rachel is telling Phoebe about Mark, as Gunther eavesdrops behind
them.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Wow! I cannot believe Mark asked you out.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I know.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What, so what are you gonna tell him?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, I told him I would think about it, but I&#146;m gonna tell him no.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Huh.</p>

<p>(Gunther tries to swoop in to ask Rachel out.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I mean I think I&#146;d say no to anybody right now. (Hearing this
Gunther swoops back to cleaning tables.) Oh, but it was so strange. I mean I&#146;m
standing there with this charming, cute guy, who&#146;s asking me to go out with him,
which I&#146;m allowed to do, and I felt guilty. Y'know, like I&#146;d be cheating on Ross
or something.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Wow. So, okay, maybe that means that, you&#146;re not over Ross yet and
you have issues with your father.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I don&#146;t have any issues with my Father.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, so it&#146;s probably just the Ross thing then.</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is telling Chandler about Kate.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I hate this woman!! I hate her! She told everyone in the company about
that info-mercial, and now they all keep asking me to open their drinks. Okay, and
whenever I can&#146;t do it, they&#146;re all like-like laughing at me.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (entering) Hello.</p>

<p><b>Chandler and Joey:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> So Rachel called. Wants to see me. Going over in a minute.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Wow, what-what do you think she wants?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, maybe the crazy fog has lifted and she realises that life without
me.... a-sucks.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> It&#146;s possible. You are very loveable, I&#146;d miss you if I
broke up with you. (Ross glares at him) I was just trying to be supportive.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Then be supportive like a guy.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (in a deep voice) If I broke up with you, I&#146;d miss you.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is there as Ross enters, walking very confidently.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hi.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You ah, wanted to see me?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah. Ahh, here&#146;s a box of your stuff. (hands him a box)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, y'know, it&#146;s just like hats, and a shirt, and CD&#146;s, just
sort of stuff that you&#146;ve left here.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What are you doing? Are you trying to hurt me? Or something?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No. Ross, it, it just seems that y'know it&#146;s time we-we y'know,
move on. I mean, I mean don&#146;t&#146; you think?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yes. </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yes, I do.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Good.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, I-I really do. (takes a dinosaur mug out of the box) Hey! This-this
was a gift?!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ross, you got that for free from the museum gift shop.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> It&#146;s still a gift! I got it from the <b>gift shop</b>!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, all right, give me the mug! I&#146;ll keep the mug.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No!! Y'know-y'know don&#146;t do me any favours. In fact, where,
where&#146;s the rest of my stuff?! Huh? Like-like my umm, (picks up a book) Hey, this
book is mine!! And-and-and, and that T-shirt you sleep in? I&#146;d like that back too.
Yes, I do.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You know how much I love that T-shirt! You never even where that
T-shirt!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I&#146;m just trying to help you, move on.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, you are a petty man. You are a petty, petty....</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Petty...</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Petty... (goes into her room)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Petty...</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Petty...</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Petty...</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Small...</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Small... (Rachel comes back into the living room and catches Ross mocking
her.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You are so just doing this out of spite.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Awwwahuh, no, no, no!!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Huh?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I&#146;m-I&#146;m gonna wear this all the time! I love this shirt!! (he
kisses the shirt)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You have not worn that T-shirt since you were 15!! It doesn&#146;t even
fit you anymore!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, yeah-yeah-yeah-yeah...</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (imitating him) yeah-yeah-yeah!!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh-oh, okay, okay! (He quickly takes off his sweater in order to put on
the T-shirt. It&#146;s an old &#145;Frankie says relax&#146; T-shirt, that barely fits
him. Rachel nods her head in approval of the new look.) If you don&#146;t mind I&#146;m
gonna the rest of my stuff, and relax, in my favourite shirt. (Starts to leave) You have a
pleasant evening. (He exits and leaves the door open.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, the gang minus Rachel and Ross are talking to Pete.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> So, you&#146;re like a zillionaire? (Pete smiles and nods)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> And you&#146;re our age. You&#146;re our age.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Y'know what, you should like, you should buy a state and then just name
it after yourself.</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> What like Pete Dakota?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, or, or, or, Mississ-Pete.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, oh, I got it! Pete-Chicago.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> That&#146;s not a state Joe.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, and Mississ-Pete is?</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> I got to go, so ah, I&#146;ll see you guys later.</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You&#146;re our age!</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> (to Monica, by the door) So ah, we on for tomorrow?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Absolutely! (He goes to kiss her, but she stops him and rubs his head
and says...) Now get out of here you!! (Pete leaves) (to the gang) Okay, I&#146;m running
out of places I can touch him! Look, is there something wrong with me? I mean why am I
only attracted to guys where there&#146;s no future? Either they&#146;re too old, or
they&#146;re too young, and then there&#146;s Pete who&#146;s-who&#146;s crazy about me,
and who&#146;s absolutely perfect for me, and there&#146;s like zip going on! I mean,
seriously, does it sound like something&#146;s wrong with me?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, kinda.</p>

<p>[Scene: The Theatre, Joey and Kate are rehearsing for the play.]</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> Happy?! Is that what I&#146;m supposed to be Vic? Happy?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, why don&#146;t you tell me what you&#146;re supposed to be! Huh?
Because I sure as hell can&#146;t figure it out! I talk to you and nothin&#146;. You look
at me, and it&#146;s nothin&#146;. (He kisses her) Nothing.</p>

<p><b>The Director:</b> Tasty! I&#146;m really starting to feel like you guys have a
history, it&#146;s-it&#146;s nice.</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> I have a question about this scene.</p>

<p><b>The Director:</b> Yes?</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> Well, I don&#146;t understand why Adrienne&#146;s attracted to Victor.</p>

<p><b>The Director:</b> Peel the onion. First of all, he&#146;s good looking.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> I think my character&#146;s gonna need a little bit more of reason than
that.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, hey, how about this one. Ah, it&#146;s says so in the script! Y'know
ah, I-I don&#146;t know why my character likes you either, I mean it says in the script
here that you&#146;re a bitch.</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> It doesn&#146;t say that in the script.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> It does in mine!</p>

<p>[Scene: The Hallway, Chandler and Ross are returning from working out.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I can blow dry it. I can put gel on it. It doesn&#146;t matter, I
still wind up with this little (pats the flat spot on the back of his head) cowlicky thing
on the middle part of my head. It&#146;s so annoying. Does it bug you?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You bug me.</p>

<p>[Rachel comes out of her apartment, followed by Mark, and they leave on their date,
without saying a word to Ross. Ross is stunned.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Is there any chance you didn&#146;t see that?</p>

<p align="center"><b>Commercial Break</b></p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is watching a basketball game, Ross is staring
out the peephole.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Ross! You gotta stop! Okay?! You can&#146;t just stare through the
peep hole for three hours! You&#146;re gonna get peep eye!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I knew it! I knew it! I always knew she liked him! Y'know, she&#146;d say
no, but here we are! Right? We just broke up, first thing she does!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You didn&#146;t just break up.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey, it&#146;s been like three weeks!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You slept with somebody three hours after you thought you broke up. I
mean bullets have left guns slower!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Here they come, here they come. Oh-ho, if she kisses him goodnight,
I&#146;m gonna kill myself, I swear. I can&#146;t, I can&#146;t watch this. (turns away,
then quickly turns to look again) Come on, date over! Date over! Uh-oh, here we go,
she&#146;s going in.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> She&#146;s going in. Wait! He&#146;s going in! He&#146;s going in!! The
door&#146;s closed! I, I can&#146;t see anything but the door closed!!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> And the inventor of the door rests happily in his grave.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, I have to do something. I mean, I have, I have to stop it!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Stop what?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I don&#146;t know, but I ah, I have the feeling that my being there will
do it. I&#146;ll go over and I will borrow something. Juice!! I need juice!!</p>

<p>(He starts to exit, but Chandler tries to stop him by climbing on his back and grabbing
hold of the foosball table.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No!! You can&#146;t!! </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Look, they must be stopped!</p>

<p align="left"><b>Chandler:</b> I am your friend, and I am not gonna let you do this!!
(Ross is now dragging Chandler and the foosball table to the door) You are surprisingly
strong!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I need juice! People need juice!!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Look man!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> People need juice!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Listen to me!! (Chandler turns him around and closes and holds the
door shut with his feet.) </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Juice, I need...</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> She&#146;s moving on! Okay, if it&#146;s not this guy, it&#146;s gonna
be somebody else! And unless you&#146;re thinking about subletting my peep hole, <b>you</b>
are going to have to get used to the fact that the relationship is over! Okay, man?
It&#146;s over.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, okay. </p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay. </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> It&#146;s just I miss her so much.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I know. (He rubs Ross&#146;s head) </p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is pouring Mark some coffee.]</p>

<p><b>Mark:</b> Why do all you&#146;re coffee mugs have numbers on the bottom?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh. That&#146;s so Monica can keep track. That way if one on them is
missing, she can be like, &#145;Where&#146;s number 27?!&#146;</p>

<p>(She sits down, and Mark leans over and kisses her. Rachel doesn&#146;t react. He tries
it again, and Rachel jumps back quickly.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Y'know what?</p>

<p><b>Mark:</b> No. And I don&#146;t think I&#146;m gonna want to.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I can&#146;t do this.</p>

<p><b>Mark:</b> Yep. Yep, that&#146;s what I didn&#146;t want to know.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, oh, Mark, I&#146;m doing this for the wrong reasons, y'know?
I&#146;m just doing it to get back at Ross. I&#146;m sorry, it&#146;s not very fair to
you.</p>

<p><b>Mark:</b> Ahh! Fair, schmair! Y'know? Look, if you want to get back at Ross, I am
here for you. Really? No-no, I say-I say, I say we get back at him right on this couch.
Right here!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh God. I&#146;m sorry about this.</p>

<p><b>Mark:</b> That&#146;s okay.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You sure?</p>

<p><b>Mark:</b> Yeah. I can just go home and get back at him by myself.</p>

<p>[Scene: A Hospital Reception, Monica and Pete are there.]</p>

<p><b>Spokeswoman:</b> ...has become the penicillin of the twenty-first century. And so
today, this hospital is about to take major steps toward leading that revolution. It is
truly ironic, on one hand consider the size...</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> (to Monica) Hey, can I ask you something?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Sure.</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Where are we? </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (looks around) Well, with all these doctors and nurses, I&#146;m gonna
say, midget rodeo.</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Just tell me the truth.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay. Umm, y'know, I don&#146;t think, I don&#146;t think I told you
this, but umm, I just got out of a really serious relationship.</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Oh, yeah. Wasn&#146;t that like a year ago?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> So I did tell you. Okay, y'know, that really isn&#146;t the thing. Umm,
the thing is that, right now I&#146;m just in a place in my life where I need to focus on
me. Y'know what I mean?</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Oh, yeah. I know that.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I so wanna be attracted to you.</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> But you&#146;re not. Okay, good.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I&#146;m sorry.</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Y'know what, don&#146;t be. This is not, don&#146;t be, &#145;cause
it&#146;s not so bad.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> It&#146;s not?</p>

<p align="left"><b>Pete:</b> I know I&#146;m no John Bon Jovi, (Monica laughs) or someone
who find attractive, I&#146;m just, I think, y'know, that you might end up feeling
differently.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well, um, look I-I don&#146;t want this to come our wrong, but ah, you
seem awfully confident for a guy I just told I wasn&#146;t attracted too.</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Yeah, stupidly charming isn&#146;t&#146; it? Well listen let&#146;s, you
wanna get something to eat? &#145;Cause this place is kinda <b>de</b>pressing. (they start
to leave)</p>

<p><b>Spokeswoman:</b> And the man who made all this possible... Mr. Peter Becker.</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> (to Monica) One second.</p>

<p>(He takes the scissors, cuts the ribbon, shakes her hand, posses for the picture, and
leaves.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is sitting in one of the black chairs, and turns
to face the other one.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I don&#146;t think this town is big enough for both of us to relax in.
(He blows on his hand) Draw!! (He quickly pulls the lever to raise the foot rest, like a
gunfighter in a Western.) </p>

<p>(Joey enters.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (to Joey) I wasn&#146;t doing anything. (Joey starts angrily throwing
his stuff down.) Uh-oh, what did she do now?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Just because she went to Yale drama, she thinks she&#146;s like the
greatest actress since, since, sliced bread!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Ah, Sliced Bread, a wonderful Lady MacBeth.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> God, I just, I hate her! I hate her!! With her, &#145;Oh, I&#146;m so
talented.&#146; and &#145;Oh, I&#146;m so pretty,&#146; and &#145;Ooh, I smell so
good.&#146;</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I think somebody has a crush on somebody.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey, Chandler, can we please stay focused on my problem here?! Y'know?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I&#146;m talking about you. You big, big freak.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh. (realises) Ohh. Ohh, you&#146;re out of your mind.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey, you have nothing but talk about her for the last 48 hours! If you
were in a school yard you&#146;d be pulling her pigtails and pushing her down now!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, yeah?! Then how come I keep thinking about her in all these sexual
scenarios and stuff huh?!</p>

<p>[Scene: The Theatre, Kate and Joey are rehearsing the same scene as before.] </p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> Happy?! Is that what I&#146;m supposed to be Vic? Happy?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, why don&#146;t you tell me what you&#146;re supposed to be! Huh?
Because I sure as hell can&#146;t figure it out! I talk to you and it&#146;s nothin&#146;.
You look at me, and nothin&#146;. (He kisses her, more passionately this time) Nothing.</p>

<p><b>The Director:</b> You guys make me fly! High! Okay, we&#146;re gonna pick it up
here, tomorrow.</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> Well, that was ah...</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Better?</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> Yeah! Yeah, it was definitely an improvement. G&#146;night.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ah, Kate? </p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> Yeah?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> You ah, you forgot your shoes.</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> (she giggles) I&#146;m probably gonna need those. Huh? (she giggles some
more)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey, listen you ah....</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> Hmm?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> ...feel like getting a cup of coffee?</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> Umm.</p>

<p><b>The Director:</b> (leaning in) Kate?</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> Yep.</p>

<p><b>The Director:</b> You ready to go?</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>The Director:</b> (to Joey) Very nice. Very nice. (he walks away)</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> So umm, I&#146;ll see you tomorrow, huh?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, yeah sure, goodnight.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is in the kitchen chopping vegetables. Chandler and
Phoebe are sitting in the living room.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (to Chandler) Hey! (Chandler looks up, startled) Why isn&#146;t it
Spiderman? Y&#146;know like Goldman, Silverman...</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> &#145;Cause it&#146;s-it&#146;s not his last name.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> It isn&#146;t?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No, it&#146;s not like, like Phil Spiderman. He&#146;s a spider, man.
Y'know like ah, like Goldman is a last name, but there&#146;s no Gold Man.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, okay. There should be Gold Man!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (entering) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey, Rach, how was work?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, great. Although I did sit down where there wasn&#146;t a chair.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> By the way, Ross dropped by a box of your stuff.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, well, I guess I had that one coming. I&#146;m just gonna throw it
out, it&#146;s probably just a bunch of shampoo and... (she opens the box and stops)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Something wrong?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (She takes the T-shirt out of the box and holds it to her chest and take
a deep breath.) No. Nothing. (She smiles and goes into her room.)</p>

<p align="center"><b>Closing Credits</b> </p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Phoebe and Chandler are sitting in the black chairs.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> So, ahh, what kind of powers would Gold Man have?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay well, he would turn things to gold.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What about things that are already gold?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ahh, his work is done.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, let&#146;s play my game now.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay. All right you yellow-bellied-lilly-livered-DRAW!! (they both kick
up the foot rests like an old fashioned gun fight.)</p>

<p align="center"><b>End</b></p>
</body>
</html>
320<html>

<head>
<title>The One With The Dollhouse</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="white" text="black" link="green" vlink="black" alink="yellow">

<h1 align="center">The One With The Dollhouse</h1>

<hr align="center">

<p>Written by: Wil Calhoun<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a></p>

<hr>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler, Monica, Phoebe, and Joey are there.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Wait a minute, wait. You&#146;re telling me this actress person is the
only woman you ever wanted who didn&#146;t want you back?!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah! Oh my God! (to Chandler) Is this what it&#146;s like to be you?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Wow, you&#146;re really crazy about her, huh?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, you have no idea. And-and when we&#146;re on stage I get to-to kiss
her and-and touch her, but then she goes home with the director, and it&#146;s like
somebody&#146;s ripping out my heart!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, it&#146;s so <b>great</b> to see you feeling like this!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (entering) Hey!</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Monica, uh Dad called this morning and ah, Aunt Silvia passed away.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yes!! Yes! Yeah, yeah, yeah!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> We were all pretty shaken up about it.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Wait, am I missing something though? &#145;Cause I thought death was
something that&#146;s supposed to be sad, in a way.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well ah, Aunt Silvia was, well not a nice person.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, she was a cruel, cranky, old bitch! (Ross gives her a look) (to
Ross) And I&#146;m sorry she died. Did Dad say I get the dollhouse?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You get the dollhouse.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I get the dollhouse!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Wow, a house for dolls, that is so cool! When I was kid, I had a barrel.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Uh, Pheebs, you had a barrel for a dollhouse?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, just a barrel.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Y'know what, you can play with my dollhouse.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Really?! Really?!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Any time you want. Y'know, when I was younger, all I wanted to do was to
play with this dollhouse, but no!! It was to be looked at, but never played with.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> My Grandmother used to say that exact same thing to me.</p>

<p align="center"><b>Opening Credits</b></p>

<p>[Scene: Rachel&#146;s office, Chandler and her are coming back from lunch.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hey, Sophie!</p>

<p><b>Sophie:</b> Hey, Rach!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Sophie:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Thanks for lunch, Chandler. Y'know, you didn&#146;t have to walk me all
the way back up here.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, that&#146;s-that&#146;s okay, no problem. (He starts to look
around her office.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Honey um, honey, you do realise that we don&#146;t keep the women&#146;s
lingerie here in the office?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes, I realise that.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Summer catalogue! (hands him the catalogue)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> That&#146;s the stuff! (quickly grabs it)</p>

<p>[Rachel&#146;s boss, Joanna, enters]</p>

<p><b>Joanna:</b> Rachel, I need the <em>Versachi</em> invoice. (to Chandler) Hello! You
don&#146;t work for me.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (introduces them) Joanna, this is my friend Chandler Bing (to Chandler)
Joanna.</p>

<p><b>Joanna:</b> Bing! That&#146;s a great name.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Thanks, it&#146;s ah, Gaelic, for &#145;Thy turkey&#146;s done.&#146;
So ah, I&#146;m gonna go, nice, nice meeting you.</p>

<p><b>Joanna:</b> Me too.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Bye, Chandler.</p>

<p><b>Joanna:</b> (to Rachel) So ah, what&#146;s wrong with him?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, nothing, he&#146;s just goofy like that, I actually, hardly notice
it anymore.</p>

<p><b>Joanna:</b> Oh no, no-no-no, is he ah, married, or involved with anyone?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No!! No! He&#146;s not married, or involved, with anyone!</p>

<p><b>Joanna:</b> Oh, Rachel, (pause) actually, y'know what, forget it.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, I&#146;ll ask him for you, if you want me too?</p>

<p><b>Joanna:</b> Would you? Or, is it just to sad and desperate, and y'know something
that Sophie would do?</p>

<p><b>Sophie:</b> Uh, uh, uh, I am here.</p>

<p><b>Joanna:</b> I know that.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is showing off her new dollhouse. It&#146;s a huge
dollhouse, that takes up the entire living room table.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Look at it! Ohhh! Wallpaper&#146;s a little faded, that&#146;s okay.
Carpet&#146;s a little loose. Hardwood floors!!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (entering) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hello.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh! Ooh! Oh Monica! It&#146;s so beautiful.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I know!!!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> So, I&#146;m here, ready to play.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I brought a bunch of stuff for the house, so check it out. Ha-ha. (She
removes this large ceramic dog that comes up to the second floor and places it next to the
house.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What&#146;s this?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> That&#146;s a dog, every house should have a dog.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Not one that can pee on the roof.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, maybe it&#146;s so big because the house was built on radioactive
waste.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (holding a tissue) And is this in case the house sneezes?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, no, that&#146;s the ghost for the attic.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I don&#146;t want a ghost.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, nobody wants a ghost. But you&#146;ve got one, because the house
is sitting on an ancient Indian burial ground.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Wait a minute, the house was built on radioactive waste, and an ancient
Indian burial ground? That would never happen.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, obviously you don&#146;t know much about the U.S. government.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (entering) Hey!</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Hello.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I need to talk to you!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Sure, what&#146;s up?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, sorry. I meant Chandler.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I-I know. Well if something comes up... (walks away)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, I'm glad you guys are past that little awkward phase.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, my boss, Joanna, when you left, she started asking questions about
you...</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh-ho, liked what she saw, huh? Dug my action, did she? Checkin&#146;
out the Chan-Chan man!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (looks at him) That was (pause) surreal. Okay, what do think? Are you
interested at all?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, she seemed cool, attractive. I&#146;ll do it.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh thank you, Chandler, this is so great, she&#146;s gonna love me.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (holding a dinosaur) Okay, dinosaur attack!! Quick, everybody into the
house!! Ahh-ahh! (the dinosaur starts attacking the house. She starts to bark like a dog.)
Roof! Rrroof-roof-roof!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay, Phoebe, y'know what? That-that&#146;s it, that&#146;s it, all
right? No dinosaurs, no ghosts, no giant dogs, okay? They&#146;re not the right size,
they&#146;re not Victorian, and they just don&#146;t go.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, (starts to pack up her stuff) fine. Come dinosaur, we&#146;re not
welcome in the house of no imagination.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Uh, Pheebs, while we&#146;re hovering around the subject. I just have to
say dinosaurs, they-they don&#146;t go, rrroof!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> The little ones do.</p>

<p>[Scene: The Theatre, Joey and Kate are getting ready to rehearse the play.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey, Kate!</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> Morning.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Listen, I ah, went to that restaurant that you were talking about last
week...</p>

<p><b>The Director:</b> Hey, lovely! Come, talk to me a minute! (she goes over to him)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (to himself) And I ate the food, I had the fish, it was good, yeah. It was
good, yeah...</p>

<p><b>Woman:</b> Hi, oh, I&#146;m Lauren, Kate&#146;s understudy.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, hey! Joey Tribbiani.</p>

<p><b>Lauren:</b> I know! I-I&#146;m a big fan of yours.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (looks at her, shocked) What?!</p>

<p><b>Lauren:</b> I used to umm, schedule my classes so I could watch Dr. Drake Remoray on
<i>Days of Our Lives</i>.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Get out of here, really?!</p>

<p><b>Lauren:</b> Absolutely!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah? </p>

<p><b>Lauren:</b> Oh but then, they went and dropped you down that elevator shaft.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> They gave me the shaft all right.</p>

<p><b>Lauren:</b> (laughing) Oh, you&#146;re so funny. Listen, umm, what are you doing
after rehearsals? Do you want to get a drink, or something?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well Ahh, (he sees Kate and the director kissing) yeah! Yeah, sure, a
drink sounds great.</p>

<p><b>Lauren:</b> Cool! I-I&#146;ll see you then.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> All right.</p>

<p><b>The Director:</b> All right, it&#146;s time to act, my talking props. (Both Joey and
Kate just look at each other.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe is entering with her own dollhouse, that she made
herself.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey! </p>

<p><b>All:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Look everybody, look at my new dollhouse!!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Wow!!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Look, look! (She lifts up the roof, and the front panel falls revealing
the interior.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey, what&#146;s this?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, okay, it&#146;s the slide instead of stairs. Watch this. (She slides
a doll down the slide)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> It&#146;s very interesting, Phoebe.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What&#146;s this?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> The Licorice Room, you can eat all the furniture. And, when guests come
over, they can stay on the tootsie roll-away bed.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> This is the coolest house ever!!</p>

<p>(Monica is looking on with a hurt expression on her face.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey, does anybody want to join me in the aroma room? (lights some
incense)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> All right!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I would!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey, guys, guys, did you see my new, china cabinet?!</p>

<p><b>Ross and Rachel:</b> Uh-huh.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Watch, watch. (She turns a strand of Christmas lights strung around the
house.)</p>

<p><b>Ross and Rachel:</b> Ooohhhh!!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> And, and! (She turns on a bubble maker.)</p>

<p><b>Ross and Rachel:</b> Ahhhh!!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (entering) Hey, my Father&#146;s house does that!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (to Chandler) O-o-o-okay, how did it go? Tell me everything.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, the movie was great, dinner was great, and there&#146;s nothing
like a cool, crisp New York evening. </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hmm.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Of course, I didn&#146;t get to enjoy any of that, because
Joanna&#146;s such a <b>big, dull dud</b>!</p>

<p>[Scene: Rachel&#146;s office, Joanna&#146;s telling Rachel, her side of the story.]</p>

<p><b>Joanna:</b> Chandler is fantastic!!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Joanna:</b> Oh God, we just clicked! Y&#146;know how people just click? Like he came
by to pick me up, and I opened the door, and it was just like, click! Did he tell you?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, I....</p>

<p><b>Joanna:</b> Oh, and he&#146;s got such a good heart! Doesn&#146;t he have a good
heart?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, I know...</p>

<p><b>Joanna:</b> Oh, I know and he&#146;s soo sweet! Listen, he said he was going to
call, so put him straight through.</p>

<p><b>Sophie:</b> Isn&#146;t this great?!</p>

<p><b>Joanna:</b> Don&#146;t spoil it.</p>

<p>[Scene: The Theatre, Joey and Kate are rehearsing.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Come on baby, don&#146;t go. Please? What do you say?</p>

<p>[A phone rings.]</p>

<p><b>The Director:</b> (answering the phone) Hello. Oh! It&#146;s you. Just ah, just
one-one sec. (to Joey and Kate) I am going to take this call. When I continue, I hope that
there will appear on stage this magical thing that in the theatre we call, <b>committing
to the moment</b>! (He goes to take the call.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (to Kate) That guy&#146;s like a cartoon. What do you see in him anyway?</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> He happens to be brilliant. Which is more than I can say for that sweater
you&#146;re dating.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey, I&#146;m not interested in her sweater! It&#146;s what&#146;s
underneath her sweater that counts. And besides, since ah, since when do you care who
I&#146;m going out with?</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> I don&#146;t care. Why, do you want me to care?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Do you want me to want you to care?</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> Do you?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>The Director:</b> (returning) Okay, I&#146;m afraid to say this, but let&#146;s pick
it up where we left off.</p>

<p>[They resume rehearsing.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Come on baby, don&#146;t go. Please? What do you say?</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> I&#146;ve got no reason to stay. </p>

<p>(Joey grabs her and kisses her.)</p>

<p><b>The Director:</b> Stop!! Stop it! You must stop! You are bad actors! This is a
terrible play! I&#146;ll see you in the morning. (exits)</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> I can&#146;t believe we go on in, in a week.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey, it&#146;s gonna be all right.</p>

<p><b>Lauren:</b> (to Joey) Hey! So since we&#146;re getting off early, do you want to go
and paint mugs?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Lauren:</b> You know! At the place I told you about last night?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, yeah, with the mug painting. Yeah. I was so listening to that. But ah,
y'know what, I think I kinda need to work on my stuff tonight.</p>

<p><b>Lauren:</b> Oh, okay.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay. (he gives her a peck on the cheek)</p>

<p><b>Lauren:</b> I&#146;ll see you tomorrow. (she kisses him full on the mouth.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Lauren:</b> G&#146;night. (exits)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (to Kate) Ah, are you okay?</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> Yeah, I guess. Look, what are we gonna do about this scene, huh?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I don&#146;t know.</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> Well umm, maybe if it had more heat.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> How do you mean?</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> Well, Adrian&#146;s looking for a reason to stay, right? Victor can&#146;t
just kiss her, he&#146;s gotta, gotta really give her a reason, y'know?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Maybe he could slip her the tongue.</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> Or maybe, maybe he could grab her, and, and, and, and lift her up.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, yeah, and then Adrian, she maybe she could wrap her legs around his
waist.</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> And then she could rip off his shirt and kiss his chest, and, and his
stomach!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> And then, then he could use his teeth, his teeth to undo her dress, and,
and, and bite her!</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> And then right, right when the scene ends, he could take her with this
raw, animal....</p>

<p>[cut to Joey&#146;s bedroom, Joey and Kate are emerging from under the covers.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Something like that?</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> Yeah, that&#146;s pretty much what I had in mind.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p align="center"><b>Commercial Break</b></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross and Monica are eating breakfast as Joey enters, very
happily.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (to Ross) Hey.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hi.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (to Monica) Hey. </p>

<p>(He walks up behind Monica and gives her a big hug and a kiss on the neck.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hi.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey.</p>

<p>(He walks over behind Ross, thinks about it for a moment, and gives him a big hug.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> It&#146;s a little early to be drinkin&#146;.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No-no, things ah, finally happened with Kate.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Ohhhhh!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You&#146;re kidding?! That&#146;s great!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, it was so amazing. After the (pause) love making...</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh my.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yep. I just, I just watched her sleep for like hours, just breathing in
and breathing out. And then I knew she was dreaming &#145;cause, &#145;cause her eyes keep
going like this. (He closes his eyes and moves them around, kinda like he&#146;s been
processed by the devil, or something.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (entering with Rachel) I&#146;m telling ya, Joanna&#146;s got it all
wrong. Okay? All I said was, &#145;This was fun. Let&#146;s do it again sometime.
I&#146;ll give you a call.&#146;</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ohh, gee. I wonder why she thinks you&#146;re going to call her?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> That&#146;s what you say at the end of a date.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You can&#146;t just say, &#145;Nice to meet you, good night?&#146;</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> To her face? Look it&#146;s the end of the date, I&#146;m standing
there, I know all she&#146;s waiting for is for me to say &#145;I&#146;ll call her&#146;
and it&#146;s just y'know, comes out. I can&#146;t help it, it&#146;s a compulsion.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Come on Rach, when a guy says he&#146;s going to call, it doesn&#146;t
mean he&#146;s going to call. Hasn&#146;t it ever happened to you?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, they always called.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hmm, bite me.</p>

<p>[Scene: Rachel&#146;s office.]</p>

<p><b>Joanna:</b> (entering) Did he call?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No. Sorry.</p>

<p><b>Joanna:</b> Why?! Why?! He said he&#146;d call. Why hasn&#146;t he called?</p>

<p><b>Sophie:</b> Maybe he&#146;s intimated by really smart, strong, successful women.</p>

<p><b>Joanna:</b> Sophie, would you please climb out of my butt. Why hasn&#146;t he
called, Rachel? Why?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, okay. Umm, well ah, maybe he, maybe he feels awkward because you
are my boss.</p>

<p><b>Joanna:</b> Awkward? Why should he feel awkward?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well...</p>

<p><b>Joanna:</b> The only person that should feel awkward is you, and you didn&#146;t
tell him not to call me, did you?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No. I...</p>

<p><b>Joanna:</b> Because if you feel uncomfortable with your friend dating someone you
work for, there are always ways to fix...that.</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Chandler is reading a magazine as Rachel approaches.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (grabbing the magazine out of his hands) Call her! Call her now!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Multiple, so many paper cuts.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Why hasn&#146;t he called Rachel? Why? Why? I don&#146;t understand.
Why? He said he&#146;ll call. Why? Why? Chandler I&#146;m telling you she has flipped out,
she&#146;s gone crazy!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (sarcastic) Oh, well give me the phone then.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Come on, this isn&#146;t funny. She thinks it&#146;s my fault that you
haven&#146;t called her. You have to call her!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Look, you can&#146;t call somebody after this long just to say,
&#145;In case you didn&#146;t notice, I don&#146;t like you!&#146;</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well then you&#146;re going to have to take her out again.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Nooo!! She&#146;s really dull! And she gets this gross mascara goop
thing in the corner of her eye!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I don&#146;t care! I don&#146;t care! You are going to have to take her
out again and end it, and end it in way that she knows it&#146;s actually ended. And, I
don&#146;t care how hard it is for you, do not tell her that you will call her again!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All right! Fine! But it&#146;s just a lunch date, no more than an
hour! And from now on I get my own dates, I don&#146;t want you setting me up with anybody
ever again!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> That&#146;s fine!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> That&#146;s just a lot of big talk, y'know.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I know.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross is entering.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Mon?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (from the bathroom) I&#146;m in the shower!</p>

<p>[He closes the door and walks over to get something from the fridge. He starts to smell
something and turns around to see Phoebe&#146;s dollhouse smoking. He runs over and takes
off the roof to reveal that the dollhouse fire.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, fire! There, there&#146;s a fire! Fire!!</p>

<p>[He tries to blow it out, and obviously, it doesn&#146;t work. He runs over to the sink
to get a glass of water to put out the fire, but since Monica is in the shower the water
pressure is very low and takes a long time to fill the glass. In desperation he takes the
half full glass over and dumps it on the fire, it doesn&#146;t work. He then picks up the
dollhouse and considers bringing it over to the sink, but decides to take it into the
bathroom and use the shower to put it out. He kicks open the door and we hear Monica
scream at the top of her lungs.]</p>

<p>[Scene: The Theatre, Kate is arriving for rehearsal.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> Hi.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> So I ah, talked to Lauren, kinda told her how things were with us. Did you
ah, did you talk to Marshall?</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> About what?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Y'know, about what happened with us.</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> Nooo. And there&#146;s really no reason he should find out, so ah
let&#146;s not make a big deal about it, okay?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What are you talking about? It was a big deal. I mean, come on you
can&#146;t tell me last night didn&#146;t mean something to you. I-I was there,
you&#146;re not that good an actress.</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> Look umm, I, I was, I was just caught up in the moment. That&#146;s all it
was. Joey, I&#146;m-I&#146;m sorry you feel bad, but haven&#146;t you ever sleep with a
women where it meant more to her than it did to you?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Nooo.</p>

<p><b>Lauren:</b> (entering) Hi, Kate!</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> Hi, Lauren.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hi, Lauren.</p>

<p><b>Lauren:</b> Hi, pig!</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Ross are inspecting the damage to the
dollhouse.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Sorry I ah, I scared you in there.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, that&#146;s okay. By the way, I was just checking the shower
massager.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (entering) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (runs over to her) I tried to reach you at work. There&#146;s....been a
fire.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What?! Oh my... (sees the remains of the house) Oh my God!! What
happened?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, we believe it originated here. (He uses a pointer and points to the
point of origin.) In the Aroma Room.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> All right. Did everyone get out okay?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well, the giraffe&#146;s okay. And so is the pirate.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ohh. What is this? (She sees a tissue covering something, and moves to
remove it.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No Phoebe, don&#146;t look! You don&#146;t want to see what&#146;s under
there!!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (She pauses to ready herself, and removes the tissue.) Ohh, the-the
Foster puppets! </p>

<p>(She picks up a charred piece of plastic that once was the Foster puppets, and starts
to break down. Monica goes over and comforts her.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Rachel&#146;s office, Chandler and Joanna are returning from their lunch date.
He is telling her about her mascara problem. Rachel is already there.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> It&#146;s not a big deal. It&#146;s, just it&#146;s right here,
(points to his eye) and it&#146;s all the time.</p>

<p><b>Joanna:</b> Well, thanks again for lunch.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (He looks over at Rachel, who nods her head) Yes, this, this was
pleasant.</p>

<p>(Rachel is slowing trying to leave and let them talk.)</p>

<p><b>Joanna:</b> It was, wasn&#146;t it?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> The food there was, was great.</p>

<p><b>Joanna:</b> Wasn&#146;t it?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> So take care.</p>

<p><b>Joanna:</b> You too.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, this was great. I&#146;ll give you a call. We should do it again
sometime. (Rachel is disappointed) </p>

<p><b>Joanna:</b> Great! I&#146;m looking forward to it. Rachel, any messages?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Sophie&#146;s desk.</p>

<p>(Chandler starts to leave ashamed of himself, but Rachel stops him in the hallway.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (whispering) Chandler!! Are you gonna call her!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Noo! </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Chandler!!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Look, I&#146;m sorry. Okay? I&#146;m weak, and pathetic, and sorry.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, you are going to tell her and you&#146;re going to tell her now.
(She grabs his nipple and starts to twist it.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Ahhhh&#151;I&#146;m not going to call you.</p>

<p><b>Joanna:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I&#146;m sorry. I&#146;m-I&#146;m-I&#146;m sorry that I said I was
going to when I&#146;m not. Look, this has nothing to do with you, y'know? And this
isn&#146;t Rachel&#146;s fault. It&#146;s me. I have serious, serious problems when it
comes to women. I have issues with commitment, intimacy, (pause) mascara goop. And
I&#146;m really sorry, it&#146;s just that this is not, this isn&#146;t going to work out.</p>

<p><b>Joanna:</b> Well, this isn&#146;t how I was hoping how this would end, but I guess I
have to appreciate your honesty.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, o-okay.</p>

<p><b>Joanna:</b> So...</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well this is great! I&#146;ll give you a call! We should do it again
sometime!</p>

<p>(Rachel is shocked, and holds her arms out in disbelief.)</p>

<p align="center"><b>Closing Credits</b></p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is talking on the phone.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (on phone) Well, so anyway Beth, what I&#146;m saying is I should&#146;ve
considered your feelings before I went home with you that night. I&#146;ve ah, I&#146;ve
recently learned what&#146;s it like to be on your side of it, and I&#146;m sorry. So, do
you think you can forgive me? (listens) Great. Thanks. Okay, bye. (He sits down and
crosses out something, and dials the phone again.) Hello, Jennifer? (listens) Oh hi, Mrs.
Loreo, is Jennifer there? (listens) Oh, she&#146;s not home huh? (listens) Well ah,
actually I kinda need to talk to you too.</p>

<p align="center"><b>End</b></p>
</body>

321<html>

<head>
<title>The One With A Chick. And A Duck</title>
</head>

<body TEXT="#000000" BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK="#008000" VLINK="#000000" ALINK="#FFFF00">

<h1 ALIGN="CENTER">The One With A Chick. And A Duck</h1>

<hr>

<p>Written by: Chris Brown<br>
Transcribed by: <a HREF="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a> </p>

<hr>

<p align="left">[Scene: Outside Central Perk, Rachel and Phoebe are helping Monica learn
how to roller skate by rolling her between themselves.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> So who&#146;s idea was it to put everybody in the diner on skates?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, some idiot customer put a suggestion in the suggestion box.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh my God, they took my idea!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> That was you?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah! Okay, here you go. (rolls her back to Rachel)</p>

<p><b>Gunther:</b> (bringing Rachel a mug) Rachel, I made you a cocoa. </p>

<p>[He distracts her from catching Monica and Monica slams into her, knocking her down.
Monica then falls on top of her.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh my God, are you guys okay?</p>

<p><b>Gunther:</b> Are you all right?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (leaving Central Perk and seeing Monica laying on top of Rachel who is
moaning in pain.) Oh my.</p>

<p>(They both turn and give him a dirty look.)</p>

<p align="center"><b>Opening Credits</p>

<p></b>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is watching <i>Quincy M.E.</i> as Chandler is
walking into the living room from his bedroom.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (sporting a goatee) Hey.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey. Y'know with that goatee you kinda look like Satan.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, so that&#146;s why the priest threw holy water on me.
(there&#146;s no reaction from Joey) Okay, listen, <b>you</b> have to cheer up! Okay? You
should come out with Ross and me, I mean anything is better than sitting around here
crying all day about Kate.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey I was crying because, because nobody believed Quincy&#146;s theory.
Okay?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (entering) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (triumphantly) I&#146;m gonna be on TV!!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No way!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah! They&#146;re putting together this panel to talk about these fossils
they just found in Peru and <i>The Discovery Channel&#146;s</i> gonna film it!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh my God! Who&#146;s gonna watch that?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Thanks. You ready to go?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah. (they start to leave)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Saw a girl with that vest.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Thanks. (He takes off the vest and throws it on the floor.)</p>

<p><b>Anchorwoman:</b> (on TV) While most of us think of chocolate bunnies and baskets as
traditional Easter gifts. Some people insist on giving live chicks as presents. (Joey is
intrigued by the idea) Unfortunately, the sad fact remains that most of these little guys
won&#146;t live to see the fourth of July. (Joey starts to call a place to buy a little
baby chick) Because of as a result of improper care, they will be dead.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (on phone) Yeah, hi. You guys got any of those baby chicks? &#145;Cause I
was watching this ah, commercial on TV and man, those guys are cute!</p>

<p>[Scene: The Moondance Diner, Pete is entering, Monica is on roller skates.]</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hi! Hey, Pete you&#146;re back! Hey, check this out. (She starts to
