skate over to him)</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Wow! Skates! </p>

<p>(She gets just about all the way over to him and falls into his arms.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Wow! You&#146;re a lot sturdier that Chandler. He crumpled like a piece
of paper. So how was you&#146;re trip?</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Well... (he holds up a gift he brought her)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, what&#146;d ya bring me?! (She opens the gift) Awww, hotel
toiletries from Japan. Oh, these are gonna go in my permanent collection. You want some
coffee?</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Yeah, sure, that&#146;d be great.</p>

<p>(She starts to go and get the coffee and falls behind the counter.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (popping back up) Regular or decaf?</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Ah, which ever is closest. </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay. (hands him a cup)</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> So ask me what I did today.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> So what did you do today Pete?</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> I bought a restaurant and I would like you to be the head chef.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What?! Oh.(She turns around quickly and falls)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is telling Rachel about Pete&#146;s offer.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Can you believe he just offered me a restaurant?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What a jerk! You want me to kick his ass?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I mean this has been like my dream since I got my first Easy Bake Oven
and opened Easy Monica&#146;s Bakery. I mean I would kill for this job. I mean I can
totally do this job, and God knows I paid my dues. (She removes her fake breasts) But
Pete&#146;s just doing this because he has a crush on me.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> And you&#146;re still not attracted to him at all?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hmm, no. I mean how can I accept a restaurant from him? I-I-I-I
can&#146;t. I couldn&#146;t even accept a necklace from Stu Vincent in the seventh grade.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, but Mon that&#146;s totally different. He was you&#146;re health
teacher.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, please. </p>

<p>(She slaps Rachel&#146;s side and Rachel screams in pain.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What? Honey.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, I am, my side still hurts from when you crashed into me yesterday.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh God, I&#146;m so sorry.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I know. </p>

<p>(Monica hugs her goes and hugs her)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ow!!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh God!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (entering, wearing a white suit with a little red bow tie) Hey, you guys!
Guess what?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (looking at the outfit) Got a job on a river boat?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Y'know what I didn&#146;t wear this suit for a year because you hated it.
Well, guess what? You&#146;re not my girlfriend anymore so...</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh I see, so this suit is making a point.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Right.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Now that you&#146;re on you&#146;re own, you&#146;re free to look as
stupid as you like.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (to Monica) You like it right?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh absolutely. I like it even more on you than I did on Colonel Sanders.
(Ross starts to leave) Ross! Ross! I&#146;m kidding!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, come here!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What-what was it you were gonna tell us? </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah. Oh! Was how you invented the cotton gin?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, good bye! (leaves)</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is talking to Phoebe about her suggestion.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> So um, after you put the suggestion in the box, how long did it take
for the roller skating thing to happen.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Umm, oh, about three months.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, so I guess that&#146;s about ah, two weeks before the topless
thing kicks in.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (entering carrying a box) Hey!!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I got you something! Open it! Open it!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay. (He opens it and it&#146;s a baby chick) It&#146;s a chicken.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> It&#146;s cute, huh?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Whoa-whoa-whoa, you guys, do you know anything about chicks?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Fowl? No. Women? Nooo.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, well they are a huge responsibility, especially at this age. They
require constant care. They-they need just the right food, and lot&#146;s and lot&#146;s
of love.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, well no problem there. (He picks up the chick, hugs it really tight,
and talks to it like it&#146;s a little baby.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Easy Lenny.</p>

<p>[Scene: The Moondance Diner, Pete is talking to Monica about the restaurant.]</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> So? I mean have you thought about it?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay. Here&#146;s the thing.</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Oh no, not the thing. I hate the thing. What&#146;s the thing?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I can&#146;t do it. I&#146;m sorry, I wish I could, but umm, see you
have these feelings for me....</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Wait, wait, wait, wait, that&#146;s-that&#146;s what you&#146;re worried
about? If that&#146;s the problem, we&#146;ve got no problem.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Huh?</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> No! Look, I was gonna tell you this over dinner, but I met somebody else.
On my trip.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh?</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Her name&#146;s Ann, she&#146;s a journalist. Ahh, we met on the plane.
She asked me if she could finish off my peanuts, I thought she said something else, we had
a big laugh. Yeah, I just, I mean I got, I got tired of waiting.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, that&#146;s great! I mean I&#146;m-I&#146;m sorry, but I&#146;m so
happy for you. And now I can work for you!</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> I guess you can.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh my God! Oh, this is incredible! Ohh! (she rolls over and kisses him
on the cheek) All right, y'know what? I&#146;m just gonna roll right into that office
and-and quit!</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> All right.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay. (she gets ready to go) Can you give me a little push?</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Yeah, sure. Good luck!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (rolling towards the office) I&#146;m quitting!! Woo-hoo! (She rolls
through a doorway and out of sight. We then hear a big crash, and see Monica roll past the
door the other way.) I&#146;m okay!! I&#146;m all right!!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (to Pete) Wow! That&#146;s exciting, you went to Japan, made up a woman.</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I&#146;m just saying, this woman, I mean she&#146;s fictitious. No?</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Why would you say that?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> &#145;Cause you&#146;re still into Monica. So you told her there was
somebody else so she would agree to work with you, so &#145;cause you figure oh if you
spent a lot of time together, maybe something might happen, and...</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> You&#146;re good. You&#146;re good!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, no, I&#146;m fairly intuitive and psychic. It&#146;s a substantial
gift.</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Listen, can you promise me that you won&#146;t tell her though?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Absolutely, oh I promise. Tell her what?</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Thanks a lot.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No I&#146;m serious. I mean I&#146;m intuitive, but my memory sucks.</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is baby-chick sitting.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, but this is the last time. (singing) With a chick-chick here,
and a chick-chick there. Here a chick, there a chick, everywhere a chick-chick-(Joey
enters)-chickeeeen.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> How&#146;s she doing?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> She?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well yeah, don&#146;t-don&#146;t you think it&#146;s a she?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I don&#146;t know. (He picks the chick up and turns it over, trying to
determine the sex of the chick, and blows on it.) I can&#146;t tell, what ever it was went
back in too quickly.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, anyway, I got to go change, I&#146;m ah, meeting some of the cast
for drinks.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Excuse me?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I stayed home from work today while you were at rehearsal so somebody
could be here with our chick!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey! Who was up from 2 o&#146;clock this morning until 5 o&#146;clock this
morning trying to get her back to sleep?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You don&#146;t think I get up when you get up?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ohhh, here it comes.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes, here it comes! I&#146;m stuck here all day, and then you come in
and spend two seconds with us and then expect to go off gallivanting with your friends?
Well I don&#146;t think so mister!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey!! I need to relax! Okay? I was working all day!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> And you don&#146;t think taking care of our chick is work?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> That&#146;s not what I said. Okay, I just meant...</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I know what you meant!! (pause) You notice that ever since we got this
chick, we&#146;ve been fighting a lot more than we used too?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I don&#146;t know, maybe we weren&#146;t ready to have a chick.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I&#146;ll take her back tomorrow.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Do you think we&#146;ll get our three bucks back?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (entering carrying a garment bag) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (sees the chick) Ohhh, hey! All right, listen, I-I have that TV thing in
like two hours, and I need your help, okay? What do you think? (takes out two suits) This
blue suit, or this brown one?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, the brown one brings out your eyes, but your butt looks great in the
blue one.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Really? (Joey gives him a &#145;Like I would know&#146; look)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is trying to take some aspirin.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (she reaches for the bottle) Oww! (She grabs the bottle, but has trouble
opening it. She pops the top off and aspirins fly all over the place as Ross enters.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Wow! That aspirin dance really works!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (She bends over to try and pick up the aspirin) Oww!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh my God, is that still...</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I&#146;m fine, I&#146;m fine.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No you&#146;re not.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yes I am! </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Rach!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Look, I&#146;m fine. Watch. (She picks up an aspirin between her toes)
Look at that. (She lifts her leg to grab the aspirin with her hand and almost falls over.)
Whoa-whoa!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (stopping her from falling) Okay, okay. Look, you have got to go to a
doctor! Okay?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No. I have <b>got</b> to get ready and go to a dinner at my bosses
house. It&#146;s a very big deal, there&#146;s a lot of people there I have to meet.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> And I&#146;m sure you&#146;re gonna make a big impression. Hi! I&#146;m
Rachel Green. It&#146;s nice to meet you. (He lifts his leg and imitates shaking hands
with it, just like how Rachel was trying to pick up the aspirin with her feet.) Come on,
you probably have a broken rib!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, I will go to the hospital tomorrow, it&#146;ll still be broken
then.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Rach...</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> But y'know, I could use a hand getting ready.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Rachel...</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Look, either help me or go.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Fine. I&#146;ll go.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (with a hurt expression on her face) Okay, but before you go, could you
help me first?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (He checks his watch) Sure. I&#146;ll help you.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (rushing in) Oh, good! Good! Do you guys know how to get a chick out
of a VCR?!</p>

<p align="center"><b>Commercial Break</p>

<p></b>[Scene: Rachel&#146;s bedroom, Rachel is trying to put on eye liner with her left
hand, as Ross is setting out her shoes.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (She drops the brush) Y'know what? I cannot do this with my left hand!
Would you please, help me with this too?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Ohh. (He drops the shoes, takes the brush from her, and licks the tip. He
doesn&#146;t like how it tastes.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (taking the brush back) Okay. Let&#146;s use this brush. (Hands him
another one.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay. This stuff? </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> All right.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Careful. Light. Okay, do you know how, just sweep it across the lid.
Okay? Just sweep it.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oke-dokey. (He pokes her in the eye with the brush.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh-ho!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Sorry.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hey! That&#146;s just poking me in the eye!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Sorry, I&#146;m sorry. Close, close, close...</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, just sweep it.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I&#146;m sweeping...</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Right.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Sweep, sweep....(He starts to paint it on her eye, making it look like she
has a black eye.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, now make it even, &#145;cause we don&#146;t...</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What? What?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> We don&#146;t want it-it to be too much, we want it to be subtle.</p>

<p>(Of course it&#146;s too late for that.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No. No, y'know you don&#146;t, you don&#146;t wear enough of this. (Rachel
is shocked) What?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Since when, since when do you think I don&#146;t wear enough of this?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well I, close your eyes, I just think you&#146;re gonna like this a little
better, &#145;cause, close-close... (He gets some more on the brush)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Blow it.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (blows it) Sorry. &#145;Cause umm, I think this will make you a little
more sophisticated.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Sophisticated like a hooker?</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Monica is entering, Phoebe is already there.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey! </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey, guess what I&#146;m doing tonight.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I&#146;m checking out the restaurant with Pete.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ohh, Monica, I am so excited for you.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I know.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ooh, I have to tell you something.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> But I can&#146;t tell you.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay, but wouldn&#146;t it be easier if you had to tell me something
that you could tell me.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, sure in a perfect world. But, no, I promised I wouldn&#146;t tell,
and I swore to like all my gods.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay. Does it have to do with Ross and Rachel?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Does it have to do with Joey?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Does it have to do with-with Chandler and that sock that he keeps by his
bed?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, but let&#146;s come back to that later!</p>

<p>[Scene: Rachel&#146;s Bedroom, Ross is finishing up her make-up.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> There you go! Good enough for your party, huh?</p>

<p>(She turns and looks in the mirror, and it&#146;s way, way over done. She looks like
she has two black eyes.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Sure.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yep?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Sure, I&#146;ll just sit next to the trans-sexual from purchasing.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, come on! All right, I gotta go! So good luck at the party. Okay?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh wait, Ross, would you just stay and help me get dressed?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (checks his watch) Sure, okay.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay. Okay, great! Umm, okay, just turn around.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I don&#146;t want you to see me naked!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Rachel, I&#146;ve seen you naked a million times. I ate hot fudge off you
naked. Remember, I-I sucked that mini-marshmallow out of your belly button?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, but that was different. Y&#146;know? I mean, we were, we were
going out then, now I think it&#146;s weird.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Rach, y'know I can see you naked any time I want.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> All I have to do is close my eyes. See? (closes his eyes) Woo-hoo!!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ross! Stop that!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Ah, I&#146;m sorry.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Come on! I don&#146;t want you thinking of me like that any more!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Ahh, sorry, nothing you can do about it. It&#146;s one of my ah, rights as
the ex-boyfriend. (closes his eyes again) Oop, oh yeah!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Stop it! Cut it out! Cut it out!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, okay, I&#146;m sorry, it will never happen... (closes eyes) Uh-oh!
Wait a minute! Wait-wait, now there are a hundred of you and I&#146;m the king. </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Rosss...</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Come on, would you grow up? It&#146;s no big deal.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> All right. (She starts to take off her robe) Fine.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yowzah!!!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> O-kay!! See what you did, I&#146;m gonna be doing it by myself now.
Okay? </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Aww, come on.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> That&#146;s it. (She crawls onto the bed) Ow!!! </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh my God!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh-ow!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> All right.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ow!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Look...</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ow!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ow!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Rach?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ow! Ow!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Easy. Easy. You have to go to the hospital. Okay?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, I do. </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I really do.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, I&#146;m gonna get your coat and then I&#146;ll-I&#146;ll put you in
a cab.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay. Oh wait, wait-wait, you&#146;re not gonna come with me?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (He thinks about it) Of course I am. I just have to make a call.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay? (goes into the living room)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Thank you. (She goes to take off her make-up and screams in pain)
Oww!!!! God!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (rushing back in) What?! I wh-, what&#146;s wrong?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I&#146;m sorry, I just can&#146;t go to the hospital lookin&#146; like
this.</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Monica is trying to find out what Phoebe won&#146;t tell her.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Does it involve travel?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Noo!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Does it involve clogs?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, wait, wait. Clogs, or claws?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Clogs.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Claws?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay, so it doesn&#146;t involve Ross or Rachel or Chandler or Joey.
But, what about Pete?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (Shaking her head yes) No!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What is it?! What about Pete?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I don&#146;t know! (frantically points at Monica)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay, I feel like I&#146;m talking to Lassie. All right, Phoebe would
you just tell me!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I can&#146;t!!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay, I gotta go. (gets up)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I, but you&#146;re so close! No!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay, does it involve something to do with Pete&#146;s computer company?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, just go. You&#146;re never gonna get it!</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is watching <i>Baywatch</i> with the baby chick.
He&#146;s on one leather chair, the chick is on the other. It&#146;s watching Yasmine
Bleeth run and is chirping.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I know. See, yes. That&#146;s Yasmine Bleeth, she&#146;s a completely
different kind of chick. I love you both. But in very different ways.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (entering) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (sees he&#146;s watching <i>Baywatch</i>) Ohhh. (sees he still has the
chick) Ahh! What are you doing?! I thought you were gonna take her back to the store
today.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I did! But the store wouldn&#146;t take her back! So then I took her
to the shelter, and you know what I found out? </p>

<p>(Joey wants to know, but Chandler doesn&#146;t want to discuss it by the chick, so he
and Joey move over to the windows and away from the chick.) </p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> If they can&#146;t find a home for her, they kill her! And I&#146;m
not gonna let that happen to little Yasmine!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay, good, good, good, &#145;cause, good, &#145;cause I was kinda having
second thoughts too. </p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay. And it&#146;s not just chicks y'know? It&#146;s all kinds of
other animals!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> That&#146;s horrible! Well, you did the right thing man.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Thanks, I&#146;m glad you see it that way.</p>

<p>(He hear a duck start quacking, and see it waddle into the living room from the
bathroom. Joey wants to know what&#146;s with the duck.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Ohhh-hoo, funny story!</p>

<p>[Scene: Pete&#146;s Restaurant&#146;s Kitchen, Pete is showing Monica around the
kitchen.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I don&#146;t believe this! Wow, look at this refrigerator! It&#146;s
gigantic! I mean I could live in this thing! I&#146;d be cold, but I&#146;m always cold.
Oh my God, look at these spider burners! I love spider burners.</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> So you like it?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, it is sooo perfect. Thank you so much. (runs over and hugs him)</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Oh, you&#146;re welcome. (He takes a deep breath)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Did you just smell my hair?</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Nooo. Uh-huh, no way. What? No.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh God.</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You still have feelings for me don&#146;t you?</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Now, nooo! I&#146;m just excited about the restaurant, that&#146;s all.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Pete.</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Okay, I love you. Is that so bad?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No, it&#146;s not bad. It&#146;s not bad at all. It&#146;s-it&#146;s
really nice.</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Look, the only who stands to get hurt is me. And I&#146;m okay with that.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You may be okay about getting hurt, but I am not okay with being the one
who hurts you. That&#146;s why I can&#146;t take this job.</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> And well, we probably shouldn&#146;t see each other anymore. I&#146;m
sorry.</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Okay, yeah. I mean... If that&#146;s, if that&#146;s really what you want,
okay.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay, bye. </p>

<p>(She kisses him on the cheek, and he kisses her back on the mouth.)</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> I&#146;m sorry things didn&#146;t work out...</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> All right shut up for a second and let me just see something. (She
kisses him back on the lips) Oh, wow! (They then hug and kiss, very passionately.)</p>

<p>[Scene: The Hallway Between The Apartments, Ross and Rachel are coming back from the
hospital. Ross is helping her up the stairs.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, you&#146;d tell me the truth. Right?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Rach, you can&#146;t look fat in an x-ray.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay.</p>

<p>(As they approach the door, Chandler comes out carrying his duck.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay! Now you stay out here, and you think about what you did!!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (to Chandler) That&#146;s a duck.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> That&#146;s a bad duck!!! (to Ross) How&#146;d the thing go tonight,
Ross?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, it was, nah, well....</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What thing? What thing?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Nothing, ah there was this thing at the museum. Come on. (they go into her
apartment) Easy.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (to the duck) Okay, now when you come back I hope you remember that,
that chick is not a toy! (He goes back into the apartment)</p>

<p>[cut to inside Monica and Rachel&#146;s]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What thing? What is this thing?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I was kinda, supposed to be on TV tonight for <i>The Discovery Channel</i>.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh my God! </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ross, why didn&#146;t you tell me that?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Eh, &#145;cause I knew that if I told you, you&#146;d make me go, and I
knew you needed someone to be with you tonight. Come on. Come on.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I cannot believe you.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> That is the sweetest thing, I just....</p>

<p>(They both look at each other for a while)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (breaking the silence) You should get some sleep.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> So, I&#146;ll umm...</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, I&#146;m sorry I spoiled you&#146;re evening.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, that&#146;s, no, as long as you&#146;re okay. So I&#146;ll ah,
I&#146;ll see you tomorrow.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Um-hmm, yeah.</p>

<p>(He leaves)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (After he closes the door) See ya.</p>

<p>(In the hallway, Ross all dejected, sits down on the step.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (coming out of his apartment and seeing Ross) What did you do?</p>

<p align="center"><b>Closing Credits</p>

<p></b>[Scene: Chandler and Joey&#146;s Bathroom: Chandler is watching the duck swim in
the bathtub.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What &#145;cha doing?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Having a swim.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What about the chick?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Chicks don&#146;t swim.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Are you sure?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I don&#146;t know. Should we try it?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Sure.</p>

<p>(Chandler picks up the chick and drops it in the water.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> See, I told you they don&#146;t swim. (He goes to take it out)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (stopping him) Wait. Give him a minute.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Noo! (takes him out) Oh, it&#146;s okay, it&#146;s okay, baby, baby,
baby.</p>

<p>(Joey picks up and turns on a hair dryer.)</p>

<p align="center"><b>End</b></p>
</body>
</html>
322<html>

<head>
<title>The One With The Screamer</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="white" text="black" link="green" vlink="black" alink="yellow">

<h1 align="center">The One With The Screamer</h1>

<hr align="center">

<p>Written by: Scott Silveri &amp; Shana Goldberg-Meehan<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a></p>

<hr>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe is on the phone, Chandler and Monica are sitting in
the living room, and Ross is in the kitchen as Rachel enters from her bedroom.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, Phoebe, are you still on hold? I was supposed to call my Dad back
like two hours ago.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, yeah, he clipped on, he said call him as soon as you get a chance,
he&#146;s at Flimby&#146;s.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What&#146;s Flimby&#146;s?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, yeah, that&#146;s the word I use when I can&#146;t remember the real
thing.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay. Hang up! That&#146;s it! Come on!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No! Rachel, that&#146;s what they want me to do. My warranty expires
tomorrow, if I don&#146;t get through, they&#146;re not gonna fix my crappy, broken phone
for free! We cannot let them win! It&#146;s us versus them!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Ye-e-es!!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (entering) Hey.</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Hey. </p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Uh, listen I gotta double check for tickets tonight. Who-who got what?</p>

<p><b>Chandler, Phoebe, and Rachel:</b> I had one.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I need two. I&#146;m bringing Pete. My boyfriend. I have a boyfriend
now!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Two it is. Ross, how about you?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Uh, yeah, I ah, I also need two.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Really? Who&#146;s number two?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Who&#146;s number two? One of the more difficult games sewer workers
play.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Uh, no, it&#146;s-it&#146;s just this person.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Like a date type (looks at Rachel) person?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, kinda. It&#146;s this woman from work. I hope that won&#146;t be too
weird. Will it, Rach?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No. No, not at all, not at all. I actually was gonna bring someone
myself, so&#133;</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> But you said one.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I meant, me plus one!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay. (to Phoebe and Chandler) Did ah, you guys mean you plus one?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> All right, I&#146;ll see you tonight.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, bye-bye!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Bye!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Bye-bye!</p>

<p>(Ross exits)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, I need a date! (runs to her bedroom)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, hey, you guys are finally gonna get to meet Kate!</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Oh!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (to Chandler) And I ah, borrowed some of your cologne. I hope she likes
it.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Joey, what are you doing?! It&#146;s never gonna happen, she&#146;s
seeing somebody.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, and I don&#146;t have any cologne.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> The green bottle next to the shaving cream.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh! Worm medicine for the duck.</p>

<p>(In horror, Joey wipes his neck and smells it.)</p>

<p align="center"><b>Opening Credits</b></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is getting ready to go to Joey&#146;s premiere and
Phoebe is still on hold.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (to Phoebe) Here you go. You can wear this. (hands her a sweater)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Thanks!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Uh-huh.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay. (on phone) Ooh, I&#146;m setting the phone down. (does so) But
I&#146;m still here! Just don&#146;t go anywhere I&#146;m still here. (starts to put on
the sweater) Don&#146;t-don&#146;t switch or anything, &#145;cause I&#146;m, I&#146;m
right here. (She has pulled the sweater over her head, but her head is stuck in a sleeve.)
Just one sec. One sec! One second!! (She is now frantically trying to get the sweater on,
as Monica returns from the bathroom.) Wait! One second! Just&#133;</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Phoebe?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What?! Monica, I&#146;m scared!!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> All right. Honey, that&#146;s-that&#146;s a sleeve. Okay? </p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> And! We also have speaker phone. (She turns on the speaker phone.)</p>

<p><b>Hold Voice:</b> Please, stay on the line. Your call is important to us.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay, wait, you gotta hang up &#145;cause we&#146;re gonna be late.</p>

<p>(Phoebe starts to hang up the phone, but&#133;)</p>

<p><b>Hold Voice:</b> Thank you for your patience, you&#146;re the next caller.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yes!! Yes!! I&#146;m the next caller! You were gonna have me hang up.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (entering, carrying the chick and duck) Hey! Can you take a duck and a
chick to the theatre? </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Of course not.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay. I just wanted them to hear it from somebody else.</p>

<p>[Scene: Joey&#146;s Premiere, Rachel is already there with her date, Tommy who's played
by Ben Stiller who will be in <em>There's Something About Mary</em> and <em>Meet The
Parents</em>, as Ross and his date, Cailin, arrive.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey, hey Rach!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, hi!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> How are you? (She goes to kiss him on the cheek, but stops because of
the dates and pats him on the shoulder.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Good.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> So it&#146;s looks like we&#146;re the first ones here.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, looks that way. First ones here! Wooo!!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yay!!</p>

<p>(An awkward silence follows.) </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh! Tommy, this is Ross. Ross, Tommy.</p>

<p><b>Tommy:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey. Oh, I&#146;m sorry, this is Cailin.</p>

<p>(They all try and shake hands at once. They end up criss-crossing they&#146;re arms to
shake each other&#146;s hand, and Ross says&#133;)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> And! Break!!</p>

<p>(Awkward laughter follows.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, uhh, I think I&#146;m going to run to the ladies room.</p>

<p><b>Tommy:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Cailin:</b> I&#146;ll join you.</p>

<p><b>Tommy:</b> I&#146;ll get our seats.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay. (The girls leave.) (to Tommy) So uh, well, this-this is uh, this is
awkward.</p>

<p><b>Tommy:</b> Yeah?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well y'know &#145;cause Rachel and I used to go out.</p>

<p><b>Tommy:</b> Oh, I didn&#146;t, I didn&#146;t know that.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh! Well then <b>this</b> is awkward. So what do you uh&#133;</p>

<p><b>Tommy:</b> I think we&#146;re here.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh! Yeah. </p>

<p><b>Tommy:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay. (sees two people sitting in their seats.) Uh, huh. Excuse me,
I&#146;m sorry, I-I think you may be in our seats.</p>

<p><b>Man:</b> Umm, no, I don&#146;t think so.</p>

<p><b>Tommy:</b> Can-can we take a look at your ticket?</p>

<p><b>Man:</b> Sure. (Hands him the ticket.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (looking at ticket) Yep! Yeah, see this says D-13, and uh&#133;</p>

<p><b>Man:</b> Oh, well I thought that ah&#133;</p>

<p><b>Tommy:</b> Oh, you thought, huh? Yeah, well that didn&#146;t really work out too
well for you did it you <b>idiot</b>!! What are you?! A moron!! Huh?! It says D-13! Okay?!
Look you&#146;re surrounded by even numbers!! Did that give you some clue?!</p>

<p><b>Man:</b> Uh, the usher told us to come&#133;</p>

<p><b>Tommy:</b> Oh! Oh! The usher must be right! What, with all that training they go
through! Get out!! (They start to leave.) Here! (He throws him back his ticket.) (to Ross,
calmly) Hey man, you want the aisle?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, I&#146;m good. (He sits down, stunned.)</p>

<p>[Scene: The Theatre, at the post premiere party. The gang is already there, except
Phoebe. Joey runs in.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (seeing Joey) There he is!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> There&#146;s our star!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> So, so, what&#146;d ya think?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Almost as good as that play with the two naked girls on the see-saw.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I-I wasn&#146;t in that.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I know.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (sees Kate) Oh-oh, hey-hey, Kate! Listen I want you to meet everybody.
Everybody, this is Kate.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>The Director:</b> (stepping in) Excuse me. Excuse me. (to Kate) Sweetheart! (Kisses
her.) Come! (They leave.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> So that&#146;s the girl you like.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (drags Chandler over to buffet table) I&#146;m telling you, this guy
Rachel is with is crazy! Okay? He viscously screamed at total strangers! I think he&#146;s
baaad news!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Wait a minute, wait a minute, you <b>don&#146;t</b> like the guy
Rachel&#146;s dating? Well, that&#146;s odd.</p>

<p>[cut to Joey, Rachel, and Tommy.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, hey, Lauren. Uh, you guys this is, this is Kate&#146;s understudy,
Lauren.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, hi!</p>

<p><b>Lauren:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hey. Gosh, you look soo familiar.</p>

<p><b>Lauren:</b> Oh, yeah! I-I ran into you in the hallway in your building. It was right
after I slept with Joey. He dumped me the next day.</p>

<p>[cut to Monica, Pete, and Cailin]</p>

<p><b>Cailin:</b> So. How&#146;d you guys meet?</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Well ah, the short version is, I ah pursued her for a couple of months,
then I gave her a check for 20,000 dollars, and she was mine.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah, and in the long version, I dump him for telling people the short
version.</p>

<p>[cut to Joey as Estelle, Joey&#146;s agent, approaches]</p>

<p><b>Estelle:</b> Joey, sweetheart, you were fabulous! </p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey you guys, this is my agent, Estelle.</p>

<p><b>Estelle:</b> How do you do. (to Rachel and Monica) Ooh, you two girls were
outstanding! (to Joey) Did they have representation?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No, they-they weren&#146;t in the play.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> We&#146;re not actors.</p>

<p><b>Estelle:</b> Ooh, what a shame! Because with her face (points to Monica) and her
chest (points to Rachel) I could really put something together.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Could I borrow it?</p>

<p>[cut to later]</p>

<p><b>Cailin:</b> (to Ross) Hi! Remember me?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hi! Yeah! Tommy&#146;s in line for the bathroom and someone just cut in
front of him, I think he&#146;s gonna snap. (He&#146;s watching very intently)</p>

<p><b>Cailin:</b> Ross, I&#146;m gonna go.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Go? Why?</p>

<p><b>Cailin:</b> I don&#146;t know. Could be because I don&#146;t feel like standing
around all night waiting for some guy who <b>may</b> or may not scream.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> But-but Cailin, he definitely will scream.</p>

<p><b>Cailin:</b> Good bye Ross.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Uh, oh-ho bye.</p>

<p><b>The Director:</b> (entering carrying a newspaper) Here we go people! (starts reading
the review) Boxing Day! The Lucille Lortel Theatre, blah-la-la-la&#133; Ah-ha! Joey
Tribianni, gives an uneven performance, but Mr. Tribianni is not the worst thing in this
production.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yes!!! Ha-ha-ha!</p>

<p><b>The Director:</b> Kate Miller&#146;s awkward and mannered portrayal is laughable.
(Kate walks away depressed.) Badda-badda-badda. Ah-ha! Here it is! The direction by
Marshal Talmant is&#133; (stops, reads it again, and throws down the paper in disgust)
Thank you, boys and girls, you&#146;ve ruined my life. Please, stuff your talentless faces
with my Mother&#146;s crab cakes! (starts to leave) Excuse me!!</p>

<p>(Joey steps in a picks up the paper, the gang all look at him.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Anyone mind if I save this?</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Rachel are returning. Phoebe is <b>still</b> on
hold.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, is the play over?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah. Where were you?</p>

<p><b>Hold Voice:</b> Thank you for your patience, you&#146;re the next caller.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You were the next caller five hours ago. You must be going crazy.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Nah. I kept myself busy.</p>

<p>(Both Rachel and Monica walk into their bedrooms, stop, and come back into the living
room with confused looks on their faces.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, okay, yeah. (to Monica) I put your stuff in her room, and her stuff
in your room.</p>

<p>(They both look at each other, nod their heads &#145;All right&#146; and follow their
stuff into their new rooms.)</p>

<p>[Scene: The Theatre, after the party. Joey is trying to comfort Kate.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey! Are you okay?</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> Fabulous.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Listen, drama critics they&#146;re nothing but, but people who
couldn&#146;t make it as actors. You know what you should do?</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> Become a drama critic!</p>

<p><b>The Director:</b> (entering, drunk) I am hurt! (to Joey and Kate) A plague on both
your houses! (walks away)</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> By the way, he dumped me tonight after he read my review.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, classy. </p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> Yep! I sure know how to pick &#145;em, huh? Y'know I gave up a part on a
soap for this!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Wow! Yeah I ah, I gave up a job too.</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> Really. What?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Uh, de-clawing cats. Hey, tell ya what. Let me walk you home. We&#146;ll
stop by every news stand and burn every copy of their Times and the Post.</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> Why the Post?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, you didn&#146;t see the Post?</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> No. You?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No. Why?</p>

<p>[Scene: Kate&#146;s Apartment, Joey and Kate are returning from a night out on the
town.]</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> (drunk) So you really think those newspapers are just jealous of me?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, absolutely! You&#146;re talented and you&#146;re good looking.</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> Oh, you&#146;re sweet and cute.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I know! That&#146;s why they trashed me!</p>

<p>(They kiss.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Whoa. Wait a minute, wait a minute.</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I, I don&#146;t get you. I mean first, you hate me. Then you sleep with
me. Then you want nothing to do with me, now you want me again.</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> What? So you never went out with an actress before?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Kate, do you even like me?</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> Of course I do.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well so, how come you blew me off? Y'know? How come you were with him?</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> I don&#146;t know! I just, just do this! I-I always have to pick the like
the smartest guy, or-or the most talented guy&#133; Why can&#146;t I just pick someone
like you?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Thanks.</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> You know what I mean. I mean like the sweetest guy. Joey, you&#146;re just
so, you&#146;re so, so&#133; (She passes out and slumps against his shoulder.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (Checks to see if she&#146;s drooling on his shirt.) Okay. Okay, okay,
hey. (Lays her down and covers her with a blanket.) There we go, let&#146;s get your feet
up there. (Looks at her) Good night, Kate. Sweet dreams. (Picks up a garbage can) I&#146;m
gonna put this can right here in case you have to hurl.</p>

<p align="center"><b>Commercial Break</b></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the next morning, Phoebe is <b>STILL</b> on hold.]</p>

<p><b>Hold Voice:</b> Please stay on the line. You&#146;re call is very important to us.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (entering from her bedroom) Pheebs, you&#146;ve been up for 24 hours! Go
to sleep, honey. Th-this isn&#146;t healthy.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, no, I&#146;m fine, and y&#146;know why? &#145;Cause of all the
riboflavin.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (entering, happily) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey! Didn&#146;t you have that outfit on last night?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah! I stayed at Kate&#146;s, but ah, nothing happened. Hey, Pheebs,
where were ya?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I&#146;m so, so, so sorry, Joey. I definitely am gonna see you&#146;re
play. I swear you&#146;re play is very important to us, thank you for your patience.
You&#146;re play is the next play is the next play I&#146;m gonna see.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Anyway, how did it go with Kate?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, it was great! Yeah, I-I walked her home, and it was amazing how much
we connected, y'know? Then ah, then she passed out, but then she woke up. Yeah? And we
stayed up all night talking, and now we&#146;re like totally crazy about each other!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Joey, you had the night! </p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> When two people finally realise their feelings for each other, and-and
they talk for hours, and they-they learn all about the other person!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> You-you think?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Did you like learn about her family?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Two brothers, one died!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yes!!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah?!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh! (They hug, triumphantly.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Chandler and Monica are sitting on the couch, Rachel is on the
chair.]</p>

<p><b>Gunther:</b> (bringing Chandler a cup) This is from the woman at the bar.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh-ho-ho-ho. </p>

<p>(He turns and looks at her. The woman whispers something to Gunther; who comes back and
takes the mug away from Chandler.)</p>

<p><b>Gunther:</b> Sorry. She thought you were somebody else.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What time is it?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> One.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> One.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> 7:15. (Monica looks at him) Watch doesn&#146;t work.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Tommy&#146;s supposed to be here soon, we&#146;re going to lunch.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Look. Look, I wasn&#146;t going to say anything to you, but... All right,
I don&#146;t think you should be seeing Tommy anymore.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You don&#146;t?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No! The guy is mean. I mean really mean. I think you should stay away from
him.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Umm, <b>or</b>, maybe, I should stay away from all men.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, it&#146;s not just &#145;cause I&#146;m jealous. (Both Monica and
Chandler give him a &#145;Come on&#146; look) I mean I&#146;m not, I&#146;m not, I&#146;m
not jealous, okay? It&#146;s&#133; Look, the guy, he screamed, he actually screamed at
this couple sitting in our seats.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, and at the end of the play, he, he got up y'know, and he just
started like, (claps his hands) banging his hands together!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, fine, fine. You don&#146;t want to believe me? No, that&#146;s fine.
(starts to leave)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> We&#146;re kidding!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Ross, don&#146;t. Ross!</p>

<p><b>Monica;</b> Ross!</p>

<p>[cut to outside of Central Perk]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You don&#146;t want to believe me, I&#146;m Mr. Funny to you. Mr.
Funny&#133; (turns around and almost spills his coffee on Tommy) </p>

<p><b>Tommy:</b> Whoa!!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Whoa, sorry Tommy.</p>

<p><b>Tommy:</b> What&#146;s in the cup, Ross?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Umm&#133;</p>

<p><b>Tommy:</b> <b>What</b> is in the cup?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, it&#146;s coffee.</p>

<p><b>Tommy:</b> Ice coffee? Tell me it&#146;s ice coffee!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> It&#146;s-it&#146;s hot&#133;</p>

<p><b>Tommy:</b> Hot coffee!!! You idiot!! You were gonna spill hot coffee all over me,
huh?!! What are you just some big, dumb, stupid, doofy idiot, with a doofy idiot hairdo,
huh?! Huh?! </p>

<p>[cut to inside Central Perk, we see Ross quietly tapping on the window, desperately
trying to get the gang&#146;s attention, while Tommy is still screaming at him]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (not seeing Ross) What&#146;s your favourite thing about summertime?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Umm, going to the beach. When it stays light real late.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah&#133;</p>

<p><b>Tommy:</b> (entering, finished with yelling at Ross, who follows him in shell
shocked) (happily) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Tommyyyy! Say, what&#146;s your favourite thing about summer?</p>

<p><b>Tommy:</b> Ooh, I don&#146;t know. Probably the smell of freshly cut grass.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Ohh, that&#146;s a good one.</p>

<p>(Ross is having a fit, about how calm Tommy is now)</p>

<p>[Scene: Backstage at Joey&#146;s play, Joey is arriving, late.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Sorry! Sorry, I&#146;m late; sorry, I&#146;m late! My duck and my chick
and a fight, it-it was ugly.</p>

<p><b>Stage Manager:</b> Look, we held the curtain for you buddy. Come on, let&#146;s go!
Let&#146;s go!</p>

<p>[cut to onstage with Lauren standing in for Kate, the doorbell rings.]</p>

<p><b>Lauren:</b> (answering the door) Vic! Where have you been, baby?!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (surprised it&#146;s Lauren) (hugs her) (whispering) Where&#146;s Kate?</p>

<p><b>Lauren:</b> (whispering) She got a job in L.A.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (stunned) What?!</p>

<p><b>Lauren:</b> I&#146;ve been waiting up all night for ya. Where have you been? (Joey
doesn&#146;t answer) Where have you been? Vic?!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, ahh, go to the window. I&#146;m wanna run down to the truck and show
you something.</p>

<p><b>Lauren:</b> (at the window, she&#146;s looking down out of the window) What do you
got down there, Vic? What do you got under that tarp? </p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (grabs the window from the outside and sticks his head in) (whispering)
When is she leaving?</p>

<p><b>Lauren:</b> (whispering) Tonight. What are you doing?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (making like he is yelling up to the second floor) I&#146;m coming up!</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler and Ross are in the kitchen, Rachel and Monica
are sitting in the living room, and Phoebe is, you guessed it, still on hold.]</p>

<p><b>Tommy:</b> Hey, mind if I use the phone?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, I&#133; (starts jabbering incoherently)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Why don&#146;t you use ours across the hall, &#145;cause
she&#133;has&#133;problems.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (coming out of the kitchen with a cup of coffee, almost running into
Tommy) Oh-ho, whoa! Sorry, Tommy. I almost spilled this hot coffee on you.</p>

<p><b>Tommy:</b> Yeah, but you didn&#146;t.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, but it&#146;s-it&#146;s-it&#146;s hot!</p>

<p>(We see Tommy go into Joey and Chandler&#146;s apartment)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ross, would you just stop it! It&#146;s getting really old.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I can&#146;t believe no one believes me!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I do, I believe you.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You do Pheebs?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah. But I also believed her (points to the phone) when she said I was
next.</p>

<p>[cut to Chandler and Joey&#146;s apartment, Tommy is using the phone]</p>

<p><b>Tommy:</b> (noticing the chick) Ooh, hey! Hey, there little fella. (picks up the
chick) Mr. Fuzzy-Man, how are you doing? (starts to pet him) Aww. (The chick poops on his
hand.) Eww! Oh! Eww! Gross! Idiot!! Stupid little, fuzzy, yellow creature!! Oh look at me,
I&#146;m so cute, I&#146;m a little chick who&#146;s disgusting! God, you&#146;re so
stupid, how are you not yet extinct!! (the duck wattles behind him and quacks) (to the
duck) Quack-quack, quack-quack!! What are you quacking about?! Dumb Donald Doo-Doo!! </p>

<p>(We see the gang staring at him through the doorways.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Step away from the duck.</p>

<p><b>Tommy:</b> Ooh, sorry little Mr. Chic-A-Dee, sorry you went doody in my hand!
(starts to walk out and stops) (to Rachel) Well, I guess we&#146;re not going out anymore.
Whaa!!!</p>

<p>(He leaves the gang in stunned silence.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Backstage at Joey&#146;s play, Joey is changing for the next scene as Kate
arrives, carrying her bags.]</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> Joey!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> I&#146;m soo glad I caught you, I couldn&#146;t find you before.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Wh-wh-what&#146;s going on? Wh-what&#146;s this about L.A.?</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> They still want me for <i>General Hospital</i>.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> But, but wh-what about us?</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> Last night was wonderful. But I-I can&#146;t stay here just for you.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, so, stay for the museums! </p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> I&#146;m sorry.</p>

<p><b>Stage Manager:</b> Joey, onstage!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well can you at least stay to the end of the play? I mean, I&#146;ll go to
the airport with ya, I-I wanna say good bye.</p>

<p><b>Lauren:</b> (yelling from onstage) Where are you Vic?</p>

<p><b>Kate:</b> Flight&#146;s in an hour. I-I gotta go.</p>

<p><b>Lauren:</b> Vic! Vic! <b>Vic</b>!!! </p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (to Lauren) In a minute!!</p>

<p>[cut to the end of the play]</p>

<p><b>Lauren:</b> So this is it? Victor?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, I guess it is. (sees Kate is watching, he turns Lauren so that he
can talk directly to Kate, but still look like he is talking to Lauren) Listen, I ah, I
gotta say good bye, and-and I gotta say it quick &#145;cause this is killing me. One thing
you gotta know, is that I will never forget you. But, you&#146;ve got things you have to
do now, and so do I. And so&#133; I&#146;m gonna get on this spaceship, (smoke starts
pouring in from the ceiling, and a ladder comes down, with flashing, colored lights on the
side of it) and I&#146;m gonna go to Blargon 7 in search of alternative fuels. But when I
return, 200 years from now, you&#146;ll be long gone. But I won&#146;t have aged at all.
(gets on the ladder) So you tell your great-great-granddaughter to look me up, because
Adrienne, baby, I&#146;m gonna want to meet her. </p>

<p>(The ladder retracts, taking Joey up into the spaceship for his voyage to Blargon 7,
and Kate waves good bye.)</p>

<p><b>Lauren:</b> So long, Vic! (waving good bye as the ladder retracts)</p>

<p align="center"><b>Closing Credits</b></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the gang, except Joey, is there. Phoebe is, well you
y'know.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Phoebe, it&#146;s been two days.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, I know. Oh, good thing it&#146;s one of those 801 numbers. Right?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Phoebe, 800 is toll free, 801 is-is Utah.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, no, no, oh no-no-no, it&#146;s has to be 800. (picks up the
instruction manual to check the phone number) &#145;Cause all those big companies have 800
numbers, every one. (Finds the number) Yeah, every big Utah-based company has one.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Phoe-be!!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Sorry, I&#146;m so sorry, I will pay you back.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> And yet, she&#146;s still not hanging up the phone.</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Hang it up! Hang up the phone!!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Fine! Fine! (slams the phone down, breaking it) Oh-oh!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, I think I broke it. But that&#146;s all right, here&#146;s the
number you can call.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (sarcastic) Oh.</p>

<p align="center"><b>End</b></p>
</body>
</html>
323<html>

<head>
<title>The One With Ross's Thing</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="white" text="black" link="green" vlink="black" alink="yellow">

<h1 align="center">The One With Ross's Thing</h1>

<hr>

<p>Written by: Andrew Reich &amp; Ted Cohen<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a></p>

<hr>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler and Joey are playing with the duck and the
chick.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey, wouldn't be cool if our duck and chick had a little baby? We could
call it Chuck.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Or... Dick.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (entering) Hey.</p>

<p><b>Chandler and Joey:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Listen, I-I need a favor. Umm, I was in the shower, and as I was cleansing
myself, I ah, I-I, well I felt something.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Was it like a sneeze only better?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, no, I mean, I mean a thing on my body.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (with a disgusted look) What was it?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, I don't know, it's-it's kinda in a place that's not... It's not
visually accessible to me, and I was hoping maybe you guys could-could help me out.
(starts to take off his pants)</p>

<p><b>Chandler and Joey:</b> Whoa!!!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No!!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Come on you guys, it's no big deal! (He turns around and shows him his
thing.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Whoa-heeeiiiiii-iiiii-ah!! (sees it) Huh.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well what is it? Is it a mole? (He moves closer to them, and they jump
back.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No, it's too wrinkly to be a mole.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, eww. What? Is it a pimple?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No, it's... fancier than a pimple. Look Ross, why don't you just go
see a&#133; </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (entering, interrupting them) Hey guys! What's... (sees what they're
doing and stops, the guys are stunned)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, well, it's definite, two more weeks of winter.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Ahhh.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, right.</p>

<p>(Rachel backs out with a confused look on her face.)</p>

<p align="center"><b>Opening Credits</b></p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Chandler, Joey, and Rachel are there, as Phoebe enters with her
date.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (to her date) Okay, and then this is the coffee house. This is where I
play my music. (points to the stage)</p>

<p><b>Vince:</b> Good deal.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, and these are my friends. People. This is Vince, Vince the people.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Vince:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Vince is a fireman.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Wow! Have you ever rescued anyone from a burning building before?</p>

<p><b>Vince:</b> 98 hot saves, highest in the force.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, y'know if Joey and I played with matches we could get you up to
an even hundred. </p>

<p><b>Vince:</b> (dead serious) Fire safety is not a joke, son.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You're right, I know.</p>

<p><b>Vince:</b> (to Phoebe) Look, I gotta go. I'm on call tonight. (kisses her) See you
Saturday. (leaves)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay. (watches him leave)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Wow, he's cute, Pheebs! But I thought you just started dating that
Kindergarten teacher.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, Jason? Yeah, uh-huh, we're seeing each other tonight.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What-Pheebs?! Two dates in one day? That's so unlike you.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I know, I know! I'm like playing the field. Y'know? Like, juggling two
guys, I'm sowing my wild oats. Y'know? Y'know, this kind've like y'know oat-sowin',
field-playin' juggler.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> So Pheebs, do they know about each other?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Does a dog's lips move when he reads? (Joey makes an `I don't know'
face, and looks to Chandler and Rachel, who're also stumped) Okay, no they don't.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (entering) Hey guys!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hi!</p>

<p>(He goes over and sits down at the counter, all depressed.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (going over to him) Well?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (joining them) Okay, how'd it go at the doctor's?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, he said there's definitely nothing to worry about, it's totally
benign.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well what is it?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> He couldn't even tell me! He said it was just some sort of skin...
abnormality. And the worst thing is he-he-he said, he said, without being able to identify
it, he was reluctant to remove it.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Y'know what? You should go to my guy, because when I went in there
with my third nipple. He just lopped it right off. Y'know? So I guess I'm lucky. I mean
not as lucky as people who were born with two nipples.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> At least they knew what yours was. Y'know, yours had a name.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh! Maybe they'll name yours after you! Y'know, they'll call it, The Ross.
And then people would be like, &quot;Awww, he's got a Ross.&quot;</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (sarcastic) Yeah, that'd be cool!</p>

<p>[cut to Phoebe and Rachel as Monica returns from the bathroom]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Pete's breaking up with me.</p>

<p><b>All:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I just checked my messages, and he said that when he gets back from
Atlanta, <b>we</b> need to talk.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> And?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well that's it. People never say `We need to talk' unless it's something
bad.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Whoa, that doesn't necessarily mean that he's breaking up with you.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Really?!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, maybe he just cheated on you.</p>

<p>[Scene: A Street, Phoebe is walking with her second date, Jason.]</p>

<p><b>Jason:</b> ...and I know I'll never miss doing it, but I gotta tell you, it's pretty
cool knowing that you're making a difference in a kid's life.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> That is so great! Oh, I... (sees that a parked car near them has caught
on fire) Oh my God!</p>

<p><b>Jason:</b> Whoa!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (the fire has worsened) Oh my God!!!</p>

<p><b>Jason:</b> Ahh-ahh, we'd better call the fire department!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (stopping him) No! No! </p>

<p><b>Jason:</b> No, no?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, we don't n-n-n-n-need a fireman, we'd, we'd like a good mechanic.
(hears the sound of approaching sirens) Oh my God, here they come! Well, we gotta get out
of here!</p>

<p><b>Jason:</b> W-w-w-wait! Why?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well look, if I wanted to see a fireman, I would date one. Okay? (she
drags him away)</p>

<p>[Scene: A Doctor's Office, Ross is having his thing looked at by Dr. Rhodes.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Th-th-that's all it is, a third nipple. Y'know? Just your run-of-the-mill
third nipple. Y'know? You can take it off. Just slice that baby right off!</p>

<p><b>Dr. Rhodes:</b> Take your shirt off, and let's see what we're dealing with here.
(Ross starts to take off his pants) What are you doing?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Just showing you my run-of-the-mill-slice-it-right-off third nipple.</p>

<p><b>Dr. Rhodes:</b> Well that's not a third nipple.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No?</p>

<p><b>Dr. Rhodes:</b> First of all, it's on your ass.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well then, what is it?!</p>

<p><b>Dr. Rhodes:</b> Wait a minute, hold it. (He goes to the door and opens it.) Johnson!
Will you come in here a moment?</p>

<p><b>Dr. Johnson:</b> I'm with Hamilton!</p>

<p><b>Dr. Rhodes:</b> He's good with rear things, bring him in too.</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Chandler, Monica, and Joey are there.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (starting to get up) I gotta go water Pete's plants. (stops) Y'know
what, if he's gonna break up with me, maybe I <b>won't</b> water his plants.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, if he's gonna break up with you, maybe Joey and I should water
his plants. If y'know what I mean.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Or ha-ha, we could go over there and pee on them.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (entering with Rachel) &#133;and I-I can't take it! Y'know? I'm just,
always afraid one of them is gonna catch me with the other one. It's making me crazy.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well honey, then why don't you break up with one of them?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (disgusted) Uh.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Whoa-whoa-whoa. What ah, what happened to playing the field?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, it just, it doesn't feel like playing anymore, it feels like work.
It's like I'm working in the field.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> So Pheebs, pick one of them.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah. Which one do you like more?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, Vince is great, y'know `cause, he's like a guy, guy. Y'know? He's
so burly, he's sooo <b>very</b> burly. (giggles)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay, good, so there you go. Go with Vince.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, but Jason's really sensitive.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well sensitive is important, pick him.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh sure, go with the sissy.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Jason is not a sissy!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh no-no-no-no, I meant Chandler.</p>

<p>[Scene: Dr. Rhodes's Office, a rather large group of doctors has now gathered to take a
look at Ross's thing. Ross is none too pleased with the developments, he has a disgusted
look on his face.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Y'know I have dinner plans!!</p>

<p><b>Dr. Rhodes:</b> Thank you soo much for coming on such a short notice. Ladies and
gentlemen, I've-I've-I've been practicing medicine for twenty-three years, and I'm
stumped. </p>

<p>(He removes the blanket covering the thing.)</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Whoa. (they all lean in to get a closer look, Ross isn't pleased)</p>

<p>[Scene: Pete's apartment, Monica is there to water the plants, and is showing the gang
around.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay, this is the den. All right, check this out. Lights! (the lights
turn on automatically, but are very bright) Whoa! All right. Less lights! Bad lights!
Lights go away! (they dim) Oh, see you just need to find the right command.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yes, and the dimmer switch.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Whoa! For a rich guy he's got, that's a pretty small TV.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No-no-no, that's a video-phone. But hey guys you're not supposed to be
here, so please, do <b>not</b> touch anything.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (sitting down on the couch) I-kea! This is comfortable.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (entering with Phoebe) This place is amazing.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> God, that is the nicest kitchen.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I know.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No! But it's the nicest kitchen, the refrigerator told me to have a
great day.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Look at this! A millionaire's checkbook.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Joey, put that down! (the phone rings) Oh my God! It's Pete. Okay, get
out!! How the hell do you answer a video-phone! (steps in front of it, and automatically
answers it)</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Monica? (the gang ducks and hides)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I guess that's how.</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Hey Monica, how's it going.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh it&#146;s umm, good! It's umm, it&#146;s good, just here watering the
plants.</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Well don't forget that fiches over there by Rachel.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (standing up) Ahh... Chandler's on the couch!!</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> I see him, you guys are just the worst hiders ever.</p>

<p><b>All:</b> (standing up) Hey Pete.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hi, how ya doing?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Ahh, Pete, the other day when you said you needed to talk, umm, just so
I know, is it good news or bad news.</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Oh, it's good news. No, it's definitely good news. Hold on a second, I
have another call. (clicks his remote) (to his other call) Hey, how's it going?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh no-no-no, it's still me.</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Ah, no it's not. I've got picture-in-picture here. (to other caller) Yeah.
(listens) Yeah, okay. I'm gonna have to call you back later. (pause) Monica? You. I'm
gonna have to call you back.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, oh, okay umm, so I'll see you soon.</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Okay, I love you.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I love you.</p>

<p><b>All:</b> I love you, love you.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay. Well, it's good news. It's good news.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> So, what do you thing the good news is?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (looking at the checkbook) Wow! Look at this! He wrote a check for 50,000
dollars to Hugo Ligrens Ring Design. (Monica is stunned) Oh, sorry, what do you think the
good news is?</p>

<p>[pause]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh my.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Monica's gonna marry a millionaire!!!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey, you gotta get Mom on the phone. Call Mom! Call Mom!</p>

<p>(Pete's computer automatically calls Mom, Pete's Mom.)</p>

<p><b>Pete's Mom:</b> Hello.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> And that's Pete's Mom. </p>

<p>(The gang quickly hides again.)</p>

<p align="center"><b>Commercial Break</b></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the gang is returning from Pete&#146;s.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Mon you definitely have to make it a theme wedding, and the theme could
be, &#147;Look how much money we&#146;ve got!&#148; Y'know, I mean you could put, you
could put money in-in the invitations! You-you could have like little money place
settings. And ah, you could start with a money salad! I mean it&#146;ll be dry, but people
<b>will</b> like it.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Would you stop? We&#146;ve only been going out a couple of weeks, I mean
we don&#146;t even know if he&#146;s gonna propose.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes, but this is Pete. Okay? He&#146;s not like other people, on your
first date he took you to Rome. For most guys that&#146;s like a third or fourth date
kinda thing.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well if-if that&#146;s what it is, then it&#146;s-it&#146;s crazy.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Monica&#146;s right. We&#146;re talking about getting married here. Okay?
She-she can&#146;t just rush into this.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh please, what do you know! You married a lesbian!</p>

<p>(Joey laughs, Ross glares at him, and Joey stops.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> All right. I gotta go. I have break up with Vince.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, so you&#146;re going with the teacher, huh?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, I like Vince a lot, y'know? But, it&#146;s just Jason&#146;s so
sensitive, y'know? And in the long run, I think sensitive it&#146;s just better than
having just like a really, really, really nice (pause) butt. (Her eyes glaze over thinking
about the butt.) (pause) Jason! Definitely Jason! Okay, wish me luck!</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Good luck!</p>

<p>(pause)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> OH MY GOD!!! (She holds her hands up in triumph and the gang all look at
her.) Sorry, I was just imagining what it&#146;d be like to catch the money bouquet. </p>

<p>[Scene: A Fire House, Phoebe has gone to break up with Vince.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Excuse me. Umm, is Vince here?</p>

<p><b>Fireman:</b> Oh sure. Vince?!</p>

<p><b>Vince:</b> Yo!! (slides down that pole that fire station&#146;s have)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Wow! I didn&#146;t know you guys actually used those. </p>

<p><b>Vince:</b> So, what&#146;s up?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Umm, wow. This-this isn&#146;t gonna be easy. Umm, I don&#146;t think we
should see each other anymore.</p>

<p><b>Vince:</b> Uh-huh. G-good deal.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I&#146;m sorry.</p>

<p><b>Vince:</b> No-no it&#146;s okay. It&#146;s just that ah, I thought we had something
pretty special here. And y'know I-I felt like you were someone I could finally open up to,
and&#133; (starts choking up) That there&#146;s so much in me I have to share with you
yet.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh my God, I didn&#146;t&#133;</p>

<p><b>Vince:</b> (starting to cry) I&#146;m sorry, I can&#146;t talk. I&#146;m gonna go
write in my journal. (walks away)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (running after him) Wait-wait-wait! Wait!!</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe, Ross, and Monica are there.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (to Ross) I&#146;m telling you, if you want to take care of that thing,
you should go to my herbal guy.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Thank you, but I want to remove it Pheebs. I don&#146;t want to make it
savory.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Y'know when girls sleep with guys with weird things on their body, they
tell their friends about it.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Gimme this. (Grabs the herbalist&#146;s card and leaves.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (entering) Hi! Okay, don&#146;t be mad at me, but I couldn&#146;t
resist.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Brides magazines?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yes, and I know that you&#146;d say no if he asked you, but I&#146;m
sorry; how great would you look walking down the aisle in this Donna Carin. (shows her the
picture.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (gasps) Oh, you so would! Oh, you should get that anyway. (They both
look at her.) Like for clubbing. </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> It is so weird, I know what I said, but uh, this morning, I was lying in
bed I was, I was imagining what it would be like to say yes. (Rachel slams the magazine
shut in amazement.) I know it&#146;s a little sudden, and it&#146;s a little rushed, and
it&#146;s totally not like me to do something like this, but that doesn&#146;t mean I
can&#146;t. Right? I mean I&#146;m-I&#146;m crazy about Pete, and I know that we want the
same things, and when I thought about saying yes, it made me really happy.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh my God. (starting to cry) </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I know. (pause) I need more pie. (goes and gets some)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey Mon umm, if you do get married, can I bring two guests?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You didn&#146;t break up with that fireman?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, that was my way of telling you. Well, it turns out he&#146;s
incredibly sensitive, he keeps a journal and he paints. He even showed me charcoal
drawings that he drew of me.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Wow!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, well he&#146;d prefer water colors, but y'know, he has easy access
to a lot of charcoal.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> So then, are you going to dump Jason?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, yeah, because I have to break up with someone, and&#133; Okay so
Jason is sensitive, (holds up one finger) but now so&#146;s Vince (holds up one finger on
her other hand) Plus, Vince has the body y'know? (holds up two more fingers on the Vince
side) So&#133; It&#146;s really just about the math.</p>

<p>[Scene: Jason&#146;s apartment, Phoebe has gone to break up with Jason.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (knocks on the door) Jason?</p>

<p><b>Jason:</b> Yeah, come on in.</p>

<p>(She goes in, and sees Jason without his shirt. It turns out that he has a great body
too, and is at a loss for words.)</p>

<p><b>Jason:</b> So Phoebe, you ah, sounded kinda serious on the phone, is ah, is anything
wrong?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Nah-ha!</p>

<p>[Scene: Phoebe&#146;s Herbal Guy&#146;s office, Ross is there about his thing. Ross is
looking around the exam room, and he goes over to a large bank of drawers, pulls one out
and almost spills it as the herbalist, Guru Saj, enters.]</p>

<p><b>Guru Saj:</b> You must be Ross.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hi.</p>

<p><b>Guru Saj:</b> I am Guru Saj. (takes the drawer back and replaces)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Listen, I got to tell you I&#146;ve-I&#146;ve never been to a guru before,
so...</p>

<p><b>Guru Saj:</b> Well, relax. If it makes you feel better, I&#146;ve attended some of
the finest medical schools in Central America. Well then, let&#146;s take a look at this
skin abnormality of yours. (motions to the table) Come on, have a seat. (looks at it) Eeh,
huh. As I suspected, it&#146;s a koondis!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What&#146;s a koondis?</p>

<p><b>Guru Saj:</b> I don&#146;t know, what&#146;s a koondis with you? (starts laughing as
if that joke was funny, Ross only looks at him, and he stops) Please, lie down! I&#146;ve
got a sav that oughta shrink that right up.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I guess it&#146;s worth a try.</p>

<p><b>Guru Saj:</b> Oh sure, we should see results&#151;Whoa!! Clearly not the way to go!!
(quickly wipes it off)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What?! What?!</p>

<p><b>Guru Saj:</b> We appear to have angered it.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> We?! We angered it?!</p>

<p><b>Guru Saj:</b> Oh, I think I see the problem. And I&#146;m afraid we&#146;re gonna
have to use a much stronger tool. (Ross gives him a &#145;What?&#146; look) Love.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh God!</p>

<p><b>Guru Saj:</b> (He starts moving his hands around in circles above the thing.) Ross,
there is absolutely no way this is going to come off unless you start to&#133;</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Ow!! </p>

<p><b>Guru Saj:</b> Oops.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What was, what was that?</p>

<p><b>Guru Saj:</b> Well it&#146;s gone.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What?! How&#146;s that?</p>

<p><b>Guru Saj:</b> It got caught on my watch.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey! (congratulates him)</p>

<p>[Scene: Pete&#146;s apartment, Pete and Monica are coming back from a date.]</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Lights. (The lights turn on, once again they&#146;re too bright.) Uh,
romantic lights. (The lights dim.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Ooh, nice.</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> So ah, there was this thing I wanted to talk to you about.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, right! I completely forgot about that.</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Well ah, I&#146;ve been doing a lot of thinking, and I look at my
life&#133;</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah?</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> And I feel like I&#146;ve conquered the business world, and I feel like
I&#146;ve conquered the intellectual world, and now I-I have the most beautiful woman in
the world.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Wow.</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> There&#146;s one thing missing.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What&#146;s that?</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> It&#146;s time for me to conquer the physical world.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay. (not sure of herself)</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Monica, I want to become (pause) the Ultimate Fighting Champion.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You wanna what?!</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> I want to become the Ultimate Fighting Champion! It&#146;s the most
intense physical competition in the world, it&#146;s banned in 49 states!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What are you talking about?</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Okay, my trainer, Ho Chi, is teaching me a combination of Gee Koon Doe and
Brazilian street fighting, I&#146;ve even had my own octagon training ring designed.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> And I suppose you used a ring designer for that.</p>

<p><b>Pete:</b> Yeah. Monica, I want you there in the front row when I win. I want you
close enough to smell the blood. What do you think?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> My parents will be so happy.</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe&#146;s singing, Vince is also there.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (singing) &#147;Crazy underwear, creepin&#146; up my butt. (Jason
enters) Crazy underwear, always in a rut. Crazy under-(sees Jason)-wear&#133;&#148; (In
her head) <i>Oh No! What is he doing here? All right, just keep playing, just keep
playing. You&#146;ll get through this; you&#146;ll be fine.</i> (She tries to continue the
song, but she has lost the ability to pronounce words, and the lyrics come out as
gibberish.) (giving up on the song) Okay, thank you. And, as always no one talk to me
after the show.</p>

<p>(They all applaud her.)</p>

<p><b>Jason:</b> (going up to her) Hey. I was&#133;</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Jason:</b> I was passin&#146; by and I saw that you were playing tonight, it&#146;s
kinda cool seeing you up there. (kisses her)</p>

<p><b>Vince:</b> (running over) Whoa! Hey-hey! What&#146;s going on here? Who is this guy?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I don&#146;t know, he just started kissing me. Get him! Get him, Vince!</p>

<p><b>Vince:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Jason:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, okay, I&#146;ve-I&#146;ve been dating both of you, and it&#146;s
been really horrible. &#145;Cause y'know it&#146;s been a lot of fun, for me. Umm, but I-I
like you both, and I, and I didn&#146;t know how to chose, so... I&#146;m sorry, I&#146;m
just, I&#146;m terrible, I&#146;m a terrible person. I&#146;m terrible.</p>

<p><b>Vince:</b> Phoebe, Phoebe relax, it&#146;s okay. I mean we never said this was
exclusive.</p>

<p><b>Jason:</b> Yeah, and neither did we. Give yourself a break.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Really?!</p>

<p><b>Jason:</b> Yeah. I mean y'know, we haven&#146;t been going out <b>that</b> long.
Come on, we haven&#146;t even slept together yet. Huh.</p>

<p><b>Vince:</b> You haven&#146;t?</p>

<p><b>Jason:</b> You have?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, this is none of my business. (starts to walk away)</p>

<p><b>Jason:</b> (to Phoebe) I-I can&#146;t believe this! You-you&#146;ve slept with him?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, I made you a candle light dinner in the park.</p>

<p><b>Jason:</b> Y'know Phoebe, I&#146;m gonna make this real easy for you. (walks out)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (to Vince) Well, that could&#146;ve been really awkward.</p>

<p><b>Vince:</b> You made him a candle light dinner in the park?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, but I-I-I-I can do that for you, I&#146;m gonna do that for you.</p>

<p><b>Vince:</b> Uh yeah, I can&#146;t believe I ever went out with somebody who would
actually have an open flame in the middle of a wooden area. (walks out)</p>

<p align="center"><b>Closing Credits</b></p>

<p>[Scene: Guru Saj&#146;s office: Joey and Chandler have taken the duck to see the guru.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (comforting the duck) Everything&#146;s gonna be all right. Okay,
Dick?</p>

<p><b>Guru Saj:</b> (entering) Hello, I am Guru Saj-(sees the duck)-Whoa!! (to Joey)
That&#146;s supposed to be a duck right? &#145;Cause otherwise, this is waaay out of my
league.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, yeah. He&#146;s got a, he&#146;s got a really bad cough, and our
vet, he can&#146;t do anything about it. Is there something you can do?</p>

<p><b>Guru Saj:</b> Hmm, let me see. Let me see. Do you think you could get him to eat a
bat?</p>

<p>(The duck starts to frantically flap his wings, while Joey is holding him, in an
attempt to get away.)</p>

<p align="center"><b>End</b></p>
</body>
