<p><b>Chandler:</b> (to Joey) Noo!! I don&#146;t care! I&#146;m not, I&#146;m not gonna
playing one-on-one strip poker with you for practice! </p>

<p>(Rachel and Ross both stop kissing, and quickly step back from each other.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> But I made cards!!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well! Good night. (to Ross) I&#146;m going upstairs.</p>

<p><b>Joey and Chandler:</b> G&#146;night.</p>

<p>(Rachel walks inside, stops, and turns back to look at Ross for a moment then goes
upstairs.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (to Ross) Wanna play strip poker for practice?</p>

<p>[Scene: Phoebe Sr.&#146;s house, Phoebe is breaking in through a window.]</p>

<p>(She throws her bag inside, and starts to climb through the window. She gets halfway in
and the window slams shut on her butt.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ow! My ass. Okay. Okay. (She manages to climb completely inside and the
window slams shut.) Oh, shhh!</p>

<p>(She starts walking across the darkened room and hits her head on a wind chime hanging
from the ceiling, to stop it from making a noise she grabs it and &#147;Shhh&#146;s&#148;
it. She goes into the kitchen and finds Phoebe Sr.&#146;s appointment book, to read it she
opens the freezer. Just as she starts to read, Phoebe Sr. jumps out from her bedroom with
a coat hanger, startling Phoebe.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No! No!! It&#146;s me! It&#146;s me! I-I didn&#146;t want to make any
noise!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe Sr:</b> Then don't break in!!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I&#146;m sorry.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe Sr:</b> What are you doing here?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I-I, came to fill your ice cube trays.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe Sr:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Umm, okay, okay, look. I took this picture from your fridge. Okay,
because I know that this is my Father. Yeah, this is Frank Buffay and you are standing
right there next to him. Now, look I deserve to know where I came from. All right? So if
you can help me find my Father then you should! Otherwise, you&#146;re just mean! (pause)
So, just tell me the truth!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe Sr:</b> All right, the man in the picture is Chuck Magioni. </p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> My Father is Chuck Magioni?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe Sr:</b> No, no, that&#146;s just Chuck Magioni, I-I sold him a house last
year! And I&#146;m very sorry, but I don&#146;t know where your Father is, and that&#146;s
the truth.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe Sr:</b> But umm, you&#146;re right. I think that a person should know where
they come from. Wh-which is why I ah, (pause) ahh, (pause) okay. I&#146;m your mother.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Heh?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe Sr:</b> Y'know I wanted to tell you yesterday, but I just, I kinda felt all
floopy, and... </p>

<p>(At that Phoebe&#146;s eyes open in shock.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Outside the beach house, Ross is telling Joey and Chandler what happened with
Rachel.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I&#146;m telling ya, you guys are totally getting back together!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> That&#146;s not true! Her, she doesn&#146;t even know what she wants!
Rachel&#146;s still mad about the whole thing.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, then you gotta back away, all right? You don&#146;t need that
kind&#146;ve hurt. Take it from a guy who&#146;s never had a long term relationship......</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I know, but ahhhhhh!! I really wanna go up there and finish that kiss!</p>

<p><b>Bonnie:</b> (coming back from her swim) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Ahhhh! (Steps away from her.)</p>

<p><b>Bonnie:</b> You guys, the water&#146;s great. You should really go in.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, ahh, no thanks, I just had an M&amp;M.</p>

<p><b>Bonnie:</b> Okay, well g&#146;night.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Good night.</p>

<p><b>Bonnie:</b> (kisses Ross) Don&#146;t be too long.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okey-dokey!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> There is not <b>one</b> hair on that head.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey, it&#146;ll grow back, right? And she-she&#146;s really fun, and
she&#146;s cool, and-and I&#146;m finally moving on. Y'know? I mean getting over Rachel
was so (makes an incoherent nasal sound), y'know? Y'know, and I&#146;m finally feeling
sane again. And now if I go up there, and-and I kiss her, and, Gooood I wanna kiss her,
and-and-and it doesn&#146;t work out, right? Do I really wanna put myself through that
again?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> So let me get this straight. If you go with Bonnie tonight, you&#146;re
doing the smart, healthy thing and moving on.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Right, and you go with Rachel, Bonnie&#146;s free tonight?</p>

<p>[Scene: The hallway between the bedrooms. Ross is coming upstairs and stops between two
doors. He looks at the one on the right, then he looks at the one on his left, thinks
about it, and goes in the one on his right.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (entering the bedroom) Hi. (closes the door)</p>

<p align="center"><b>Closing Credits</b></p>

<p>[Scene: The beach house, Chandler is simulating he&#146;s coming to pick up Monica for
a date. Chandler knocks on the door, and Monica answers it.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (in a fake voice) Hi there.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> That&#146;s that weird voice again.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay! Okay! Let me try it again, you&#146;re gonna wanna date this
next guy, I swear!</p>

<p>(Monica closes the door, Chandler knocks, and Monica opens it to reveal Chandler on his
knees.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hi! I&#146;m Dorf! You&#146;re date for the evening. (Monica walks
away in disgust) Oh come on! Dorf on dating, that&#146;s good stuff!!</p>

<p align="center"><b>End</b></p>
</font>
</body>
</html>
401<html>

<head>
<title>The One With The Jellyfish</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="white" text="black" link="green" vlink="black" alink="yellow">

<h1 align="center">The One With The Jellyfish</h1>

<hr align="center">
<i>

<p></i>Written by: Wil Calhoun<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a><i> </p>
</i>

<hr>
<font size="3">

<p><b>Joey:</b> (lying on a beach towel, recapping what happened in the last episode)
Okay, so we went to the beach, because Phoebe found out about this lady who knew her mom
and dad, and I don&#146;t really know what happened with that.</p>

<p>[cut to Phoebe Sr.&#146;s house, from the last episode]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe Sr.:</b> (to Phoebe) I&#146;m your mother.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ehh?</p>

<p>[cut to Monica opening the door of the beach house, with Chandler trying to pick her up
for a date.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (voice-over) Oh, and then Monica joked that she wouldn&#146;t go out with
a guy like Chandler...</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (to Monica) (in a funny voice) Hi there. (Monica turns her head away
in disgust)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (voice-over) ...and he couldn&#146;t let it go, and... I don&#146;t really
know what happened with that either. </p>

<p>[cut to a montage of scenes involving Bonnie, Ross, and Rachel from the last episode.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (voice-over) Oh-oh! And then Ross&#146;s new girlfriend, Bonnie, shows up
and Rachel convinced her to save her head. And then Ross and Rachel kiss, and now Ross has
to choose between Rachel and the bald girl and I don&#146;t know what happened there
either... </p>

<p>[cut back to Joey on the beach towel]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Y'know what, hold on, let me go get Chandler. (gets up and leaves.)</p>

<p>[Scene: The beach house, it&#146;s the same scene from the end of last year, with Ross
in front of the two doors of Rachel&#146;s and Bonnie&#146;s rooms, trying to decide which
door to choose. He finally chooses the one his right and goes in.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (surprised) Hi!</p>

<p><b>Rachel and Bonnie:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>Bonnie:</b> Rachel was just helping me out. My head got all sunburned.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Awww.</p>

<p><b>Bonnie:</b> (to Rachel) Thanks a million.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, you&#146;re welcome a million.</p>

<p><b>Bonnie:</b> (getting up and leaving) (to Ross) Okay, I&#146;ll see you in our room.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah. (closes the door, and goes over and kisses Rachel.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (softly) Oh my God.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I know.</p>

<p>(They both kiss again and fall onto the bed.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (stopping suddenly and getting up) Okay, I gotta go.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Whoa! What?! Why?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, I-I gotta go break up with Bonnie.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Here?! Now?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, yeah. I can&#146;t-I can&#146;t stay here all night, and if I go in
there she&#146;s-she&#146;s gonna wanna... do stuff.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, can&#146;t you tell her that you are not in the mood?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, she likes that. Yeah. Faking sleep doesn&#146;t work either, I
can&#146;t tell you how many mornings I woke up with her...</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (interrupting) Whoa-ho.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Whoa-oh, okay! Yeah, why am I telling you that?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I don&#146;t know.</p>

<p>(they kiss again)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, yeah. (opens the door) It wasn&#146;t every morning.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, making it worse!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay.</p>

<p align="center"><b>Opening Credits</b></p>

<p>[Scene: Phoebe Sr.&#146;s house, it&#146;s right after she told Phoebe that she&#146;s
her birth mother.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe Sr.:</b> So I guess you&#146;d like to know how it all happened. </p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I-I mean I, well I think I can figure it out. I guess y'know I was born,
and everyone started lying their asses off!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe Sr.:</b> Noo! No! It wasn&#146;t like that I... Remember how I told you how
Lily, Frank, and I we were, we were close. Well, we were, we were very close.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> How close?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe Sr.:</b> Well, the-the three of us we were, kind of umm, a couple.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I don&#146;t even know how that would work!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe Sr.:</b> Well, we were...</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (interrupting) I&#146;m not asking!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe Sr.:</b> Well, any how, some how I got pregnant, and, and I was scared. I was
stupid and sellfish, and I was 18 years old. I mean, you remember what it&#146;s like to
be eighteen years old?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah. Let&#146;s see, my had Mom killed herself, and my Dad had run off,
and I was living in a Gremlin with a guy named Cindy who talked to his hand.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe Sr.:</b> Well, I&#146;m so sorry. I thought I was leaving you with the best
parents in the world, I didn&#146;t even hear about your Mom and Dad til a couple of years
ago, and by then you were already grown up. I don&#146;t know, you&#146;re here, and I
would, I would really, I would like to get to know you.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, well, everybody does! I&#146;m a really cool person. And y'know
you had 29 years to find that out, but you didn&#146;t even try! Y'know what, you walked
out on me, and I&#146;m just, I&#146;m gonna do the same thing to you.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe Sr.:</b> Wait!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I don&#146;t <b>ever</b> want to see you again! </p>

<p>(She walks out and slams the door.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (walking back in with her hand over her eyes.) Umm, where&#146;s my
purse?</p>

<p>[Scene: The beach house, Joey and Chandler are sitting at the dinner table, Monica is
looking in the fridge.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (closing the fridge in disgust) Shoot! We&#146;re out of soda.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (jumping up) Oh, I&#146;ll go out and get you some.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Really?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Nope! Because I&#146;m not your boyfriend. (to Phoebe, who&#146;s
entering) Hey Pheebs, how did it go?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, umm, my Mom&#146;s friend, Phoebe, is actually my birth Mom.</p>

<p>(The gang is shocked.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I found a dried up seashores.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Sweety, what are you talking about?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, my new Mom, who-who&#146;s a big, fat abandoner! (starts to go
upstairs)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Whoa, wait, Pheebs, wait a second! Don&#146;t you wanna stay here and talk
about it?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No. I&#146;m just, I wanna, I need to be alone.</p>

<p>(She starts to go upstairs.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (turning around, insistently) Monica!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh.</p>

<p>[Scene: The beach house, Rachel&#146;s bedroom. She is finishing up writing something
as Ross walks through the door.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> It&#146;s over.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, was it awful?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, it was loong. I didn&#146;t even realise how late it was, until I
noticed the 5 o&#146;clock shadow on her head. (They both start to laugh, then stop
themselves quickly.) Anyway, she didn&#146;t want to stay. I called a cab; she just left.</p>

<p>(They kiss.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I wrote you a letter.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Ohh! Thank you! I like mail. (He goes to kiss her again, but she turns
away.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (handing him the letter) It&#146;s just some things I&#146;ve been
thinking about. Some things about us, and before we can even think about the two of us
getting back together, I just need to know how you feel about this stuff.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay. (He leans in to kiss her again, but she leans back preventing him
from making contact.) Wow, it&#146;s-it&#146;s 5:30 in the morning. (Rachel laughs) So,
I&#146;d better get cracking on this baby.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, I&#146;ll be waiting for you, just come up when you&#146;re done.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, I&#146;ll be up in, (looks at the letter) 18 pages. Front and back.
Very exciting.</p>

<p>[Scene: The beach house, the next morning. Ross is passed out on the kitchen counter.
He wakes up with a start and has one of the pages of the letter stuck to his face.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh. (looks at his watch) Oh-oh. (takes a drink of coffee and resumes
reading the letter)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (coming down the stairs) Hey! (Ross jumps up, and quickly puts the
letter back together, pretending like he has just finished it.) What happened to you? Why
didn&#146;t you come up?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Done!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You just finished?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, I wanted to be thorough. I mean this-this is clearly very, very
important to you, to us! And so I wanted to read every word carefully, twice!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> So umm, does it?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I&#146;m sorry.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Does it?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Does it? Does it? Yeah, I wanted to give that whole &#145;Does it?&#146;
part just another glance.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What are you talking about, Ross, you just said that you read it twice!
Look, y'know what, either it does or it doesn&#146;t, and if you have to even <b>think</b>
about it...</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (interrupting) No, Rach, no. I don&#146;t, I don&#146;t, I don&#146;t <b>have</b>
to think about it, in fact, I&#146;ve decided, I&#146;ve decided that, that it.......does.</p>

<p>(Rachel stands there for a moment, starting to cry. Then gasps and runs over and hugs
him. While hugging her, Ross tries to find the &#145;Does it?&#146; part in the letter.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Are you sure?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, sure! I&#146;m sure.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I know. (Hugs him more violently this time and pushes him back away from
the letter.)</p>

<p>[Scene: The beach. Chandler and Monica are out getting some sun.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All right, there&#146;s a nuclear holocaust, I&#146;m the last man on
Earth. Would you go out with me?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Ennnh.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I&#146;ve got canned goods.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (jumping up in a hole that he is digging, he is shoulder deep) Hey, you
guys! Take a look at this! (Chandler and Monica jump up and go over to the hole.) Check
this baby out, dug me a hole!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Excellent hole, Joe.</p>

<p>(A wave crashes on the beach and partially fills up his hole.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh no! No!! My hole!!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (screaming in pain) Ow!! Ow!!!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (climbing out of the hole) What?! What?!! What is it?!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Jellyfish sting! Oh, it hurts! It hurts!! It hurts!!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, can we help?! You want us to take you back to the house?!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> It&#146;s like two miles!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, and I&#146;m a little tired from digging the hole.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh damn the jellyfish. Damn all the jellyfish!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> We&#146;ve got to do something!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, there&#146;s really only one thing you can do.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What?! What is it?!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> You&#146;re gonna have to pee on it.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What?!! Gross!!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Don&#146;t blame me, I saw it on <i>The Discovery Channel</i>.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Y'know what, he&#146;s right. There&#146;s something like uh, ammonia
in that, that like kills the pain.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well forget it! It doesn&#146;t hurt that (tries to take a step) <b>baaad</b>!!!!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> If you want some privacy you can use my hole.</p>

<p>[Scene: The beach house, Phoebe is coming down the stairs all packed and ready to go.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, I&#146;m ready to get the hell out of here! (Sees Ross and Rachel
cuddling on the couch.) Oh. Are you? Are you?!! (they nod &#145;Yes.&#146;) Ohh!
That&#146;s so great!! Ooh, not for Bonnie. (they nod &#145;No.&#146;) But for you, yay!
Ohh.</p>

<p>(The rest of the gang arrives with their heads down in shame.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> How was the beach?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Nothing, I don&#146;t know.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What happened?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Nothing. I&#146;m gonna take a shower.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Me too!!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Me too.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, I&#146;m gonna put this (her suitcase) in the car.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ooh, I have to go pack. (Gets up to do so.) It really does?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> It does. It really and truly does.</p>

<p>(Rachel kisses him, and goes upstairs. After she&#146;s gone, Ross frantically tries to
find and read the &#145;Does it?&#146; part.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (finding the part) (looks up in disgust) It so does <b>not</b>!!!</p>

<p align="center"><b>Commercial Break</b></p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Ross is telling Joey and Chandler about the letter.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> She wants <b>me</b> to take responsibility for everything that went wrong
in our relationship. I mean she goes on for five pages about, about how I was unfaithful
to her! (Both Joey and Chandler shrug their shoulders as to say &#148;Well...&#148;)
(yelling) WE WERE ON A BREAK!!!!!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh my God! If you say that one more time, <b>I&#146;m</b> gonna break
up with you!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Fine! Fine! But this break-up was not all my fault, and she, she says
here, (reading from the letter) &#147;If you accept full responsibility...&#148; (to
Chandler and Joey) Full responsibility! &#147;...I can begin to trust you again. Does that
seem like something you can do. (yells at Joey) Does it?!!&#148;</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Look, Ross, you have what you want, you&#146;re back with Rachel. If
you bring this up now you&#146;re gonna wreck the best thing that even happened to you.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (calming down) Yeah, I know. I mean, no, you&#146;re right. Yeah I guess
I&#146;ll let it go. But you-you understand how-how hard it is to forget about this.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Sure, it&#146;s hard to forget! But that doesn&#146;t mean you have to
talk about it! A lot of things happened on that trip that we should never, (to Chandler)
ever talk about.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What the hell happened on that beach?!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> It&#146;s between us and the sea, Ross!</p>

<p>(Ross laughs and has a &#145;Come on...&#146; look on his face as he looks and Chandler
who nods his head in agreement with Joey. Ross is stunned.)</p>

<p>[Scene: A hallway in an apartment building. Phoebe is knocks on a door and it opens.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (to the person that answered the door) Hi, Ursula.</p>

<p><b>Ursula:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, well umm, I know that we haven&#146;t talked in a long time, but
umm okay, our Mom is not our birth Mom. This-this other lady is our birth Mom.</p>

<p><b>Ursula:</b> Right, okay, the one that lives in Montuak, umm-hmm.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (shocked) You know her?!</p>

<p><b>Ursula:</b> No, I umm, I read about her in Mom&#146;s suicide note.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> There-there was a suicide note?! (Ursula nods &#145;Yes.&#146;) Well, do
you still have it?</p>

<p><b>Ursula:</b> (disgusted) Hang on. (She goes into her apartment and slams the door in
Phoebe&#146;s face.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I can&#146;t believe you didn&#146;t tell me there was a suicide note!</p>

<p><b>Ursula:</b> Yeah. So how have you been doing?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I, umm, shut up!</p>

<p>(Ursula opens the door and hands her the note.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (reading from the note) &#147;Good-bye Phoebe and Ursula. I&#146;ll miss
you. P.S. Your Mom lives in Montauk.&#148; You just wrote this!</p>

<p><b>Ursula:</b> Well, it&#146;s pretty much the gist. Well, except for the poem. You
read the poem, right?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Noooo!!</p>

<p><b>Ursula:</b> All right, hang on! (She takes the note, goes back into her apartment
and slams the door shut.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler, Monica, and Joey are sitting at the table eating
dinner and not talking. Ross and Rachel are outside cuddling on the balcony.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Pass the cheese, please.</p>

<p>(Joey hands her the cheese without looking at her.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> My God, you can&#146;t even look at me! Can you?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Nope.</p>

<p>(Phoebe enters.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (jumping up) Hey! Phoebe! We can talk to Phoebe!!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No. I&#146;m-I&#146;m to depressed to talk.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I&#146;ll give you a thousand dollars to talk to us.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (coming back in with Rachel) Hey, you guys! What do you, what do you think
about making that beach trip an annual thing?</p>

<p><b>Chandler, Monica, and Joey:</b> NO!!!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> All right, that&#146;s it, you guys! What happened out there?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What? We took a walk, nothing happened. I can back with nothing all over
me.</p>

<p><b>Ross and Rachel:</b> Come on!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What happened? Joey?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> All right. (gets up) </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (stopping him) No! Joey, we swore we&#146;d never tell!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (running over and joining Monica) They&#146;ll never understand!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, we have to say something! We have to get it out! It&#146;s eating me
alive!! Monica got stung by a jellyfish.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (interrupting) All right!! All right. (walks slowly into the living
room) I got stung. Stung bad. I couldn&#146;t stand. I-I couldn&#146;t walk.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (following Monica) We were two miles from the house. Scared and alone.
We didn&#146;t think we could make it. (He goes to put his hands on Monica&#146;s
shoulders but for some reason can quite complete the action and pulls back.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I was in too much pain.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> And I was tired from digging the huge hole!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> And then Joey remembered something.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I&#146;d seen this thing on <i>The Discovery Channel</i>...</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Wait a minute! I saw that! On <i>The Discovery Channel</i>, yeah! About
jellyfish and how if you... (stops suddenly and turns to look at Monica) Ewwww!! You peed
on yourself?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe and Rachel:</b> Ewwww!!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You can&#146;t say that!! You-you don&#146;t know!! I mean I thought I
was gonna pass out from the pain! Anyway I-I tried, but I-I couldn&#146;t...bend that way.
So... (looks at Joey.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe, Ross, and Rachel:</b> (turning to look at Joey) Ewwww!!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> That&#146;s right I stepped up! She&#146;s my friend and she needed help!
And if I had too, I&#146;d pee on anyone of you! Only, uhh, I couldn&#146;t. I got the
stage fright. I wanted to help, but there was too much pressure. So-so I uh, I turned to
Chandler.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (wails loudly into his hands) Joey kept screaming at me, &#147;Do it
now! Do it!! Do it! Do it now!!&#148; Sometimes late at night I can still here the
screaming.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (laughs) That&#146;s &#145;cause sometimes I just do it through my wall to
freak you out.</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe is finishing up a song.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (singing) &#147;...fuchsia and mauvvve. Those are the 66 colours of my
bedroommmm.&#148; (applause) Thank you, thank you. Ohh, and I invite you to count the
colours in your bedroom. (Sees that Phoebe Sr. has entered, and to her) Except for you.
You go away.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe Sr.:</b> I&#146;ll go in a second, I-I just wanted to tell you that there
hasn&#146;t been a day where I didn&#146;t regret giving you up.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, bye.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe Sr.:</b> No, I&#146;m not done. I-I-I just want you to know that I, the
reason I didn&#146;t look you up was, well I was afraid that you&#146;d react, just well
like, the way, the way you&#146;re reacting right now, and can&#146;t we just, y'know,
start from here?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe Sr.:</b> Sorry. But just one last thing. Y'know you came looking for family.
I&#146;m family, I&#146;m it. Now, now I&#146;m done. (starts to leave)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> But, it&#146;s not like we&#146;re losing anything. Y'know?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe Sr.:</b> Yeah, I guess you&#146;re right.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> It&#146;s not like we-we know each other or anything. Or that have <b>anything</b>
in common.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe Sr.:</b> Well, I don&#146;t know. I mean it&#146;s not like we don&#146;t
have <b>anything</b> in common. I mean I like uh, pizza.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I-I like pizza!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe Sr.:</b> You do?! Wait, I like umm, the Beetles.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh my God, so do I!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe Sr.:</b> I knew it, wow!!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Wait-wait-wait, wait! Puppies. Cute or ugly?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe Sr.:</b> Ohh, so cute.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Uh-huh, well! But umm, still I&#146;m-I&#146;m mad at you.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe Sr.:</b> I know. I&#146;m mad at me too.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well umm, do you wanna get something to eat? I&#146;m kinda hungry.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe Sr.:</b> Hey! Me too!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> All right, stop it. Now you&#146;re just doing it to freak me out.</p>

<p>[Scene: Rachel&#146;s bedroom. Ross and Rachel have just finished consummating the new
relationship.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh-hooo, I missed you.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I missed you too.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ooh, I was soo nervous about that letter. But the way you owned up to
everything, it just showed me how much you&#146;ve grown. Y'know?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (getting miffed) I suppose.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You have! Ross, you should give yourself credit. I mean my Mom <b>never</b>
thought this would work out. It was all, &#147;Once a cheater, always a cheater.&#148;</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (getting angry) Umm-hmm.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ooh, I just wish we hadn&#146;t lost those four months, but if time was
what you needed just to gain a little perspective...</p>

<p>[cut to Monica cleaning the floor in the kitchen]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (yelling from the bedroom) WE WERE ON A BREAK!!!!!!!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (entering with Joey) (to Monica) Coffee house?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You bet.</p>

<p>[cut back to Rachel&#146;s bedroom with both of them hurriedly getting dressed]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> And for the record, it took <b>two</b> people to break up this
relationship!!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah! You and that girl from that copy place, which yesterday you took
full responsibility for!!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I didn&#146;t know what I was taking full responsibility for! Okay?! I
didn&#146;t finish the whole letter!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?!!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I fell asleep!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You fell asleep?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> It was 5:30 in the morning, and you had rambled on for 18 pages. Front and
back!! (they go into the living room, trapping Monica, Chandler, and Joey in the kitchen)
(to Rachel) Oh-oh-oh, and by the way, Y-O-U-apostrophe-R-E means &#145;you are,&#146;
Y-O-U-R means &#145;your!&#146;</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Y'know I can&#146;t believe I even <b>thought</b> about getting back
together again! We are so over!!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (starts to cry) FINE BY ME!! (he opens the door and traps Chandler behind
it)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, oh, and hey-hey-hey, those little spelling tips will come in handy
when you&#146;re at home on Saturday nights playing <i>Scrabble</i> with Monica!!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey!!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (to Monica) Sorry!! (to Ross) I just feel bad about all that sleep
you&#146;re gonna miss wishing you were with me!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, no-no-no don&#146;t you worry about me falling asleep. I still have
your letter!!!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> And hey! Just so you know, it&#146;s <b>not</b> that common! It <b>doesn&#146;t</b>
happen to every guy! And it <b>is</b> a big deal!!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I KNEW IT!!!!</p>

<p align="center"><b>Closing Credits</b></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler and Monica are playing cards at the dinner
table.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (sets down some cards) Gin.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> We were playing Gin? Y'know if we were a couple, we could play this
game naked.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Will you stop!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay. All right.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay, all right, I think you&#146;re great, I think you&#146;re sweet,
and you&#146;re smart, and I love you. But you will always be the guy who peed on me.</p>
</font>

<p align="center"><b><font size="3">End</font></b></p>
</body>
</html>
402<html>

<head>
<title>The One With The Cat</title>
<meta name="GENERATOR" content="Microsoft FrontPage 3.0">
</head>

<body bgcolor="white" text="black" link="green" vlink="black" alink="yellow">

<h1 align="center">The One With The Cat</h1>

<hr>

<p>Written by: Jill Condon &amp; Any Toomin<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a></p>

<hr>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is eating breakfast as Chandler comes out of his
bedroom, ripping his coat in the process.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Wow! That ripped! That ripped real nice!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> How many times do I have to tell you! Ya, turn and sliiiide! Y'know, turn
and slide.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You don&#146;t turn and slide, you throw it out! I&#146;m tired of
having to get a tetanus shot every time I get dressed!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Look, we&#146;re not throwing it out! I built this thing with my own
hands!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All right, how about we, how &#145;bout we sell it.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> All right. But, you&#146;re gonna have to tell them. (He opens the cabinet
to reveal the chick and the duck living inside with Christmas lights and a disco ball as
decorations.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (nods his head) Do you mind if we stick you in another cabinet? (to
Joey) They seem all right with it!</p>

<p align="center"><b><font size="3">Opening Credits</font></b></p>

<p><font size="3">[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Ross are there. Monica is
checking the messages.]</p>

<p><b>Chip:</b> (on machine) Hey Monica, it&#146;s Chip.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yesss!!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Who&#146;s Chip?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Shhh!</p>

<p><b>Chip:</b> (on machine) Good runnin&#146; into you at the bank today, so ah,
here&#146;s my number, 555-9323. Give me a call. Later.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Chip, is Chip Matthews.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> The guy who took Rachel to the prom? Why is he calling you?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> &#145;Cause I ran into him at the bank, he is still soo cute.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Monica, you&#146;re so lucky! He&#146;s like the most popular guy in
school!!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I know!! (calls him) (on phone) Chip? Hi! It&#146;s Monica. (listens)
&#145;Kay. (listens) &#145;Kay. (listens) Okay. (listens) Okay, good-bye. (hangs up) Oh my
God, we just had <b>the</b> best conversation!! (goes into her room as Rachel enters)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (to Rachel) I was just leaving.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Good! &#145;Cause I&#146;ve got a product report to read, it&#146;s like
eight pages, I hope I don&#146;t fall asleep.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Why? Did you write it?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (sees Chip&#146;s phone number) Wow! Look at that, Chip Matthews called.
I wonder what he wants?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well ah, actually...</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (interrupting) I bet he sensed that I was ready to have sex with another
guy.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, umm, why don&#146;t you give him a call?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay. (picks up phone) Are you sure you wanna hear this?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, I&#146;m sure.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (on phone) Chip! Hi, it&#146;s Rachel. (listens) Rachel Green. Yeah,
umm, you left me a message. (listens) Yes you did, my roommate wrote it down. (listens)
Monica Geller. (listens) Ohh.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (whispering in her ear) Oh, that&#146;s right! He called to ask out
Monica! That-that&#146;s gotta be embarrassing! </p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe is finishing up a song.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (screaming, angrily) ...DUMB, DRUNKEN, BITCH!!! (applause) (happily)
Thank you, thanks.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (reading the newspaper) Hey, here&#146;s a question; where did you guys
get the finest oak East of the Mississippi?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Uh-huh, first you tell us where you got the prettiest lace in all the
land.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I&#146;m reading your ad.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Looks good, uh?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (reading the ad) Stunning entertainment center. Fine, (pause) fine
Italian craftsmanship. (Joey is very proud of himself)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh my God, you guys are selling the entertainment center?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Why? I love that thing.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You want it?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe and Rachel:</b> Oh no.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Ahh, Gepeto, $5,000 dollars? Are you insane?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey, the ad alone cost 300 bucks!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All right look, I&#146;m changing it to 50 bucks, or your best offer.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What kind of profit is that?! And you call yourself an accountant.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (looks at him) Nooo.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh. What do you do?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I can&#146;t believe you don&#146;t know what I do for a living!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, I actually don&#146;t know...</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Good, so do I</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Something to do with numbers?</p>

<p>[Cut to someone entering Central Perk which lets a cat in. The cat then runs over to
Phoebe&#146;s guitar case and starts sniffing around.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh my God! No! Shoo! Kitty! No! No-no-no! Shoo! Come on, you! (goes over
and picks up the cat) Come on. Crazy. (looks into the cat&#146;s eyes) Oh my God.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Nothing. Nothing.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What? What&#146;s wrong?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I just, I just have this really strong feeling that this cat is my
Mother.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You mean the mom you met in Montauk. She was a cat?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, no-no, <b>she</b> was a human lady. This is the spirit of my Mom
Lily, the one who killed herself.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Are you sure she&#146;s in the cat, or have you been taking your
grandma&#146;s glycoma medicine again?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No Dr. Skeptismo! I&#146;m sure. First of all, okay, there&#146;s the
feeling. (Chandler shrugs) Okay, and for another, how about the fact that she went into my
guitar case which is lined with orange felt. (Rachel nods her head in unsure agreement) My
Mother&#146;s favourite fish is Orange Roughy... (Joey thinks he understands, but then
nods that he has no clue.) Cats....like....fish! (Ross and Rachel are totally lost) (to
the cat) Hi, Mommy. (Rachel covers her mouth, in an &#147;Oh my God.&#148; gesture) Oh, I
haven&#146;t seen this smile in 17 years!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (to Chandler) Dude, Phoebe&#146;s mom has got a huge peni...</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (interrupting) Let it go!!</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is working as Monica enters.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Umm, when were you gonna tell me that you&#146;re going out with Chip
Matthews?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Now? Is it okay if I go out with Chip Matthews?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Nooo! It&#146;s not okay! I can&#146;t believe you would want to after
what he did to me!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What, that little thing at the prom?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Monica! I couldn&#146;t find him for two hours! He was having sex with
Amy Welch!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Come on, that was back in high school! How could that still bother you?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I mean why, of all people would you want to go out with Chip?!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Look, you and I went to different high schools...</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, that doesn&#146;t help me, because we went to the same high
school.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You went to one where you were popular, and you got to ride off
Chip&#146;s motorcycle, and wear his letterman jacket. I went to one where I wore a band
uniform they had to have specially made.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (shocked) They had to have that specially made?!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> It was a project for one of the Home Ec classes.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (stunned) Oh my God, they told us that was for the mascot!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Back then, I thought that I would never, ever get the chance to go out
with a Chip Matthews, and now he&#146;s-he&#146;s called me up and asked me out. And the
fat girl inside of me really wants to go. I-I owe her this. I never let her eat.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, you go out with him. (goes over and hugs her) </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, really?!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah. Just, if it&#146;s possible, could you leave him somewhere and go
have sex with another guy?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I&#146;ll try.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the next morning, they are all there eating breakfast.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> So you guys having any luck getting rid of the entertainment center?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, there were a couple of calls last night, but ah, I don&#146;t think
any of them are gonna work out.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes, Joey has a very careful screening process. Apparently, not
everyone is qualified to own wood and nails.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (is struggling with the cat) Stop it! Stop it! She keeps squirming,
trying to get away! Just like when she was alive.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> So Pheebs, how long is your mom gonna be with us?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, I&#146;m not sure. I mean, I guess until she y'know, gets used to
the fact that there&#146;s y'know, a new mom. Y'know, I think she&#146;s worried that
y'know, she&#146;s gonna, she&#146;s gonna be replaced. (to the cat, in a funny voice)
Well, that&#146;s not gonna happen is it? Noo. (gets up) Okay, I have to return a call in
the other room.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Why can&#146;t you use the phone in here?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, I&#146;m returning a call from a certain mom at the B-E-A-C-H. I
just spelled the wrong word. (goes into Monica&#146;s room)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> So, guys, am I crazy, or does Phoebe&#146;s mom remind anyone of a <b>cat</b>?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Ross, don&#146;t start.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Come on, you-you can&#146;t tell me you actually believe that-that
there&#146;s a woman inside that cat!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I believe it.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No you don&#146;t. </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yes, I do.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No you do&#151;y'know what, you&#146;re not gonna suck me into this.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh sure I am, because you always have to be right.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I do not always have to be&#151;okay, okay. (starts to leave)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> <i>Jurassic Park</i> could happen.</p>

<p>(Ross wants to say something, but just smiles and leaves.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey and Chandler are showing a couple of guys (Tony and
Peter) the entertainment center.]</p>

<p><b>Tony:</b> Wow! That&#146;s ah, that&#146;s pretty nice!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Pretty nice?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You&#146;ll have to pardon my roommate, he wanted to marry this.</p>

<p><b>Tony:</b> We don&#146;t have 50 bucks, but would you be willing to trade for it?
We&#146;ve got a canoe.</p>

<p>(Joey jumps up in excitement and without turning around Chandler holds out his hand
stopping him, and ushering him back into his seat. Joey sits down, dejected.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Y'know, I, I really don&#146;t think we need a canoe.</p>

<p><b>Tony:</b> You gotta take the canoe!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All right, just, just take the entertainment center, and then when you
get home, throw the canoe away!</p>

<p><b>Peter:</b> We&#146;re not throwing it away! I built that canoe! (starts to leave as
Tony chases after him)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (to Peter) Good for you!!</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Chandler, Joey, Monica, and Ross are there.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (entering) You guys, you&#146;re never gonna believe what I just found
tacked up on a telephone pole! (She&#146;s holding a flyer.) Look kinda familiar?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (taking the flyer) Apparently Phoebe&#146;s mother also goes by the name
Julio.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You guys, there&#146;s a little girl in Soho looking for this cat. I
mean, you know what that means?!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (looking at the flyer) Yeah-eah! 200 dollar reward, split five ways!!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Do we have to tell her?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yes, we have to tell her!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, but it&#146;s made her so happy.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (holds up a hand) Little girl misses her cat. (hold up the other hand)
Crazy lady thinks her mother is in a cat. (gets up) Okay, y'know what, I have to go have
dinner with my son, can I trust that when you see Phoebe, you will tell her.</p>

<p><b>All:</b> (disappointed) Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Thank you.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I <b>hate</b> when Ross is right!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> He is right, isn&#146;t he?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Y'know what, I think this might be one of the times he&#146;s wrong.</p>

<p><b>All:</b> You think?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh-no, he&#146;s right.</font></p>

<p align="center"><b><font size="3">Commercial Break</font></b></p>

<p><font size="3">[Scene: Central Perk, the same scene is continued from before the break.
With Joey, Monica, Rachel, and Chandler sitting on the couch.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (entering, with Julio) Hi. (sits down in the chair)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Uh, Pheebs, about your mom...</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (pause) How&#146;s that going?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> So great. Oh, we took a nap today and my Mom fell asleep on my tummy and
purred.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> That&#146;s so sweet. (pause) I&#146;m gonna get some coffee. (gets up and
leaves)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (sliding into Joey&#146;s place on the couch to try and talk to Phoebe)
Huh? What&#146;d ya say Joe? I&#146;ll be right there. (gets up and joins Joey)</p>

<p>(Rachel and Chandler slide into position.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Pheebs...</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I just feel so, uhh.....</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> All right!!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I&#146;m coming already!!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Jeez!</p>

<p>(They both get up and leave Phoebe alone.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is reading at the kitchen table as there is a knock
on the door.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (running from the bathroom to her room, wearing only a towel) Not yet!
Not yet! Not yet! Not yet! Not yet! Not yet! Not yet! Not yet! (gets to her room and
closes the door, as Rachel gets up to answer the door.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hello, Chip.</p>

<p><b>Chip:</b> Hey, Rach! How ya doin&#146;?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I&#146;m great! I&#146;m great. I&#146;ve got a great job at <i>Bloomingdale&#146;s</i>,
have wonderful friends, and eventhough I&#146;m not seeing anyone right now, I&#146;ve
never felt better about myself.</p>

<p><b>Chip:</b> So ah, Monica ready yet?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> She&#146;ll be out in a second. So, Chip, how&#146;s umm, Amy Welch?</p>

<p><b>Chip:</b> Amy Welch? Wow! I haven&#146;t seen her since... So, Monica about ready?</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is showing off the entertainment center.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> This is the unit for you my friend. Sturdy construction, tons of storage
compartments, some big enough to fit a grown man.</p>

<p><b>Guy:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh yeah! I got in there myself once. My roommate bet me five bucks that I
couldn&#146;t, and then he stuck a board through the handles that locked me in. Yeah. It
was funny &#145;til I started feeling like I was in a coffin.</p>

<p><b>Guy:</b> No, you, you can&#146;t fit in that thing. That&#146;s not deep enough.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh yeah? (opens up the center and takes out the stereo) If I can&#146;t,
I&#146;ll knock five bucks off the price off the unit.</p>

<p><b>Guy:</b> All right, you have yourself a deal. (shakes his hand)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay. (he gets in the unit and closes the door) See?! I told ya! </p>

<p>(The guys takes a hockey stick and slips it through the handles then proceeds to take
the stereo and Chandler&#146;s computer and walk out.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Sometimes I get in here just to get away from it! Hey, a nickel!!</p>

<p>[Scene: A street, Chip is walking Monica to his motorcycle.]</p>

<p><b>Chip:</b> Here, we are.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh my God! You still have the Chipper!</p>

<p><b>Chip:</b> The what?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> That&#146;s what we used to call your ah, your motorcycle in high
school. Y'know how a motorcycle is a Chopper, and you&#146;re Chip. Nevermind.</p>

<p><b>Chip:</b> No, I think it&#146;s cute. (kisses her)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Wow! A lipper from Chipper.</p>

<p><b>Chip:</b> So you still in touch with anyone from high school?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Umm. Well, there&#146;s Rachel, and umm, I think that&#146;s it. How
bout you?</p>

<p><b>Chip:</b> Oh yeah, I still hang with Simmons and Zana, y'know. I see Spindler a lot.
Devane, Kelly, and I run into Goldie from time to time. Steve Brown, Zuchoff, McGwire,
J.T., Breadsly.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Is that all?</p>

<p><b>Chip:</b> Ehh, y'know after high school, you just kinda lose touch. Oh yeah! I ran
into Richard Dorfman.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Ohh, how is he?</p>

<p><b>Chip:</b> Not so good, Simmons and I gave him a wedgie.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Isn&#146;t he an architect now?</p>

<p><b>Chip:</b> Yeah, they still wear underwear.</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is coming home. As we walks through the door, and
without looking up, he goes to throw his keys on the foosball table, only, it&#146;s gone
and the keys it the floor. He then looks up at an empty apartment; everything is gone
except for the entertainment center and that ceramic dog. Even the food in the fridge!]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> OH MY GOD!!!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (still trapped in the entertainment center) WHAT?!! </p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Are you all right?!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah...</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (lets him out) What happened?!!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (getting out) Awww, man! He promised he wouldn&#146;t take the chairs!!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What the hell happened?!! How were you locked in?!! And where the hell
is all of our stuff?!!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, this guy came by to look at the unit and-and he said he didn&#146;t
think big enough to fit a grown man!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> So&#151;You got in <b>voluntarily</b>?!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I was tryin&#146; to make a sale!! Oh, man, if I ever run into that guy
again, do you know what I&#146;m gonna do?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> BEND OVER?!!!</p>

<p>[Scene: Dot&#146;s Spot, Chip and Monica are on there date, eating dinner. Chip is
telling a story.]</p>

<p><b>Chip:</b> ...and then Zana, just let one rip!! (laughs histerically)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Look, not that I enjoy talking about people who I went to high school
with, &#145;cause I do, but umm, maybe we could talk about something else? Like you, I
don&#146;t even know where you work?</p>

<p><b>Chip:</b> You know where I work!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I do?</p>

<p><b>Chip:</b> The movie theatre, you used to come in all the time.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You still work at the multiplex?</p>

<p><b>Chip:</b> Oh, like I&#146;d give up that job! Free popcorn and candy, anytime I
want. I can get you free posters for your room.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Thanks, I&#146;m set. Do you still live with your parents?</p>

<p><b>Chip:</b> Oh yeah, but I can stay out as late as I want.</p>

<p>(Monica takes a big swig of her martini.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Rachel, Phoebe, and Julio are consoling Joey and
Chandler.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Wow! They really got you guys. Your T.V. The chairs.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh yeah, your microwave. The stereo.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (looking through a deck of cards) Aww, man, he took the five of spades!!
Oh, no-no-no, here it is!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (entering) Oh my God! What happened?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, umm, Joey was born, and then 28 years later, I was robbed!!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (to Monica) So, how was your date?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well, y'know how I always wanted to go out with Chip Matthews in high
school?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Um-hmm.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well, tonight, I actually went out with Chip Matthews in high school.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh honey, I&#146;m sorry.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No, it&#146;s okay, not only did I get to go out with Chip Matthews, I
got to dump Chip Matthews.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ohh! That&#146;s so great!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I know!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (entering) Hey! So ah, what did the insurance company say?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, they said uh, &#147;You don&#146;t have insurance here, so stop
calling us.&#148;</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (seeing Phoebe still with cat) You didn&#146;t tell her?! (They all kinda
shy away.) Okay, fine! Pheebs?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah? (sees Ross) Hi!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hi! Listen uhh, this cat belongs to a little girl. There are flyers all
over the place.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I&#146;m sorry, sweetie. (shows her the flyer)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey, we can take her back with you if you want.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ohh. Um-hmm. But y'know, she choose to find me. I mean, I have to
respect her decision. Right?</p>

<p><b>Chandler, Monica, Joey, and Rachel:</b> That&#146;s a good call. Right.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No! No! Look&#151;Hey, enough is enough! Look, I am sorry that you feel
guilty or whatever about spending time with your new mom, but this is not your old mom.
This is a cat! Okay, Julio the cat! Not mom! Cat!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (she turns around and puts the cat on the entertainment center) Ross,
how many parents have you lost?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> None.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, then you don&#146;t know what it feels like when one of them comes
back. Do you? I believe this is my Mother. Even if I&#146;m wrong, who cares? Just be a
friend. Okay? Be supportive.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I&#146;m sorry.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I don&#146;t know what to say.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You could.... say you&#146;re sorry to her mom.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I think she would like that.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (goes over to Julio) Come here, here, come here, come here, (pause) Mrs.
Buffay. Sorry, about what I said, umm, it was, it was insensitive of me to say that you
were just a cat. When clearly you are also the reincarnated spirit, of my friend&#146;s
mother.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Thank you. We both forgive you.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> So honey, what are you gonna do about the little girl?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, okay, listen, umm, Mom, I hope you know you still mean a lot to
me. And you&#146;re welcome to come back anytime.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Pheebs, if she could come back as a couch, we&#146;d really appreciate
it. (Joey nods in agreement)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Come on, Mom, I&#146;ll take you home.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I&#146;ll go with you.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Me too. (they all leave)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh! Y'know, I&#146;ve got an extra futon.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Dude, you don&#146;t have to brag! We got nothing here!!</p>

<p align="center"><b>Closing Credits</b></p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey and Chandler have trading the entertainment center
for the canoe. Joey is sitting in the bow, staring off into space as to envision his
future full of possibilities. Chandler is sitting at the stern, staring into space and is
looking at an uncertain future.]</p>

<p align="center"></font><strong>End</strong></p>
</body>
</html>
