<body bgcolor="#FFFFFF" link="#008000">

<h1 align="center">The One With The &#145;Cuffs</h1>

<hr>

<p>Written by: Seth Kirkland<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a><br>
With Help from: <a href="mailto:dpartrid@novell.com">Darcy Partridge</a></p>

<hr>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is sitting in the canoe as Joey runs through the
door carrying an outdoor patio table.]</p>

<p><strong>Joey: </strong>Hey!! We are <strong>so</strong> in luck! Treeger said that we
could have all this cool stuff from the basement. Wait right there. (Goes back into the
hall)</p>

<p><strong>Chandler</strong>: Oh no-no-no, I&#146;m, I&#146;m paddling away!</p>

<p><strong>Joey:</strong> (Returning carrying a couple of rusted lawn chairs) Huh?!</p>

<p><strong>Chandler:</strong> Wow! Really?! We get all this rusty crap for free?!</p>

<p><strong>Joey:</strong> Uh-huh. This <strong>and</strong> a bunch of bubble wrap. And,
some of it is not even popped! </p>

<p>(They both sit down at the table and the chick and the duck enter from Joey&#146;s
bedroom.)</p>

<p><strong>Chandler:</strong> Could we <strong>be</strong> more white trash?</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Opening Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica, Ross, Phoebe, and Rachel are eating breakfast.]</p>

<p><strong>Monica</strong>: (Entering from her bedroom) How desperate am I?</p>

<p><strong>Rachel</strong>: Oh! Good thing Chandler&#146;s not here, he always wins at
this game.</p>

<p><strong>Monica</strong>: I just told my Mom I&#146;d cater a party for her.</p>

<p><strong>Phoebe</strong>: How come?</p>

<p><strong>Monica:</strong> Because I need the money, and I thought that it&#146;d be a
great way to get rid of that last little schmidgen of self-respect.</p>

<p><strong>Ross: </strong>Come on, I think this is a good thing. I don&#146;t think Mom
would&#146;ve hired you if she didn&#146;t think you were good at what you do.</p>

<p><strong>Monica</strong>: You don&#146;t have to stick up for her. She can&#146;t here
you.</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is reading the paper and Chandler is getting ready
for work.]</p>

<p><strong>Rachel: </strong>(entering) Hey! Umm, do you guys have any juice?</p>

<p><strong>Joey:</strong> Just pickle.</p>

<p><strong>Chandler:</strong> Hey uh, Rach, funny story. I ah, bumped into Joanna on the
street yesterday.</p>

<p><strong>Rachel: </strong>My boss, Joanna? Wow, that must&#146;ve been awkward.</p>

<p><strong>Chandler:</strong> Well, no, actually she uh, asked me if I wanted to get a
drink.</p>

<p><strong>Rachel</strong>: (laughs) You ah, you didn&#146;t say &#145;Yes&#146; to that
did you?</p>

<p><strong>Chandler: </strong>(laughs) No. No!</p>

<p><strong>Joanna</strong>: (Coming out of the shower wearing nothing but a towel) Hello,
Rachel. (She goes into Chandler&#146;s bedroom)</p>

<p><strong>Chandler:</strong> Well, not at first.</p>

<p><strong>Rachel:</strong> What is she doing here?</p>

<p>(Joey makes a sound like a creaking bed.)</p>

<p><strong>Rachel:</strong> I don&#146;t understand! Last time you went out with her you
said she was a &#145;big, dull dud.&#146;</p>

<p><strong>Chandler:</strong> Well, I think I judged her too quickly, and this time we
were able to take the relationship to the next level.</p>

<p>(Joey creaks louder)</p>

<p><strong>Rachel</strong>: Well, last time I almost got fired. You must end it, you must
end it now!</p>

<p><strong>Chandler: </strong>Oh, come on! It&#146;s not like this is an everyday
occurrence for me! I mean usually I&#146;m pretty much just in there by myself.</p>

<p>(Joey makes a sound imitating one person making a bed creak and Chandler turns and
glares at him.)</p>

<p><strong>Rachel:</strong> Chandler!! (He turns around quickly) Promise me, you will end
it.</p>

<p><strong>Chandler:</strong> Okay, I promise, I&#146;ll end it.</p>

<p><strong>Rachel</strong>: Thank you.</p>

<p><strong>Chandler</strong>: I hope you know what I&#146;m giving up for ya, because
she&#146;s not just the boss in your office, if you know what I mean.</p>

<p><strong>Joey:</strong> Yeah-eh-eah! (Rachel glares at him) Oh-oh, sorry, I-I knew what
he meant.</p>

<p>[Scene: The Geller household kitchen, Monica and Phoebe are cooking for Mrs.
Geller&#146;s party.]</p>

<p><strong>Mrs. Geller: </strong>(entering) How&#146;s the hired help?</p>

<p><strong>Monica: </strong>Doing great, the quiches are coming along.</p>

<p><strong>Mrs. Geller:</strong> What&#146;s this? Blue nail polish?</p>

<p><strong>Monica</strong>: Yeah, I thought it was cute.</p>

<p><strong>Mrs. Geller:</strong> Ahh, that&#146;s what your Grandmother&#146;s hands
looked like when we found her.</p>

<p><strong>Monica:</strong> Let me ask you a question.</p>

<p><strong>Mrs. Geller</strong>: Hmm.</p>

<p><strong>Monica:</strong> Why did you hire me?</p>

<p><strong>Mrs. Geller:</strong> Oh, well Richard raved about the food at his party, of
course you were sleeping with him. Then I heard the food at that lesbian wedding was very
nice, I assume you weren&#146;t sleeping with anybody there. Though, at least that would
be something. (Leaves)</p>

<p><strong>Monica:</strong> (to Phoebe) Oh my God! Did you hear that? She hired me because
she thinks I&#146;m good.</p>

<p><strong>Phoebe: </strong>Okay, I didn&#146;t hear that.</p>

<p><strong>Monica:</strong> Oh yeah, she didn&#146;t hire me out of pity, it wasn&#146;t
so she could pick on me in front of her friends, she actually thinks I&#146;m good.</p>

<p><strong>Phoebe:</strong> Wow! And hey, it&#146;s cool if you&#146;re a lesbian! (Gives
her a thumbs up)</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is scrapping gum off the table as there is a knock on
the door. He goes over and opens it.]</p>

<p><strong>The Salesman:</strong> (Entering before Joey can say anything) Good afternoon,
are you the decision maker of the house?</p>

<p><strong>Joey:</strong> Uhhhh. (He&#146;s not sure)</p>

<p><strong>The Salesman:</strong> Do you ah, currently own a set of encyclopedias? </p>

<p><strong>Joey:</strong> No! No. But ah, try the classifieds, people sell everything in
there.</p>

<p><strong>The Salesman:</strong> Actually, I&#146;m not buying. I&#146;m selling. Let me
ask you one question. Do your friends ever have a conversation and you just nod along even
though you&#146;re not really sure what they&#146;re talking about?</p>

<p>(We go into a flashback sequence with Joey remembering some of those times.)</p>

<p>[Cut to Monica and Rachel&#146;s apartment, all are there.]</p>

<p><strong>Ross</strong>: &#133;I&#146;m telling you it&#146;s totally unconstituional.</p>

<p><strong>Monica, Chandler, Phoebe, and Rachel:</strong> Oh yeah, I totally agree.</p>

<p>(Joey just nods his head.)</p>

<p>[Cut to Central Perk, the entire gang is there.]</p>

<p><strong>Monica: </strong>&#133;I think he deserves a Nobel Prize. (Joey starts to nod
&#145;Yes.&#146;)</p>

<p><strong>All: </strong>Nooo!! (Joey quickly stops nodding his head.)</p>

<p>[Cut to Monica and Rachel&#146;s, they&#146;re all there playing cards.]</p>

<p><strong>Chandler:</strong> &#133;it was like the Algonquin kids table. (They all laugh,
but Joey only laughs not to be left out.)</p>

<p>[Cut back to the present day.]</p>

<p><strong>The Salesman: </strong>(Interrupting the flashback) Excuse me, I&#146;m sorry,
you haven&#146;t said anything for about two and a half minutes, are you at all
interested?</p>

<p><strong>Joey:</strong> Yeah-well-yeah! Yeah-oh-yeah. Come on in.</p>

<p>[Scene: The Geller&#146;s Kitchen, Monica and Phoebe are still cooking.]</p>

<p><strong>Phoebe: </strong>That&#146;s weird.</p>

<p><strong>Monica: </strong>What?</p>

<p><strong>Phoebe:</strong> Your nails.</p>

<p><strong>Monica: </strong>Oh, I know, I never wear fake ones. I just did it so my Mom
wouldn&#146;t give me grief about me biting them.</p>

<p><strong>Phoebe:</strong> Oh, no, I meant that it&#146;s weird that you only have nine
now.</p>

<p><strong>Monica:</strong> (Looks at her nails) Oh my God. Wait a minute, I had them
put&#133; (realises) Oh my God! It&#146;s in the quiche! Oh My God!</p>

<p><strong>Phoebe:</strong> Okay, don&#146;t panic. I&#146;m gonna go to the store,
I&#146;m gonna get you another set of nails, no one&#146;s gonna know, and you&#146;re
gonna look great. (She runs over to get her coat.) Oh! Oh, it&#146;s &#145;cause
they&#146;re gonna eat&#151;that&#146;s the problem.</p>

<p><strong>Mrs. Geller:</strong> (entering) (to Monica) Honey, don&#146;t bite your nails.</p>

<p><strong>Monica: </strong>Okay ah, please don&#146;t freak out. Umm, but ah,
there&#146;s a blue fingernail in one of the quiche cups, and there&#146;s no way to know
which one.</p>

<p><strong>Phoebe: </strong>And! Whoever finds it wins the prize!</p>

<p><strong>Mrs. Geller:</strong> (laughs) I&#146;m not freaking out.</p>

<p><strong>Monica: </strong>Then why are you laughing?</p>

<p><strong>Mrs. Geller:</strong> It&#146;s nothing, it&#146;s just that now your Father
owes me five dollars.</p>

<p><strong>Monica: </strong>What? You bet I&#146;d lose a nail?</p>

<p><strong>Mrs. Geller: </strong>Oh no, don&#146;t be silly. I just bet I&#146;d need
these. (Opens the freezer to reveal&#133;)</p>

<p><strong>Monica: </strong>Frozen lasagnas?</p>

<p><strong>Mrs. Geller:</strong> Um-hmm.</p>

<p><strong>Monica:</strong> You bet that I&#146;d screw up?! So all that stuff about
hiring me because I was good was&#133;</p>

<p><strong>Mrs. Geller</strong>: No-no-no, that was all true. This was just in case you
pulled a Monica.</p>

<p><strong>Monica</strong>: You promised Dr. Weinburg, you&#146;d never use that phrase.</p>

<p><strong>Mrs. Geller: </strong>Oh honey, come on, have a sense of humour, you&#146;ve
never been able to laugh at yourself.</p>

<p><strong>Monica: </strong>(laughs) That&#146;s right. My Mom doesn&#146;t have any faith
in me! Oh, that&#146;s hilarious! Ha-ha-ha-ha-ha.</p>

<p><strong>Phoebe:</strong> I don&#146;t get it.</p>

<p><strong>Mrs. Geller:</strong> No, I have faith&#133;</p>

<p><strong>Monica: </strong>(interrupting) No! You have lasagnas! (Storms out and an
awkward silence follows.)</p>

<p><strong>Oven:</strong> Ding!</p>

<p><strong>Phoebe:</strong> Op, the ruined quiches are ready.</p>

<p>[Scene: Joanna&#146;s office, Joanna and Chandler are making out on her chair. Chandler
isn&#146;t wearing any pants.]</p>

<p><strong>Chandler:</strong> It just doesn&#146;t&#133;feel like we&#146;re breaking up.</p>

<p><strong>Joanna: </strong>No, we are. I&#146;m sad.</p>

<p><strong>Chandler:</strong> Okay.</p>

<p>(They start kissing again, but are interrupted by the phone.</p>

<p><strong>Joanna:</strong> (answering the phone) Yes. (listens) Uh, can&#146;t you wait
until tomorrow? (listens) All right. (hangs up) Unbelievable!!</p>

<p><strong>Chandler:</strong> Thanks.</p>

<p><strong>Joanna:</strong> No, no, that was my boss. I have to go.</p>

<p><strong>Chandler:</strong> Okay. (Starts to button up his shirt)</p>

<p><strong>Joanna: </strong>What are you doing?</p>

<p><strong>Chandler</strong>: I&#146;m getting dressed.</p>

<p><strong>Joanna:</strong> Why?</p>

<p><strong>Chandler:</strong> When I walk outside naked people throw garbage at me.</p>

<p><strong>Joanna</strong>: Wait. I wanna show you something.</p>

<p><strong>Chandler</strong>: What is it?</p>

<p><strong>Joanna</strong>: Just a little gag gift somebody gave me. (She&#146;s holding a
pair of handcuffs) Put your hands together.</p>

<p><strong>Chandler:</strong> Ah-ha, you&#146;re not the boss of me. (She kisses him)
Yeah, you are! (She handcuffs him to the chair) Ooh, saucy.</p>

<p><strong>Joanna: </strong>(kisses him) I&#146;ll be back in ten minutes. (Starts to
leave)</p>

<p><strong>Chandler:</strong> You are, you&#146;re gonna leave me like this?</p>

<p><strong>Joanna:</strong> Knowing you&#146;re here, waiting for me I think it&#146;s
kinda exciting.</p>

<p><strong>Chandler:</strong> Okay. But if you don&#146;t come back soon, (She leaves and
closes the door) there&#146;s pretty much nothing I can do about it!</p>

<p>[Cut to Joanna&#146;s outer office, where Rachel and Sophie work. They are both coming
back from lunch.]</p>

<p><strong>Joanna:</strong> (locking her door) Oh.</p>

<p><strong>Sophie: </strong>Hi! I brought you back a macaroon!</p>

<p><strong>Joanna: </strong>Oh great! I&#146;ll keep it in my butt with your nose. (She
grabs the cookie and walks out.)</p>

<p><strong>Rachel: </strong>That&#146;s weird, she locked the door.</p>

<p><strong>Sophie:</strong> Y&#146;know why? She&#146;s got the Christmas bonus list in
there. I saw her working on it this morning.</p>

<p><strong>Rachel:</strong> Okay, swear you won&#146;t tell, but when Mark left he gave me
a key to Joanna&#146;s office. Do you wanna see the list?</p>

<p><strong>Sophie:</strong> Yeah!</p>

<p>(Rachel unlocks and opens the door to reveal a half-naked Chandler handcuffed to the
chair. They both gasp and Chandler stares at them in shock and surprise.)</p>

<p><strong>Chandler: </strong>Hi! (to Sophie) How are you?</p>

<p>(Rachel and Sophie both back out and close the door without saying anything.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Commercial Break</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Joanna&#146;s office, Chandler, still handcuffed to the chair, is looking
through the lingerie catalogue by turning the pages with his teeth. The phone rings and
Chandler answers it with his nose.]</p>

<p><strong>Chandler: </strong>Hello, Joanna&#133;(Realises he doesn&#146;t know her last
name)&#133;&#146;s office.</p>

<p><strong>Joanna:</strong> (on speaker phone) I&#146;m really sorry but I may be a little
while longer.</p>

<p><strong>Chandler:</strong> How little?!</p>

<p><strong>Joanna: </strong>A couple of hours, I feel awful.</p>

<p><strong>Chandler:</strong> Look, this isn&#146;t funny! You get back here right now!</p>

<p><strong>Joanna:</strong> I can&#146;t!!</p>

<p><strong>Chandler: </strong>Why not?!</p>

<p><strong>Joanna:</strong> I&#146;m in my boss&#146;s car!</p>

<p><strong>Chandler:</strong> What?!</p>

<p><strong>Joanna: </strong>Uh-oh, tunnel. (The phone gets cut off)</p>

<p>(Chandler gets an idea)</p>

<p>[Cut to Rachel&#146;s office as her intercom buzzes.]</p>

<p><strong>Rachel:</strong> (answering it) (angrily) What?!</p>

<p><strong>Chandler:</strong> (in a serious, businesslike tone) Rachel, could I see you
for a moment?</p>

<p>(Rachel goes into talk to Chandler.)</p>

<p><strong>Chandler:</strong> Okay, here&#146;s the situation. The keys to the cuffs are
on the back of the door. Could you be a doll and grab them and scoot on over and unlock
me? And on a totally different subject, that is a lovely pantsuit.</p>

<p><strong>Rachel: </strong>You <strong>promised</strong> you would break up with her!</p>

<p><strong>Chandler: </strong>I did break up with her! She just took it really, really
well!</p>

<p><strong>Rachel:</strong> And the fact that you were jeopardising my career never
entered your mind?!</p>

<p><strong>Chandler:</strong> It did enter my mind! But then something happened that made
it, shoot right out.</p>

<p><strong>Rachel:</strong> Y'know what Chandler, you got yourself into those cuffs, you
get yourself out of them.</p>

<p><strong>Chandler:</strong> No-no-no-no-no-no-no!! I can&#146;t get myself right out of
them! You must have me confused with the Amazing Chandler!! Come on, you have to unlock
me, she could be gone for hours, and I&#146;m cold, and (Stops and looks up the skirt on a
statue behind Joanna&#146;s desk.)</p>

<p><strong>Rachel: </strong>Oh, Chandler!! All right, this is it! (Grabs the key) You
never see Joanna again!</p>

<p><strong>Chandler:</strong> Never!</p>

<p><strong>Rachel:</strong> You never come into this office again!</p>

<p><strong>Chandler:</strong> Fine!</p>

<p><strong>Rachel: </strong>You give me back my Walkman!</p>

<p><strong>Chandler:</strong> I&#151;never borrowed your Walkman.</p>

<p><strong>Rachel: </strong>Well, then I lost it. You buy me one!</p>

<p><strong>Chandler:</strong> You got it! Here we go! Come on! This is great! (Rachel goes
over and unlocks the handcuffs) Ahhh! (He starts rubbing his wrist)</p>

<p><strong>Rachel: </strong>Does it hurt?</p>

<p><strong>Chandler: </strong>No, I just always see guys doing this when they get
handcuffs taken off them. (He runs over to where his pants are hanging) Hello sweet pants!</p>

<p><strong>Rachel:</strong> Wait a minute! What are you gonna tell Joanna?</p>

<p><strong>Chandler: </strong>About what?</p>

<p><strong>Rachel:</strong> When she sees that you&#146;re gone, she&#146;s gonna know
that I let you out, and that I was in here, and I&#146;m gonna get fired!</p>

<p><strong>Chandler: </strong>I&#146;ll make something up! I&#146;m good at lying, I
actually did borrow your Walkman!</p>

<p><strong>Rachel: </strong>No, there&#146;s nothing to make up, she&#146;s gonna know
that I have a key to her office, I&#146;ve got to get you locked up back the way you were!
(She tries to drag him over to the chair, but Chandler stops her.)</p>

<p><strong>Chandler:</strong> Oh-ho-ho, I don&#146;t think so!</p>

<p>(He starts to put his pants on, but Rachel manages to drag him to the chair. When they
get to the chair, Chandler drops his pants and knocks the chair away. Rachel then backs
him up and locks him to the top drawer of a filing cabinet.)</p>

<p><strong>Chandler:</strong> Well, this is much better.</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, The salesman is trying to sell Joey the encyclopedias.]</p>

<p><strong>The Salesman:</strong> So, here&#146;s somebody interesting, Joey. What do you
know about Van Gogh?</p>

<p><strong>Joey:</strong> He cut off his ear.</p>

<p><strong>The Salesman: </strong>And?</p>

<p><strong>Joey:</strong> I&#146;m out.</p>

<p><strong>The Salesman:</strong> He painted that. (Points to one of his paintings in the
book)</p>

<p><strong>Joey:</strong> Wow! That&#146;s pretty nice. I thought he cut off his ear
&#145;cause he sucked. What else you got in there?</p>

<p><strong>The Salesman:</strong> Let&#146;s see, ahhh&#133; Where does the Pope live?</p>

<p><strong>Joey:</strong> In the woods. No wait-wait, that&#146;s the joke answer.</p>

<p><strong>The Salesman:</strong> Actually its, Vatican City. Now ahh, what do you know
about vulcanised rubber?</p>

<p><strong>Joey: </strong>Spock&#146;s birth control.</p>

<p><strong>The Salesman:</strong> (laughs) You <strong>need</strong> these books.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica&#146;s childhood bedroom (which has been turned into a gym), Monica is
lying on the treadmill as Phoebe enters.]</p>

<p><strong>Phoebe:</strong> Hey!</p>

<p><strong>Monica: </strong>Hi.</p>

<p><strong>Phoebe:</strong> This used to be your room? (She nods &#145;Yes&#146;) Wow! You
must&#146;ve been in really good shape as a kid.</p>

<p><strong>Monica:</strong> Ohh, I&#146;m such an idiot. I can&#146;t believe I actually
thought she could change.</p>

<p><strong>Phoebe:</strong> Well, who cares what your Mom thinks? So you pulled a Monica.</p>

<p><strong>Monica: </strong>Oh good, I&#146;m glad that&#146;s catching on.</p>

<p><strong>Phoebe:</strong> No but, why does that have to be a bad thing. Just change what
it means. Y'know? Go down there and prove your Mother wrong. Finish the job you were hired
to do, and we&#146;ll call that pulling a Monica.</p>

<p><strong>Monica: </strong>What?</p>

<p><strong>Phoebe: </strong>Okay, umm, if a kid gets straight A&#146;s, his parents would
say, &quot;Yeah, he pulled a Monica.&quot; Y'know? Or a fireman saves a baby, and they go,
&quot;Yeah I know, he pulled a Monica.&quot; Or someone hits a homerun and the announcer
says, &quot;Yeah, that one&#146;s outta here.&quot; Though some things don&#146;t change.</p>

<p><strong>Monica: </strong>(getting up) All right, I&#146;ll go down there. But, I&#146;m
not gonna serve the lasagna. I&#146;m gonna serve something I make.</p>

<p>(She exits and Phoebe goes over and sits down at the machine that works your shoulders
and tries to do one, which she does, easily.)</p>

<p><strong>Phoebe:</strong> Wow! My breasts are really strong. (She goes and joins
Monica.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Joanna&#146;s office, Rachel and Chandler are having a little tug-of-war with
his pants.]</p>

<p><strong>Rachel:</strong> Chandler! Chandler, please, I have to get you locked up back
the way you were, I am sooo gonna lose my job, she&#146;s very private about her office.
Now I know why.</p>

<p><strong>Chandler:</strong> Hey, look, you&#146;re in trouble either way! Okay? If she
comes back and sees me locked to this instead of the chair, she&#146;s gonna know you were
in here. So you might as well just let me go.</p>

<p><strong>Rachel: </strong>What if I clean your bathroom for a month?</p>

<p><strong>Chandler:</strong> It still wouldn&#146;t be clean. (Rachel makes an &#145;Eww,
disgusting!&#146; face) All I want is my freedom.</p>

<p><strong>Rachel: </strong>Foot rubs for a month!</p>

<p><strong>Chandler: </strong>Freedom!</p>

<p><strong>Rachel: </strong>I&#146;ll take all of your photos and put them into photo
albums!</p>

<p><strong>Chandler:</strong> Freedom! I want my freedom! Why won&#146;t you here me?!
(Opens the door) Sophie, help me! Help me!! (Sophie stands up)</p>

<p><strong>Rachel: </strong>Sophie sit!!</p>

<p>(She closes the door and puts his tie into his mouth as a gag.)</p>

<p><strong>Rachel:</strong> No! God, would you just calm down!</p>

<p>(Chandler screams a little bit, then realises that he can spit out his gag. He does so
with a &#145;Pouff!&#146;)</p>

<p><strong>Chandler: </strong>I&#146;m gonna say this for the last time. Would you please
just&#133; (He moves his arm which opens the drawer and hits in the back of the head,
which proves his point.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is now reading the &#145;V&#146; book, with the
salesman watching.]</p>

<p><strong>Joey: </strong>Wow! There&#146;s a lot I didn&#146;t know about vomit. (The
duck comes to the door of the bathroom, quacking.) (To the duck) In a minute. (The duck
goes back into the bathroom.)</p>

<p><strong>The Salesman:</strong> So, what do you say, Joey? You get the whole set of
encyclopedias for twelve hundred dollars, which works out to just 50 bucks a book!</p>

<p><strong>Joey:</strong> Twelve hundred dollars? You think I have $1200? I&#146;m home in
the middle of the day, and I got patio furniture in my living room. I guess there&#146;s a
few things you don&#146;t get from book learnin&#146;.</p>

<p><strong>The Salesman:</strong> Well ah, what can you swing?</p>

<p><strong>Joey:</strong> How about zero down and zero a month for a long, long time?</p>

<p><strong>The Salesman: </strong>You don&#146;t have, anything?</p>

<p><strong>Joey:</strong> You wanna see what I got? (He gets up to empty out his pockets)
Okay? I&#146;ve got a baby Tootsie Roll, a movie stub, keys, a Kleenex, a rock, and an
army man. Hey!</p>

<p><strong>The Salesman: </strong>Okay, I-I get the picture. Uh, thanks, for your time.
(Starts to leave)</p>

<p><strong>Joey:</strong> And a 50. (The salesman stops suddenly) Huh, these must be
Chandler&#146;s pants.</p>

<p><strong>The Salesman:</strong> For 50 bucks, you can get one book! What will it be? A?
B? C?</p>

<p><strong>Joey: </strong>Oh, I-I think I&#146;m gonna stick with the V, I wanna see how
this bad boy turns out.</p>

<p>[Scene: Joanna&#146;s office, Rachel and Chandler are still negotiating.]</p>

<p><strong>Rachel: </strong>I ah, will buy and wrap all of your Christmas gifts.</p>

<p><strong>Chandler:</strong> No!</p>

<p><strong>Rachel:</strong> I ah&#133; Oh! I&#146;ll squeeze you fresh orange juice every
morning!</p>

<p><strong>Chandler: </strong>With extra pulp?</p>

<p><strong>Rachel:</strong> (happily) Yeah!!</p>

<p><strong>Chandler:</strong> No!</p>

<p><strong>Rachel:</strong> D&#146;oh!! (pause) I&#146;ve got it!</p>

<p><strong>Chandler: </strong>You don&#146;t have it.</p>

<p><strong>Rachel:</strong> I have <strong>so</strong> got it. There&#146;s gonna be
rumours about this, there&#146;s no way to stop it. Sophie knows, Monica and Phoebe know.</p>

<p><strong>Chandler:</strong> How do Monica and Phoebe know?</p>

<p><strong>Rachel: </strong>Oh, I called them. And when they ask me what I saw, I can be
very generous (Holds her hands far apart) or very (In a high pitched voice) stingy.</p>

<p><strong>Chandler: </strong>(intrigued) Go on.</p>

<p><strong>Rachel: </strong>I can make you a legend. I can make you this generation&#146;s
Milton Berle.</p>

<p><strong>Chandler:</strong> And Milton Berle has a&#133;</p>

<p><strong>Rachel: </strong>Ohh, not compared to you. (Chandler nods in agreement)</p>

<p>[Scene: The Geller&#146;s kitchen, Phoebe is bringing in some dirty dishes.]</p>

<p><strong>Monica: </strong>Well?</p>

<p><strong>Phoebe: </strong>They&#146;re not even touching the lasagna!</p>

<p><strong>Monica:</strong> Really?!</p>

<p><strong>Phoebe:</strong> Oh, they love your casserole.</p>

<p><strong>Monica:</strong> Yes!!</p>

<p><strong>Phoebe: </strong>It&#146;s hard to believe that just a little while ago this
was nothing but ingredients.</p>

<p><strong>Mrs. Geller:</strong> (entering) Well, everyone seems to be enjoying your dish.</p>

<p><strong>Monica:</strong> And you?</p>

<p><strong>Mrs. Geller:</strong> I thought it was&#133; quite tasty.</p>

<p><strong>Monica:</strong> So if everyone liked it, and you liked it, that would make
this a success. Which would make you&#133;</p>

<p><strong>Mrs. Geller: </strong>(interrupting) A bitch?</p>

<p><strong>Monica:</strong> Well, I was going for wrong, but we can use your word.</p>

<p><strong>Mrs. Geller: </strong>Yes, well I was wrong, and I have to say you really
impressed me today.</p>

<p><strong>Monica: </strong>Wow!</p>

<p><strong>Phoebe:</strong> Umm, you might even say that she pulled a Monica. (They both
look at her) (to Monica) She doesn&#146;t know we switched it. (Monica nods her head
&#145;No.&#146;)</p>

<p><strong>Mrs. Geller:</strong> And the next time you cater for me, there will be nothing
but ice in the freezer. (She starts to bite her nails)</p>

<p><strong>Monica: </strong>That really means a lot. Oh, and Mom, don&#146;t bite your
nails.</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, all except Chandler, are there.]</p>

<p><strong>Chandler: </strong>(hello) Hello.</p>

<p><strong>Joey, Rachel, and Ross: </strong>Hey!</p>

<p><strong>Monica:</strong> (in a sexy voice) Hello, Chandler. (Phoebe has a huge smile on
her face.)</p>

<p><strong>Chandler:</strong> (to Rachel) I love you. (Kisses her on the forehead)</p>

<p><strong>Joey:</strong> Wh-what&#146;s going on?</p>

<p><strong>Phoebe:</strong> Oh. </p>

<p>(She motions for them to come closer, they lean in and she whispers what Rachel told
her. The guys both lean back laughing.]</p>

<p><strong>Joey:</strong> No he doesn&#146;t!</p>

<p><strong>Chandler: </strong>(checks his watch) Two hours, that lasted!</p>

<p><strong>Rachel:</strong> So did you break up with Joanna?</p>

<p><strong>Chandler:</strong> I think so.</p>

<p><strong>Joey: </strong>Well, it&#146;s good thing you got out when you did, before she
blew up like that Vesuvius.</p>

<p><strong>Ross: </strong>The volcano?</p>

<p><strong>Joey:</strong> Yeah. And speaking of volcanoes, man are they a violent igneous
rock formation.</p>

<p><strong>Rachel: </strong>What?!</p>

<p><strong>Joey:</strong> Oh yeah, lava spewing, hot ash, of course some are dormant.</p>

<p><strong>Monica: </strong>Why are you talking about volcanoes all of the sudden?</p>

<p><strong>Joey:</strong> Well, we can talk about something else. What do you want to talk
about? Vivisection? The Vasdeferens? The Vietnam War?</p>

<p><strong>Monica:</strong> Oh! Did anybody see that-that documentary on the Korean War?
(Joey is pissed)</p>

<p><strong>All: </strong>Oh, yeah. Yeah.</p>

<p><strong>Phoebe:</strong> Oh God, Korea is such a beautiful country.</p>

<p><strong>Ross:</strong> With such a sad history.</p>

<p><strong>Chandler:</strong> Could there <strong>be</strong> more Kims?</p>

<p>(They all laugh and Joey joins them, not to be left out. When the laughing dies down,
he has a depressed look on his face.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Closing Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Rachel&#146;s office, Rachel is coming in for the day.]</p>

<p><strong>Joanna: </strong>(from her office) Who&#146;s out there?</p>

<p><strong>Rachel:</strong> It&#146;s me! Good morning!</p>

<p><strong>Joanna: </strong>Rachel, could you come in here for a moment, please?</p>

<p><strong>Rachel:</strong> Yeah, sure. Umm, they didn&#146;t have poppy seed bagels, so
I&#133; (Enters Joanna&#146;s office and sees her handcuffed to her chair wearing nothing
but a slip) Oh my word!</p>

<p><strong>Joanna:</strong> I seem to have had a slight office mishap. Could you please
get the key off the back of the door for me.</p>

<p><strong>Rachel:</strong> Oh, yeah! Yeah!</p>

<p>(She goes back and forth, not sure what to do first, put the bagel down or grab the
key. She finally puts the bagel down and grabs the key and goes over to unlock Joanna.)</p>

<p><strong>Joanna:</strong> You tell your friend Chandler that we&#146;re <strong>definately</strong>
broken up this time.</p>

<p><strong>Rachel: </strong>Okay.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>End</strong></p>

<h1 align="center"><strong>The One With The Ballroom Dancing</strong></h1>

<hr>

<p>Written by: Andrew Reich &amp; Ted Cohen<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com" style="color: rgb(0,128,0)">Eric Aasen</a></p>

<hr>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the gang is there eating breakfast. Chandler is cleaning
out his wallet.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey! New wallet, huh?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, it was time. The old condom ring in the leather just
doesn&#146;t say &#145;cool&#146; anymore.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Rachel!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You just put an empty carton back in the fridge!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh yeah, I know, but the garbage was full.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Have you ever taken out the trash? (Hands her the garbage.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, I thought you <b>liked</b> doing it. (Rachel starts out the door
and stops.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Third door on the left.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Right!</p>

<p>[Scene: Garbage room: Mr. Treeger is unclogging the trash chute as Rachel enters.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh! Hey, Mr. Treeger.</p>

<p><b>Mr. Treeger:</b>: Hey.</p>

<p>(Rachel opens the trash chute, winces at the smell, and throws the garbage bag in. She
then tries to throw the pizza box in, but since it&#146;s so big she jams it into the
opening and it prevents the door from closing. She then turns around too see Mr. Treeger
watching her.)</p>

<p><b>Mr. Treeger:</b>: What are you doing?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ummm. Oh! I&#146;m sorry. (She grabs the box and offers him a piece.)
It&#146;s a little old but&#133;</p>

<p><b>Mr. Treeger:</b>: No! You&#146;re clogging up the chute that I spent a half-hour
unclogging!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I&#146;m sorry. I didn&#146;t&#151;I don&#146;t come in here a lot.</p>

<p><b>Mr. Treeger:</b>: Oh yeah, of course you don&#146;t!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No.</p>

<p><b>Mr. Treeger:</b>: &#145;Cause you&#146;re a little princess! &quot;Daddy, buy me a
pizza. Daddy, buy me a candy factory. Daddy, make the cast of <em>Cats</em> sing Happy
Birthday to me&#133;&quot;</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I didn&#146;t&#133; I never said that.</p>

<p><b>Mr. Treeger:</b>: You think you could make a mess and the big man in coveralls will
come in here and clean it up, huh? Well, why don&#146;t think of someone else for a
change?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (starting to cry) Okay, I&#146;m sorry. (Runs out still carrying the
pizza box.)</p>

<p>[Cut to Monica and Rachel&#146;s apartment as Rachel returns in tears.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> God! If you&#146;re gonna cry about it! (She grabs the box and goes to
through it out.]</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Opening Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Continued from earlier, Rachel is now telling everyone of
her experience in the garbage room.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Whoa-whoa, Treeger made you cry?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yes! And he said really mean things that were only partly true. </p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I&#146;m gonna go down there and teach that guy a lesson.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Joey, please don&#146;t do that. I think it&#146;s best that we just
forget about it.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> That&#146;s easy for you to say, you weren&#146;t almost just killed.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> All right that&#146;s it, school is in session! (Exits and slams the
door.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (Picking up a card from Chandler&#146;s wallet.) My God! Is this a gym
card?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh yeah, gym member. I try to go four times a week, but I&#146;ve
missed the last 1200 times.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> So why don&#146;t you quit?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You don&#146;t think I&#146;ve tried? You think I <b>like</b> having
50 dollars taken out of my bank account every month? No, they make you go all the way down
there! Then they use all of these phrases and peppiness to try and confuse you! Then they
bring out Maria.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Who is Maria?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh Maria. You can&#146;t say no to her, she&#146;s like this lycra
spandex covered gym&#133;treat.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You need me to go down there with you and hold your hand?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> So you&#146;re strong enough to face her on your own?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh no, you&#146;ll have to come.</p>

<p>[Scene: Treeger&#146;s apartment, Joey knocks on the door and Treeger opens it.]</p>

<p><b>Mr. Treeger:</b>: Tribbiani! Hold on, I&#146;ll get the plunger.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey! You hold on pal! Now you made my friend, Rachel, cry. So now,
you&#146;re gonna go up there and apologize to her, unless you want me to call the
landlord.</p>

<p><b>Mr. Treeger:</b>: And tell him what?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Have you heard about a little something called, Not Making Girls Cry.</p>

<p><b>Mr. Treeger:</b>: Yeah. Well maybe you have heard about the Rent Stabilization Act
of 1968!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I have actually <b>not</b> heard of that.</p>

<p><b>Mr. Treeger:</b>: Yeah, well your friends are in violation of it. I&#146;ve been a
nice guy up until now, but uh, I don&#146;t need this grief. I&#146;m gonna call the
landlord and tell him that Monica is illegally subletting here grandmother&#146;s
apartment. Your friends are outta here pal.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Why don&#146;t you tell me something I don&#146;t know! (He storms out,
and once Treeger closes the door behind him, Joey makes an &#145;Oops!&#146; have.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, continued from earlier, everyone is still eating
breakfast.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh please, somebody tell me I don&#146;t have to go to work today!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What&#146;s the matter?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, my first massage today is this incredibly gorgeous guy, and every
time I see him I just want to do things to him that I&#146;m not allowed to charge for.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> So do them for free.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh no, it is forbidden! No-no, Mrs. Potter fires people for fooling
around with clients. And it&#146;s against my oath as a masseuse.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> They make you take an oath?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, I made myself take an oath. Yeah, no fooling around with clients and
umm, always be prepared. Yeah, that one&#146;s actually from the Boy Scouts, but it just
makes good sense.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Why don&#146;t you just give him to somebody else?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, I can handle it. No, I&#146;m a professional. (She starts to leave)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh Pheebs, is that a new ankle bracelet?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Wow! And you got a petticure. Your feet are all dressed up.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Because that&#146;s the only part of you he can see when he&#146;s on
the table!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You&#146;re gonna do some feet flirtin&#146;!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I don&#146;t what your talking about. (Laughs nervously and continues to
leaqve)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Then how do you explain the toe ring?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Because it&#146;s Arabian princess day at work! Okay?! Leave me alone!</p>

<p>[Cut to later, Joey is returning from talking to Mr. Treeger.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh! My hero! What happened?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well uh, I went down there and told him that no one treats my friends like
that and that he&#146;d better come up here and apologize. I&#146;ll see you later.
(Starts to leave)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What a minute, what did he say?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> He said that he wasn&#146;t gonna apologize because you guys are living
here illegally, so instead what he&#146;s gonna do is have you evicted&#151;I&#146;ll see
you later.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?! You got us evicted!!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I told you not to go down there!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well he made Rachel cry!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Rachel always cries!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> That&#146;s not true! (Starts to cry.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Now Joey, you go down there and you suck up to him. I mean you suck like
you&#146;ve never sucked before!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> All right! I&#146;ll try! But if I can&#146;t, you can stay with Chandler
and I until you get settled.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Go!!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> All right, all right, all right. (Starts to leave, stops, and turns
around) I mean I&#146;ll have to check with him first, but I&#146;ll think he&#146;ll be
cool with it. (Monica shoos him out.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler&#146;s gym, He and Ross are there to cancel his membership.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Whoa-whoa-whoa, hey! Now remember what we talked about, you gotta be
strong.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes. (In a stronger voice) Yes!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> One more time, &quot;Hey, don&#146;t you want a washboard stomach and rock
hard pecs?&quot;</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No! I want a flabby gut and saggy man breasts!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Good! That&#146;s good!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay. (They go inside) (To the guy at the desk) I wanna quit the gym.</p>

<p><b>Gym Employee:</b> You wanna quit?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I wanna quit the gym.</p>

<p><b>Gym Employee:</b> You do realize that you won&#146;t have access to our new full
service Swedish spa.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (He turns to Ross and Ross makes a &#145;Be strong&#146; sound.) I
wanna quit the gym.</p>

<p><b>Gym Employee:</b> Okay, Dave in the membership office, handles quitters. (Both
Chandler and Ross start to make their way to the membership office.) Uh, excuse me, (to
Ross) are you a member?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Me? No.</p>

<p><b>Gym Employee:</b> Sorry, members only.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (horrified at the prospect of trying to quit alone and unsure about
himself) I wanna quit the gym.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> It&#146;s okay man, be strong. (Chandler goes into the office.)</p>

<p><b>Gym Employee:</b> (to Ross) So, are you a member of any gym.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No! And I&#146;m not gonna be, so you can save you little speech.</p>

<p><b>Gym Employee:</b> Okay, no problem. (To someone out of the picture) Could you come
here for a second?</p>

<p>(This gorgeous woman in spandex walks up)</p>

<p><b>Woman:</b> Hi, I&#146;m Maria.</p>

<p>(Ross is at a loss for words.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Heeling Hands Inc., Phoebe&#146;s work, she is giving a massage to the guy,
Rick, she likes.]</p>

<p><b>Rick:</b> (looking at her feet) Wow, you have really pretty feet.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> These old things.</p>

<p><b>Rick:</b> Would you mind spending some time on my siadic area, it&#146;s been
killing me today.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> You mean the&#151;Okay by siadic, you mean the towel covered portion.</p>

<p><b>Rick:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Sure, yeah, no I can do that, yeah, because umm, y'know, the muscles in
the siadic area can get y&#146;know, real (lifts up the towel) nice and tight. So umm,
tell me Rick, how umm, how did you injure the area.</p>

<p><b>Rick:</b> Oh, a 16-hour sit-in for Greenpeace.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh. (She goes to work, and her head slowly drops out of view.)</p>

<p><b>Rick:</b> Ow! Did you just bite me?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No!</p>

<p>[Scene: Mr. Treeger&#146;s apartment, Joey is there to suck up.]</p>

<p><b>Mr. Treeger:</b>: What?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Please don&#146;t kick Monica and Rachel out, this wasn&#146;t there
fault, it was mine.</p>

<p><b>Mr. Treeger:</b>: You want me to kick you guys out instead?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No you can&#146;t do that, where would the chick and the duck live?</p>

<p><b>Mr. Treeger:</b>: You have pets!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Noo-no-no, no, those are nicknames. I&#146;m the chick and Chandler is the
duck.</p>

<p><b>Mr. Treeger:</b>: Huh, I would&#146;ve thought it was the other way around.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Come on man, just-just let the girls stay, I&#146;ll do whatever you want.</p>

<p><b>Mr. Treeger:</b>: Really? You&#146;ll do anything?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah-yeah, absolutely.</p>

<p><b>Mr. Treeger:</b>: Yeah, I&#146;ve got something you can do.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What, what is it?</p>

<p><b>Mr. Treeger:</b>: Can you be my dancing partner?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> That&#146;s not, prison lingo, is it?</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Commercial Break</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Joey is telling Monica and Rachel what he has to do.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> His dancing partner?!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, there&#146;s this superintendent&#146;s dance, the Super Ball. I
don&#146;t know, and he wants to impress Marge, this lady super that he&#146;s a crush on.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, why doesn&#146;t he practice with a girl?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, he&#146;s too shy, he doesn&#146;t thing he&#146;s good enough to
dance with girls yet.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, right, he almost danced me right down that&#133;garbage chute.
(Starts to cry)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, would you let it go already?! You&#146;re fine!</p>

<p>(Chandler and Ross enter)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hey! So, did you quit?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No, I almost did, couldn&#146;t leave Ross there without a spotter!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Wait, now so you joined the gym?</p>

<p>(Rachel starts to laugh.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> And that&#146;s funny, why?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, umm, I was just y&#146;know working out and umm&#133; Oh,
that&#146;s it.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> We&#146;re doomed. Okay, they&#146;re gonna take 50 bucks out of our
accounts for the rest of our lives. What are we gonna do?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well, you could actually <b>go</b> to the gym.</p>

<p>(Chandler and Ross both laugh)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Or! Or, we could go to the bank, close our accounts and cut them off at
the source.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You&#146;re a genius!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Aww, man, now we won&#146;t be bank buddies!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Now, there&#146;s two reasons.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (entering) Hey.</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ohh, you guys, remember that cute client I told you about? I bit him.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Where?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> On the touchy.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> And <b>that&#146;s</b> not against your oath?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, I know! I-I&#146;m sorry, but the moment I touch him, I just wanna
throw out my old oath and take a new, dirty one.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well, next time your massaging him, you should try and distract
yourself.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah! Yeah! Yeah! Like-like when I&#146;m doing something exciting and I
don&#146;t wanna get <b>too</b> excited, I just ahh, y&#146;know try to thing of other
things like ah sandwiches, and ah baseball, and ah Chandler!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Thank you, Joey.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No-no, thank you.</p>

<p>[Scene: Treeger&#146;s apartment, Joey knocks and Mr. Treeger opens the door.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> All right, I&#146;m here, let&#146;s ahh, get this over with.</p>

<p><b>Mr. Treeger:</b>: Okay ahh, well, just ahh, follow my lead. (Turns on some music)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Whoa-whoa, don&#146;t we need to do some kinda preparation first? Like
ahh, get really drunk?</p>

<p><b>Mr. Treeger:</b>: Look come on, eh, just ah, just ah, put your arms around me, eh.</p>

<p>(Joey does so, and they both start dancing. Treeger tries to spin Joey, but ends up
throwing him into the door.)</p>

<p><b>Mr. Treeger:</b>: Ahhhh! I&#146;m sorry!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No, it&#146;s okay, but if I&#146;m Marge, my breasts are coming out my
back.</p>

<p><b>Mr. Treeger:</b>: Ahh, forget it! I&#146;ll never be any good at this, my mom was
right, I&#146;m just a big potato with arms, and legs, and a head.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Come on man, you&#146;re not a potato.</p>

<p><b>Mr. Treeger:</b>: I&#146;m sure as hell a dancer, it&#146;s no use Marge will never
go for me.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Come on Treeger, don&#146;t say that. You just ahh, you just need more
practice. Here, come on, let&#146;s ahh, let&#146;s try it again. Come on. (they start
dancing again) Plus, it was, it was probably mostly my fault, anyway. I mean, y&#146;know,
I&#146;m not really that comfortable dancing with a&#151;(Treeger throws him) We-he!! Hey!</p>

<p><b>Mr. Treeger:</b>: Yeah!</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel and Monica are sitting at the table as Joey
enters.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey-hey, how goes the dancing? Gay yet?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ah-ha-ha, you guys owe me big time. (He walks into the kitchen and does a
little dance step on the way.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (laughing) What was that?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You just did a little dancy thing.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No I didn&#146;t.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yes you did! You did like a little hop.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You are soo enjoying this.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No, I&#146;m not! And it wasn&#146;t a hop it was a pademarie. </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (laughing harder) You know the words! You are <b>so</b> into this!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> All right, well maybe I&#146;m enjoying it a little bit. I mean I&#146;m
getting pretty good at it.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ooh, this is soo sweet, Joey our little twinkle-toes.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey-hey, hold on, this isn&#146;t some kind of like girly dance. All
right, it&#146;s like a sport, it&#146;s manly!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> All right, then show me some manly moves.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> All right.</p>

<p>(They both get up and Monica expects Joey to take the lead, but he doesn&#146;t, and
they fumble around for a little bit.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I don&#146;t know how to lead.</p>

<p>[Scene: Ross and Chandler&#146;s bank, they are there to close their accounts.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hello.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hi.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> We&#146;d like to close our accounts.</p>

<p><b>Bank Officer:</b> Close your accounts? Is there some kind of problem?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No-no.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No, we&#146;d just like to close them.</p>

<p><b>Bank Officer:</b> Okay, Ms. Lambert handles all our closures. (to a beautiful woman)
Would you come over here please?</p>

<p><b>Ms. Lambert:</b> Hi, I&#146;m Karen.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I wanna quit the bank!</p>

<p>[Scene: Healing Hands, Inc., Phoebe is giving Rick a massage.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (thinking to herself) Okay, baseball. Rick, playing baseball. Okay,
slides into second, maybe even his pants come down a little&#133; Oh no&#151;wait no, no!
No! Okay, all right, sandwiches, sandwiches. Umm, okay, on a plate, maybe Rick&#146;s
pants come down a little. No! No! Okay, Chandler! Okay Chandler, ooh, that&#146;s working.</p>

<p>(The camera zooms in on the clock on the wall and it reads a quarter after one. Time
lapse. The clock now reads 3:30, and Phoebe is still giving Rick his massage.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (thinking to herself) Chandler&#146;s knees. Chandler&#146;s&#133;
ankles. Chandler&#146;s ankle hair. (notices the clock) Oh no. (to Rick) Okay, you&#146;re
all set.</p>

<p><b>Rick:</b> Oh wow! That was amazing, was that really just an hour?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah! In&#133; really long hour world.</p>

<p><b>Rick:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ugh, okay, I have an enormous crush on you. But because you&#146;re a
client, I can&#146;t ask you out, even though you give me y&#146;know, the feeling.</p>

<p><b>Rick:</b> Wow! I had no idea! But you know, I could always find another masseuse. </p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Really?!</p>

<p><b>Rick:</b> Yeah, really.</p>

<p>(They start to kiss, then Rick stops suddenly.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Rick:</b> Suddenly, I very aware that I&#146;m naked.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (laughs) Okay, quit down. (they start to kiss again)</p>

<p>(Suddenly, Phoebe&#146;s boss, Mrs. Potter, and a client, Mr. Simon, enters.)</p>

<p><b>Mrs. Potter:</b> Mr. Simon&#146;s been waiting for&#151;(sees Phoebe and Rick) Oh my
God!</p>

<p><b>Mr. Simon:</b> Why wasn&#146;t I offered that? I&#146;d definitely pay more for
that.</p>

<p><b>Mrs. Potter:</b> Phoebe, we have rules here, this isn&#146;t that kind of place.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh yeah, oh and I know, but this isn&#146;t what it looks like,
&#145;cause Rick is my ahh, husband.</p>

<p><b>Mrs. Potter:</b> Oh really? Well, then you&#146;d better tell his other wife,
&#145;cause she called three times asking where he is.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yes, I will tell her.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler and Ross are telling Joey, Rachel, and Monica of
their bank woes.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> So you <b>didn&#146;t</b> leave the bank?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No! And somehow, we ended up with a joint checking account.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What are you ever gonna use that for?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> To pay for the gym.</p>

<p>(Phoebe enters)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey! So I had a great day, Rick and I really hit it off, and we started
making out, and then my boss walked in and fired me for being a whore.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You got fired?! </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh my Gosh!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> It&#146;s so weird, I have never been fired from anything before!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Sweety...</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I just-I just started walking around not knowing what to do next,
y&#146;know? I-I started asking people on the street if they wanted massages. Then these
policemen, thought I was a whore too. It&#146;s been a really bad day, whore wise.</p>

<p>(There&#146;s a knock on the door and Chandler answers it.)</p>

<p><b>Mr. Treeger:</b>: Hey Duck, is Chick here?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah&#133; Bunny-rabbit.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (To Mr. Treeger) So you ah, ready for our last practice?</p>

<p><b>Mr. Treeger:</b>: Yeah, but y&#146;know, I think the reason we&#146;re not getting
that spin right is because my apartment&#146;s too small.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Look, you wanna use our place?</p>

<p><b>Mr. Treeger:</b>: No, I ahh, had another idea.</p>

<p>[Cut to the roof, where Joey and Mr. Treeger are dancing happily to ^Night and Day^.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> We did it!!</p>

<p><b>Mr. Treeger:</b>: I know, we did it!! Hey, that was incredible, huh?!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I know, it was amazing! I mean, we totally nailed it, it was beautiful.</p>

<p><b>Mr. Treeger:</b>: Thank you, listen, thanks a lot Tribbiani, (checks watch). Oh my
God, look at the time, I gotta catch the bus to the ball.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh well, okay, good luck.</p>

<p><b>Mr. Treeger:</b>: Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Unless you wanna practice the Foxtrot again? Or-or the Tango?</p>

<p><b>Mr. Treeger:</b>: Ahh, thanks but no. You see I-I think I&#146;m ready to dance with
girls.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Mr. Treeger:</b>: Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Go get &#145;em Treeger.</p>

<p><b>Mr. Treeger:</b>: Right. (Starts to leave) Hey, ahh, you wanna come? Marge has a
girlfriend.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (intrigued) Really?</p>

<p><b>Mr. Treeger:</b>: Yeah, you could dance real good with her, she&#146;s the same size
as me.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No, I&#146;m good.</p>

<p>(Treeger leaves, and Joey&#146;s dances off.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Closing Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Lara and Jeni&#146;s Massage, Phoebe is interviewing for a job.]</p>

<p><b>Interviewer:</b> So it looks like you&#146;ve got some great experience here.
Let&#146;s see ahh, reason for leaving last job?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, they thought I was a whore.</p>

<p><b>Interviewer:</b> Okay, we&#146;ll give a call if anything comes up.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Great! Thank you very much.</p>

<p>(The interviewer watches her leave with an &#145;Oh my goodness&#146; face.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>End</strong></p>

<h1 align="center">The One With Joey's New Girlfriend</h1>

<hr>

<p>Written by: Michael Curtis &amp; Gregory S. Malins<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a></p>

<hr>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, the gang's all there. Ross has a slip of paper that he throws on
the ground tying to get Rachel's attention.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (picking up the slip of paper) Hello! What's this? Oh right its that
girl's phone number. (Rachel ignores him) Yeah-yeah, there it is, just a phone number a
really hot girl gave me. (He holds it so that Rachel can see it, she continues to ignore
him) It's no big deal, I mean it is her home phone number, but...(Rachel still ignores
him) Whoa! (Throws it in her lap) Whoa-whoops, I almost lost this baby! Yeah, the lovely
Amanda gives me her number and I-I go and drop it. (He waves it in front of Rachel's face.
Then suddenly Phoebe has to sneeze and Rachel quickly grabs the slip of paper and gives it
to Phoebe for her to sneeze into.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Thank you.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Opening Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, the next morning. Chandler, Monica, Ross, and Rachel are there.]</p>

<p><b>Gunther:</b> Rachel?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah?</p>

<p><b>Gunther:</b> When's your birthday?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> May fifth, why?</p>

<p><b>Gunther:</b> Oh, I-I'm just making a list of people's birthdays.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, mine's December...</p>

<p><b>Gunther:</b> Yeah, whatever. (Walks away)</p>

<p>(Chandler is talking to Monica and notices a beautiful woman.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Ohh, she's pretty. Pretty ahh, pretty girl, the pretty--she's pretty.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Just go up to her and ask her out. (Chandler laughs) Oh, what's the
worst thing that could happen?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I could die.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, it's-it's tough being single. That's why I'm so glad I found Amanda.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ross, you guys went out once. You took your kids to <em>Chucky Cheese</em>,
and you didn't even kiss her.</p>

<p>(Ross glares at Chandler.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I tell people secrets. It makes them like me.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (entering) Oh.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey! (Phoebe sneezes)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Phoebe! You're sick, you shouldn't play. You should just go home, get in
bed, and stay there.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (in a nasally voice, from her cold) But I'm unemployed, my music is all
I really have now. Well music, and making my own shoes. (She puts her shoe on the table,
and it's horribly decorated) Pretty, huh? (Sneezes)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All right, I'm gonna do it! I'm gonna get shot down. Any advice?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Just be yourself. But, not too much.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (gets up) (softly) Wish me luck.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (loudly) Good luck!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Wish it! (To the woman, Kathy, he likes) Hi. Hi, I-I was just sitting
over there, and uhh, Chandler. My name is Chandler. Did I say that?</p>

<p><b>Kathy:</b> No, you didn't. Hi, I'm Kathy.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Uh Kathy, with K or a C?</p>

<p><b>Kathy:</b> With a K.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh-oh-hey!</p>

<p><b>Kathy:</b> Wow! You are really good at this.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey, come on, give me a break, I'm out on a limb here.</p>

<p><b>Kathy:</b> I'm sorry, you're right, I apologize, but I should tell you that I'm
waiting for a date. (Joey enters) Oh, and there he is now.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey! Hey, hey-hey, hey. (Joey kisses Kathy.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey, I see you guys already met, huh?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes-yes, I was just trying to figure out a way to uh, demonstrate how
I could get my exceptionally large feet into my even bigger mouth.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Didn't I tell ya? Always showin' off.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Before I start, I just wanna say that umm, I have a cold, so if I sneeze
in the middle of song, it's not on purpose. Oh, except the last verse of Pepper People.
(Starts to sing) <em>Smelly cat, smelly cat. What are they feeding you?</em> (Stops
singing) This chick sounds good. (Singing) <em>Smelly cat, smelly</em>--(stops singing)
Hey Gunther, be a good little boy and bring me a whiskey.</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is walking into the living room having just
gotten up in the middle of the night.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (sees Kathy is up watching TV) Hi!</p>

<p><b>Kathy:</b> Hi.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Jeez, at 2:30 in the morning, I didn't expect to have to fight over
the remote.</p>

<p><b>Kathy:</b> I'm sorry, it's just this Ernie Cofax thing on in a few minutes I wanted
to watch.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh my God! That's why I got up too!</p>

<p><b>Kathy:</b> You're kidding! Oh, I love him.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey, listen, I'm sorry about this afternoon, y'know, if I would've
known you guys were... I never would've...</p>

<p><b>Kathy:</b> Oh please!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> So ah, Joey tells me you two met in acting class.</p>

<p><b>Kathy:</b> Yeah, they teamed us up as partners. Joey picked three scenes for us to
do; all of them had us making out.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> That's a good thing actually, because ah, he used to have me rehearse
with him.</p>

<p><b>Kathy:</b> (laughs) Oh-oh-oh-oh!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Is it on?</p>

<p><b>Kathy:</b> No, but this wonder broom is amazing!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey! (Runs over and gets his wonder broom)</p>

<p><b>Kathy:</b> Oh my God!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh! It's on! It's on!</p>

<p>(Chandler jumps into the canoe and sits down. The chick starts chirping and Chandler
reaches down to pick him up.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> There we go little fella.</p>

<p><b>Kathy:</b> (laughs) What about the duck?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well the duck can swim.</p>

<p><b>Kathy:</b> Oh, jeez. (Hits him)</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, the next night, Phoebe is finishing up her set.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (singing, drunk) <em>My sticky shoes, my sticky-sticky shoes, why do you
stick on me, ba-a-by!</em> Thanks for the lights honey. </p>

<p><b>All:</b> Way to go, Phoebe!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> That cold makes you sound so great.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> It's fun, God I love how sexy I am. (Coughs really loudly.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, Kath, we should get going. We're going to by hamsters.</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Ooh, that's great, I love those little guys.</p>

<p><b>Kathy:</b> No, no, it's not like that. I, I work for a medical researcher.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, have fun!</p>

<p><b>Kathy:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, I think it's great that the medical community is finally trying to
help sick hamsters.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Y'know what, I like Kathy.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh yeah, me too, she's so cool and pretty.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, she's...</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> She's smart and funny, y'know? We were up all last night talking, she
said the funniest thing about--what? </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You love her.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No, I don't.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yes, you do. Chandler loves Kathy.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Come on, Pheebs lay off him.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Thank you, Ross.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, he's a little sensitive right now, `cause he's so in love.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All right.</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Ohh!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All right.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (turning around and doing that, &quot;I'm making out with someone,&quot;
thing with her hands) Ooh, umm, oh Kathy! Kathy, I love you! Oh! (She turns around and
sees Gunther staring at her and stops suddenly.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe and Monica are there.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> So, I need to write some depressing stuff to go along with my new floozy
voice, but nothing that sad has ever really happened to me.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh umm, how about your mom dying, or having to live on the streets when
you were 14?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Uh-huh. Oh, yeah, I could write about the time my hair did that
&quot;Woo-hoo&quot; thing.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (entering) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (loudly) So I'm going over to Amanda's tonight!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Rachel's not here.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> How's it going with her?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Great, actually. I'm thinking tonight, maybe the night. Yeah, I mean ah,
the kids are gonna play together and then when they're asleep, I'm thinking Amanda and I
break open a bottle of wine, and do a little &quot;playing&quot; ourselves.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (entering, with a guy) Hi guys! This is Josh. Josh, these are my
friends, and that's Ross.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hi, Josh.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hi.</p>

<p><b>Josh:</b> Dudes.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> So, did you play in college? (She points to his NYU Soccer (football for
the rest of the world) sweatshirt he's wearing.)</p>

<p><b>Josh:</b> Oh, I still do. Next year, I hope to make varsity though.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ross, didn't you ah, play soccer in High School? Oh no wait, that's
right. You just organized their game schedules on your Commodore 64.</p>

<p><b>Josh:</b> Well, it's getting late, I've got to get to the game, so I'm gonna...
head.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay. (He starts to leave, and Rachel grabs him and gives him a
passionate kiss.) I'll miss you.</p>

<p><b>Josh:</b> Dope! (exits)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Wow, cute one!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Very!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I know, isn't he great? It's so nice to finally be in a fun
relationship, y'know? There's nothing boring about him, and ah, I bet he's never set foot
in a museum.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well maybe he'll get to go soon, like on a class trip or something.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Y'know what else is really great about him, oh, what is the word for the
adult that doesn't have dinosaur toys in their bedroom?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh! (He bangs his fists together.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What was that?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Monica knows.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> It's this dumb thing that Ross made up `cause he was trying to fool our
parents. It's a way of giving the finger, without actually having to give it. I remember I
cried the night you made it up, `cause it was the first time that I realized that I was
actually cooler than my older brother.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, I'm gonna go get ready, (Gives Monica the fist thing.) for my date
tonight, so ah, I'll just_ head.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, I should go to, `cause I'm playing in one hour. Hey, (clears her
voice and in her normal voice) you guys should come hear me, ooh hear me. Ooh, (tries to
sing) <em>My sticky shoes</em>--eww! Eww! I lost my sexy phlegm!</p>

<p>[Scene: Amanda's apartment, Ross is arriving with Ben.]</p>

<p><b>Amanda:</b> (opening the door) Hi!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>Amanda:</b> Hi Ben!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Wow! You-you look great!</p>

<p><b>Amanda:</b> Thanks!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (she lets him in) Okay! (to her son) Hey Tommy.</p>

<p><b>Amanda:</b> I am so glad that you could come over tonight.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh no-no-no, it's my pleasure.</p>

<p><b>Amanda:</b> Okay, well, my cell phone number is right here on the counter, please
help yourself to anything in the fridge.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Amanda:</b> I appreciate this soo much, I've been trying to go out with this guy for
like a month.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I-I-I...</p>

<p><b>Amanda:</b> (noticing the bottle of wine he has) Oh, I don't mean to be a square,
but I'd really appreciate it if you wait and drink your wine after the kids are asleep? Oh
uh, thanks for this, I hope I can do the same for you sometime. (She leaves)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Who wants to make some long distance calls?</p>

<p>[Scene: A street, Chandler is buying a newspaper and notices Kathy running by.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Kathy! Kathy! Hi!! Kathy! Kathy! (She doesn't hear him and keeps
running, Chandler starts chasing her as the theme to <em>The Mod Squad</em> starts to
play. First, a car almost hits him and then gets mustard splashed on him as he runs by a
hot dog vendor.) Kathy! (He keeps running and gets tangled up in the leashes of five dogs,
in desperation he throws his paper.) Fetch! Fetch it! (He frees himself and resumes the
chase) Kathy! Kathy! Kathy! (He now trips and falls into a pile of garbage, he tries to
get up and scream her name again but he has a piece of spinach in his mouth. He gets out
of the garbage and starts crossing the street by running over the hoods of a couple of
cabs.) Kathy! (He jumps in front of her and out of breath he says) Kathy.</p>

<p><b>Kathy:</b> Hey, Chandler! What are you doing here?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, I just wanted to say, &quot;Hey!&quot;</p>

<p><b>Kathy:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay. (He walks away disgusted with himself.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Commercial Break</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross is telling Monica about his new baby sitting job.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh come on! You're making it sound worse than it actually was.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Her date tipped me ten dollars. (Monica laughs)</p>

<p>(Phoebe runs into the kitchen with wet hair, opens the window, and sticks her head
outside.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Pheebs, what are you doing?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, I wanna be sexy again so I'm trying to catch a cold. It should be
easy, supposedly they're pretty common.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Phoebe, you'll catch pneumonia.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (entering) Okay. You were right. I'm in love with Joey's girlfriend.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Are you serious?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, how-how-how is that possible? You barely know her!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I don't know. I can't--I just, I can't get her out of my head. Y'know?
I mean, I'm a very bad person. I'm a very, very bad person. I'm a horrible person. (he
waits for a reaction, when he doesn't get one) No you're not Chandler! We still love you
Chandler!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (sneezes) Oh gosh, Phoebe, I think I caught your cold.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> You mean you stole it! (Monica sneezes again) Don't cover your mouth
when you do that!</p>

<p>(Joey and Kathy enter, laughing)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Kathy:</b> (to Chandler) We were just talking about you.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Really?!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah-yeah, I told her about the time you got drunk and fell asleep with
your head in the toilet.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (laughs) Right in there!</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is playing Hide-and-Go-Seek with the chick and
the duck.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> 99...100! Ready or not, here I come! (He opens his eyes and sees that
the chick and the duck are still sitting in front of him) All right, let's go over the
concept one more time.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (entering) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey guys. (to Chandler) Listen uh, you wanna get some dinner with me and
Kathy tonight?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Ohh, umm, y'know what, I already ate.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> It's 4:30.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Y'know I had a big meal on Monday, y'know. So that's just gonna get me
straight through the week.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay, I see what's going on here.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You-you do?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah! You don't like Kathy.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You got me.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, you've been avoiding her ever since we started going out. Look, I
made an <strong>effort</strong> to like Janice, now I think it's your turn to make an
effort to like Kathy by going out to dinner with us. Right?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah. Right.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Good, and hey! My treat. (He turns to go into his bedroom then stops.) But
that's only because you're not eating anything, right?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is returning from a date with Josh, and when they
get the door open, Rachel turns and passionately kisses Josh.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (lying on the couch suffering from her cold) Ross isn't here.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh. (She tries to walk away from Josh, by he keeps holding her) Stop it!</p>

<p><b>Josh:</b> So I'll see you at the party? Beer's beer man, 24, 7!!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah! (Monica gives a sarcastic thumbs up) (Josh leaves) I am soo gonna
marry that guy. (looking in her wallet) Ohhh!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I think he's stealing from me.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Why?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Because he's stealing from me!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (entering) Hi! It's me. And soup. (to Rachel) Hey, I just saw Josh, he
looks so yummy in your leather jacket.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ughh! (Storms out after him)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (to Monica) Here, now I don't eat chicken, so it's just noodle soup. And
there's no chicken in the broth either, so it's really just... noodle water. </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Thank you so much Phoebe.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (picking up Monica's used Kleenex and putting some in her pocket.) Sure.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What are you doing with those?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> But, I need your germs! I want my cold back! I miss my sexy voice.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Sorry, Phoebe.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> It's okay. How's the soup?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Umm. (nodding her head, &quot;Good.&quot;)</p>

<p>(Monica sets the soup down and Phoebe picks it up and licks the rim.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Ohhhh!! Gross!!</p>

<p>[Scene: A nightclub, Chandler is having dinner with Kathy and Joey.]</p>

<p><b>Kathy:</b> Ohh, God, guys, check it out, you can see that girl's underwear!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Is she great or what?</p>

<p><b>Kathy:</b> (to Chandler) So? Huh? What do you think?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Ohh, she's-she's not really my type.</p>

<p><b>Kathy:</b> Not your type?! She's gorgeous!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Y'know what I think it is? It's the fishnet stockings. Y'know?
Whenever I see a girl in fishnet stockings it reminds me of my father in fishnet
stockings.</p>

<p><b>Kathy:</b> Okay. Understanding a little more why you're single. Ohh! Y'know, I have
a friend you would like, she's really pretty. And then we could double date!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Uhh, no-no thanks.</p>

<p><b>Kathy:</b> Okay, I've got some ugly friends, and they're all available too.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Listen, I-I'm gonna grab a beer. (Leaves)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (to Kathy) I'll be right back. (to Chandler) What was that?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Kathy was being really nice and you just walked away. I thought we had a
deal.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey, look, what do you want from me?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I want you to like her! But if that's too damned difficult for you, then
the least you can do is pretend.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I am pretending.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well then, do it better!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, what do you saw I go over there and say how much I like her?
(Joey gives him a thumbs up) No-no it'll be good, I can tell her much I've been thinking
about her. That I haven't stopped thinking about her since the moment I met her. That I'm
so fantastically, over-the-top, wanna-slit-my-own-throat in love with her, that for every
minute of every hour of every day I can't believe my own damn bad luck that you met her
first!!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, that's pretty good. But you might wanna tone it down a little.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Rachel are there.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (entering) Hey! So, uhh, Amanda just-just dropped me off. Yeah, that's one
of the things I love about her, she's...uh, she's old enough to drive. (to Monica) So uhh,
I guess you're not going to mom and dad's tonight?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No, sorry.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well where's Amanda?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey Rach, could you get me some cough drops?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I mean y'know, I'm thinking. You could bring her, and you guys could go
up to your old room, and not make out.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Ross, cough drops, please?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> At least I know she's not going out with me to get into R rated movies.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Why don't you just marry her? Oh no, wait a minute you can't, I'm sorry
I forgot, she's not a lesbian.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You see Amanda and I have a very special...</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (interrupting) You have nothing! You're not even going out! You're her
baby sitter! You have a 12-year-old girl's job!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (laughing) Ohh, that is soo sad.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> And what are you laughing at, Miss
`My-keg-sucking-boyfriend-is-stealing-from-me!'</p>

<p>(Ross starts laughing)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hey, so he stole a couple bucks from me! At least he bought me something
with it! (Shows her, her ring)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> That's mine!! Now, would you both please start acting like adults? And
get me my cough drops!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Fine.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Sorry.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Here. (Hands her, her cough drops) (to Rachel) At least I made ten bucks
in my relationship.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Y'know...</p>

<p>(She does Ross's little gesture. In response Ross puts his hands behind his neck with
his arms sticking straight out and starts flapping them together.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe is there with her guitar.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (singing) <em>Platting goats are platting. Platting down the street.
Platting goats are platting, leaving little treats</em>. (to Gunther) Does it even work
without my sexy voice?</p>

<p><b>Gunther:</b> I like it. (sneezes)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Gunther, kiss me.</p>

<p><b>Gunther:</b> What?</p>

<p>(Phoebe grabs Gunther and kisses him. He then falls to the couch in shock.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is watching TV as Joey and Kathy are laughing in
Joey's bedroom. They get to be pretty loud so Chandler turns the TV way up.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (opening the door wearing nothing but a sock, and holding a dart board
over the `Little General.') Hey! (Chandler turns down the TV) Now, we're not actually
gonna be sleeping in her, but do you mind?</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica, with a blanket draped over her shoulders, opens
the door to a similarly clad Chandler.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Can I sleep on your couch?</p>

<p>(Monica nods `Yes.' And they both walk to the couch looking all depressed.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Closing Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe is singing, with everyone else present.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (singing) <em>And I'm still waiting for my paper mache man</em>. Thank
you my babies.</p>

<p>(applause)</p>

<p><b>Gunther:</b> Rachel?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Gunther:</b> I don't know if you heard about what happened between me and Phoebe the
other day_</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No!</p>

<p><b>Gunther:</b> Well, we kissed. I-I-I didn't initiate the kiss, but-but I also didn't
stop it, and I've been feeling guilty.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (confused) Okay.</p>

<p><b>Gunther:</b> So umm, are we cool?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (really confused) Okay.</p>

<p><b>Gunther:</b> I knew you'd understand.</p>

<p>(Gunther walks away, leaving Rachel with a `What just happened?' look on her face.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>End</strong></p>
</body>
</html>
406<html>

</head>

<body TEXT="#000000" LINK="#0000ff" VLINK="#800080" BGCOLOR="#ffffff" alink="#ff0000">

<h1 ALIGN="CENTER">The One With The Dirty Girl</h1>

<hr>

<p>Written by: Scott Silveri &amp; Shana Goldberg-Meehan<br>
Transcribed by: Darcy &amp; Julie Partridge</p>

<hr>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Ross and a beautiful blonde (Cheryl) are standing outside. The
rest of the gang is watching from inside.] </p>
<b>

<p>Cheryl:</b> So, thank you for the delicious dinner. </p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> You're welcome for a delicious dinner. </p>

<p>[inside] </p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe:</b> Hey what are you guys looking at? </p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> Ross and the most beautiful girl in <strong>the world</strong>. </p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, come to papa. </p>

<p>[Cheryl walks away and Ross walks inside. Everyone stares at him in disbelief.] </p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> I know! </p>
<b>

<p>Monica:</b> Probably the only time I'll ever say this, but did you see the <strong>ass</strong>
on her? </p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> Where did you, when did you, how did you... (Joey hits the back of
Chandler's head) How did you get a girl like that? </p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> Yeah, so what is she, like a... like a spokesmodel, or an aerobics
instructor, what? </p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Actually she's a paleontology doctoral candidate, specializing in the
centazoic era. </p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> Okay, but that's, like, the easiest era. </p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> I've seen her at work, but I always figured, ah-huh? But, uh, I made her
dinner. We had a great time. And we're going out again tomorrow. </p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> Well maybe she and her friends are just having a contest to see who can
bring home the biggest geek. </p>
<b>

<p>Ross:</b> Fine by me; hope she wins. </p>
<b>

<p align="center">Opening Credits</b></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's. Ross, Rachel, and Phoebe are there. Chandler enters.] </p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> Hi. You guys have any wrapping paper? </p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe:</b> Oo! Is it for my birthday present? </p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> Phebes, it was your birthday, like, months ago. </p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, but remember you said you ordered something special, and it just
hasn't come yet? </p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> Well, I have a call in about that. </p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe:</b> 'Kay. </p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> Actually, this is for Kathy's birthday. It's an early edition of her
favorite book. </p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> Oh, <i>The Velveteen Rabbit</i>! Oh my God, when the boy's love makes the
rabbit real! </p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> Okay, but don't touch it, because you fingers have destructive oils. </p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> Huh. Well, then you'd better keep it away from Ross's hair.<b> </b>So this
is pretty rare. How did you get that? </p>
<b>

<p>Chandler:</b> Oh, it wasn't a big deal. I just went to a couple of bookstores, talked
to a couple of dealers... called a couple of the author's grandchildren. </p>
<b>

<p>Rachel:</b> Oh, honey, that's so sweet. </p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, and what a great way to say, &quot;I secretly love you, roommate's
girlfriend!&quot; </p>
<b>

<p>Chandler: </b>It doesn't say that. Does it? </p>
<b>

<p>Ross: </b>How do you think it's gonna look when you get her something incredibly
