<body bgcolor="#FFFFFF" link="#008000">

<h1 align="center"><strong>The One With Phoebe&#146;s Uterus</strong></h1>

<hr>

<p>Written by: Seth Kirkland<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a></p>

<hr>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Frank and Alice are there talking with Phoebe.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh my God! I can&#146;t believe my little brother is married!</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Oh I know!! (Both he and Alice squeal hysterically)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> You guys, why didn&#146;t you tell me you were eloping?</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> &#145;Cause it just sorta happened, y&#146;know we were at the
courthouse, we were having lunch&#133;</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Wait, wait, why were you at the courthouse? </p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> We were having lunch. Yeah and then all of the sudden we were like,
&quot;Hey! Y'know, we&#146;re here, having lunch let&#146;s get married!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Wow, a year and a half ago I didn&#146;t even know I had a brother, and
now I have a sister too. (They all hug, and Frank and Alice start kissing.) Okay. Okay.
Stop it, don&#146;t. So, I gotta get you a gift now. Is there anything you need?</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Uhh, yeah.</p>

<p><b>Alice:</b> We&#146;ve been trying to get pregnant, uh pretty much ever since we got
engaged, we thought we&#146;d get a jump on things, y&#146;know no one&#146;s getting any
younger.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> See the thing is umm, we&#146;re not able to y&#146;know, uh, conceive.</p>

<p><b>Alice:</b> And we&#146;ve tried everything, we&#146;ve seen a bunch of doctors.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Yeah, and they-and they say that our-that our only chance to have a baby
is that if they take my sperm, her egg and put it together in a dish and then put it into
another girl. So we were wondering if you could be the girl that we could put it into.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (shocked) That&#146;s a really nice gift. I was thinking of like a gravy
boat.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Opening Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica, Rachel, and Chandler are trying to throw cards
into a vase.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (entering with Ross) Hey! You guys! Check it out, check it out! (He&#146;s
wearing a blue blazer) Guess which job I got.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I don&#146;t know, but Donald Trump wants his blue blazer black.</p>

<p>(The gang is stunned.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Blue blazer back. He-he wants it back.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> But you-you said black. Why would he want his blue blazer black?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, you-you know what I meant.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No, you messed it up. You&#146;re stupid.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> So what job did you get Joe?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, ah, tour guide at the museum. Yeah, Ross got it for me.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, how can you be a tour guide, don&#146;t you have to be a dinosaur
expert or something?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No, not really. They give you all the information, it&#146;s uh, it&#146;s
like memorizing a script. (Making like a tour guide) &quot;And on your left, you have
Tyrannosaurus Rex, a carnivore from the Jurassic period.</p>

<p><strong>Chandler, Monica, and Rachel:</strong>&nbsp; Great!! That&#146;s great!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Uh actually Joey, it&#146;s the Cretasous period.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah but, I can pronounce Jurassic.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (entering) Hey!!</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Guess what. Frank Jr., and Alice got married!</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Oh my God!!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> And! And, they&#146;re gonna have a baby! (The gang is shocked.) And!
And, they want me to grow it for them in my uterus. (The gang is stunned into silence.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> My God!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Are you serious?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> You&#146;re really thinking about having sex with your brother?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ewww! And &quot;Oh no!&quot; It&#146;s&#151;they just want me to be the
surrogate. It&#146;s her-it&#146;s her egg and her sperm, and I&#146;m-I&#146;m just the
oven, it&#146;s totally their bun. </p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Huh.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What did you tell them?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, they said that I had to think about it first, but what is there to
think about? I&#146;m gonna be giving them the greatest gift you can possibly give.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You&#146;re gonna be carrying their baby and give them a <em>Sony Play
Station</em>?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Honey, this really is an incredible thing to do for them, but there are
things to think about.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah, like you&#146;re gonna be pregnant. I mean pregnant.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I know!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Pheebs, you&#146;re talking about putting your body through an awful lot,
I mean morning sickness, uhh, labour, and it&#146;s all for somebody else!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, what&#146;s your point?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, the stuff I just mentioned.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Wow! I don&#146;t know if I could ever do that. I always figured the
first time I had a baby was with somebody I love and that baby would be a&#133;keeper.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Y'know you guys were a lot more supportive when I wanted to make denim
furniture.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No, Pheebs, listen, if you decide to do this, we&#146;ll be supportive
like crazy.</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> We just want you to think it through.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, honey, maybe you can talk to somebody who&#146;s had a baby. Like
your mom?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> My mom never gave birth. Oh! But my birth mom did.</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Chandler and Kathy are kissing.]</p>

<p><b>Kathy:</b> Umm, (moves her hand&#146;s down to his butt) I love this touchy. Can I
take it to work with me?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, yeah, sure, it&#146;s not mine anyway. It can with the pants.</p>

<p><b>Kathy:</b> Oh! (They kiss and she leaves)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I am so jealous.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You guys are really right&#133;there aren&#146;t you?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes. Right where?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> In the beginning where y&#146;know it&#146;s all sex and talking and sex
and talking and&#133;</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, you-you gotta love the talking.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> And the sex?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All right, we haven&#146;t had sex yet. Okay, what&#146;s the big
deal? Y&#146;know? This is special, and I want our love to grow until we move on to the
next level.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, Chandler that is so nice.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> That is really nice&#133;lying! No way is that the reason!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Why? Just because you&#146;re not mature enough to understand something
like that?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No, he&#146;s right, I&#146;m totally lying.</p>

<p>(Ross makes an &quot;I was right, and you weren&#146;t face.&quot; And Rachel does
Ross&#146;s little I&#146;m-flicking-you-off-but-I&#146;m-not-giving-you-the-finger
banging of the fists.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Then what is it?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, Kathy&#146;s last boyfriend was Joey.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> And you&#146;re afraid you won&#146;t be able to&#133;fill his shoes.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No, I&#146;m afraid I won&#146;t be able to make love as well as him.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, I was going for the metaphor.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes, and I was saying the actual words.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> So big deal, so Joey&#146;s had a lot of girlfriends, it doesn&#146;t
mean he&#146;s great in bed.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> We share a wall! So either he&#146;s great in bed, or she just likes
to agree with him a lot.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Sweetie, with you it&#146;s gonna be different. The sex is gonna be
great, &#145;cause you-you guys are in love.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Just go for it Chandler.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah, you should.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, you should, really.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Go on.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All right, all right, I&#146;ll go sleep with my girlfriend. But
I&#146;m just doing it for you guys.</p>

<p>[Scene: The museum, Joey is giving a tour to a bunch of school kids.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay, now the Mastodon is from the semi-late Jurassic period.</p>

<p><b>Smart Kid:</b> Isn&#146;t the Mastodon from the Pliocene Epic?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Shhh! This is a museum, no talking. Right down here, (Motions to a
fossilised dinosaur foot.) we have a large foot. (Sees Ross working in one of the display
cases.) Uhh, and over here we have Ross Geller. (Knocks on the glass) Everyone wave
&#145;Hi&#146; to Ross. Ross is one of our most important scientists, look at him, hard at
work. (Ross does the old &quot;Putting a cigarette in your ear and pulling it out of your
mouth trick.&quot;) Okay, moving right along. Come on.</p>

<p>[Scene: Phoebe Sr.&#146;s house, there&#146;s a knock on the door.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe Sr:</b> It&#146;s open! Come in!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe Sr:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I&#146;m sorry, I&#146;m late.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe Sr:</b> Oh, that&#146;s okay, it gave me time to finish glazing my nipples.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Wow! You really go all out when you&#146;re expecting company.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe Sr:</b> No, I was working on my pottery.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh! Ooh! Oh, I didn&#146;t know that you did&#133;pot.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe Sr:</b> Well, yeah, mostly nudes. It combines my two passions, pottery and
erotica.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ooh, erotiery!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe Sr:</b> Hey! Okay! Well thanks for coming out to see me. I just-I just
thought it would be a very good idea to talk about this baby stuff in person.
Y&#146;know&#133;</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe Sr:</b> I really don&#146;t think it&#146;s a very good idea, Phoebe.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Why not?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe Sr:</b> Well, because you&#146;d be giving up a baby, and I-I really
don&#146;t&#151;I don&#146;t know if there&#146;s anything I can say that could make you
understand the pain of giving up a baby. So, umm, (Picks up a puppy in the box next to the
couch.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh no! No-no! I understand the pain! Don&#146;t-don&#146;t hurt the
puppy.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe Sr:</b> No-no-no, the-the puppy&#146;s yours.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, I get a puppy!!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe Sr:</b> Well, yeah! I mean yeah, but only for three days.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Why?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe Sr:</b> I realise I don&#146;t have any right to start get all parenty on you
and everything now, but umm, (Sees that Phoebe isn&#146;t paying attention and is busy
mimicking the puppy.) uhh&#133; Phoebe, would you please look at me and not the puppy,
it&#146;s very important. </p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe Sr:</b> I mean, I know what I&#146;m talking about. I gave up two babies, and
I only wish I had someone there that had given up babies, that could tell me how terrible
it is to give up babies. I just think that, it would be something you will regret every
single day for the rest of your life. So, how ever hard it is to give up this puppy, it
would be like a million times harder to give up a child. (Phoebe is playing with the puppy
again, and not listening) I really shouldn&#146;t have given you the puppy first.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> All right, I&#146;m sorry.</p>

<p>[Scene: The museum&#146;s worker cafeteria, Joey is eating lunch with the rest of the
tour guides. Another tour guide tries to sit down in a seat Joey saved for Ross.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Uhh, do you mind sitting there. I&#146;m-I&#146;m saving this for my
friend Ross.</p>

<p><b>Tour Guide:</b> You mean Dr. Geller?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Doctor? Wow! I didn&#146;t know he had a nickname.</p>

<p><b>Tour Guide:</b> Oh, he won&#146;t sit here. Only the people in the white coats sit
over there, (Points to there table) and only the people in the blue blazers sit here.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, how-how come?</p>

<p><b>Tour Guide:</b> That&#146;s just the way it is.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> That&#146;s crazy.</p>

<p><b>Tour Guide:</b> Maybe it&#146;s crazy in a perfect world, a world without lab coats
and blazers, but you not in a perfect world, you in a museum now. See that scientist in
the classes, he and I used to play together all the time in grade school, but
now&#133;(Turns around) Peter! Hey, Peter! It&#146;s me Rhonda! From PS-129! I shared my
puddin&#146; which you man! I gave you my <em>Snack Pack</em>! (to Joey) See, he pretend
he don&#146;t even here me!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I-I think everybody&#146;s pretending they don&#146;t hear you. Anyway,
look, I don&#146;t know about you and your jackets and your separate tables, but Ross is
one of my best friends, and if I save him a seat, I&#146;m telling you, he <b>will</b> sit
in it! (Ross enters and goes over to the white table) Ross! Ross! Over here, man! I-I
saved you seat.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> That&#146;s okay, I&#146;m cool over here. I&#146;ll catch up with you
later, Joey. (Joey is shocked.)</p>

<p>(Another woman enters without a coat or blazer and tries to sit at the &#145;blue&#146;
table.)</p>

<p><b>Tour Guide:</b> Op, this is saved. (Joey wonders why) Gift shop.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Commercial Break</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Joey is eating dinner, Monica and Rachel are sitting on
the couch.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (entering) Hey, uh, I&#146;m really, really sorry about what happened in
the cafeteria today.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> It&#146;s no big deal. Hey, y&#146;know, you do what you gotta do. Right?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> But hey, it&#146;s not just me, I mean the scientists and the tour guides <b>never</b>
sit together.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Whatever.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> It&#146;s like that everywhere, Joey! Okay, Mon, back me up here. Where
you work the uh, waiters eat with the waiters, right? And the chefs eat with the other
chefs, right?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I eat by myself in the alley because everybody hates me.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Look, Ross, really it&#146;s-it&#146;s no big deal. Y&#146;know you wear a
white coat, I wear a blue blazer, if that means we can&#146;t be friends at work, then so
be it. Y&#146;know, hey I understand. Y&#146;know? Hey, when I&#146;m in a play and
you&#146;re in the audience, I don&#146;t talk to you, right? So it&#146;s y&#146;know,
it&#146;s uh, it&#146;s cool. I&#146;ll see you tomorrow. (Leaves)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, when we&#146;re in the audience he doesn&#146;t talk to us, but he
does wave.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the next morning, Phoebe is there with her puppy and is
trying to sing it to sleep as Chandler enters.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hi.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Why is Phoebe singing to Carl Mulden?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ooh, y&#146;know what, I think it&#146;s time for puppy to go out again.
Come on, let&#146;s go to the balcony.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Umm, the street. Come on, let&#146;s go to the street. Ooh, listen,
don&#146;t go onto the balcony until after I get back. (Leaves)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (to Chandler) So, did you do it?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes, yes, we had the sex.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Uh-oh, it was bad?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> It was fine, y&#146;know? But she didn&#146;t agree with me as
strongly as she agreed with Joey. She was more like, &quot;I see you point, I&#146;m all
right with it.&quot;</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well, it was the first time. Y&#146;know, there&#146;s not always a lot
of agreement the first time.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, not girls anyway, guys agree (snaps her fingers) like that.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Look, you have to help me! Okay? I mean, I know what to do with a
woman, y&#146;know, I know where everything goes, it&#146;s always nice. But I need to
know what makes it go from nice to, &quot;My God! Somebody&#146;s killing her in
there!&quot;</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> All right, I&#146;m gonna show you something a lot of guys don&#146;t
know. Rach, give me that pad, please? (She does so and Monica starts drawing on it) All
right. Now&#133;</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Look, you don&#146;t have to draw an actual wo&#151;whoa! She&#146;s
hot!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Now everybody knows the basic erogenous zones. (She starts labelling
them) You got one, two three, four (Chandler is shocked to find out there&#146;s more than
three), five, six, and seven!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (shocked) There are seven?!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Let me see that. (Monica shows her) Oh, yeah.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (Points to one) That&#146;s one?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> It&#146;s kind of an important one!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, y&#146;know-y&#146;know what, I was looking at it upside down.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, y&#146;know, sometimes that helps. (She realises what that
could&#146;ve meant.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (continuing) Now, most guys will hit uh, 1-2-3 and then go to 7 and set
up camp.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> That-that&#146;s bad?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well if you go to <em>Disneyland</em>, you don&#146;t spend the whole
day on the Materhorn.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well you might if it were anything like 7!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> All right uh, the important thing is to take your time, you want to hit
&#145;em all, and you mix &#145;em up. You gotta keep them on their toes.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oo, toes!! Well, for some people. (Chandler eyes her and her toes.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> All right. Umm, you could uh start out with a little 1, a 2, a 1-2-3, 3,
5, a 4, a 3-2, 2, a 2-4-6, 2-4-6, 4, (Rachel starts getting worked up) 2, 2, 4-7, 5-7,
6-7, 7, &#133;7..&#133;7&#133;7-7-7-7-7-7-7-7-7-7-7-7&#133;(mouths 7)! (They both lean
back on the couch satisfied.)</p>

<p>[Scene: The museum cafeteria, Joey is eating with the tour guides as Ross enters.]</p>

<p><b><b>Older Scientist:</b></b> Dr. Geller, there&#146;s a seat over here. (Motions to
an empty chair at the &#145;white&#146; table.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Thank you, Dr. Phillips, but I&#146;m having my lunch at this table, here
in the middle. I&#146;m having lunch right here, with my good friend Joey, if he&#146;ll
sit with me.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (standing up) I will sit with you Dr. Geller. (He goes over to his table
and they shake hands.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Y'know, we work in a museum of natural history, and yet there is something
unnatural about the way we eat lunch. Now, I look around this cafeteria, and y&#146;know
what I see, I see-I see division. Division, between people in white coats and people in
blue blazers, and I ask myself, &quot;My God why?!&quot; Now, I say we shed these-these
coats that separate us, and we get to know the people underneath. (He takes off his coat
and throws it down.) I&#146;m Ross! I&#146;m divorced, and I have a kid!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (stands up, and throws his coat on the floor) I&#146;m Joey! I&#146;m an
actor! I don&#146;t know squat about dinosaurs!</p>

<p><b>Another Tour Guide:</b> (standing up and removing his coat) I&#146;m Ted, and I just
moved here a month ago, and New York really scares me.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> All right, there you go!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, you hang in there Teddy!</p>

<p><b><b>Older Scientist:</b></b> I&#146;m Andrew, and I didn&#146;t pay for this pear.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, good-good for you.</p>

<p><b>Tour Guide:</b> I&#146;m Rhonda, (motions to her breasts) and these aren&#146;t
real! (Joey and Ross look at each other, shocked)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Wow, Rhonda.</p>

<p><b>Another Scientist:</b> I&#146;m Scott.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, okay, Scott!</p>

<p><b>Another Scientist:</b> And I need to flip the light switch on and off 17 times
before I leave a room or my family will die.</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe, with the puppy, Monica, and Rachel are sitting on the
couch.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> My mom&#146;s gonna be here any minute. I can&#146;t do this, I
can&#146;t give him up. Yes&#151;no, I can. I don&#146;t want to. But I can. No.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oo, I can&#146;t watch this, it&#146;s like <em>Sophie&#146;s Choice</em>.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Y&#146;know, I never saw that.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ooh, it was only okay.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ooh, I can&#146;t do this. My mom was right. If I can&#146;t-if I
can&#146;t give him up, then there&#146;s no way I can give up a baby. Ohh, God, Frank and
Alice are gonna be so crushed. What-what else, what else can I give &#145;em&#151;a
kidney!</p>

<p><b>Alice:</b> (entering with Frank) Hi!</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>Alice:</b> Uhh, we were just in the neighbourhood, so&#133;</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Yeah, so we just thought we&#146;d stop by and let you know there&#146;s
still no pressure.</p>

<p><b>Alice:</b> None. But if there was something you wanted to tell us, we&#146;re just
gonna be right over there (points to the counter) having coffee.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> (noticing the puppy) Oh, who&#146;s this little guy?! (Grabs the puppy)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh! Ooh! Umm!</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Oh, he&#146;s so cute, he reminds me of my old dog, Tumour.</p>

<p><b>Alice:</b> You are so precious, I could just take you home.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey, why don&#146;t you?</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Are you serious?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Uh-huh, yeah!</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Oh, thanks.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What are you doing?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, I&#146;m really okay with this. Y&#146;know why? &#145;Cause look at
them, and I made that, so&#133; I know it&#146;s gonna be like a million times harder to
give up a baby but, oh my God, it&#146;s gonna feel like a million times better, right? I
wanna do this. (To Frank and Alice) I wanna carry your baby.</p>

<p><b>Alice:</b> (shocked) Oh! Oh! Oh! Thank you so much! You don&#146;t know what this
means to us! Oh!</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Oh my God, I think I&#146;m gonna cry!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> It&#146;s gonna be so great.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe Sr:</b> (entering) Hi! What&#146;s going on?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, I-I gave them the puppy and it made them so happy that I decided
I&#146;m gonna carry their baby.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe Sr:</b> But Phoebe&#133;</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No-no-no, I know, but you and I are different people though, and this is
a totally different situation, and I know that I am not gonna regret this.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe Sr:</b> Oh, I-I-I understand all that, but it&#146;s just&#151;that was my
puppy.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh!</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Closing Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Rachel are sitting at the table.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Would you ever be a surrogate for anyone?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> It depends on who asked.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What if I asked?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, Mon, sure.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Really?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yes. (Pause) You&#146;re not asking are you?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yes! Totally!</p>

<p>(Kathy runs in, hair all out of place, and hugs Monica.)</p>

<p><b>Kathy:</b> Oh! Thank you! Thank you! Thank you! Yes! Thank you! (Runs back to
Chandler)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>End</strong></p>
</body>
</html>
412<html>

<head>
<title>The One With The Embryos</title>
<meta HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=windows-1252">
<meta NAME="GENERATOR" CONTENT="Microsoft FrontPage 3.0">
<meta NAME="Template" CONTENT="C:\Program Files\Microsoft Office\Templates\FRIENDS1.dot">
</head>

<body bgcolor="#FFFFFF" link="#008000">

<h1 align="center">The One With The Embryos</h1>

<hr>

<p>Written by: Jill Condon &amp; Amy Toomin<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a></p>

<hr>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, it&#146;s 0-Dark:30, in other words it&#146;s really,
really early. Everyone&#146;s asleep, and all through the apartments not a creature was
stirring, not even a mouse. That is except for the chick, who turns out to be a rooster
and is crowing in the sun. Needless to say, this awakens Monica and Rachel who rush into
their living room, searching for the cause of the sound.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What the <b>hell</b> is that?!! (to Monica) What the hell is that? Is
that you? (Monica nods her head no, and Rachel realizes what is making that sound.)
Ohhhhhhh! (storms over to Chandler and Joey&#146;s with Monica in trail.) </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Boy, you are <b>really</b> not a morning person.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (angrily) BACK OFF!!! (She starts banging on their door.) Get up! Get
up! Get up! God damn it! Get up, get up, get up, get up, get up!!</p>

<p>(Chandler opens the door, finally.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> <b>What</b> is that noise?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> It&#146;s the chick! She&#146;s&#133;going through some changes.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What kind of changes?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well the vet seems to think that&#146;s she&#146;s becoming a rooster.
(The rooster crows.) We&#146;re getting a second opinion.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Opening Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, it&#146;s later that morning, everybody has gotten up and
Ross and Phoebe has joined them for breakfast. Rachel is returning from shopping.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey, what are you doing shopping at eight in the morning?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, I&#146;ve been up since six. Thanks to <b>somebody&#146;s</b>
dumb-ass rooster.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> You guys you really should get rid of those animals. They shouldn&#146;t
be living in an apartment.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah! Especially not with all of these knives and cookbooks around&#133;</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> All right. I&#146;m gonna go to the fertility doctor and um, see if
I&#146;m ready to have Frank and Alice&#146;s embryo transferred into my uterus.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Now, how will they know if you&#146;re ready?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, they&#146;re just gonna umm, look to see if my endometria layer is
thick.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, I can uh, check that for ya.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay everyone, think thick.</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Good-bye! Good luck! (She opens the door to reveal Monica and Joey.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hi! Wish me luck!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, good luck.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Good luck. (to Monica) And I&#146;m still right!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> That is sooo not true!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> She&#146;s mad because I know today&#146;s her laundry day and that means
she&#146;s wearing her old lady underpants.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I can check that for ya.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I just&#151;I can&#146;t believe that you think that you and Chandler
know me and Rachel better than we know you.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well&#133; we-we do. <b>You</b> can only eat Tic Tacks in even
numbers.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, what&#146;s that about?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (to Rachel) And you&#133; Ross, I believe, if you check Rachel&#146;s
bag you will find a half-eaten box of cookies in there.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (He does so, and finds a half-eaten box of cookies.) You&#146;re good.
(Tries a cookie.) These are not.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I&#146;m <b>so</b> not impressed. Everybody snacks when they shop.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh yeah? Ross, how many items left in that bag?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Five.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, ten bucks says that we can name every item in that bag.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> How many guesses do you get?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Six.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Challenge extended.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Deal!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Challenge excepted.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> All right, we&#146;ll start with&#133;apples.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> We&#146;ll be starting with apples.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (to Ross) Stop that now!</p>

<p>(Ross reveals a bag of apples.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay. Uhh, tortilla chips, yogurt.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Diet soda.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yes. Yes. Yes. (They&#146;re perfect so far.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Orange juice.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No! There&#146;s no orange juice in there! We win!! </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Ha-ha!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> They <b>have</b> another guess.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, well, we won that one.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay, the last thing&#133;</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh-oh, oh, oh-oh! (Whispers something in Joey&#146;s ear.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No-no, not for like another two weeks.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I got it! Scotch&#133; tape. (They&#146;re right.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> How did you know she would buy scotch tape?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, we used there&#146;s up last night making scary faces.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Aww, man!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All right! Ten buck! Fork it over! Cough it up! Pay the piper! Gimme
it.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> That does not mean you know us better, I-I want a rematch.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, and none of these stupid grocery questions, real personal
questions.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah! And the winner gets a hundred bucks.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Serious?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Are you scared?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No! All right, who-who makes up the questions?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Ross will do it.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh sure, &quot;Ross will do it!&quot; It&#146;s not like he has a job, or
a child, or a life of his own.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Fine! We&#146;ll ask Phoebe.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No-no-no, I-I wanna play.</p>

<p>[Scene: The Doctor&#146;s office, Dr. Zane is examining Phoebe as Frank and Alice
watch.]</p>

<p><b>Dr. Zane:</b> It looks like your uterus is ready for implantation.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh! I knew it! I knew it! I felt really thick this morning.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Well, okay, so what&#146;s now&#151;go get, go get the eggs, put &#145;em
in there.</p>

<p><b>Dr. Zane:</b> Okay, it&#146;ll take just a little while to prepare the embryos.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Embryossss? As in, &quot;More than one?&quot;</p>

<p><b>Dr. Zane:</b> Um-hmm, five actually.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Five? Okay, where am I giving birth, a hospital or a big box under the
stairs?</p>

<p><b>Dr. Zane:</b> We do five because that gives you a 25% chance that at least one will
attach.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> That&#146;s it! 25 percent? That means that&#146;s it&#146;s like 75
percent chance of no baby at all!</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Hey, y&#146;know I was thinking, what are the odds like if-if, if you
stuff like 200 of them in there?</p>

<p><b>Alice:</b> Sweety, now, she&#146;s a woman, not a gumball machine.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, well y&#146;know what, don&#146;t worry you guys, &#145;cause
I&#146;m-I&#146;m gonna do this as many times as it takes to get it right.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Well, you see, the-the thing is, we-we only got, we kinda have one shot
to make it right.</p>

<p><b>Alice:</b> Umm, it costs $16,000 each time you do this. So, umm, we&#146;re kinda
using all the money we have to do it just this one time.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Whoa!! That&#151;okay, that&#146;s a <b>lot</b> of pressure on me and my
uterus. (to Dr. Zane) So, well okay, so is there&#151;is maybe is there something that I
can do y&#146;know just to like help make sure I get pregnant?</p>

<p><b>Dr. Zane:</b> No, I&#146;m sorry.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Wow! You guys really don&#146;t know anything!</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> I know! Why don&#146;t you get drunk! That worked for a lot of girls in
my high school.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the game is about to begin.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You guys! Do you realize that any minute now, Phoebe can be pregnant?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Huh.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I know! I know, it&#146;s such a huge, life-altering thing.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I know.</p>

<p>(They all pause and think about it.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> The test is ready.</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Yeah! Yes! (They all right into the living room, all excited.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, each team will answer ten questions. The first team that answers the
most questions wins. Okay, the categories are, Fears and Pet Peeves, Ancient History,
Literature, and It&#146;s All Relative. Now, the coin toss to see who goes first. (He
flips the coin and they all watch it hit the table and stop. Then they all look up at him,
to see who goes first.) Okay, somebody call it this time.</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Oh yeah!</p>

<p>(Ross flips the coin again.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Tails!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> It&#146;s heads. (The guys celebrate.) Gentlemen, pick your category.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Fears and Pet Peeves.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What is Monica&#146;s biggest pet peeve?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Animals dressed as humans.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> That&#146;s correct. Ladies?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Same category?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> According to Chandler, what phenomenon scares the bejeezus out of him?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Michael Flatley, Lord of the Dance!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> That is correct.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (to Chandler) The Irish gig guy?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> His legs flail about as if independent of his body!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Gentlemen, you&#146;re pick.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> It&#146;s All Relative.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Monica and I have a grandmother who died, you both went to her funeral,
name that grandmother!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (to Chandler) Nana?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> She has a real name.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (answering the question) Althea!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Althea?! What are you doing?! </p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I took a shot.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You're shooting with Althea?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Althea is correct.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Nice shooting!</p>

<p>(Ross motions for the girls to pick.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> We&#146;ll take Literature!!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Every week, the TV Guide comes to Chandler and Joey&#146;s apartment. What
name appears on the address label?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Chandler gets it! It&#146;s Chandler Bing!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No!!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I&#146;m afraid the TV Guide comes to Chinandolor Bong.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I knew that! Rachel! Use you&#146;re head!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Actually, it&#146;s Miss Chinandolor Bong.</p>

<p>[Scene: The Doctor&#146;s office, Phoebe is giving a pep talk to the petrie dish
containing the embryos.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hello, tiny embryos. Well, I&#146;m-I&#146;m Phoebe Buffay, hi!
I&#146;m-I&#146;m-I&#146;m hoping to be your uterus for the next nine months. You should
know, that we&#146;re doing this for Frank and Alice, who you know, you&#146;ve been
there! Umm, y&#146;know they want you so much, so when you guys get in there, really grab
on. Okay, and-and I promise that I&#146;ll keep you safe and warm until you&#146;re ready
to have them take you home, so&#133; Oh! And also, umm next time you see me, I&#146;m
screaming, don&#146;t worry, that&#146;s what&#146;s supposed to happen.</p>

<p><b>Dr. Zane:</b> Ready?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Uh-huh. (To the embryos) Good luck.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the game is coming to a close.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> All right, the score is nine to eight in favor of the guys. Ladies if you
miss this the game is theirs, pick your category.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (shouting) It&#146;s All Relative!!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You don&#146;t have to shout everything.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (shouting) I&#146;m sorry!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Ooh. What is the name of Chandler&#146;s father&#146;s Las Vegas all-male
burlesque?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Viva Las Gaygas!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Unfortunately that is correct.</p>

<p><b>The Girls:</b> Yes!!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> All right, we have a tie. Luckily, I have prepared for such an event. (He
opens up an envelope and holds up some note cards.) The Lightning Round!</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Ohhhh.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Thirty seconds, all the questions you can answer.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You guys are dead, I am <b>so</b> good at lighting rounds.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I majored in lightning rounds. All right, we&#146;re gonna destroy
you.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Huh, wanna bet?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, I&#146;m so confused as to what we&#146;ve been doing so
far&#133;</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> How about we play for more money, say 150?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> 150 dollars.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Say 200?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> 200 dollars.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You&#146;re doing it again.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Excuse me.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Monica, I don&#146;t want to lose 200 dollars.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> We won&#146;t. (to Chandler) 300?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Monica?!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I&#146;m just trying to spice it up!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, so let&#146;s play for some pepper! Stop spending my money!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I got it! How about, if we win, they have to get rid of the rooster?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oooohh that&#146;s interesting.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey, no way, that rooster&#146;s family!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Throw in the duck too!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What do you have against the duck?! He doesn&#146;t make any noise!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, he gets the other one all riled up.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Look, we are not gonna&#133;</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (interrupting) All right, hold on! If you win, we give up the birds.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (shocked) Dah!! (Chandler motions for him to calm down.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> But if we win, we get your apartment.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oooooh!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Deal!</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Commercial Break</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, continued from earlier, only slightly later.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Monica, betting the apartment, I don&#146;t know about this.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Rachel, I have not missed one question the whole game. I own this game!
Look at my hand. (Holds up her hand.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Why? Do you have the answers written on there?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No! Steady as a rock! Now, are you with me.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> All right, let&#146;s do it.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Come on!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay. (They go into the living room.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> All right, gentlemen, you&#146;re up first.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay. (Starts jumping around.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You have 30 seconds. And the lightning round begins&#151;stop it (Chandler
stops jumping)&#151;now. What was Monica&#146;s nickname when she was a field hockey
goalie?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Big fat goalie.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Correct. Rachel claims <b>this</b> is her favorite movie&#133;</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> <em>Dangerous Liaisons</em>.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Correct. Her actual favorite movie is...</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> <em>Weekend at Bernie&#146;s</em>.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Correct. In what part of her body did Monica get a pencil stuck at age 14?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh! (Whispers something in Joey&#146;s ear and then in Ross&#146;s
ear.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Eww! No!! Her ear! All right, Monica categorizes her towels. How many
categories are there?</p>

<p>(They both confer.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Everyday use.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Fancy.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Guest.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Fancy guest.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Two seconds&#133;</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Uhh, 11!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> 11, unbelievable 11 is correct. (The guys celebrate.) All right,
that&#146;s 4 for the guys. Ladies, you&#146;re up. </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> All right!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Come on!</p>

<p>(As they change places, they give each other the now patented Ross maneuver. If you
don&#146;t know what that means, click here to find out The One With Joey's New
Girlfriend.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> 30 seconds on the clock. 5 questions wins the game. The lightning round
begins&#133;now! What is Joey&#146;s favorite food?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Sandwiches! </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Correct. Chandler was how old when he first touched a girl&#146;s breast?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> 14?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, 19.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Thanks man.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Joey, had an imaginary childhood friend. His name was?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Maurice.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Correct, his profession was?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Space cowboy!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Correct! What is Chandler Bing&#146;s job?</p>

<p>(The girls are stumped)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh gosh, it has something to do with numbers.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> And processing.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> He carries a briefcase.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> 10 seconds, you need this or you lose the game.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> It&#146;s umm, it has something to do with transponding.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh-oh-oh, he&#146;s a transponce&#151;transpondster!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> That&#146;s not even a word! I can get this! I can get this!</p>

<p>(Ross stops the clock, signifying the end of the lightning round.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> <b>NOOOOOOOOO!!!!!</p>
</b>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh my God.</p>

<p><b>Chandler and Joey:</b> <b>YEAH!!!</b> YES!!!</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, erm, Chandler and Joey's, Chandler and Joey are carrying
in the foosball table.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I call Monica&#146;s room!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You can&#146;t just call Monica&#146;s room.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Sure I can, standard shotgun rules, I&#146;m sight of the room and I
called it.</p>

<p>(Chandler grunts and turns around, sees that he&#146;s in sight of the room, and mouths
damn!)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Man, I feel like I&#146;m coming down with something.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah. (to Chandler) I bet you can&#146;t guess what color my tonsils
are? I&#146;ll bet the apartment!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, I would never bet this apartment. It&#146;s too nice.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (entering) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey&#151;ooh Pheebs, are they in there?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Umm, yeah, uh-huh, they&#146;re implanted.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> How do you feel?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, freaked. &#145;Cause it turns out that the odds are really sucky.
And! This is Frank and Alice&#146;s like only shot. Like, they are <b>literally</b>
putting all of their eggs in my basket.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, but I bet it works.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Really?! How much?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> All right, I&#146;m gonna go take a pregnancy test, right now.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh wow! You can tell this soon.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well the doctor says it takes a couple days, but my body&#146;s always
been a little faster than Western medicine. </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (entering from Chandler&#146;s bedroom, I guess, and sees the foosball
table.) Oh my God! I can&#146;t believe you guys are actually think you&#146;re moving in
here!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well believe it baby!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well I-I-I&#146;m not moving.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> <b>What?!</p>
</b>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No, it was a stupid bet! We were just playing a game!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> You can&#146;t just ignore the bet! It&#146;s a bet! You bet and you bet
and if you lose, you lose the bet!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Look Rach, we have to move. I mean if they had lost, we would&#146;ve
made them get rid of the birds. Right?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Noooo.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> All right, look, I hate this as much as you, but if it makes you feel
better, it&#146;s all your fault.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Chinadolor Bong, come on, we steal that TV Guide every week!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I knew it!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I don&#146;t care, I&#146;m not going anywhere.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Cool, girl roommate.</p>

<p>(Phoebe comes in from the bathroom as Rachel sits down in disgust.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Nope, not knocked up yet.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> It&#146;s only been a couple of hours, so just give it some time.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, all right. Meanwhile, I&#146;m gonna do whatever I can to help
this so, I&#146;m just gonna y&#146;know, lie it your chair, (She climbs into the chair
and drapes her feet over the back of the chair.) Y'know? Yeah, good, I&#146;m let gravity
y&#146;know, do its jobs.</p>

<p>[Cut too later, the moving process is progressing steadily. Monica is trying to lift a
heavy box, as Rachel comes in from Chandler&#146;s bedroom.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey, Rach, can you give me a hand with this box?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No! Put that box down! We are not going anywhere! This is my apartment
and I like it! This is a girl&#146;s apartment! That is a boy&#146;s apartment, it&#146;s
dirty and it smells. This is pretty. It&#146;s-it&#146;s so pretty! And look, and
it&#146;s-it&#146;s purple! And I&#146;m telling you, you with the steady hand, I am not
moving, and now <b>I</b> have got the steady hand. (She holds out her hand, which is
shaking uncontrollably.) </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I&#146;ll take care of it.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> That&#146;s right! You do what the hand says!</p>

<p>[Cut to later, Phoebe is still in the chair and Rachel is laying down as Monica
enters.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> How did it go?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I lost our mattresses.</p>

<p>[Cut to still later, Rachel has now resigned herself to move and is now helping Monica.
Phoebe is still on the chair.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (singing) &quot;<em>Are you in there little fetus</em>? <br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<em>In nine will you come great us</em>? <br>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
<em>I will buy you some Adidas</em>.&quot;</p>

<p>(There&#146;s a knock on the door and Monica answers it.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Frank and Alice:</b> (entering) Hi!</p>

<p><b>Alice:</b> Hi, Phoebe! We were just at the drugstore and we got you a little
present.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh. Oh.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Umm, it&#146;s a lollipop and a uh, a home pregnancy test.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey, don&#146;t mix those up, you could really ruin that lollipop.</p>

<p><b>Alice:</b> So umm, you feel like taking a test? There&#146;s only one question.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> All right, I will. No, I will. But umm, y&#146;know just remember that
it&#146;s still really early, okay so, if it says that I&#146;m not pregnant, that
doesn&#146;t mean that I&#146;m not gonna <b>get</b> pregnant, okay and, and just please,
just so I don&#146;t go completely nuts, just try not put all your hopes on this.</p>

<p><b>Alice:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Okay. (They both squeal in expectation.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Great. (Goes to take the test.)</p>

<p>(The door opens and Joey and Chandler ride in on the big, fake dog in triumph)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Y&#146;know what, you are mean boys, who are just being mean!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey, don&#146;t get mad at us! No one forced you to raise the stakes!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> That is not true. She did! She forced me!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey, we would still be living here if hadn&#146;t gotten the question
wrong!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well it stupid, unfair question!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Don&#146;t blame the questions!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Would you all stop yelling in our apartment! You are ruining moving
day for us!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Will you stop calling it your apartment!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> But it is our apartment!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No it&#146;s not!</p>

<p>(They all decay into massive bickering as Phoebe returns from the bathroom.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> You guys! You guys! You&#146;re gonna have a baby! They&#146;re gonna
have a baby!</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> <b>MY SISTER&#146;S GONNA HAVE MY BABY!!!!!!!</p>
</b>

<p>(They all go over and hug Phoebe.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, but this can&#146;t be good for the baby.</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Oh! (They stop hugging her to let her out and resume the hug without her.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Closing Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, erm, Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Rachel are busy
unpacking.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I can&#146;t find garbage bags!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, I think I saw some in here. </p>

<p>(She opens a door and they both scream at horror at what&#146;s inside of it.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What is it?!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I don&#146;t know! But maybe if we keep that drawer shut, it&#146;ll
die.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I can&#146;t believe we&#146;re living here!</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, erm, Chandler and Joey's, they&#146;re both unpacked. The
big ceramic dog has found a new home in front of the window. Joey screams and runs into
the living room.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What?! What-what is it?!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Did you see the size of the closets?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I can&#146;t believe we live here!</p>

<p>(They both sit down on the chairs and put up the foot rest.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler and Joey:</b> Awwwww!! (They lean back all the way.) Awwwwwww!!!</p>

<p align="center"><strong>End</strong></p>
</body>

<body bgcolor="#FFFFFF" link="#008000">

<h1 align="center">The One With Rachel&#146;s Crush</h1>

<hr>

<p>Written by: Shana Goldberg-Meehan<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a></p>

<hr>

<p>[Scene: A Theatre, Chandler and Ross are there to watch the premiere of Kathy&#146;s
play.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, she is the star of the play. And she is <b>my</b> girlfriend! I
get to have sex with the star of the play!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> People can hear you.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I know!!</p>

<p>(The play starts.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Wow! She looks great. Doesn&#146;t she?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p>(Onstage there&#146;s a knock on the door and Kathy opens it. We don&#146;t see
what&#146;s going on, only hear it.) </p>

<p><b>Kathy's Co-Star:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>Kathy:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> That is one good looking man!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Is it just me, or can you actually see his abs through his overcoat?!</p>

<p><b>Kathy's Co-Star:</b> Sooo, you&#146;ve been doing this long?</p>

<p><b>Kathy:</b> No, you&#146;re my first. Put the money on the table.</p>

<p>(Ross and Chandler have stunned looks on their faces as Kathy and her co-star start
making out.)</p>

<p><b>Kathy's Co-Star:</b> Oh, yeah! Ooh, that&#146;s nice. (They start making out
harder.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Dude!</p>

<p><b>Kathy's Co-Star:</b> Is that an expensive blouse?</p>

<p><b>Kathy:</b> If you want it to be. </p>

<p>(Kathy&#146;s co-star rips her blouse off and buttons go flying into the audience, and
one hits Ross. Chandler&#146;s mouth is on the floor.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Here&#146;s your girlfriend&#146;s button. (Holding the button.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Opening Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, erm, Monica and Rachel's, Monica is still unpacking after
the move, and Phoebe is their also.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, hey, Mon, do you still have your like old blouses and dresses from
high school?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah, I think I have some around here somewhere. Why? </p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, it&#146;s just that maternity clothes are so expensive.</p>

<p>(Rachel enters)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey, Rach! I made a pile of your stuff over on this side of the room. If
you could just&#133;(Rachel grunts and throws her purse at it)&#133;throw your purses at
it.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> <em>Bloomingdale&#146;s </em>eliminated my department. (Phoebe gasps)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh my God, are you out of a job?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No, but they stuck me in personal shopping. Which is just a <b>huge</b>
step down!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Personal shopping? What is that? Like where you walk around with snooty
rich people and tell them what to buy?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Uh-huh.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> That sounds great!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (entering) Hey! (Goes to the fridge.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Umm, excuse me, we switched apartments. You can&#146;t eat are food
anymore, that-that gravy train had ended.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (Holding a turkey leg) There&#146;s gravy?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> If you have the big apartment you have to deal with people coming over
all the time. That fridge has got to be stocked, okay, that&#146;s your department now.
(She takes back the turkey leg)</p>

<p>(Joey climbs up on the counter and starts looking at the top of the cabinets.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What are you doing?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I think I left a donut up here.</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Ross and Chandler are entering after the play. Phoebe and Joey
are already there.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ooh! How was Kathy&#146;s play?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, Kathy gets half-naked and simulates sex with a real good
lookin&#146; guy.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, it&#146;s like someone <b>literally</b> wrote down my worst
nightmare and then charged me $32 to see it!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> <b>That&#146;s</b> a good idea for a business!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I&#146;m totally screwed. Okay, they are gonna be hot and heavy on
stage every night, and then they&#146;re gonna go to their cast parties and he&#146;s
gonna try to undermine me. Y'know it&#146;ll be like, &quot;So where&#146;s your
boyfriend, what&#146;s-his-name, Chester?&quot; And she&#146;ll go, &quot;No-no-no,
it&#146;s Chandler.&quot; And he&#146;ll go, &quot;Whatever. Ha-ha-ha-ha!&quot;</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (to Ross) That-that is a good trick.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All right, look, look, what am I gonna do?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Chandler, look they&#146;re actors. They&#146;re there to do a job, just
&#145;cause they work together, doesn&#146;t mean they&#146;re gonna get together. I mean
just &#145;cause it happened with Susan Sarandon and Tim Robbins, it doesn&#146;t mean
it&#146;s gonna happen with them.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh-oh, Alec Baldwin and Kim Basinger.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Tom Cruise and Nicole Kidman. </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey, Mel Gibson and Clint Eastwood.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> They&#146;re not a couple!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh-okay, I get the game now.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay look, look, let me ask you a question, when they were doing it on
stage, was it like really hot?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh yeah!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well okay, so then you&#146;re fine. The rule is when two actors are
actually doing it off-stage all the sexual tension between them is gone. Okay? So as long
as it&#146;s hot onstage you got nothing to worry about. It&#146;s when the heat goes
away, that&#146;s when you&#146;re in trouble.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Really?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Look, you guys have been to every play I&#146;ve ever been in, have I ever
had chemistry on stage?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Noooo!!</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, erm, Chandler and Joey's, the gang minus Monica and Rachel
are eating breakfast. Ross and Chandler are sitting at the foosball table and eating.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> So uh, man, are you gonna go to the play with me tonight?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Y&#146;know what, I don&#146;t know how comfortable I am going to see how
hot the sex is between some guy and your girlfriend.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, I know but&#133;</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh no-no-no, I&#146;m there.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (entering) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey Mon! Want some pancakes?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You made pancakes?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yep! Grab a plate.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay. (She does so and starts to walk towards Joey to receive her
pancakes.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No-no, stay right there. (Monica stops and Joey flips her a pancake, which
flies over her head and lands in the living room.) Gettin&#146; closer.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, okay, but don&#146;t worry, because we also have cereals,
muffins, waffles, <b>and</b>, jams, jellies, and marmalades. Which I&#146;m fairly certain
are the same thing.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Listen also we&#146;re uh, we&#146;re watching the game here Saturday
night, if people want to come over.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh yeah!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, I was thinking about having people over for the game.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh yeah, who&#146;s playing?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> The players.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Somebody seems to be missing being the hostess.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (laughs) Please, it&#146;s a relief is what it is, is what it is.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> All right Pheebs, stick out your plate!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh. (Joey flips the pancake and Phoebe catches it and throws it on her
plate.)</p>

<p>[Scene: <em>Bloomingdale&#146;s</em>, Rachel&#146;s new job.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (on the phone) Monica, I&#146;m quitting! I just helped an 81 year old
woman put on a thong and she didn&#146;t even buy it! (Pause) I&#146;m telling you
I&#146;m quitting! That&#146;s it! I&#146;m talking to my boss right now! (Pause) Yes I
am! (Pause) Yes I am! Yes I am! Yes I am! Yes I am! Yes I am! Okay bye, call me when you
get this message. (Hangs up as her boss, Mr. Waltham, walks in.) Oh! Mr. Waltham, I ah
really need to talk to you.</p>

<p><b>Mr. Waltham:</b> In a moment, please, I&#146;m in the middle of a task. And you have
a customer. </p>

<p>(It&#146;s a really good-looking man, Joshua, that Rachel has an instant crush on. Well
actually it&#146;s Tate Donovan, so it&#146;s not like she&#146;s really testing her
acting skills.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Hi, I&#146;m Joshua.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hi, I&#146;m Rachel Green. What can I do for you Joshua?</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Well, I need a whole new wardrobe. My wife, well my <b>ex</b>-wife&#133;</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, I&#146;m so sorry.</p>

<p>(He walks over to look and some clothes and Rachel quickly turns around and adjusts her
bra, trying to show off her assets.)</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Anyway, she burned all of my clothes. I got away with two things. This
suit and what turned out to be a skirt.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, at least that&#146;s a great suit.</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Yeah, but it wasn&#146;t much fun dropping it off at the dry cleaners in
the skirt. (Rachel laughs) So I need everything down to underwear, so if you&#146;re
willing, I&#146;m all yours.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Mr. Waltham:</b> Rachel, you needed to speak to me?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No-no, that wasn&#146;t me! (To Joshua) Well, we should get started. Let
me show you my underwear. (Joshua turns at that) The selection of underwear we carry.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh-oh, sorry, it&#146;s this way, it&#146;s this way. (Motions to the
correct way.)</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> It&#146;s this way? Sorry. (He walks past her and she again admires his
butt.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I&#146;m right! Right? There was like no chemistry between them.
Before they had heat, and now there&#146;s no heat! Now you know what this means, Joey
told us what this means!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> All right, let&#146;s not jump to any conclusions. All right? There was
some sexual chemistry between them.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Come on, it was like cousins having sex up there!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Here she comes. Don&#146;t say a word, okay? Just be cool, don&#146;t
be&#133;y'know you.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Kathy:</b> Hi! (Kisses Chandler) Thank you so much for coming again. Did you like it

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, absolutely! (Chandler mumbles something.)</p>

<p>(Chandler laughs without opening his mouth.)</p>

<p><b>Kathy:</b> It&#146;s a good play, isn&#146;t it?</p>

<p>(Chandler mumbles something, and Ross tells him to &quot;Come on.&quot;)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, I loved the play. You were great, and <b>Nick</b> ditto. Clearly

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, I&#133; (Walks away.)</p>

<p><b>Kathy:</b> Clearly, I&#146;m having sex with him?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh come on, it was so obvious! There was no chemistry between you two!</p>

<p><b>Kathy:</b> Okay, so let me just get this straight. You&#146;re accusing me of
cheating on you, and insulting my performance?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Y&#146;know, I-I could see how this could happen, y'know you&#146;re

<p><b>Kathy:</b> Acting! Chandler, this is my job! I&#146;m-I&#146;m playing a part in a

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, you can understand, given how we started.</p>

<p><b>Kathy:</b> Oh, wow. I can&#146;t believe you&#146;re throwing that in my face.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, that is what happened, and I don&#146;t even see you denying
this!</p>

<p><b>Kathy:</b> I&#146;ll tell you what, Chandler, why don&#146;t you call me when you
grow up!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, well, don&#146;t expect <b>that</b> to happen anytime soon!</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Commercial Break</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, erm, Chandler and Joey's, Joey, Phoebe, and Ross are there
eating pizza as Rachel enters.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I have the best job in the entire world! The most adorable guy came over
today, and I got to dress him up all day!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Rachel has a new doll.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, I wish he was a doll, then I could get a Rachel doll and bump them
together and make kissy noises. Oh! And he has the most beautiful name, I never realised
it, Joshua! Josh-<strong>u</strong>-a! Joshua! Josh.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Uh, hello!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hi-e!!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ooh, what do I smell?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I don&#146;t know, it smells good.</p>

<p>(He goes over and opens the door to reveal Monica holding a plate of cookies and a fan
to blow the smell across the hall.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Fresh cookies! Hot from the oven!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ooh! (They all go over to her apartment)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Please, have some!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, yumm!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah, I&#146;ve just been fiddling around in here making delicious
treats for everyone.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (Holding a magazine) Wow! The new <em>Playboy</em>!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah, it&#146;s just something I picked up.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Cookies and porn, you&#146;re the best mom ever!!</p>

<p>(Rachel laughs hysterically for no reason.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What? What?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, it was just something Josh said about v-necks, but you had to be
there.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, how does Jason look in a v-neck?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> It&#146;s Joshua.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, whatever. (Laughs and gives Joey the thumbs up heading back to his

<p><b>Monica:</b> Wait! Wait! This isn&#146;t take-out!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (getting up) Well, I hate to eat and run, but&#133;</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No, wait, please don&#146;t go! I&#146;ve got porn for you too!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, I don&#146;t need it.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> People are supposed to wanna hang out here!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Why? Honey, what is the big deal?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I&#146;m the hostess! Not those guys! I&#146;m always the hostess! I
mean, I was always the hostess, I mean even when I was little, I mean the girls brought

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, why did you make like a whole big thing out of y'know, everyone

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> If you wanted to punish them, you should&#146;ve just made them hang out
here! </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, that&#146;s true.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> All right then, when I&#146;m done with this place, it&#146;s gonna be
ten times better than that place!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, are we gonna trash that place?</p>

<p>(Chandler comes back, obviously drunk, and trips over the steps.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Steps! (He opens the door to his apartment to Ross and Joey looking at

to hear that Kathy is sleeping with that guy!</p>

<p><b>All:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> So you were right?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I confronted her, and she didn&#146;t deny it! (Pause) I don&#146;t
live here! (Goes back into his apartment and they all follow him.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Chandler!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Chandler, what did she say?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Wait a minute.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Come here.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Are you sure?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, I may be drunk, but I know what she said! Then I went over to <em>Beefsteak
Julie&#146;s</em>&#133;</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> <em>Beefsteak Charlie&#146;s</em>?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes! See you and I have always been like&#151;(motions that they think
the same.)</p>

<p>[Scene: The hallway between the apartments, Monica is lugging one of those floor
polishing machines through the hallway. Rachel comes up the steps and stops when she sees
Monica.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Whoops. (Starts to go into Chandler and Joey&#146;s.) Oh, hey, do you
need help with that?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Nah, I got it.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ooh, I just feel bad, I never vacuum. (She goes into Chandler and
Joey&#146;s.)</p>

<p>[Cut to inside the apartment.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> So I was with Joshua for an hour today, and he has not asked me out.
It&#146;s just so frustrating!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Why don&#146;t you ask him out?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, yeah, totally! That&#146;s such a turn-on!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Really? It doesn&#146;t seem desperate?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh-ooh, that&#146;s the turn-on.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> He just got a divorce right? </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hmm-mmm.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> So he&#146;s probably really nervous around women, y'know? Maybe, you
just have to make the first move.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah but, I&#146;ve never asked a guy out before.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (shocked) You&#146;ve never asked a guy out?!!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No. Have you?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Thousands of times!! That doesn&#146;t make me sound too good does it?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I don&#146;t even know how I would go about it.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh-oh-oh-oh, how I do it is, I look a woman up and down and say,
&quot;Hey, how you doin&#146;?&quot;</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, please!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (to Phoebe) Hey, how you doin&#146;?</p>

<p>(Phoebe looks at him, and then giggles and looks away.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You know what, I&#146;m gonna do that, I&#146;m gonna call him up, and
I&#146;m gonna ask him out. I can do that. Ask him out. (Practising) How you doin&#146;?
(Calls him) Hi! Joshua? It&#146;s Rachel Green from <em>Bloomingdale&#146;s</em>.
(Listens) Yeah, umm, I was wondering if you umm, if you umm, left your wallet at the store
today? Well, we found <b>a</b> wallet, and we&#151;(Listens) the license? Well, that is a
good idea! Uh, well, let&#146;s see here this says this license belongs to a uh, uh,
belongs to a mister uh, Pheebs, and umm, yeah, so sorry to bother you at home. I&#146;ll
see you tomorrow. Bye. (Hangs up) (to Phoebe) You&#146;ve done that a thousand times?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I&#146;ve never done that.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ohh, God, I just got so nervous that he would say no.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, you gotta give him something that he can&#146;t say no too. Like uh,
Knicks tickets! Invite the guy to a Knicks game, you&#146;re guaranteed he&#146;ll say
yes!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Really?! You think that will work?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Absolutely! And if it doesn&#146;t, can I get the extra ticket?</p>

<p>(We hear a noise coming from Monica and Rachel&#146;s apartment.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What the heck is that?</p>

<p>(They go open the door and reveal Monica being spun around on the floor polisher and
getting the cord wrapped around her legs.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, erm, Chandler and Joey's, Ross, Joey, and Phoebe are
watching a movie as Chandler comes in from his bedroom.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Did she call?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, sorry.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All right, maybe I should call her.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No! Forget her, man! You don&#146;t need her, you don&#146;t need that!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> He&#146;s right, what she did was unforgivable.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, yeah, but y'know, what-what if I was wrong?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> How might you be wrong?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well y'know, what if she didn&#146;t actually sleep with the guy?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Dude, tell me she actually told you this.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> She did not have to tell me, I saw the play, and there was no heat.
Back me up here, Ross!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> That&#146;s all you&#146;re basing this on?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> That&#146;s not backing me up! Look, you said with the off-stage and
the heat, and the onstage and the oy heat.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Whoa-whoa, that-that was just a theory! There&#146;s a lot of theories
that didn&#146;t pan out. The lone gunman. Communism. Geometry.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh my God!!</p>

<p>[Scene: <em>Bloomingdale&#146;s</em>, Rachel&#146;s new job, she is waiting for Joshua
and practising how to ask him out.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Would you like to go to a basketball game with me? (Tries again.) You
know, its funny, basketball, because I happen to have tickets too&#133; (Tries again.)
Umm, who likes the Knicks&#151;(Joshua comes in from the dressing room.)</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> What do you think?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh! Well, as a single woman, who is available, I think you look great!</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Huh. (She starts brushing the lint off and checking him out in the
mirror.) Yeah?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yep. Oh, yeah, look you great. (She puts her arm in his and checks how
they would look as a couple.) Oh yeah. Yeah, this looks great. (Pause) Umm, so you like
it?</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> I do. I do. I love it. In fact, I think I&#146;m gonna wear it home.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Great.</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> All right, thank you so much for all your help. </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Sure.</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Well, I guess this is uh, I guess this is it.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah-eah-ha!</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Thanks. (He starts to leave) Maybe I&#146;ll see in the spring, with the
uh, y&#146;know, for the uh, bathing suits.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh well, you don&#146;t want to do that now?!</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Ah, that&#146;s okay, thanks.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Anyway, hopefully, I&#146;ll see you around sometime. (He goes out the
door.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Basketball!</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> (coming back in) I&#146;m sorry.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I uh, I have two tickets to the Knicks game tonight if you&#146;re
interested, just as a thank you for this week.</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Wow! That would be great.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Really?</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Yeah, that would be fantastic! My-my nephew is crazy about the Knicks!
This is fantastic, thank you so much Rachel. (He takes the tickets and leaves as Mr.
Waltham returns.)</p>

<p><b>Mr. Waltham:</b> Good morning.</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Hi!</p>

<p>(Mr. Waltham admires Joshua&#146;s butt as he leaves.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Kathy&#146;s apartment, Chandler is knocking on the door.]</p>

<p><b>Kathy:</b> (opening the door) Hey.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey. I just, I just wanted to come over to-to say that I&#146;m sorry.
Y&#146;know? I know I acted like the biggest idiot in the world, and I can completely
understand why you were so upset.</p>

<p><b>Kathy:</b> Oh wow. I really wish you&#146;d call me.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, I know, I-I wish I had too, but y&#146;know I-I think this is a
good thing. Y'know? &#145;Cause we&#146;ve had our first fight, and now we can move on.
Y&#146;know, I know for me&#151;(Notices a pair of men&#146;s pants on the chair.)
Nick&#146;s pants?</p>

<p><b>Kathy:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah. Well, I think our second fight is going to be a <b>big</b> one!</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, erm, Chandler and Joey's, Joey is debriefing Rachel on her
rejection earlier that day and telling her what she should&#146;ve done. Ross and Phoebe
are watching.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay, for next time, what do you say?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I have an extra ticket. An extra ticket. Not, two tickets, I have an
extra ticket.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> So the first time you ask a guy out, he-he turns you down?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> He didn&#146;t turn me down! He&#146;s at the game isn&#146;t he? I got
the date, I&#146;m just not on it!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (entering) Okay, it&#146;s ready. Come on.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What&#146;s ready?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Just come. </p>

<p>(They all go over to her apartment.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh my God!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Wow! Monica!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Great!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> This is beautiful!</p>

<p>(She has cleaned it, completely redecorated it, removed the carpet, and polished the
floor.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh did you&#151;what did you&#151;did you work for two days straight?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Pretty much. (to Joey) So, what do you, what do you think of the floor?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I don&#146;t know, it looks the same.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You used to have carpet.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh yeah!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> So I made snacks. Please, just hang out okay? I&#146;m just gonna rest
my eyes just a little bit.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Look, Mon, do you want us to uh, come back later?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh no-no-no, stay, stay, stay, just keep talking. I&#146;m always the
hostess.</p>

<p>(Chandler returns.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> How&#146;d it go?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, she wasn&#146;t sleeping with him.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh good!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> She is now.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What are you saying?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I&#146;m saying that she&#133; is a devil woman! Y&#146;know I mean
you think you know someone and then they turn around and they sleep with Nick! Nick, with
his rock hard pecs, and his giant man-nipples! I hate him, I <b>hate</b> her! Well, I
don&#146;t hate her, I love her. This is all my fault really.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> How? How is your fault?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Because, I-I should&#146;ve called! Y&#146;know if I had just called
her after our big, stupid fight, she never would&#146;ve gone out with Nick, and they
would&#146;ve ended up in bed together. I threw her at his man nipples!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Honey, this is not your fault, just because you guys had a fight, it
does not justify her sleeping with someone.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, if-if she thought they were on a break&#133;</p>

<p>(They all turn and glare at him.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Closing Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: <em>Bloomingdale&#146;s</em>, Rachel is sitting at her desk as Mr. Waltham
comes in.]</p>

<p><b>Mr. Waltham:</b> Rachel, one of your customers seems to have left his billfold. A
Joshua Bergen. </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Really?</p>

<p><b>Mr. Waltham:</b> Will you call him?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yes! I will! Absolutely! (She takes out his license and her license and
holds them face to face with each other. She then proceeds to act like Dark Helmut in <em>Spaceballs</em>,
and mimic a conversation between the two of them.) Hello, Rachel. Hi, Joshua. I left my
wallet here on purpose. Really? Yes, I just wanted to see you again. Oh, I&#146;m glad.
Rachel, I&#146;d like to say something to you. Yes? How you doin&#146;?</p>

<p align="center"><strong>End</strong></p>

<h1 align="center">The One With Joey&#146;s Dirty Day</h1>

<hr>

<p>Written by: Wil Calhoun<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a></p>

<hr>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, erm, Chandler and Joey's, Joey is getting ready for a
fishing trip and Phoebe is asking him about the fishing lures. Ross is playing with the
rod, and Monica is pretty much just watching the on goings.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (holding a lure) So now, what is this now?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Guggly worm.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (laughs and picks up another lure) And this?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Glow-pop giggly jammer.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (laughs harder) You make it so funny.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (not wanting to be left out, picks up something) Hey umm, what&#146;s
this?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (examining it) Ohh, a hunk of sandwich from last year. (Monica drops the
sandwich)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (pretend fishing in the living room) Ohh, Geller&#146;s got one hooked!
Ohh! Looks like a big one! Yeah, ohh! Ohh! (Swinging the rod back and forth) It&#146;s the
classic struggle between man and&#151;(swings the rod and knocks over a lamp.) Someone
knocked over a lamp.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (going over and picking up the rod) That&#146;s all right. Hey you guys,
you know what&#146;s going to be great about the fishing trip this year? When my dad gets
me out in the middle of the lake and gives me that, &quot;Joey, what are you doing with
your life?&quot; stuff. I can say, &quot;Well, I&#146;m doing a movie with Charlton Heston
dad. What are you doing with your life?&quot;</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Great!</p>

<p>(Chandler enters from his bedroom, all depressed and wearing sweat pants, with the
chick and duck in tow.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You don&#146;t have to stop having fun just because I&#146;m here.
Kathy didn&#146;t cheat on all of you. (To Joey) Well, except you. (They hug and Chandler
goes into the bathroom with the chick and duck following him.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey, Joey, I don&#146;t think that you should leave Chandler alone. I
mean it&#146;s only been two days since he broke up with Kathy. Maybe you can go fishing
next week?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Look, there&#146;s nothing I can do for him right now, he&#146;s still in
his sweat pants, that&#146;s still Phase One. Y'know? I&#146;ll be back for Phase Two, I
would never miss Phase Two.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What&#146;s Phase Two?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Gettin&#146; drunk and going to a strip club. </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> How does going to a strip club help him better?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Because there are naked ladies there.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Which helps him get to Phase Three, picturing yourself with other women.</p>
