girls.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> And do you know what girls are really good at?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Stripping!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, listening! Sit! Y&#146;know, maybe it would just really, really help
if you would just talk.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, come on! What&#146;s going in on in there? (Pats his chest.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah. And y&#146;know, if you wanna cry, that&#146;s okay too.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, look, I&#146;m gonna have to ask you all to leave.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Come on! Chandler!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Look, forget it. We tried, but Phase Three is a lost cause, Okay?
Those strippers were insanely hot, and I couldn&#146;t picture myself with any of them.
(Sits back in disgust.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> They really were pretty, weren&#146;t they? (Rachel and Phoebe both
agree)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, I really liked that fighter pilot one.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, Candy! She was so spunky! </p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Y&#146;know, I think if I were going to be with a woman. (Chandler is
intrigued.) It&#146;d, it&#146;d be with someone like Michelle, she was so oh, she was so
petite.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> See, I don&#146;t know, for me it would have to Chantal.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, Chantal!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh my goodness, she had the smoothest skin! I mean when I stuck that
dollar bill in her g-string and grazed her thigh&#133;</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (jumping up) Phase Three! I just achieved Phase Three!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Really?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I am totally picturing you with all those women!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> That&#146;s-that&#146;s not Phase Three.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, I&#146;m there too!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, are we all together? Like in a group?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Stop it! You&#146;re killing me! I think I just moved on to Phase
Four!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh! What is that? What is that?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Where I don&#146;t want to have a relationship ever! I just want to
have sex with strippers and my friends!!</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, the gang is there, minus Ross. Chandler is trying to cheer Joey
up about missing Phase Two.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Come on, let me see that smile.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I don&#146;t wanna.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Please?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I wanted to go to the strip club!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I know, I know, but you&#146;re gonna have plenty of chances. There
are literally thousands of women out there just waiting to screw me over.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, all right. (Ross enters.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey&#151;ooh so, how was Vermont?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Emily is&#133;incredible. I mean there-there are no words to describe it,
I mean the whole weekend was like a dream. (Sees Rachel coming back from the bathroom.)
Oh! And you! Rach!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, hey!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey! You were so right!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Uh, what you said, about us being in a place where we could finally be
happy for each other. </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, hmm.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I mean, I, I-I admit I-I wasn&#146;t quite there. Y&#146;know, I mean the
thought of you and that-that Josh guy&#133;</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Joshua.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Joshua&#133;guy at that club, dancing and having a good time, the thought
of it kinda&#133;y&#146;know.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, I&#133;</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> But now! I&#146;m there! I&#146;m totally there! I&#146;m-I&#146;m finally
where you are!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, thank goodness!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, and-and thank you for Emily.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, no problem. I&#146;m so glad I could help. Happy for you. (She
playfully punches him.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Happy for you. (He punches her back.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No, happy for you! (Hits him harder.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Closing Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, erm, Monica and Rachel's, Chandler is there and is getting
ready to direct a bunch of strippers, Monica, Rachel, and Phoebe on what to do in the
upcoming orgy of lesbian lust. Yes, it&#146;s a dream sequence, this isn&#146;t cable.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All right ladies, here&#146;s what we&#146;re gonna do. (Points to a
stripper.) <b>You</b> are gonna take off my clothes. (To another two strippers) You two,
go get the oils. (To another stripper) And you just constantly scream at the top of your
voice, &quot;Chandler&#146;s the king! Chandler&#146;s the king!&quot;</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I-I wanna be with her, (points to the stripper next to her) I like her.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, that&#146;s fine! Go with your instincts, go with your instincts.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Wait, now, what am I doing again?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Come on! Would you please pay attention, I could wake up at any
moment!</p>

<p><b>The Cigarette Guy:</b> Hi, I&#146;m Joshua, I&#146;m here to pick up Rachel.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No-no-no, that&#146; not Joshua.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What do you want from me, I&#146;ve never met the guy. So anyway,
Rachel, I&#146;m sorry you can&#146;t stay, (Rachel is upset about leaving the orgy with
the cigarette guy.) but the rest of us have a <b>lot</b> of work to do. (The cigarette guy
starts rubbing Chandler&#146;s back.) What are you doing? (The guy just nods) All right,
listen, I&#146;ve got to wake up!</p>

<p align="center"><strong>End</strong></p>
</body>
</html>

<title>The One With All The Rugby</title>

<body bgcolor="#FFFFFF" link="#008000">

<h1 align="center">The One With All The Rugby</h1>

<hr>

<p>Teleplay by: Wil Calhoun<br>
Story by: Andrew Reich and Ted Cohen<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a></p>

<hr>

<p>[Scene: A beauty parlour, Rachel is getting a manicure while Chandler, yes Chandler, is
getting a petticure (Does that scare you that I know those terms?&nbsp; Well, it scares
me.).]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Y'know, I can't believe I'm getting my nails done!&nbsp; And <strong>you</strong>
said it was gonna be fun! (pause) Which it kinda is.&nbsp; Also, you said there would be
other guys here. There are no other guys here!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Chandler, there&#146;s a guy right over there. (Points to the counter)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> That&#146;s a mailman! That&#146;s <b>our</b> mailman! (Waves to the
mailman) (Sarcastic) Hi. How are ya?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Chandler, don&#146;t worry! This doesn&#146;t make you any less of a
guy! (Chandler starts blowing on his fingernails like women do.) <b>That</b> does!
(Chandler stops blowing.) What am I sitting on? (She looks and finds a huge nail.) I <b>hate</b>
to think what this woman was scratching when this broke off.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey, you know who used to have nails like that?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hmm.</p>

<p><strong>Woman: </strong>OH&#133;MY&#133;GAWD!! (Yep, you guessed it. It&#146;s Janice.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Opening Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's erm, Monica and Rachel's, Rachel and Joey are standing at
the counter. Monica is flipping a light switch on and off next to the door.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Joey let me ask you a question. <b>What</b> does this light switch do?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ohh, Nothing.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Didn&#146;t it drive you crazy to have a switch and not know what it
did?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I <b>know</b> what it did! Nothing.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> They wouldn&#146;t have put it there if it didn&#146;t do something! How
can you not care?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Like this. (Shrugs)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, here&#146;s another question for ya. Uhh, do you know what that
silver knob on the toilet does?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Sure! It flushes it.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, good. Now that since you know, when you come over would you mind
actually using it?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (entering, with Janice in tow) Hello!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey! (Sees Janice.) Ah!! (Janice screams in surprise.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Guess who we ran into today?!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Janice?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Isn&#146;t this amazing? </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> How have you been?</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Oh well, I&#146;m divorced.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ohhh, wow.</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Yeah, I&#146;m riding the alimony pony. (Does the now famous laugh.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> And there it is.</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> I just came up to say, &quot;Hi!&quot; Hi! (to Chandler) And you,
sweetie, I&#146;ll see you tonight.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay. Bye.</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Bye.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Bye.</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Bye.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Bye.</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Bye.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> B-bye!</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Bye-bye.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Bye. (Finally closes the door on her.) (After it&#146;s closed) I
can&#146;t stand the woman! (Phoebe is shocked, Joey is relieved.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What?! I thought you were crazy about her!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, I know, but all of those little annoying things she did before
we fell in love? Like her voice, her laugh, her personality&#151;Well, they&#146;re all
back! Y&#146;know? And she&#146;s picked up like nine new ones!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> So what are you doing bringing her here?! There&#146;s people here!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Don&#146;t worry about it. I&#146;m taking care of it tonight.
(Chandler opens the fridge and grabs something to drink.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You are not. You have <b>never</b> been able to break up with her.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (standing in the door of the fridge) Well, I don&#146;t have to break
up with her this time. We&#146;re not involved! I&#146;m going to do a pre-emptive strike!
I&#146;m going to end it with her before it starts. My ass is like frozen! (Closes the
fridge.) </p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, try sticking it in the freezer for 20 minutes. (They all look around
and then back at Joey.) I&#146;m tellin&#146; ya!</p>

<p>[Scene: A street, Ross and Emily are walking home from a date.]</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> I can&#146;t believe you really walk alone here! I mean, you hear such
stories about New York.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, it&#146;s really not that bad. I mean, I-I for one, feel perfectly
safe.</p>

<p>(At that moment two very large men start screaming and running towards Emily and
picking her up.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Help! Help!! Help! Help!!</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> No, no, no Ross! Ross, these are friends of mine from home. (Introducing
them) Liam, Devon, this is Ross.</p>

<p><b>Devon:</b> Hey, mate.</p>

<p><b>Liam:</b> How are ya man?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh hey, that was a good one, huh? (Imitating himself) Help! Help!</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> So how are you? I&#146;ve been meaning to ring you ever since I arrived
but umm, well, I&#146;ve been rather busy.</p>

<p><b>Devon:</b> Do you realise that we have not seen each other since the night of that
U2 concert?</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Oh my God. I think you&#146;re right.</p>

<p><b>Liam:</b> (puts his arm around her) Well, actually the last time you and I saw each
other was that morning.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Oh, Liam. (Ross laughs and takes her back.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, Liam. So uh, what, were you guys playing soccer or something&#151;or
should I call it (In an English accent) football?</p>

<p><b>Devon:</b> We were playing rugby.</p>

<p><b>Liam:</b> In fact we&#146;re playing a game at the park tomorrow. You&#146;re
welcome to play too if you want.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> (laughs) Ross play rugby? I don&#146;t think so.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What&#146;s ah, what&#146;s so funny about that?</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Well I mean, you&#146;re American to start with. You don&#146;t even have
rugby here.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, we didn&#146;t have <b>freedom</b> here until 1776, either so&#133;</p>

<p><b>Devon:</b> So good then! We&#146;ll see you at Riverside Park at 2:00! Cheers!</p>

<p><b>Liam:</b> Cheers!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Cheers!</p>

<p>(Liam and Devon both take a swig of their beers, while Ross takes a swig of his coffee.
The Brits both crush their cans, and not to be out done, Ross crushes his coffee cup,
spilling its contents.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Chandler is attempting his pre-emptive strike.]</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Oh boy, I just love to sing!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes, I-I know that you do, but I think one of the reasons people were
complaining though, was that they paid to hear the <b>actor</b> sing <i>Old Man River</i>.</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Oh, look at us! Who would&#146;ve thought that Cupid had a station at
14th Street Nails. (Does the laugh)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (laughs) Okay, we have to talk. I&#146;m just getting out of a very
serious relationship&#133;</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> I know! And I&#146;m just getting out of a marriage, I mean talk about
meant to be!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Right! I just think that this is happening too soon.</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Oh, too soon, too schmoon. Face it honey, I am not letting you get away
this time.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I hear ya. (Pause) But! Unfortunately, my company is transferring me
overseas!</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Oh no! Where to? (Gasps) Too Paris?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No! No! Not, Paris. </p>

<p><b>Janice:</b>Too London? No-no, Rome? Vienna? Ooh-ooh, Barcelona?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, could you just stop talking for a second? (Thinks) Yemen.
That&#146;s right, yes, I&#146;m being transferred to Yemen!</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> When?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I don&#146;t know exactly.</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Ugh, well I will just have to soak up every once of Chandler Bing until
that moment comes.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> But I do know that it&#146;s some time tomorrow.</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's erm, Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe and Monica are plugging in
a bunch of electronics.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Done?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yep!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (entering, with Joey) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey! What&#146;s up?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> This switch thing has been driving me crazy. So I turned it off and
checked every outlet. Now, four of them don&#146;t work. Which means, one of <b>them</b>
has to be controlled by the switch. So, I plugged in things in all four of the outlets
that-that make noise, so that way, when I turn it on I just follow the noise and find out
which one it is.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (to Rachel) I bet I stopped listening before you did.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Y&#146;know, you-you also could&#146;ve used uh, <b>lamps</b> and then
followed the light.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah, well, I&#146;m using noise. Okay. All right! So, is everybody
ready? Here we go. (She flips on the switch and a hum starts.) I hear something! I hear
something! Where is it? (They all start looking until Rachel realises it&#146;s Joey.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> It&#146;s coming from Joey!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh my God, that&#146;s so freaky! Turn him off!!</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, Ross, Joey, and Rachel are
watching rugby on TV as Phoebe enters.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ooh, hey, could we put on the news? I think it might be raining.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, just hold on a second. I&#146;m watching this rugby thing on <i>ESPN</i>.
I don&#146;t know what the big deal is. I&#146;m man enough to play this sport.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Dude, you&#146;re not even man enough to order the <b>channel</b> that
carries the sport.</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> (entering) Hey there Ross!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (shocked) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (whispering to Ross) Janice.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Y&#146;know uh, you didn&#146;t really have to help me pack.</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Ohh, well when you said all you were going to be doing between now and
the time you leave is packing, you didn&#146;t really leave me much choice. Did you?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, I-I thought I did but, I-I guess I did <b>not</b>!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey-hey, what&#146;s going on?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, I&#146;m packing. Y&#146;know I&#146;m-I&#146;m packing
&#145;cause I&#146;m moving to Yemen tomorrow.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Thanks for telling me!</p>

<p>(Janice runs into the bedroom.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I&#146;m only going to pretend I&#146;m moving to Yemen, it&#146;s the
only way I can get rid off her.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ohhhh, good one! And Yemen that actually sounds like a real country.</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> (leaning in from the bedroom) Chandler! Come on, I&#146;m gonna show how
to roll up your underwear and stuff it in your shoes. It&#146;s a real space saver.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, I know, I do that &#145;cause it makes me look taller.</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Okay, Chandler, come on!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (to Janice) Okay. (to Joey) Joey, trade lives with me!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Nope. (To Ross) Man look at this! Ross, I can&#146;t believe you said
you&#146;d play rugby. I mean look how brutal this is!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey, I can handle it! All right?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Please, Ross, you-you got hurt playing badminton with my dad.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> That&#146;s &#145;cause-&#145;cause you&#146;re mom&#146;s dog kept-kept
looking at me.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (pointing to the TV) Okay, Ross, look-look-look-look, look right here.
That&#146;s called a scrum, okay? It&#146;s kinda like a huddle.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> And is a hum, kinda like a scruddle?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ross! (Laughs) They&#146;re gonna kill you!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, why are you doing this anyway?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, you should&#146;ve seen the guy that she used to go out with. I
mean, he&#146;s like Joe Rugby.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> You&#146;re kidding! And he plays rugby?! That&#146;s so funny.
(Realises) Ohh! I see how you did that. All right.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Anyway, she thought the very <b>idea</b> of me playing rugby with him was
like hilarious. So I&#146;m gonna show her how tough I really am!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (starts laughing, Ross stares at her) I&#146;m sorry. I&#146;m sorry.
You&#146;re right, you are a tough guy. You&#146;re the toughest palaeontologist I know.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> All right, come on look, Ross can take care of himself! It&#146;s not like
he&#146;s&#133;Chandler!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (from his bedroom) Thanks!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Look, don&#146;t worry about me. Okay? I&#146;ll just stay real energetic
and stay away from the ball. I&#146;ll uh, I&#146;ll be that guy right out of the circle.
(He points to a player who starts running and then gets viscously tackled from behind.)</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Oh!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, well maybe there was a dog lookin&#146; at him.</p>

<p>(Ross turns and wants to attack Rachel, but Joey stops him.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Commercial Break</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: The park, everyone is warming up for the rugby game. Only Joey and Phoebe came
to support Ross.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ross-Ross-Ross-Ross! Stay away from that guy (Points), and that guy
(Points). And that one&#151;Dude! They&#146;re all huge!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> They don&#146;t look any bigger than me!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, maybe that&#146;s because you&#146;re closer to you. So you look
bigger to you from where you are.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> I&#146;m just going to say hi to the lads. All right?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> All right.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Okay. (Goes to say hi to the lads.) </p>

<p>(A player comes over and picks up a ball in front of Phoebe.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (to the player) Hi.</p>

<p>(The player stands up and smiles. Showing that he has no front teeth.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Whoa! (The player leaves and to Joey) I kinda liked it.</p>

<p>(The referee blows the whistle and the players gather to start the game.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, I know what I have to do. I&#146;ve got to go Red Ross. (Joey and
Phoebe don&#146;t know what he&#146;s talking about.) Y&#146;know, Red Ross!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I totally don&#146;t know what you&#146;re talking about.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Come on! The time we were all waiting in line for <i>Dances With Wolves </i>and
that one guy cut in line in front of us and I just lost it?! Screamed at him! Turned all
red! Red Ross!!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You&#146;ll see.</p>

<p>[Cut to Emily, Devon, and Liam]</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Liam, do me a favour. Tell the lads to go easy on Ross, it&#146;s his
first time.</p>

<p><b>Liam:</b> You don&#146;t say! (We see Ross who is hopping about with the ball and
spikes it in his face.)</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> (to Ross) Good luck, babe.</p>

<p>(The scrum forms and the game is underway.)</p>

<p><b>Liam:</b> Ross! Ross! Come on! Get in here! (Ross gets pumped up.) Ross! Come on!</p>

<p>(Ross walks over to the scrum, walks around a bit looking for a way to get into the
scrum.)</p>

<p><b>Liam:</b> Ross, come on! Get in the bloody scrum! Ross, get in!</p>

<p>(Ross, urged on by his team-mates, jumps on top of the scrum and falls headfirst into
the middle, leaving his feet sticking straight up.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> JOEY!!!!!!</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's erm, Monica and Rachel&#146;s, Monica is going over some
plans as Rachel enters.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You&#133;are&#133;not going to believe it! Joshua came into work today,
and guess what happened?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> He asked you out?!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No. But I was showing him some cufflinks and I felt his pulse.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Saucy!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (refers to the table) What are these?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Electrical plans for the building.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, okay, okay should I be scared?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I know that switch does something, okay? So-so I went down to city hall
and got these. All I had to do was pay $25 and wait in line for three hours.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Wow! If only more people knew.</p>

<p>[Scene: The airport, the Yemen Express counter, Chandler is still trying to get rid of
Janice.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Y&#146;know you, really didn&#146;t have to take me to the airport.</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Oh please. Every moment is precious. Y&#146;know? Besides, somebody had
to ride in that other taxi with the rest of your luggage, and your friends don&#146;t
really seem to care too much that you&#146;re leaving.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, we&#146;re really not that close. (Pause) Okay, so I guess this
is uh, good-bye then.</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> On no! No! It&#146;s not good-bye, I&#146;m not leaving until you get on
that plane.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay. Then I guess it&#146;s just, wait here then. (Hands her the sign
that says, Wait Here.&quot;) (To the ticket agent) Hi. I need one fake ticket to Yemen.</p>

<p><b>Ticket Counter Attendant:</b> One ticket to Yemen?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh no-no-no, no. No, no, no, I just, I just need a pretend ticket.</p>

<p><b>Ticket Counter Attendant:</b> I&#146;m sorry sir, I don&#146;t understand. </p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What would you give to a kid if he wanted a ticket to play with?</p>

<p><b>Ticket Counter Attendant:</b> Are you travelling with a child?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No. All right, y&#146;know what, she&#146;s (Points to Janice) gonna
think that I&#146;m handing you a credit card, but what I&#146;m really gonna do is hand
you a library card.</p>

<p><b>Ticket Counter Attendant:</b> Ah, sir a ticket to Yemen is $2,100 and we don&#146;t
take library cards.</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> What&#146;s the matter? Is something wrong? Do you have to stay?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (to the ticket agent) <i>American Express</i>?</p>

<p>[Scene: The rugby game, Ross is getting killed.]</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> I can&#146;t believe they&#146;re doing that to him! I told them to go
easy on him!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No offence but, y&#146;know sometimes it&#146;s hard to understand you,
y&#146;know with the accent, so&#133;</p>

<p>(The whistle blows.)</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> That&#146;s just halftime, there&#146;s more of this.</p>

<p>(Ross limps over all covered in mud.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Did you see me? I was pretty good, huh? That is one fun game!</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Right.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (to Emily) Hey, could you do me a favour? Could you just grab me a bottle
of water? </p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Thanks. (When she&#146;s gone he collapses into Joey.) I-I think I&#146;m
dying. I really do. </p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, poor baby.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (to Phoebe) Tell my son that I love him. (Emily returns with the water.)
Excellent! Well, okay, I gotta have some more fun!</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Ross, they are killing you out there!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (whines &quot;No.&quot;) That&#146;s not true!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> She&#146;s right! You have to stop!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What? No! No, I&#146;m not stopping. I&#146;m Red Ross!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Dude, if you go back out there, you&#146;re gonna be Dead Ross!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I don&#146;t care! I am not quitting! I insist on finishing this game!</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> All right, all right, if you insist on doing this, at least let me help
you.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, God no! That is no place for a woman. Those guys will grab anything.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> No. That&#146;s not what I&#146;m saying. I just may know a few things
that might help you inflict some pain.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I like that.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Yeah? Listen closely, Devon has got a weak ankle. </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Huh?</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> One swift kick and he&#146;ll back off.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> All right, bad ankle, got it!</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> And that big bloke with the beard, he has got a trick hip. Yeah. And uh,
and David over there, I heard he doesn&#146;t wear a cup.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah? I can use that, trick hip, no cup, okay! Okay!</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> And uh, Liam, Liam&#146;s got bad knees. You hit him right and he&#146;ll
go down like a lamp.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> But-but, Liam&#146;s on my team.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> I don&#146;t care! You just get him!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I&#146;m gonna go get him! Okay, I am going back in! (Squeals like a
madman.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> The Red Ross! Okay.</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's erm, Monica and Rachel&#146;s, Monica is reading a book as
Rachel returns.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (noticing a bunch of pictures around the door that weren&#146;t there
originally.) What-what are-what are these?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, just some pictures I made and hung up. I thought they&#146;d
brighten up the place. They do don&#146;t you think?</p>

<p>(Rachel rips one of the wall and finds a huge hole underneath.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No-no-no, no!</p>

<p>(Rachel rips off another one, revealing another hole. Rachel then moves onto a third
one, but this one doesn&#146;t have a hole underneath it.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I know that there&#146;s no hole there, I just really liked that
picture.</p>

<p>(Rachel looks at it and then throws it away. She then removes a fourth one, revealing a
third hole.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh my God! Look at this!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay, but there <b>is</b> a wire back there! I mean that switch is
connected to something!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I don&#146;t care! The wires have come loose in your head!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I just thought that if I could follow the wire I could find out what it
did.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> And did you?!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No. It disappears back there behind that baseboard. For a minute there,
I thought it went downstairs.</p>

<p>(Rachel removes a paper on the floor which is covering a hole and gasps.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> But it didn&#146;t. Say hello to Mrs. Chatracus.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh my God.</p>

<p><b>Mrs. Chatracus:</b> Hello darling.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hello, Mrs. Chatracus.</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, They are returning from the rugby game, Joey and Emily are
carrying Ross.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Now, are you sure you don&#146;t want to go see a doctor?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh no! That-that&#146;ll just bring me down! This was great! I mean I-I-I
was great! This is a great day! Y&#146;know what? I&#146;m buying everyone coffee. All
right? If someone would just grab my wallet, it&#146;s in my pocket. </p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, sure.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, not you. (Emily gets it.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Uhh, look, your eye&#146;s still popping out a little, I&#146;m gonna go
get some ice.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ooh, ice! I am so in the mood for ice! (They go and get the coffee and
the ice leaving Ross and Emily alone.)</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> You were amazing out there.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, I kinda was, wasn&#146;t I?</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Oh my God!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I made a man twice my size cry. I mean, I haven&#146;t done that since I
was four and I washed my dad&#146;s Porsche with rocks.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> You really enjoyed yourself didn&#146;t you?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Please! Are you kidding? I-I hurt three huge men, I gave a guy a bloody
nose&#151;I mean I-I&#146;m not proud of it but, I really am. And it&#146;s all because of
you, wonderful, amazing you.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> I think you&#146;ve got concussion.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, no, I&#146;m serious. Thank you.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> You&#146;re welcome. (She hugs him tightly and he winces.) I&#146;m
sorry. Did I hurt you?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> It&#146;s worth the pain. (She goes to hug him again.) Y&#146;know what,
you know what? It&#146;s not.</p>

<p>[Scene: The airport, the flight to Yemen is being called.]</p>

<p><b>Ticket Counter Attendant:</b> (on the P.A.) This is the final boarding call for
Flight 664 to Yemen.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, I-I guess I gotta go.</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Oh, my Bing-a-ling. I&#146;ll wait for you. Do you even know how long
you&#146;re going to be gone?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, just until we find an energy source to replace fuel.</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Oh. Well, I&#146;ll right you everyday. (Reading the address) 15 Yemen
Road, Yemen.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, good-bye. Good-bye. </p>

<p>(He gives the agent his ticket and walks onto the jetway. Janice walks over and looks
out the window. Chandler walks back into the terminal and tries to walk right past Janice,
but she sees him.)</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Chandler?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No!</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Chandler! </p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Janice! There you are! There you are! I had to have one last kiss, and
also-also you said that you were going to leave right after I got on the plane!</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> No! No! I wanna see you take-off.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, I then guess I&#146;m going to Yemen! I&#146;m going to Yemen!
(To this old woman also going to Yemen.) When we get to Yemen, can I stay with you?</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Closing Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's erm, Monica and Rachel&#146;s, Monica has finally given up
on her search to find what the light switch does and is now flicking it on and off
aimlessly.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> All right. The super couldn&#146;t figure out what it did. A $200 an
hour electrician couldn&#146;t figure out what it did. I&#146;ve had seven pretty serious
shocks. I officially give up.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Thank God.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I guess Joey was right, it does nothing.</p>

<p>[Cut to Chandler and Joey&#146;s, Joey and Phoebe are watching TV. The TV is turning
off and on, and each time Phoebe is blinking her eyes like the Genie did. The switch
obviously controls the outlet which the TV is plugged into.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> See? I&#146;m doing it. I am totally doing it. (Suddenly it stops
working.) I lost it.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>End</strong></p>
</body>
</html>
416<html>

<head>
<title>The One With The Fake Party</title>
<meta HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=windows-1252">
<meta NAME="GENERATOR" CONTENT="Microsoft FrontPage 3.0">
<meta NAME="Template" CONTENT="C:\Program Files\Microsoft Office\Templates\FRIENDS1.dot">
</head>

<body bgcolor="#FFFFFF" link="#008000">

<h1 align="center">The One With The Fake Party</h1>

<hr>

<p>Teleplay by Shana Goldberg-Meehan &amp; Scott Silveri <br>
Story by Alicia Sky Varinaitis<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a></p>

<hr>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, Chandler, Monica, and Phoebe are
there. Phoebe is stressing out about something.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What is it hon?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I-I can&#146;t find anything that I want to eat! Everything I eat makes
me nauseous! I&#146;m telling you, being pregnant is no piece of cake&#151;ooh! Cake!
(Chandler shrugs, and Phoebe grimaces.) No.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Aww, honey I&#146;m sorry.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> God! Ooh! What is that smell? It&#146;s coming from the bathroom. Ooh!
(She goes to the bathroom.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Wow! Pregnancy does give you some weird cravings.</p>

<p>[Cut to the bathroom, Joey is taking a shower and Phoebe knocks on the door.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> It&#146;s me. It&#146;s Phoebe. Listen there&#146;s something in here I
want to eat, what-what smells so good?</p>

<p>(Joey sticks his head out of the shower curtain.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Is it the shampoo? It&#146;s guava.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (she smells his head) No!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh! Wait-wait! (Reaches inside the shower.) Is it my bologna sandwich?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yes. Yes. Yes. I can&#146;t believe it! The baby wants bologna! Maybe he
wants me to eat meat? I can&#146;t eat meat!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, wait-wait! (Reaches into the shower again.) Maybe it&#146;s a pickle?!</p>

<p>(Phoebe grimaces at the smell.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Opening Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Chandler, Monica, Joey and Rachel are there. Rachel is writing
something on a pad, and then crumples it up and throws it on the floor.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What are you writing?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, Joshua&#146;s coming in tomorrow and since I don&#146;t have the
guts to ask him out, I&#146;m going to sell him a coat and put this note in the pocket.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh yeah? (He grabs the pad and starts reading it.) Joshua, give me a
call sometime, guys like you (Pause) never go out of style&#151;what did you throw away?</p>

<p>(Ross and Emily enter.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hi guys!</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey, what have you guys been up too?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, we went to see a collection of Victorian doorknobs and the
Cupert-Hewitt museum.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Without me?!</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> My uncle dragged us there. But, it actually it turned out to be really
interesting.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> They were so ornate and beautiful, I mean look at that! (Shows them a
doorknob she has.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I don&#146;t know how museums work in England but, here, you&#146;re not
supposed to take stuff.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> I uh, I got it from the gift shop. They have really lax security there.
(Chandler is shocked.) It&#146;s a joke. (They all laugh.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Bye. (They kiss.)</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Right, I&#146;ve got to be off, I&#146;ll see ya. Buh-bye then. (She
leaves.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Wow! You guys seem to be having a good time.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh yeah, she&#146;s-she&#146;s amazing. And-and she&#146;s so much fun.
And! Y&#146;know what? When I&#146;m with her, I&#146;m fun! I even signed up for
helicopter classes. (Chandler is shocked.) She&#146;s leaving in two days, I don&#146;t
have to do it.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh no, two days, you must be bummed.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, she&#146;s got to go back to London. But you know what? I&#146;ve
been prepared for this from the start. We both knew we had two weeks together, and
that&#146;s it. Y&#146;know.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey that&#146;s what all my relationships are like.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes, but in Ross&#146;s case, they <b>both</b> know in two weeks
that&#146;s it.</p>

<p>(Phoebe enters.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Pheebs!</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (starts rubbing her belly) Hello! Hello!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (angered by the rubbing) Yes! I know! I know! Yeah! So the baby is
totally craving meat. This afternoon I tried tricking it, I made it a soy-burger to make
it think it was getting meat, y&#146;know? And I got nauseous.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Maybe that&#146;s because soy-burgers suck!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Being pregnant is tough on your tummy.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey, but at least you got that cool, pregnant lady glow.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> That&#146;s sweat. You throw up all morning, you&#146;ll have that glow
too.</p>

<p>[Scene: <i>Bloomingdale&#146;s</i>, Rachel is preparing to slip Joshua the note.]</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> (coming in from a changing room) Okay!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, here&#146;s that trench-coat that you wanted.</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Oh great! (He tries on the coat.) Wow! Yeah, it&#146;s comfortable. </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah?</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Man, I could really flash somebody in this thing. (He goes to put his
hands in his pockets.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (stopping him) Oh no-no, no-no, they don&#146;t want you to put your
hands in the pockets until you are out of the store.</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Why not?!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, that&#146;s because of a lot of&#133;(She imitates someone picking
their nose and placing the treasure found in the pockets.)</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Y&#146;know, they ruin it for everybody.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I know!</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Y&#146;know, I wore that cashmere sweater on a date last night.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh?</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Yeah, it was my first date since the uh, since the divorce.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, congratulations, so do you love her?</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> No, no, no, she&#146;s nice but, y&#146;know, it just it made me realize
that I&#146;m just not, I&#146;m just not ready to be dating, y&#146;know?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Huh. Well, uh, that&#146;s uh, that&#146;s interesting. (She goes over
and retrieves her note.)</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> (noticing her) Hey-whoa-hey-hey, what was that?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, it&#146;s just an anti-theft device.</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Then uh, what&#146;s-what&#146;s this? (Shows her the real anti-theft
device.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You need that, you need that too &#145;cause obviously, a thief could
just tear this up. (Rips up the note.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, Ross is writing on the <i>Magna-Doodle</i>
as Rachel enters.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oops, sorry. Listen, we-we have to have a party tonight! Actually, we
have to have one in five minutes, so everybody cancel your plans.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What are you talking about?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, what&#146; going on?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> We have to have a surprise Bon Voyage party for Emily. But it&#146;s
actually for Joshua. (Starts handing out party hats.) Look, he said he&#146;s not ready to
date, so I had to invite him to a party if I wanted to see him outside of work, and now I
have the perfect opportunity to seduce him! (Hands Ross a party hat.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, as much as I&#146;d like to meet Josh and warn him, Emily and I
aren&#146;t going to be here. All right? I mean, she&#146;s going to come by first to say
good-bye, and then I&#146;ve got a whole special evening planned. So I&#146;m sorry, no
party.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Awwww!</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> (entering) Hello?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Surprise!!!</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler and Joey:</b> Surprise!! </p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> No one&#146;s ever thrown me a surprise party before!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, it was all Ross&#146;s idea.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> You&#146;re so sweet! And I&#146;m so surprised!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You really didn&#146;t know?</p>

<p>[Cut to later, the party is in full swing. Rachel is in the kitchen and Chandler goes
over to talk to her.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Why are you in here if Joshua is all the way over there? (Points to
the living room.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Uhh, because I&#146;m trying to play hard to get. Oh, quick he&#146;s
looking over here, say something funny.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Like what?</p>

<p>(Rachel laughs hysterically.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What-what-what is so funny?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I said, &quot;Like what?&quot;</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Now that&#146;s a thinker.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, y&#146;know what, y&#146;know what? This playing hard to get thing
is not working. Umm, hand-hand me those cherries. (Chandler does so.) Okay. Okay. (She
does a little sexy walk over to where Joshua is standing.) Hi!</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Care for a cherry?</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Oh, no thanks.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No? Y&#146;know, I can tie one of these into a knot using just my
tongue. </p>

<p>(She tries to demonstrate this unique ability, but only succeeds in choking on it.)</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> You okay? (Rachel swallowed it whole and is not hacking like a heavy
smoker in the morning.) You all right? (Rachel walks away, coughing.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (interrupting Monica and Emily) So we should probably get going soon.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Oh, but the party&#146;s only just getting started!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, but we-we have to be at the<i> Four Seasons</i> for drinks in 15
minutes and then y&#146;know, then <i>The Plaza</i> for dinner.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> So why did you plan a party at the same time?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No-no-no, no, umm, actually American surprise parties are-are-are very

<h1 align="center">The One With The Free Porn</h1>

<hr>

<p>Story by Mark J. Kunerth <br>
Teleplay by Richard Goodman <br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a></p>

<hr>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is watching TV, and we
hear Mr. Treeger in the bathroom.]</p>

<p><b>Mr. Treeger:</b> Ohhh, man!!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (coming in from his bedroom) What is that?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Treeger&#146;s snaking the shower drain.</p>

<p><b>Mr. Treeger:</b> What in the name of hell?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Maybe he found you flip-flop.</p>

<p>(Joey sits down and changes the channel, and we see two people making out.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Whoa! Is this porn? What did I do? I must&#146;ve hit something on the
remote.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Do we pay for this?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No, we didn&#146;t even pay our cable bill&#151;maybe this is how they
punish us.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Maybe we shouldn&#146;t pay our phone bill&#151;free phone sex.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Maybe we shouldn&#146;t pay our gas bill? (Stops and thinks about what he
just said.)</p>

<p><b>Mr. Treeger:</b> (coming in from the bathroom) Whoa, hey, that lady&#146;s all kinds
of naked.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, Joey just pressed something on the remote and it just, came on!</p>

<p><b>Mr. Treeger:</b> Yeah, it happened to me once. I was just flipping through the
channels and bam! It was like finding money.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Like finding money with naked people on it!</p>

<p><b>Mr. Treeger:</b> Then I made the mistake of turning off the TV, I never got it back
again. And I&#146;m sad. (Exits.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (to Chandler) Why would he turn off the TV? (Chandler shrugs.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Opening Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, later that morning. The porn is
still on, there are three women getting ready to shave the chest of some guy. Joey and

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Or a job where you don&#146;t have to carry a table.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> You mean like a doctor?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Pheebs! You&#146;re blocking the porn! Look out!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ohh! (She moves.) Oh my. Oh, that reminds me, I have to see my OB-GYN

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hi.</p>

we have to talk about the future? Let&#146;s just enjoy&#133;&quot;</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (interrupting him) No-no-no, don&#146;t-don&#146;t do the accent.
You&#146;ve <b>got</b> to see her again.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> And why do you care so much?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Because! You could get to live out my fantasy!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You had fantasies about Emily?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No! Y&#146;know, <b>the</b> fantasy! Meet someone from a strange land,
fall in madly love, and spend the rest of your lives together.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Is that why in junior high you were the only one that hung out with that
Ukrainian kid?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah that, plus his mom used to put sour cream on everything!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Ahh.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Do you love her?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> We said it was only going to be two weeks, y&#146;know?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You love her!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What-what is love really?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Ohhh, I <b>knew</b> you loved her! Then you need to go to the airport
and tell her. You&#146;re probably just gonna catch her just as she&#146;s about to go to
the gate. You&#146;re gonna call out her name and say, &quot;I love you!&quot; And
she&#146;s gonna say, &quot;I love you, too!&quot; And you guys are going to have the most
amazing kiss, everyone at the gate will applaud.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I am a good kisser.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Then you two can, can sneak into the cockpit, and things will start to
heat up, and then a stewardess comes in&#133; (Ross looks at her.) I&#146;ve been watching
too much porn.</p>

<p>[Scene: Beth Israel Medical Center, Phoebe is at her OB-GYN doing an ultrasound, Rachel
is with her. We here the baby&#146;s heartbeat.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Is that the heartbeat?</p>

<p><b>The Doctor:</b> That&#146;s it.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh my God!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh wow! This is so cool.</p>

<p>(The heartbeat changes, and we hear a different one.)</p>

<p><b>The Doctor:</b> Have we talked about the possibility of multiple births?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Why don&#146;t take care of this one, and should I get pregnant again,
I&#146;ll hold onto your card, okay?</p>

<p><b>The Doctor:</b> No, I&#146;m getting three separate heartbeats.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Three? You guys were worried I wouldn&#146;t even have one!</p>

<p><b>The Doctor:</b> Doctors are wrong all the time.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, yeah.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, so, are-are you sure that there are three?!</p>

<p><b>The Doctor:</b> Definitely. (Points out each head on the ultrasound.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh my God! Oh my God! Oh my God!! So I-I mean so in a few months
I&#146;m going to have three full grown babies just walkin&#146; around inside me?! Oh!
Oh! And it&#146;s gonna be one of those log rides where they just come shooting out!</p>

<p><b>The Doctor:</b> Actually, giving birth to three babies isn&#146;t that different
from giving birth to one.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What do you know?!</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe is there, waiting to tell Frank and Alice the news.]</p>

<p><b>Alice:</b> (entering) Oh-oh, Phoebe!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ooh! Hi!</p>

<p><b>Alice:</b> Hi! (She runs over and hugs Phoebe&#146;s stomach.) So, how did it go at
the doctors?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh well, okay, hey, y&#146;know how when you&#146;re umm, you&#146;re
walking down the street and you see three people in a row, and you say, &quot;Oh,
that&#146;s nice?&quot;</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Yes.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, yeah well, good news, you&#146;re going to have three babies.</p>

<p><b>Alice:</b> Three babies?</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> I finally got my band!</p>

<p><b>Alice:</b> We&#146;re gonna have a big family, I&#146;ve always wanted a big family!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh God, I&#146;m so glad you guys are happy, I was so afraid you were
going to be all freaked.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Why would we be freaked?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, no maybe &#145;cause it&#146;s harder to raise them, and the added
expense, and&#133;</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> (They&#146;re less than happy now) Oh.</p>

<p><b>Alice:</b> Right.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, back to happy. Back to happy!</p>

<p><b>Alice:</b> No-no-no, no, it&#146;s going to be fine. Because umm, because I teach
Home Ec, and uh, I can have 30 kids making baby clothes all year long. Y&#146;know
it&#146;ll-it&#146;ll be like my very own little sweatshop. </p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Yeah, I&#146;ve been thinking ever since you said we were having
triplets, the best thing for me to do is to drop out of college and get a job.</p>

<p><b>Alice:</b> No, Frank.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No you can&#146;t quit college! No! You&#146;re in college? Really?</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Yeah, refrigerator college.</p>

<p><b>Alice:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Yeah, y&#146;know when we found out we were going to have a baby,
y&#146;know I figured y&#146;know like I should y&#146;know have like a career&#151;and I
love refrigerators!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> You can&#146;t give up on your dream.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> No, it&#146;s okay. We&#146;re-we&#146;re gonna have three kids! And
that&#146;s-that&#146;s a different kind of dream. Three kids and no money.</p>

<p>[Scene: The airport, Emily is getting ready to board her flight to London.]</p>
<b>

<p>Ticket Agent:</b> (On the P.A.) This is the boarding call for Flight 009.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Emily! (Runs up.)</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Oh my God! What are you doing here? (They hug)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I just, I had to see you one more time before you took-off.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> You are so sweet. (They kiss.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> That&#146;s, that&#146;s, that&#146;s a big candy bar. (She&#146;s holding
one of those huge <i>Toblerone</i> bars.) I had the most amazing time with you.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Me too.</p>
<b>

<p>Ticket Agent:</b> This is the final boarding call for Flight 009.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Well, that&#146; me. (They kiss again.) Here, have this. (She gives him
the candy bar.) I&#146;m only allowed one piece of carryon anyway. (She starts towards the
jetway.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (stops her) Wait uh, listen. I-I, I have to tell you something. Umm,
I&#146;ve been thinking, I&#146;m just gonna come out and say it. Okay? I-I-I ah, I-I
think I love you.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Oh. (She&#146;s shocked and hugs him.) Thank you. (She boards the plane.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> That&#146;s no problem.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Commercial Break</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, Rachel is singing some kind of
song.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What&#146;s that song? It has been in my head all day long.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> It&#146;s the theme from Good Will Humping.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Y&#146;know who doesn&#146;t even like dirty movies? My new boyfriend
Joshua.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah right.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No, he told me. He prefers to leave certain things to the imagination.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh-oh, yeah, and did he also say that ah, some of the dialogue was
corny and that he actually found it was funny and not sexy?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yes!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, he likes porn.</p>

<p>(Rachel starts to leave.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Where ya going?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I&#146;m going to find out if he really thinks supermodels are too
skinny. (As she exits, Phoebe enters.) Hey, Pheebs!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> How did it go with Frank and Alice?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, Frank has to quit college because his super fertile sister is
having three babies! I need to make a lot of money really fast, and I had an idea that I
want to talk to you (Points to Chandler) about, &#145;cause you work for a big company.
Okay, insider trading, what information is there that you can give me.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> They don&#146;t really talk to us about that kind of stuff. I can get
you some free white out though.</p>

<p>(Ross enters.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Ohh! Did you do what I said? Did-did-did you tell her?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I did.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> And well, what did she say?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Thank you.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, you&#146;re totally welcome! What&#146;d she say?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> She said, &quot;Thank you.&quot; I said, &quot;I love you.&quot; And she
said, &quot;Thank you.&quot;</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Whoa-whoa, wait a minute, did you say, you love her?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, what were you trying to get her to do?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What do I do now?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> You play hard to get.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> She already lives in London.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Then you go to Tokyo.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All right look, forget it, forget it. You told her you love her,
it&#146;s over.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> It is not over! You&#146;re over!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You know!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay. (Pause) Good one.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> It is not over because she is going to call you and tell you she loves
you. And the reason why she couldn&#146;t, is because her feelings were so strong, it
scared her. Now you go home and wait for her call, she could be calling you from the
plane! Come on now go! Go! (Tries to push Ross out the door.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay! Okay! But if she doesn&#146;t call, it is definitely over! No, wait.
Wait. Unless, eventually, I call her, y&#146;know just to she what&#146;s going on, and,
and she says she&#146;ll call me back, but then she doesn&#146;t. <b>Then</b> it&#146;s
over.</p>

<p>(Joey holds his fist up, and Chandler gives him two thumbs up.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Way to be strong, man!</p>

<p>(Ross leaves, and after the door closes, Joey gives him the loser sign.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's erm, Monica and Rachel's, Chandler and Joey enter having
just woken up.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hi! Listen, can we watch cartoons on your television? We need a porn
break. We spent the last two hours watching In &amp; Out &amp; In, Again.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, so, why don&#146;t you just turn it off?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Because then we would be the guys who turned off free porn.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (entering carrying a case) Ooh, good, you&#146;re hear! Okay.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, what-what &#145;cha got there?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh this, well I&#146;m glad you asked. (She opens the case and removes a
knife and an soda can.) Now, don&#146;t you hate it when you have to cut a tin can with an
ordinary steak knife? (She efficiently cuts it in half.) Ahh! Now, I know what you&#146;re
thinking&#133;</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Pregnant Woman Slays Four?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Phoebe, they didn&#146;t make you pay for those knives, did they?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Are you sure?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Honey, you&#146;re not gonna make enough money to help Frank and Alice
just by selling knives.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No-no, I know that, but I just have to make enough money for the second
part of my plan.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What&#146;s the second part of your plan?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> My <i>Saturn</i> dealership.</p>

<p>[Scene: Ross&#146;s bedroom, he has fallen asleep waiting for Emily to call. He is
awaken by the phone.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (Answers the phone.) Hello?</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Ross.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Emily, hi! Uh, how-how was you flight?</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> It was dreadful. I felt terrible about how I acted when you said those
wonderful things.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, no, that-that, that&#146;s all right. Umm, I&#146;m just glad you
called.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Ross umm, there&#146;s something that I&#146;ve got to tell you,
there&#146;s-there&#146;s someone else.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Does that mean the same thing in England as it does in America?</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, Ross is relating his recent
conversation with Emily to the gang.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> She doesn&#146;t know which one of us she wants, me or this Colin guy.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> This isn&#146;t how it&#146;s supposed to go, there can&#146;t be
another guy.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well&#133;</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Of course there&#146;s another guy!! This is even more perfect! Now you
have to prove your love!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I&#146;m not proving anything. Okay, I&#146;m done listening to you. If I
hadn&#146;t let you talk me into going to the airport in the first place, I never
would&#146;ve put my fist through the wall!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You put your fist through the wall?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, I missed and hit the door. But, it opened really hard!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> <b>You</b> have to go to London!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah, you have to go fight for her!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh yeah, sure, that makes sense. Yeah. &#145;Cause you already told her
you love her and she didn&#146;t say it back, then she called you and told you that
there&#146;s another guy, so yeah, go to London that&#146;ll scare her!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> When Rachel was with Paulo, what did you do?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I made fun of his accent.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You sat back and let him have her, you didn&#146;t fight at all. Am I
right? Do you want the same thing to happen with Emily?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> All right then, go fight for her! Go to London! I mean, that could be
you and Emily! (Points to the TV.) That, but-but nicer. Just, go to London!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Really?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Come on! Surprise her! Show up at her doorstep! Don&#146;t let her go
without a fight!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> All right. All right, I&#146;m gonna do it! </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> All right.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I&#146;m gonna, I&#146;m gonna go to London and I&#146;m going to fight
for her.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay, good luck!</p>

<p>(Ross starts to leave.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ross! Ross! If you&#146;re going to the airport, could you pick me up
another one of those <i>Toblerone</i> bars? (Chandler nods his head no.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's erm, Monica and Rachel's, Monica, Joey, and Chandler are
sitting and talking as Phoebe and Rachel enter.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ooh-Ooh! I did it! I did it! I figured out a way to make money! I&#146;m
gonna open up my own massage place and Frank&#146;s gonna help me! And! We can work it
around his schedule so he doesn&#146;t have to quit school!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> That&#146;s sounds great, but how are you going to afford it?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, we were walking down the street and we saw that van that you guys
used for catering and we realised&#133;</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I&#146;m telling it! I&#146;m telling it!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay. You know how people need transportation, but they also need
massages to help them relax so I just figured we could combine the two, okay, I give the
massages and Frank drives! I can fix up the van, bolt the table in the back, and you know
what I&#146;ve got?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> A place where no one will ever get out alive?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No! Think about it, it&#146;s a taxi that people take when they need to
relax, it&#146;s&#133;</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (interrupting) Relaxi-Taxi!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> The name was my favourite part!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, well I can up with it!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> <b>YOU DID NOT</b>!!!! Oh! No! You came up with Relaxi Cab! That&#146;s
not good.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, I&#133;</p>

<p>(The phone rings and Monica answers it.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hello.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (on phone) Hey.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh my God! Ross, are you in England? Was Emily surprised?</p>

<p>[Cut to Ross in one of those British phone booths.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, because she hasn&#146;t come home yet. And she hasn&#146;t been home
all night! She&#146;s obviously staying with that other guy, and I&#146;m the stupid moron
who spent the whole night outside her apartment!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> All right. When is, when is the next flight out?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> About four hours.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay, just stay there a couple more hours and if she doesn&#146;t show
up by then, then just come on home.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey, tell him about Relaxi-Taxi, and-and ask him if he thinks
that&#146;s better than Relaxi Cab.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, it&#146;s not Relaxi Cab. It&#146;s Relaxicab, like taxicab. </p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, that is better.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, later that same night. There is a
knock on the door and Chandler answers it to reveal Emily standing behind it.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Are we in London?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What are you doing here? You can&#146;t be here!</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> I&#146;ve uh, I&#146;ve come to talk to Ross.</p>

<p>(She sets her bag down on the foosball table and Joey sees the <i>Toblerone </i>bar
sticking out of it and gazes longingly at it.)</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (pause) Nothing. No, nothing.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> I was going to call him, but&#133;</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, you came to tell him you love him! I knew it! (Points at Chandler) I
was right! (Points to Emily) I&#146;m right, right?</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> I&#146;d really rather talk to him. </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> I uh, I&#146;ve been to his apartment and he wasn&#146;t there, and uh. I
need to talk to him, so do you have any idea where he is?</p>

<p>[Cut to London, we sit Ross sitting outside Emily&#146;s apartment. We hear
Emily&#146;s phone ring with <b>amazing</b> clarity. Apparently, sound travels quite
easily through the walls of British buildings. Anyhoo, Ross looks around for the ringing
phone and in the meantime Emily&#146;s answering machine picks up and once again with
amazing clarity we hear Emily say&#133;]</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Ross, are you there? Ross, I don&#146;t know if you can hear this
but&#133; (Ross has moved to the window, apparently so that he can hear better.) I&#146;m
gonna talk anyway, uh, I&#146;m in the States with you sister and your friends and
it&#146;s all over with Colin. I came here to tell you that, and to tell you&#151;Yes,
Joey you can have all the chocolate you want, just take it! Uh, I came here to tell you
that I love you.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (yelling, thinking Emily can hear him through the answering machine all
the way to New York.) I love you too! I&#146;m, I&#146;m gonna call you right now from the
phone booth! (Realises) You can&#146;t hear me. (Goes to make his call.)</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> I wish I could know if you&#146;d heard any of that. I suppose I&#146;ve
either just told you I love you or given my neighbours a good laugh. Mrs. Newman if
you&#146;re listening, bugger off this in none of your business. I suppose there&#146;s
not much chance you did heard that, and there&#146;s the call waiting so, I should go. Oh
well. (Answers the call waiting.) Hello.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hi.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Ross, I love you!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Ohh! Thank you.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Closing Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, Joey is still watching the porn
as Chandler enters.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I was just at the bank, and there was this really hot teller, and she
didn&#146;t ask me to go do it with her in the vault.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Same kind of thing happened to me! Woman pizza delivery guy come over,
gives me the pizza, takes the money, and leaves!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What, no, &quot;Nice apartment, I bet the bedrooms are huge?&quot;</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Noo! Nothing!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Y&#146;know what, we have to turn off the porn.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I think you&#146;re right.</p>

<p>(Goes over and picks up the remote.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All right, ready?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> One.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Two.</p>
<b>

<p>Both:</b> Three.</p>

<p>(Chandler turns off the porn and sets the remote down.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> That&#146;s kinda nice.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, that&#146;s kinda a relief.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p>(Pause.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You wanna see if we still have it?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p>(Chandler turns on the TV and&#133;)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> FREE PORN!!!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah!!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> We have free porn here!!!</p>

<p align="center"><strong>End</strong></p>

<h1 align="center">The One With Rachel&#146;s New Dress</h1>

<hr>

<p>Teleplay by: Jill Condon &amp; Amy Toomin<br>
Story by: Andrew Reich &amp; Ted Cohen<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a></p>

<hr>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Joey and Chandler are there as Phoebe enters carrying a drum.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey! Wow, it <b>is</b> true what they say, pregnant bellies look like
a drum.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (not amused) Ha-ha. (She sits down on the couch.) No, it&#146;s just
I&#146;m so pregnant that I&#151;my guitar doesn&#146;t fit anymore. So I thought
&#145;til I&#146;m not, I&#146;m just gonna play all my songs on this drum. It sounds <b>really</b>
cool!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All right.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Listen. Listen. (She starts to play and sing.) <i>Smelly cat, smelly
cat, what are they feeding you? </p>
</i>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Wow, Pheebs! That sounds great!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I know! I know, and I&#146;ve only been playing for like an hour!</p>

<p><b>Alice:</b> (entering) Phoebe! Phoebe! Hi! Hi!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey! What are you doing here?</p>

<p><b>Alice:</b> Umm, actually, I came down to ask you a big favour.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, well, don&#146;t tell me you want to keep more of your stuff in my
uterus.</p>

<p><b>Alice:</b> (laughs) No. No. No. (Sits down.) Okay, now, see, I wanna name the girl
baby Leslie, and Frank wants to name one of the boy babies Frank JR. JR. </p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Wouldn&#146;t that be Frank the III?</p>

<p><b>Alice:</b> Don&#146;t get me started. (To Phoebe) Anyway, umm, since there are three
babies and umm, we both got to put our names in, we would be truly honoured if you named
the other boy baby.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Wow! That&#146;s so great! Oh! Oh! Cougar.</p>

<p><b>Alice:</b> You think about it. (Leaves)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Opening Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Ross&#146;s apartment, he and Emily are getting ready to go to the airport.]</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> I left a bra drying on the shower rod, you don&#146;t think your son will
think it&#146;s yours and be horribly traumatised? </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey, if mommy can have a wife, daddy can have a bra.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> (checks the clock) Ohh, it&#146;s time to go.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, no-no-no, see, that-that clock&#146;s a little fast, uh, we have 17
minutes. Huh, what can we do in 17 minutes? Twice?</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Well that&#146;s ambitious.</p>

<p>(They kiss but are interrupted by a knock on the door.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey, uh, you can ignore that.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> That&#146;s Carol with your son!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Uhh, believe me when he&#146;s older, he&#146;ll understand.</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> (knocking on the door) Ross!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I&#146;ll be right there. (He goes over and opens the door to Carol,
Susan, and Ben.) (To Ben.) Hello! (To Carol.) Hello! (To Susan.) Hey. Uhh, Emily, this is
Carol and Susan.</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> Hey, it&#146;s so nice to finally meet you!</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Me too!</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Ohh, y&#146;know, Susan&#146;s gonna be shooting a commercial in London
next week.</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> Oh yeah, I&#146;m so excited, I&#146;ve never been there.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Oh, well, I&#146;ll show you around.</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> That would be great! Also, uh, I was hoping to catch a show so if you can
make any suggestions&#133;</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Oh, there&#146;s tonnes of terrific stuff&#151;I&#146;ll go with you!</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> Ahh!</p>

<p>(Ross accidentally, on purpose, bumps into Susan.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Look at you two, bonding, making us late for the airport so&#133;</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Are you all right?</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> Oh, he&#146;s fine. He&#146;s fine. It&#146;s just that us getting along
is difficult for him, because he doesn&#146;t like me.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh come on! That&#146;s-that&#146;s&#133; true.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, Joey and Chandler are playing
foosball as Phoebe enters.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey! Do we have a baby name yet?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ugh! No! This is so hard! I went through this whole book (Holds up a
book) and found nothing! I want a name that&#146;s really like, y&#146;know strong and
confident, y&#146;know? Like-like Exxon. </p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, it certainly worked for that Valdez kid.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ooh-ooh, Pheebs, you want a strong name? How about, The Hulk?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, I&#146;m-I&#146;m not sure about Hulk, but I like the idea of a name
starting with &quot;The.&quot;</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, want a good name, go with Joey. Joey&#146;s your pal. Joey&#146;s your
buddy. &quot;Where is everybody?&quot; &quot;Well, they&#146;re hanging out with
Joey.&quot;</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey, y&#146;know what, if you&#146;re gonna do that, if you&#146;re
gonna name him Joey, you should name him Chandler. (Phoebe doesn&#146;t think so.) Oh,
come on! Chandler&#146;s funny, sophisticated, and he&#146;s very loveable, once you get
to know him.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh well, hey, Joey&#146;s loveable too! But the thing about Joey is, if
you need him, he&#146;ll be there.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, Chandler will be there for you too. I mean, well, he might be a
little late, but-but, he&#146;ll be there. And he&#146;ll bring you some cold soda, if
want you need him for is that you&#146;re really hot.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What do ya say? What do ya say?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, I, I like the idea of naming him after someone I love, and Joey
and Chandler are great names. (They both stare at her.) But, all right, I
don&#146;t&#151;maybe I&#146;ll just name him The Hulk.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I knew I shouldn&#146;t have mentioned it! That&#146;s what I wanted to
name my kid!</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's erm, Monica and Rachel's, Monica is cooking and Rachel is
getting ready for a date with Joshua.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hey, Mon, if you were hoping to sleep with Joshua the first time
tonight, which one of these would you want to be wearing. (She&#146;s holding two frilly,
lace nighties.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Y&#146;know what? It <b>really</b> creeps me out choosing other
people&#146;s sex clothes.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Sorry. I&#146;m so exited! I&#146;ve been waiting for this for months! I
got my hair coloured! I got new sheets! I&#146;m making him a <b>very</b> fancy meal. </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Um-hmm.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What am I making him by the way?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well, you&#146;re making him a frieze salad with goat cheese and pine
nuts, wild nuts, wild rice, roast asparagus, and salmon au croup.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I thought I was making him filet mignon? </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah, you were, but you decided to make salmon because you had some left
over at the restaurant. And then you realised if you (Points at Rachel) bitched about it,
then you (Points to herself) would stop cooking, and you (Points at Rachel) would have to
make your famous baked potato and Diet Coke.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Wow, I really get crabby when I cook.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, Joey, Chandler, and Phoebe are
there as Ross enters.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> So uh, Emily called last night&#133;</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> And <b>now</b> you&#146;re giving me the message!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Turns out them Emily is just <b>crazy</b> about Susan. Yeah, they&#146;re
going to the theatre together! They&#146;re going to dinner! They&#146;re going horseback
riding!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> God, Susan is so fun!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Look, this is just a little too familiar, okay? For like, for like six
months before Carol and I spilt up, all I heard was: &quot;My friend Susan is so smart. My
friend Susan is so funny. My friend Susan is so great.&quot;</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You actually think that something can happen between Emily and Susan?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey, they&#146;re going to the gym together! Two women! Stretching!
Y&#146;know they-they take a steam together! Things get a little playful&#151;didn&#146;t
you see <i>Personal Best</i>?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No, but I&#146;m gonna!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hi! Hi! You&#146;re crazy! Okay? This is Emily. Emily is straight.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> How do you know? I mean we thought Carol was straight before I married
her!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, I definitely. I don&#146;t like the name Ross.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What a weird way to kick me when I&#146;m down.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No! No! I-I meant for the baby!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh. What&#146;s wrong with Ross?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, it&#146;s just y&#146;know that something like this would never to
like The Hulk, y&#146;know&#133;</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Actually that-that&#146;s not true, in <i>The Incredible Hulk</i> uh, No.
72, Dr. Bruce Banner found&#133; (Sees everyone staring at him and stops.) Y&#146;know,
ugh, nevermind, my girlfriend&#146;s a lesbian. (Leaves.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> So, I decided I&#146;m definitely going to go with either Joey or
Chandler.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh! Oh-oh, you gotta pick Joey! I mean, name one famous person named
Chandler.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Raymond Chandler.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Someone you didn&#146;t make up!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, there are <b>no</b> famous Joey&#146;s. Except for, huh, Joey
Buttafucco.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, that guy really hurt us.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, how about a compromise then, okay? What if it&#146;s like
y&#146;know, Chanoey?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, look, Joey! Come on, think about it, first of all, he&#146;ll
never be President. There&#146;s never gonna be a President Joey.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> All right look man, I didn&#146;t want to bring this up, but Chandler, is
the stupidest name I ever heard in my life! It&#146;s not even a name; it&#146;s barely
even a word. Okay? It&#146;s kinda like chandelier, but it&#146;s not! All right?
It&#146;s a stupid, stupid <b>non</b>-name!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Wow, you&#146;re, you&#146;re right. I have a horrible, horrible name.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I&#146;m sorry man, I didn&#146;t&#151;I&#146;m-I&#146;m sorry. I&#146;m
sorry. (Goes over and comforts him.) </p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> So I guess it&#146;s Joey then!</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's erm, Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is on her dinner date with
Joshua.]</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> This is so nice. Thank you for doing this.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ohh, please! Cooking soothes me. (They kiss.) Ahh. So, dig in!</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Great! Oh, it all looks sooo good!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (taking a bite) Hmmm!</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Oh my God!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh I know, my God, this is so&#151;this rice is so&#151;I am so good.</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Behind you?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (sees the chick and the duck) Oh, yeah, I&#146;m sorry. They used to
live here; sometimes they migrate back over.</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> (getting up and backing away from they.) Is there ah, is there some way
they can not be here. It&#146;s just ah, farm birds really kinda freak me out!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, sure, okay. Okay.</p>

<p>(Rachel gets up and ushers them into the hall, as they pass Joshua, he leaps onto the
counter to avoid them. Rachel drops them off in the hall, and knocks on Joey&#146;s door.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (answering the door.) Hey, how did you do that?! Come on in. (He brings
them inside.)</p>

<p>[Cut back to Rachel&#146;s date.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> All gone! So, farm birds, huh?</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Yeah, it&#146;s-it&#146;s my only weird thing, I swear. And I-I-I
would&#146;ve told you about it, but I didn&#146;t know they would be here.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh.</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> So, all right.</p>

<p>(They both sit back down.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay. So, can I serve you a little of&#151;What? What? What? (She sees
that Joshua isn&#146;t relaxed.)</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Nothing I uh, it&#146;s just that I know that they&#146;re still out
there.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> But, they&#146;re across the hall! I mean that&#146;s two doors away, it
would take them a long time to peck their way back over here.</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Okay, that&#146;s-that&#146;s not funny. Uhh.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, y&#146;know, would you feel better if we went someplace else? I
mean we could pack all this stuff up and y&#146;know go to your apartment.</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Oh, they&#146;re working on this week, it&#146;s a total mess. But uh,
I&#146;m staying at my parents&#146; house, we could go there.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Your parents&#146;?</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Yeah, they&#146;re out of town.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ohh.</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Yeah-yeah, it&#146;s this <b>huge</b> place, and-and it&#146;s got this
gorgeous view of the park, and very, very romantic. What do you say?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah that works.</p>

<p>(He moves to kiss her, but stops when he hears the duck.)</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> They-they-they can smell fear.</p>

<p>[Scene: Ross&#146;s apartment, Carol has come to pick up Ben.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (opening the door.) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Hey! How&#146;s Ben?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, I asked him if he wanted to eat, he said, &quot;No.&quot; I asked
him if he wanted to sleep, he said, &quot;No.&quot; I asked him what he wanted to do, he
said, &quot;No.&quot; So, he&#146;s sweeping. (We see Ben playing with a broom and a
dustpan.)</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Hey, Ben! Hey!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> So umm, any word from Susan?</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Ooh, yeah! She said she&#146;s having sooo much fun with Emily.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Uh-huh. Uh-huh. Uh, by the by, did it uh, did it ever occur to you that, I
don&#146;t know, maybe they might be having a little too much fun?</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> What&#146;s too much fun?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Y&#146;know, the kind of fun, you and Susan had when we were married.</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Oh my God, you are <b>so</b> paranoid! </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Am I?!</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Yes!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> <b>Am I</b>?!</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> I can&#146;t speak for Emily, but <b>Susan</b> is in a loving, committed
relationship.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Uh-huh, Carol, so were we. All right, just-just imagine for a moment,
