Susan meets someone and-and they really hit it off. Y&#146;know? Say-say they&#146;re
coming back from the theatre, and they-they stop at a pub for a couple of drinks,
they&#146;re laughing, y&#146;know, someone innocently touches someone else&#133;
There&#146;s electricity, it&#146;s new. It&#146;s exciting. Are you telling me there
isn&#146;t even the slightest possibility of something happening?</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Maybe.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> OH MY GOD!! I didn&#146;t really believe it until you just said it!!</p>

<p>[Scene: Joshua&#146;s parents&#146; apartment, Rachel and Joshua are entering.]</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> &#133;and even though none of the other kids believed me, I swear to
God, that duck pushed me!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Wow! This place is fabulous!</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Yeah, yeah, let me show you around. This is the uh, downstairs living
room.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Whoa-whoa, there&#146;s two living rooms? God, growing up here, this
place must&#146;ve been a real babe magnet.</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Yeah, well, it would&#146;ve been, but uh, my parents just moved here.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ohh, you should know, this place is a real babe magnet. Wanna make out?</p>

<p>(They kiss.)</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Hey, here&#146;s an idea. Why don&#146;t uh, I put the food in the
fridge and we can eat it later?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> That sounds like a plan. Umm, is there a place I can go freshen up?</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Oh yeah, yeah uh, it&#146;s down the hall and uh, second door to your
left.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ah.</p>

<p>(She goes down the hall. Joshua goes to put the food away when his parents walk in.)</p>

<p><b>Mrs. Burgin:</b> Oh, hi, darling!</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Mom, Dad, what are you guys doing here?</p>

<p><b>Mrs. Burgin:</b> Oh, well we cut the trip short.</p>

<p><b>Mr. Burgin:</b> France sucks!</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Umm, this may be a little weird, but I-I-I got a date here.</p>

<p><b>Mrs. Burgin:</b> Oh, say no more!</p>

<p><b>Mr. Burgin:</b> We&#146;ll just grab some food and take it with us right upstairs,
and we&#146;ll be right out of you hair.</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Oh, that-that would be great. So you didn&#146;t even get to Italy?</p>

<p><b>Mr. Burgin:</b> Yep, sucks!</p>

<p>(They all go into the kitchen. Just then, Rachel comes back from the bathroom; she had
removed her dress and is wearing nothing but a lace nightie. She tries to find someplace
seductive to wait for Joshua. She tries to sit on the piano, but it makes too much noise.
So she goes over to the couch and kinda half lays down to wait for Joshua. Joshua comes in
from the kitchen, sees Rachel, and freezes.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hi you!</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Oh my God!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I know, I can do more than cook.</p>

<p>(Just then, his parents enter. Rachel gasps.)</p>

<p><b>Mr. Burgin:</b> I like her. She sees smart.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Commercial Break</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Joshua&#146;s parents&#146; apartment, continued from earlier.]</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Uhh, Rachel, my parents&#133;</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ohh! It&#146;s so nice to meet you. (She goes over and shakes their
hands.) Hello. </p>

<p><b>Mr. Burgin:</b> Hi.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hello.</p>

<p><b>Mrs. Burgin:</b> Hello. Well, Joshua, that $500 was for groceries.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What? This-this, no, oh no, no-no-no, this is
not&#151;that&#146;s-that&#146;s not what it is. See, see, okay, I work in fashion, see
and-and, this is a real dress actually. It&#146;s-it&#146;s, they&#146;re-they&#146;re
wearing it in Milan, so part of my job is too wear the clothes, and then I see how people
respond, and then I report back to my superiors at <i>Bloomingdale&#146;s</i>, so&#133;
And obviously in uh, in-in this case, (She grabs a pen and paper) I am going to report
back, &quot;USA not ready.&quot;</p>

<p><b>Mrs. Burgin:</b> Maybe in L.A?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yes!</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> There you go.</p>

<p><b>Mr. Burgin:</b> So, have you kids eaten yet?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, we were going to do that after&#151;I mean umm, next.</p>

<p><b>Mr. Burgin:</b> Well, we&#146;re starving, why don&#146;t we all go get something to
eat?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, yeah, well&#133; Yeah, no use wasting this baby, just lyin&#146;
around the house. </p>

<p><b>Mr. Burgin:</b> So&#133; We go eat.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yes.</p>

<p><b>Mr. Burgin:</b> You&#146;ll wear that. We&#146;ll be eating, and of course,
you&#146;ll be wearing that.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is looking for a new
name in Phoebe&#146;s book of names.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Dude, I am sorry about what I said!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No, no, you&#146;re right, it is a ridiculous name!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> It&#146;s not that bad.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes it is! From now on, I have no first name.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> So, you&#146;re just Bing?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I have no name.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> All right, so, what are we supposed to call you?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay uh, for now, temporarily, you can call me, Clint.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No way are you cool enough to pull of Clint.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, so what name am I cool enough to pull off?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Umm, Gene.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> It&#146;s Clint. It&#146;s Clint! (He heads for his bedroom.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> See you later, Gene.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Bye, Gene.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> It&#146;s Clint! <b>Clint</b>!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What&#146;s up with Gene?</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Rachel is telling Phoebe and Monica of her date.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> So, you wore your nightie to dinner?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, yeah. And uh, the best part though, when the uh, waiter spilled
water down my back, I jumped up, and my boob popped out.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh my God!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, no!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No, it&#146;s all right. I got nice boobs. (Phoebe and Monica nod there
heads in agreement.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (returning from the phone.) So, I just picked up a message from Emily, she
and Susan are going to a poetry reading together! </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> So?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> So! Poetry? Susan&#146;s gay! They&#146;re being gay together!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Emily&#146;s straight.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, wake up!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Wow, Carol really messed you up!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Excuse me?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, she turned you into this-this-this untrusting, crazy, jealous,
sycophant. (They all look at her.) All right, so I don&#146;t know what sycophant means,
but the rest is right.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Look, I don&#146;t know what you&#146;re talking about, I am not a crazy,
jealous person.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Huh.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> She&#146;s totally right! When we were together, you got all freaked out
about Mark and there was nothing going on.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> This totally makes sense!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> It does not!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, sure it does! In high school, you weren&#146;t jealous at all even
though <b>all</b> your girlfriends were cheating on you!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> All right, all right, so up until &#145;92-93 he was very trusting, then
&#146;94 hit, Carol left him and bamn! Paranoid city!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Absolutely! Absolutely!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> This is so much fun!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> This is <b>not</b> fun!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Look, all we&#146;re trying to say is, don&#146;t let what happened with
Carol ruin what you got with Emily.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah. The &#146;92 Ross wouldn&#146;t.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, I still think I was right about that whole Mark thing.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What&#151;yeah&#151;what, y&#146;know what? I hope Emily <b>is</b> a
lesbian.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, Phoebe is showing off more of her
drum skills to Joey by rubbing one of the sticks back and forth across the drum.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Drum roll.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (entering) Okay. Okay. All right. Help! Am I a Mark, or a John?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Nah, you&#146;re not tall enough to be a Mark, but you might make a good
Barney.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All right look, am I serious, okay? Tomorrow at 3:30 I am going down
to the courthouse.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> You&#146;re actually going through with this?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey, look, this name has been holding me back my entire life. Okay,
it&#146;s probably why kids picked on me in school, and why I never do well with
women&#133; So, as of 4 o&#146;clock tomorrow, I&#146;m either gonna be Mark Johnson or
John Markson.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> You got problems because of you! Not your name! All right, this has got
to stop! Chandler is a great name! In fact&#151;yes, (To Joey) I&#146;m, I&#146;m sorry. I
know you really wanted me to name the baby Joey, but eh, so, I&#146;m-I&#146;m, I&#146;m
gonna, I&#146;m gonna name the baby Chandler.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (pleased) Really?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, but you have to keep the name too!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay. Thanks.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You wanna hug it out?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah!</p>

<p>(They both hug.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yay! </p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yay! </p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yay&#151;oh&#151;yay! Okay, I gotta go tell Frank and Alice! Right now!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ooh, uh&#133; (She grabs her coat and runs out.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Bye, Pheebs!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, bye! </p>

<p>(She exits, and after the door is closed, Chandler turns to Joey and&#133;)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Ha! Ha! Ha!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ohh! (Realises it was all a trick to get Phoebe to name the baby
Chandler.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Closing Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: The Airport, Carol and Ross are waiting for Emily and Susan to deplane. A
gorgeous woman walks by and they both turn to watch her go.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Nice luggage.</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> I was gonna say&#133;</p>

<p>(Susan and Emily get off.)</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> Hey!</p>

<p>(They both run and hug they&#146;re respective partners.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Hey! I missed you.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, I missed you too.</p>

<p><b>Susan:</b> (To Emily) Thanks for everything, I had such a great time.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Oh, so did I.</p>

<p>(They hug and give each other a little peck on the cheek.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (To Carol) No tongue. (And gives her the thumbs up.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>End</strong></p>
</body>
</html>
419<html>

<head>
<title>The One With All The Haste</title>
<meta HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=windows-1252">
<meta NAME="GENERATOR" CONTENT="Microsoft FrontPage 3.0">
<meta NAME="Template" CONTENT="C:\Program Files\Microsoft Office\Templates\FRIENDS1.dot">
</head>

<body bgcolor="#FFFFFF" link="#008000">

<h1 align="center">The One With All The Haste</h1>

<hr>

<p>Written by: Wil Calhoun &amp; Scott Silveri<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a></p>

<hr>

<p>[Scene: Rachel&#146;s bedroom; Rachel is awoken by a man singing in the next
apartment.]</p>

<p><b>The Singing Man:</b> (singing, duh) Morning&#146;s here! Sunshine is here! The sky
is clear, the morning&#146;s here! The morning&#146;s here!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> HEY!! Do you <b>have</b> to do that? It&#146;s Saturday!</p>

<p><b>The Singing Man:</b> Oh come on! Morning&#146;s here! (Starts singing)
Morning&#146;s here! The morning is here! Sunshine is here!</p>

<p>(Rachel slams shut her window and storms into the living room, where Joey and Monica
are eating breakfast.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I <b>hate</b> this apartment! I hate the color of these walls! I hate
the fact that this place still smells like bird! I hate that singing guy!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Are you kidding? I love that guy! (Starts singing) Morning&#146;s here!
Morning is here&#151;</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Stop it! I will kill you. I hate the fact that my room is so small.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey, I have all the space I need. Just do what I did.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Monica, you don&#146;t even have a bed, you sleep in a ball on the
floor!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Y&#146;know what? I am <b>really</b> tired of your bellyaching! Okay,
I-I worked really hard at making this a nice place for us to live!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I&#146;m sorry. I&#146;m so sorry.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> See, this is a <b>great</b> apartment.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Shut up! This place is a hole!</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Opening Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Ross&#146;s bedroom; Ross and Emily are making out. Ross as a new feature.]</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Oh, blimey, I still can&#146;t believe you&#146;ve got an earring!</p>

<p>(Yep, it&#146;s a little gold loop.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Huh? I know, I know. Who am I? David Bowe? (Shakes his head around,
pretending like he&#146;s jamming.)</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> He does that?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Uh, I don&#146;t know, whatever.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> I think it makes you look really dangerous.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, I know. Y&#146;know what, I never would&#146;ve gotten this if it
weren&#146;t for you. No really, when I&#146;m with you I&#146;m-I&#146;m like this whole
other guy, I <b>love</b> that guy! I mean, I love you too, a lot, but that guy! I-I love
that guy!</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> I love both of you!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah?</p>

<p>(They kiss.)</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> I wish I didn&#146;t have to go.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Then don&#146;t. Stay here. Just don&#146;t go so soon to London, just one
more day.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Ohh, Ross, please!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> One more day, seriously/</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Don&#146;t do this to me, again. You&#146;d know I&#146;d stay here in a
minute, but I&#146;d really miss so much work, they&#146;ll fire me.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> So, then you can stay as long as you want.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> I wish I could.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh no. Don&#146;t, don&#146;t, don&#146;t start packing. Come on! (She
puts some clothes into her bag, and Ross throws them out.)</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> I don&#146;t think you understand packing. Look, I just don&#146;t want
to leave it to the last minute. Last time I left in such a rush, I left my knickers here.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, I know, I uh, I tried them on.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> You didn&#146;t!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No. No, I didn&#146;t. I didn&#146;t want to be <b>that</b> guy.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, Joey and Chandler are watching
one of those Kung Fu movies and imitating the moves.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (entering, wearing Santa pants) Hello!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Ho! Ho! Ho!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Excuse me.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Your pants!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, yeah! You like &#145;em? I just, I went to a used clothes store and
got a bunch of maternity stuff. These are sooo comfortable!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Uhh, Pheebs, those are uh, those are Santa pants.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Santa pants. (Phoebe still doesn&#146;t get it.) Santa Claus&#146;s
pants.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Nuh-uh! They&#146;re maternity pants. They even came with a list of baby
names. (Pulls out a sheet of paper which lists who&#146;s been naughty and who&#146;s been
nice.) See, these names are good, and these names are bad. (Finally, she figures it out.)
Ohh.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (entering) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (entering) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> So&#151;Hey, Pheebs! So, how are the elves?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I don&#146;t know! How are the-the-the-the, y&#146;know&#151;You&#146;re
clothes aren&#146;t funny.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey, guys, what-what should I wear to a Knicks game?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Uhh, a T-shirt that says, &quot;I don&#146;t belong here.&quot;</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> You have Knicks tickets?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, my mom got my dad&#146;s season tickets in the divorce, so she
just gave them to me.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah, apparently, they&#146;re pretty good seats.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (examining the tickets) Oh my God! Those are almost right on the floor!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Do you guys want these?</p>
<b>

<p>Joey:</b> Yeah!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah we do!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ohh, well you got &#145;em.</p>
<b>

<p>Both:</b> All right!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Just give us our apartment back!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Boy! I didn&#146;t see that coming!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Are you serious?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, come on! We know what these are worth.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah, what, do you think we&#146;re stupid?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> You&#146;re not stupid. You&#146;re meaner than I thought.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What do you say?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Forget it! Okay, I&#146;m not giving up my bachelor pad for some
basketball seats!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You&#146;re bachelor pad?!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Have you even had a girl up here?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No. But uh, Joey has, and I usually talk to them in the morning time.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, you do!</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Joey is whining to Chandler about the tickets.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Come on!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (ignoring him) Yes, Gunther, can I get two cups of chino, please?</p>

<p><b>Gunther:</b> Good one.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Come on, season tickets! Season tickets, do you know what that means?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Forget it! Okay, I&#146;m not giving up the apartment.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh come&#151;look, when I was a kid my dad&#146;s company gave season
tickets to the number one salesman every year, all right? My dad <b>never</b> won! Of
course, he wasn&#146;t in the sales division, but still, I never ever, ever forgot that!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (entering) Hey, guys! (They both notice his new little friend)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh my God!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> We don&#146;t make enough fun of you already?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh yeah, Emily convinced me to do it.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You do know that Wham broke up?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I like it, and Emily likes it, and that&#146;s what counts. So uh, how are
you guys doing?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh-no, don&#146;t try and talk all normal with that thing in your ear.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Where is Emily?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Ugh, she&#146;s saying good-bye to her uncle.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Man, didn&#146;t she like just get here?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah!! Yeah!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Easy tiger.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I just, I hate this so much! I mean, every time I go pick her up at the
airport, it&#146;s-it&#146;s so great. But at the same time I&#146;m thinking, &quot;Well,
I&#146;m gonna be right back there in a couple of days, dropping her off.&quot;</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> So what are you going to do?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Nothing! There&#146;s nothing to do! I mean, she lives there, I live here.
I mean, she-she&#146;d have to uh, move here. She <b>should</b> move here!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I could ask her to live with me!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Are you serious?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I mean, why not! I mean, I mean why not?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Because you&#146;ve only known her for six weeks! Okay, I&#146;ve got
a carton of milk in my fridge I&#146;ve had a longer relationship with!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Look guys, when I&#146;m with her it&#146;s-it&#146;s-it&#146;s like she
brings this-this-this great side out of me. I mean I-I-I love her, y&#146;know?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> And I love the milk! But, I&#146;m not gonna some British girl to move
in with me! (Realizes that made no sense.) Joey, you say things now.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> All right look, Ross, he&#146;s right. Emily&#146;s great, she&#146;s
great! But this way too soon, you&#146;re only gonna scare her!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I don&#146;t want to do that.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No! You don&#146;t want to wreck it, you don&#146;t want to go to fast!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, no, you&#146;re right, I know, you&#146;re right, I&#146;m not,
I&#146;m not gonna do it. All right, thanks guys. (Gets up to leave.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, no problem, just remember to wake us up before you go-go.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, later that same day. Joey and
Chandler are eating pizza, and Phoebe is trying to knit something.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> That&#146;s too hard. Too hard!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (entering with Rachel) All right boys, last chance for the tickets!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Or I&#146;ll give them to my new boyfriend, Joshua.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No thank you.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Wait-wait-wait-wait! (To Chandler) Come on! Come on, let&#146;s trade! The
timing&#146;s perfect, I just clogged the toilet! </p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Look, I want those basketball seats as much as you do! Okay, but we
can&#146;t leave in the small apartment after we&#146;ve lived here! Didn&#146;t you ever
read <i>Flowers for Algernon</i>?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yes! Didn&#146;t you ever read <i>Sports Illustrated</i>?! No! I
didn&#146;t read yours! But come on, we can go to the game tonight!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Look, the only way I will even consider this is if they offer a lot
more than just season seats.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> It&#146;s the Knicks!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Screw the Knicks!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Whoa!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I didn&#146;t mean that. I just meant that the apartment is worth so
much more.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Huh.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> And the Knicks rule all.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, the Knicks rule all!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey, so? Are you gonna do it?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No. No. We&#146;re not gonna do that, y&#146;know why? Because its not
an even trade.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> All right, okay, look, what if you could keep the apartment and get the
tickets?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Done!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Let me finish. </p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh. </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I&#146;m talking about a bet, winner takes all.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ooh, we could end up with nothing.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Or you could end up with everything.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ooh, I like that.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> All right, so what do you say?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, just do it!!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Op, op, I&#146;m convinced!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Come on man, you know I&#146;d do it for you! Because, you&#146;re my best
friend.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All right, but you can&#146;t use that again for a whole year.
I&#146;m in.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> All right!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ooh, this is so exciting! Ooh, God, what are you going to bet?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, okay, well, I think we should let Phoebe decide, because she&#146;s
the only who&#146;s impartial, and she&#146;s so pretty.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay. Umm, ooh, ooh&#151;oh, I have a game!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay! </p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> This is great!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What&#146;s the game?! What&#146;s the game?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, well, it doesn&#146;t have a name&#151;oh, okay, Phoebeball! No, it
doesn&#146;t have a name. Umm, okay, Monica, what is your favourite thing about trees?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> They&#146;re green?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Good! Good! Five points!</p>

<p>(They both rejoice; Chandler is totally confused.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> All right, Joey, same question.</p>

<p>(He looks to Chandler, who doesn&#146;t have a clue.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Uhh, they&#146;re tall.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ooh, three points. Both fine answers, but we were looking for leafy,
leafy.</p>

<p>(Joey turns and is angry that Chandler didn&#146;t come up with the answer.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> That&#146;s not even a game!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What? Shut up! We&#146;re winning!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You wanna finish this right now? All right, we get a deck of cards, high
card wins. What do you say?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Fine, let&#146;s do it.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, I have cards!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, good.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah! Here! (She grabs a deck out of her purse) Oh no, these are the
trick deck. Okay. Here yes. Okay.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, you guys uh, you guys pick first</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay. (She picks a card.) Four.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> That&#146;s a low one!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah! Okay. (Joey picks a card.) Phoebe, you look, I can&#146;t.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What make you think I can?! (Shields her eyes from it.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay. Okay. (He looks at the card.) Ace!</p>

<p>(Both Joey and Chandler and Monica and Rachel jump up and down for joy.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Why are you screaming and hugging?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Because we won our apartment back!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What? Ace is high! Jack, queen, king, ace!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No! Ace is low! Ace, two, three, four!</p>

<p>(They all look to Phoebe to settle this.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I don&#146;t know. Ooh! Ooh! Look it! (She fans out the trick deck.)
Ah-ha!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> All right, cut, let&#146;s pick again, pick again.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Come on apartment! Come on apartment! (Picks a card.) Oh! I know queen
is high!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Uh-huh, not as high as&#133;(picks a card) It worked! King!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah baby!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> But, we pick again! We pick again!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Why?!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I don&#146;t know!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Tickets please! (Rachel hands over the tickets) That&#146;s courtside
baby!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Seriously, good game though. Good game. (He tries to congratulate them,
but they pull away.) (To Chandler) What are they so mad about? They get the apartment
back!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No they didn&#146;t!</p>

<p>[Scene: Ross&#146;s apartment, Emily has packed as Ross returns.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> I packed while you were gone. I left some knickers under your pillow.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (laughs) Move in with me.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Don&#146;t be scared, I-I know it sounds crazy and-and people will say
it&#146;s too soon, but just-just think, think how great it will be.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Ohh, no. Ugh. Oh, leaving London, my whole family lives there.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I know.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> My job!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, so, you-you&#146;ll get a job here! I mean, I&#146;m always hearing
about uh, them foreigners coming in here and stealing American jobs; that could be you!</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Yeah, but it-it-it&#146;s my whole life&#151;you come to England.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, I can&#146;t. I would, I really would, but my son is here; I
can&#146;t leave him. Isn&#146;t&#151;you don&#146;t think there&#146;s any way?</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Ohh, I don&#146;t think so. I mean it would be different if it was way
into the future &#150;and-and-and we were getting married or something.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Oh no, no, right I shouldn&#146;t have said married. Uh, please
don&#146;t go freaky on me. I didn&#146;t mean it. Well, I didn&#146;t say it; I take it
back!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, no, don&#146;t. Why don&#146;t we?</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Why don&#146;t we what?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Get married.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> You are mad!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No! No! I&#146;m not! It&#146;s-it&#146;s-it&#146;s perfect! I mean
it&#146;s better than you just-just moving here, &#145;cause it&#146;s us together
forever, and that&#146;s-that&#146;s what I want.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> We&#146;ve only known each other for six weeks!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, I know, so what? I mean, who&#146;s-who&#146;s to say? Does that me
we-we can&#146;t do it? Look, huh, I was with Carol for four years before we got married
and I wound up divorced from a pregnant lesbian. I mean, this, this makes sense for us.
Come on! I mean, on our first date we ended up spending the whole weekend in Vermont! I
mean, last night I got my ear pierced! Me! This feels right. Doesn&#146;t it?</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> My parents are going to be really mad.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Is that&#151;are you saying yes? Is that yes?</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Yes.</p>

<p>(They kiss and hug.)</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Yes!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yes! We&#146;re getting married?!</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Oh my God! </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yes!</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> We&#146;re getting married!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Come here, come here. Uh, (He takes the earring out.) ow! Emily, will you
marry me?</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Yes.</p>

<p>(He tries to put it on her finger.)</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Ohh, it&#146;s a bit small.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Damn! I thought that was going to be romantic as hell!</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> It was.</p>

<p>(They kiss.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Commerical Break</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: The hallway, Joey and Chandler are coming back from the game.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Those were like the best seats ever.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh yeah. Hey! Should we give these shirts to the girls? Y&#146;know, kinda
like a peace offering.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh yeah, that&#146;s very nice. Plus, y&#146;know they were free and
they&#146;re too small.</p>

<p>(He knocks on the girls&#146; door and walks in. Surprise! The girls, obviously using <i>Star
Trek</i> technology, have completely moved everything in both apartments back to their
original positions, all in the time it took for the guys to go to a basketball game. Wow!
Anyhoo, Chandler is stunned, and Joey doesn&#146;t even realise it.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh. Oh, God! (He starts running around like a chicken with his head
cut off.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey, want a beer? (Hands him a beer and sits down in one of the chairs.)
(Jumping up.) WHOA!!!!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I KNOW!!!</p>

<p>(They both sprint to what used to be their apartment.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Open up! Open up! Open up!</p>

<p>(A very angry Monica opens the door with the security chain still on.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> We&#146;ll discuss it, in the morning! (Slams the door shut.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What the hell is going on?!</p>

<p>(It&#146;s Rachel&#146;s turn to open the door.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> We took our apartment back!! (Slams the door shut.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (opening the door) I had nothing to do with it. (Closes the door.)
(Opens the door.) Okay, it was my idea, but I don&#146;t feel good about it.</p>

<p>(She goes to close the door, but Chandler puts his foot it in.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> We are switching back, right now!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No, we&#146;re not! We&#146;re not leaving!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, you&#146;re gonna have to leave sometime, because you both have
jobs, and as soon as you do, we&#146;re switching it back! There&#146;s nothing you can do
to stop us! Right, Joe?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I don&#146;t know.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I don&#146;t want to move again! </p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I don&#146;t care, this is our apartment! And they stole&#151;you
stole it&#151;our apartment, and we won that apartment fair and square, twice! And I am
getting it back right now. I&#146;m getting back right now!</p>

<p>(They open the door.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> All right. We figured you might respond this way, so we have a backup
offer.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh no-no-no, no more offers. You can&#146;t offer anything to us!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Let us keep the apartment and&#133;</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> As a thank you, Rachel and I will kiss for one minute.</p>

<p>[Time lapse. The guys are entering their apartment.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Totally worth it!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> That was one good minute!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Good night.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Good night.</p>

<p>(They both go back into their old rooms and shut the doors. Of course, Chandler has to
close both sections of his door.)</p>

<p>[Cut to the girls apartment.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Men are such idiots.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah! Can you believe that something that stupid actually got us our
apartment back?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> That&#146;s so funny to think if you&#146;d just done that right after
the last contest, no one would have had to move at all.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah, let-let-let&#146;s pretend that&#146;s not true.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, scarf&#146;s done. (It&#146;s not really a scarf, it&#146;s just a
bunch of yarn that Phoebe has tied together. Just then, Ross and Emily enter dragging with
them Joey and Chandler.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Come on! Come on. Come on.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What-what&#146;s going on?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ross has some big thing to tell everyone.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Uhh, okay, it&#146;s uh, Emily and I, we decided to uh, to get married.</p>

<p>(The gang is stunned.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What? Oh, are you pregnant too?!</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Umm, no.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> When, when did&#151;how, how did you&#133;</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> We, we just decided to uh, to go for it.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> I mean, we know it&#146;s a bit hasty but, uh, it just feels so right,
so&#133;</p>

<p>(Rachel slowly walks in from her bedroom. She is stunned speechless.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (turning around.) Umm, uh, I was just telling the guys&#133;</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, I-I heard. (Pause, everyone looks at each other, waiting for
Rachel&#146;s reaction.) I think it&#146;s great! (Hugs Ross.) Ohh, I&#146;m so happy for
you!</p>

<p>(Seeing Rachel&#146;s apparently okay with this, the rest of the gang jumps up to
congratulate Ross and Emily on their pending nuptials.) </p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, well, that&#146;s great!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah! Yeah!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (to Ross) I can&#146;t believe you&#146;re getting married! </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah. (They hug again.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Monica and Rachel made out. (Giggles like a schoolboy and Monica glares at
him.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Closing Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Joey&#146;s bedroom, he is awoken by the singing guy.]</p>

<p><b>The Singing Man:</b> (singing) Morning&#146;s here! The morning&#146;s here! </p>

<p>(Joey joins him.)</p>
<b>

<p>Both:</b> Sunshine is here! The sky is clear, the morning&#146;s here!</p>

<p><b>The Singing Man:</b> Hey! You&#146;re back!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey! (Singing) Get into gear!</p>

<p><b>The Singing Man:</b> (singing) Breakfast is near!</p>
<b>

<p>Both:</b> The dark of night has disappeared!!</p>

<p><b>The Singing Man:</b> I&#146;ll see you tomorrow morning!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (happily) Okay!</p>

<p align="center"><strong>End</strong></p>
</body>
</html>
420<html>

<head>
<title>The One With All The Wedding Dresses</title>
<meta HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=windows-1252">
<meta NAME="GENERATOR" CONTENT="Microsoft FrontPage 3.0">
<meta NAME="Template" CONTENT="C:\Program Files\Microsoft Office\Templates\FRIENDS1.dot">
</head>

<body bgcolor="#FFFFFF" link="#008000">

<h1 align="center">The One With All the Wedding Dresses</h1>

<hr>

<p>Story by: Adam Chase<br>
Teleplay by: Michael Curtis &amp; Gregory S. Malins<br>
Transcribed by:<a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com"> Eric Aasen</a></p>

<hr>

<p>[Scene: Joey&#146;s bedroom, he is asleep and snoring loudly. Chandler enters wondering
who left their engine running.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Are you kidding me?! Joey. Joey! Joey! Joey! Joey! Joey! Joey! Joey!
Joey! Joey!!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (joining in, in his sleep) Joey. Joey. Joey. Joey! Joey!!</p>

<p>(Chandler acts disgusted, but is happy that Joey has stopped snoring. However, just as
he is about to leave, Joey starts snoring again. So to get him to stop, he slams the door
shut, waking Joey.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh. Oh, did-did-did I wake you?</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Opening Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Chandler is getting another cup of coffee.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Gunther, can I get another cup of coffee, please? (Gunther starts to
pour him another cup.) So uh, what do you do when you&#146;re not working here?</p>

<p><b>Gunther:</b> You don&#146;t need to fill these silences.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, okay, thanks. (He goes back to the couch and rejoins Monica, Joey,
and Phoebe.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Chandler, that&#146;s like your fourth cup of coffee!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, I am drinking lots of cups of coffee because I&#146;m exhausted!
Because Joey started snoring!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> He&#146;s in a different room! He&#146;s really that loud?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (proudly) Oh, you should here me.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> It&#146;s not something to be proud of, okay? You have to go to a
sleep clinic!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Look, I told ya, I&#146;m not going to any clinic! I don&#146;t have a
problem, you&#146;re the one with the problem! You should go to a &quot;Quit being a baby
and leave me alone&quot; clinic!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> They don&#146;t have those.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, they do! Quit being a baby and leave me alone! There, you&#146;ve
just had your first class!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Y&#146;know I used to go out with this guy that was a really light
sleeper, and whenever I started to snore, he would just roll me over&#133;</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ohhh, yeah!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> He would just roll me over and I would stop snoring.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Next time you snore, I&#146;m rolling ya over!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I gotta do what I gotta do, you gotta do what you gotta do, you just do
it.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (entering) Hey guys!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey, all right!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey!</p>

<p>(Joey starts humming <i>Here Come the Bride</i>.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, the Olympics.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Have you guys picked a date yet?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh no, not yet.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I <b>still</b> cannot believe you&#146;re engaged! (Ross looks at her)
Just &#145;cause its happening so fast; not &#145;cause you&#146;re such a loser. </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh. Thanks. Uh, has anyone seen Rach?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Ugh, she&#146;s upstairs <b>not</b> doing the dishes! And I tell ya
something! I&#146;m not doing them this time! I don&#146;t care if those dishes sit in the
sink until they&#146;re all covered with&#151;I&#146;ll do them when I get home!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah&#151;oh! Hey listen umm, Emily found this wedding dress in
London&#133;</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Already?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, but it didn&#146;t fit. Well, luckily there&#146;s a store here that
has one left in her size, but I&#146;m the groom, I&#146;m not supposed to see the
dress&#133; </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I&#146;ll pick it up for you!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Thank you.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, she&#146;s got you running errands, y&#146;know, picking up
wedding dresses&#133; (Laughs and makes like Indiana Jones and his whip) Wah-pah!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What&#146;s wah-pah?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Y&#146;know, whipped! Wah-pah!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> That&#146;s not whipped! Whipped is wh-tcssh!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> That&#146;s what I did. Wah-pah!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> You can&#146;t do anything!</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is not doing the dishes. She hears someone coming
up the stairs and quickly puts down her magazine and pretends like she&#146;s actually
doing the dishes.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hey, Mon, I was just doing the dishes! </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh! It&#146;s you. (She stops doing the dishes.) Hi.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey, do uh, do you have a minute?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, yeah, I was just about to take a break anyways, so&#133;</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> So listen uh, I know you and I haven&#146;t really had a chance to talk
since uh, Emily and I decided to get married, and uh, I was just wondering how you were.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I know if you were getting married I&#146;d feel, kinda&#133;..
y&#146;know.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah. Yeah. Definitely, well it definitely took me by surprise, but
I&#146;m okay.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> All right, I just wanted to check.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, that&#146;s sweet.</p>

<p>(He goes over to hug her.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You&#146;re great. And I-I know someday this will happen for you too. You
just hang in there.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (breaking the hug) Uhh, hang in there?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, no, I didn&#146;t mean, uh&#133;</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I mean maybe you didn&#146;t hear about a serious relationship called me
and Joshua?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, I thought you guys had just been on like four dates, I didn&#146;t
realise that had become anything, yet.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, no-no-no, no-no-no, it has become, it has&#151;yeah. Oh no, those
were four <b>great</b> dates. </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh. Yeah?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah. Oh, yeah. And I mean, the connection, I mean y&#146;know,
emotionally, mentally, physically&#133;</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Wow, that&#146;s-that&#146;s-that&#146;s incredible.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I know isn&#146;t it? It&#146;s like I&#146;m right there with Joshua.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Uh-huh.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You are right there with Emily. And it&#146;s y&#146;know, it&#146;s
kinda like&#133;. it&#146;s a tie! Well, I gotta get, I gotta get back to the dishes.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I gotta get to work.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh yeah? Fine.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey, y&#146;know, y&#146;know what would make me really happy?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh yeah, no, what&#146;s that?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> If like the four of us could all y&#146;know, hang out together. Uh, in
fact Emily&#146;s coming into town this weekend, why don&#146;t you say we all have
dinner? Say, Sunday night?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> That would be great!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, all right, it&#146;s a date. (He leaves)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (to the closed door) Hang in there. You hang in there. (Gives him the
raspberry.) </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (coming back in) Did you say something?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No, just singing. (Does a little song.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Beatrice Bridal Shop, Monica and Phoebe are there to pick up Emily&#146;s
dress.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh my God! Ohh! Look at this one! It&#146;s so beautiful!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, but y&#146;know, about have of these are gonna end up getting
divorced.</p>

<p><b>The Saleslady:</b> May I help you ladies?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, yes, umm, I&#146;m here to pick up a dress that you have on hold.</p>

<p><b>The Saleslady:</b> Yes, what&#146;s the name, please?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Emily Waltham.</p>

<p><b>The Saleslady:</b> Yes! I have it right here. (Phoebe and Monica both gasp at the
dress.) Would you like to try it on Ms. Waltham?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (laughs) Okay.</p>

<p>[Time lapse. Monica is wearing the dress and starring at herself in the mirror.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> You&#146;re the most beautiful bride I&#146;ve ever seen.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I am, aren&#146;t I?</p>

<p><b>The Saleslady:</b> Ms. Waltham?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yes?</p>

<p><b>The Saleslady:</b> We&#146;re closing.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> All right. (Goes to take off the dress.)</p>

<p><b>The Saleslady:</b> And could I get my ring back?</p>

<p>(She disgustedly takes the ring off and gives it back.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Joey&#146;s bedroom, he&#146;s snoring again and Chandler is there to roll him
over.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All right buddy, time to roll over. (Rolls him over, and discovers a
surprise) (Looking down) No-no! (Covers his eyes) No, no-n-n-n-no!! You are going to a
clinic! You&#146;re going to a clinic, and a pyjama store!</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is doing the dishes.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Does she use the cups? Yes! I believe she does. Does she use the plates?
Yes! I believe she does. (Looks at the wedding dress and stops.)</p>

<p>[Time lapse, Monica is now <b>wearing</b> the dress while doing the dishes and is
making like she is thanking her guests for coming to her wedding. Paging Dr. Crane. Dr.
Fraiser Crane!]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh. Thank you. Ohhh, thank you very much. Oh, thank you for coming.
(There&#146;s a knock on the door.) Uh, just a second!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No-no, let me in!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Phoebe?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Can you just hold on for one minute?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, you have to let me in right now!!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Are you alone?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yes!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> All right.</p>

<p>(She goes over and lets Phoebe bounce in wearing her own wedding dress.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is complaining about going to the clinic.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> This sucks! I didn&#146;t know I had to stay up all night before I went to
this stupid sleep clinic! I&#146;m so tired!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> It&#146;s 6:00.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, well&#133;</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (entering) Hi!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey, I hear that you and Joshua are going out to dinner with Ross and
Emily, and I think that&#146;s, I think that&#146;s really cool.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, Rach, I think you&#146;re handling that really well.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Handling it? What do you mean, handling it? There&#146;s nothing to
handle. Now, maybe I would have a problem with this if it wasn&#146;t for me and Joshua.
Y&#146;know, they&#146;re not gonna get married anyway!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Come on! They rushed into this thing so fast it&#146;s ridiculous! I
mean, they&#146;re gonna be engaged for like what? A year? And somewhere along the way,
one of them is gonna realise what they&#146;ve done and they&#146;re call the whole thing
off. I&#146;m telling ya, you&#146;re gonna be dancing at my wedding before you&#146;re
dancing at there&#146;s.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, well, I don&#146;t dance at weddings.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Why not?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Because weddings are a great place to meet women, and when I dance, I
look like this&#133; (Starts to dancing really, really, really badly. Ross enters behind
him and he stops.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey man.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> So, what are you guys doing four weeks from today?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Nothing.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Nothing.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I am&#133; (Looks in his date book.) free!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Great! Because Emily and I are getting married in a month!</p>
<b>

<p>Joey and Chandler:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yep!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> In a month?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You mean, you mean 30 days?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> From now? </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, that&#146;s great.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah! Yeah, Emily always wanted to get married in this beautiful place
that her parents got married, but it&#146;s going to be torn down, so&#133; I mean, I-I
know it&#146;s crazy, but everything up &#145;til now has been so crazy, and I don&#146;t
know, this just feels right. Y&#146;know?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (still looking in date book) Hey! That&#146;s the day after I stop
menstruating! (They all look at him.) This isn&#146;t mine.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Commercial Break</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Rachel is waiting impatiently for Joshua.]</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> (entering) Hey, Rachel.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> What&#146;s up? You&#146;re voice sounded all squeaky on the phone.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ohh, nothing, I just wanted to see you. See you and hug you. (Hugs him)
See you.</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Great!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah! (She sits down) Sit!</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> (sitting) You okay?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I&#146;m more than okay, I am really, really happy! Wanna know why?</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Do I?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> &#145;Cause I am really happy about us. I think we are, I think we are
so on the right track! Y&#146;know? I mean, I think we are working, I think we are
clicking. Y&#146;know?</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Yeah, sure-sure, yeah,
we&#146;re-we&#146;re-we&#146;re-we&#146;re-we&#146;re clicking.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah-yeah, y&#146;know if-if there was just like one little area where
I&#151;that I think we need&#151;we would need to work on; I-I would think it was
we&#146;re just not crazy enough!</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> I-I gotta say, I-I-I-I&#146;m not too sure I agree with that.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, yeah, right, y&#146;know what? Yeah, you&#146;re right, I mean, we
no, we have our fun. Yeah! But if (Grunts uncomprehensively)&#133;&#133;I mean, I mean
like <b>craaaazy</b>! Y&#146;know? Okay, all right. This is gonna, this is gonna sound
y&#146;know, a little umm, hasty, but uh, just go with it. Umm. Ugh. What if we got
married?</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> What?! (Gunther is listening in.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, I know, I know, it&#146;s-it&#146;s so, it&#146;s so totally like,
&quot;Whoa! Can we do this?&quot; Y&#146;know, I mean, but I mean it just feels right!
Don&#146;t you think? It does! I mean, it just feels right, don&#146;t you think?</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> Wow! Uhh, Rachel uhh, you&#146;re a real special lady, but my divorce
isn&#146;t final yet and, and, and we&#146;ve been on four days, so I&#146;m thinking
&quot;No, but thanks.&quot;</p>

<p><b>Gunther:</b> <b>YOU IDIOT</b>!!!!!</p>

<p>[Scene: The Sleep Clinic, Joey is having trouble staying awake.]</p>

<p><b>Sleep Clinic Worker:</b> Your name, please?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Joey Tribbiani.</p>

<p><b>Sleep Clinic Worker:</b> Um-hmm, and did you stay up all night in preparation for
your sleep study. (Joey doesn&#146;t answer) Uh, sir? (Joey starts snoring)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (answering for him) Yes he did.</p>

<p><b>Sleep Clinic Worker:</b> Alll right, we&#146;ll call you in a few minutes.</p>

<p>(As she leaves, a beautiful woman enters and sits down across from the boys.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (waking Joey) Hey, check out that girl! She is really hot!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (sleepily) Yeah, she is. Wow! (Falls back asleep, loudly) How you
doin&#146;?</p>

<p>(Chandler wakes him up, again.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You&#146;re coming on to the entire room! (He goes over to pick up a
stack of magazines next to her, and to get her attention, he throws them back down.)
I&#146;m Chandler.</p>

<p><strong>Woman:</strong> I&#146;m Marjorie.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hi.</p>

<p><b>Marjorie:</b> Hi.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You mind if I&#133;</p>

<p><b>Marjorie:</b> No, please. </p>

<p>(He sits down next to her.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> So uh, what are you in for?</p>

<p><b>Marjorie:</b> I talk in my sleep.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What a coincidence, I listen in my sleep.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (asleep) So why don&#146;t you give me your number?</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Phoebe, still defying reality, are now <b>throwing</b>
a bouquet at each other, pretending to catch the <b>actual</b> bouquet at an <b>actual</b>
wedding.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay, ready?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay.</p>

<p>(She turns around and throws the bouquet to Phoebe.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (catching it) I got it! Mine! (They both hug)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Congratulations!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Thank you!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay! My turn! My turn!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay! (Gets into position) Okay, ready?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (cocking her head from side to side in some pre-bouquet-catching ritual)
Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay. (Phoebe turns and throws it on the couch.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (upset) That was a terrible throw!!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I&#146;m not gonna right to you! That&#146;s not real!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Look at me! My big concern is what&#146;s real?! (Finally realises) Oh
my God. We&#146;re really sad, aren&#146;t we?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, I think we are.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> This isn&#146;t even my dress.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, at least you didn&#146;t <b>rent</b> yours from a store called,
&quot;It&#146;s Not Too Late.&quot;</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I&#146;m changing out of this.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Me too.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> In like a half-hour?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Me too.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay, throw it straight this time.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay.</p>

<p>(She throws it straight, and Monica makes a big deal about catching it.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I&#146;m getting married next!!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yay!</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Monica and Phoebe, back to reality, are sitting in normal
clothes.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I <b>hate</b> my regular clothes now! Y&#146;know? I look down and-and I
know that this isn&#146;t gonna be the most special day of my life.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah. I mean it was kinda fun for a while, but didn&#146;t you start
feeling silly?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I guess.</p>

<p>(Monica crosses her legs and is still wearing the garter belt.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh my God! </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh God.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, you&#146;re such a cheater!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (entering) Hello! Little ones.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> So, is Joey gonna stop snoring?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yep! And! A beautiful woman agreed to go out with me. (They&#146;re
stunned.) Joey wanted to ask her out, but uh, she picked me.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, how&#146;d that happen?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Because I&#146;m cooler.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No, seriously.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well she&#146;s, she&#146;s the kinda girl&#151;Joey was unconscious. </p>

<p>(Joey enters, wearing a mouth guard like boxers wear.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (muffled by the mouth guard) Hey you guys! What&#146;s happening?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh my God!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What is that?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (muffled) Oh, they gave it to me at the sleep clinic, and it&#146;s gonna
help me not to snore.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well, are you asleep right now, Joe? &#145;Cause I don&#146;t think you
have to wear it unless you are!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (takes out the mouth guard) I know I don&#146;t have too! It tastes good.
(Puts it back in.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Plus, you look cool.</p>

<p>(Joey totally agrees with this statement and kicks his feet up.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is putting away the wedding dress, finally.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (entering from her bedroom) Well, I just called Joshua&#133;</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, how did it go?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, I did my best to convince him that I&#146;m not some crazy girl
who is dying to get married&#151;I&#146;m just going through a hard time.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What did he say?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well uh, his answering machine was <b>very</b> understanding. Ugh. I
feel blue.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Ohh, sweetie! (Goes to comfort her.) Hey, I bet you anything that
he&#146;s gonna call you again.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, maybe, but I don&#146;t think I even care. I don&#146;t think
he&#146;s the one I&#146;m sad about. Y&#146;know, I know that I said that I am totally
okay with Ross getting married, but as it turns out, I don&#146;t think I&#146;m handling
it all that well.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, maybe.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> And I-I am just trying to figure out why.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Any luck?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, yeah, y&#146;know how Ross and I were on again, off again, on
again, off again? I guess I just figured that somewhere down the road, we would be on
again.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Again. Y&#146;know what? I think we all did.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (entering) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey! (She jumps up and throws Emily&#146;s wedding dress into
Rachel&#146;s room.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> So, I got us some reservations for Sunday night, okay? How about,
Ernie&#146;s at 9 o&#146;clock?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, well, you uh, better make it for three.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, see I-I don&#146;t know if we&#146;re gonna be hungry at three.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Three people. Joshua&#146;s not gonna be there.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What happened?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Uh, well, I think, I think he broke up with me.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Noo. Why?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, apparently he scares easy.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, Rachel, I&#146;m-I&#146;m sorry.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> It&#146;s okay. Sometimes, things don&#146;t work out the way you&#146;d
thought they would.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Come here.</p>

<p>(They hug.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (breaking the hug) Oh, hey, don&#146;t you have to go pick up Emily?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah. </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You okay?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah! I got my girls.</p>

<p>(He leaves.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ugh. (She goes over and lays her head on Phoebe&#146;s lap.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (looks at Monica) Hey, y&#146;know what might cheer you up?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?</p>

<p>[Time lapse, all three girls are now wearing wedding dresses, eating popcorn, drinking
beer, and watching TV.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Y&#146;know, I gotta tell ya, this really does put in a better mood.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, I wish there was a job where I could wear this all the time. (Pause)
Maybe someday, there will be.</p>

<p>(There&#146;s a knock on the door.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh God! He&#146;s gonna come by and borrow some candles for his big
date!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, okay! (She goes to answer the door.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No-no, Rachel, don&#146;t get it! He can&#146;t see us!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, yeah! The groom cannot see the bride!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I&#146;m not gonna marry Chandler!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Not after this!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, you guys, just relax. (She goes over to open the door, and as she
does, she says.) I doooo. (Sees that it&#146;s Joshua, not Chandler that knocked on the
door.)</p>

<p><b>Joshua:</b> I gotta go.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, wait, Joshua! Joshua! (Pause) (Comes back inside) Yeah, well, that
oughta do it.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Closing Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler&#146;s bedroom, he is sleeping with Marjorie. All of the sudden,
Marjorie starts talking in her sleep, awakening Chandler. After a little bit, she quiets
back down, and Chandler tries to get back to sleep. There&#146;s a short pause until she
starts screaming, causing Chandler to scream with her. She quickly calms down. This all
wakes up Joey, who comes over wearing the mouth guard, opens the top half of
Chandler&#146;s door, and starts to complain about the noise.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (muffled by the mouth guard) Dude! I am <b>trying</b> to sleep! (Shrugs to
say, &quot;What&#146;s up with that?&quot;)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>End</strong></p>
</body>
</html>
421<html>

<head>
<title>The One With the Invitation</title>
<meta HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=windows-1252">
<meta NAME="GENERATOR" CONTENT="Microsoft FrontPage 3.0">
<meta NAME="Template" CONTENT="C:\Program Files\Microsoft Office\Templates\FRIENDS1.dot">
</head>

<body bgcolor="#FFFFFF" link="#008000">

<h1 align="center">The One With The Invitation</h1>

<hr>

<p>Written by: Seth Kirkland<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a><br>
With Help from:<a href="mailto:dpartrid@novell.com"> Darcy Partridge</a><br>
Episodes Orginally Transcribed by:<b> </b><a href="mailto:shadelet@easynet.co.uk">guineapig</a>,
Ruth Curran, <a href="mailto:mmatting@indiana.edu">Mindy Mattingly Phillips</a>, Josh
Hodge,&nbsp; <a href="mailto:dannys@pwa.acusd.edu">Dan Silverstein</a>, and <a
href="mailto:eaasen@plains.nodak.edu">Eric Aasen</a>.</p>

<hr>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Joey and Chandler are sitting and talking.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Y&#146;know what? It seems like all of the sudden; so much has
happened.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I know. <b>Ross</b> is getting married.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Phoebe is, making people.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Everybody&#146;s doing stuff!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> And we just sit here. I mean if I die the only way people would even
know I was here, would be by the ass print on this chair! Look, we have to do something.
Okay? Something huge!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (snaps his fingers) We could climb Mt. Everest!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No-no, not something stupid, something huge.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No-no-no-no-no, I saw an ad for this video, people climb that thing
everyday! We could totally do that!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Why not?! I mean it&#146;s just, it&#146;s just climbing! It&#146;s
just, it&#146;s just steep!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> We&#146;re going to Everest! Okay, it would be nice to leave an ass
print on Everest!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (entering) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What-what&#146;s up?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> We&#146;re gonna climb Mt. Everest!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah baby!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Really?! I looked into that. Yeah, but, I mean it costs like $60,000 and
y&#146;know you can die. And, you would die!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (dejected) Yeah, well&#133;</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> We could get that Everest video though.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, we could do that without y&#146;know risking our lives at all!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> And while we&#146;re down at the video store, you know what else we could
rent? <i>Die Hard</i>! (Chandler&#146;s excited.) Oh, y&#146;know what? I just remembered,
that Everest thing is only available through mail order.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (dejected) Oh, well&#133;</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> So you guys&#146;ll stay here and hang out with me?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeeeeahhhh.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah. Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> But I&#146;ll tell you something. One of these days we&#146;re get off
of our buts and rent <i>Die Hard</i> again!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah we are!</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Opening Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Ross&#146;s apartment, he and Emily are addressing their invitations.]</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> So what did he decide? Does your Uncle Nathan get an invite or not?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Ohh, God, nobody likes him, and he&#146;s so cheap, he&#146;d never fly to
London in a million years. Yeah, invite him? Hey, did I do these neat enough? (Hands her
some envelopes.)</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Yeah, they&#146;re fine.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah?</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> If anyone asks, we&#146;ll just say Ben addressed them. (Looking through
the envelopes.) Oh! So you invited Rachel then?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Sure. Why not?</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Really?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah?</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> I don&#146;t think I&#146;d be comfortable with any of my old lovers
there.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Wait-wait-wait, do you, do you think, maybe we shouldn&#146;t invite her?</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Oh, no-no, y&#146;know I absolutely adore Rachel it&#146;s just that,
well it might be a awkward for you. But it&#146;s absolutely your decision. (Gets up.)
More tea?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah sure.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Earl Grey?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Huh? Yeah, fine, invite whoever you want.</p>

<p>[And with that we start off on a series of clips from the entire history of Ross and
Rachel, from Ross&#146;s point of view. The first clip is from The Pilot.]</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Ross is complaining about Carol.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I don't want to be single, okay? I just... I just- I just wanna be married
again!</p>

<p>(A woman enters wearing a wet wedding dress and frantically starts to look around.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> And I just want a million dollars! (He extends his hand hopefully.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Rachel?!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh God Monica hi! I just went to your building and you weren't there and
then this guy with a big hammer said you might be here and you are, you are!</p>

<p>[cut to later]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay, everybody, this is Rachel, another Lincoln High survivor. (To
Rachel) This is everybody, this is Chandler, and Phoebe, and Joey, and- you remember my
brother Ross? </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hi, sure!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hi. </p>

<p>(They go to hug but Ross' umbrella opens.&nbsp; He sits, defeated again.)</p>

<p>[cut to later]</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross and Rachel are finishing up some cookies.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You know you probably didn't know this, but back in high school, I had a,
um, major crush on you.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I knew.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You did! Oh.... I always figured you just thought I was Monica's geeky
older brother.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I did.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh. Listen, do you think- and try not to let my intense vulnerability
become any kind of a factor here&#151;but do you think it would be okay if I asked you
out? Sometime? Maybe?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, maybe...</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay... okay, maybe I will...</p>

<p>[The next clip is from The One With The Blackout.]</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross and Rachel are talking about passion.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b>&nbsp; See, I see.... big passion in your future.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Really?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I do.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh Ross, you're so great. [she playfully rubs his head and gets up]</p>

<p>[Ross gets up, pleased with himself and starts to walk past Joey.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> It's never gonna happen.</p>

<p>[cut to later]</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's balcony, Ross is about to be attacked by Paulo's cat.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey, I have a question. Well, actually, it's not so much a question as..
more of a general wondering... ment.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay. Umm, for a while now, I've been wanting to, um....</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ohhh!!!! [looking at something behind Ross]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yes, yes, that's right...</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, look at the little cat! [a small kitten is on the roof behind Ross]
Look at it!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What? [the cat jumps on his shoulders] Ow!</p>

<p>[Cut to inside, Monica, Joey and Phoebe are singing while outside, Ross and Rachel are
trying to get the cat off of Ross' shoulder.]</p>

<p><strong>Monica, Joey, and Phoebe</strong>: [singing] <i>I'm on top of the world,
looking down on creation and the only explanation I can find...</i></p>

<p>[The next clip is from The One With The East German Laundry Detergent.]</p>

<p>[Scene: The Laundromat, Rachel is fighting with that old, annoying woman for a cart.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> All right, listen, missy. If you want this cart, you're gonna have to
take me with it! </p>

<p>(She thinks it over, and then walks away.)</p>

<p><strong>Rachel:</strong> (to Ross) Yes! Did you see that?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You were incredible! Brand new woman, ladies and gentlemen.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I could not have done this without you.</p>

<p>(Rachel stands up and kisses Ross. He is stunned. A moment of silence follows.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Ok, um, uh, more clothes in the dryer? (Ross turns and bangs his head on
an open dryer door.) I'm fine, I'm fine.</p>

<p>[The next clip is from The One Where Ross Finds Out]</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, I'm sure you've guessed, it's the famous fight scene between Ross
and Rachel.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You had no right to tell me you ever had feelings for me.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (hurt) What?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I was doing great with Julie before I found out about you.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hey, I was doin' great before I found out about you. You think it's easy
for me to see you with Julie?</p>

<p>[cut to later]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> The point is I... I don't need this right now, OK. It, it's too late, I'm
with somebody else, I'm happy. This ship has sailed.</p>

<p>[cut to later]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Alright, fine, you go ahead and you do that, alright Ross.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Fine.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> 'Cause I don't need your stupid ship.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Good.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Good. (Ross leaves)</p>

<p>[cut to later]</p>

<p>(Rachel slams the door and locks it. She sits down, visibly upset. She puts her head in
her hands and begins to cry. Ross comes back and is standing outside the window. When
Rachel regroups and gets back up to finish closing, she sees him.)</p>

<p>[cut to later]</p>

<p>(She opens the door and they kiss.)</p>

<p>[The next clip is the second famous fight in The One Where Ross and Rachel Take A
Break.]</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross and Rachel are arguing.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ross do you realise this is the first time in my life I&#146;m doing
something I actually care about. This is the first time in my life I&#146;m doing
something that I&#146;m actually good at. I mean. if you don&#146;t get that...</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, hey, I get that, okay, I get that big time. And I&#146;m happy for ya,
but I&#146;m tired of having a relationship with your answering machine! Okay, I
don&#146;t know what to do anymore.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well neither do I!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Is this about Mark?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (shocked) Oh my God.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, it&#146;s not, it&#146;s not.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh my God. I cannot keep having this same fight over and over again,
Ross, no, you&#146;re, you&#146;re, you&#146;re making this too hard.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh I&#146;m, I&#146;m making this too hard. Okay, what do you want me to
do.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I don&#146;t know, I don&#146;t know. Urrrgh! Look, maybe we should take
a break.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, okay, fine, you&#146;re right. Let&#146;s ah, let&#146;s take a
break, (goes to the door) let&#146;s cool off, okay, let&#146;s get some frozen yogart, or
something.. (opens the door)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No. (Ross is standing in the doorway.) A break from us.</p>

<p>(Ross looks at her, then leaves slamming the door behind him.)</p>

<p>[The next clip is from The One The Morning After]</p>

<p>[Scene: Ross's apartment, Ross is hurrying Chloe out the door.]</p>

<p><b>Chloe:</b> Do I know why we&#146;re rushing?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, y'know the ah, the girlfriend I told you about last night?
(He&#146;s frantically throwing the cushions off of the couch looking for her other shoe)
Well it turns out she ah, she wants to get back together with me. Oh, I found it!! </p>

<p><b>Chloe:</b> That&#146;s so great for you guys!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah! </p>

<p>[cut to later]</p>

<p><b>Chloe:</b> Good luck, with your girlfriend. </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, thank you. (She goes to kiss him, but he holds her coat up between
their faces to stop her.) Hey, hey. (opens the door, sees Rachel, and hides Chloe behind
the door) Rachel!!!!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hi. Ohhh, you got my message.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, oh hey, you are right on time.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> So what do you say? Can I be your girlfriend again?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yes, you can, very much.</p>

<p>(Chloe gives Ross the thumbs up while still standing behind the door.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (seeing the thumbs up) Ahhhh!! (Hugs Rachel tighter.)</p>

<p>[cut to later]</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel has just found out about Chloe and is screaming at
Ross.&nbsp; The rest of the gang is trapped in Monica's bedroom.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No!!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Just get out! Now!!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No!! No!! I wanna stay. I wanna talk about this.</p>

<p>(Rachel picks up a newspaper and starts beating him with it.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What? Okay, okay, okay, okay.</p>

<p>[The next clip is from The One With The Jellyfish.]</p>

<p>[Scene: Rachel's bedroom, Rachel, entering selfish mode, is thanking Ross for wrongly
taking the entire blame of the breakup; as if she had absolutely nothing to do with it.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b>&nbsp; ...the way you owned up to everything, it just showed me how much

<p align="center"><strong>Commercial Break</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Joey, Monica, and Phoebe are opening their invitations.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Ohh, this is soo amazing! I can&#146;t believe my brother&#146;s getting

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (sarcastic) Noo.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I never knew that either.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I knew that! (They all look at him) I sooo didn&#146;t know that, but you
should see your faces.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (entering) Hey guys! What&#146;s up?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Heyyy. (They all try and hide their invitations.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> We&#146;re hanging out.</p>

<p>(Rachel starts going through her mail, and come across her invitation.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What&#146;s this? Is this Ross&#146;s wedding invitation?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> See, maybe that&#146;s the one we should&#146;ve actually hidden.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, no! No you guys! Come on, you don&#146;t have to do that! I&#146;m
happy for him! I am! I really&#151;I&#146;m-I&#146;m happ&#151;I&#146;ll work on it.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I&#146;m sorry honey.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Rach, you&#146;re gonna come though aren&#146;t you?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, honey, I don&#146;t know. I&#133;</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> This isn&#146;t one of those uh, y&#146;know &quot;If she doesn&#146;t
come, we-we don&#146;t, we don&#146;t come?&quot; Right? Because I already bought my
ticket&#133;</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You know what would be real weird? Is if you weren&#146;t there. Just
say you&#146;ll think about it, okay?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No, I&#146;ll think about it. Yeah.</p>

<p>[And with that, we go into another set of clips, this time from Rachel&#146;s point of
view.]</p>

<p>[The first clip is from The One Where Rachel Finds Out.]</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, it's Rachel birthday party and Chandler is about to spill
the beans.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Who's this from?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, that's Ross's. </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh... (opens it and sees it is a pin) Oh my God. He remembered.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Remembered what?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> It was like months ago. We were walking by this antique store, and I saw
this pin in the window, and I told him that it was just like one my grandmother had when I

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, it's so pretty. This must have cost him a fortune.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I can't believe he did this.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Come on, Ross? Remember back in college, when he fell in love with

Rachel.)</p>

<p>[The next clip is from The One Where Ross Finds Out.]</p>

<p>[Scene, A Restaurant, Rachel is on her date, drunk, and is leaving that answering
machine message.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (on phone) Ross, hi, it's Rachel. I'm just calling to say that um,

<p><b>Ross:</b> Rach, I got a message from you.</p>

<p>(Rachel comes out of her room, suddenly she remembers leaving the message.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh my God. Oh my God Ross, no, hang up the phone, give me the phone

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ohhhhhhhh God. (climbs off his back)</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Rachel is deciding on whether or not to go to the wedding.]</p>

<p>[cut to another clip, this one is from The One With The Prom Video]</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the gang is watching the Prom Video and Rachel is about to
make her entrance on the video.&nbsp; The italics are portions of the prom video.]</p>

<p><i><strong>Mrs. Geller:</strong> Rachel's coming up the path.&nbsp; Doesn't she look
pretty. Jack... (Rachel enters with a huge nose)</i></p>

<p><a name="line22"></a><b>Rachel:</b> Oh my God.</p>

<p><strong>All:</strong> Oh yeah we do. C'mon.</p>

<p><i><strong>Mrs. Geller:</strong> Get a shot of Monica. Where's Monica.</p>

<p><i><strong>Monica:</strong> Oh, dad, turn it off.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Lookin' good Mr. Cotter.</p>
