<p><i><strong>Rachel:</strong> I can't go to my own prom without a date, I can't, it's too
late.</p>

<p><strong>Monica:</strong> If you're not going then I don't want to go either.</i></p>

<p><i><strong>Mrs. Geller:</strong> (to Ross on the stairs) I have a wonderful idea. You
should take Rachel to the prom.</i></p>

<p>[cut to later]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Y'know what?&nbsp; I think we've seen enough, let's turn it off.</p>

<p><strong>All:</strong> No, no, no.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> OK, fine, well I'm not gonna watch, alright.</p>

<p><i><strong>Mr. Geller:</strong> C'mon kid, let's go.</p>

<p><strong>Mrs. Geller:</strong> Ahh, are you hadsome.</p>

<p><strong>Mr. Geller:</strong> Let's show 'em.</p>

<p><strong>Ross:</strong> (walks down the stairs and grabs the flowers out of the vase on
the endtable) Okay dad.</p>

<p><strong>Mr. Geller:</strong> (going downstairs) Rachel, ready or not, here comes your
knight in shining&#151;Oh no. (Chip has shown up and the four are leaving.)</p>

<p><strong>Rachel, Monica, Roy, and Chip:</strong> Bye.</p>

<p><strong>Mrs. Geller:</strong> Oh, dear. Jack, how do I turn this off?</p>

<p></i><b>Monica:</b> (to Ross) I can't believe you did that.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, well.</p>

<p>[Rachel, seeing what he did for her, gets up, walks across the room, and kisses Ross]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> See, he's her lobster.</p>

<p>[Cut back to the present, Rachel has made her decision.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (seeing the decision) Nooooo. You&#146;re really not going?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah. It&#146;s just gonna be too hard. Y&#146;know? I mean, it&#146;s
Ross. How can I watch him get married? Y&#146;know it&#146;s just, it&#146;s for the best,
y&#146;know it is, it&#146;s&#133; Y&#146;know, plus, somebody&#146;s got to stay here
with Phoebe! Y&#146;know she&#146;s gonna be pretty big by then, and she needs someone to
help her tie her shoes; drive her to the hospital in case she goes into labour.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You don&#146;t have a car. And your license expired. </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I know. (Starts to cry) Yeah, see, there&#146;s so much to do and I have
so little time to do it in.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Closing Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Chandler, Joey, and Phoebe are reading a book about things to do
whilst in London.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All right, check it out. Check this out. It says here that
there&#146;s a place you can go to rent videos of all the museums! (Reading from the
book.) &quot;It&#146;s almost as good as being there.&quot;</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> It&#146;s better! You can&#146;t go to a museum in your underwear!</p>

<p align="left"><strong>Chandler: </strong>Well, You could, but... probably just the one
time.</p>

<p><strong>Joey: </strong>I bet we could get videos of all the sites, get a VCR in our
hotel room... we'd never even have to go outside!</p>

<p><strong>Chandler: </strong>If we do that, we gotta get Die Hard.</p>

<p><strong>Joey:</strong> Oh-ho! I bet the British version is gooooood!</p>

<p align="center"><strong>End</strong></p>
</body>
</html>
422<html>

<head>
<title>The One With The Worst Best Man Ever</title>
<meta HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=windows-1252">
<meta NAME="GENERATOR" CONTENT="Microsoft FrontPage 3.0">
<meta NAME="Template" CONTENT="C:\Program Files\Microsoft Office\Templates\FRIENDS1.dot">
</head>

<body bgcolor="#FFFFFF" link="#008000">

<h1 align="center">The One With The Worst Best Man Ever</h1>

<hr>

<p>Teleplay by: Michael Curtis<br>
Story by: Seth Kurland<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a></p>

<hr>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, the gang is there, Phoebe is returning from the bathroom.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (angrily) That&#146;s like the tenth time I&#146;ve peed since I&#146;ve
been here!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> That&#146;s also like the tenth time you told us.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, oh I&#146;m sorry, it must be really hard to hear! I tell ya,
it&#146;s a lot easier having three babies play Bringing in the Noise, Bringing in da Funk
on your bladder! I&#146;m so sick of being pregnant! The only happiness I get is from a
cup of coffee, which of course is decaf, &#145;cause&#151;Oh! I&#146;m pregnant!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Pheebs, did&#133;you want a cookie?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (starting to cry) Thank you so much.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> So uh, Pheebs, honey, how are those mood swings coming?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I haven&#146;t really had any yet.</p>

<p>(Monica, Joey, and Chandler all shake their heads.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Opening Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey and Chandler are there as Ross enters.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey guys!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> All right, here&#146;s the ring. (Shows Chandler the wedding ring he plans
on giving Emily) </p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (shocked) Yes! Yes! A thousand times, yes!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> So uh, any ideas for the bachelor party yet?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Whoa-whoa-whoa! Before you start handing out wedding rings and planning
bachelor parties, don&#146;t you have to decide who your best man is gonna be?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, it&#146;s awkward. It&#146;s awkward. It&#146;s awkward.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I sort&#146;ve already asked Chandler.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What?! He got to do it at your first wedding!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Joey, I figured you&#146;d understand. I mean, I-I&#146;ve known him a lot
longer.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Come on Ross! Look, I-I don&#146;t have any brothers; I&#146;ll never get
to be a best man!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You can be the best man when I get married.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (pause) I&#146;ll never get to be a best man!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (to Chandler) Wait-wait, so, you get to be my best man twice and I never
get to be yours at all?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh no-no-no, you&#151;yeah, of course you get to be my best man.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (impatiently tapping Chandler on the shoulder) What about me?! You-you
just said I could!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I&#146;m not even getting married! Okay, this is a question for
science fiction writers!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I can&#146;t believe you&#146;re not picking me.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey, how can it <b>not</b> be me?!HeyHey!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I&#146;m not even&#133; I&#146;m not even&#133;</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Fine, y&#146;know what, that&#146;s it. From now on, Joey, I want you to
be my best man.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yes! (to Chandler) Shame about you man.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica, Rachel, and Phoebe are eating breakfast.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (to her babies) Stop it!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> One of the babies is kicking.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I thought that was a good thing.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> It&#146;s not kicking me, it&#146;s kicking one of the other babies. Oh
(looks down her dress)! Don&#146;t make me come in there!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (entering) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Do you guys have like a big bowl I can borrow?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah, there&#146;s one right under the cabinet. </p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (grabs it) Thanks.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Why do you need it?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, we&#146;re having a big party tomorrow night. Later! (Starts for the
door.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Whoa! Hey-hey, you planning on inviting us?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Nooo, later. (Walks out the door.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey!! Get your ass back here, Tribbiani!! (Joey walks back in, scared.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hormones!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What Phoebe meant to say was umm, how come you&#146;re having a party
and we&#146;re not invited?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, it&#146;s Ross&#146;s bachelor party.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Sooo?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Are you bachelors?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Nooo!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Are you strippers?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Nooo!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Then you&#146;re not invited. (Starts for the door again.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> All right fine! You&#146;re not invited to the party we&#146;re gonna
have either.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh-whoa, what party?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well umm&#133;</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> The baby shower for Phoebe!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Baby shower. Wow! That sounds sooo like something I don&#146;t want to do!
Later! (Finally, he makes his exit.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I can&#146;t believe I&#146;m gonna have a party! This is so great!
(Really excited) A party! (Really, really excited) Yay!! (Suddenly, she starts crying and
Rachel moves to comfort her.) I don&#146;t know why.</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Joey and Ross are talking over party plans.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> This is what I&#146;ve got going for the party so far, liquor wise. Get a
lot of liquor.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Great. Great.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay, now uh, in terms of the invite list, I&#146;ve got you, me, and
Chandler and I&#146;m gonna invite Gunther &#145;cause, well, we&#146;ve been talking
about this pretty loud.</p>

<p><b>Gunther:</b> I&#146;ll be there.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> All right&#151;oh! Listen, I know this is your party, but I&#146;d really
like to the number of museum geeks that are gonna be there.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah. Tell ya what, let&#146;s not invite any of the anthropologists, only
the dinosaur dudes!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay! We&#146;ll need a six-pack of <i>Zima</i>.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (entering) Hey guys, what are you doing?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, just planning my bachelor party with my best man.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, well, good luck trying to top the last one.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, see, I don&#146;t think it&#146;s gonna that difficult considering
this one <b>won&#146;t</b> be taking place in the basement of a <i>Pizza Hut</i>.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, I&#146;m Ross. I&#146;m Ross. I&#146;m too good for the Hut;
I&#146;m too good for the Hut.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Look, I gotta go pick up Ben. Everything so far sounds great Joey, just
remember to keep it on the mellow side, okay? Just a couple of guys hanging out playing
poker, no-no strippers or anything okay?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> You got it.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, see ya later.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> See ya. (Ross exits, and Chandler moves over next to Joey, laughing.)
Have fun planning your mellow bachelor party.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, there&#146;s gonna be strippers there. He didn&#146;t say anything
about no strippers.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> He just said, &quot;No strippers.&quot;</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, I chose not to hear that.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is returning from shopping and Rachel is there.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Look what I got! Look what I got! Look what I got! (She shows Rachel
what she bought. She bought a little leather jacket and a little cowboy outfit for the
babies.) Can you believe they make these for little people?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Little village people.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay, look at this one. This is my favourite. (It&#146;s a little pink
and white dress for the girl baby.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, that is so sweet!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I know! Phoebe is gonna love dressing them in these!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Huh. Except, Phoebe&#146;s not gonna be the one that gets to dress them.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Because she&#146;s not gonna get to keep the babies.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh my God! We are throwing the most depressing baby shower ever!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Wait a minute! Unless, we give her all gifts she can use after
she&#146;s done being pregnant. Like-like umm, regular coffee, Tequila.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, and somebody can get those leather pants she&#146;s always wanted!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, she&#146;s gonna love that!</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe&#146;s baby shower, she is holding those leather
pants, and isn&#146;t happy about it.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What the hell is this?! What, did you actually thought it would make me
feel better to give me stuff that I can&#146;t use for another two months?! This sucks!
All right, what&#146;s my next present?!</p>
<b>

<p>All:</b> I don&#146;t have anything. (All of the rest of the women there hide their
gifts behind their backs.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Ross&#146;s bachelor party. Ross is thanking Joey for the
party.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey listen man, about the stripper&#133;</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Good call!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (banging a spoon against his beer bottle) Okay, a little announcement,
a little announcement. I&#146;ve decided that my best man is, my best friend Gunther!</p>

<p><b>Gunther:</b> What&#146;s my last name?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Central Perk?</p>

<p><b>Gunther:</b> (to Ross) Thanks for not marrying Rachel. (He starts to leave.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh-whoa-wait, Gunther don&#146;t-don&#146;t forget your shirt. (He gives
Gunther his shirt and Gunther leaves.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey-hey, what are those?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, little party favours, check it out! (It&#146;s a shirt that reads,
&quot;Ross Geller, Bachelor Bash 1998&quot;)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Wow! Yeah!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh-oh! (Shows him what&#146;s on the back, &quot;Best Man Joey Tribbiani,
with a huge picture of him.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (banging on the bottle again) Okay, okay, a little announcement, I
just want everyone to know that the position of my best man is still open! And uh, (to the
stripper) so is the position of the bride.</p>

<p><b>The Stripper:</b> Great!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Smooth man. Yeah, you got some chilie on your neck. (Chandler checks and
runs into the bathroom.) Well, I just want to say, thanks everyone, this-this was great.
And hey! See you guys Monday morning. (They museum geeks wave at him.) Thanks Joey.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, hey, don&#146;t forget your shirt.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, thanks! (Takes it and throws it back into the box and leaves.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay, hey, museum geeks, party&#146;s over. Okay. Wave bye-bye to the nice
lady. There you go. Back to your parent&#146;s basement. All right. (The museum geeks exit
and Joey unlocks his door and lets the chick and the duck out.) Come on boys, come on out!
Here you go. All right.</p>

<p><b>The Stripper:</b> Ohhh, look at the little birdies! Are those yours?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah!</p>

<p><b>The Stripper:</b> Wow, I didn&#146;t know they let you keep chickens and ducks as
pets.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh yeah-yeah. And I got the duck totally trained. Watch this. Stare at the
wall. (The duck complies.) Hardly move. (The duck complies.) Be white. (The duck
complies.)</p>

<p><b>The Stripper:</b> You are really good at that. So uh, I had fun tonight, you throw
one hell of a party.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh thanks. Thanks. It was great meetin&#146; ya. And listen if any of my
friends gets married, or have a birthday, or a Tuesday&#133;</p>

<p><b>The Stripper:</b> Yeah, that would be great. So I guess umm, good night.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh unless you uh, you wanna hang around.</p>

<p><b>The Stripper:</b> Yeah?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah. I&#146;ll let you play with my duck.</p>

<p>[Scene: Joey&#146;s bedroom, it&#146;s the middle of the night, he&#146;s waking up and
discovers he&#146;s alone in bed.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey, (realises he doesn&#146;t know her name.) stripper! (He notices that
the ring box is open, so he picks it up, sees it&#146;s empty and starts to panic.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Commercial Break</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, it&#146;s continued from earlier. Joey is now waking
Chandler and telling him the news.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (running and banging on Chandler&#146;s door) The stripper stole the
ring!! The stripper stole the ring!! Chandler! Chandler, get up! Get up! The stripper
stole the ring!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (opening the door) What?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> The ring is gone!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Ugh. Just a sec, give me a minute to wake up for this&#151;Ah-ha-ha!!
You lost the ring! You&#146;re the worst best man ever!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Dude, this isn&#146;t funny! What am I gonna do?! I go to bed last night,
everything&#146;s cool! I wake up this morning, the stripper&#146;s gone and the ring is
gone!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You slept with the stripper?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Of course!! (Shrugs.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe is entering, Monica and Rachel are talking on the couch.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hi, guys.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hi! Phoebe. (Both Monica and her try to move out of Phoebe&#146;s way.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hi Phoebe.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I-I wanted to apologise if I&#151;y&#146;know seemed a tad edgy
yesterday at my shower. Y&#146;know it&#146;s just the hormones, y&#146;know.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No we&#133;</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hormones.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> &#133;hormones, yeah.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Anyway, I just wanted to say thank you, it was just, it was so sweet.
(She goes to hug them and they both flinch, thinking that Phoebe is about to attack them.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Wow, you seem to be doing so much better. That&#146;s great. So how-how
are things going?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Good. Y&#146;know&#151;no-no, okay, it&#146;s-it feels like
everything&#146;s been about me lately, so what&#146;s happening with you?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, well, actually we were just talking about me not going to
Ross&#146;s wedding.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> It just might be too hard, given the history and all that&#133;</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Wow! This reminds me of the time when I was umm, living on the street
and this guy offered to buy me food if I slept with him.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, h-how is this like that?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, let&#146;s see, it&#146;s not. Really, like that. Because, you see
<b>that</b> was an actual problem, and uh, yours is just like y&#146;know a bunch of
y&#146;know high school crap that nobody really gives y&#146;know&#133;</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (starting to cry) I&#146;m-I&#146;m sorry, I just thought that&#133;</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Alrighty, here come the water works. (Rachel starts crying harder.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is trying to figure out what to do.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ugh! I don&#146;t know what I&#146;m going to do! I called the company
that sent and th-they don&#146;t care! Then I called 9-1-1 and they laughed at me, if this
isn&#146;t an emergency, then what is?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (entering) Hey guys!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey&#133;</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I just wanted to thank you again for last night, what a great party! And
the guys from work had a blast. Y&#146;know, one of them had never been to a bachelor
party before. Yeah! And-and another one had never been to a party before, so&#133;</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> So uh, hey, that uh, that wedding ring, huh? Man, that&#146;s nice!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, right!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I was uh, I was thinking I might want to pick one of those babies up for
myself, I might want to get one of those&#133;</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> That ring? When my grandmother first came to this country, that ring and
the clothes on her back were all she had with her.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> So you might say, the ring is irreplaceable? (Gives Joey a little
squeeze.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh absolutely! It has been in my family for generations, and every bride
who has worn it has had a long and happy life.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> So you might say, it&#146;s a magic ring.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (laughs, softly) Yeah, the stripper stole it.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> My-my ring? My-my wedding ring? The-the stripper stole my wedding ring?!
H-how?! How could this all happen?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, I think it all started when you said, &quot;Hey Joey, why
don&#146;t you be my best man.&quot;</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (dialling the phone) All right-all right, fine! I-I&#146;m gonna call the
cops!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Dude, I screwed up, you don&#146;t have to turn me in!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Not on you! On the stripper!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, yeah, well I already did that! They said they&#146;re gonna look into
it right after they solved all the murders.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, well, we&#146;ll call the company that sent her!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I did that too! They wouldn&#146;t give me her real name or her number.
They said, &quot;If I bothered them again they&#146;d call the police.&quot; I said,
&quot;If you talk to the police, you tell them I&#146;m missing a ring!&quot;</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> So what, Joey? Wh-wh-what? What are you telling me? That there&#146;s
nothing we can do? Well, how could this happen?!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Look Ross, I am so-so sorry. I-I-I&#133;</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, what if we just ah, called her, used a fake name, and had her
come to my office?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, that sounds like fun, but we&#146;ve got a ring to find!!</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Rachel are cautiously serving Phoebe some tea.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Here&#146;s your tea Phoebe. (They give it to her and quickly take a
step back.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (sips it) It&#146;s so good. (Monica and Rachel breath a sigh of
relief.) Oh, thanks.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Good.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I&#146;m so glad you liked it.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (sets the cup down) Oh! (Grabs her stomach in pain.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?! She made the tea! (Points to Monica.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh! No, I-I think I just had a contraction.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You what?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh my God!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, I thought I had one a couple of minutes ago, and now I know that
was <b>definitely</b> one.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Wait, you can&#146;t have the baby here! I mean I haven&#146;t
sterilised it since the guys moved out!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay. It&#146;s okay. We&#146;re gonna be okay. Y&#146;know what?
It&#146;s okay. I&#146;m gonna, I&#146;m gonna, I&#146;m gonna boil some water and just
rip up some sheets!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No. It&#146;s all right; it&#146;s probably false labour. They said
that, that can happen near the end, just somebody get the book.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Rachel, get the book! The book!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay! (Runs and grabs a book and hands it to Monica.) Okay! Here!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> The Bible?!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I don&#146;t know!</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler&#146;s office, the guys are there waiting to ambush the stripper.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> All right, okay, this is great, uh, Chandler, you get behind the desk.
And-and when she comes in hopefully, she won&#146;t recognise you because, well, why would
she? Uh, okay, and then you buzz Ross and I. (to Ross) You be Mr. Gonzalez, and I&#146;ll
be uh, Mr. Wong.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Diverse.</p>

<p>(There&#146;s a knock on the door.)</p>

<p><b>The Stripper:</b> Did anybody call for security?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (to Ross) You be cool. (He opens the door and lets her in as they all
turn there backs on her.)</p>

<p><b>The Stripper:</b> Okay, which one of you guys is Gunther Central-Perk? (Sees Joey.)
Hey, Joey?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Where&#146;s my ring? My dead grandmother&#146;s wedding ring? Where is
it? Where is it?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Way to be cool, man.</p>

<p><b>The Stripper:</b> What&#146;s he talking about?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> There was a ring, in a box, on my nightstand, after you left, it was gone!</p>

<p><b>The Stripper:</b> Wait, you guys think I stole some ring?</p>
<b>

<p>The Guys:</b> Yeah!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> We know you took so just-just save yourself the time and confess!</p>

<p><b>The Stripper:</b> Okay, who are you? The Hardy boys? Look, I don&#146;t need to
steal some stupid ring, all right? I make $1,600 a week doing what I do; any of you guys
make that?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Marry me. (Both Ross and Chandler hit him.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, the guys are now trying to figure out what next to do,
since their plan with the stripper backfired on them.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I don&#146;t get it! It was in my room all night! And if she didn&#146;t
take it, and I didn&#146;t take it; and you (Chandler) didn&#146;t take it, then who did?
(The duck quacks.) Shh! We&#146;re trying to think! (Ross and Chandler realise it at the
same moment and stare at Joey, who doesn&#146;t get it. After a short pause, with the duck
still quacking, Joey figures it out and starts pointing at the duck.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe is recovering from her false labour.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I still don&#146;t get how you know when it&#146;s false labour.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, do you <b>see</b> any babies?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> How do you feel?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, I guess. I mean&#133; I don&#146;t know, it&#146;s just, I guess I
know it&#146;s going to be over soon.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, isn&#146;t that a good thing? You said you were sick of this.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I know. It&#146;s just y&#146;know usually when you&#146;re, when
you&#146;re done with the pregnant thing, y&#146;know, then you get to do the mom thing.
I&#146;m gonna be y&#146;know, sitting around in my leather pants, drinking Tequila.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Some moms do that.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay that&#146;s even sadder. Look, I know, I know what I got myself
into, it&#146;s just that now that they&#146;re in me it&#146;s like, it&#146;s like I
know them y&#146;know, I mean-I mean, it&#146;s just not gonna be easy when these little
babies have to go away.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Aww, sweetie, but it&#146;s not like you&#146;re not gonna have
anything. You&#146;re gonna have nieces and nephews, and some ways that&#146;s even
better.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, okay.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No, really. Really, Pheebs, you&#146;re not gonna be the one worrying
about saving for college, or yelling at them when they&#146;re bad, y&#146;know, or
deciding to put them on Ritalin when they just won&#146;t calm down. Y&#146;know?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I mean, you&#146;re the one they&#146;re gonna come to when they wanna
run away from home, and the one they talk to about sex.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> And you just get to be cool Aunt Phoebe!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Cool Aunt Phoebe. I am pretty cool!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> And y&#146;know what else, oh my God, are they gonna love you.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> They are gonna love me.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Thanks you guys! Again.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, sweetie! (They all hug.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> You&#146;re the best. Thanks. Oh! </p>
<b>

<p>Monica and Rachel:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Just kidding. Ahh!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh my God!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Got cha again, you guys are so easy.</p>

<p>[Scene: The Animal Hospital, the guys have taken the duck in to remove the ring. Joey
is pacing around like an expectant father.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> If anything should happen to him&#133;</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Joey! The vet said it&#146;s a simple procedure.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> So! Things can go wrong! You don&#146;t know! What if he doesn&#146;t make
it?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> He will, Joe.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, but what if he doesn&#146;t? He&#146;s such a good duck.</p>

<p>(With that we go into a little flashback about the guys&#146; memories of the duck. The
first one is Joey playing with him in the bathtub and drying him off. Then it&#146;s
Chandler sitting on his couch after they moved into the girls apartment, and Chandler
reading to him in bed, and him watching <i>Baywatch</i> when all they had was the canoe
and the duck was in a bucket of water. Then we see Ross eating some cereal and the duck
watching him. He takes a lamp and moves the duck off of the table. Then it&#146;s Chandler
shooing them out of the bathroom in the girls&#146; apartment, Joey revealing their disco
cubby hole in the entertainment-center, then Chandler playing Hide-and-Go-Seek with them,
and it&#146;s concluded with various scenes with the duck flapping it&#146;s wings. And
the guys staring into the distance in remembrance of the duck.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I&#146;m so worried about him, y&#146;know?</p>

<p><b>The Doctor:</b> (coming in from surgery) Somebody lose a ring?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh my God! Thank you! Thank you so much! (He grabs the ring, kisses it,
and then does a double-take realising where it&#146;s been.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> H-h-h-how&#146;s the duck?</p>

<p><b>The Doctor:</b> He&#146;s doing just fine, he&#146;s resting now, but you can see
him in a little bit.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ohh, great! Oh hey, listen Ross, thanks for being so cool about this.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, that&#146;s all right.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No, it&#146;s not. I mean you-you made me your best man and I totally let
you down!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey, come on, it&#146;s not your fault.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, it is! You wouldn&#146;t have lost the ring, right? Y&#146;know
what, Ross you were right from the start, he (Chandler) should be your best man.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No, you should.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Now, don&#146;t argue with me&#133;</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey! Hey! Hey! <b>I</b> get to choose my best man, and I want both you
guys. </p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Really?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Really?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey, both you guys should be up there with me. I mean, you two are-are
my&#133; I mean, I&#146;m lucky to have just one good&#133; (They all start getting
emotional.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Thanks man.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (starting to cry) I gotta go check something over here. (He walks away so
that they can&#146;t see him cry.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What a baby.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Total wuss!</p>

<p>(They both turn and wipe their eyes.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Closing Credits</strong></p>

<p>[There was no closing scene, only a preview of the wedding.]</p>

<p align="center"><strong>End</strong></p>
</body>
</html>
423<html>

<head>
<title>The One With Ross's Wedding Parts I and II</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="#FFFFFF" link="#008000">

<h1 align="center">The One With Ross&#146;s Wedding Parts I and II</h1>

<hr>

<p>Part I Written by: Michael Borkow<br>
Part II Teleplay by: Shana Goldberg-Meehan &amp; Scott Silveri<br>
Part II Story by: Jill Condon &amp; Amy Toomin<br>
Part I Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a> <br>
Part II Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:webmaster@friendsplace.com">Aaron D. Miller</a></p>

<hr>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey and Chandler are getting ready for the flight to
London and Monica comes running in.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Guys, hurry up! The flight leaves in four hours! It could take time to
get a taxi! There could be traffic! The plane could leave early! When we get to London,
there could be a line at customs! Come on!! (She runs back to her apartment.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Six-hour trip to London. That&#146;s a lot of Monica.</p>

<p>[Cut to the girls&#146; apartment, Monica is putting things into her purse as Phoebe
and Rachel watch.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Passport, check! (As she puts away each item, she says check.) Camera,
check! Traveller&#146;s cheques, check! </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Who are you saying &quot;check&quot; too?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Myself. Y&#146;know for remembering to pack a thing. Yeah, you do a good
thing, you get a check! (pause) My mom does it, I never realized it was weird.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, my mom used to put her head in the oven. Well, actually, she only
did it the one time. But it was pretty weird.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (entering) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey! Are you ready yet?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yep! You got the tickets?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh! Got &#145;em right here, (Pats his coat pocket) check!</p>

<p>[Cut to the guys&#146; apartment.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> It&#146;s all London, baby! Here we go. (He takes a picture of a less than
enthused Chandler and starts towards the girls&#146; apartment.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You got your passport?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, in my third drawer on my dresser. You don&#146;t want to lose that.</p>

<p>(Chandler glares at him. At first Joey doesn&#146;t know why, it takes him a little bit
to figure it out.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ohh!! (Runs to his room.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> There it is.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Opening Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, continued from earlier, Monica is telling Phoebe where
everything is.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay, if you need the vacuum, it&#146;s in my closet on the left-hand
side. Ah, the garbage bags are next to the refrigerator&#133;</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, okay, but Rachel&#146;s gonna be here too, can&#146;t I just ask
her this stuff?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah, okay, give that a try!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (entering, with Joey) All right! Let&#146;s do it!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Woo-hoo!!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, cheerie-o! </p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> London baby!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, &#145;cause that&#146;s not gonna get annoying.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (louder) London baby!!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey, y&#146;know what? I was wrong.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, we&#146;re all here! I guess we should get going!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ohhh, I wanna come over there and give you a hug and wish you luck on
your wedding, but I don&#146;t&#151;can&#146;t get up.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, I&#146;ll-I&#146;ll come hug you.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Great! Yeah, could you bring me the newspaper?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah. (He does so and Phoebe hugs him.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, have a great wedding!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Thanks.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, hey, Chandler I wanna hug you too!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey! (Trots over)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, and great! You might as well bring me my book, it&#146;s on the
counter in your apartment.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh. (Goes and gets Phoebe&#146;s book as Rachel comes in from her
room.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (to Rachel) So, we&#146;re off.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Have fun!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Thanks! (They hug.) Ugh, I can&#146;t believe you&#146;re not gonna be
there!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, I know.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> So-so come! Why don&#146;t you come?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> To London! Come to London. Please? It&#146;ll mean so much to me.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, well, I gotta work, I&#146;m sorry.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Why-why can&#146;t you take a couple of days off?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Because, I can&#146;t! Ross, I told you, no. I can&#146;t.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> This is my wedding.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> All right, y&#146;know what? We really are late! Let&#146;s go!
Let&#146;s go! Let&#146;s go!!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Fine. You&#146;ll-you&#146;ll watch it on video when we get back.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (entering, with Phoebe&#146;s book.) Here you go Phoebe! Here you go
Phobo! Phewbedo! Phaybobo.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (laughs) Thank you.</p>

<p>(Chandler kneels down with his arms spread waiting for his hug.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Thank you. (She pats him on his head.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> All right, let&#146;s go! Bye, Pheebs!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Bye, Pheebs!</p>

<p>(They all start out, Rachel gives each one a kiss, and says &quot;bye.&quot; In the
hall, Joey says&#133;)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> London baby!! (And Rachel slowly closes the door, sadly.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, do you need a hug? You don&#146;t have to bring me anything!</p>

<p>(And with that, television history is made as, for the first time ever, an entire show
moves it&#146;s entire production to an entirely different country to make a single
episode. We get shots of Buckingham Palace, London Bridge, Big Ben, and the <i>London
Marriott</i> as Joey and Chandler exit.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Street in front of the <i>London Marriott</i>, Joey and Chandler exit. Joey is
carrying a video camera and is shooting Chandler.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Come on! Do something!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I am, I&#146;m ignoring you.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay, here! (Gives him the camera.) I wanna be the on camera guy. All
right, first stop, Westminster Abbey. (Joey folds out his &quot;pop-up&quot; map of
London. All of the major landmarks pop-up like in a pop-up book.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, what the hell is that?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> It&#146;s London, baby! All right, the hotel&#146;s here. (Points to the
map.) Wait. No, we wanna go&#133; No. I know. (Sets the map down.) I&#146;m gonna have to
go into the map. (So Joey literally steps into the map.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, if you see a little version of me in there? Kill it!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I got it! (Picks up the map and starts walking.) Here we go.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay. Listen-listen, we&#146;re not gonna have to walk this way the
entire time are we?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Shhh! (Pause) Man, you made me lose it! (He goes into the map again.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Another street, somewhere along the River Themes, Ross, Emily, and Monica are
walking to where they&#146;re gonna get married. Emily is relating the troubles with the
caterer.]</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> &#133;and that was all before 10 o&#146;clock. The caterer rang and said
it was going to be Chicken Kiev instead of Chicken Tarragon. And then the florist phoned
to say there aren&#146;t any tulips. Oh, and the chilliest has carpel-tunel syndrome.
We&#146;re not gonna be&#133;</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Whoa-whoa-whoa! Emily, (Gives her the time-out signal.) honey, okay?</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Well, up yours too!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What?! No! No! That&#146;s-that&#146;s time-out!</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Sorry.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Sweetie, you gotta relax. Everything&#146;s gonna be great, okay? Come on.
Come on.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Chicken Kiev?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Um-hmm! Doesn&#146;t that sound delicious at the last minute?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah, y&#146;know, but something like salmon which would be so much more
elegant than the chicken. And, you wouldn&#146;t have to worry about the salmonella. (Ross
pushes her.) So, I can&#146;t wait to see this place you&#146;re getting married!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah. Yeah. Yes, this place is beautiful. Emily&#146;s parents got married
here.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> I still can&#146;t believe they&#146;re tearing it down. It really is the
most lovely building you&#146;ll ever see. I mean it&#146;s over&#133; (She stops
suddenly, when she sees that demolition has already started.) Oh my God!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> It&#146;s nice.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Oh. Oh. (She starts running towards the building.)</p>

<p>[Cut to inside.]</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> (running in, with Ross) Oh. Oh my God. How can this be happening? What
are we going to do?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> It&#146;s all right! Everything&#146;s gonna be all right.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> How&#146;s it gonna be all right?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Uh-huh, I see that.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (entering) Okay, I talked to the guy with the shovel and I found out
what happened. </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What? What?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> They torn it down a few days early.</p>

<p>[Scene: Westminster Abbey, Joey and Chandler have successfully navigated the streets of
London and are approaching the Abbey.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> All right! Westminster Abbey! Hands down, best Abbey I&#146;ve ever seen.
Hey! (Pushes Chandler in front of the camera.) Okay. What do you think of the Abbey,
Chandler?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I think it&#146;s great. It&#146;s great. Y&#146;know, they&#146;re
thinking of changing the name of this place.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Really? To what?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> To Put the Camera Away!!!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Man, <b>you</b> are Westminster Crabby. (He starts chasing Chandler
towards the Abbey.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe is trying to move off of the couch as Rachel
enters.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh. Oh.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, honey! Don&#146;t get up! What do you need?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, no. Oh, nothing.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Come on! I am here to take care of you! What do you need? Anything.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, I have a wedgie.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, that is all you.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> So-so, what do you want for lunch?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, I don&#146;t know. I guess we <b>have</b> to eat.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, I do. What&#146;s the matter?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I&#146;m just bummed about the way I left things with Ross. I
shouldn&#146;t have lied to him about having to work. He seemed so mad at me.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Eh, don&#146;t be so hard on yourself. If someone I was still in love
with was getting married&#133;</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (interrupting) Still in love with?! </p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I&#146;m not in love with Ross!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh. No. No. Good! Yeah, me neither.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Phoebe, I&#146;m going to Ross&#146;s wedding because he is my
ex-boyfriend and that would be <b>really</b> uncomfortable. Not because, I&#146;m still in
love with him! I mean, hey, y&#146;know, I like Ross as much as the next guy, y&#146;know?
<b>Clearly</b> I have feelings for him, but feelings don&#146;t mean love! I mean, I still
have loving feelings for Ross. Yeah! But, I have, I have continuing feelings of love, but
that doesn&#146;t mean that-that I&#146;m still in love with him. Y&#146;know? I-I have
sexual feelings for him, but I <b>do</b> love him&#151;Ohh! Oh my God! Oh my&#151;why
didn&#146;t you tell me?!!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> We thought you knew!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> We?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, we all know! We talk about it all the time!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You all know? Does Ross know?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh no, Ross doesn&#146;t know anything.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, I can not believe you didn&#146;t tell me!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, because we thought you knew!! It&#146;s so obvious! God, that
would be like telling Monica, &quot;Hey, you like things clean.&quot;</p>

<p>[Scene: A park in London, Joey and Chandler walk up to a souvenir stand.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>The Vendor:</b> So, what are you guys in the market for? We&#146;ve got uh, scarves,
tulip post cards...</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Check this out? Huh? (Joey has this big tall hat with a British flag on
the front of it.) Yeah. That&#146;s the stuff. What do you think?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, I don&#146;t have to buy that, &quot;I&#146;m with stupid&quot;
T-shirt anymore.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, I like it. Here you go. (He pays for the hat.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All right, look, you&#146;re not really gonna buy that are you?
Don&#146;t you think you&#146;ve embarrassed me enough for one day?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, I embarrass you? </p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> How can I answer that when I&#146;m pretending I don&#146;t know you?</p>

<p><b>The Vendor:</b> He&#146;s just jealous. You&#146;ll fit right in; all Londoners wear
them!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh really? Then how come no one here is wearing them?</p>

<p><b>The Vendor:</b> (looks around) They&#146;re all tourists.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All right, look, if you insist on wearing that, in public,
y&#146;know, you&#146;re gonna spend the rest of the afternoon all by yourself.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh yeah? (Puts the hat on.) If you&#146;re gonna make me choose between
you and the hat? I choose the hat.</p>

<p><b>The Vendor:</b> Good choice.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Thanks.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, wait. All right, that&#146;s it, okay, I&#146;m out of here. I
am not going to be embarrassed anymore! (He trips over a box, falls into a flower stand
and walks away trying to be cool.)</p>

<p>[Scene: The hotel, Ross&#146;s room, Emily is entering.]</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Hello?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey! I just spoke to your dad, and you know what? He seems to think
we&#146;ll be able to find a new place for the wedding.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> We don&#146;t have to.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Whoa-whoa-what? You found a place?</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> No. But, Monica and I were talking, and-and I was so upset about the hall
being knocked down, and she suggested that we put the wedding off for a bit.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> She said what?</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> She said, &quot;If I&#146;m not gonna be happy getting married somewhere
that we find in a day, well then we should just postpone it.&quot;</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Postpone it? Emily, do you think Monica realises how much our parents
spent on this wedding? Do you my sister&#146;s teeny-tiny little brain comprehends that
people took time out of their lives to fly thousands of miles to be here, huh? (He puts
his pants on backwards.) This isn&#146;t right.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> I realize that people are going to be disappointed. But, I&#146;m sure
they&#146;ll come back when we can do it right.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I can&#146;t ask people to do that? Would you ask people to do that?
(Holds out his pants)</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Don&#146;t you point your pants at me! (She throws them on the floor.) We
have no choice! Anywhere that&#146;s half-decent would&#146;ve be booked months ago, Ross
don&#146;t you understand? This is our wedding I&#146;m talking about.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> The only thing I understand is; postponing it is not an option. This is
when we&#146;re getting married.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> So what are you saying? It&#146;s now or never?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No. I&#146;m saying it&#146;s now. (He starts putting on his pants,
backwards again.)</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Or?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> There&#146;s no &#145;or&#146; in mind. What is wrong with these pants?!!</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> It&#146;s not the pants. It&#146;s you that is backwards. And if, and if
you don&#146;t understand how important this is to me, well then, perhaps we
shouldn&#146;t get married at all! (She storms out.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (chasing her, trying to zip up his pants. His got them on right now.) No,
wait! Emily! No, wait, stop! Emily, please&#151;(He catches something important in the
zipper and howls like a little boy and falls to the floor.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Commercial Break</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe is on the couch as Rachel returns carrying a bunch
of shopping bags.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (depressed) Hi.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> So, did shopping make you feel any better about Ross?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Manhattan does not have enough stores.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, <b>I</b> think I can help you get over him.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You can?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah. I just need you to bring me some photos of Ross.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Um-hmm.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> And a small piece of chocolate.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> And a glass of tepid water. (She gathers up all of these things.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ooh, is this one of those things where you throw it in a bag with some
graveyard dirt and hang it from a north-facing tree?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Uh, only if you have the hiccups too. Yeah, the pictures are for you,
the water and the chocolate is for me. I just didn&#146;t feel like getting up. Okay,
I&#146;m gonna show you a picture of Ross. Okay? And you&#146;re going to remember all of
the bad things about him. All right? Really focus on his flaws.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I can do that. I certainly did it when we were going out.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay. Umm, before we get started, I just wanna say for the record that I
love Ross, I think he&#146;s such a great guy. Here. (Hands her the picture, Rachel grabs
it out of her hand.) Okay, now, close your eyes. And imagine that you&#146;re with Ross
okay and imagine that you&#146;re kissing him. And you&#146;re-you&#146;re running your
hands all over his body. And then you run your hands through his hair, but eew-oh gross
it&#146;s some kind of grease, it&#146;s&#151;uck! Hah?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I don&#146;t know, his uh, his hair never really bothered me that much,
and y&#146;know it was always more crunchy than it was greasy.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, this is going to be harder than I thought. Umm, let&#146;s try
some uh, aversion therapy.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> All right.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> So uh, now look at the picture&#133;</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> All right, and umm&#133; (She grabs the picture and smacks her in the
head.) </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ow!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, how do you feel now?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, I like <b>you</b> less!</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey&#146;s hotel room. Chandler is watching TV as Joey returns,
still wearing his hat.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey. (He nods at the hat.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh. (Takes off the hat.) Sorry!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No-no-no, y&#146;know what? I really shouldn&#146;t have said that you
were embarrassing me, I mean that really wasn&#146;t cool. And if it makes you feel any
better, I&#146;ve had a really lousy day.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Me too.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Noo!! I&#146;ve had the best day ever! Dude, check this out!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (entering) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Sh-shh-shh! (He motions for her to watch something he has taped.)</p>

<p>[Cut to the tape Joey made in front of some famous place in London with a rather famous
English-type person.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (on tape) Okay, so say hi to my friend and tell him that you like the hat.
</p>

<p><b>Fergie:</b> (Yep, Sarah, the Duchess of York) Okay, so umm, what&#146;s your
friend&#146;s name?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (on tape) Oh, Chandler.</p>

<p><b>Fergie:</b> Hi Chandler! (Waves) </p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> That&#146;s&#133; That&#146;s was&#133;</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh my God!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> That&#146;s Fergie baby!!</p>

<p><b>Fergie:</b> Joey says you don&#146;t really like his hat, but I think it&#146;s
kinda dashing.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> How did you? How? How?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, I was trying to figure out how to get to Buckingham Palace, right?
So, I&#146;m in my map and-and&#133;(Ross enters) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hi. I understand you had a little talk with Emily.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (laughs) Yes, I did! And <b>you</b> are welcome!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Am I?! And was it <b>your</b> idea to postpone the wedding?!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Umm&#133;</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I&#146;m gonna go to the bathroom.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Wait up! (They both run to the bathroom.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey-hey, since you&#146;re the &#145;fix-it&#146; lady, here&#146;s a
pickle, what do you do when the bride says she doesn&#146;t want to have the wedding at
all?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> She said that?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Why?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I don&#146;t know, I told her it was stupid to put off the wedding just
because the hall was gone and she liked flipped out.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh my God. You&#146;re even dumber than <b>I</b> am!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Excuse me?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Ross, how long have you been planning this wedding?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I don&#146;t know. A month?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Emily has probably been planning it since she was five! Ever since the
first time she took a pillowcase and hung it off the back of her head. That&#146;s what we
did! We dreamed about the perfect wedding, and the perfect place, with the perfect
four-tiered wedding cake (Starting to cry), with the little people on top. (Ross gets
thrown a box of Kleenex from the bathroom and he gives her one.) Thanks. But the most
important part is that we had the perfect guy who understood just how important all that
other stuff was.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I had no idea. And that-that pillowcase thing, I thought you guys were
just doing the flying nun.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Sometimes we were.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Come on. You gotta help me figure out what to do. Okay?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Come on. (They leave and Chandler sticks his head out.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> That was pretty intense huh?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah. (Pause) Hey, I hope Ross didn&#146;t think that we just went in
there because we were uncomfortable being out here!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (glares at him) I hope he did!</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the phone rings and Phoebe answers it.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hello.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (on phone) Hey, Pheebs! It&#146;s Joey!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey, Joey! Hey! Ooh! Ooh! I just say someone on the&#151;that looks just
like you on the subway. And I was gonna go over and say &#145;hi!&#146; but then I

<p><b>Joey:</b> That just cost me four bucks. But uh listen, I just called to see how the

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ohh, they&#146;re having a <b>great</b> time with their Aunt Phoebe!
Aunt Rachel hasn&#146;t been helpful at all. So, do you miss me?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Kinda, but I&#146;ve just been having way too much fun.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> So you&#146;re not homesick yet?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No, I don&#146;t think so.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> All right, the seven of us miss you.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Who&#146;s seven?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Y&#146;know, me, Rachel, the birds, the babies&#133;</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ahh, the babies miss me?</p>

<p>(There is a knock on Rachel and Phoebe&#146;s door.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ooh, the pizza guy&#146;s here!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What? You ordered pizza without me?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah. But y&#146;know we were thinking about you, y&#146;know we ordered
the Joey Special.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Two pizzas?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yep! Okay, gotta go, talk to you later.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Wait, well, where did you get it from?! </p>

<p>(Phoebe has already hung up, leaving Joey in the dark. So Joey decides to watch some TV
and turns on a rerun of <i>Cheers</i>, with the theme song playing. At first, he&#146;s
happy, but as the song progresses Joey gets depressed and homesick.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Ross and Emily&#146;s planned wedding place, Monica is dragging Emily in.]</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Monica, why have you brought me here of all places?!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You&#146;ll see.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> I tell you, this wedding is not going to happen.</p>

<p>(At that Ross plugs in some Christmas lights to light the place up.)</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Oh God.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay? But-but imagine a lot more lights, okay? And-and y&#146;know fewer
bricks, and-and-and flowers, and candles&#133;</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> And the musicians, look, they can go over here (Points to a little
alcove), okay? And the chairs can face this way (Points), and&#133; (Points to Ross) You
go.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> But-but, if you don&#146;t love this, we&#146;ll do it in any other place
at any other time. Really, it&#146;s fine, whatever you want.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> It&#146;s perfect.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> And, I don&#146;t know, if it starts to rain&#133;</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Well then we&#146;ll get wet. (They kiss.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Ohh. And I don&#146;t even have a date.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is in her bedroom.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Pheebs?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Do you remember where the duck food is?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, it&#146;s in the guys&#146; apartment under the sink. Why?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (enters with a bag packed) Because I&#146;m going to London.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What?! What do you mean you&#146;re going to London?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, I have to tell Ross that I love him. Now honey, you take care, you
don&#146;t have those babies until I get back. (Kisses her stomach.) </p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I&#151;Rachel, you can&#146;t go! Ross loves Emily!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, I know, I know, I know he does. But I have to tell him how I feel!
He deserves to have all the information and then he can make an informed decision.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> That&#146;s not why you&#146;re going! You&#146;re going because you
hope he&#146;s gonna say, &quot;Yeah, I love you too, Rach. Forget that British
chippy.&quot;</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ohh&#151;Do you think he will?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No! Because he&#146;s in love with the British chippy! Look, Rachel, if
you go, you&#146;re just gonna mess with his head and ruin his wedding! Y&#146;know,
it&#146;s too late! You missed you&#146;re chance! I&#146;m sorry, I know this must be
really hard, it&#146;s over.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Y&#146;know what? No. It&#146;s not over until someone says, &quot;I
do.&quot; (Exits)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I do! I do! I do! (Chases her into the hall, but Rachel doesn&#146;t
stop.) I do! (Gives up.) Ugh, like I can really chase you. I&#146;m carrying a litter.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Commercial Break</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Moving Shot towards The Waltham House. A phone &nbsp; is ringing.]</p>
<b>

<p>Housekeeper: </b>The Waltham Residence.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe: </b>Oh...yes..is this..umm..Emily&#146;s Parents&#146; house.</p>

not how one addresses oneself on the telephone. First one identifies oneself and then asks

<p>Phoebe: </b>(In a British accent) This is Phoebe Buffay. I was wondering, please, if-if
it&#146;s not too much trouble, please, umm, might I speak to Miss Emily Waltham, please?</p>

<p><b>Housekeeper: </b>Miss Waltham, is at the rehearsal dinner and it&#146;s not polite

<p>[Scene: Rehearsal dinner hall. Ross and Emily are standing in the reception area.

<p>Monica: </b>Hey.</p>
<b>

<p>Mrs. Geller: </b>Sweetheart. Oh sorry were late, my fault, I insisted on riding the

<b>

<p>Mrs. Geller: </b>Jack, that&#146;s what they call the subway.</p>
<b>

<p>Mr. Geller: </b>Ohh, I thought that you....</p>

<p>Ross and Monica: </b>Dad, dad. We got it!! We Got It!!!</p>

<p>Emily: </b>Ohh, here comes my dad and stepmum. Mister and Misses Geller, this is Steven
and Andrea Waltham.</p>
<b>

<p>Mr. Waltham: </b>(Shaking everyone's hand.) Hello. Hello. How do you do? How do you do?
Very nice to meet you. (Looking over at his wife.) Darling it&#146;s the Gellers. (She
pays no attention she&#146;s talking on a cellular phone.) (Louder) Darling, it&#146;s the

<b>

<p>Mr. Waltham: </b>Terribly nice of you to offer to pay for half the wedding. (He hand a

<p>Mr. Geller: </b>Ohh forget it. Too hell with tradition, we&#146;re happy to do it.</p>

<p>Monica: </b>Ha ha, a joke that&#146;s funny in all countries.</p>

<p>(Ross quickly directs the families to their tables.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey are standing by the kitchen entrance. A waiter comes out.]</p>
<b>

<p>Waiter: </b>Sir? (Looking at Joey.)</p>
<b>

<p>Joey: </b>What&#146;s in it?</p>
<b>

<p>Waiter: </b>Goat cheese, water chestnuts, and panchetta. (Joey Looks down disgustingly
at the food.)</p>
<b>

<p>Joey: </b>(Looking up at the waiter)That&#146;s not food...No, I don&#146;t, no...(Taps

<p><b>Chandler: </b>Joey, it&#146;s been three days, okay.. Your just a little homesick,
Okay. Would you just try to relax. Just, just try to enjoy yourself.</p>
<b>

<p>Joey: </b>(Pointing&nbsp; at Chandler.) Your different here too. Your mean in England.
(Chandler throws his hands up to his head in frustration. They walk away from each other.)</p>

<p>[Camera pans to the Geller family table. Ross, Rachel, Mr. and Mrs. Geller are there.]</p>
<b>

<p>Mr. Geller: </b>(Looking at ht wedding bill.) What the hell!!!</p>
<b>

<p>Ross: </b>what&#146;s up, Dad?</p>
<b>

<p>Mr. Geller: </b>This bill for my half of the wedding. it&#146;s insane.</p>
<b>

<b>

<p>Mr. Geller: </b>(Pointing items out on the bill.) Flowers, liquor, recarpet first
floor. New guest bath, landscaping. I&#146;m paying to remodel this guys house. (Angrily
gets up.) I&#146;m going to give that son on a bitch, a piece of my mind.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross: </b>(Holding him back.)Dad, dad, please. Look I don&#146;t want anything to upset
Emily tonight. Alright, she's had a hard enough couple of days as it is. (Picks up the
