503<html>

<head>
<title>The One Hundredth</title>
<meta HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=windows-1252">
<meta NAME="GENERATOR" CONTENT="Microsoft FrontPage 3.0">
<meta NAME="Template" CONTENT="C:\Program Files\Microsoft Office\Templates\friends.dot">
</head>

<body bgcolor="#FFFFFF" link="#008000">

<h1 align="center">The One Hundredth</h1>

<hr>

<p>Written by: Marta Kauffman &amp; David Crane<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a></p>

<hr>

<p>[Scene: The Hospital, Phoebe is arriving with Ross, Joey, and Rachel in tow.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (to the nurse) Hi.</p>

<p><b>Nurse:</b> Hi.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hi, yeah, hi! I'm umm, Phoebe Buffay, and I have babies coming out of
me.</p>

<p><b>Nurse:</b> Okay. Have you started having contractions?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Not yet. Umm, I heard they really hurt, do they hurt?</p>

<p><b>Nurse:</b> Well&#133;</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh my God!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> It's all right.</p>

<p><b>Nurse:</b> Now, which of you is the father? (Points to Joey and Ross)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh no, none of them are the father. The father is my brother.</p>

<p><b>Nurse:</b> (not sure what to do with that) Okay&#133;</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I am <b>so</b> gonna miss watching you freak people out like that!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay, uh Pheebs, quick. Look! This (His video camera) is for the babies to
look at someday, so is-is there anything you want to say? Y'know before it all starts?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, okay, umm, hi kids! Um, it's me, Aunt Phoebe. I can't wait to see
you. Please don't hurt me! </p>

<p>(Monica and Chandler come running in.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey, what took you guys so long? Your cab left when ours did!</p>

<p>(There's a pause as they figure out what to say.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well, we-we had to go back because I forget my jacket.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> That's right.</p>

<p>(Both Rachel and Ross stare at her for a moment.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You-you're not wearing a jacket.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh man! I did it again!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (standing up) Okay, so umm, somebody has to call Frank and Alice. (As
she is talking Joey is sticking the camera under her skirt.) And then my mom wants to
know-(notices Joey)-Joey, what are you doing?!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I gotta get the before shot!</p>

<p>(She shakes her head no.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Opening Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: The delivery room, Rachel and Ross are entering.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hi, Pheebs? Okay, so just spoke to the nurse and the reason that your
doctor is late is because uh, she's not coming.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Apparently she fell in the shower and hit her head.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh my God, she's so stupid!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Look, Pheebs-Pheebs, it's gonna be okay.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> That's easy for you to say, I don't see three kids coming out your
vagina!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Honey, listen, y'know what? The nurse said the doctor is wonderful.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, he's head of the department.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> All right&#151;Ooh! Oh dead God, save me! </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I'm having my first contraction!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh no.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ooh, it's not bad.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh! (In an announcer type voice) And so the miracle of life begins, and
aaiiyyyeeee! (He grabs his side and doubles over in pain.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey! You okay?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ooh, something hurts!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ooh, it's sympathy pains. Ohh, that's so sweet!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Are they? I didn't know I cared that much.</p>

<p>(The doctor, Dr. Harad, enters.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hello.</p>

<p><b>Dr. Harad:</b> Hi! Phoebe, I'm Dr. Harad, I'm going to be delivering your babies. I
want you to know, you're gonna be in good hands. I've been doing this for a long time.
I'll be back in a minute to do your internal, in the meantime, just relax because
everything here looks great. And also, I love Fonzie. (Exits)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Did he just say, he loves Fonzie?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> That's what it sounded like.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All right&#133;</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> (entering) Hey!</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> (To Phoebe) Hey! Am I late? Am I late? Nobody came out yet, right?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No-no-no! We haven't started yet. Where's Alice?</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Uh, Delaware. She's on her way though, so until she gets here, I'm gonna
be your coach. But don't worry, she told me all about the la-Mazada stuff.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, that's when if you get the babies out by the end of the month,
they give you 2% financing.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p>[Scene: The waiting room, Monica and Joey are sitting there.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (entering) Monica? You gonna be very proud of me. I just got us dates
with two unbelievably cute nurses.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh my!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> They're male nurses.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Not in my head.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Anyway, they want to take us out Saturday night! What do you say?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Umm. (Looks at Chandler who is using the phone.) Umm. Umm. I don't think
so.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What? What are you talking about?! You-you're the one who's been telling
me to get over Ross and move on. I'm moving on, and you're moving on with me. Come on,
give me one good reason why you don't wanna go.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Umm, why don't you give <b>me</b> something that would be a good reason
and-and then I'll tell you if it's true.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Harder than it sounds. Isn't it?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, you're coming with me, and I also told them that if we're still
here when they get off that we'll go down to the cafeteria and have some <i>Jell-O</i>
with them.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (in a sexy voice) Yep! There's always room for <i>Jell-O</i>&#133;</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Joey, how do you make <b>that</b> dirty?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, it's easy. Yeah, I-I can do it with anything. Watch uh, (snaps his
fingers and in a sexy voice) Grandma's chicken salad&#133;</p>

<p>[Scene: The delivery room, Chandler, Frank, and Ross are with Phoebe.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (entering) Ross! Get a shot of this. (He's carrying an issue of the <i>USA
Today</i> and hands Ross the camera.) Hey babies! These are the headlines on the day you
were born! Okay, now girl baby turn away and boy babies&#133; (Throws the paper away to
reveal a copy of Playpen, which is the TV version of <i>Playboy Magazine</i>.) Check it
out, huh?! This is what naked women looked like the month you were born. All right, now
let's dive right into the good stuff. (Joey opens the magazine and Ross sticks the camera
in it.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, okay, I'm having another one! This one doesn't hurt either&#151;Ooh,
yes it does! Ow! Ow! Ow! Ow! Ooh! (Checks under the blanket.) Oh, I was kinda hoping that
was it.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey, where are Monica and Rachel anyway?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, a couple of nurses asked them out. Maybe they're with them.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Really? Male nurses?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, I was bummed too.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> So they're going on dates? When?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I think Saturday&#151;(groans in pain again).</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> (To Phoebe) What's with him?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Umm, sympathy pains. I thought it was really sweet at first, but now I
think he's just trying to steal my thunder.</p>

<p><b>Dr. Harad:</b> (entering) Okay!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Dr. Harad:</b> Let's see what we got here. Ohh, y'know, Fonzie dated triplets.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> This-this Fonzie person you keep referring too, is that uh, is that
another doctor?</p>

<p><b>Dr. Harad:</b> Oh no-no-no. Fonzie is the nickname of Arthur Fonzerelli. The Fonz.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All right.</p>

<p>(Dr. Harad exits.)</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> It's not <b>that</b> weird, is it?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> It's <b>very</b> weird! I don't want some guy down there telling me, I'm
y'know, dilatedamundo!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> To be fair, he doesn&#146;t seem to be impersonating Fonzie&#133;</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (interrupting) What are you doing?!! Why are you defending him?! Just
get me another doctor! One who is not crazy and who is not Fonzie!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Again, it's not that he&#133;</p>

<p>(Phoebe fakes pain to get Ross looking for another doctor.)</p>

<p>[Scene: The waiting room, Chandler is looking for Monica.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (spotting her) Oh-hey-hey-hey! There you are!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Umm, listen there's something I think you should know.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, is this about you-you dating the nurse? Yeah, Joey already told
me, and I am so-so fine. I mean, you and I we're just, y'know, we're nothing, we're
goofin' around.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Umm, actually I was about to tell you that I was, I was going to get out
of it, but hey, if we're just goofing around then uh, maybe I <b>will</b> go out with him.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Fine! Maybe I will too!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (entering from the elevator caring gifts for the kids) Hey, you guys! Look
what I found in the giiiiiiift shop. (He doubles over in pain in front an old man in a
wheel chair.) Get up! Get up! Get up! (The old man waves him away.)</p>

<p>[Scene: The delivery room, Ross has returned with another doctor. This one, is well,
younger.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, Phoebe, this Dr. Oberman. He has no strong feelings about Fonzie or
any of the <i>Happy Days</i> gang.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hi! And you're going into what grade?</p>

<p><b>Dr. Oberman:</b> Umm, I'm actually a first year resident, but I get that a lot, you
see, I-I graduated early&#133;</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (interrupting) Uh-huh, me too. Ross, maybe I should've specified that
I'd be needing a grown up doctor. </p>

<p><b>Dr. Oberman:</b> Oh no, I'm fully qualified to&#133;</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Shh! Doogie, shh! Doesn't anybody understand that I'm gonna be having
babies soon? Huh? Go! Go little boy, go!</p>

<p>(He runs out and Frank watches him go.)</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Oh cool! You made him cry!</p>

<p>[Scene: Another hospital room, Joey has now been admitted and his doctor is about to
break the bad news to him, Monica, and Chandler.]</p>

<p><b>Joey's Doctor:</b> Mr. Tribbiani, I'm afraid you've got kidney stones.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Umm, well, what else could it be?</p>

<p><b>Joey's Doctor:</b> It's kidney stones.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Or?</p>

<p><b>Joey's Doctor:</b> Kidney stones!</p>

<p>[Scene: The delivery room, Dr. Harad is back and checking on Phoebe.]</p>

<p><b>Dr. Harad:</b> All right, you're getting there. Oh, and y'know, these babies are
very, very lucky.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> They are. Why?</p>

<p><b>Dr. Harad:</b> They have the honor of being born on The Fonz's half-birthday.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Happy birthday!</p>

<p><b>Dr. Harad:</b> Just-just to clarify, I'm not Fonzie. (Phoebe nods in agreement as he
leaves.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Honey, y'know I just gotta tell you, I think this is such a terrific
thing you're having these babies for Frank and Alice.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I know, it is.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Can I tell you a little secret?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I want to keep one. (Giggles in excitement.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ohh, I'm gonna be on the news!</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Commercial Break</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: The delivery room, continued from earlier.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, Phoebe, honey, you gotta be kidding. I mean, you <b>know</b> you
cannot keep one of these babies!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Why not?! Maybe I can, you don't know!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yes! Yes! Yes, I do! I do know! Frank and Alice are gonna want to keep <b>all</b>
of their children!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Maybe not! Y'know? Seriously, three babies are a handful maybe they're
y'know, looking for a chance to unload one of them. Listen, I-I hate to miss an
opportunity just because I didn't <b>ask</b>! Y'know?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Phoebe, no! This is, this is insane.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, just ask him!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Me?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> <b>I</b> can't ask him! Do you have any idea how inappropriate that
would be?! All I'm saying is just talk to Frank. Okay? Just, y'know, feel him out!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No! Forget it! I am <b>not</b> gonna ask Frank to give you one of his
kids!!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> You're right. </p>

<p>(There's an awkward silence then suddenly Phoebe gets an idea.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Tell him it's for you.</p>

<p>[Scene: Joey's room, his doctor, Chandler, and Monica are there.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Feeling a little better sweetie?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, maybe a little. I wish you hadn't seen me throw up.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Me too.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (entering) Hey! I just heard. What's up?</p>

<p><b>Joey's Doctor:</b> Kidney stones! Now, ordinarily Mr. Tribbiani, we try to break up
the stones up with shock waves, but they're to close to the bladder now. Which means we
can either wait for you to pass them or else go up the urethra&#133;</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (interrupting) Whoa-whoa! No-no-no-no-no, nothing is going up! Okay? Up,
up is not an option&#151;what's a urethra? (Monica whispers what it is in his ear.) Are
you crazy?!</p>

<p>[Scene: The delivery room, Rachel and Frank are there.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (To Rachel) So did you ask him?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No, I haven't had a chance to be alone with him yet.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, I'm kinda on a clock here.</p>

<p><b>Dr. Harad:</b> (laughing) Oh Fonzie.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Y'know who I always liked? Mork.</p>

<p>(Dr. Harad drops what he's doing and stares at her.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Undo it. Undo it. Undo it.</p>

<p><b>Dr. Harad:</b> Fonzie met Mork. Mork froze Fonzie.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, but umm&#133; Yes, but, Fonzie was already cool, so he wasn't
hurt, right?</p>

<p><b>Dr. Harad:</b> Yeah, that's right.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (entering with Chandler) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (To Phoebe) How are you doing?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, doctor says any minute now.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Hey, y'know, Alice is gonna be here so soon, you couldn't just like do me
a favor and like, like hold them in?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Sorry Frank, I'm kinda in the middle of the last favor you asked me to
do.</p>

<p>(A male nurse enters.)</p>

<p><strong>Male</strong> <b>Nurse:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><strong>Male</strong> <b>Nurse:</b> Rachel.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Monica, this is Dan (points to him), one of the guys that we're gonna be
going out with on Saturday. (Mouths &quot;He's yours.&quot; to her.) Uh Dan, Monica.</p>

<p><b>Dan:</b> Nice to meet you.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hello Dan! I'm <b>really</b> looking forward to Saturday night! Really,
really!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> So Dan, nurse not a doctor huh? Kinda girlie isn't it?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Chandler!</p>

<p><b>Dan:</b> Nah that's okay. I'm just doing this to put myself through medical school.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh.</p>

<p><b>Dan:</b> <b>And</b> it didn't feel so girlie during the Gulf War.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Sure. (Pause) And listen, thanks for doing that for us, by the way.
(Retreats in defeat.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> So, why wait 'til Saturday, are you free tomorrow?</p>

<p><b>Dan:</b> Sure! I'll get somebody to cover my shift.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, great!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (to another female nurse) Hey, how 'bout it? You, me, Saturday night?</p>

<p><b>Delivery Room <b>Nurse:</b></b> No.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All right. Very good.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oo, this is a big one. Eww! Arghhhh!!</p>

<p>[Cut to Joey's room, who's going throw his own contractions. Plus, he has Ross in a
headlock.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ohh, get these things out of me!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Breathe! Breathe! Breathe throw the pain.</p>

<p>(Joey starts breathing hard)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I want the drugs Ross, I want the drugs! (He starts rocking back and
forth, taking Ross with him.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I do too! I do too!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Argh!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Argh!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Argh!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Argh!</p>

<p>[Scene: The waiting room, Frank is on the phone as Rachel approaches.]</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Yeah, I love you. Okay, bye! (To Rachel) Hi!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> That was Alice's mom, she said she left five hours ago. She should be
here by now!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, honey, don&#146;t worry. She's gonna make it on time.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah. So Frank, three babies. Whew, that just seems like a lot, huh?</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> (laughs) Not to me.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, fair enough.</p>

<p>[Scene: The delivery room, later on, Rachel, Chandler, Monica, and Frank are there as
Dr. Harad is checking out Phoebe.]</p>

<p><b>Dr. Harad:</b> Okay, you're at ten centimeters. Time to start having some babies.
All right, I want only the father in here please.</p>

<p>(They all kiss her and wish her luck.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Bye Dan!</p>

<p><b>Dan:</b> Uh, bye Monica.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Bye, momi-moo.</p>

<p>(Everyone except Frank leaves.)</p>

<p><b>Dr. Harad:</b> All right, I need a clamp, sterile towel, and channel 31.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What is that?</p>

<p>(Dan turns on the TV and the <i>Happy Days</i> theme song comes on.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh my God!</p>

<p><b>Dr. Harad:</b> Oh, no-no-no, it's a good one! Fonzie plays the bongos. All right,
are you ready? It's time to start pushing.</p>

<p>[Cut to Joey's room, his doctor and Ross are there.]</p>

<p><b>Joey's Doctor:</b> Are you ready? It's time to try peeing. (Joey makes a face like
he is trying to pee.) Wait-wait-wait-wait-wait! It's <b>almost</b> time to try peeing.
(Points at the bottle Joey is to pee into.)</p>

<p>[Cut to the delivery room.]</p>

<p><b>Dr. Harad:</b> Okay, now push! That's it push! Just concentrate on pushing! Yeah,
here we go!</p>

<p><b>Dan:</b> I see the head.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Yes, it has a head! </p>

<p><b>Dr. Harad:</b> All right. Keep pushing! Come on!</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> I can't believe there's somebody coming out of you right now. There's
somebody coming out of you! Is it? Is it? It's my son.</p>

<p><b>Dr. Harad:</b> All right. Here's your first baby.</p>

<p>[Cut to the waiting room, a triumphant Frank rushes in.]</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> YESSSSS!!!!! We got a baby boy!! </p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes!</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Frank Jr. Jr.!!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, how does he look? How does he look?</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> So gross! (He runs back to the delivery room.)</p>

<p>[Cut to the delivery room, Phoebe is about to give birth to the middle kid.]</p>

<p><b>Dr. Harad:</b> Okay. You ready to push again?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I already had a baby. Leave me alone.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Okay, okay, come on, you can do it. You can do it!</p>

<p>(Phoebe screams in pain, and Frank screams with her.)</p>

<p>[Cut to the waiting room, a twice triumphant Frank returns.]</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Yeah!! Little Leslie is here! We got another one! Oh my God, I can't
believe I have two-two children. How scary is that? (He returns to the delivery room.)</p>

<p>[Cut to the delivery room, Phoebe is at it for the last time.]</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Come on little Chandler, it's time to be born. Come on little Chandler!
Come on!</p>

<p><b>Dr. Harad:</b> All right, he's coming. He's coming!</p>

<p>(They both stare at the newborn.)</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Hey, where's his thing?</p>

<p>[Cut to the waiting room, a thrice triumphant Frank returns again.]</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Chandler's a girl!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh God, kindergarten flashback.</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> They musta read the sonogram wrong. 'Cause they, 'cause they thought it
was a boy, but Chandler's a girl! Chandler's a girl!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, keep saying it!</p>

<p><b>Alice:</b> (running in from the elevator) Am I too late?!</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> No-no ah, everything's okay. Everybody's healthy there's 30 fingers and
30 toes.</p>

<p><b>Alice:</b> We have our babies?</p>

<p><b>Frank:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Alice:</b> (Starting to cry) Oh, we have our babies.</p>

<p>(They hug. And quickly that hug turns into a heated make out session, right there on
the waiting room couch. Chandler, Rachel, and Monica quickly make their exits.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Joey's room, he is recovering from his birth.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh my God.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You did it, man.</p>

<p><b>Joey's Doctor:</b> Would you like to see them? (He hands Joey a little jar.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> They're so small! (Both he and Ross look at them with satisfied looks on
their faces.)</p>

<p>[Scene: A hallway, Monica and Dan are talking.]</p>

<p><b>Dan:</b> So, I'll call you tomorrow.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Great!</p>

<p>(Dan leaves as Chandler enters.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> So, are you really gonna go out with that nurse man?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well uh, you and I are just goofing around, I thought, why not goof
around with him.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Y'know, I don't know if you've ever looked up the term goofing around
in the dictionary&#133; Well, I have, and the technical definition is, two friends who
care a lot about each other and have amazing sex and just wanna spend more time together.
But if you have this new fangled dictionary that gets you made at me, then we have to,
y'know, get you my original dictionary. I am <b>so</b> bad at this.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I think you're better than you think you are.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Really? Okay, so&#133;</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (interrupting) Know when to stop.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Y'know, I sensed that I should stop. So we're okay?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah. All right, I'm gonna go tell Dan that it's not gonna happen. (They
kiss and as she starts to leave, Chandler starts to dance. Without turning around.) Don't
do the dance.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Right!</p>

<p>[Scene: The delivery room, everyone except Rachel is there. Phoebe, Monica, and Ross
are holding the babies.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I think you're my favorite.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Which one do you have?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I don't care.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (entering) Hi. (To Phoebe) Hey, hi! So uh, Frank and Alice wanted me to
tell you that they're still outside making phone calls.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> But umm, I mean, did you talk to them about, y'know&#133;</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, umm, no honey.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh. It was a long shot. Hey, you guys can I just like have a second
alone with the babies.</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Yeah, sure yeah. Yeah.</p>

<p>(They hand her the babies and leave them alone.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> So, here you are. It seems like yesterday I was talking to you in that
little petri dish. Everyone said labor was the hardest thing I'd ever have to do, but they
were wrong this is. Oh, I had the most fun with you guys! I wish I could take you home and
see you everyday. Okay, I'll settle for being your favorite Aunt. I know Alice's sister
has a pool, but you lived in me. Okay, so we're cool. Yeah, we're gonna be great. Little
high fives! (Imitates the high fives.) Ahh! Ahh! Ahh! (One of the babies begins to cry.)
Well, if you're gonna cry. (She starts crying.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Ending Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: The delivery room, everyone is hanging out with Phoebe. Frank, Alice, and the
kids aren't there.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Phoebe, we are so proud of you! You're amazing!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I know.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> So does it really hurt as bad as they say?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah. You won't be able to take it.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> So uh, now that little Chandler turned out to be a girl, what are they
gonna name her?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> They're gonna call her Chandler.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> That's kind of a masculine name, don't you think?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Works on you.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>End</strong></p>

<hr>

504<html>

<head>
<title>The One Where Phoebe Hates PBS</title>
<meta HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=windows-1252">
<meta NAME="GENERATOR" CONTENT="Microsoft FrontPage 3.0">
<meta NAME="Template" CONTENT="C:\Program Files\Microsoft Office\Templates\friends.dot">
</head>

<body bgcolor="#FFFFFF" link="#008000">

<h1 align="center">The One Where Phoebe Hates PBS</h1>

<hr>

<p>Written by: Michael Curtis<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a></p>

<hr>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel has just gotten home and is going through the mail.
She finds something that's Monica's and goes over and knocks on her closed bedroom door.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (In a sexy voice) Come in. I've been waiting for you. </p>

<p>(Rachel enters.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hi! I just wanna-(sees Monica)-Ahhh!!! Oh my God! (She runs out in
horror.) Oh my God!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (pulling on a robe) Okay, I'm sorry! I'm sorry! I-I-I was um, I was
taking a nap.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Since when do take naps in <b>that</b> position. Oh God Monica, tell me
you were waiting for a guy! Please tell me you were waiting for a guy!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yes. Yes, I was. A guy. From work. (Thinks) I'm seeing a guy from work!
Ha!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (Gasps) That cute waiter guy from your restaurant, the one that looks
like a non-threatening Ray Liotta?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Uh-huh, that one!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Y'know what, just give me a second and I'll be out of your hair. I'm
just gonna grab a jacket. When I get back, I want every little detail. (There's a knock on
the door.) Maybe that's him. (Goes to answer the door.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (Panicking) Okay, umm, okay, umm&#133; (Rachel opens the door.) It's
just Joey and Ross.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Why aren't you guys at the movie?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, we were! But Ross was talking so loud on his phone they threw us
out!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I had to talk loud because the movie was loud!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (to Monica and Rachel) He's talking to London!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> But why?! Did he get in touch with Emily?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well no, not yet. He's calling everyone on her side of the family hoping
that someone will help him get in touch with her.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (on phone) I-I-I don't care if I said some other girl's name you prissy,
old twit!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ross! Way to suck up to the family.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (entering, happily, with a bottle of champagne, thinking that Monica
is the only one there) Ha-ha-ha-(sees everyone)-enh-enh. I'm so glad you guys are all
here! My office finally got wrinkle free fax paper!</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Opening Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the next morning, Phoebe, Chandler, Ross, and Monica are
eating breakfast.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (entering, wearing a tux) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh no-no-no-no-no-no, vomit tux! No-no, vomit tux!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Don't worry, I had it dry-cleaned.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Vomit tux? Who vomited on&#151;y'know what, what you up to Joe?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, I'm doing this telethon thing on TV and my agent got me a job as
co-host!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh that's great!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> A little uh, good deed for PBS and a little TV exposure, now that's the
kind of math Joey likes to do!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ugh, PBS!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What's wrong with PBS?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ugh, what's <b>right</b> with them?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Why don&#146;t you like PBS, Pheebs?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, 'cause right after my mom killed herself, I was just in this
really bad place, y'know personally. So, I just thought that it'd make me feel better if I
wrote to <i>Sesame Street</i>, 'cause they were so nice when I was a little kid! No one
ever wrote back.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well y'know a lot of those Muppets don't have thumbs.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> All I got was a lousy key chain! And by that time I was living in a box.
I didn't have keys!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I'm sorry Pheebs, I just, y'know, I just wanted to do a good deed.
Like-like you did with the babies.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> This isn't a good deed, you just wanted to get on TV! This is totally
selfish.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Whoa! Whoa! Whoa! What about you, having those babies for your brother?
Talk about selfish!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What-what are you talking about?!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, yeah, it was a really nice thing and all, but it made you feel
really good right?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah. So?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> It made <b>you</b> feel good, so that makes it selfish. Look, there's no
unselfish good deeds, sorry.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yes there are! There are totally good deeds that are selfless.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, may I ask for one example?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, it's&#133; Y'know there's&#151;no you may not!</p>

<p>(They are standing on either side of Chandler as they discuss the point. Chandler,
meanwhile, is disgusted with the whole argument.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> That's because all people are selfish.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Are you calling me selfish?!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Are you calling you people? (Chandler rolls his eyes.) Yeah, well sorry to
burst that bubble, Pheebs, but selfless good deeds don't exist. Okay? And you the deal on
Santa Clause right?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I'm gonna find a selfless good dead. I'm gonna beat you, you evil
genius.</p>

<p>(Ross's phone rings and he answers it.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (on phone) Hello.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> (on phone from London) Hello, Ross?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Emily? Emily! Oh my God! Oh my God, it's Emily! (He picks up a lamp and
hands it to Chandler, for no reason.) It's Emily everyone! Shush-shush-shhst! (to Emily)
Hi!</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Ross, I'm only ringing to say stop harassing my relatives. Good-bye!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No wait! Look, wait! Okay, you can hang up, but I'm gonna keep calling!
I'm gonna, I'm gonna call everyone in England if that's what it takes to get you to talk
to me!</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Really? About what?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Look you're my wife. We're-we're married. Y'know? I-I love you. I-I really
miss you.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> I miss you to. Well, at least I think I do.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (to the gang, whispering) She's talking.</p>

<p><b>All:</b> (subdued) Yay! (He motions for them to keep quiet, including Chandler who
is still holding the lamp Ross handed him, before he goes off to talk to Emily in
private.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey, Joey, when you said the deal with Santa Clause, you meant?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> That he doesn't exist.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Right. (She turns and opens her eyes in shock.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Chandler, Monica, and Rachel are there.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> So Chandler, have you heard about Monica's secret boyfriend?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Uhh, yeah. She uh, she uh, she uh might've mentioned him.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> So Mon, when are we gonna meet this new secret waiter man?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Ohh, he's really shy. I-I don&#146;t think he's up to meeting everyone
yet.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, I don't think he's up to meeting everyone yet.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I don&#146;t care! I wanna meet this guy who's the best sex she ever
had!</p>

<p>(Chandler is quite pleased with that statement.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Really?! That's what you heard? (To Monica) You said that?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I might've said that. (Chandler laughs.) Why is that funny?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Because I'm very happy for him! (To Monica) And <b>you</b>, you lucky
dog!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (entering) Hi!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, Emily's willing to work on the relationship.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> That's great!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> In London!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> She wants me to move to London.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> But you live here! (Ross rolls his eyes.) You know that.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What-what-what are you gonna do?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I bet if I talk to Carol and Susan I can convince them to move to London
with Ben.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah, I'm sure your ex-wife will be more than happy to move to another
country so you can patch things up with your new wife.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> It could happen.</p>

<p>[Scene: Unitel Video, Studio 55, Joey's telethon, he is being shown around by the stage
director.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (To the pledge volunteers) How ya doin'? Welcome. Good to see ya!</p>

<p><b>Stage Director:</b> This will be your phone.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> That's great. But uh, I'm not really expecting a lot of calls.</p>

<p><b>Stage Director:</b> No you answer it and take pledges.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> But I'm the host!</p>

<p><b>Stage Director:</b> No, Gary Collins is the host. You'll be answering the phones.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> You don't seem to understand. See, I was Dr. Drake Remoray.</p>

<p><b>Stage Director:</b> Well, here's your phone doctor. (She walks away.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe, Rachel, and Monica are there.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I cannot believe I can't find a selfless good deed! Y'know that old guy
that lives next to me? Well, I snuck over there and-and raked up all the leaves on his
front stoop. But he caught me and force-fed me cider and cookies. Then I felt wonderful.
That old jackass!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Maybe Joey's right. Maybe all good deeds are selfish.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I will find a selfless good deed! 'Cause I just gave birth to three
children and I will not let them be raised in a world where Joey is right!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (entering) Hey, Monica? Can I ask you a cooking question?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Sure!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> If you're cooking on the stove, does that mean that your new secret
boyfriend is better in bed than Richard?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Chandler! (Pause) Is he?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well, y'know I-I-I think I'm gonna respect the privacy of my new secret
boyfriend.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Why?! I mean if this guy was <b>me</b> and it was <b>me</b> who had
learned that it was <b>me</b> who was the best you'd ever had, I'd be going like this. (He
jumps up onto the table and starts doing his happy dance.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Ross's apartment, he's on the phone with Emily.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> All right Emily, as much as I love you, I'm sorry, I can't move to London
without Ben.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> I understand that would be difficult.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, would you <b>please</b> consider moving here? I mean you were gonna
move here anyway, why can't you just do that?</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> I don't know, it's just&#133;</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh-oh-okay, but-but <b>I</b> know, that even though I've been a-a complete
idiot up 'til now, I mean, I mean you-you-you have to come here. You have to come here so
we can work this out.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> All right.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> All right, did you just say all right?</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> I did. Now I'm the idiot.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, Emily that is, that is so great. It's gonna be so great! We're gonna
be like-like-like two idiots in love!</p>

<p>(She laughs.)</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Ross, there's one thing that really scares me still.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yes, tell me.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> Well, you have to understand how humiliating it was for me up on that
altar in front of my entire family, all my friends.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I know. I am, I am so sorry.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> And then after decided to forgive you, seeing you at the airport catching
our plane with her.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Again, very sorry.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> I mean, I can't-I can't be in the same room as her! It drives me mad just
thinking of you being in the same room as her!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Emily, there is <b>nothing</b> between Rachel and me. Okay? I love you.</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> All right. I'll come to New York and we'll try and make this work.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh that is so great! That's&#133;</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> (interrupting him) As long as you don't see Rachel anymore.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Commercial Break</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross is telling Phoebe, Monica, and Chandler about Emily's
ultimatum.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> So I asked Emily if she would come to New York, and she said yes.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ooh-ohh!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Great!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No-no-no! Only if I promise never to see Rachel again.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Why?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What?! You can't&#151;what did you tell her?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I told her I'd have to think about it. I mean, how the hell am I supposed
to make this kind of a decision? (They're all quiet.) I'm <b>actually</b> asking you!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, you can't just not see Rachel anymore, she's one of your best
friends.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah! But, he can't not exactly see Emily, I mean that's his wife.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> That's true!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, but you've known Rachel since High School and you cannot just cut
her out of your life.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> <b>That's</b> true!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No, you cannot.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Thanks for the help, problem solved. (Wipes his hands.)</p>

<p>(The phone rings.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (answering it) Hello.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (on phone) Hey Mon!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh hey Joey! We've been watching all day, when are you gonna be on TV?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> See, there was kind of a mix up in my agent's office, but I'm still on TV
and that's good exposure. </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (Looking at the TV) You're not on TV.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, uh, okay, how, how about now? (He waves his hand in front of the woman
next to him and you can now see his arm on TV.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey, there he is! There he is!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hello New York! (The woman bats his hand out of the way.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, the chick and the duck are watching Emeril Live, a cooking
show.]</p>

<p><b>Emeril:</b> (on TV.) Now maybe you just like wanna but the whole duck in there! Who
cares, y'know? Now I got the legs&#133;</p>

<p>(Chandler enters and sees what they're watching, panics, and runs to turn off the TV.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> How many times have I told you guys, you <b>never</b> watch the
cooking channel!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (entering) Hi Chandler.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Uh, listen, I need that broiling pan that Joey borrowed the other day.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh that was yours? Uh, yeah, we used it when the duck was throwing up
caterpillars. </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> <i>William Sonoma</i>, fall catalog, Page 27.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Expect it in 4-6 weeks. (She starts to leave.) Umm, hey, umm, Joey's
gonna be at the telethon for the rest of the day, we have the whole place to ourselves.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah, so?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well I just, thought maybe you'd wanna book some time with the best
you'd ever had.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Y'know what, champ? I think I'll pass.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Why?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Why? (She hops into the living room and imitates Chandler's happy
dance.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What's your point?</p>

<p>[Scene: The Telethon, Joey's phone rings and he answers it.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (in a bored voice) PBS telethon.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (on phone from Central Perk) Hey Joey, I just wanted to let you know
that I found a selfless good deed. I just went down to the park and I let a bee sting me.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What?! What good is that gonna do anybody?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, it helps the bee look tough in front of his bee friends. The bee
is happy and I am definitely not.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Now, y'know the bee probably died after he stung ya.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (Thinks for a moment.) Aw, dammit! (Slams the phone down.)</p>

<p><b>Stage Director:</b> Back on in 30 seconds people!</p>

<p>(Joey gets up and moves to the other end of his row to talk to the guy sitting there.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey, excuse me, would you mind switching with me?</p>

<p><b>PBS Volunteer:</b> Hey, no way, I'm in the shot man.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Come on man! You've been here all day!</p>

<p><b>PBS Volunteer:</b> Yeah, I-I'm taking pledges here, eh?</p>

<p><b>Stage Director:</b> We're on in 3, 2, (points to Gary Collins.)</p>

<p><b>Gary Collins:</b> Welcome back to our fall telethon. Now if you've been enjoying the
performance of <i>Cirque Du Soleil</i>,<i> </i>(As he is speaking, Joey and the volunteer
getting into a shoving match.) and you'd like to see more of the same kind of programming,
it's very simple. All you have to do (Joey is knocked down.) is call in your pledge and at
that time tell the operator, one of our volunteers, what kind of programming you'd like
to&#133; (Just as the volunteer sits down, Joey pulls him to the ground.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Phoebe are cooking, Chandler is reading a
magazine.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (entering) Okay, that's it. I cannot make this decision! It is <b>too</b>
difficult, so I'm just gonna leave it entirely to the gods of fate. (He holds up and
starts shaking a&#133;)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> A Magic Eight ball?! You can't be serious, you can't make this decision
with a toy!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ooh, it's not a toy.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, I don't know what else to do. I mean, I either keep my wife and lose
one of my-my-my best friends or I keep my friend and get divorced the second time before
I'm 30! So-so if anyone has-has a better suggestion, let's hear it! 'Cause I-I got
nothing! All right, don't be shy, any suggestion will do. (There are none.) Okay then.
Here we go. Magic 8 Ball, should I never see Rachel again? (He turns it over and reads the
answer) Ask again later. Later is not good enough. (He shakes it up again and reads the
answer.) Ask again later. What the hell! This is broken! It-it is broken!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> All right, let me see. (She grabs the 8 ball.) Will Chandler have sex
tonight? (Reads the answer.) Don't count on it. Seems like it works to me.</p>

<p>[Scene: The Telethon, Joey answers his ringing phone.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (in an unenthusiastic voice) PBS Telethon.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (on phone) Hi Joey.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey Pheebs!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> <b>I</b> would like to make a pledge. I would like to donate $200.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> $200? Are you sure Pheebs? I mean, after what <i>Sesame Street</i> did to
ya?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, I'm still mad at them but I also now that they bring happiness to
lots of kids who's moms didn't kill themselves, so by supporting them, I'm doing a good
thing, but I'm not <b>happy</b> about it. So there, a selfless good deed.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> And you don't a little good about donating the money?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, it sucks. I was saving up to buy a hamster.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> A hamster? What, those things are like 10 bucks.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, not the one I had my eye on.</p>

<p><b>Gary Collins:</b> (on TV.) It looks like we have surpassed last year's pledge total!
Thank you viewers! The pledge that did it was taken by one of our volunteers&#133;(He
walks over to where Joey is sitting.) Oh boy! And may I say one of our sharpest dressed
volunteers, (Joey stands up.) Mr. Joseph Tribbiani!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, look-look, Joey's on TV! Isn't that great? My pledge got Joey on TV!
Oh that makes me feel&#151;Oh no! (Realizes that her deed made her happy and therefore
it's selfish and covers her mouth in horror.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, later that day. Monica is coming out of the bathroom
carrying her cleaning gear.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (entering) Look, maybe I got carried away before. But there's
something you gotta know. If I'm the best, it's only because you've made me the best.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Keep talking.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I mean I was nothing before you. Call the other girls and ask. Which
wouldn't take long. But when I'm with you, and we're together, OH&#133;MY&#133;GOD.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Really?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh-aw my God! Now, I understand if you never want to sleep with me
again, but that would be wrong. We're too good! We owe it, to sex!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well, if we owe it? (She throws down her cleaning stuff and jumps into
his arms.) Oh my&#133; When is Joey gonna be home?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, I was kinda hoping we could do this without him. (She starts to
take off her latex gloves.) Oh no-no-no, leave the gloves on.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> But, I just cleaned the bathroom.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, why don't we lose the gloves.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah. (She takes them off.)</p>

<p>(He carries her over to the door and opens it.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All right, let's show them how it's done.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay.</p>

<p>(He starts to carry her into the hallway but hits her head on the door.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Ow!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Y'know that wasn't part of it?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I know!</p>

<p>(He carries her into the hall.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Ross's apartment, Ross is prying at the Magic 8 Ball with a screwdriver as
there's a knock on his door which he goes to answer.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (entering) Hi! Are you ready? We're gonna be late!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> For what?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> For Stella! Remember? She's gettin' her grove back in like 20 minutes.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, I uh, totally forgot about that. You mind if I take a rain check?
I'm waiting for a call from Emily.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Sure. I guess. Hey, I hear you don't have to go to London. Yay!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> It's not that easy, there's still a lot of relationship stuff.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Like what?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Just stuff. Y'know kinda what Emily wants.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, why don't you talk to me about it, maybe I can help.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No. No. You-you can't help. I mean, I kinda have to do this without your
help.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, I-I know you can do that too. I'm just, I'm just saying if you
need somebody to talk to&#133; Hi!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Thanks.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ross? Look, whatever this relationship stuff that Emily wants, just give
it to her. Come on, the bottom line here is that you love her. So just fix whatever she
wants fixed. Just do it. (The phone starts ringing.) I mean, you're gonna <b>have</b> to
try. You'll just gonna hate yourself if you don't. (The phone keeps ringing.) Oh come on
answer it! It's driving me crazy!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (answering the phone.) Hello. (Listens) Hi sweetie. (Listens.) Good. Look
umm, yes I've been thinking about that thing that you wanted me to do and, I can do it.
(Rachel gives him a thumbs up.) So will you come to New York? (Rachel wants to know what
she said, and he gives her a thumbs up and she goes over and hugs him. All the time not
knowing what's going on.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Ending Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, ??????? is playing, as Chandler peaks his head out of the storage
closet and sneaks back to his seat and pretends he's reading something. Then a short while
later Monica pokes her head out of the closet and sneaks back to her seat and sits down,
pretending as if nothing has happened.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Never done that before.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Nope.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>End</strong></p>

<hr>

505<html>

<head>
<title>The One With All the Kips</title>
<meta HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=windows-1252">
<meta NAME="GENERATOR" CONTENT="Microsoft FrontPage 3.0">
<meta NAME="Template" CONTENT="C:\Program Files\Microsoft Office\Templates\friends.dot">
</head>

<body bgcolor="#FFFFFF" link="#008000">

<h1 align="center">The One With All the Kips</h1>

<hr>

<p>Written by: Scott Silveri<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a></p>

<hr>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, 3:02 A.M., Chandler is up. There's a knock on the door and
Chandler answers it.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (quietly) Hi!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (quietly) Hi! (They both start kissing.)</p>

<p>(Joey enters and Chandler pushes her away.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Monica? What time is it?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Uhh, 9. (He pushes the clock into the sink.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> But it's dark out.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well that's because you always sleep to noon, silly! This is what 9
looks like.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I guess I'll get washed up then. Watch that sunrise. (He goes into the
bathroom.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I'm <b>really</b> getting tired of sneaking around.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I know, me too. Hey! Y'know what if we went away for a whole weekend?
Y'know we'd have no interruptions and we could be naked the entire time.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> All weekend? That's a whole lotta naked.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, I can say that I have a conference and you can say you have a
chef thing.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Ohh, I've always wanted to go to this culinary fair that they have in
Jersey!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, y'know your not though. Let's go. (He starts for his bedroom.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Wait! What about Joey?</p>

<p>(Chandler opens the bathroom door to reveal Joey passed out on the toilet with a
toothbrush in his mouth.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Opening Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the next morning, Chandler, Joey, and Phoebe are eating
breakfast.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (entering from her room) Hey, guess what I'm doing this weekend! I'm
going to this culinary fair in New Jersey.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh weird, Chandler just told us he's got a conference there!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh now that-that-that's funny, it seems like Chandler's conference
could've been in Connecticut or Vermont.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I'm not in charge of where the conference is held. Do you want people
to think it's a fake conference? It's a real conference.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (entering) Hey.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Is Rachel here? I gotta talk to her.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No, she's out shopping.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Damn!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What's going on?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I told Emily to come. And I just need to y'know, talk to Rachel about it.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Wait a minute! So when Emily comes you're just, you're not gonna see
Rachel anymore?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well look, I'm just trying to focus on the &quot;I get to see my
wife,&quot; part, all right? And not the part that makes me do this. (He takes a big swig
of <i>Pepto Bismol</i>.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Wow, so you guys are, you're never gonna be in the same room together?
How is that even gonna work?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I have no idea. I mean&#133; But-but I assure you I will figure it out.</p>

<p>(They all reflect briefly on what was said.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Doesn&#146;t seem like it's going to work, I mean&#133;</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (entering) Hi, guys!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Uh, hey!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What's going on?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> We're flipping Monica's mattress.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> So I'm thinking, basically we pick it up and <b>then</b> we flip it.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah that's better than my way.</p>

<p>(They all agree and head to Monica's room.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh okay, hey guys, would you flip mine too?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Aww, man! (They go into Monica's room.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (going through the mail) Oh look! A letter from my mom.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> So, Rach, y'know-y'know how Emily's coming right?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh yeah! I know.</p>

<p>[Cut to Monica's bedroom, Chandler is trying to listen through the door.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (To Chandler) Can you hear anything?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh yes, somebody just said, &quot;Can you hear anything?&quot;</p>

<p>(Joey is bent over at the waist and is looking for something under Monica's bed.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey, Joey's ass! What are you doing?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (holding a box) Well, remember when they got in that big fight and broke
up and we were all stuck in her with no food or anything? Well, when Ross said Rachel at
the wedding, I figured it was gonna happen again, so I hid this in here.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Ooh, candy bars, crossword puzzles&#133;</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ooh, <i>Madlibs</i>, mine! (Grabs it.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Condoms?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> You don't know how long we're gonna be in here! <b>We</b> may have to
repopulate the Earth.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> And condoms are the way to do that?</p>

<p>[Cut to the living room.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Anyway it-it kinda-it all boils down to this, the last time I talked to
Emily&#133;</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (interrupting) Oh my God! My dog died!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh my God, Le Poo, our dog!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Le Poo's still alive?!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh God, it says he was hit by an ice cream truck and dragged for
nine-(turns over the note)-teen blocks. Oh. (They all come out from Monica's bedroom) Oh
my God.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Sweetie, we heard you crying. Please don't cry.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> It's Le Poo.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I know it's le poo right now, but it'll get better.</p>

<p>[Scene: Atlantic City, New Jersey, Chandler and Monica are about to start their weekend
of sex, sex, nothing but sex.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (jumping on the bed) I can't believe it! We're here!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Ooh, chocolates on the pillows! I love that!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, you should live with Joey, <i>Roll-os</i> everywhere.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Come here. (He does, and they kiss.) Okay, be right back. </p>

<p>(Goes to the bathroom and Chandler turns on the TV and finds a high-speed police
chase.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh yes! Monica, get in here! There's a high-speed car chase on!</p>

<p>(Monica returns, carrying a glass.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> We're switching rooms.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (looks at what she's holding and shies away) Oh dear God, they gave us
glasses!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No, they gave us glasses with lipstick on them! I mean, if they didn't
change the glasses, who knows what else they didn't change. (He glares at her.) Come on
sweetie, I just want this weekend to be perfect, I mean we can change rooms, can't we?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, but let's do it now though, because Chopper 5 just lost it's
feed! (He grabs their bags and sprints out.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Ross is trying to tell Rachel about Emily's ultimatum again.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey, so uh, y'know how there's something I wanted to talk to you about?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh yeah! (Turns to face him.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, y'know how I'm trying to work things out with Emily. Well, there's
this one thing&#133; Okay, (Rachel has her back turned to the camera, and Ross isn't
looking at her.) here goes. I made a promise that-(they cut to the other camera and Ross
notices something coming out of Rachel's nose)-Oh hey!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You're nose is bleeding!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh God. (He hands her some tissues.) No! Oh not again! (Wiping her
nose.) This-this happened when my grandfather died. It's ugh! Sorry. (She puts her head
back.) Oh, okay, so I'm sorry, what-what were you-what did you want to tell me?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Umm&#133; (Rachel blows her nose.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Sorry. Sorry.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, I uh, I can't see you anymore.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, I know. It's ridiculous! I can't see you either.</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Monica's weekend, a hotel clerk is showing them their new room.]</p>

<p><b>Hotel Clerk:</b> I think you'll find this room more to your liking.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, great. (He grabs the remote and turns on the TV to the chase.)</p>

<p><b>Hotel Clerk:</b> (watching the chase) They say he's only got half a tank left.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Half a tank? We still got a lot of high-speed chasing to do!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> We're switching rooms again.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What? Why?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> This is a garden view room, and we paid for an ocean view room.</p>

<p><b>Hotel Clerk:</b> Our last ocean view room was unacceptable to you.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (To Chandler) Excuse me, umm, can I talk to you over here for just a
second?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Uh-huh. (He doesn't take his eyes off the TV.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Chandler!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (turning to face her) Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Look, these clowns are trying to take us for a ride and I'm not gonna
let 'em! And we're not a couple of suckers!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I hear ya, Mugsy! But look, all these rooms are fine okay? Can you
just pick one so I can watch-(realizes)-have a perfect, magical weekend together with you.</p>

<p>[Time lapse, Monica and Chandler have changed rooms yet again.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay, <b>this</b> one I like!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (watching TV, in fact, ER is on.) Nothing! It's over! Dammit! This is
regularly scheduled programming!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Can we turn the TV off? Okay? Do we really want to spend the entire
weekend like this?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, I'm sorry, am I getting in the way of all the room switching fun?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey, don't blame me for wigging tonight!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, who should I blame? The nice bell man who had to drag out luggage
to 10 different rooms?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I don't know, how about the idiot who thought he could drive from Albany
to Canada on a half a tank of gas!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Do not speak ill of the dead.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> We're supposed to uh, be spending a romantic weekend together, it-it,
what is the matter with you?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I just want to watch a little television. What is the big deal? Geez,
relax mom.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What did you say?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I said, &quot;Geez, relax Monnnnn.&quot;</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is reading a magazine and has two tissues stuck up
her nose in an attempt to stop the bleeding and as she hears Ross enter, she quickly hides
her face behind the magazine and removes the tissues.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey. Rachel, I-I-I've been wanting to tell you something for a while now
and I really, I just have to get it out.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, what's up?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, y'know how you told me I should do whatever it takes to fix my
marriage?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, I told you to give Emily whatever she wants.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> And while that was good advice, you should know that what-what she
wants&#133; </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> &#133;is for me not to see you anymore.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> That's crazy! You can't do that! What are you going to tell her? (Pause)
(Realizes) Oh God. Ohh, you already agreed to this, haven't you?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> It's awful I know, I mean, I feel terrible but I have to do this if I want
my marriage to work. And I do, I have to make <b>this</b> marriage work. I have too. But
the good thing is we can still see each other until she gets here.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ohh! Lucky me! Oh my God! That <b>is</b> good news, Ross! I think that's
the best news I've heard since Le Poo died!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You have no idea what a nightmare this has been. This is so hard.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh yeah, really? Is it Ross? Yeah? Okay, well let me make this a just a
little bit easier for you.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What are you doing?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Storming out!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Rachel, this is your apartment.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, well that's how mad I am!!</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Commercial Break</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is returning from his disastrous weekend. He
throws his bag down and sits down on one of the leather chairs, but he sits on something
and picks it up and throws it away.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Damn <i>Rollos</i>!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey, you're back!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> How was your conference?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> It was terrible. I fought with (Pause) my colleagues y'know, the
entire time. Are you kidding with this? (Throws away another <i>Rollo</i>)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, so your weekend was a total bust?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Uh, no, I got to see Donald Trump waiting for an elevator.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (entering) Hi!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey, you're back too!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah. Umm, Chandler can I talk to you outside for a second?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey, how was your chef thing?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, it was awful. (To Chandler) I guess some people just don't
appreciate really good food.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, maybe it was the kind of food that tasted good at first but then
made everybody vomit and have diarrhea.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Chandler! (Motions for him to come outside.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Monica. (Follows her out.)</p>

<p>[In the hall.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay, I'd like to know how much the room was because I'd like to pay my
half.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, fine, $300.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> 300 dollars?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, just think of it as $25 per room!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Urghh!!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (sticking his head out the door) What are you guys woofing about?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Chandler stole a twenty from my purse!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Nooooo!!! Y'know what? Now that I think about it, I constantly find myself
without twenties and <b>you</b> always have lots!</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Ross is drinking some <i>Alka-Seltzer</i>. The rest of the gang,
minus Rachel is there as well.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You should've seen the look on her face. I don't want Rachel to hate me! I
don't know what to do.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> You want my advice?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yes! Please!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> You're not gonna like it.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> That's okay.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> You got married to fast.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> That's not advice!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I told ya.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I'm going to the bathroom. (Gets up and exits.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Man, if anyone asked me to give up any of you, I couldn't do it.</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler and <b>Phoebe:</b> </b>Yeah, me either.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Maybe I could do it.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (entering) Hi!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hi, Rach.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Look, I know you guys heard about the whole thing with me and Ross but
y'know, I've been obsessing about it all day and I'd just <b>love</b> not to talk about
it. All right?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I-I-I don't know if this falls under this category, but uh, Ross is right
back there. (Points over his shoulder.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> That's not Ross!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh no! Not that guy! He does look like him though.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, Ross is in the bathroom.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh my God, its happening. It's already started. I'm Kip.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey, you're not Kip!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (To Joey) Do you even know who Kip is?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Who cares? You're Rachel! (To Chandler) Who's Kip?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Kip, my old roommate, y'know we all used to hang out together.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, that poor bastard.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> See? Yeah, you told me the story. He and Monica dated when they broke up
they couldn't even be in the same room together and you all promised that you would stay
his friend and what happened? He got phased out!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You're not gonna be phased out!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, of course I am! It's not gonna happen to Ross! He's your brother.
(To Chandler) He's your old college roommate. Ugh, it was just a matter of time before
someone had to leave the group. I just always assumed Phoebe would be the one to go.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ehh!!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Honey, come on! You live far away! You're not related. You lift right
out.</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is watching TV.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (entering) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey, Mr. Bing. That uh, hotel you stayed at called. Said someone left an
eyelash curler in your room.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes that was mine.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> 'Cause I figured you'd hooked up with some girl and she'd left it there.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes that would have made more sense.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Y'know, I-I don't even feel like I know you anymore man! All right, look,
I'm just gonna ask you this one time. And whatever you say, I'll believe ya. (Pause.) Were
you, or were you not on a gay cruise?!</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe is sitting on couch and Rachel is getting some coffee.
Phoebe keeps turning her head from to keep from looking at Rachel.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Phoebe? (She turns her head further away.) I'm sorry about the whole
lifting out thing. (Moves over next to her.) You gotta come with me!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Come where?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Wherever I go. Come on you and me, we'll-we'll start a new group, we're
the best ones.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, but try and get Joey too.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (entering) Pheebs, you mind if I speak to Rachel alone for a sec?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, sure! (She gets up to leave.) Bye Ross! (Whispering behind his
back.) Forever.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hi.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hi. What are you doing here? Isn't this against the rules?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I talked to Monica, look, I'm the one who made the choice. <b>I'm</b> the
one who's making things change, so I should be the one to y'know, step back.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, Ross&#133;</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, no, it's okay. Really. They're plenty of people who just see their
sisters at Thanksgiving and just see their college roommates at reunions and just see Joey
at <i>Burger King</i>. So is, is that better?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No, it's not better. I still don't get to see you.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, what-what would you do? Rach, if you were me, what-what would you
do?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, for starters I would've said the right name at my wedding!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I can't believe this is happening.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I know.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I am so sorry.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I know that too.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (entering) (He clears his throat to get their attention.) Hey, Rach? Sorry
to interrupt but umm, Phoebe wanted me to talk to you about a trip or something.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is doing a crossword puzzle.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (entering) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hi.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I just came over to drop off&#133;nothing. So that weekend kinda
sucked, huh?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah, it did.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> So, I guess this is over.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, y'know, you and me, it had to end sometime.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Why, exactly?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Because of the weekend, we had a fight.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Chandler that's crazy! If you give up every time you'd have a fight with
someone you'd never be with anyone longer than&#151;Ohhh! (They both realize something
there.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> So, this isn't over?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (laughs) You are so cute! No. No, it was a fight. You deal with it and
move on! It's nothing to freak out about.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Really? Okay. Great!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Ohh, welcome to an adult relationship! (She goes to kiss him.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (stops her) We're in a relationship?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I'm afraid so.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay.</p>

<p>(They kiss.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica, Rachel, Joey, and Chandler are there as Phoebe
enters.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh hey, Monica, I heard you saw Donald Trump at your convention.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah, I saw him waiting for an elevator.</p>

<p>(Joey thinks that sounds familiar, but dismisses the thought.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey, Rach, can I borrow your eyelash curler, I think I lost mine.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, it's in there. (Points to the bathroom.)</p>

<p>(Joey puts two and two together.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (shocked) Oh! Ohh! Oh!!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Joey, can I talk to you for a second? (He grabs him and starts to drag
Joey into Monica's room.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oohh!! Ohh! Oh-oh-oh! Oh-oh!!</p>

<p>(Chandler pushes him through the door and Monica closes it behind them.)</p>

<p>[Cut to Monica's room, Chandler tackles Joey onto her bed and tries to cover his
mouth.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ohhhhhhhhhhh!!!!!!!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes. Yes. (Lets him up.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (To Chandler) You?! (To Monica) And-and you?!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yes, but you cannot tell anyone! No one knows!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> How?! When?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> It happened in London.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> <b>IN LONDON!!!</p>
</b>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> The reason we didn't tell anyone was because we didn't want to make a
big deal out of it.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> But it is a big deal!! I have to tell someone! </p>

<p>(They both grab him and stop him.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No-no-no-no-no! You can't!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Please? Please?! We just don't want to deal with telling everyone, okay?
Just promise you won't tell.</p>

<p>(Joey thinks it over.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> All right! Man, this is unbelievable! I mean, it's <b>great</b>, but&#133;</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I know, it's great!</p>

<p>(She goes over and kisses Chandler.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Aww, I don't want to see that!</p>

<p>[Cut to Phoebe and Rachel.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> We're so stupid! Do you know what's going on in there? They're trying to
take Joey!</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Ending Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the gang, minus Ross are playing <i>Madlibs</i>. Phoebe is
reading hers.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> The most popular Phoebe in tennis is called the overhand Phoebe. And if
you win, you must slap your opponent on the Phoebe and say, &quot;Hi, Phoebe!&quot;</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh that's cute! We really all enjoyed it. But y'know, it doesn't count.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Count for what?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Count in our heads as-as good <i>Madlibs</i>.</p>

<p>(They putting their notepads down and get up to leave.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I guess I'm done.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Fun's over!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Wait-wait, guys! If-if we follow the rules, it's still fun and it means
something!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Uh-huh!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I think I'm gonna take-off.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Guys, rules are good! Rules help control the fun! (They all leave and
close the door on Monica.) Ohhh! (Throws her notepad down in disgust.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>End</strong></p>

<hr>

506<html>

<title>The One With The Yeti</title>
<meta HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=windows-1252">
