512<html>

<head>
<title>The One With Chandler's Work Laugh</title>
<meta HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=windows-1252">
<meta NAME="GENERATOR" CONTENT="Microsoft FrontPage 3.0">
<meta NAME="Template" CONTENT="C:\Program Files\Microsoft Office\Templates\friends.dot">
</head>

<body bgcolor="#FFFFFF" link="#008000">

<h1 align="center">The One With Chandler's Work Laugh</h1>

<hr>

<p>Written by: Alicia Sky Varinaitis<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a></p>

<hr>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is trying to pry more information about Chandler
and Monica from Joey who's sitting on the couch and busy downing a pizza.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Come on Joey!!!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Rach, I told you everything I knew last night! Look, it's not that big of a deal,
so Monica and Chandler are doing it.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I can't believe you would say that!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Sorry. Monica and Chandler are making love.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No! I mean come on! This is a <b>huge</b> deal! (She sits next to him on the
couch.) Fine I want&#151;I need more details, who-who initiated the first kiss?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (thinks) I don't know.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Is he romantic with her?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I don't know.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Are they in love?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (thinks) I don't know.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You don't know anything.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ohh, I know one thing!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> They did it right there on the couch. </p>

<p>(He points to where she's sitting and she jumps up quickly.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Opening Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, everyone is there as Ross enters.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey Ross!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (disinterested) Hey-yeah. (He hurries up to the counter.) Hey Gunther, can I have
a scone please? (To the gang.) Wanna hear some good news? Someone I know is getting
married! Yeah! And weddings are happy occasions! Oh, by-the-by it's my ex-wife Emily!</p>

<p><b>All:</b>  What? Oh!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Sorry man.</p>

<p><b>Gunther:</b> Here's your scone.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, thanks Gunther. (He takes it, hands the plate it's on to Rachel, sets it down
on the table, and proceeds to pound it into oblivion while saying.) STUPID BRITISH SNACK
FOOD!!!!!!!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Did they teach you that in your anger management class?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey, you know what might help you deal with it? Think of it this way, you and
Emily are in the past and you can't be mad about the past. So are you still mad about the
Louisiana Purchase?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Pheebs, I don&#146;t think anyone's mad about that.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Exactly! Because it's in the past!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (eyeing the flattened scone) Anybody gonna eat that?</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler's office, Monica and him are at a party his office is throwing.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Look at us all dressed up for the big office party! By the way, what are we
celebrating?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, we had a lot of liquor left over from the Christmas party.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I think this is so cool because none of our friends are here and we can be a
real couple. We don't have to hide.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I know, I can do this. (He takes her hand.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Ooh, and I can do this. (She kisses him on the cheek.)</p>

<p>(They both stand real close together.)</p>
<b>

<p>Both:</b> We can't do that. (They separate.)</p>

<p>(Chandler's boss (Doug) walks up.)</p>

<p><b>Doug:</b> Hey Bing! (Slaps him on his ass.) (Sees Monica) Wo-ho-ho, who's the pretty lady
and what the hell is she doing with you?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I asked myself that very question, sir. Uh, (Points to Monica) this is
Monica. (Points to his boss.) This is my boss, Doug. Doug this is Monica.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hi, nice to meet you!</p>

<p><b>Doug:</b> Hi! And this is my wife Kara.</p>

<p><b>Kara:</b> Nice to meet you Monica. Bing! (Slaps Chandler on his butt.)</p>

<p><b>Doug:</b> Say uh, Bing, did you hear about the new law firm we got working for us?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No, sir.</p>

<p><b>Doug:</b> Yeah, Dewey, Cheatum, and Howe.</p>

<p>(Chandler does a fake laugh.)</p>

<p><b>Doug:</b> Come on honey, let's go drink our body weight. (They walk off leaving Chandler
and Monica alone.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What was that?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> That noise you just made?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, that was my work laugh.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Really? Your work laugh?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, believe me, to survive this party, you're gonna have to come up with one
too.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> All right, check me out.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay.</p>

<p>(She walks up to where Doug is finishing another joke to another group.)</p>

<p><b>Doug:</b> &#133;says $30 Father; same as in town.</p>

<p>(Monica does a fake laugh. For the laughs, you'll have to see the episode. I can't
describe them.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Monica is buying a muffin as Chandler runs in.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey! Everybody at work loved you last night! </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Really?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> <b>And</b>! They like me more just because I was with ya! I think you
repaired a lot of the damage from when they met Joey. And Doug wants us to play tennis
with them. He's never even <b>talked</b> to me outside of work. Except for that time when
we bumped into each other at that strip club. (She glares at him.) Strip church. Anyway,
I'm gonna go try and find a racquet.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey, I thought you already had one.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh I used too, but then Joey thought it would be fun to go to Central Park
and hit rocks at&#133;bigger rocks. (He starts to leave and stops an entering Rachel.) Hey
Rach, do you have a tennis racquet?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh umm, y'know I lent it to Joey and I never actually got it back.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, good luck with that. (Exits.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (To Monica) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What's up?!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What are you doing here? I thought you had to do inventory all day.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well yeah, I do, but I decided to take a long lunch and spend some time with my
friend Monica. Y'know I-I feel that we don't talk anymore. How are you? What is new with
you?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Uhh, not much. Uh, work's good.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh y'know what, we don&#146;t have to talk about work. We can talk about
anything!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay. Umm&#133;</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hey! Y'know what? Let's talk about relationships!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay, what's going on with you?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Nothing! You go!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well, I-I&#151;there was this guy at the bank that I thought was cute umm, but
I don't anymore.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Wow that's uh, juicy. Umm, (checks watch) y'know what though Mon, I actually do
have a lot of work to do so if-if&#151;are you sure there's just not anything else?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yes, I'm sure! Rachel is there something that you want to talk me about?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No! (Gets up to leave.) (Under her breath.) If there was I wouldn't tell you.</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler, Joey, and Ross's, Phoebe is settling a dispute between the chick and
the duck.]</p>

<p>(The duck quacks.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, then what happened?</p>

<p>(The duck flaps its wings frantically.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (gasps) Ohh. Uh-huh. Uh-huh. (The chick clucks.) You'll get your turn!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (entering from the bathroom) Hey Pheebs, what's going on?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Nothing! (Picks up and sets the chick down on the floor.) (To the chick.) This
is not over!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No! No! No!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I was up all night writing this really nasty letter to Emily! It was perfect and
now it's all covered in-in&#133; (The duck quacks.) Actually, thanks!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (entering from his room) All right! Everybody ready to go to the movies?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Uh actually, I think I'm gonna skip it.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Really?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, I'm gonna stay and read my book. I just wanna be alone right now.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh. Are you sure you don't want to come? Tom Hanks, Meg Ryan, they get mail and
stuff.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> That's okay, Joe.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> All right, let's go Pheebs.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (licks the envelope and encounters a foreign substance on the glue.) Oh God!</p>

<p>[Scene: A tennis court somewhere in the city of New York, it's the doubles match-up of
a century Chandler and Monica versus Doug and Kara.]</p>

<p><b>Doug:</b> Bing! </p>

<p>(Hits the ball towards Chandler who returns it back to him. He then hits the ball at
Monica who slams it and it bounces off Kara's leg.)</p>

<p><b>Kara:</b> Oww!!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Game!</p>

<p><b>Doug:</b> Well, I gotta tell ya Bing; that partner of yours is a real tiger. (To his wife.)
Are you all right sweethart?</p>

<p><b>Kara:</b> (out of breath and mouths) I'm not all right.</p>

<p><b>Doug:</b> We're, we're just gonna get a little sip of water.</p>

<p>(They both walk off the court.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Am I on fire today or what?! Those birds are browned, basted, and ready to be
carved!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, easy Martina. I think we should let them win the next game.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I'm sorry, I don't understand what you just said.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Let them win one.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Are you crazy?! We own those two! I mean look at 'um, he can't breath and she's
popping pills.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You're not even giving them a chance!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> They have racquets don't they?!</p>

<p><b>Doug:</b> Uh Bing, I think we're gonna make this the last game.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh yes, sir! Put me out of my misery. Are you sure you never played pro?
(Does his work laugh.) (To Monica) Please let them win!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I'll take it down to 95% but that's the best I can do.</p>

<p>(She serves to Doug who returns it to Chandler. As it bounces over his head Chandler
swings and misses.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oopsey, missed it!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I got it! (She hits a forehand smash that bounces right in between Doug and
Kara and scores a point.)</p>

<p><b>Doug:</b> Nice shot.</p>

<p>(Chandler glares at her and she shrugs her shoulders. Monica serves again; and Kara
returns it.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I got it!!</p>

<p>(Chandler cuts in front of her and hits the ball high and long.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Long! (Gives Monica the Work Laugh.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Chandler are returning from the game.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I can't believe you let them win!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, at least you hid your feelings well about it. (Removes a smashed
racquet from his bag.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I was frustrated.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> It was my racquet.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I was frustrated with you!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> If we hadn't lost the game they never would've invented us to dinner tomorrow
night.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Y'know what really bothers me? Is&#151;it's how-how different you act around
them! I mean y'know the throwing the tennis games, the fake laugh, the &quot;I'll see you
around, Bing!&quot; &quot;Not if I see you first, Doug!&quot; (Mocks the fake laugh.) I
gotta tell you, I don't like Work Chandler. Okay? The guy's a suck-up.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay y'know what, because you said that, I'm not putting out tonight.</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler, Joey, and Ross's, the next morning the girls are there with Joey.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I'm telling you, something's wrong! My brother does not stay out all night.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Maybe we should check the trash chute.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ross couldn't fit down the trash chute.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> That's right, he almost could. Which is exactly how I got stuck there.</p>

<p>(Ross enters.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> There he is!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh my God! (She goes to hug him, stops short, and hits him on the shoulder.)
Where the hell have you been?!!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Just, y'know out.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ohh, out, oh God, I don't know why we didn't think to check there!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What were you doing?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I uh, went to a bar. And then I just uh, just walked around for a while.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You walked around all night in the city by yourself?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (snaps his fingers) He hooked up! He hooked up with someone.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Look, I don't have to answer your questions! Okay? I'm a big boy, I can do
whatever I want!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> He hooked up!! Tell us about her!</p>

<p>[Suddenly the door opens and Ross's mystery girl enters. I'll give you a hint to who it
is: OH&#133;.MY&#133;.GAWD!! Uh-huh, it's Janice.]</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> (entering) Ross you left you scarf in&#133;(sees everyone.) Hey you guys. (Does
the laugh.)</p>

<p>(They all turn and with shocked looks on their faces stare at Ross. Ross is at a loss
for words at this moment.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Commercial Break</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler, Joey, and Ross's, continued from earlier.]</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Uh-oh-okay. Uh-oh-okay. I know what you all are thinking. But Chandler is in <b>Yemen</b>!
I'm a young woman! I have needs! I can't wait forever!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah! No that's what I was thinking.</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> So I'm asking you please, take a moment before you judge me.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, nobody's judging you. (They all turn and look at Ross.)</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Oh! Okay! (To Ross) You, Mister Right Place at the Right Time, call me! (Does
her famous, or is that infamous, laugh and exits.)</p>

<p>(They all turn and glare at Ross.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, look, I-I know what you guys are going to say&#133;</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> You two will have very hairy children.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, I didn't know you would say that.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ross! Janice?!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> All right, hold on! Hold on. Hold on. This is Ross, okay? He's our friend. He
obviously went crazy. He obviously lost his mind.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Look, I <b>didn't</b> lose my mind! Okay, Janice and I have a lot in common!
We've-we've both been divorced. We-we both have kids.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> So are you actually gonna see her again?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Phoebe! Don't put ideas in his head!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I <b>am</b> gonna see her again.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Damnit Phoebe!!</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is going through her purse as Rachel rushes in.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (entering) Okay, I have to tell you something that I have never admitted during
our entire friendship! But, when we were in high school I made out with James Farrell even
when I knew that you liked him! Wow, that feels so good to get off my chest! Okay, you go!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> My turn? What-what are you talking about?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ugh, Monica, I know about you and Chandler.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I overheard you guys on the phone the other day, and you said, &quot;I'll just
tell Rachel that I'm doing laundry for a couple of hours.&quot; And he said,
&quot;Laundry? Is <b>that</b> my new nickname?&quot; And you said, &quot;No! You know what
your nickname is, Mr. Big.&quot;</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well. Sounds like you're writing yourself a little play there Rach. Wow! Let me
know how that one turns out.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, I wouldn't know because I got so freaked out that I hung up the phone.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well, if you had kept listening, you-you would have heard me call him Mr.
Big&#133;(Thinks)&#133;ot.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Mr. Bigot. He tells the most <b>racist</b> jokes.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> All right. So you're telling me that there is nothing going on between you and
Chandler.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Me and Chandler?! (Does her fake laugh.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler, Joey, and Ross's, Phoebe and Joey are there.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> All right, put your 20 bucks down. First one to find the tasty treat wins. Okay?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Uh-hmm.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> All right. Let's get the contestants out of their isolation booths. (He removes
the waste bucket that's over the duck and the laundry basket that's over the chicken.) And
they're off! (He puts his foot in front of the chick, stopping it from moving.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Get your foot off my contestant! Judge!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Judge rules, no violation.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ohhh.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (entering) Hey guys!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah!</p>

<p>(Neither of them turns around from watching the chick and the duck look for the tasty
treat.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Y'know what? It sounds so weird to say this but, I just had a great day with
Janice! </p>

<p>(They both turn around.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Are you serious?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah! I opened up to her about all the terrible stuff that's been happening to
me. I mean I talked for hours. (Joey has lost interest and is watching the race again.) It
is amazing to have someone give you such-such focused attention.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> You don't need Janice for that, you've got us. We&#133;</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> And the duck gets the Nutter-Butter!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (turning from Ross.) No!! Hey-hey that's not a Nutter-Butter, that's just an
old Wonton!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Judge rules, Nutter-Butter.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ohh, tough call.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p>[Scene: Doug's house, Chandler, Monica, and them are just finishing dinner.]</p>

<p><b>Doug:</b> But seriously, I believe that we should all support President Clinton. And her
husband Bill. (Chandler does the laugh.)</p>

<p><b>Kara:</b> So how do you kids like your coffee?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, none for me. Thanks.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Just a little bit of sugar.</p>

<p><b>Doug:</b> Well, maybe I'll bring it out and have Monica stick her finger in it. That oughta
sweeten it up, huh? (Once again, with the laugh.)</p>

<p>(Doug and Kara go get the coffee.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (To Chandler) How does that laugh not give you a headache?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, you get used to it.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Y'know, I-I-I don't think that I can. So if you don't mind, maybe this will be
it for me on the work things.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> So I laugh at my boss's jokes, what's the big deal?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I'd rather hang out with a sniveling work weasel guy when I can be hanging out
with my boyfriend who I actually respect.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh. (Does a double take when he realizes what she just said.)</p>

<p><b>Doug:</b> (entering) Uh, I gotta apologize for Kara's coffee. Y'know, I feel sorry for it
if it ever got in a fight, it's not strong enough to defend itself. (Chandler does not
laugh.) Did you hear what I said Bing?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Doug:</b> The joke Bing. What's the matter with you?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, I-I just didn't think it was funny sir.</p>

<p><b>Doug:</b> Excuse me?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, I just&#133;</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (interrupting) Honey, I just don't think that you understood the joke.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Really?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah! I mean it was really funny, I-I just don't think you got it. You see
Kara's coffee is-is-is weak tasting, okay? But-but what Doug was-was imply that it was
weak physically. You get it now honey?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I think I do! (They all laugh.) Thank you, Monica.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I thought you could use the help.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Coffee in a fight! (Does the laugh again.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is going through the mail as Joey enters.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (entering) Hey Rach! Hey, you mind if I read my comic books in here?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Sure! Why?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh well, Chandler and Monica are over there and it's kinda hard to concentrate.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?! She just called and said that she was gonna be working late! She keeps
lying to me! That's it! Y'know what? I'm just gonna go over there and confront them right
now!</p>

<p>[Cut to Chandler, Joey, and Ross's apartment, Rachel enters and sneaks up to Chandler's
bedroom where she overhears Chandler and Monica talking.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (from his bedroom) All right, so you're telling me that I have to tell racist
jokes now?!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Sorry! I'm just&#151;I'm not very good at this! I'm a terrible liar and I hate
having to lie to Rachel!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> But we're not ready to tell yet!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I know! It's just that&#133;ever since high school Rachel was the one person I
told everything too. Y'know? I miss that so much now. She's my best friend.</p>

<p>(Rachel decides not to confront them and starts to walk out, knocking over a lamp in
the process.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (entering) Joey?! Oh my God, Rachel!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hey! Hi!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Wh-wh-what are you doing here? (She tries to pull her shirt down to cover the
fact that she's wearing men's boxers.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, I was actually&#151;I-I came over here to-to borrow this lamp. To umm,
look at my books, y'know, see them a little better.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay great! </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Great! Umm, well what-what I was doing in Chandler's room is that umm, I was
cleaning it! In fact, he pays me to clean it!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh! What a great way to earn some extra pocket money.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Y'know when I said to you earlier that I was at work umm, I'm at my new work.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> That's good enough. Right? (Pause.) Okay, well umm, I'm gonna go look at my
books!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I'll get back to my new job.</p>

<p>(Pause.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> 'Kay. (Pause.) Congratulations on your new job. (She goes and hugs Monica and
is almost in tears.)</p>

<p>(After she exits, Chandler enters.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Man, she is really gullible.</p>

<p>(Monica motions that it went right over Rachel's head.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Ross and Janice are sitting on the couch.]</p>

<p><b>Gunther:</b> Here you go. (Serves them both some coffee.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Thanks!</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Actually, I should get going.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Are you sure? Because I can stay out as late as you want. I told you how I'm on
sabbatical from work, right?</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Yes! Yes! You did!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh&#133;</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> What is wrong now?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> This isn't what I ordered! Man! Can anything go right in my life?! First my
marriage falls apart and then&#133;</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> I know! I know! And then you lose your apartment! And then you lose your job!
And then your ex-wife gets married so fast! And now the coffee&#151;ahh!! Ross, we need to
talk.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay. Sometimes I feel&#133;</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> No-no-no, no. <b>I'm</b> going to talk. I believe that the sun has set on our
day in the sun.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Huh?</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> (starting to cry) You're a very sweet person Ross, umm, unfortunately I don't
think I can take another second of you whining!!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Let-let me make sure I'm hearing this right, you're ending this with me because <b>I'm</b>
too whiney? (Janice makes an agreeing sound.) So you're saying, I've become so whiney that
<b>I</b> annoy <b>you</b>, Janice.</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Well yeah!!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> OH&#133;MY&#133;GOD!!</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Are you gonna be okay?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I am now.</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Okay.</p>

<p>(Joey enters.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Umm, hi.</p>

<p><b>Janice:</b> Oh hi! Well, I guess that's two out of three, Joey. (Laughs and exits.)</p>

<p>(Joey looks at Ross with a horrified look on his face.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Ending Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler, Joey, and Ross's, Chandler is reading a magazine as Ross hands him a
beer.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Dude, we got to talk.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I just wanted to tell you something before you heard it from someone else and I
hope this isn't too weird, but uh, I had uh, a thing with Janice. (He laughs, his real
laugh this time.) What you're-you're not mad?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Why would I be mad?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, because y'know there are certain rules about this kind of stuff. You don't
uh, you don't fool around with your uh, friend's ex-girlfriends or possible girlfriends or
girls they're related to.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (realizes what Ross just said and the implications to him) I am mad! But you
know what I'm gonna do? I'm gonna forgive you! Because that's what friends do! They
forgive their friends when they do everything you just said, all on the list there. Well,
but I want you to remember that <b>I</b> forgave you.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I also want you to remember that I let you live here rent free!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> All right.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> And, I want you to remember that I gave you twenty (counts his money) seven
dollars. No strings attached. Now, if you can't remember that, I think we should write it
down&#151;let's write it down!</p>

<p align="center"><strong>End</strong></p>

<hr>

513<html>

<head>
<title>The One With Joey's Bag</title>
<meta HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=windows-1252">
<meta NAME="GENERATOR" CONTENT="Microsoft FrontPage 3.0">
<meta NAME="Template" CONTENT="C:\Program Files\Microsoft Office\Templates\friends.dot">
</head>

<body bgcolor="#FFFFFF" link="#008000">

<h1 align="center">The One With Joey's Bag</h1>

<hr>

<p>Teleplay by: Seth Kirkland<br>
Story by: Michael Curtis<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a></p>

<hr>

<p>[Scene: Chandler's bedroom, he is giving Monica a massage.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I can't <b>believe</b> we've never done this before! It's sooo good! So
good for Monica! </p>

<p>(Chandler picks up the timer being used and turns it to zero at which it chimes.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh! Look at that, time's up! My turn!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> That was a half an hour?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> It's your timer.</p>

<p>(They change places.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Y'know, I don't like to brag about it, but I give the <b>best</b>
massages!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All right, then massage me up right nice!</p>

<p>(She starts the massage, only she is doing extremely hard and Chandler is gasping in
pain.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Ah! Ahh!! Ahh!!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> It's so good, isn't it?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> It's so good I don't know what I've done to deserve it!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Say good-bye to sore muscles!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Good-bye muscles!!</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Opening Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Chandler and Joey are sitting on the couch.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I'm telling you, she gives the worst massages ever!! Okay, it was like
she was torturing me for information. And I wanted to give it up I just&#151;I didn't know
what it was!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Chandler, if it really hurts that bad you should just tell her.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Look, for the first time in my life I'm in a real relationship. Okay,
I'm not gonna screw that up by y'know, telling the truth.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (walking up with Rachel and carrying coffee) Hey.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Whoa, dude, look out! You almost crushed my hat! (He picks a hat up from
the floor. It's one of those magician stovepipe hats.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Sorry.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (examining the hat) And the bunny got away. (Turns and starts looking
for the bunny as Joey puts the hat on.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (glaring at Joey) This would be the place where you explain the hat.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh! Yeah, look there's this play all right? And I'm up for the part of
this real cool like suave international guy. A real clothes horse. So I figure that
everyone at the audition is gonna be wearing this kinda y'know, ultra-hip, high fashion
stuff.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> And you're gonna make them all disappear.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, like you could find something as sophisticated as this.</p>

<p>(Chandler picks up a basket from the table and puts it on his head.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Done.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Joey, if you wanna look good, why don't you just come down to the store?
I'll help you out.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Great! Thanks, Rach!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Sure! (Pause) God, please take those off!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> All right. </p>

<p>(Both of them remove their hats as Phoebe enters.) </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey Pheebs, how's it going?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey! Umm, well, only okay because I just got back from, from the
hospital.</p>

<p>(All at once.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Is everything okay?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Are you all right?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh yeah, no-no-no. I'm fine. I'm okay, but umm, my Grandma sorta died.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Pheebs! Sorry!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> It's okay, I mean she had a really incredible life. And it's not like
I'm never gonna see her again, y'know she's gonna visit.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well maybe, maybe she's with us right now?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, her first day on a new spiritual plane and she's gonna come to the
coffeehouse!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (entering, in a hurry) Guys! Guys! I just saw two people having sex in a
car right outside.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Uhh, Pheebs' Grandmother just died.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Ohh my God, I'm so sorry.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> It's okay. Actually y'know what, it's kinda cool. 'Cause it's like
y'know, one life ends and another begins.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (to the guys) Not the way they're doing it. What, what happened? How did
she die?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well umm, okay we were in the market and she bent down to get some
yogurt and she just never came back up again.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Pheebs, I'm so sorry.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> It was really sweet. The last thing she said to me was; &quot;Okay dear,
you go get the eggs and I'm gonna get the yogurt and we'll meet at the checkout
counter.&quot; And y'know what? We <b>will</b> meet at the checkout counter.</p>

<p>[Scene: <i>Bloomingdale's</i>, Rachel is fixing Joey up with some new clothes.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay now Joey, y'know that since you're returning all of this stuff
right after the audition you're gonna have to wear underwear?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> All right, then you'd better show me some of that too then.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, it's missing something. Ooh, I know! Umm, okay. (Goes and grabs a
bag, that looks like a purse, and shows it to Joey.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Really? A purse?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> It's not a purse! It's a shoulder bag.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> It looks like a women's purse.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No Joey, look. Trust me, all the men are wearing them in the spring
catalog. Look. (Shows him.) See look, <b>men</b>, carrying the bag.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> See look, <b>women</b>, carrying the bag. (He puts it on his shoulder and
looks at himself in the mirror and likes what he sees.) But it is odd how a women's purse
looks good on me, a man.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Exactly! Unisex!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Maybe you need sex. <b>I</b> had sex a couple days ago.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No! No Joey! U-N-I-sex.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, I ain't gonna say no to that.</p>

<p>[Scene: Ursula's apartment, Phoebe is about to break the bad news to her sister. She
knocks on the door.]</p>

<p>Ursula: Who is it?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> It's Phoebe.</p>

<p>Ursula: Oh great! (Opens the door.) (Disappointed) Oh, you. Umm, what's up?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Umm, well I sorta have some bad news, can I come in?</p>

<p>Ursula: Umm, yeah&#151;no thanks.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Umm, well, umm Grandma died.</p>

<p>Ursula: Wow! Didn't she die like five years ago?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, she just died today! Okay, umm, we're having a memorial service
tomorrow.</p>

<p>Ursula: Okay, I know that I went to that all ready.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No you didn't!</p>

<p>Ursula: Well, then who's been dead for five years?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, lots of people! Look, are you coming to memorial service or not?</p>

<p>Ursula: Umm, no. See I already thought she was dead so I kinda made my peace with it.
Plus, I'm going to a concert tomorrow. So&#133; I'd invite you, but umm, I only have two
tickets left.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Fine. Okay, enjoy your concert. (Starts to leave.)</p>

<p>Ursula: Thanks! Enjoy your funeral.</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Ross and Chandler are on the couch as Joey enters with his new
bag.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey!</p>

<p>(As he walks past both Chandler and Ross notice the bag and stare at each other in
shock.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Wow! You look just like your son Mrs. Tribbiani!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What? Are you referring to my man's bag? At first, I thought it just
looked good, but it's practical too. Check it out! It's got compartments for all your
stuff! Your wallet! Your keys! Your address book!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Your make-up!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (entering) Joey, what are you doing with the bag? You're audition is not
until tomorrow.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, but sandwich time is right now. (Removes a sandwich and starts
eating.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Joey, y'know you get any mustard on that bag, you can't return it.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Why would I return it? I love this bag!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> All right, then you owe me $350.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Fine! Do you take Vasa or Mustercard? (He's holding the fake credit cards
that come with the bag.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (glaring at him) Joey&#133;</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> All right relax, look I'll pay you with the money from the acting job I am
definitely gonna get thanks to you.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What's the part, Anti-man?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hey, don't listen to them. I think it's sexy.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> U-N-I-sexy? (Smiles provocatively.) </p>

<p>[Scene: Phoebe's Grandmother's memorial, Phoebe is at the door welcoming people.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well hello, Mrs. Penella! Thank you so much for coming! Well, okay look,
here's your umm, 3-D glasses and Reverend Pong will tell you when to put them on.</p>

<p>(The gang arrives.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hi sweetie!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey, how are you holding up?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey Pheebs, I'm so sorry.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (notices his bag.) Hey, y'know what? My Grandma had the exact same bag!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Here, I brought you some flowers. (He pulls them out of the bag.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Thanks!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Pulling flowers out it makes the bag look a lot more masculine.</p>

<p>(Another man, an older man, enters, looking around and bumps into Chandler.)</p>
<b>

<p>Man:</b> Oops, I'm sorry. Excuse me. Is this the umm, the memorial?</p>

<p>(The gang moves off as Phoebe greets the new guest.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, welcome.</p>
<b>

<p>Man: </b>Hello. Hello.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Umm here's your 3-D glasses.</p>
<b>

<p>Man:</b> Oh, umm, all right.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> So how did you know Francis?</p>
<b>

<p>Man:</b> Well I actually, I-I really, I haven't seen her for years. But umm, well I-I
was pretty tight with-with her and her daughter.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Really?! What's your name?</p>
<b>

<p>Man:</b> Umm, Frank Buffay. </p>

<p>(Needless to say, Phoebe is stunned into silence. And one audience member gasps.) </p>

<p><b>Frank Sr.:</b> (Seeing the look on her face) Y'know what? Strike that. My name uh,
actually is-is Joe. Uh, Joe umm, Hill.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> You're Frank Buffay?</p>

<p><b>Frank Sr.:</b> Shh! (Whispers) No! Joe Hill!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> You just said&#133;</p>

<p><b>Frank Sr.:</b> Y'know what, I gotta go. And thank you <b>so</b> much for coming.
(Hands back his glasses and hurries out.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> But&#133;</p>

<p>(Phoebe takes one step after him and stops.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh my God!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What?! What honey?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What happened?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> That was my dad!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh my God!</p>

<p>(They all look down the hall he left from.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (approaches, wearing his glasses) Hey you guys, check it out. Check it
out. (Moves his hand towards and away from his face.) It's like it's coming right at me.
(Chandler helps out a little bit by pushing on Joey's arm, which causes his hand to slap
him in his face.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Commercial Break</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: The Funeral Home, continued from earlier. Phoebe is returning after looking for
her father.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, did you catch him?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Uh-huh.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Wh-what did he say?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> He said, &quot;Nice to meet you Glenda.&quot; (They stare at her,
dumbfounded) Well, obviously I couldn't give him my real name?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Why?! Why not?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Come on, you saw the way he ran out of here! What do you think? He's
gonna stick around and talk to the daughter he abandoned!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What did you say to him?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, I said, I told him y'know, that I was the executor person of
Francis' will and that I needed to talk to him so I'm gonna meet him at the coffee house
later.</p>
<b>

<p>The Pastor:</b> Could everyone please take their seats?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> All right, well, I just can't think about that right now. I just wanna
say good-bye to my Grandma.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> All right, let's go say good-bye.</p>

<p>(They put on their glasses and try to find their way to their seats.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, after the funeral, everyone is there.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (entering, with bag) Hey! I'm off to my audition. How do I look?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ahhh, I think you look <b>great</b>! That bag is gonna get you that
part.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> And a date with a man!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Y'know what? Make fun all you want. <b>This</b> is a great bag! Okay? And
it's as handy as it is becoming. Now, just because you don't understand something, doesn't
make it wrong. All right? So from now on you guys are gonna have to get used to the fact
that Joey, (pats the bag) comes with a bag! (Exits.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> All right, I'd better go too. I have to go talk to my dad.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ooh, Pheebs, what are you gonna say? Are you gonna tell him who you are?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Umm, no, not at first 'cause I-I don't want to freak him out</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, but aren't you pissed at him?! I mean this guy <b>abandoned</b> you!
I gotta tell you if this were me, this guy would be in some serious physical danger!
(Getting worked up) I mean I-I-I'd walk in there and I'd be like, &quot;Yo, dad! You and
me outside right now!&quot; (Calming down.) I kinda scared myself.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well, at least you scared someone.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Y'know it's funny, you'd <b>think</b> I'd be angry. I mean, you'd <b>think</b>
I'd wanna rip his tiny little head off. Fortunately, I'm past it.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Phoebe, you do seem a little tense. Here, let me help you. </p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> All right.</p>

<p>(She goes over and tries to give Phoebe a massage. Phoebe yelps in pain and jumps away
from her.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh! Get off!! Ow!! Oh, stop it!! Why?! Why are you doing that to me?!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What are you talking about?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> As a masseuse and a human, I'm begging you, never do that to anyone!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (indignant) I give good massages! (Ross laughs.) I used to give them to
Rachel all the time before she got allergic! And-and-and Chandler loves them! Watch! (She
starts giving Chandler a massage.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (seeing the look on Chandler's face) He-he does not like it! He hates
it! He's in pain!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No he's not!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (wincing) Yes, he is!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I'm sorry but, ow-owww-owww!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You've been lying to me? I can't believe you'd do that.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, maybe he just didn't want to hurt your feelings.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> But the minute we start to lie to each other&#133; (Pauses after she
realizes what she's saying.) And by 'we' I mean society.</p>

<p>[Scene: Joey's audition, he is with bag.]</p>

<p><b>The Casting Director:</b> Any time you're ready, Joey.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (reading from the script) Well, you must be new here. Why don't we get a
table and I'll buy you a drink.</p>

<p><b>The Casting Director:</b> (stopping him) I'm sorry. Could you, could you try it
without the purse?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, sure. (He takes it off and starts reading.) Well, you must be new
here. Maybe we should&#151;I'm sorry, can I ask you something? (He stops and asks a
question.)</p>

<p><b>The Casting Director:</b> Sure. What?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, first it's not a purse.</p>

<p><b>The Casting Director:</b> Okay, anytime.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I mean if-if you're thinking it's a woman's bag, it's not. It's a man's
bag!</p>

<p><b>The Casting Director:</b> Okayyyy! Anddd, go!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> All right look, let me show you the catalog! (Does so.) See? Huh? It's the
latest thing! Everyone's got one! Men! Women! Children! Everyone's carrying them!</p>

<p><b>The Casting Director:</b> Umm, do you sell these bags?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Noooo. No-no-no, these babies sell themselves.</p>

<p><b>The Casting Director:</b> Okay! Thank you! That was great!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah but I didn&#146;t read anything.</p>

<p><b>The Casting Director:</b> I think we've seen enough!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay! All right, I'll see ya. (As he's walking off stage.) (Patting the
bag.) We got it! We got it!</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler is poking his head in.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey, is Rachel here?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (coming all the way in) Listen, I just wanted to apologize about this
afternoon and the whole massage thing. Y'know? I-I really like 'em.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, please, stop! Look, we're supposed to be honest with each other. I-I
just wish you could tell me&#151;just say, &quot;I don't like your massages.&quot;</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (falling into that trap) I don't like your massages.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (starting to cry) See? It's no big deal.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, but now see you're crying!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I'm not crying about that! I'm crying about something that happened at
work.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (bursting into tears) My boyfriend said he didn't like my massages.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> It's okay, you don't have to be the best at everything.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh my God! You don't know me at all!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, you give the worst massages in the world.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I'm crying here!!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, hear me out. Okay? You give the <b>best</b> bad massages. If
anybody was looking for the best bad massage and they were thinking to themselves,
&quot;Who's the best of that?&quot; They'd have to go to you.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Huh. So you're saying like umm, if there was an award for the best bad
massage, well who would get that?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, it would be you! You! Monica! And you'd get all the votes!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> So maybe they could umm, call the award the Monica?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Absolutely!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay. I suck!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah! (They hug.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Frank Sr. is just arriving.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Umm, thank you for meeting with me.</p>

<p><b>Frank Sr.:</b> Thank you. All right.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Come, sit. (He's hesitant.) Sit. (Still hesitating.) Sit! (He sits on
the arm of the couch.) Umm, all righty, before we get started I just&#151;I need you to
state for the official record that you are in fact Frank Buffay.</p>

<p><b>Frank Sr.:</b> Oh yes. Yes, yes, I am, uh-hmm.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Frank Sr.:</b> So, what did Francis leave me?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Huh?</p>

<p><b>Frank Sr.:</b> Well, that's why you wanted me to come, right?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh yes. Yes. Yeah&#151;no. She did. She left you umm, (looking in her
purse) this lipstick.</p>

<p><b>Frank Sr.:</b> Oh. Huh. It's huh, well it's (opens it) oh it's&#151;ew used. Umm,
cool.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay. I have just a few questions to ask so I'm going to get out my
official forms. (She picks up a couple of crumpled receipts.) Okay, so, question 1) You
and uh, you were married to Francis' daughter Lilly, is that correct?</p>

<p><b>Frank Sr.:</b> Yes, yes I was.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, umm, question 2) Umm, did that marriage end A. Happily, B. Medium,
or C. In the total abandonment of her and her two children?</p>

<p><b>Frank Sr.:</b> It really says that?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah. See? (Quickly shows him.)</p>

<p><b>Frank Sr.:</b> Well then I guess then I-I would I would have to say C.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hmm, okay, <b>total</b> abandonment. Okay, reasons for abandonment, A.
Top secret government work, B. Amnesia, or C. Or you're just a selfish, irresponsible bad,
bad man?</p>

<p><b>Frank Sr.:</b> Y'know, I don't think I want the lipstick that much. (Gets up to
leave.) But umm&#133; Oh, would you do me a favor? And umm, would you, would you give
Lilly that, please? (Hands her a note.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Frank Sr.:</b> Well Lilly, when you see Lilly would you give her that, that note?
Because I wanted to talk to her at the memorial but, well I pictured her getting mad at me
the way you got mad at me and I well, I chickened out. So, uh, I wrote her that note,
would you give it to her please?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> But you-you-you came to see Lilly?</p>

<p><b>Frank Sr.:</b> Yeah, yeah. Why?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Lilly's dead. (He looks up in shock.)</p>

<p><b>Frank Sr.:</b> She what?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> She's dead.</p>

<p><b>Frank Sr.:</b> Are you sure?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, if she isn't then cremating her was a <b>big</b> mistake.</p>

<p><b>Frank Sr.:</b> I can't believe this. I just&#151;I can't believe this.
How-how&#151;Oh my God. How long ago?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> 17 years ago.</p>

<p><b>Frank Sr.:</b> Oh! What about, what about the girls?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, Ursula is a waitress and-and she lives in Soho. And Phoebe,
(pause) is on this couch.</p>

<p>(Silence ensues.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yep, lipstick and a daughter, big day for you!</p>

<p><b>Frank Sr.:</b> Phoebe, I-I-I-umm, (Sits down next to her and brushes against her
leg.) Oops. (He backs up.) I just, I-I-I-I don&#146;t, I don&#146;t know what to say. I
just can't believe that you're my daughter, you're so pretty.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yes. Well, that's neither here nor there.</p>

<p><b>Frank Sr.:</b> So would it, would it make you feel better if I said I was very, very
sorry that I left?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Y'know what, it doesn&#146;t matter what you say it's not gonna make a
difference anyway, so you can just go.</p>

<p><b>Frank Sr.:</b> All right. Well, y'know in my defense I was a lousy father.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> That's a defense?</p>

<p><b>Frank Sr.:</b> Yes. Yes it is. I burned the formula and I put your diapers on
backwards. I mean, I made up a song to sing you to sleep, but that made you cry even more!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> You make up songs?</p>

<p><b>Frank Sr.:</b> Well no, just-just that one. But, it was stupid. Let's see, how did
it, how did it go. Umm. (Singing.) </p>
<i>

<p>Sleepy girl, sleepy girl.<br>
Why won't you go to sleep?<br>
Sleepy girl, sleepy girl.<br>
You're, you're, you're keeping me uppp! </i>(Yeah, that's to the tune of Smelly Cat.)<i></p>
</i>

<p>Yeah. </p>

<p>(Phoebe is trying not to smile. He moves closer and very shyly holds out his hand and
turns his head, hoping for Phoebe to take his hand. She doesn't.)</p>

<p><b>Frank Sr.:</b> I just, I y'know, I'm not very good at this. So, umm&#133; (Backs
away.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, I am. (Moves over and takes his hand.)</p>

<p>(She holds his hand for a little while then&#133;)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Not yet, no. (Drops his hand and moves back.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Ending Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Joey returns from his audition and finds everyone but
Phoebe there.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (dejected) Hi.</p>

<p><strong>All:</strong> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey man, how did the audition go?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Estelle said I didn't get it. (Sits down next to Rachel on the couch.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?! Why? Joey you were so ready for it!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, I thought so too but, she said the casting people had some problems
with me.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What kind of problem?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well to tell you the truth, they uh, (Pause) they had a problem with the
bag!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh my God!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Nooooo!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Y'know what? It was a stupid play anyway!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Y'know, Joey, I think it's time to give up the bag.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I don't wanna give up the bag. I don't have to give up the bag! Do I Rach?
(She's avoiding his eyes.) Oh, you think I should give up the bag!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Honey wait, Joey, I&#146;m sorry I mean as terrific as I think you are
with it&#133; (Looks for help.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, hey! (Ross nods in agreement as well.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> &#133;I just don't know if the world is ready for you and your bag.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I can't believe I'm hearing this!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Wait a minute! Wait a minute! I'm not saying that you shouldn&#146;t
have a bag, I just&#151;it's just there are other bags that are a little less umm, (Pause)
controversial.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah umm, they're called wallets.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>End</strong></p>

<hr>

514<html>

<head>
<title>The One Where Everyone Finds Out</title>
<meta HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=windows-1252">
<meta NAME="GENERATOR" CONTENT="Microsoft FrontPage 3.0">
<meta NAME="Template" CONTENT="C:\Program Files\Microsoft Office\Templates\friends.dot">
</head>

<body bgcolor="#FFFFFF" link="#008000">

<h1 align="center">The One Where Everyone Finds Out</h1>

<hr>

<p>Written by: Alexa Junge<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a></p>

<hr>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, everyone is eating some Chinese food.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (looking out the window) Oh hey, you guys, look! Ugly Naked Guy is
putting stuff in boxes!</p>

<p>(They all run and join her at the window.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I'd say from the looks of it; our naked buddy is moving.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Ironically, most of the boxes seem to be labeled clothes.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ohh, I'm gonna miss that big old squishy butt.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> And we're done with the chicken fried rice.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey! Hey! If he's moving, maybe I should try to get his place!</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Good idea! Yes!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> It would be so cool to live across from you guys!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey, yeah! Then we could do that telephone thing! Y'know, you have a can,
we have a can and it's connected by a string!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Or we can do the <b>actual</b> telephone thing.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Opening Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Ugly Naked Guy's apartment, Ross, Rachel, and Phoebe are checking out the
place. Luckily, Ugly Naked Guy is nowhere to be seen.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh my God! I love this apartment! Isn't it perfect?! I can't believe I
never realized how great it is!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well that is because your eye immediately goes to the big naked man.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> It's amazing! You better hurry up and fill out an application or I'm
gonna beat you to it.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (laughing) Ohh. (Phoebe takes a couple of steps to the door and Ross
quickly hurries out.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, I never thought I'd say this, but I'm gonna go use Ugly Naked
Guy's bathroom. (Does so.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (looking out the window) Oh, look! There's Monica and Chandler! (Starts
yelling.) Hey! Hey, you guys! Hey! (Chandler and Monica start taking each other's clothes
off.) Ohh!! Ohh! Ahh-ahhh!!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (screaming) Ahhh!! Chandler and Monica!! Chandler and Monica!!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh my God!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> <b>CHANDLER AND MONICA!!!!</p>
</b>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> OH MY GOD!!!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> <b>OH!!</b> <b>MY EYES!!!</b> <b>MY EYES!!!!</p>
</b>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Because I'm in love with Monica!!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> You're-you're what?!</p>

<p>(Monica comes out of the bathroom like a bolt, and Rachel and Joey both enter.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Love her! That's right, I&#133;LOVE&#133;HER!!! I love her!! (They
walk together and hug.) I love you, Monica.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I love you too Chandler. (They kiss.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I just&#151;I thought you guys were doing it, I didn't know you were in
love!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Dude!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> And hats off to Phoebe. Quite a competitor. (Pause) And might I say
your breasts are still showing.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> God! (She turns and buttons up.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> All right! So that's it! It's over! Everybody knows!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well actually, Ross doesn't.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes, and we'd appreciate it if no one told him yet.</p>

<p>(Joey suddenly gets very angry.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Ending Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Ross's new apartment, he is showing his boss, Dr. Ledbetter his new place and
new outlook on life.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> A new place for a new Ross. I'm gonna have you and all the guys from work
over once it's y'know, furnished.</p>

<p><b>Dr. Ledbetter:</b> I must say it's nice to see you back on your feet.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well I am that. And that whole rage thing is definitely behind me.</p>

<p><b>Dr. Ledbetter:</b> I wonder if its time for you to rejoin our team at the museum?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh Donald that-that would be great. I am totally ready to come back to
work. I&#151;What? (He notices something through the window.) No! Wh&#133; What are you
doing?!! (Dr. Ledbetter is slowly backing away.) <b>GET OFF MY SISTER!!!!!!!!!!!!!</b> </p>

<p align="center"><strong>End</strong></p>

<hr>
