515<html>

<head>
<title>The One With The Girl Who Hits Joey</title>
<meta HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=windows-1252">
<meta NAME="GENERATOR" CONTENT="Microsoft FrontPage 3.0">
<meta NAME="Template" CONTENT="C:\Program Files\Microsoft Office\Templates\friends.dot">
</head>

<body bgcolor="#FFFFFF" link="#008000">

<h1 align="center">The One With The Girl Who Hits Joey</h1>

<hr>

<p>Written by: Adam Chase<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a></p>

<hr>

<p>[Scene: The hallway, Ross is running up the stairs. Note: This show continues where the
last one left off.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Chandler!!! Chandler!!! (He opens the door to the apartment but is stopped
by the chain; Chandler and Monica quickly stop making out and try to get dressed.)
Chandler, I saw what you were doing through the window! Chandler, I saw what you were
doing to my sister! Now get out here!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (To Monica) Wow! Listen, we had a good run. What was it? Four? Five
months? I mean, that's more than most people have in a lifetime! So, good-bye, take care,
bye-bye then! (He kisses her and starts to climb out the balcony window.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What are you doing?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, I'm going on the lamb.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Come on Chandler, come on, I can handle Ross. (They go to the door. Ross
is trying to stick his hand through and undo the chain; Monica pushes his hand back.) (To
Ross) Hold on! (She opens the door.) Hey Ross. What's up bro?</p>

<p>(Ross spots Chandler and starts chasing him around the kitchen table. Chandler runs and
hides behind Monica.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What the hell are doing?!!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (running from the guy's apartment with Joey in tow) Hey, what's-what's
going on?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, I think, I <b>think</b> Ross knows about me and Monica.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (panicking) Dude! He's right there!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (To Chandler) I thought you were my best friend, this is my sister! My
best friend and my sister! I-I cannot believe this!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Look, we're not just messing around! I love her. Okay, I'm in love
with her.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I'm so sorry that you had to find out this way. I'm sorry, but it's
true, I love him too.</p>

<p>(There's a brief pause.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (happily) My best friend and my sister! I cannot believe this. (He hugs
them both.) (To Joey and Rachel) You guys probably wanna get some hugs in too, huh? Big
news!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Awww, no, it's okay, we've actually known for a while.</p>

<p>(There's another pause as Ross gets angry again.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What? What? What?! You guys knew? (Joey and Rachel backup against the
door.) You <b>all</b> knew and you didn't tell me?!!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, Ross, we were worried about you. We didn't know how you were going
to react.</p>

<p>(Pause.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (happily again) You were worried about me? You didn't know how I was going
to react? (He hugs them both.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay, all right, whew! What do you say we all clear out of here and let
these two lovebirds get back down to business? (Ross turns and glares at him.)
Hey-hey-hey, I-I-I'm just talking here, he-he's the one doing your sister.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Opening Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, everyone is there.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey, you know what I just realized? If you guys ever have kids&#133;</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (interrupting) Whoa-whoa-whoa! We're having kids?!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (quickly) I call Godfather!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You can't just <b>call</b> Godfather. Don't you think her brother should
be Godfather?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Sure, if you cared enough to call it first.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Guys, you're a few steps ahead of us.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, big zero gravity moon steps.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh! Oh, I just thought of the greatest wedding gift to get you.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ooh, I'll go in on that with you! I couldn't think of anything.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay.</p>

<p>(A girl enters.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (to her) Oh, hey Katie! Everyone, this is Katie.</p>

<p><b>Katie:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> So, are you ready to go?</p>

<p><b>Katie:</b> Yeah, I just gotta run to the bathroom.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh sure, right back there. (Points.)</p>

<p><b>Katie:</b> Hey, where are we going to lunch?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I was thinking Chinese food.</p>

<p><b>Katie:</b> Ohh, I <b>love</b> Chinese! How did you know I love Chinese?! (She hits
him repeatedly as she says that.)</p>

<p>(She heads to the bathroom and Joey sits back down.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> She is so cute! You could fit her right in your little pocket!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I don't know. I mean I like her a lot, and she's really nice, but&#133;</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> But what?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (shyly) She keeps punching me.</p>

<p>(They all laugh.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> In that cute, little, sweet way she just did?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey, it's a lot harder than it looks! Okay? (Quietly) She-she-she's
hurting me.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I know what you need, you need a bodyguard. Hey Ross, what is Ben doing
after preschool?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey listen, come on, Joey is having a problem! A little girl is
beating him up.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Aww, Joey, come here. (She takes his hand.) Look honey, I know this must
be really, really difficult for you and I--Oh, I'm sorry. Am I hurting you?</p>

<p>[Scene: Ross's apartment, he's unpacking after moving in. There's a knock on the door
and he answers it.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (opens it to reveal Phoebe) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey! I brought you some house warming gifts.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Aww.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah. Salt, so your life always has flavor.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Huh.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Bread, so you never go hungry.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Ohh.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> And a scented candle for the bathroom, because well, y'know.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Thanks. Thanks. And thanks again.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah!</p>

<p>(The door across the hall opens and a guy walks into Ross's apartment.)</p>
<b>

<p>Guy:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hi!</p>
<b>

<p>Guy:</b> Welcome to the building. I'm uh, Steve Sarah; I'm president of the tenants
committee.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh hi! Ross Geller. And this is my friend Phoebe.</p>

<p><b>Steve:</b> Oh hi Phoebe.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Mr. President.</p>

<p><b>Steve:</b> I came to talk to you about Howard.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Howard?</p>

<p><b>Steve:</b> Yeah, he's the handy man. He's gonna be retiring next week and everyone
who lives here is kicking in a 100 bucks as a thank you for all the hard work type of
thing.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh that's nice.</p>

<p><b>Steve:</b> Yeah. So, do you want to give a check? Or&#133;</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh. Uhh&#133;</p>

<p><b>Steve:</b> Oh look, you don't have to give it too me right now! You can slip it
under my door. (Points to his apartment across the hall.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No-no, it's not that, it's just&#133; I-I <b>just</b> moved in.</p>

<p><b>Steve:</b> Well, the guy's worked here for 25 years.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yes, but I've lived here for 25 minutes.</p>

<p><b>Steve:</b> Oh, okay, I get it. (Starts to leave.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No wait, look. Look! I'm sorry, it's just I've never even <b>met</b>
Howard. I-I mean I don't know Howard.</p>

<p><b>Steve:</b> Howard's the <b>handy</b> man!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yes but too me he's just, man.</p>

<p><b>Steve:</b> Okay, fine, whatever. Welcome to the building. (Exits.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (To Phoebe) Ugh, can you believe that guy!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah. I really like his glasses.</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Ross is lamenting to Chandler and Rachel about his
troubles in his new building.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> &#133;so then President Steve told everyone that I was a cheapskate, and
now the whole building hates me! A little kid spit on my knee! Y'know what I'm gonna do?
I'm gonna throw a party. That's right. For everyone in the building, and I'm gonna sit
them down and explain to them, I am not a bad guy. I am not a cheap guy! I'm just a guy
who-who stands up for what he believes in. A man with principles.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (To Rachel) Sounds like a fun party.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hmm. Look, Ross, if you want your neighbors to like you, why don't you
just pay the hundred bucks? The party's gonna cost you way more than that.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> It doesn't matter! It's my principles! We're talking about my principles!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, I thought it was about your neighbors liking you.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, they'll like me. Once they come to my awesome PAR-TAY! Okay, I gotta
run. I gotta go get some nametags. (Exits.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> And that crazy party animal will be your brother-in-law.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Very, very funny, but don't say things like that in front of Monica. I
don't want you putting any ideas in her head.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Umm, Chandler, you <b>do</b> realize that those ideas are probably
already in Monica's head.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Wh-wh-why?!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, because she loves you and because you love her.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, so, what's that supposed to mean?!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hey, Chandler, don't freak out! I'm telling you something you already
know! Come on, she broke up with Richard because he didn't want to have babies. And she's
a woman, and she's almost 30, and y'know it's Monica.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I don't see it that way. Okay? Because, I see two Monicas, the one
that was my friend, who lived across the hall, and wanted to have a lot of babies and then
the new Monica, who I just started to date. Now, who's to say what <b>she</b> wants?!
I&#146;m right. I'm right. Am I right?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No, you're right, you are absolutely right. I mean that makes, that
makes everything different.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay. It's not different at all, is it?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Not unless different means the same.</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Joey is sitting on the couch with Katie.]</p>

<p><b>Katie:</b> You were so funny with that waiter! You're such a nut! (She slaps her
thighs, Joey jerks, and spills some of his coffee.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (sets the coffee down) Y'know, breadstick fangs are always funny.</p>

<p><b>Katie:</b> No, you make them funny. You're the funny one! (She punches him again and
he retreats to the arm of the couch.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Uhh, look Katie, uh listen, we-we need to talk. Okay? Umm, look I like
you. I-I really do, I like you a lot. Okay? But sometimes when you, when you playfully
punch me like that it-it feels like someone's hitting me with a very tiny but very <b>real</b>
bat.</p>

<p><b>Katie:</b> Aww, like I could hurt you. Are you making fun of my size? Don't make fun
of me because of my size! (She punches him again and almost knocks him off the arm of the
couch.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler and Monica are curled up on one of the chairs.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Isn't this great?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hmm.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Couldn't you just stay like this forever? (His eyes snap open.)
Chandler! Couldn't you just stay here forever?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, here, somewhere else, y'know where-where ever. (Gets up.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Are you okay?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, I'm cool. Casual.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What-what are you doing?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I'm just hanging out. Y'know, having fun. Y'know with the girl that
I'm seeing casually.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Man, I knew it! I knew you were going to do this!!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Get all freaked out because everybody was talking and just joking around
about marriage and stuff.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, you <b>do</b> want all that stuff, right?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh and <b>you</b> know what I want!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes! You want babies! You have baby fever!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I do not have baby fever!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh please, you are obsessed with babies and-and marriage and
everything that's related to babies and-and marriage! I've got an idea, why don't we turn
down the heat on this pressure cooker?!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Have you lost your mind? Chandler, this isn't about me! This is about
you and all your weird relationship commitment crap!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Nah-uh! I know you! Okay? I know the thoughts that you have in the
head--in your head!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You don't know everything. Did you know that I'm going out with Rachel
tonight instead of you? Hmm? And did you know that the only baby around here is you?! And
did you know that I can't even look at you right now?! (She storms out.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, I did not know that.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Commercial Break</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Chandler is getting advice from Ross and Joey.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> It's gonna be okay, right? I mean she's not gonna leave me? This is,
this is fixable.</p>
<b>

<p>Ross and <b>Joey:</b></b> Oh yeah, yeah, sure. Absolutely.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> By me?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, no!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No-no.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, unless you make some kind of big gesture.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, big!</p>

<p>(Monica enters.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Uh-oh, shht! The Misses.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Gunther, can I get a coffee (Looks at Chandler) to go?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Monica. (Goes to talk to her.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I'm still not done not wanting to talk to you.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Just tell me what I need to do to make things right.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, that's what we do. Y'know, I-I mess up and then you tell me how
to fix it and then I do and then y'know you think I'm all cute again.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Really? I'm really tired of being your relationship tutor. You're gonna
have to figure this one for yourself. All right? Y'know what? If you're too afraid to be
in a real relationship, then don't be in one. (She walks out.)</p>

<p>(Chandler turns to watch her go and then sees Ross and Joey both with huge grimaces on
their faces.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Ross's apartment, he's having his party, only he's the only guest. He gets up
and puts on a nametag that says Ross, but doesn't quite like it. So he takes it off and
puts on one that says Dr. Geller and he puts the Ross one underneath the Dr. Geller one.
Then as he turns off the music, we hear the party for Howard raging in the apartment
across the hall.]</p>
<b>

<p>Party Guests:</b> (chanting) Howard! Howard! Howard! Howard! (Ross goes to investigate
the noise) Howard! Howard! Howard! (They're holding Howard above their heads.) Howard!
Howard! Howard! Howard! Howard! (He sees Phoebe chanting along with them.) Howard! Howard!
Howard! Howard! Howard! Howard! Howard! Howard! Howard! Yay!!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Phoebe! (He grabs her arm to get her attention.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, hi Ross!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What are you doing?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, I thought this was your party and it turns out it&#146;s a party for
Howard. He's just the sweetest little man! (A guest walks up to her.)</p>

<p><b>Guest #1:</b> See ya Phoebe! Oh and hey, thanks for chipping in!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You chipped in?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, uh-huh, a 100 dollars.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Phoebe! I can't believe you gave them money! I thought you agreed it was
totally unreasonable that they asked me for that money!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, but they didn't ask me! Y'know? This way I'm just y'know, the
exotic, generous stranger. That's always fun to be.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, but you're making me look bad!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No I'm not. No! If anything I'm making you look better! They'll see you
talking to me and that's--I'm a hit!</p>

<p><b>Steve:</b> (walking up) Oh hey, Pheebs!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Steve:</b> Oh hey, Ross. Umm, see, I was thinking maybe you two could switch
apartments because Phoebe's more our kind of people. Something to think about. (Walks
away.)</p>

<p>(Ross turns and glares at Phoebe.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, okay, my bad.</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Rachel is getting some coffee as Joey enters. He's looking a
little puffy, but that's probably from the large number of different color sweaters he's
wearing.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hi! Wow! You look, you look&#133;big.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Thanks! I've been working out. Hey listen, is it obvious that I'm wearing
six sweaters?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Uhhh, yeah. But it's not obvious why.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well look, I&#146;m breaking up with Katie so I had to put on some extra
padding. Y'know? I mean, if she hits me when she's happy, can you imagine how hard she's
gonna hit me when I tell her I'm taking away the Joey love?</p>

<p><b>Katie:</b> (entering) Hi!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey! Hiya!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hey! Hey, cute jacket!</p>

<p><b>Katie:</b> Oh, thanks! That's so sweet! (She punches Rachel like she punched Joey.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh! Ow! (Joey motions, &quot;You see what I mean?!&quot;)</p>

<p><b>Katie:</b> Oh, ow! Did Joey tell you to say that? You guys, (Punches Joey) are too
much! (Punches Rachel.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Whoa! (Laughs) Y'know what Katie? I gotta tell ya I-I-I-I think you are
the one who is too much. (She punches Katie back.)</p>

<p><b>Katie:</b> Ohh, Joey has the nicest friends! (She punches Rachel.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ohh, and the nicest girlfriend! (She retaliates.)</p>

<p><b>Katie:</b> You're so sweet! (Punches Rachel yet again.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ohh, you're so sweet! (She kicks Katie in the shin.)</p>

<p><b>Katie:</b> Oww!!!! Joey, she just kicked me.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Huh.</p>

<p><b>Katie:</b> Well? Aren't you gonna do something?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Uhh&#133;.</p>

<p><b>Katie:</b> You'd better do something, or I'm gonna walk out that door right now!
Well? Are you gonna?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Nah.</p>

<p>(She looks at Rachel and storms out. After she's left Joey hugs Rachel in thanks.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Howard's party, Phoebe is talking Ross up to two more partygoers. Ross isn't
happy about it.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (trying to get her attention) Phoebe?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (ignoring him and continuing her conversation) That's what I'm saying.
(Laughs.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (tapping her on the shoulder) Phoebe? Phoebe?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ooh. (Turns to him.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Look, this is a disaster! Can't I please just go?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No! No! I'm talking you up to people. Just give it a little time, all
right? Relax, get something to eat! Okay?</p>

<p>(They go to the food table.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> So uh, what did you tell them about me?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, I was telling them about you and Emily. Y'know, try to get some
sympathy.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Ohh. (He cuts himself a piece of cake.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> But somehow you came off as the bad guy.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, I think I told it wrong. Y'know, we should talk about that because
I don't totally understand what happened there.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (trying a piece of cake) Ohh, this cake is really good!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, okay, see? Things are looking up already!</p>

<p><b>Guest #2:</b> (sees the cake) Oh my God! Someone cut Howard's cake! (Ross tries
dumping it into a nearby plant.) Who would do a think like that?</p>

<p>(Steve goes over to look at Ross who's trying to look cool, but has some frosting on
his lip.)</p>

<p><b>Steve:</b> 3-B!</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Oh yeah, aww!</p>

<p><b>Steve:</b> Okay, you got your free food! You ruined everyone's fun! Don't you think
it's time you went home?!</p>

<p><b>Guest #3:</b> Yeah, leave!</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Yeah, get out! Now!</p>

<p><b>Steve:</b> Go back to 3-B, 3-B!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> All right, everyone calm down! Everyone calm down! I have something that
I would like to say! Who here likes Ross? (Ross is the only one who raises his hand and
Phoebe glares at him to put his hand back down.) Of course you don't like him! He-he
didn't give you any money, he raised his own hand when I asked, &quot;Who hear likes
Ross,&quot; and he's wearing two nametags! (He takes one off.) I-I'll be honest with you
guys, when I first met Ross I didn't like him at all! But then once I got to know him I
saw that he's really sweet and caring and <b>very</b> generous. I mean, all I'm saying is
don't judge Ross before you get to know him all right? I mean, I like all you guys now,
but when I first meet you y'know Kurt, I thought, y'know abrasive drunk, umm Lola, mind
numbingly stupid! And okay, you guys (She turns to an elderly gentleman and a 20 something
woman, who're a couple.) (To the girl) Gold-digger, (To the old guy) cradle robbing perv!
So, I think you all know what I mean.</p>

<p>[Scene: Ross's apartment, Ross and Phoebe have been banished to Ross's place.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Obviously I didn't think they were gonna start throwing things. I just
thought if I kept insulting everyone, you would jump in and defend everyone and then you
could look like the hero.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh wow, yeah! See, I did not get that.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler comes running in. Everyone else is already
there.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Where's Monica?! Where is she? I need to talk to her! It's urgent! Is
she here?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (raising her hand) I'm Monica.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I need to talk to you, it's urgent!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, I've been doing a lot of thinking about us, y'know a lot of uhh,
us thinking. And uh, well I guess there's only one-one way to do this. (He slowly and
awkwardly gets down on one knee.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Wait what-wh-wh-what are you doing?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (getting out a ring box) Monica&#133;</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No-no, don't-don't-don't do it!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Will you marry me?</p>

<p>(Phoebe hides her eyes in shame. Rachel is starring at them wide-eyed and open-mouthed.
Joey and Ross are stunned to temporary silence.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh-no. No. No.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What a bad idea!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ohhhh, I cannot look at it! (She doesn't move.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Chandler, why are you doing this?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I don't know. But I know I'm not afraid to do this.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Chandler.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I'm doing this because I'm sorry?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Do you umm, you really think the best reason to get married is because
you're sorry?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No, the best reason to get married is pregnancy. Sorry is pretty much
fourth y'know, behind being ready and actually <b>wanting</b> to get married. (Laughs.)
Will you be my wife?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (kneels with him) Chandler, umm, I want you to take just a minute and I
want you to think about how <b>ridiculous</b> this sounds.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, I'm kinda wishing everyone wasn't here right now.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Honey! Do you know that none of that stuff came from me?! I mean I never
said I wanted to have babies and get married right now!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah I know, but I was really confused and then I talked to these
guys. (Turns to look at Ross and Joey.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Who? Two divorces and Joey?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> She's right y'know.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, but still, cheap shot!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Y'know what? Y'know when I said that I want you to deal with this
relationship stuff all on your own? Well, you're not ready for that.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I didn't think I was!</p>

<p>(They hug.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh my God, what would have done if I said yes?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well I would've been happy because I would've be able to spend the
rest of my life with the woman that I love. Or, you would've seen a Chandler shaped hole
in that door. (Points at the door.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Ending Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Everyone is there.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey Ross, will you pass me that knife?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, I will not!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, it's okay. You don't have to be so mean about it.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You're right, I'm sorry. Will you marry me?</p>

<p>(They all laugh.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Aw, and I was gonna ask you to marry me because I forgot to say hello to
you last week.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh no wait Pheebs, I think for something like that you just ask them to
move in with you. But I'm not sure, Chandler?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, how long is this going to go on.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well I think the length of teasing is directly related to how insane you
were so, a long time.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> This is fun. Hey Rach, remember that whole &quot;We were on a break
thing?&quot; Well, I'm sorry, will you marry me? (Laughs--whines as he sees that no one is
laughing. They're just staring at him in shock.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> That's not funny.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> That's not funny at all!</p>

<p>(They all get up and leave.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>End</strong></p>

<hr>

516<html>

<head>
<title>The One With A Cop</title>
<meta HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=windows-1252">
<meta NAME="GENERATOR" CONTENT="Microsoft FrontPage 3.0">
<meta NAME="Template" CONTENT="C:\Program Files\Microsoft Office\Templates\friends.dot">
</head>

<body bgcolor="#FFFFFF" link="#008000">

<h1 align="center">The One With A Cop</h1>

<hr>

<p>Story by: Alicia Sky Varinaitis<br>
Teleplay by: Gigi McCreery &amp; Perry Rein<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a></p>

<hr>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Monica and Chandler are sitting on one of the chairs doing
a crossword puzzle.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What are you guys doing up?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, we wanted to finish the crossword before we went to bed. Hey, do
you know a six-letter word for red?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (thinks) Dark red.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, I think that's wrong, but there's a Connect the Dots in here for
you later. (To Monica) Hey, how about maroon?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (checks to see if it works) Yes, you are so smart! (Kisses him.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Aww, you guys are so cute!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I know.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> All right, I'll see you in the morning.</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler and <b>Monica:</b></b> Okay.</p>

<p>[Scene: Joey's bedroom, time lapse. He's asleep and dreaming. In his dream he's doing
the crossword puzzle with&#133;wait for it&#133;Monica!]</p>
<b>

<p>Dream <b>Monica:</b></b> Y'know, I love doing crossword puzzles with you honey!</p>
<b>

<p>Dream <b>Joey:</b></b> Aww, me too. Now let's finish this and go to bed.</p>
<b>

<p>Dream <b>Monica:</b> </b>Okay! There's only one left, three letter word, not dog
but&#133;</p>
<b>

<p>Dream <b>Joey:</b></b> Cat.</p>
<b>

<p>Dream <b>Monica:</b></b> Yes! You are so smart! (Kisses him.) I love you.</p>
<b>

<p>Dream <b>Joey:</b></b> I love you too.</p>

<p>(They hug.)</p>

<p>[Cut back to Joey in bed, he's smiling, enjoying the dream as he wakes up. Suddenly, he
realized what he was dreaming about and bolts upright in bed.]</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Opening Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, everyone is there but Ross and Joey. Gunther hands them the bill,
and Chandler gives some money to pay it.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (looking at the bill) Uhh, we still need a tip.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> All right. Hold on. (She starts digging in the chair.) I got it. Nickel!
(Donates it.) How much more do we need?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> A couple of bucks.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, dime! (Donates that.) You guys should probably keep talking; this
could take a while. (Finds something else.) Oh no, wait! Look it! Whoa! (Looks at it.) Oh
my God, this is a police badge!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Wow!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh that's so cool! Why would a cop come in here though? They don't
serve donuts. (No one laughs.) Y'know what actually, could you discover the badge again? I
think I can come up with something better than that.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Phoebe, I bet somebody's missing that badge.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, I should probably take it back. Ooh, but you know what? While I'm
at the police station, I could check their Ten Most Wanted lists because my friend Fritzy
has been like number 11 forever, so this could be her year! (She crosses her fingers in
hope.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (entering) Hey, you guys!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hey Joey!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (To Monica) Hey. That uh, that my sweatshirt?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh yes, it is. I'm sorry I borrowed it, I was cold. I hope its okay?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well uh, it's just that uh, y'know if-if you're gonna be wearing someone's
sweatshirt shouldn't it be your boyfriends--and I&#146;m not him.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I'm sorry, I'll give it back to you.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No-no! No! I mean it's gonna be all smelling like Monica!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Are you saying I smell bad?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No! No, you smell like a meadow. (Pause.) I'm sorry. (Runs to the
bathroom.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What's with him?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, y'know what? The last time Joey went to a meadow, his mother was
shot by a hunter.</p>

<p>[Scene: A couch store, Ross is trying to decide on a new couch for his place. He has
dragged Rachel along for the trip, and she's not too happy about it. Ross is sitting on it
in different ways to see how it feels. He tries to just sit on it normally, and then he
tries flopping on it. One thing about this couch, it's huge. It's like twice the size of a
normal full size couch. Whoever designed this thing, needs help and fast.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (disgusted at Ross's antics) Ugh!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (To Rachel) Yeah, I still don't know. (To the salesman who is hovering
nearby) I'm sorry I just wanna make sure that I bought the right couch. I need a couch
that says, &quot;Kids welcome here.&quot; But that also says, (In a sexy voice) &quot;Come
here to me!&quot;</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?! You say that to kids?!!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No! No! No! The &quot;Come here to me&quot; is y'know for the ladies.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ross, honey, it's a nice couch. It's not a magic couch.</p>

<p><b>The Salesman:</b> You picked a great couch.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah?</p>

<p><b>The Salesman:</b> Yeah. Could you just sign right here please? (Hands him a
clipboard.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, sure. Whoa-whoa, what's this? The delivery charge is almost as much as
the couch!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Wait! No, that's ridiculous. Come on, he lives three blocks away!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, y'know what? I'll take it myself, thank you! (He signs the form and
hands it back to the salesman.) All right Rach, let's go! (He picks up one end of the
couch.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah! (She puts on her coat and turns around and sees Ross is expecting
her to help.) (Laughing.) Are you kiddin'?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, come on it's only three blocks! And-and, it's not very heavy, try it!
Come on! Come on!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (Disgustedly she goes and tries to pick up the couch. Much to her
amazement, she is successful.) Oh. Oh! I can do it!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah!</p>

<p><b>The Salesman:</b> You two are really gonna enjoy that couch.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh yeah, we're uh, yeah we're not together. (He starts backing out of the
store.)</p>

<p><b>The Salesman:</b> Ohh, okay. (Laughs.) Something didn't quite add up there. (Ross
stops, walks back to talk to the salesman, and in the process pushes Rachel up against a
wall.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ross!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What's that supposed to mean?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ross!</p>

<p><b>The Salesman:</b> Well you, her, I mean, she's very&#133;y'know. And you're
like&#133;y'know.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Not that it's any of your business, but we <b>did</b> go out.</p>

<p><b>The Salesman:</b> Really? You two?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah! Rach?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Come on, I don't really want to be doing this right now. I am carrying a
very heavy couch.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Then tell him quickly.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (To Ross) Fine! (To the salesman) We went out.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Not only did we go out, we did it 298 times!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ross!! Oh my--ugh!! You kept count?! You are <b>such</b> a loser!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> A loser you did it with (To the salesman) 298 times!</p>

<p>(Rachel pushes on the couch and pushes Ross out the door.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Outside of Central Perk, Phoebe is exiting and sees a woman put out her
cigarette on a tree.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh. Oh! Ma'am? Excuse me, ma'am? </p>

<p><b>The Smoking Woman:</b> Yes?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> You can't put your cigarette out on a tree!</p>

<p><b>The Smoking Woman:</b> Yeah I can, it worked real well.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No but you shouldn't! Don't ever do that again.</p>

<p><b>The Smoking Woman:</b> I won't! (Turns away) Until I have my next cigarette.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hold it! (Grabs the badge) N.Y.P.D! Freeze punk!</p>

<p><b>The Smoking Woman:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah that's right you are so busted. (To no one in particular.) Book
'em.</p>

<p><b>The Smoking Woman:</b> Who are you talking too?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Save it Red! Unless you wanna spend the night in the slammer, you
apologize to the tree.</p>

<p><b>The Smoking Woman:</b> I am <b>not</b> going to apologize to a tree!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> You apologize to the tree right now or I am calling for backup. (The
woman calls her bluff.) (Screaming at no one in particular) Backup! Backup!!</p>

<p><b>The Smoking Woman:</b> I-I'm sorry! Sorry.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, cancel backup! Cancel backup!</p>

<p>[Scene: Ross's building's lobby, he and Rachel are about to attempt to take the couch
upstairs.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay. (Throws off the last cushion.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ross, didn't you say that there was an elevator in here?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Uhh, yes I did but there isn't. Okay, here we go.</p>

<p>(They start the attempt. Ross is going backwards and reaches the first landing. This
staircase has three steps then a landing, makes a 90-degree turn, and has more steps
before another landing and another 90-degree turn.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, go left. Left! Left! (The bottom of the couch is hitting the
railing.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, y'know what? There is no more left, left!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh okay, lift it straight up over your head! Straight up over your head!
You can do it! You can do it! (She gets it lifted up and they make the first turn.) Okay.
You got it?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Good-good-good. </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh-oh! </p>

<p>(She can't stay at the end as the couch rounds the turn so she shifts to the back
corner of the couch and is at a 90-degree angle to it.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, you got it right? You got it right? You got it? </p>

<p>(She don't got it as the couch slips out of their grips and falls over the bottom
railing.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Any chance you think the couch looks good there?</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Phoebe is telling Chandler and Monica how she fought crime
in her own way with the badge she found.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> &#133;so this guy was all (Mumbles.) And I'm all, Buffay, Homicide.
(Flashes the badge.) It was just so cool!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (cooking something) Phoebe, you were supposed to take that back!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I know but I'm having so much fun doing good deeds.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, but impersonating a police officer is a serious thing. You could
get arrested.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> You could get arrested, right now! (Flashes the badge and they glare at
her.) All right, yeah, I gotta take it back. I'm totally drunk with power. (She heads for
the door just as Joey enters.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (To Joey) Hey.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (To Phoebe) Hey! (Sees that Monica's there.) Oh.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hi, Joe.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, I didn&#146;t know you guys were going to be here.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey Joey, sweetie, taste this. (Holds out a spoon for him.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (backing away) What?! Why?!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What is going on with you?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Nothing!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, come on! You've been acting strange all day!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> All right! There is something. I kinda had a dream, (pause) but I don't
want to talk about it. (Starts for his room.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Whoa-whoa-whoa-whoa-whoa-what-what if Martin Luther King had said
that? (Imitating what his famous speech would sound like.) I kinda have a dream! I
don&#146;t want to talk about it.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, it involved Monica.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You had a dream about a girl that I am seeing?! Oh, that is so cool!
(To Monica) I can't tell you how many times I've dreamt about a girl that he was seeing.
(Seeing Monica's stare.) (To Joey) Anyway we're talking about your dream. (To Monica) I
love you. (To Joey) Your dream? (Leans in to listen closely.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Don't worry, there wasn't any sex in it or anything. I haven't dreamt
about her like that since I found out about you two--ish. </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What was the dream about?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, okay. You were my girlfriend and <b>we</b> were doing the crossword
puzzle. Y'know like you guys were doing last night. So, that's it. I'm in love with Monica
and I'll be moving out.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Wait, Joey! Joey! That doesn&#146;t mean that-that you're in love with
me!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> It-it doesn&#146;t?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No, it can mean anything. Like uh, all of the sudden you're jealous
because I've become the apartment stud.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> That kinda sounds like your dream dude.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Or, it could mean that-that you saw Chandler and me together and we
y'know were being close and stuff and then you just want to have that with someone too.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> In the dream I did enjoy the closeness.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Um-hmm.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Joey, look, are you attracted to Monica? Right here, right now, are
you attracted to her?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (looks at her) Not really.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well there you have it!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well sure! I'm just wearing sweats! (Looking at Chandler and slowly
realizing what his point is.) But that's good that you're not in love with me, because you
just want a girlfriend!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No, I don't think it's just about just getting a girlfriend. Y'know? I
mean, yeah, I can get a girlfriend! Yeah, we could sit in the chair and do crosswords, but
y'know are we ever going to have y'know the closeness like-like you guys have?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well y'know, Monica and I were <b>friends</b> before we started
dating. So maybe-maybe that's it?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Friends first? That's interesting.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You become friends after?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No, never done that either.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (entering) Hey, umm, do you guys have that tape measure?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh yeah, it's actually in my bedroom.</p>

<p>(Monica and Chandler both remember a special moment between them.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (laughing) That's right.</p>

<p>(They realize the implication of their behavior, stop instantly and head for his
bedroom. In the meanwhile, Joey is starring at Rachel in a seductive way.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (noticing him) What's up Joey?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (in a sexy voice) How you doin'?</p>

<p>(Rachel is stunned.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Commercial Break</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Outside Central Perk, Phoebe is walking up and notices a car that is parked
half on the curb and right in front of the door, making it difficult for people to enter
Central Perk.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Excuse me, is this your car?</p>

<p><b>Guy:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well I don't think it's very nice of you to park here, y'know you're
blocking the entrance. </p>

<p><b>Guy:</b> Don't worry about it. It's not a problem.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, it's a problem for me, which means it's a problem for you 'cause
I'm a cop. (Shows the badge.)</p>

<p><b>Guy:</b> (he reaches into the car and slams his siren on the roof.) So am I!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ohh, no. (Pause) Oh okay, so you're a cop which means you can park
anywhere, 'cause I know that 'cause I'm a cop too. So, all right, keep up the good work.
10-4. (Tries to leave.)</p>

<p><b>Cop:</b> (stopping her) Hey, wait a second! So wait, what precinct are you with?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I-I'm with the umm, the 57<sup>th</sup>.</p>

<p><b>Cop:</b> Oh, I know a guy in homicide up there.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I'm in vice. Yeah, in fact I'm undercover right now. I'm a whore.</p>

<p><b>Cop:</b> Who-who else is in vice up there?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Umm, do you know, umm Sipowicz?</p>

<p><b>Cop:</b> Sipowicz? No, I don't think so.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, big guy, kinda bald.</p>

<p><b>Cop:</b> No, I don't know him.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (starts to walk away, but stops) Don&#146;t try to call him or anything,
'cause he's not there, he's out. His umm, his partner just died.</p>

<p><b>Cop:</b> Wow umm, tell Sipowicz I'm real sorry for his loss.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I-I sure will, take care. (Starts walking off.)</p>

<p><b>Cop:</b> (following her) Hey by the way, I'm sure Sipowicz is gonna be all right. I
heard that kid from <i>Silver Spoons</i> is really good. (Phoebe's stunned) And where did
you find my badge?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh. (She starts laughing. Then she throws the badge at him and runs
away.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Joey is entering. Rachel is there getting some tools to
help Ross out.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hey! Joey, would you mind giving me and Ross a hand moving his couch?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, I'd love too, but I got acting class. But y'know what? I guess I can
blow that off, (In a sexy voice) for you.</p>

<p>(He starts staring at her longingly.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Thanks!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Uh, hey, Rach let me ask you something. Uh, I was just over there talking
to Monica and Chandler, boy they are really tight.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I know.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah that's not such a bad situation they got going over there. I'm
thinking of getting me one of those.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What's up Joe?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, the reason I think Monica and Chandler are so great&#133;</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> &#133;is because they were friends first. Y'know? So I asked myself,
&quot;Who are my friends?&quot; You and Phoebe, and I saw you first. So&#133;</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (laughing) What are you saying?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I'm saying maybe you and I crank it up a notch.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Y'know honey, umm, as uh, as flattered as I am that uh, you saw me
first, uhh, I just, I-I don't think we should be cranking anything up.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I'll treat you real nice. (Pulls out a chair for her.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (laughs and pushes the chair back in) Yeah, well, y'know umm&#133; No
honey, listen I think it's a <b>great</b> idea to become friends with someone before you
date them, but I think the way you do it is y'know you meet someone, become their friend,
build a foundation, then you ask them out on a date. Don't hit on your existing friends!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Won't-won't that take longer?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah. Yeah. Oh, but once you find it, ohh it's <b>so </b>worth the wait.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah. I understand. I understand. (Pause) <b>Man</b>, I wish I saw Phoebe
first!</p>

<p>[Scene: The lobby of Ross's building, he's sitting on the couch at the bottom of the
stairs, and he's practicing enticing women to join him on the couch.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Come here to me. No-no, you come here to me.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (entering) Hey Ross! I brought reinforcements.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh great! What, you brought Joey?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, I brought the next best thing.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (entering) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Chandler?! You brought Chandler?! The next best thing would be Monica!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Y'know, I would be offended, but Monica is freakishly strong, so&#133;</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Look, I-I drew a sketch about how we're gonna do it. (Showing them) Okay
Rach, (points to the sketch) that's you. That's the couch. (Points again.) </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Whoa-oh, what's-what's that? (Points.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, that's me.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Wow! You certainly think a lot of yourself.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No! That's-that's my arm!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (looking at the sketch) Oh, I see. I thought you just really, really
liked your new couch.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Y'know what? Just-just follow my lead. </p>

<p>(Chandler and Ross head for opposite ends of the couch.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Come on, Chandler. </p>

<p>(They pick up the couch and after throwing off the last pillow; Rachel helps out on
Chandler's end.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> All right. (They start up the stairs. Ross is first.) Okay, here we go!</p>

<p>(Chandler has moved forward and is now underneath the couch as it heads up the first
set of stairs.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> All right, ready?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Turn.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (straining) Okay.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Turn! Turn!</p>

<p>(As they turn the couch, Chandler gets sandwiched between the railing and the couch.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, I don't think we can turn anymore!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ross, I don't, I just don't think it's going to fit.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh yeah it will! Come on, up! Up-up-up! Up! Yes! Here we go! Pivot! (They
start up the stairs again. Chandler is between the couch and the wall now.) Pivot! Piv-ot!
Piv-et!! Piv-ett!!! Piv-et!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Shut up! Shut up! Shut up!!</p>

<p>(They set the couch down.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, I don't think it's going to pivot anymore.</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler and <b>Rachel:</b></b> You think?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> All right, let's uh, let's bring it back down and-and try again.</p>

<p>(As they start back down the couch drops a little bit and gets jammed. They try to free
it to no avail.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, yeah, I think it's really stuck now.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I can't believe that didn't work!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I know, me neither! I mean, you <b>had</b> a sketch!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, y'know, what did you mean when you said pivot?</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is returning and finds Chandler, Monica, and Rachel
are there.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (entering) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hey! How's it going? Did you make any new friends?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, yeah, I met this woman. (Starts for his room.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (stopping him) Hey, whoa-whoa! What's she like?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Uhh, well, she's&#133;really good in bed.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Joey, I thought you were gonna try to be friends first!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (To Rachel) Well look, hey, it's all your fault!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?! Why?!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well because you didn't give me advice! No! You gave me a pickup line! As
soon as I told her I wanted to y'know, build a foundation and be friends first. I
suddenly, through no fault of my own, became irresistible to her! (Pause) And her
roommate!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What about the closeness?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Closeness-shmoshness! There was three of us for crying out loud!</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Joey is entering with a pizza and finds everyone but Ross
there.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (entering) All right! Hey, who wants pizza?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Ooh, I do! I do! I do!</p>

<p>(They all walk over to get a slice.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (taking a bite) Oh, great! Can you believe I found it on the second floor?
</p>

<p>(They all throw their pieces back as there is a knock on the door.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Who is it?</p>
<b>

<p>Voice:</b> N.Y.P.D!!</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe and <b>Joey:</b></b> Oh my God!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Uhh, just a minute officer!! </p>

<p>(He throws his piece back in the box, runs into the living room, looks for a place to
hide the pizza, finds one, slides the box under the couch, sits down on the table, and
tries to quickly chew the food in his mouth.)</p>
<b>

<p><b>Cop:</b></b> I'm looking for Phoebe Buffay!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ooh, God, it's him! It's that cop! God, I can't believe it! He found me!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh my God, Phoebe, are you gonna go to jail?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, if I'm going down, I'm taking you (Points at all of them) with me.
(They all look at her.) Harboring a fugitive? That's one to three years minimum. Good luck
Chandler. (She opens the door to the cop from before.) Okay, you can arrest me. Fine. But
you'll never make it stick and you know it!</p>

<p><b>Cop:</b> Yeah, but I kinda don't have a choice, it's my job. I mean, you understand
right?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yep! As long as you understand that I'm going to call my lawyer and once
he puts you on the stand he'll make you look like a fool. A fool!</p>

<p><b>Cop:</b> I don't like looking foolish. Y'know what? Maybe uh, I don't arrest you
today. Maybe I came by and you weren't here.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I would <b>love</b> it if I weren't here!</p>

<p><b>Cop:</b> Okay, so since umm, you're not going to jail tonight I was wondering if you
would like to go to dinner with me?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Me?!</p>

<p><b>Cop:</b> Yeah. Ever since you flashed my badge at me, I kinda can't stop thinking
about you. You're the prettiest, fake undercover whore I've ever seen.</p>
<b>

<p>Chandler and <b>Joey:</b></b> Nice!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Wow! I didn't see that coming! You're-you're asking me out!</p>

<p><b>Cop:</b> Yeah. I mean, I coulda done it better, but these people keep staring at me.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Umm, yeah, I'd like to go out with you officer&#133;</p>

<p><b>Cop:</b> Gary.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Gary.</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Okay, so it's a date.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah! So--ooh, I gotta ask you though. How did you know where to find
me?</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Well you're fingerprints were all over my badge so I just ran it through
the computer and this was listed as your last known address so I just checked it out.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ohh, impressive.</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Not as impressive as you. I gotta tell you, I looked at your record and
you've done some pretty weird stuff.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, we'll talk at dinner.</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Okay. (He starts to leave.) So I'll come by in a couple hours and pick you
up?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> All right, I can't wait!</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Okay. And don't worry, I'm not just gonna take you out for donuts.</p>

<p>(Chandler busts out laughing and everyone just looks at him.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (To Rachel) He <b>has</b> a gun!</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Closing Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: The couch store, Ross is talking to a saleswoman.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I'd like to return this couch. I'm not satisfied with it.</p>

<p>[The camera cuts to show the couch, which has been cut in half.]</p>

<p><b>The Saleswoman:</b> You wanna return this couch? (Ross nods yes.) It's cut in half!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> That's what I'm telling you.</p>

<p><b>The Saleswoman:</b> Did you cut this couch in half?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> This couch, is cut in <b>half</b>! I would like to exchange it for one
that is not cut in half!</p>

<p><b>The Saleswoman:</b> You're telling me this couch was delivered to you like this?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Look, I am a reasonable man. I <b>will</b> accept store credit.</p>

<p><b>The Saleswoman:</b> I'll give you store credit in the amount of four dollars.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (thinks) I take it.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>End</strong></p>

<hr>

517<html>

<head>
<title>The One With Rachel's Inadvertant Kiss</title>
<meta HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=windows-1252">
<meta NAME="GENERATOR" CONTENT="Microsoft FrontPage 3.0">
<meta NAME="Template" CONTENT="C:\Program Files\Microsoft Office\Templates\friends.dot">
</head>

<body bgcolor="#FFFFFF" link="#008000">

<h1 align="center">The One With Rachel's Inadvertant Kiss</h1>

<hr>

<p>Written by: Andrew Reich &amp; Ted Cohen<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a></p>

<hr>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, everyone is there as Rachel enters, happily.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Good, you guys are all here!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey! What's up?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, I have a job interview at <i>Ralph Lauren</i> tomorrow!</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Congratulations! Ohh, that's great!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I know!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Boy, that guy's underwear sucks!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Wh-what?!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I got this pair marked excess, I gotta tell ya, there was no room for
excess anything in there.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Anyway, I'm going to be the coordinator of the woman's collection, I'll
work right under the director, it's the perfect, perfect job for me!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Wow! Well, if you nail the interview, you'll get it!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> You wanna work on your interview skills?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> O-okay!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay! All right, let's start with the handshake. Hi.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hi. </p>

<p>(They shake hands.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Very good handshake, good wrist action.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Let me try. (Gets up to join them.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay. (They shake hands and she pulls away suddenly) Oh my God! What did
I ever do to you?! (Rubbing her hand.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Did I squeeze it too hard?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Let's just say, I'm glad I'm not Chandler.</p>

<p>(Chandler tries to comprehend that remark.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Opening Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Joey is standing at the window waving at Ross.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> That's right Ross, I can see you in your new apartment! And you can see
me! Same as yesterday, (To Monica) same as the day before.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Is he doing his shark attack bit yet?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Nope. Op, wait! There he goes. </p>

<p>(We see Ross through the window and he acts like a swimmer that gets attacked by a
shark, picture one of the many, many, many <i>Jaws</i> movies they made and you get the
idea.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (waving) Very funny Ross! Very life-like and funny. Okay. (Notices that a
woman is waving back.) Oh no-no-no, I wasn't waving at you lady. (She just stares at him.)
(Joey sees how beautiful she is.) Whoa, maybe I was! Hey, Monica, this totally hot girl in
Ross's building is flirting with me.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Get in there man! Flirt back, mix it up!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, I-I-I'm down with that. (He turns back to the woman.) Okay, here
goes. (Thinks.) How (Holds up his hand like an Indian) you (Points at her) a-doin'? (Does
a little twisting motion with both hands and ends up pointing at her, he then winks. She
smiles and waves again.) (To Monica) It worked! She's waving me over. (Towards the woman.)
Okay, I-I-I'll be right over. Let's see, she's on the third floor&#133;</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (joining him) Wow! She is pretty, huh?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Tell me about it, huh? (Realizes that she can see Monica.) Oh no-no-no,
I'm not with her, she's just Monica! (He pantomimes that out.) Ewwuck! (He pushes Monica
away and makes a disgusted face.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Ross's Building, Joey is trying to find the hot girl's apartment. So he's
walking up the hallway counting doors. He comes to what he thinks is the right one and
knocks on it. Ross opens the door, it's his apartment.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey Joey! Great stuff huh?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> This is your place?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Of course it is. Yeah, come on in. Ooh-ooh, go by the window you can
pretend to be surfing. (He pretends he's surfing by the window.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> But I counted, you're not supposed to live here! Oh man! (Runs away.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Joey is entering again.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ugh!!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What happened?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I ended up at Ross's place. Oh, I musta missed counted or something.
(Looks out the window.) Damn! She's not there anymore. Oh, l-l-look, Ross is doing his
'Watching TV' bit. (We see Ross sitting on the couch and flipping through the channels on
his remote.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No Joey, I think he's just watchin' TV. </p>

<p>(It's only when the camera cuts to Ross's apartment that we see that the TV is turned
off and Ross is indeed doing a bit. He then tries to hide his smirk.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, later that day, Gary is kissing Phoebe good-bye.]</p>

<p><strong>Gary's Radio: </strong>We've lost visual contact with the suspect.</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Okay, now I've really have to go!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> But it's just so unfair that our date has to get cut short just 'cause
some guy shot at a store clerk.</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> I know, but it's my job, sweethart!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, then maybe I can come too!</p>

<p><strong>Gary's Radio: </strong>Suspect has just emerged naked from the sewer.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> All right, you go. (They kiss.)</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Bye-bye.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> 'Kay, bye!</p>

<p>(Gary closes the door behind him.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh God!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh I just miss him so much!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Wow! For just a week you guys are really close, huh?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, it's weird. I can't help it though he's so sweet, he's like this
little puppy dog, y'know? But like a really tough one that shots bad guys. Ohh, I just <b>love</b>
beginning parts of relationships, y'know?! You just like can't keep your hands off each
other.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I know it is the best.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> So-so how long did that last for you and Chandler?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What? It's still going on.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Come on, seriously! When did it end?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I-I am serious, I mean, we're, we're all over each other all the time.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, you know where you are better than I do. I was just curious.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (Start annoying hyper-competitive mode now.) (Jumping up) What don't you
just calm down Phoebe! All right?! Why don&#146;t you just get all your facts before you
run around telling everybody that you're the only hot couple!!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (Under her breath) God, I woke the beast. Sorry. (To Monica) I was <b>wrong</b>
obviously, I just&#151;I misspoke. It's okay.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh no, it <b>is</b> okay, I mean as long as you know that Chandler and I
are also very hot and fiery, just as hot as you! I mean our flame, whew, is on fire!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (entering) Hey Monica, here's your broom back.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You are so cute. (She goes over and kisses him passionately.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the next day, Chandler and Joey are there as Rachel
returns from her interview.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh hey, how'd the interview go?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ugh, horrible! I did the stupidest, most embarrassing thing!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Did you tell the guy you wanted to have sex with his wife and then fall
right out of your chair?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> So what happened?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ugh, it was horrible! And-and the interview part went so well, y'know? I
even made him laugh. He said something about a boat and I was like, &quot;Well, yeah! If
you've got enough life jackets!&quot; (She starts laughing; Chandler and Joey are not
amused.) Trust me, it was actually, it was very funny. Anyway, so we were saying good-bye
and ugh!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What happened?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (We see a flashback as Rachel describes what happened.) All right, we
were shaking hands and he kinda leaned toward me&#133; Y'know maybe he was going to open
the door, but I totally miss read him and I uhhh&#133; (The flashback shows that she
kissed him on the cheek.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> You kissed him?!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, I didn't know what else to do!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well you coulda tried, not kissing him.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Thanks Chandler.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (entering from the bathroom) Hey Rach, a guy from <i>Ralph Lauren</i>
called, you got a second interview!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I can't believe it! I got a second interview!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yes!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I bet that kiss isn't looking like such a big mistake now, is it?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What-what, wait a minute, you don't think that's why he wants me back?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah! (Chandler makes a noise) No?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> A kiss? What are you talking about?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I accidentally kissed him in the interview, and now he wants me back
y'know of course, 'cause &quot;Let's bring the girl back who kisses everybody!&quot;</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Come on, Rach.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh my God! What if he thinks I'm the kind of girl that-that would just
sleep with him?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> He probably wants you back because you're right for the job.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Maybe. I-I don't know&#151;Oh God, how could I be so stupid?!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh Rachel look, don't say that, I think you just need a hug from Joey.
Come on. Come on. (She hugs him and Joey looks out the window.) She's back! Hot girl's
back!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ohh, well I'm not totally back yet, but thank you.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No, in Ross's building! (He throws Rachel onto the chair and heads to the
window.) She's back! She's back! (Pantomimes) Okay, wait there, I'll be over in a second.
(He counts where she is again.) Got it! (Runs out and does a little hot over a chair.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I gotta check out this hot girl! (He heads to the window but realizes
something, stops, turns and points at Monica.) There she is! (He dances over to her and
kisses her.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Ross's building, Joey is knocking on a door again. It's again answered by
Ross.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Damnit!! Did you move?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yes. I lived with you guys for a while and then I found this place. (Joey
just stares at him) I'm Ross.</p>

<p>(Joey makes a frustrated face and noise and walks away. He knocks on the next door and
it's answered by an old man.)</p>

<p><b>The Old Man:</b> Yes?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (Looking around) Uhh do you happen to have a hot girl in there?</p>

<p><b>The Old Man:</b> No. I'm all alone.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah. Sorry about that. (He walks away and knocks on the next door which
is answered by a little girl.) Oh, hey little girl. Uhh, is-is your mommy, or sister, or
babysitter by any chance a hot girl?</p>

<p><b>The Little Girl:</b> Daddy!!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Later! (He runs away down the hall and hides behind a corner to a whole
other corridor.) Oh man! (Walks down the hallway in desperation.) Hot girl! Hot girl!!</p>

<p>[Scene: Rachel's job interview, she is waiting outside Mr. Zelner's (the interviewer)
office banging her pen between her teeth.]</p>

<p><b>Mr. Zelner:</b> Hi Rachel!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>Mr. Zelner:</b> Come on in.</p>

<p>(They go inside.)</p>

<p><b>Mr. Zelner:</b> It's really nice to see you again.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Thank you.</p>

<p><b>Mr. Zelner:</b> (Sees that she has some ink on her lip from her pen.) Oh Rachel,
uhh&#133; (He points to his lip to get her to notice the ink on hers.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Mr. Zelner:</b> Just ah&#133; (He points again.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Excuse me?</p>

<p><b>Mr. Zelner:</b> Here let me&#133; (He goes to wipe it off himself.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (stopping him) Wh-whoa! All right, okay-okay, I see, I see what's going
on here! Now listen, look-look, I'm sorry if I gave you the wrong impression, but I am <b>not</b>
some hussy who will just sleep around to get ahead! Now even though I (He tries to
interrupt and tell her about the ink), hey-hey-hey, even though I kissed you, that does
not give you the right to demand sex from me. I do not want, <b>this</b> job <b>that</b>
bad. Good day, sir. (She storms out of his office.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is returning from her interview attempt.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (entering) Ugh, you will not <b>believe</b> what that sleaze-ball from <i>Ralph
Lauren</i> did too me!</p>

<p>(Joey, Monica, and Ross all point to their lips to get Rachel to once again notice the
ink on her lip.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay-okay that-that's amazing. How did you know that?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You got ink on your lip.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh. (Realizes.) Ohhhhhhhhh&#133;.</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe and Gary and Chandler and Monica are all there.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (To Gary) So what do you say, maybe sometime I hold your gun?</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> I don't know man, we're really not supposed to do that.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, what can happen? I mean, would you&#133; (He gestures and spills
some of his coffee.)</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Yeah, I'm gonna say no.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Phoebe, do you want to go see a movie after dinner tonight?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh we can't, we already have plans.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What are you doing?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, same thing we did all day, hang out at Gary's apartment. He is so
amazing, we never left the bedroom. But have fun at the movie.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (That annoying competitiveness thing kicks in again, what the heck <b>is</b>
that with her and why must the writers show it every flippin' episode?!) Oh, we're not
seeing a movie!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> You're not? Then why did you ask us if we wanted to go?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh umm, that's because I just wanted to y'know walk in on me and
Chandler while we were, y'know, doing it all night. Will you excuse me for just a second?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay. (She gets up and walks over to Chandler.) Chandler? Can I see you
for a second?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Uh, yeah.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay. (They walk away to get some privacy.) We have <b>got</b> to beat
them! {Here we go yet again.}</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Why?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> 'Cause, Gary and Phoebe think they're a hotter couple than we are!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Ohh, so?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> So! So we've got to go upstairs and have a lot of sex to prove them
wrong!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Monica, you have <b>got</b> to stop this competitive thing! Okay? It's
crazy. {Finally! The voice of reason.} I mean, just impress Gary and Phoebe we have to go
upstairs and have sex over and over and I'm saying no to this, why? Get your coat.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Commercial Break</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: The lobby in Ross's building, we see a flyer that is on the bulletin board that
reads, &quot;Are you the Hot Girl who waved at me? If so, give me a call!&quot; and it's
signed, Joey 629-9*** (The last couple of numbers have been ripped off). Anyhoo, Ross is
getting his mail.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (to the woman checking her mail next to him) Hey!</p>

<p>(A man walks up.)</p>

<p><b>The Man:</b> (To Ross) Excuse me. (He puts up a flyer that has a sketch drawing of
Joey and it reads, &quot;Warning! Intruder! If you see this creep - call the cops!&quot;)
You should check this out, tell the other tenants. Apparently he's running around looking
for some kind of a hot girl.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (to the woman checking her mail) Who isn't? </p>

<p>(For the first time we see that the woman Ross is talking too is in fact the hot girl
that Joey is looking for. She just kinda stares at him.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I don't, I don't think we've meet. I-I'm Ross.</p>

<p><b>The Hot Girl:</b> I know. You're the guy who wouldn't chip in for the handyman.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Nevermind! (Goes back to his mailbox.)</p>

<p><b>The Hot Girl:</b> No, I-I actually thought it was unfair the way everyone reacted. I
mean you had just moved in.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I <b>had</b> just moved in. Thank you! Listen umm&#133;</p>

<p><b>The Hot Girl:</b> Jen.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Jen, I know this may sound a little&#133;(makes some kind of crazy noise)
But uh, would you maybe wanna grab a cup of coffee sometime, or&#133;</p>

<p><b>Jen:</b> Sure! That would be nice.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Umm?</p>

<p><b>Jen:</b> Oh! My number is on there. (Hands him a business card.) Give me a call.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I will give you a call.</p>

<p><b>Jen:</b> I'll see you later. (Starts to walk away.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay!</p>

<p>(After she's left, Ross gets really happy and starts kissing the card. Suddenly, she
returns.)</p>

<p><b>Jen:</b> I forgot my paper. (Ross quickly hides the card in his mouth.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, a post-coital Monica and Chandler are recovering on the
couch.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> That was amazing!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Phoebe and Gary are <b>so</b> gonna hear about this at dinner.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> That was amazing.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> We are the hottest! Huh? <b>No one</b> is hotter than we are! You're the
best.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No, you're the best.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No, you're the best.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No, you're the best.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I <b>am</b> the best.</p>

<p>(Just as they start to get up, Joey walks in.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (entering) Hey guys! (Sees their state of undress) What 'cha been doin'?
(Has a silly grin.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (looking out the window) Hey Joey! Isn't that the girl that waved at you
the other day?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I don't know. But I can see through your sheet. (He looks out the window.)
Yeah, yeah, that's her. But y'know what? Doesn't matter, I'm never gonna get to meet her
anyway.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Why?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Because it's impossible to find her apartment! She lives in some like of
hot girl parallel universe, or something.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What are you talking about? (Pointing out the window.) She obviously
lives on the second floor, seventh apartment from the left!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No. No. No. She lives on the <b>third</b> floor, <b>eighth</b> apartment
from the left.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No, those first two windows, (Points) that's the lobby. And y'know the
other one over there, that's the stairway. You've been counting wrong.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I did <b>not</b> know that! Thank you Monica. (Starts to leave) I can't
believe I almost lost another girl because of counting.</p>

<p>[Scene: Jen's apartment, Ross is picking her up for their date.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> So uhh, you ready?</p>

<p><b>Jen:</b> Sure, I'll just get my coat. (There's a knock on the door.) Could you get
that?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Sure. (He opens the door to Joey. Needless to say, Joey's stunned.)
Joey&#133;</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Dahhhhh!! (Ross has a puzzled look on his face.) No! Noooo!! (Storms off.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Mr. Zelner's office, Rachel has come back again to try and do that second
interview.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ah, first, I-I would like to say thank you for agreeing to see me again.</p>

<p><b>Mr. Zelner:</b> That's quite all right, but I feel obligated to tell you that this
meeting is being videotaped.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (looks around for the camera) Okay. Umm, well, first I would like to
start by apologizing for kissing you and uh, for yelling at you.</p>

<p><b>Mr. Zelner:</b> Fair enough.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Now you're probably going to hire one of the people who did not ah, (She
puts her hands on his desk blotter and he moves it. Rachel then doesn't know where to put
her hands.) who did, who did not umm, yell at you and storm out, and I think that's a big
mistake and here's why. I made a huge fool of myself and I came back, that shows courage.
When I thought you wanted sex in exchange for this job, I said no. That shows integrity.
And, I was not afraid to stand up for myself and that shows courage. (Suddenly realizes
that she said courage twice.) Okay umm, now I know I already said courage, but y'know you
gotta have courage. And umm, and finally when I thought you were making sexual advances in
the workplace, I said no and I was not litigious. {By the way, litigious means to want to
litigate and litigate is to make a lawsuit against.&nbsp; So she didn't want to sue him.
&nbsp; Don't worry, I had to look it up too.} So there you go, you got, you got (counts
them off with her fingers) courage, you got integrity, you got (Pause) courage again, and
not litigious. Look Mr&#133;</p>

<p><b>Mr. Zelner:</b> Zelner.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Zelner! Right! I knew that! I really, really want this job and I think,
I think I would be really good at it.</p>

<p><b>Mr. Zelner:</b> Y'know what? I may regret this but uh, I'm going to give you a shot.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (gasps) Oh! You are?</p>

<p><b>Mr. Zelner:</b> Um-hmm.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Really? Oh thank you! Oh&#133; Oh, would it be completely inappropriate
to give you a hug?</p>

<p><b>Mr. Zelner:</b> Yes!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, well then how about a handshake? (She goes to shake his hand but
misses and touches his groin.) Oh God I'm sorry! Oh God, I'm sorry! I did not mean to
touch that&#151;I mean <b>you</b> there. There. Uhh, okay, so thank-thank you, I'm going
to leave now thank you very much uh-huh, thank you so&#151;Hey! I'll see you Monday!
(Exits.)</p>

<p>[Scene: A restaurant, Chandler, Monica, Phoebe, and Gary are on a double date. Chandler
is yawning.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> You tired Chandler?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You better believe he's tired, after the day we had! If you know what I
mean. You know what I mean?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Honey, the tortilla chips know what you mean.</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> So uh Chandler, you like that badge I got you?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh yeah, it's so cool. (He opens his coat and has it pinned to the
lining.) Now I gotta go, Officer Bing has gotta, 10-100. (Pause, softly) That's pee-pee.
(Heads for the bathroom.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Phoebe, you have a, a twig in your hair.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ohh, (laughs) umm, we kinda took a little detour on the way over here.</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Yeah, we took a little stroll in the park and no one was around, so&#133;</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You didn't!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> We did! We violated Section 12 Paragraph 7 of the criminal code!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> The park huh? A public place.</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Uh-huh.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I hear ya. Excuse me for just a second! (Gets up and heads for the
bathroom as that annoying Gotta-win-at-all-costs-super-competitive thing kicks in again.)</p>

<p>[Cut to the Men's room. Chandler is practicing flashing his badge as Monica enters.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hi Chandler.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Monica! This is the Men's room! (Pause) Isn't it?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yes it is. You see I've always found the men's bathroom very sexual.
Haven't you?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No. And if I did, I don't think we'd be going out. Monica, this is
getting ridiculous!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Come on, we <b>can't</b> let them win!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Ugh, we have already proved that we are hot! Okay? So why-why are you
getting so obsessed about this thing?!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Because Phoebe and Gary are in
that-can't-keep-their-hands-off-each-other-doing-it-in-the-park phase!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (gasps) So?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I feel really sad that we're not&#133;really there anymore.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh wow! Is that what this all have been about?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Wasn't it a lot more exciting when we were y'know all over each other
all the time?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah that was great. That was really great! But to tell you the truth,
I'm more excited about where we are right now.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Really?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah! I've never been in a relationship that's lasted this long
before. Y'know to get past the beginning and still be around each other all the time, I
think that's pretty incredible. And the fact that this is happening all with you, yeah I
think that's pretty exciting. (Kisses her.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> That is so sweet. I know that I was acting a little crazy but umm, I
feel the same way.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah. (They hug.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Y'know what I just realized? You just freaked out about our
relationship.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Did not.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes you did! Admit it! You freaked out!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay, I freaked out a little.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Little?! You freaked out big time! Okay? And I fixed it! We have
switched places! <b>I</b> am the relationship and king and you are the crazy, irrational
screw up! (Does a dance of joy.) (Monica glares at him.) And now we're back.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Ending Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Looking through Ross's window, he's doing more pantomimes. The first one is
he's walking a dog that has stopped, then suddenly tugs him forward.]</p>

<p>[Cut to the inside of Monica and Rachel's apartment, Monica and Rachel are sitting at
the table.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (laughs) I cannot believe Ross is buying this!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Thank God! I can't watch him anymore!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (entering) You guys ready fore the movies?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah! Oh by the way, thank you for loaning us Pamela and Yasmine. </p>

<p>(We see through the big window from the outside and see that Monica and Rachel have
pictures of their faces pasted onto cardboard cutouts of Pamela Anderson and Yasmine
Bleeth wearing their <i>Baywatch</i> swimsuits.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (from his apartment) Man! They cannot get enough! (Makes like he's a robot
and waves at the cutouts.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>End</strong></p>

<hr>

518<html>

<head>
<title>The One Where Rachel Smokes</title>
<meta HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=windows-1252">
