<body bgcolor="#FFFFFF" link="#008000">

<h1 align="center">The One Where Rachel Smokes</h1>

<hr>

<p>Written by: Michael Curtis<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a></p>

<hr>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Joey, Chandler, Monica, and Phoebe are there. Joey is holding a
deck of cards out to Chandler.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay, pick a card.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay. (He picks the 9 of Spades)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> All right now, memorize it. (Pause) You got it?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh yes.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (holding up the Queen of Clubs) Is that your card? (He winks and smiles.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (pause) Yes. </p>

<p>(Joey laughs then realizes the trick didn't work when Chandler hands him his card
back.) </p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> (entering with Ben and Ross) Hey guys!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hi there!</p>

<p><b>Ben:</b> Hi!!</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Guess what? Ben is going to be in a TV commercial!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What are you talking about?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (sets Ben down) Well, it's not for sure but umm, we met this guy in the
park who thought Ben was really cute--y'know, which he is--so umm anyhoo, he uh, he gave
us his card and told us to bring him down for this commercial he's auditioning.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (reading the card) Whoa! This guy is like the biggest commercial casting
director in town! (Ross gasps) Ben takes one lousy walk in the park and gets an audition!!
(Ross and Carol stare at him, then Joey realizes what he just said.) I mean, way to go
Ben! (Gives Ben the thumbs up, which Ben returns.) Man! I've been in that park a million
times and no one offered me an audition.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I know, it's crazy! We were just pushing Ben on the swings&#133;</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I'm <b>always</b> on the swings! What am I doing wrong?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> That.</p>
<b>

<p ALIGN="CENTER">Opening Credits</p>
</b>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, everyone is eating breakfast, Ross is heading for the
bathroom.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (entering from her room) Okay, gotta go! Wish me luck!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Luck!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey Rach, now that you're working at <i>Ralph Lauren</i>, can you
bring me back some of those polo shirts?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Uh well, y'know what? I don't think if I feel comfortable stealing on my
very <b>first</b> day&#133;</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Unwilling to steal from work, interesting.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Besides, if anybody's gonna get free stuff, it's gonna be me.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay guys, way to wish me luck!</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Good luck! Go get 'em! (Rachel exits.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, let's discuss Rachel's birthday. I say we throw a surprise party
this weekend.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Whoa-whoa, but her birthday isn't like for another month.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah but if we throw her a party on her birthday, then it's not a
surprise.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I think it's a great idea. Yeah, we could have a dinner party and just
invite her close friends.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ross!! We're having a surprise party for Rachel!!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (from the bathroom) Okay!!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Done.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, great so do you want to do it together?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I would love to do it together!</p>

<p>(Joey starts to giggle.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> They're gonna do it together.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Dude! That's my girlfriend!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What, so I gotta shut it down now?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> All right, I gotta take off. I'm picking up Ben then we're off to the big
audition.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> It's gonna be weird to watch some actor pretending to be Ben's dad.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Weirder than watching his two moms make out? (Monica nods in
agreement.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Whoa-whoa dad? There's a dad in the commercial?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah the dad and Ben eat soup and pretend to enjoy it.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Whoa, hey, maybe I'll go down there with ya and see if I can get an
audition to play the dad. I mean who better to play Ben's father than his godfather.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You're not his godfather.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What?! Are you kidding?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (Pause) Of course I am! (Joey is relieved) Okay, let's go godfather.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> All right!</p>

<p>(As they walk out he motions to Chandler that he is still Ben's godfather.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Ben's audition, Carol, Ross, and Ben along with about 10 more families are in a
waiting room as Joey enters happily.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey! I'm in, they're gonna let me audition!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Really? That's great!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I know! I know! It turns out that one of the casting ladies has actually
seen me in a play, so I steered clear of her&#133;</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> (noticing a kid who has picked up a copy of <i>Variety</i> to read) Hey,
that kid looks familiar.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh yeah, yeah! He's done tons of commercials. I've seen him in like Sugar
Smacks, <i>Playstation</i>, and that one for the phone company. In fact he was so good in
that one, he actually convinced me to switch phone companies. Chandler was mad&#133;.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah well, he's not gonna get this one. Ben is way cuter than that kid. I
mean look at him, look at you, (Starts to whine like a baby and Joey just glares at him.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> That's great. Listen, wouldn't it be great though if I got to play Ben's
dad?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Joey, you look nothing like Ben.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I look more like him than you do! (He winks at Carol.)</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Y'know, I don't really know you well enough for you to do that.</p>

<p>[Scene: Rachel's new job, she's in her new boss's office (Kim's) and with the other
assistant (Nancy). Together they're deciding what clothes to buy or something, who knows,
let's all watch/read to find out.]</p>

<p><b>Kim:</b> So it's down to these two, Nancy I know you like this one and I think I
agree. Rachel, what do you think?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well umm, that one is pretty but uh, I just, I just love this fabric (On
the other one.) Sorry.</p>

<p><b>Kim:</b> Oh don't be sorry, that's part of your job here to give your opinions and
then I take credit for them--I'm kidding.</p>

<p><b>Nancy:</b> She is kidding, but don't ever disagree with her again. Okay, now I'm
kidding!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (laughing nervously) Oh, what a fun office.</p>

<p><b>Kim:</b> I don't know which one, but I do know I need a cigarette. So what do you
say we take a break, we go outside, and we'll figure this out when we come back?</p>

<p>(They all get up to leave.)</p>

<p><b>Kim:</b> (at the door) Rachel? Do you smoke?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh no, my dad's a doctor and he would always tell me just horror
stories&#133;(stops and tries to change directions)&#133;about ghosts and goblins who
totally supported the princess's right to smoke.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is telling Chandler and Monica about her day.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> &#133;and then they came back from smoking and they had made all of the
decisions without me!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> That doesn't seem fair.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I know! It's like I'm being punished for not having this disgusting,
poisoning habit!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, it is the best.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I mean what if this keeps happening? Y'know, they'll-they'll be outside
smoking, making all the decisions and I'll just be up in my office breathing my stupid
clean air, y'know? And then when the day comes when Kim wants to promote one of us, who do
you think she's gonna pick? Me or Smokey Smokerson?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Rachel, you can go down there, you don't have to smoke. Just say you
wanna get some fresh air.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, I can do that.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, or you can do the easy thing and smoke.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (entering) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey Rach, you wanna get some coffee?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I would love to!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh good!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, I wanna go to babe.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh good.</p>

<p>(They all start out.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh wait, I change my mind! (She slams the door on them.) Okay, let's
talk about the party! I have so many ideas! (Holds up a cocktail napkin.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah, me too! (Runs and grabs her 3-ring binder of ideas.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, look at that.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> All right, that's a little sketch of the cake, umm some sample menus,
umm y'know what I thought we would start out with Tuscan style finger food, and for music,
here's an alphabetized list of all my CDs! I've highlighted the ones that would go really
good with the food.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What happened to the intimate dinner party?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, we're not doing that. Okay&#133;</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> So wow, it looks like you took care of everything. Thanks a lot,
co-host.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What?! I didn't take care of everything, there's-there's plenty of
things for you to do!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Like what?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (Thinks) Cups.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Cups? You're giving me cups?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> And ice!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Cups and ice? Ooh, I get to be in charge of cups and ice? (Thinks of
something) All right. Fine, okay, I <b>will</b> be in charge of cups and ice!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Wait a minute, I can get ice at the restaurant&#133;</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I got it! Mine!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (entering, downtrodden) Hi.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey! How'd the audition go?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Not so good.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Wait a minute, are you doing Joey's (sadly) &quot;Audition didn't go so
well. (Happily) Yeah it did?&quot;</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (Pause) Yeah I am! Yeah, Ben got a second audition!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (also downtrodden) Yeah, I had to teach Ross my bit because I actually
didn't get a callback.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You got a callback too didn't you?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (Happily) Yeah I did!</p>

<p>[Scene: The smoker's balcony, Rachel is out to join Kim and Nancy.]</p>

<p><b>Kim:</b> Hey Rachel, what are you doing out here?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh well, it's kinda lonely up there, so I just thought I would come out
here and get some fresh air.</p>

<p><b>Kim:</b> Nancy and I were talking about the fall collection.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh great!</p>

<p><b>Kim:</b> So anyway we really&#133; (Someone exhales and Rachel turns and coughs.)
Honey, we're just smoking all over you.</p>

<p><b>Nancy:</b> Oh, sorry!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh that's okay.</p>

<p><b>Kim:</b> No-no-no, we'll move you just stay right there. (They walk away.)</p>

<p><b>Nancy:</b> So anyway I sent the designs over to Ralph and he's very excited about
the line.</p>

<p><b>Kim:</b> Oh that's great! You are the best!</p>

<p>(Rachel gets fed up and heads over to another smoker.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Excuse me, can I, can I bum one of those? (He holds up his pack.) Y'know
what, actually&#133; (She takes the one he's smoking and heads over to where Nancy and Kim
are standing and laughing.) Okay, okay, okay, what's so funny over here?</p>

<p><b>Nancy:</b> I thought you didn't smoke.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, I thought you guys meant marijuana cigarettes, y'know? Y'know what I
mean, like dubbies? And I actually, I thought to myself, &quot;Wow, those guys are
crazy!&quot; But no, I actually smoke the regular ones all, all the time.</p>

<p><b>Kim:</b> We get high.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, me too.</p>

<p><b>Kim:</b> I'm kidding.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (Laughs) Oh, me too.</p>

<p>[Scene: Ben and Joey's (Isn't that an ice cream??) callback.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh God, this is so nerve wracking! How-how do you do this?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, unfortunately, I don't get many callbacks so&#133;</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Is it a good sign that they asked us to hang around after the audition?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Who knows?</p>

<p><b>The Casting Director:</b> (entering) Okay uh, we have narrowed it down to Raymond,
Ben, Kyle, and Joey. The rest of you, thank you very much.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yes!! I knew it!! (To the people who didn't make it.) Bye-bye! So long!
Later!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh this is great! I might actually get to play Ben's dad!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah!</p>

<p><b>The Casting Director:</b> Actually, that can't happen. Yeah because you all have
such different looks, we're putting you with Raymond and Kyle with Ben. So it'll be either
you two (Points to Joey and Raymond) or you two. (Points to Kyle and Ben.) (Exits.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Man, this is gonna be kinda weird.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, it is.</p>

<p><strong>Kyle: </strong>Yeah. It's gonna be weird.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, we-we're gonna be like best friends, that's why it's gonna be weird.</p>

<p><strong>Kyle: </strong>Oh, oh, I thought we were just talking.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Commercial Break</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Ross and Chandler are talking.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (entering, carrying two garbage bags) Hey!</p>
<b>

<p>Ross and <b>Chandler:</b></b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Is it okay if I leave this stuff here 'til Rachel's birthday party?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Ah sure. What's in 'em?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Umm, cups.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh good, because uh we got Rachel 800 gallons of water.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Seriously that's a lot of cups.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah well, that's 'cause Monica put me in charge of cups and ice, and
Monica is gonna <b>rue the day</b> that she put me in charge of cups and ice.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Y'know I rued the day once&#133;didn't get a whole lot else done.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, time to bring up the rest of the cups. (She goes and opens the
door to Joey.) Oh, hi Joey!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey Pheebs! (To the guys) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ross good, I'm uh glad you're here. I wanna talk to you about something.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What's up?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, I've been thinking about this whole commercial thing, y'know me
going up against Ben, the two of us competing, and that can't lead to anything good. So, I
think I'm just gonna step aside. I'm gonna tell them that I won't audition.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Wow, uh, Joey that's-that's great. Thanks man.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> That's it? You're-you're gonna let me do this?! This-this is my career
we're talking about here!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, you just&#133;</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I just said that so you wouldn't let Ben do it! Look Ross, if anyone
should step aside it should be Ben!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What? Chandler! Tell 'em!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (shocked) Well I mean, let me get the door first. (Goes and opens the
door.) Oh, hi! No one. (Exits.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Why should Ben step aside? It was his audition in the first place! You-you
just tagged along! You're like the uh, tag-a-long dad.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> At least I care about his feelings!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Do you know how hard this is gonna be on him when he doesn&#146;t get it?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> And why wouldn't he get it?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, come on! Have you <b>seen</b> what my kid can do?! Huh?! I mean he
dials phones! He-he-he eats tortilla chips! He-he plays soccer with the cartoon tiger!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Are you saying your kid eats soup better than my kid?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> You just give him a spoon baby!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh yeah? I guess we'll just see!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah! Because this commercial belongs to me and Mitch!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You're kid's name is Raymond!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah?! So's yours!</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Chandler and Monica are there as Rachel enters.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (To Rachel) How did work go?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh it was great! It was great! I went down there just like you said,
y'know? And we talked business. Kim totally took my opinions.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You stink!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Thanks!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No, I'm-I'm serious!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well-well that's 'cause I went down there and they were all smoking.
This is actually the smell of success.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, there's something different though--Oh my God! You smoked!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I did not!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes you did! You look happy and sick; you smoked!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> All right, fine! But I had too! I had to do it for my career!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I wish I had smoked for my career&#133;</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> That's so gross!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No well, no it's not that bad, y'know? I mean yeah, my tongue feels a
little fuzzy and these fingers sort of smell, I actually feel like I can throw up.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, but you gotta push past this because it is about to get so good!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Chandler! I have to tell you, you smell so smokey I have to get up. I'm
not kidding. (She's not; she stands and walks away. Chandler moves closer.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I think you smell great! (He sniffs her shoulder.)</p>

<p>[Scene: The smoker's balcony, Rachel, Kim, and Nancy are all puffing away on their
cancer sticks.]</p>

<p><b>Kim:</b> So, we're decided, no on plaid, yes on pink?</p>

<p><b>Nancy:</b> Absolutely!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I am so on board! (She throws away her recently lit cigarette.)</p>

<p><b>Kim:</b> Rachel didn't you just light that?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, I did, but y'know what? I am really, really trying to cut back,
y'know? (Laughs) Good luck, Rach.</p>

<p><b>Nancy:</b> I've actually been thinking about quitting lately.</p>

<p><b>Kim:</b> Oh sure, every Sunday night I'm telling myself I'm quitting but every
Monday morning it's like (Mimics chain smoking.)</p>

<p><b>Nancy:</b> Tell me about it!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well then let's just quit! We'll just quit! Let's all quit!</p>

<p><b>Kim:</b> It does sound appealing.</p>

<p><b>Nancy:</b> Oh, I never could do it.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh but you could. You can. Absolutely! We can help each other out! We
can get--what are those--those patches! We could be like the Patch Sisters!</p>

<p><b>Kim:</b> Oh y'know, we really should quit. Okay, let's quit!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yes! Great! Give me those cigs! Give it! Give it! (She grabs their
cigarettes and lighters and throws them in the trash.)</p>

<p><b>Kim:</b> My late husband gave me that lighter. (Rachel laughs.) I'm not kidding.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay then! (She starts rummaging through the trash to find Kim's
lighter.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Joey and Ben's audition, Joey is rehearsing his lines, uh correction, Joey is
rehearsing his <b>line</b>.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hmmm, soup! (Tries again.) <b>Hmm</b> soup! (Tries again, with a little
caveman thrown in.) Hmm, soup!</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Joey, Ross is gonna be here any second, would you mind watching Ben for
me while I use the ladies' room?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh yeah, no problem.</p>

<p><b>Carol:</b> Thanks. (Exits.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (goes over to Ben) Hi Ben! So you wanna be an actor huh? I gotta tell ya,
it's no picnic. There's tons of rejection. <b>No</b> stability. One day you're Dr. Drake
Remoray, the next day you're eating ketchup right out of the bottle.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (entering, angrily) Joey!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (angrily) Ross!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (angrily) Ben! (Pause.) (Happily.) I mean, Ben! Ben!</p>

<p><b>The Casting Director:</b> (entering) Okay, Raymond, Joey you're up.</p>

<p>(Raymond and Joey go in the office.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>The Casting Director:</b> Okay, uh well, let's try one. Whenever you guys are ready.
(Some dude puts down a couple bowls of soup in front of them.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Uh-oh.</p>

<p><b>The Casting Director:</b> Is there a problem?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well this is noodle soup and uh, I've been working with tomato. But that's
okay, no problem. No problem. Hmm, noodle soup.</p>

<p><b>The Casting Director:</b> Y'know, that's-that's fine, but the line is, &quot;Hmm,
soup.&quot;</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, what did I say?</p>

<p><b>The Casting Director:</b> Hmm, noodle soup.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> How's that different? (She looks at him until he gets it.) Oh! Yeah!</p>

<p><b>The Casting Director:</b> All right, let's try one.</p>

<p>(Raymond and Joey both eat a spoonful and Joey turns to Raymond and says&#133;)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hmm, noodle soup.</p>

<p><b>The Casting Director:</b> Okay. Let's do it again.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay.</p>

<p>(They do it again.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hmm, soup. (Pause.) I mean, noodle soup. I mean soup!</p>

<p><b>Raymond:</b> COME ON!!!!</p>

<p><b>The Casting Director:</b> Y'know what? We need to move on.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No! No! I-I can do it one more time! See? Look! (Eats another spoonful)
Hmm, noodle soup. Damnit! (Storms out.)</p>

<p>[Scene: The smoker's balcony, Kim and Nancy are cheating and are caught by Rachel.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hey! Hey-hey-hey!!</p>

<p><b>Kim:</b> Uh-oh, busted!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Come on you guys! What are doing?! I thought we were the patch sisters!</p>

<p><b>Kim:</b> Yeah. That didn't work out.</p>

<p><b>Nancy:</b> Rachel we tried to quit, but it was too hard!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well y'know if you, if you started smoking again you could've at least
told me! Come on, give me one of those! What are we talking about?</p>

<p><b>Kim:</b> No. No! You're doing great! Don&#146;t you give up! That's why we didn't
tell you and we're <b>not</b> gonna drag you down with us.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh wait, no-no-no! Drag me down. Drag-drag me down.</p>

<p><b>Kim:</b> Forget it Rachel! We're both so proud of how well you're doing. I'm not
gonna let you blow it. In fact, if I catch you with a cigarette, you're fired. So go on,
get out of here! Go on, I don't want you breathing this stuff! Go on!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay. (Starts to walk away.)</p>

<p><b>Kim:</b> (to Nancy) So, okay! So you'll come with me on the Paris trip.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (hearing that) Oh man!</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel's surprise party. The apartment is festooned with
cups. There are cups everywhere! Cup centerpiece, cup garland, etc., etc]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (To Chandler) Check it out! Cup hat! (Points to her hat.) Cup banner!
Cup chandelier! And the thing that started it all, the cup! (Holds up one.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Great job with the cups, Pheebs!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (overhearing that) Why don't you just go out with her!</p>

<p>(Chandler starts to follow her into the kitchen.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (following him) And did you notice the ice? (Gestures to 3 huge buckets
of ice on the table.) Look! We have it all! We have crushed! Cubed! And dry! Watch! (Pours
some water onto the dry ice, causing it to evaporate/smoke.) Ahhh! Mystical!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Awesome!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Chandler! Everyone--no one's eating my Tuscan finger food 'cause they're
all filling up on Phoebe's snow cones!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> There are snow cones! (Monica glares at him.) Snow cones! Yuck!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Y'know&#133;go! Go! Right there! (Points)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Thank you! Thank you! (Runs to the snow cone machine.)</p>

<p>(Rachel enters.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (noticing her) Oh, look! Look! Look!</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Surprise!!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?! What?! My birthday's not for another month!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> That's the surprise!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh my God! You guys this is so great! I mean it's so unexpected! I mean
Chandler's birthday is even before mine!</p>

<p>(Everyone stops and looks at Chandler, who's nodding.)</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Surprise!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Wow! This is great! Look at all these cups! This is so weird.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I was in charge of cups.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, okay, not so weird.</p>

<p>[Cut to another part of the room, Ross is going to talk to Joey.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Listen man, uh, I'm sorry the audition didn't go so well.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah right! (Gets up for a refill to his snow cone.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No really, I-I am! I feel bad!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah? Well look Ross, you don't have to. Okay? It's not your fault I suck.
I mean what kind of an actor can't even say, &quot;Hmm, noodle soup.&quot; (Nods his head
in disgust.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah y'know what? Maybe-maybe you didn't mess up your audition because you
suck, maybe you messed up because you care <b>more</b> about uh, your godson.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What you do mean?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I think, sub-consciously&#133;</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Wait-whoa-whoa, you lost me.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (pause) I think on some level, you-you sabotaged your own audition so that
Ben would get the part.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, you're way sounds a lot better than mine. (Thinks about it.) Yeah.
Yeah! It's not that I'm a bad actor&#133;</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No, it's just ah, I care so damn much about little Ben that uh, it was
more important to see him succeed.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> There you go. Thank you!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Thank you! So, did-did he get it?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Eh, what are you gonna do?</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Ending Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: The smoker's balcony, Kim and Nancy are out smoking as Chandler sticks his head
out the door.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (to Kim and Nancy) Oh, hi! Excuse me, is uh Rachel Green here? I was
supposed to meet her for lunch.</p>

<p><b>Kim:</b> Oh, she doesn't come down here any more. You can find her up on ten.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, great.</p>

<p>(Kim exhales and Chandler stares at it longingly.)</p>

<p><b>Kim:</b> (to Nancy) So we talked about the (Chandler sneaks closer to her cigarette)
whole presentation yesterday at lunch (Closer) and he wondered if one person would be
enough (Closer) to get a take on the trip (Still closer) and I said, &quot;Yeah,
absolutely!&quot; (She's interrupted by Chandler who has reached his goal and takes a drag
from her cancer stick.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I'll catch you guys later. (Exits.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>End</strong></p>

<hr>

519<html>

<head>
<title>The One Where Ross Can't Flirt</title>
<meta HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=windows-1252">
<meta NAME="GENERATOR" CONTENT="Microsoft FrontPage 3.0">
<meta NAME="Template" CONTENT="C:\Program Files\Microsoft Office\Templates\friends.dot">
</head>

<body bgcolor="#FFFFFF" link="#008000">

<h1 align="center">The One Where Ross Can't Flirt</h1>

<hr>

<p>Written by: Doty Abrams<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a></p>

<hr>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is getting ready for a date with Monica as Ross
enters.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Wow! You look nice. What's the occasion?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Monica and I are celebrating our ten-month anniversary, we've got
reservations at Ja George.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Wow! How'd you get in there?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Made a few calls, pulled some strings, and they agreed to seat us at
11:30 if we both had the chicken and didn't get desert. </p>

<p>(There's a knock on the door and Chandler answers it. It's the pizza delivery girl.)</p>
<b>

<p>Delivery Girl:</b> Hi Chandler!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey Caitlin! Somebody got a haircut.</p>

<p><b>Caitlin:</b> Ugh, I hate it! I look like an 8-year-old boy.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, if that was true, gym class would've been a <b>lot</b> more
interesting.</p>

<p><b>Caitlin:</b> It's uh, 27 dollars even.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, okay. (Hands her the money.) Here you go. </p>

<p>(The duck starts quacking.)</p>

<p><b>Caitlin:</b> Hey, where's the chicken?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, he's in the back. The duck pissed him off, said that eggs came
first.</p>

<p><b>Caitlin:</b> (laughs) Great. I'll see you later!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, bye!</p>

<p>(He closes the door and turns to see Ross glaring at him.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What the hell was that?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> The flirting! Aren't you supposed to be going out with, I don't know hmm,
let's say my sister?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I was not flirting.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> It was totally flirting. &quot;Somebody got a haircut (Makes some whiney,
nasally noises.)&quot;</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay first of all, the impression, uncanny. And second, that was not
flirting, that was just casual conversation between two people. That is all.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, right.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You wanna see flirting? I'll show you flirting. (Starts to move
towards Ross.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (backing away) I'm good.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Opening Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel and Phoebe are in the kitchen.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I am so proud of Joey, I can't believe he's going to be on <i>Law &amp;
Order</i>!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I know. But don't you think that it should be called Order and Law?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No because first they arrest the guy and then they try him.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Don't get me started on that.</p>

<p>(Ross and Chandler enter with the pizzas.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I was not flirting.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> And on your anniversary, for shame!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What's going on?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Chandler was hitting on the hot delivery girl!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I was not and oh God, shh!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well I'm sorry but you were! Okay? And besides if anyone should be hitting
on her it's the guy who's single, the guy that who-who-who can do something about it.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Sounds like somebody wants to be <b>Mr.</b> Pizza Delivery Girl.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well&#133;</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Is that what this is about? You like Caitlin?</p>

<p>(Ross looks at Rachel.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ross! We broke up two years ago; you've been <b>married</b> since then.
I think it's okay that we see other people.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, I-I was watching her the other day at the pizza place.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hm-mmm.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> And she's just so sexy and funny and has the cutest little&#133;</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, y'know what? We don't need her measurements. </p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (looking through the pizzas) Okay pepperoni, pepperoni, pepperoni, okay
Ross, I know she's pretty and you love her, but is she stupid?! She forgot my vegetarian!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> This is perfect! She'll have to come back here with your pizza, and when
she does, I'll turn on the Charm-O-Ross. Oh I'm so glad you don't eat meat.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> See? Vegetarianism benefits everyone.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (entering, with his grandmother) Hey everybody, look who's here! You
remember my grandmother!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Big night!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> This is so cool!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> So, Joey on <i>Law &amp; Order</i>, you must be very proud!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Chandler, she doesn't understand a word of English.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I'm sorry, I thought you were Joey's other grandmother. (She just
stares at him.) I've done it again.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> She's my biggest fan. Yeah, she's the only one in the family that's
believed in me. </p>

<p>(They both start speaking Italian to each other, and since I'm not Italian and don't
understand one word, we'll move on to the English portion of the show. Not, that I'm
English. Not that there's anything wrong with that, it's just that I'm not. Y'know I think
I should shut-up now and move on. Anyhoo, she says something about Joey being fat I think
based on this line.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, I uh weighted like 27 pounds when I was born so&#133;</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (entering from the bathroom) Hey! Happy Anniversary!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Happy Anniversary, 10 months! (They kiss.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> So umm, when I was in the shower I was thinking about our first night in
London&#133;</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Uhh, Joey's grandmother is right there. (Points)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Is that the one that speaks English or the one that doesn't?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> The one that doesn't.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> That was some hot love you gave me! I'm gonna go get ready.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey, why don't you wear those earrings I gave you?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> That's a great idea! I was saving them for something special.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (runs over to Phoebe) You have <b>got</b> to go home!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> But I like it here!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You gotta go home and get the earrings that you borrowed from me okay?
Chandler wants me to wear them tonight.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, well I think that they're in my purse. Why don't you go get
dressed and I'll look for them.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Great!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay! (Walks over to Rachel) Rach, hi, I need those earrings you
borrowed.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, umm, okay, yeah, I'll be, yeah I'll be right back. (Goes to her
room.)</p>

<p>(Phoebe then gets possessed 'cause she starts speaking in tongues. She speaks Italian
to Joey's grandmother. She is quickly exorcised and returns to speaking in English. Of
course, too most people English is a strange language as well. But none of them are
probably reading this and if they were they wouldn't understand it. So why am I talking
about them? I have absolutely no clue. Moving on&#133;) </p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Wow Pheebs, you speak Italian?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I guess so. (See, the brief possession didn't affect her at all, like we
could really tell.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (She enters and hands Phoebe the earring) Here you go. Thank you!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Wait, Rach! Where's the other one?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh what, you-you want both of them?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Rachel Karen Green, where's the other earring?!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, okay, okay, look, just don't freak out, but I kinda lost it. I
know it's in the apartment, but I <b>definitely</b> lost it.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, what am I going to tell Monica? She wants to wear them tonight!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Tell her to wear her own earrings.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> These <b>are</b> her earrings.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Nooo! Nooooo! You lent me Monica's earrings?! I'm not allowed to borrow
her stuff!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Why not?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Because I lose her stuff!</p>

<p>[Time Lapse, the gang is now watching <i>Law &amp; Order</i>. By the way, the entire
rest of the episode takes place in Monica and Rachel's apartment. Why are they called
apartments when they're all stuck together? Something to think about.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay, see that blind guy right there? I'm gonna bash his head in later.</p>

<p>(His grandmother asks him something.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh umm, my big scene is coming up. Big scene coming up.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> If you said, &quot;Big lima bean, bubbling up.&quot; Would she
understand the difference?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (noticing Rachel crawling behind the couch) Rach? What are you doing?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh boy, I just can't watch. It's too scary!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> It's a diaper commercial.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh yeah well, you know me, babies, responsibilities, ahhh!!!</p>

<p>(There's a knock on the door.)</p>

<p><b>Caitlin:</b> Pizza delivery!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I'll get it! I will get that! (Runs over and opens the door.)</p>

<p><b>Caitlin:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>Caitlin:</b> One uh, vegetarian pizza. That's $12.15.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh. Uh, by the way, if it makes you feel any better. I happen to like
8-year-old boys.</p>

<p><b>Caitlin:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (I can't make it out.) The uh, your hair, before, your hair, you said you
thought your looks like an 8-year-old's, and I'm just saying I like it. The hair.</p>

<p><b>Caitlin:</b> Oh. Thanks.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You understand I don't actually like 8-year-old boys.</p>

<p><b>Caitlin:</b> Y'know, all I'm looking for is the money.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Here you go. (Hands her the money.) Now stop bringing us pizzas you.</p>

<p><b>Caitlin:</b> I'm gonna try. (Walks away and Ross closes the door.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You're welcome.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You couldn't let me have her, could ya?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> This is a girl that I really like and had too swoop in there!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What's goin' on?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Chandler was totally flirting with the hot delivery girl!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Thank you for that! (To Monica) I was not flirting.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> It's okay. I don't care. It's uh, it's fine.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Really?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Really?!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> It's no big deal, I do it all the time.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (starts to laugh, but then gets serious) So umm, you-you flirt with
guys all the time?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Sure! It doesn't mean anything! Just like I know it doesn't mean
anything with you!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, but there is a big difference. You are a <b>lot</b> hotter than
I am.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (walking past) True story! (Goes and sits down.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Chandler, this actually bothers you?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes, it does bother me! And I think it would bother a lot of people.
Rachel, when you were going out with Ross, did it bother you when he flirted with other
women?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Uhh, no, no, it bothered me when he slept with other women.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> And thank you, for that.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> But y'know, I never really had anything to worry about. Ross was never
very good at the flirting thing.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What? (Mumbles) What-what, what are talking about? It-it worked with you.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh! Y'know what? You're right! We meet, you flirted and then <b>bamn</b>
nine years later you had me!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> All right, all right. You-you-you know what I'm going to do? I am going to
order another pizza and when Caitlin gets here, you-you--I will show how well I flirt.
Yeah! I will, I will get her phone number! (To Chandler) And not the one on the menu!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (entering from Rachel's bedroom) I found it!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ohh! Thank God! Where was it?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> On your dresser.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay that is the one we already have!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay, here's my big scene. My big scene's here! (They have two of the cops
on the street, then they cut to where they're entering an apartment.) Oh my God.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (smiling) Okay, everybody just keep smiling. It'll kill my grandmother if
she finds out.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (smiling) Well, what is it?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (smiling) Oh, they cut me out of the show.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (smiling) What?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (smiling) Are you sure?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (smiling) Maybe your scene's coming up?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (smiling) Not likely.&nbsp; 'Cause you see that body bag right there</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (smiling) Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (smiling) I'm in it.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Commercial Break</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, it's continued from before the commercial break.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (smiling) This is terrible, what are you going to do?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (smiling) I don't know. This little, old lady lives for my career. When
they dumped me off of <i>Days of Our Lives</i> she almost died.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (not smiling) That's not good.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (smiling) No, smile! Not that face, smile! Everybody smile! (They all
smile.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (smiling) Joey, why don't you just tell her what happened? It's not your
fault.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (smiling) If we keep talking this way, aren't we gonna freak her out
soon?</p>

<p><b>Grandma Tribbiani:</b> (Something in Italian to Joey.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Soon, soon, I'm gonna be on soon. There I am! (Points to the screen, of
course it isn't him.)</p>

<p><b>Grandma Tribbiani:</b> (pointing at the screen) No! Sam Waterston!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No-no-no, that-that's me, that's me.</p>

<p><b>Grandma Tribbiani:</b> No, it's Sam Waterston! <i>Crimes and Misdemeanors</i>,<i>
Capricorn One</i>.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Doesn't know, &quot;Hello.&quot; But she knows <i>Capricorn One</i>.</p>

<p>(Phoebe gets up.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (following her) Phoebe! I have to have those earrings, we're going to
leave as soon as the show is over.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> But I already gave them back to you!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No you didn't.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> All right, I already didn't give them back to you, that's what I said.
(Walks away over to Rachel.) Where is that other earring?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> It's not here Pheebs, it's not here. Ohh, I went to Joey and Chandler's
last night! Okay! (Goes to the door.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Make sure you check Chandler's jewelry box.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Wait a minute. Chandler has a jewelry box?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, we have like ten minutes. Do you want me to get into that now?!</p>

<p>(Rachel heads for Joey and Chandler's and Phoebe heads for the kitchen to find Ross.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (To Phoebe) Hey Pheebs! How's that uh, vegetarian pizza working out for
ya? You and those vegetables have a real thing going on, huh?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (she just looks at him) Why are you being weird?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Do you like it?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, that would be, &quot;Why are you being cute?&quot;</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, I'm working on my flirting.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ohh! I did not get that.</p>

<p>[Cut to Chandler and Monica on the couch.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> So uh Monica, do you, do you like the <i>Law &amp; Order</i>?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah, it's good.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> See, I'm finding out all this stuff about you today, like you like the
<i>Law &amp; Order</i> and that you flirted with every guy in the Tri-State area!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Chandler! (Joey and his grandmother shush them and wave them away, which
they do.) Okay, let me get this straight, it's okay for you to flirt, but not for me.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, I'm so glad we cleared that up. Look, I'm sorry, some things are
different for men and for women.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Go on, teach me something about men and women.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, I've already taught you so much already, but whatever. See when
you flirt with a guy you think, &quot;I'm just flirting, no big deal.&quot; But the guy is
thinking, &quot;Finally! Somebody who wants to sleep with me!&quot;</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No way!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> It's true.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well that's pathetic!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Again true.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> And this goes for all guys?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All guys that are awake. Then we go to sleep and then all the guys
from the other end of the world wake up and behave the exact same way.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (To Ross in the kitchen) All right, it's another commercial; I still
haven't told her!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Joey! This is like the last commercial. You've got like (checks his watch)
ten minutes left!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I know, I know! What am I going to do? (Thinks) Ooh!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No! You are <b>not</b> gonna run out and leave her here!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (dejected) Yeah, all right. (Thinks of something.) Ooh! (He quickly runs
out before anyone can stop him.)</p>

<p><b>Grandma Tribbiani:</b> Joey!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Uh, Joey is gonna be right back. Right back! (Tries to pantomime it
for her.) Meanwhile, let's-let's-let's talk about you. (Pause.) So, you're old and small.</p>

<p>[Time lapse, Rachel is coming back from Chandler and Joey's.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (entering) (To Phoebe) (whispering) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Did you find it?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> The earring? No. But look, I found my sunglasses under the couch! I've
been looking for these since like last summer. (Puts 'em on.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, those are my sunglasses, you borrowed them from me.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, calm down, here they are. (Gives back the sunglasses.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (entering from her room) Phoebe! (Motions for the earrings. Phoebe gives
her the one-minute sign.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (To Rachel) What are we going to do?!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I don't know, I don't know.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> All right well, we're just gonna have to tell Monica, that's all.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh gosh, she's going to kill me.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I suppose I could tell her it's just all my fault.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ohh that'd be great!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Mon, can I talk to you for a sec?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah, what is it?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Umm, I lost one of your earrings. I'm sorry! I am so, so sorry!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (shocked) Wow! All right well, I mean, what can you do? If you lost it
you lost it.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I will replace it, I promise. I feel so terrible.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> All right, sweetie that's fine. You didn't do it on purpose.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No. </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Look at you! Come here! (They hug.) Feel better?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah! You're the best!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, wait a minute. Wait a minute, I-I-I, I can't do this. Listen
honey, this is, it's not Phoebe's fault. She lent <b>me</b> the earrings, and I lost it.
I'm so sorry. Honey, I feel terrible too. (Holds out her arms for a hug.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (angrily) That is <b>exactly</b> why I do not lend you stuff!! (Rachel
looks over at Phoebe in resignation.) Okay?! I mean, first it's my jewelry! And if it's
not my jewelry, it's-it's my blue sweater! And if it's not my sweater, it's my sunglasses!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Your sunglasses?!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yes!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, right! (Hands Monica back her sunglasses.)</p>

<p><b>Caitlin:</b> (from outside) Pizza!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (running to the door) Oh, mine! Mine! Mine! (to everyone) Okay, here goes.
Prepare yourselves for some Class A flirting.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, hold on. (Pauses as he readies himself.) Okay. (Walks away.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Honey, you have nothing to prove. And if you really like this girl, I
don't flirting is the right thing to&#133; (Ross interrupts and shushes her.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You'll see. Okay. (Readies himself.) Oh, what's-what's her name?</p>
<b>

<p>All:</b> Caitlin!</p>

<p><b>Grandma Tribbiani:</b> Caitlin!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (He opens the door while faking a laugh.) Hey! Oh, we-we can't keep eating
like this. (Monica turns her head in shame.)</p>

<p><b>Caitlin:</b> It's uh, $12.50.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, (gets the money) so, do you make the pizzas in one of those uh,
wood-burning ovens?</p>

<p><b>Caitlin:</b> No actually umm, I think that they're umm, gas.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Gas? Wow! Intense.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (To Monica) If this is the way all the Gellers flirt, we don't have a
problem.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (to Caitlin) Hey uh, y'know that smell gas has?</p>

<p><b>Caitlin:</b> (wanting more than anything to get the money and leave this horrible,
horrible place) Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> They put that in.</p>

<p><b>Caitlin:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> The gas is odorless, but they add the smell so you know when there's a
leak.</p>

<p><b>Caitlin:</b> (getting more desperate to leave) Well okay!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> A lot of other gas smells&#133;</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh the humanity.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Meth-methane smells&#133;</p>

<p><b>Caitlin:</b> Y'know what umm, actually I, I really, I should go.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh but I-I-I haven't paid you yet!</p>

<p><b>Caitlin:</b> Y'know what? That's okay, you guys have ordered so many that this one
is on me! (Runs for her life.)</p>

<p>(Ross closes the door slowly.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (To All) Was I talking to her about gas?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> More so than anything else.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I-I-I found it interesting.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I'm sorry.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Look, no-no, hey, hey, don't worry about it! In nine years, she and I will
be right there. (Goes and sits on the couch dejectedly.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, well, I'm gonna clear out some of these boxes. (She grabs a couple
of the old pizza boxes and exits.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (walking over to Ross) Ross?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What else do they add smell too?</p>

<p>[Scene: The street outside the building, Rachel is running to catch up with Caitlin.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hey! Hey! (Stops Caitlin) Hi! Hey-hey-hey, I'm Rachel! From upstairs?
The ones with all the pizza?</p>

<p><b>Caitlin:</b> Oh, is there a problem?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No. No. Every thing's--they're fine. Great pizza. But it's uh, actually
umm my friend Ross. He uh, just gets really nervous when he's flirting.</p>

<p><b>Caitlin:</b> Oh my God! That was flirting?!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Caitlin:</b> Wow!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I know, I know, but uh just, I'm telling you, once, once you get past
that part, that where it-it just feels like you wanna die, he's-he's really a good person.</p>

<p><b>Caitlin:</b> The guy with the gas?!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah. I'm-I'm telling you he's really sweet and he's really funny and
he's just ugh, got a good heart. And besides, I y'know, I think he really likes you.</p>

<p><b>Caitlin:</b> Really?!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well y'know, we have 7 people and like 10 pizzas, what do you think?</p>

<p><b>Caitlin:</b> I just, I thought Joey was there.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe, Chandler, and Joey's grandmother are still
watching <i>Law &amp; Order</i>.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (entering) Hey Ross? Umm, I just ran into Caitlin in the hallway and-and
uh, you must be getting better at this flirting stuff than I thought.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What do you mean?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, I don't get it, but she wanted me to give you her phone number.
(Hands him the slip of paper with the phone number on it.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> And she just gave you this?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Rach, thanks but uh, I don't need you doing me any favors.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I-I-I didn't! I didn't! She thought you were cute.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well that I can believe.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yay!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (entering) Hey! Is the show still on?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Almost over man.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (says hi to his grandma) Look! Oh! (Pointing out the window.) Is that the
Pope?! (Chandler and his grandma turn to look and Joey slips a tape into the VCR.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Why am I looking?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, here I am, here's my big scene!</p>

<p>(Joey has made a little home movie that's his big scene. He braces himself against the
door to his apartment and while holding a plastic gun and wearing the same sweater
says&#133;)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (on the tape) All right back off! I gotta gun! I'm not afraid to use it!</p>

<p><b>Grandma Tribbiani:</b> Oh Joey!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> That's right!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You couldn't have at least changed your shirt.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (on the tape) Now, I wanna a suitcase filled with 100,000 dollars. (The
duck quacks, to the duck) Choo! Choo! Choo! (To the imaginary cops) Filled with $100,000
in small bills, and if I don't get it&#133;(the duck quacks louder) Choo!! And if I don't
get it, (pause, picks up the duck) I'm gonna shoot this duck!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh no!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (on the tape) I'm comin' out! (He opens the door and hops out pointing the
gun in all directions and then runs out of view.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (To Phoebe) And she's supposed to buy this?!</p>

<p><b>Grandma Tribbiani:</b> Joey, bravo! (Starts with that Italian stuff again.)</p>

<p>(Suddenly, the tape cuts away from Joey's impromptu scene, to Chandler standing really,
really close to the camera.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (singing) <i>Ground control to Major Tom</i>! <i>Commencing
countdown&#133;engines&#133;on</i>!</p>

<p>(Joey and Chandler both run to shut off the tape.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (to his grandmother) That's uh, scenes from next week's show. Next week's!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I am <b>definitely</b> gonna watch that!</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Ending Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, another time lapse, Monica is seeking advice from Rachel
and Phoebe about possible replacement earrings.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What about these? These look the same?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Definitely!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Not as each other! </p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, then no.</p>

<p>(Goes over to Chandler.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (To Monica) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You ready?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You look amazing. I'm the luckiest man in the world.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Ohh, you're about to get a little luckier.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Let me see the earrings.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, honey, the earrings&#133;</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (looking at them) They look great! Does your boyfriend have the best
taste or what?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> My boyfriend really does have good taste!</p>

<p>(He turns to get his coat and Monica gives Rachel and Phoebe two thumbs up as Chandler
walks over to Ross.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (To Ross) Thanks for picking out the earrings man.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hm-mmm.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>End</strong></p>

<hr>

</html>


520<html>

<head>
<title>The One With The Ride Along</title>
<meta HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=windows-1252">
<meta NAME="GENERATOR" CONTENT="Microsoft FrontPage 3.0">
<meta NAME="Template" CONTENT="C:\Program Files\Microsoft Office\Templates\friends.dot">
</head>

<body bgcolor="#FFFFFF" link="#008000">

<h1 align="center">The One With The Ride Along</h1>

<hr>

<p>Written by: Shana Goldberg-Meehan &amp; Seth Kurland<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a></p>

<hr>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Chandler, Rachel, Joey, and Monica are sitting on the couch as
Ross is up getting some coffee.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay, guys, listen, don't forget that tomorrow is the day that Emily
gets married again, so whatever we do, just try to really keep Ross's mind off of it.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, yeah, good idea.</p>

<p>(Ross returns.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey man, what's up?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (sits down at the table) Oh, eh, just thinking about Emily getting married
tomorrow. (Joey panics.) </p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ooh, Ross, look! Look! (Points behind Ross.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (turning and looking) What? Where?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Right over there! Right there! Look-look-look!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What am I looking at?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (to the rest of the gang) Somebody help me out here!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (entering, with Gary) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Hello!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> How are you?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Monica, I'm sorry I didn't come by last night. I was out with Gary; he
let me ride around with him in his cop car. We saw and prevented crimes.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> You got to go on a ride along?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Uh-huh!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I want to go on a ride along!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Me too!</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Okay!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, yeah! Me too!</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Really?! You?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Well, it's kinda dangerous.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, I like danger.</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Okay, you guys free tonight?</p>
<b>

<p>Joey and <b>Ross:</b></b> Yeah!!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Tonight? You-you didn't say it was going to be at nighttime.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Opening Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is kneeling at the coffee table and has a bunch of
pictures laid out in front of her as Rachel enters.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey! Oh, I'm so glad you're home, I thought tonight we could <b>finally</b>
organize these photos!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ohh, thank God! <b>Finally</b>!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay, I've broken them down into categories. Okay, we have uh, we got
holidays, birthdays, candids, y'know&#133; And then what I've done is I've
cross-referenced them by subject. Right? So if you're looking up, oh let's say birthdays
and dogs, you get Photo 152. See? (Hands her the photo.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ohh, it's me and La Poo! Wow! I miss that dog.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You can also find him under umm, dog and dead.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Great! Thanks!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> All right, hand me that other box of photos; that's the very last one.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay. </p>

<p>(She picks up the box and the bottom falls out, spilling all of the pictures onto
Monica's neat little piles.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oops. Sorry! Well, good thing you number all of them, huh?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I hadn't! Photo 152 was a prototype. </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ohhhh. Honey, honey, honey, it's okay, it's okay honey. I'm gonna fix
you a drink, huh? Maybe a margarita?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Ross has the blender! Ugh, everything's just falling apart!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No honey, it's okay! Listen, I'll got to Ross's and get the blender, you
get all the margarita stuff ready.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> All right, he's keys are in the drawer. Y'know what? I also need some
cash.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, you want me to stop at the ATM?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Nah, while you're at Ross's if you see any lying around&#133;</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What?! I-I-I don't, I don't do that! </p>

<p>(Rachel slowly leaves the apartment.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Gary's cop car, Ross is in the front seat with Gary of course. Chandler is in
the back seat.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (to Gary) That was so cool man, the way you leaned on that guy.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> It is starting to get dark out there.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (to Gary) He told you everything! I mean you totally cracked him!</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Yeah well, being that he was the victim, they're usually pretty talkative.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (laughing) Okay. (Deadpan) But it is officially nighttime.</p>

<p>(Gary reaches up to grab that little light that cops have for unmarked cop cars.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh hey, Gary, want me to grab the berry for ya?</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> It's called the cherry.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> It's the&#151;Chandler!!</p>

<p>(Chandler starts laughing at his joke.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (returning from a deli) Okay, I got it! This place makes the best sandwich
in the world!</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Hey Joe does it have meatballs on it?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh-ho, yeah!</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Does it have melted cheese and marinara sauce?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yep!</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Yeah, you can't eat that in my car.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (dejected) Yeah okay. (To Chandler) Even though my tax dollars paid for
this car.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> <b>Your</b> tax dollars?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, okay.</p>

<p>[Time lapse, they're still on the ride along and Joey is just sniffing his sandwich.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (leans in and takes a sniff of Joey's sandwich) Wow! That sandwich
really does smell good.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Did I say you could smell it?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I can't smell your sandwich?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Half the taste is in the smell! You-you're sucking up all the tastiness!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, I'll give them back. (Exhales strongly through his nose and Joey
just glares at him.) Look! What is so great about that sandwich?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay, imagine the best sex you've ever had.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Are you thinking about Monica?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, what's that like?</p>

<p>[Scene: Ross's apartment, Rachel is just entering. She takes off her coat and heads for
the kitchen. As she does, she knocks something off of a bookcase next to the kitchen door
with her coat and it breaks.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ohh please don't be from a real dinosaur! Please! Please! Please!
Please! Please! Please! Please! Please! (She picks up the 2 pieces and looks at the
stand.) Made in Mexico! Yes!! Ugh, who would buy this?! (Looks for a place to hide it and
finds a wall sconce and drops the pieces into it and heads into the kitchen as the phone
rings.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (on the answering machine) Rach! It's me! Pick up!</p>

<p>(Rachel runs over and answers the phone with the blender in hand.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hey! What's up?!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I need a few more things to make the margaritas. Uhh, I need some salt,
some margarita mix, and tequila.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> So all we have is ice?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> See if he has ice.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay.</p>

<p>(She hangs up the phone and starts to head back to the kitchen and notices some money
lying out, stops, reaches down to pick it up, the phone rings causing her to drop it, she
quickly puts it back, and heads for the kitchen.)</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> (on answering machine) Hello Ross? It's Emily. (Rachel runs back into the
room with the tequila.) I know this is out of the blue but uh, I'm getting married
tomorrow. Well, maybe I am. I keep thinking about you and I'm wondering if-if we made a
mistake giving up so fast. Are you thinking about me? Of course you're not, but if you
are, call me tonight. Okay, bye.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh. Oh! (Takes a slug of tequila.)</p>

<p>[Scene: The ride along.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> So where are we going next?</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> This witness won't return my calls so we're gonna see if we can surprise
him coming home.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Sur-surprise him? We're not, we're not gonna make anybody mad are we?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Come on man! (To Gary) Listen so uh, are you gonna squeeze the perps shoes
a little bit before he lawyers up?</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> It's a witness not a perp. And no one talks like that!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, no one talks like that!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh what? Like your Mr. Cop!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey, I'm more cop than you two!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> How do you figure that?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hello! I'm in the front seat, okay? I'm Gary's partner!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Y'know, when you say partner it doesn't sound cop. It, it sounds gay.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Umm, jealous! (He drops the cherry and it turns on.)</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Hey, do you mind? We're under cover here.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, no problem. (Tries to turn it off.)</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Ross!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Sorry! Sorry! Oh, (He sticks it under his shirt) there! (It's just there
flashing through his shirt) Hey Gary, who am I? Phone home!</p>

<p>(Gary just glares at him.)</p>

<p>[Time lapse, Ross has been demoted to the back seat with Joey and Chandler. He's not
too happy about it.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Look at Officer Ross riding back here with the visitors.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, what's up with that Serpico?</p>

<p>[Scene: Ross's apartment, Rachel is playing Emily's message to Monica.]</p>

<p><b>Emily:</b> (on answering machine) Are you thinking about me? Of course you're not,
but if you are, call me tonight. Okay, bye.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (does Rachel's) Nooo!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (does Monica's) I know!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well thank God you were here! I mean, we have to erase that!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?! We can't do that!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> We have too! I mean what if Ross's hears that and then calls her back
and then they get back together? Is that what you want? Ross back with that controlling,
neurotic, crazy Emily? The Emily that wouldn't let him see you?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Noo! Oh no! No! God no! He should not get back together with her. I know
that! You know that! Even Ross knows that! But that still doesn&#146;t give us the right
to erase his message!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I'm his sister, okay? I love him! I don't want to see him get hurt! Come
on! Doesn&#146;t that give me the right to control him&#151;help him?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I don't think he's the one who needs help.</p>

<p>(They both sit down.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No, look, she's obviously unstable, okay? I mean she's thinking about
running out on her wedding day. (Rachel slowly turns and glares at her.) (Realizing what
she just said.) Okay, fine! But I mean, look at the position she's putting him in! What's
he gonna do? Ross is gonna run over there on the wedding day and break up the marriage?! I
mean, who would do that?! (Rachel again turns and glares at her in disgust.) Okay, fine,
all right, but that's y'know, it's different! Although it did involve a lot of the same
people.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ugh!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Y'know what, this is obviously some kind of twisted joke she's trying to
play on him.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, <b>you </b>are crazy! I'm sorry, but she sounded generally upset!
I mean, listen! (She hits a button on the machine.)</p>
<b>

<p>Answering Machine:</b> Your messages have been erased.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Noooooooo!</p>

<p>[Scene: The ride along, they're all waiting outside of the witness's house and still in
the car in the same places as before.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, y'know, we-we're safe right? I mean nothing bad can <b>go down</b>!</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> No. But that reminds me, (handing back a clipboard) sign this.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What is it?</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Oh it's nothing, it just says that you can't sue the city if you scrap
your knee or y'know, get your head blown off.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (deadpan) Oh, hurry up. I want to sign that.</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Okay, here he comes. What is he doing? What the hell is he doing?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What? What? What? What is it?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Is everything okay?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What's going on?</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Okay, he sees us. Now don't move. Don't look at him.</p>

<p>(They all turn and look away. Suddenly a loud bang sounds out and in slow motion Joey
slowly throws his body over Ross. Gary is shocked at what he sees while Chandler is
obviously hurt.)</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Hey, it's okay. It was just a car backfire. (Joey slowly moves off of
Ross.) Hey, look at that! You tried to save your buddy. You see that? You see what he did?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (To Ross) You okay man?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Uh-huh. Thank Joey!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Uh, <b>HELLO</b>!!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hi.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Commercial Break</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Ross's apartment, Monica has all the supplies she needs and is getting ready to
leave.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> All right, I guess we should go.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No, wait. Wait.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh yeah right! (She grabs the money and shoves into her pocket.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No, Monica! Monica! We have to fix this!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> There's nothing we can do. You erased the message!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah well unless we tell him.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well, if you're gonna be totally rational about this, I can't argue with
you! All right? Fine, if you wanna tell him, tell him. I just don't want to be a part of
it.</p>

<p>(The phone rings.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, maybe that's Emily calling back to leave the exact same message.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (on the machine) Hey Ross! It's you! I just want you to remember this
feeling. You are lucky to be alive! So live everyday to the fullest. Love yourself, okay?
Okay. Oh, and also get stamps. Bye! (He hangs up.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Wow! Play that message for Emily and this whole problem goes away!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Right?</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, the guys are returning from the ride along to find Phoebe already
there.]</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Hey, anybody want to meet a hero?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (excited) John Glenn is here?!</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> No, Joey!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Pheebs, we had the most <b>incredible</b> night! Okay, so, we're in the
car&#133;</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Wait! Hold on! (He goes over to Phoebe and gives her a kiss.) (To Phoebe)
Hi!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> (To Ross) Okay, go ahead.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, okay, so we're in the car. Right? And <b>bang</b>! A shot was fired.
And Joey with no regard for his own safety throws himself on me!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> My God, Joey!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (pouting) It was a car backfire!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, but-but <b>he</b> didn't know that!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, I didn't know that.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> And it could've just as easily have been a bullet.</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Hey Joe, you ever think about joining the force? We could use a guy like
you.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Who jumps at loud noises!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Wow! I could've died tonight.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah! If the car that backfired had run over you! Y'know what, I think
I'll go home before Ross starts rambling about his newfound respect for life. (He gets up
and starts for the door.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I <b>do</b> have a newfound <b>respect</b> for <b>life</b>.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (returning) Oh my God! (Storms out.)</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> (To Phoebe) So you wanna get some dinner?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah! Sure! Yep! (Gets up) Oh, y'know what? If I heard a shot right now,
I'd throw my body on you.</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Oh yeah? Well maybe you and I should take a walk through a bad
neighborhood.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay!</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> All right.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Bye!</p>
<b>

<p>Ross and <b>Joey:</b></b> Bye!</p>

<p>(They leave as Ross stares in awe at Joey.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Cut it out Ross! I hate to have to save your life and kick your ass in the
same day!</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is pacing as Joey enters.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Dude! How come you took off? </p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, I just went for a walk, around the living room. Whatever&#133;</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Is something wrong?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No. No I'm just tired. Y'know, from-from the walk.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You dove in front of Ross! Ross!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> That's what this is about! Oh my God, you hate Ross!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I do not hate Ross!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Of course you do! I saved him! You're mad at me! It all adds up! You want
Ross out of the picture.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What picture?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I don't know, but I don't like what I'm hearing!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Look I'm very glad that you saved Ross from the car backfire, but
y'know, it could've been a bullet and you y'know, you didn't try to save me!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ohh, you're upset because you think I chose Ross over you! No!
I&#133;knew&#133;you could take care of yourself. Y'know, I mean Ross, he need help. He's
not street like us!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> When it comes down to it, you would risk your life for Ross before you
would for me. That's the bottom line.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, no, not exactly! All right, look, I, I wasn't trying to save Ross.
Okay? My sandwich was next to Ross. All right? I was, I was trying to save my sandwich.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> From a bullet!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I know it doesn't make much sense&#133;</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> <b>Much</b> sense?!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Look Chandler, it was instinct! Okay? I just went for it!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> So you risked your life, for a sandwich!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I know it sounds crazy, but Chandler this is (Goes and picks up the
sandwich) the greatest sandwich in the world!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> So you didn't uh, choose Ross before me.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No! I would never do that! You-you're like my brother!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Really?!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah! In fact, to prove how much you mean to me, (He unwraps the sandwich
and holds it out for Chandler) here.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Thanks. (He grabs the sandwich.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No, eh, oh-oi, easy, it's not a hot dog!</p>

<p>(Chandler takes a bite.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> How good is that?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (with his mouthful) Oh-oi-ho, yeah!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> See?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hm-hmm. (Goes to take another bite.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh-whoa-hey, dude, what are you doing?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I thought you were showing me how much you mean to me.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah. With a bite! (Takes back the sandwich.) Gee-e-e-eez!</p>

<p>[Scene: Ross's apartment, Rachel is trying to repair the thing she broke earlier, but
gets interrupted by hearing Ross at the door. She panics and throws the thing into the
kitchen. And runs to the couch as Ross enters.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hey! Hi!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Rach, what uh, what are you doing here?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hey! Y'know what? <b>You</b> are in our apartment all the time! Okay?
This is, this is just a drop in the bucket mister!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Y'know, it-it doesn't matter. The important thing is that you're here.
You're my friend, and you're here. Oh! (He goes over and hugs her.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, just a little scared. What's going on Ross?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> The most amazing thing happened tonight. I thought my number was up. I had
an actual near death experience!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?! What? What happened?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, okay, we were on the ride along with Gary, right? </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> And somebody took a shot at me!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (gasps) Really?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> No, a car backfired, but (Rachel suddenly calms down) I thought somebody
was taking a shot at me. And Rach, I&#133;I survived! And I was filled with this-this
great respect for life. Y'know? I-I want to experience every moment. I want to seize every
opportunity. I-I am seeing everything so-so clearly now.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Because a car backfired?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (stares at her briefly) Okay, why are you here?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, I-I-I don't know how this fits into your whole &quot;seizing&quot;
thing but um, Emily called you today.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You talked to her?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No, she left a message. (He starts for the machine.) (Stopping him.) But
it-it kinda got erased. There's just (Pause) something wrong with your machine.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, okay, what-what did she say?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, uh something about having second thoughts about the wedding and
did you guys make a mistake breaking up and uh, she wants you to call her.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Wow!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Now, that-that was a good thing that I told you, right?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Huh? Yeah! Yes, of course!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay. Thank you! Thank you! Because&#151;I'm sorry, all right. Because
y'know what? She didn't want me&#151;not important. The point is, I was right. Your
decision. Okay? I was right. (She starts for the door.) (Stops) Your decision.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Right. I guess, I guess I should call Emily.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, no, that's not the right decision. That's not, that's not right,
no Ross-Ross, come on! I mean, that woman made you miserable! Okay, Ross, do you <b>really</b>
want to get back into that?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, look, yesterday I would've even considered calling her back, but my
ex-wife calls on the same day I have a near death experience. I mean, that-that has got to
mean something!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ugh, Ross! That was <b>not</b> a near death experience! That was barely
an experience!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You weren't there! Okay, maybe this is something that I-I'm supposed to
seize! Y'know?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, y'know what? Maybe, this is not about seizing stuff. Maybe this is
about escaping stuff.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Huh.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I mean, look-look today you escaped (Pause) (Not believing it) death,
y'know? And maybe this is a chance for you to <b>escape</b> getting back together with
Emily?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> That does make sense. Because I do wanna seize some opportunity, but I-I
really don't wanna see or talk to her.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, there you go!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah. Maybe today is just, close call day.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (laughing) Close call day.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey, thanks Rach. (They hug.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ohh, honey no problem. Okay. (Gets up.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh wait-wait-wait! The message is blinking. Maybe you didn't erase it. </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh?</p>

<p>(Ross hits the playback button.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (on machine) &quot;Hey Ross, it's you!&quot; (Hits the stop button) Oh
yeah, no that's-that's an old message, nobody needs to hear that.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No. (She heads for the door again.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (looking at the coffee table where his money was) Hey umm, was-was Monica
here?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah, I want my money back.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (going out the door) Yeah, uh you-you probably need that for stamps,
right?</p>

<p>(Ross is stunned.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Ending Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, everyone is there.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey Pheebs, has Gary ever been shot at for real?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yes. Once. Yeah, a little. He kinda did it to himself. It's not really a
good story.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I wonder how I would react under fire, y'know? And not backfire but-but
heavy fire, like I was in a war or something.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Man, I would be great in a war! I mean, I really, I think I would make a
<b>fantastic</b> military leader. I mean I know I would make General way before any of you
guys.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Before or after you were shot by your own troops?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I know where Joey would be. He would be down in the foxhole protecting all
of us.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes, if the foxhole was lined with sandwiches.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, hero sandwiches. (Points at Ross who points back.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well you all know that I'm a pacifist so I'm not interested in war in
any way. (Gets up) But y'know what? When the revolution comes, I will have to destroy you
all. (Starts to leave.) (To Joey) Not you Joey.</p>

<p>(Joey gets all happy with himself, while the rest of the gang is less than enthused.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>End</strong></p>

<hr>
