521<html>

<head>
<title>The One With The Ball</title>
<meta HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=windows-1252">
<meta NAME="GENERATOR" CONTENT="Microsoft FrontPage 3.0">
<meta NAME="Template" CONTENT="C:\Program Files\Microsoft Office\Templates\friends.dot">
</head>

<body bgcolor="#FFFFFF" link="#008000">

<h1 align="center">The One With The Ball</h1>

<hr>

<p>Teleplay by: Greg Malins<br>
Story by: Scott Silveri<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a></p>

<hr>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Gary, Phoebe, Monica, and Chandler are there.]</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> (To Phoebe) Would you like some more coffee, baby-doll?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I'm fine, thanks.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (To Monica) Yeah, see, I can't pull of baby-doll can I?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No. I think we learned that from the sugarlips incident. I'm gonna get
some tea.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay.</p>

<p>(Monica leaves and Chandler moves to talk to Phoebe.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hiya doin' pumpkin?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Nope. (Chandler nods in agreement.)</p>

<p>[Cut to Gary and Monica at the counter.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> So it looks like it's going really well for you two, huh?</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> I know, really well. In fact, I'm gonna ask Phoebe to move in with me.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (shocked) Oh my God!</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> What do you, what do you think?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I think that is so great! When are you gonna ask her?</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Tonight, but don't say anything. Okay?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I swear, I promise. I promise. Oh my God, I'm so excited! {<i>And I just
can't hide it</i>!<i> I'm about to lose control and I think I like it</i>! Sorry, just
couldn't resist it.} All right, listen let me tell you, do <b>not</b> get her flowers.
Okay? Because y'know, she cries when they die, and there's the whole funeral&#133;</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> (To Phoebe) I'll see you after work sweetie. (Kisses her.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay. Bye! </p>

<p>(Gary exits and Monica rejoins them.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> So, what movie should we see?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (sitting down) Gary's gonna ask you to move in with him!!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What?! Really?!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> He just told me at the counter. He made me promise not to tell, but I
couldn't hold it in any longer!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I can't believe this!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (terrified) Right, because it's fast. Because, it's so fast. It's
fast!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Relax! It's Phoebe! Not you!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh! Good for you Pheebs, way to go! (Breathes a sigh of relief)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, but it <b>is</b> fast. Isn't it?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Ohhhh!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, I like him a lot but I don't think I'm ready for this!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> So, what are you gonna do?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I don't know. I'll just handle it&#151;I'll ask you to talk to him!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Me?! Why me?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Because you are so afraid of commitment! You talk to him, make him
scared like you! Make him a&#133;man!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I'll try, but I'm not sure what good it would do, y'know? Because I'm
a lot less afraid of commitment than I used to be.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> That is so sweet! (She kisses him and turns to add some sugar to her
tea.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (To Phoebe, behind Monica's back) Still terrified, I'll take care of
it. No problem. (When Monica turns back he smiles and kisses her, when she turns away he
nods that he'll do it to Phoebe.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Opening Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Joey and Ross are playing catch with a little foam globe.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey Ross, is uh, is Staten Island really an island?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Uh-huh, that's why they call it Staten <b>Island</b>.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ohhh. I thought it was like Long Island.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (he catches the ball and pauses, staring at Joey in disbelief) Also an
island.</p>

<p>(The game resumes.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey, what time is it?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (looks at his watch) 2:17.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Wow! You realize that we've been throwing this ball, without dropping it,
for like an hour?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Are you serious?!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah. I realized it about a half-hour ago but I didn't want to say
anything 'cause I didn't want to jinx it.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Wow! We are pretty good at this! Hey! We totally forgot about lunch!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, I-I, I think that's the first time I ever missed a meal! (Checks his
pants.) Yeah, my pants are a little loose!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (entering) Hey, you guys&#133;</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Is Monica here?</p>
<b>

<p>Joey and <b>Ross:</b></b> No.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> All right listen umm, I just bought something I'm not sure she's gonna
like it, and it's gonna seem a little crazy, but this is something that I wanted since I
was a little girl.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> You bought Shawn Cassidy!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Noo! I wish! Okay, you ready? </p>
<b>

<p>Joey and <b>Ross:</b></b> Yeah!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay! (She goes and gets her surprise and when she returns with it, Ross
stares in shock.) Check it out!</p>

<p>(Joey turns and looks at quite possibly one of the ugliest pets that you can possibly
buy on the planet. Rachel has bought herself a hairless cat. Yep, a hairless cat! Joey and
Ross start to get sick.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What-what is it?!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What the hell is that?!!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> It's a, it's a cat!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> <b>That</b>, is not a cat! {I have to agree with Joey on this one.}</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yes it is!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Why is it inside out?!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Excuse me! But this is a purebred, show-quality Sphinx cat!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> How much did you pay for that?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, it was a little extravagant, but I a pretty good deal.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah? How much?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> A thousand bucks.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> ON A CAT??!!!!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> It's not a cat!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> All right listen ball boys! My grandmother had one of these when I was a
little girl and it was the sweetest thing! I mean it was so cute, it would sit in my lap
and purr all day long, and I would drag a shoestring on the ground and he would chase it!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Free cats do that too, y'know. {Which reminds me, if I might get a little
political here, support your local animal shelter. Pet shops are <b>not</b> the place to
buy dogs and cats from, you get a much better deal from the shelter, plus they probably
won't die on you in a week and a half. If you want a leash, go to the pet shop. If you
want the dog for that leash, go to the shelter and save it's life. Now back to regularly
scheduled programming.}</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> It's not a cat!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Ugh! Look you guys, I'm really excited about this! Okay? I don't care
what you think! I'm gonna go set up a little litter box for Mrs. Whiskerson. (They both
glare at her.) Well, what am I gonna call her? Fluffy?!</p>

<p>(Rachel goes into the bathroom as the guys continue throwing the ball.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (To Joey) Hey, you wanna get something to eat or uh, do you wanna see how
long we can throw this ball back and forth? Huh?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Uhh, the ball thing.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey Ross, wouldn't it be great if we could go two straight hours without
dropping it?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Uhh, <b>yeah</b> it would! Let's do it!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay!</p>

<p>(They throw the ball back and forth once.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (catches the ball) Uh-oh.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I have to pee. And Rachel's in the bathroom!</p>

<p>[Cut to Chandler and Joey's, Ross is seen throwing the ball into the bathroom,
presumably where Joey is currently using the facilities.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Man, I didn't think we were gonna make it!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I know! (Looks at the ball in his hands.) Don't switch hands, okay?</p>

<p>[Scene: the 5<sup>th</sup> Precinct, Gary's precinct, Chandler has come to talk to him
about commitment. And as he's walking through the door he notices a couple of &quot;Ladies
of the night&quot; sitting there. (If you know what I mean.)]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey ladies! What are you in here for? (Laughs at his joke.)</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Hey Chandler, what are you doing here?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Gary, I'm here to report a crime.</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Yeah?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> It is a crime that you and I don't spend more time together.</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> (laughs, then suddenly serious) What's up?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, I heard that you thinking about asking Phoebe to move in with
you and I thought maybe, we should have a talk. Man to uh, me.</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Sure. Okay.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Uh, are you crazy? Are you insane? If you live with Phoebe, you two
are gonna be y'know, live-living together!</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Yeah, I-I considered that. I just know it would make me happy.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You mean scared.</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> No, I mean happy.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Scared? Happy?</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Chandler, what-what are you doing?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I am trying to open your eyes, my man! Don't you see, if you lived
with Phoebe she's always gonna be there. You're gonna get home, she's there. You go to
bed, she's there. You wake up and oh yes, she's there!</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> I know! I can't wait!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Were you're parents happy, or something?</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Listen Chandler, the way I see it is that I was lucky enough to find
someone that I really love. I just&#151;I wanna be around her as much as I can.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Wow, y'know when you say it, it doesn't sound so scary.</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> So you know what I'm talking about, right?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, I think I do! Y'know what? You move in with her! You move in
with her right now! Maybe I should in with Monica!</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> No, it's too soon for you guys.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (pause) Yeah, you're right about that.</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Ross and Joey are still playing catch.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> &#133;now when they found the remains of the Mesozoic Mastodon they
discovered what <b>appeared</b> to be the remains of a Paleozoic Amphibian in its jaws!
How did it get there?!</p>

<p>{Y'know, sometimes I think the script writers throw in a line like that to try to
trip me up. But it won't work. I'll always have the last laugh! &lt;manical_laugh.wav&gt;
Okay, so maybe I'm a little deluded, it's probably just my spellchecker. But, I must admit
I did get Mesozoic and Paleozoic on the first attempt. Yay me! Anyhoo&#133;}</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Maybe this should be more of a quiet game.</p>

<p>{Oh, all right!&nbsp; Geez, I can't have <strong>any</strong> fun!}</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (entering) Hey guys!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Joey, I left my watch on the counter last night. (Goes to the counter)
It was right here, where is it?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I don't know.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> All right, come on, I'm-I'm late for work!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> How do you know? You don't have a watch.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Guys, could you please just stop throwing the ball for one minute and
just help me find it!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, I don't know&#133;. Yeah, can't do it.</p>

<p>(He throws it back to Ross, but it's intercepted by Monica and the guys both scream in
horror.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Monica, whatever you do, do <b>not</b> drop that ball!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, we haven't dropped it in&#133; (Looks to Ross.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> 2 hours, 27 minutes.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Really?!</p>

<p>[Time lapse, Monica has joined in and is calling to get out of work.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (on phone, faking she's sick) I-I'm not gonna be able to make it into
work today, I don't feel very good. (Joey makes a high throw and Monica has to catch it
way over her head.) (Not sounding sick) Yes!! (Realizes what she just did.) (Sounding sick
again) Wow! Uh, for a second there I thought I was really better, but I'm not. (Hangs up
and keeps throwing the ball.)</p>

<p>(Rachel enters.) </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey Rach!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hey.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Check it out! Almost 3 hours without droppin' it!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, wow! Congratulations, that's quite a waste of time.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Rach?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> You have scratches all over you, what happened? (Rachel's arms are
covered with scratches.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, it's my cat.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (shocked) What?!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh yeah, I got a cat.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I don't want a cat!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, don't worry, it's not a cat.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> You guys this cat is <b>nothing</b> like my grandmother's cat. I mean,
it's not sweet, it's not cute, I even dragged that little string on the ground, and it
just flipped out and scratched the hell out of me. And I swear, I know this sounds crazy,
but every time this cat hisses at me I know it's saying, &quot;Rachel!&quot;</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Doesn't sound as crazy as paying a thousand dollars for a cat.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (To Rachel) What?! You paid a thousand dollars for a cat when you owe me
300!!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, I was gonna let you play with it.</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe is drinking coffee as Chandler enters.]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hi!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hmm, did you talk to Gary about the moving in thing?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes I did, and I think you should do it.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> He's a great guy, y'know? And he loves you a lot, you are a very lucky
lady.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> You are useless! Freaking out about commitment is the <b>one</b> thing
you can do! The <b>one</b> thing! And you can't even do that right! God!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I&#146;m sorry. (Pause) If you ask me, I'd move in with him.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ohh!! God! (Gary enters and she sees him) Ooh! (To Chandler) Get out of
here, good for nothing.</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Hey Chandler.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey Gar!</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> (To Phoebe) Hi sweetie. (Kisses her.) Hi, can I talk to you for a second?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah! Okay. (They move to the couch.)</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> You look very pretty today.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Thanks! Okay. (They sit down.)</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Here's the thing.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah?</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Y'know I <b>really</b> want to move this relationship forward.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Uh-hmm.</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Because if you're not moving forward, y'know you're just moving backwards.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No that's not true. If you're not moving forward, you're just staying
still. And staying still is good. Watch this. (She stays still for a brief second.) </p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Phoebe?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah?</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> I want you to move in with me.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> That is so sweet. But don't you think it's a little too soon? I mean
there's so much we don't know about each other.</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> (disappointed) Oh. Oh-oh-okay, I get it.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I just&#151;I don't want us to jump into something we're not ready for.</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> (disappointed more) Uh-huh.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I really don't want to mess up what we have. I'm just&#151;I'm worried
it's gonna be a big mistake.</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> (on the verge of tears) Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Which is why my answer is yes!</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> (suddenly happy) Really?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Uh-huh! (They hug.) I'm so&#133;happy. (She's not happy.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Commercial Break</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey, Ross, and Monica are still playing catch, with
Chandler looking on. Joey throws the ball to Monica who catches it and whips it at Ross.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (catching the ball) Monica! Stop throwing it so hard! We're on the same
team!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Four hours? You guys have been doing this for four hours?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> That's right baby.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All right, let me in. (He jumps off of the counter to join in the
game.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (jumping in front of him) No-no! Don't do it! Don't!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> He's a dropper!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh yeah, that's right!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I'm not a dropper!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> It's really a uh-uh three person game, y'know?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> It's throwing and catching!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> All right. (He gently tosses the ball to Chandler who catches it.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh! Oh! That's so hard. (Starts to juggle the ball, but loses control
and almost drops it and hands it to Monica.)</p>

<p>(Rachel enters with the &quot;cat&quot; and the chick and the duck start to get riled
up.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Whoa-whoa you guys, it's not a cat!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh my&#151;Oh good God!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (she's wearing an oven mitt to protect her hand) I give up you guys, I
don't know what I'm going to do with this thing!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Baking it didn't help, huh?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> So, why don't you just take it back to where you got it?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I tried! They won't take her back.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Maybe that's because she's a minion of the anti-Christ.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Rach, why won't they take it back?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, they said would but they would only give me store credit. I mean,
what am I going to do, get a thousand regular cats?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Look, if you want you can keep it at our place until you find out what
to do with it.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No Mon that's not the point. I'm out a thousand dollars, I'm all
scratched up, and I'm stuck with this stupid cat that looks like a hand! (Storms out.)</p>

<p>(Monica sneezes.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh my God, the cat's made my eyes water! Don't-don't throw it to me! My
vision's been compromised!! (Quickly grabs a tissue to wipe her eyes.) Oh God! Okay. Okay.
It's okay. Man, that was close.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, you almost overreacted to something.</p>
<b>

<p>Phoebe and <b>Gary:</b></b> (entering) Hey!</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> We have <b>great</b> news!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> We're moving in together! Isn't it great! Yay!</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Congratulations! Congrats!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I know, I'm so excited!</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> So am I!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, you're not more excited than I am! No way! I'm the <b>most</b>
excited!</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Okay, I'll see you at the station later.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay, yeah, I'll see you later! Don't forget about the moving in!</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> All right.</p>

<p>(Phoebe closes the door behind him.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> So you're moving in with him. What happened?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I couldn't tell him no. He got so sad. Maybe it'll be all right. I <b>do</b>
really like him a lot and probably do it eventually anyway and plus, think of all the
money I'll save on stamps.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Why, do you write him a lot?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, I just heard when people live together, they split the cost of
stamps. Don't they?</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Yeah! That's right. Yeah-yeah! Yeah!</p>

<p>(Rachel enters with the cat, wearing the oven mitt, and startles Phoebe.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, I'm sorry, the oven mitts really freaked me out.</p>

<p>[Scene: Gary's precinct, Phoebe is entering.]</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Hey, honey! Okay, so did you find any apartments? Anything in Brooklyn
Heights?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, nothing.</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Oh really?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Nothing at all?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, as soon as something opens up we'll move right in. Unless it doesn't
have a pool, I need a pool. (Turns away from him.)</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Phoebe, can I talk to you for a second?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Uh-huh!</p>

<p>(He takes her into one of those typical interrogation rooms you see on TV and in the
movies. Which is really appropriate here, since this is a TV show. What are the odds of
that?)</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Take a seat. You okay? You feeling all right? (Closes the door and takes
off his coat.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (sits down) Yeah, I feel great. 'Cause we're moving in together.</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> So you uh, you checked the paper for listings in Brooklyn Heights, right?
You-you checked the <i>Post</i>?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, uh-huh, there was nothing. (Pause) Can I get some water?</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> In a minute. You-you checked today's <i>Post</i>?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Umm, yeah! Today's.</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> 'Cause uh, this is today's <i>Post</i> (produces one from the other chair)
and uh, these are the listings I found. (Points) Brooklyn Heights, two bedroom. (Points)
Brooklyn Heights, one bedroom. (Points) Brooklyn Heights, (points) Brooklyn Heights,
(points) Brooklyn Heights!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (looks at the paper) Are these for rent! I thought people were just
bragging!</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Let me tell you what I think might be going on. (Phoebe looks down in
shame.) No-no-no, don't look at the table. Look at me. (Points to his eyes and she does
so) Okay, I think somebody asked someone to move in with them. And I think someone said,
&quot;Yes&quot; but now she's having doubts because things are moving to fast for someone.
Does that sound at all possible to you?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yes. Yes! Fine! I <b>am</b> someone! You want me to say it? I have
doubts! (Pause) I'm sorry! (Puts her head down.)</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Phoebe&#133;</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah?</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Phoebe, it's okay that you feel this way. I mean it <b>is</b> soon. And
there's a lot of things we don't know about each other, and I just figure that everything
I really like. And the things I don't know, I get to learn about at someplace with both
our names on the mailbox.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> That's so sweet.</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Sweethart, but none of that matters if it's too soon for you. It's fine!
We don't have to move in together. I just&#151;I want you to be happy</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Living with you would make me happy.</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Phoebe, you <b>don't</b> have to say that.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, I really wanna live with you! I wanna move in with you!</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Are you sure?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yes. Definitely! Yes! Let's live in an apartment that we both live in!
(Hugs him.) </p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Oh that's great!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh wait, one sec. One sec. (Goes to the mirror) Hey you! Behind the
glass! Who are you looking at! I've always wanted to say that when I was in one of these
rooms, (sees the look on his face) which was never!</p>

<p>[Scene: The street outside Central Perk, Rachel is trying to sell the cat.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Show cat! Quality show cat! Show cat! (A woman approaches.)</p>

<p><b>Woman No. 1:</b> (looks into the box) Oh my God! What's wrong with your baby?!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> It's not a baby! It's a cat!</p>

<p><b>Woman No. 1:</b> Eew! It's creepy looking!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh no! No! It's actually&#151;it's very sweet. It's very sweet. Look!
(Goes to pet it and it hisses at her.) Yeah, do you want it?</p>

<p><b>Woman No. 1:</b> (laughs) No, I hate cats.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, so then what are you doing to me? Okay? Just get out of here! All
right? Move on!</p>

<p>(Another woman approaches.)</p>

<p><b>Woman No. 2:</b> Wow! What an unusual cat!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yes! Thank you! Exactly! You want it?</p>

<p><b>Woman No. 2:</b> Maybe. I was thinking about getting a cat, I was just going to go
to the shelter (Good for her) but&#133; Okay, why not?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, terrific! That'll be $2,000.</p>

<p><b>Woman No. 2:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, a thousand.</p>

<p><b>Woman No. 2:</b> I thought you wanted to adopt your cat.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, I do, but you're just gonna have to actually look at this as more
of an investment than a cat.</p>

<p><b>Woman No. 2:</b> Okay, yeah, I just wanted a cat. (Starts to leave.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (makes some unintelligible sound to stop her from leaving) Obviously you
know how to haggle, so I'm not gonna try and take you on. Okay? So $800 and I don't call
the cops because you're robbing me blind! Blind! (Covers her eyes) Just take cat, leave
the money, and run away! Run away! (Uncovers her eyes and sees that the woman has fled)
Damnit! (To the cat) Cat, can't you at least smile or something?! (The cat hisses at her
again, it sounds like Rachel) Okay, did anybody just hear that? Anybody?</p>

<p>[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey, Ross, Monica, and now Chandler are still playing
catch. The guys are exhausted and sitting around the room. Monica is still standing all
pumped up and being hyper-competitive yet again. {Okay! We get it! She's competitive!!
Must we see <b>all</b> the time?!}]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I'm starving! </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Come on guys! Suck it up! We're closing in on ten hours! It's gut-check
time!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I don't know who made you the boss? All right? We (Ross and him) invented
this game!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Please! I made this game what it is.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Not fun anymore?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I'm still hungry! </p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> All right, there's some pizza at my place, we can all eat with one hand
right? Are you with me?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I am!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> All right! Let's go! (Runs to the door.) Let's go Team Monica! (The guys
all stop and stare at her) All right, we can work out the name later.</p>

<p>[Cut to her apartment where Rachel is sitting at the table.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Rachel! What is your cat doing in one of my bowls!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> It's not! I'm defrosting a chicken. (Pause) Oh, I uh sold Mrs.
Whiskerson.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh, thank God!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Did you get your money back?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, 15 hundred dollars.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Wow! You made a profit!</p>

<p><b>Gunther:</b> (entering with the cat) I just came for the red-velvet pillow.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh yeah, there you go. (Hands over the pillow.)</p>

<p><b>Gunther:</b> Thanks Rachel. And-and don't forget you-you can come visit her anytime
you want.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh good, great! I'll-I'll keep that in mind. (Turns and walks away.)</p>

<p><b>Gunther:</b> (To Ross) Hey! So what is this? Some kind of snake or something?</p>

<p>[Scene: Gary and Phoebe's apartment, it's morning and they're both waking up in bed.]</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> I really like waking up with you.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I like waking up with you too. (Looks out the window) Oh! It's such a
beautiful morning. (Some birds are singing outside the window) Oh, I can stay here all
day.</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> That would be great!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> We could have breakfast in bed&#133;</p>

<p><b>Gary:</b> Wait, just a second. </p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay. (He grabs his gun and shoots the bird.) Oh! Oh no.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Hyper-competitive Monica, Rachel, Chandler, Joey, and Ross
are still playing catch. Monica is finally tiring while the rest of them are totally
exhausted and virtually asleep.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> All right! Come on Monica! Look alive! Come on, look alive!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (entering) Oh good, you're all up.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Phoebe! It's 6 o'clock in the morning! Why aren't you at Gary's?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh yeah, that's over.</p>

<p><b>All:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Come on! Gary's such a great guy! Whatever the problem is, you can
work it out!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> He shot a bird!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh that is over!</p>

<p><b>All:</b> That's terrible! I'm sorry!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Phoebe, are you okay?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah. Yeah, I'll be alright.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh hey, here Pheebs. (He throws her the ball.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (catches it) Nah, I don't feel like playing. (She sets the ball down on
the table and everyone gasps.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> It's okay. It's okay. Just pretend that it didn't happen! Okay? No one
needs to know! I mean, Phoebe's not an official ballplayer! I mean, only official
ballplayers can drop the ball!</p>

<p><b>All:</b> All right. Okay. I'm starving! (They all get up, thus officially ending the
game.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Phoebe, honey, wanna get some breakfast?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay! Okay, let's race! First one there wins! Ha-ha! (Runs out the door
and everyone watches her leave.)</p>

<p>(Pause)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You guys wanna eat here?</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Yeah! As long as we're here!</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Ending Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, everyone is there.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Man that was great! Huh? Can you believe how long we threw that ball
around?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, it is amazing it lasted that long.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I know. My arm is killing me.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No, I meant with the dropper over here. (Points at Chandler.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Y'know, how did I get this reputation as a dropper? Okay? I'm <b>anything</b>
but a dropper. (We see various scenes of him dropping a football, a mug of coffee, the
phone, an apple, a Frisbee, a record, and the final scene has a ball bouncing off of his
chest. I'm not going to describe them, you'll have to see them.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>End</strong></p>

<hr>

</html>

522<html>

<head>
<title>The One With Joey's Big Break</title>
<meta HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=windows-1252">
<meta NAME="GENERATOR" CONTENT="Microsoft FrontPage 3.0">
<meta NAME="Template" CONTENT="C:\Program Files\Microsoft Office\Templates\friends.dot">
</head>

<body bgcolor="#FFFFFF" link="#008000">

<h1 align="center">The One With Joey's Big Break</h1>

<hr>

<p>Teleplay by: Wil Calhoun<br>
Story by: Shana Goldberg-Meehan<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a></p>

<hr>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, everyone but Phoebe are there reading. Rachel is sitting on the
couch flanked by Ross and Monica. She suddenly stops reading and starts blinking her left
eye as if it's bothering her. The problem is that Joey is on her left and thinks she's
winking at him and winks back. Ross is watching this and isn't quite sure of what to make
of it.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What's going on?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, my eye is a little itchy.</p>

<p>(Ross turns to look at Joey.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Uhhh, mine too! Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (To Rachel) Wow! It's really red! You should go see my eye doctor.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Richard? I'm not gonna go see your ex-boyfriend!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, Richard. That's all I ever hear, Richard, Richard, Richard!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Since we've been going out, I think I've mentioned his name twice!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay, so Richard, Richard!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> It's not Richard! Okay? It's this new guy and he's really good.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, I'm sorry I'm not going to an eye doctor!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Oh God, here we go!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Anytime anything comes close to touching her eye or anyone else's she like
freaks out. Watch! Watch! (He takes his finger and moves it towards his eye.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (flinches) Ross! Come on! That's all right! Fine--Okay, I have a weird
thing about my eye. Can we not talk about it please?</p>

<p><b>All:</b> All right, fine.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey Rach, remember that great song, <i>Me, Myself, and I</i>? (And on
the &quot;I&quot; part she mimics poking her eye.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (flinches again) Monica! Come on!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey, does anybody want to get some lunch? All those in favor say I? (Pokes
his eye)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (freaks) Ross! Stop it! Come on!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> How much did <b>I</b> love <i>The King and I</i>? (Oh, you get the
point by now.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Chandler!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Me too! Me too! Me too! (Yeah, he does the same thing.) </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Just stop it! Come on!</p>

<p>(Joey howls in pain and holds his eye.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You okay there man?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah, I got too excited!</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Opening Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross, Chandler, Monica, and Phoebe are eating breakfast.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> All right, I gotta go. I'm taking Ben to the park.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ohh, give him a kiss for me!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> All right, bye!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Bye!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Bye!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Later! (Exits.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (after he's gone) I am so sorry you got caught in the middle of that. I
didn't mean to be so out there. I am furious with him!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Wow umm, calm down.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I'm trying, but <b>man</b> that guy can push my buttons!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Why are so mad at him?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Look, I don't wanna talk about it. Okay?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well, it just seems that&#133;</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> You wanna be on my list too? Keep talking! Has anyone seem my list by
the way?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Uh, no Pheebs. What's it look like?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Uh, it's a piece of paper and it says, &quot;Ross&quot; on it.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (entering, depressed) Hey. I just got off the phone with Estelle and guess
what. (Pause, then very excitedly) I GOT THE LEAD IN A MOVIE!!!!!!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You got the lead in a movie? That's amazing! What's the movie about?!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> It's called Shutter Speed, it's really cool! Yeah, umm, I meet this girl
in the subway and we fall in love in like a day, right? And <b>then</b>, she
disappears&#133; But I find out where she lives and when I get there this like old lady
answers the door and I say, &quot;Where's Betsy?&quot; Right? And she says, &quot;Betsy's
been dead for 10 years.&quot;</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ohh-oh, chilling!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> And the best part is, we're filming in the desert outside Vegas! (To
Chandler) And you know what that means buddy!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, I know that means buddy!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Road trip! Yeah, we can rent a car! I just have to be there by Tuesday!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh wait, my grandmother's dead.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, uh, we can talk about that too Pheebs.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No! No, her cab! She probably won't be using it; you can drive it to Las
Vegas.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> All right! Thanks Pheebs!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Whoa-whoa-whoa, what are we going to do about my job?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh umm, not go.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All right, great, road trip baby! (To Monica) This okay with you?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Chandler! You don't have to ask for my permission. (Quietly) You can go.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Thank you.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey Rach, come on! We're gonna be late for the eye doctor appointment!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (entering from her bedroom) All right! Let's get this over with! Ugh!
(She walks by the table and notices that no one is looking and accidentally on purpose
knocks over the open cereal box.) Ohhh! No! Look what I did! (She starts walking through
the mess. {Also, notice the continuity error in this scene. Note the position of the box
and dispersal pattern of the cereal before and after the camera cut.}) Oh, I mean, look at
this mess! I mean, we're probably gonna have to clean this up! Y'know? We're gonna have to
reschedule!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No. If you thought this mess is going to bother me, you are wrong! All
right, let's go Blinky! (She ushers Rachel out the door, but before the door fully closes
she sticks her head back in.) Chandler!!!! (Chandler agrees to clean up the mess.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Joey is reading a map as Phoebe enters.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh hey Joey! What's up?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I can't decide which route to take to Vegas. Hey, you've traveled a lot
right?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah, I've been around.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay, so-so which route should I take the northern route or the southern
route?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ooh, if you take the northern route there's a man in Illinois with a
beard of bees. {Okay, I must protest this, I've lived in Illinois all my life and know of
no man with a beard of bees! Wisconsin, on the other hand, might be a different story.}</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Great! Problem solved!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> But on the southern route there's a chicken that plays tic-tac-toe.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, back to square one.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, I know a way that you can decide! All right, I'm going to ask you a
series of questions and you answer as quickly as you can.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (quickly) Yes!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Good, but wait. Okay, all right, here we go. Now I want you to relax.
Take a deep breath. Clear your mind. (Quickly) Which do you like better peanut butter or
egg whites?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Peanut butter!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Which would you rather be a fireman or a swimmer?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> A swimmer!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Who would you rather sleep with Monica or Rachel?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Monica. Oh&#133; huh, I always thought it would be Rachel.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No thinking! No thinking! Tie or ascot?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ascot!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> North route or south route?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> North route!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Bamn! There you go! Huh?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Wow! That was incredible! Beard of bees, here I come!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (entering) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, this guy again. (She ignores him.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey man, what's up?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Uhh, not much. You guys want to see a movie tonight?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Sure, what do you want to see?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I don't know, umm&#133;</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, I know how we can decide. Phoebe, show him your game!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Umm, no thank you. (She gets up and moves to the couch. They were at a
table previously.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What's with her?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I don't know. But hey, I know we can decide. Okay, I'm gonna ask you
questions and you answer real quick. Okay?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What do you like better action or comedy?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Action.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Who would you rather sleep with Monica or Rachel? </p>

<p>(Ross pauses and looks at him, Joey motions for him to hurry up.) </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Dude, you are sick.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh, I'm sorry. I forgot you had that whole Rachel thing.</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica's eye doctor's office, Monica and Rachel are waiting in an exam room and
looking at this big white thing used to check eyes. I have no idea what it is, and if an
ophthalmologist happens to know what that is, let me know.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh my God! What does <b>that</b> thing do?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (looks at it more closely) Oh that's an eye removal machine.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> All right, I'm outta here!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I'm kidding! I'm kidding!</p>

<p>(Rachel heads for the door but is intercepted by the doctor.)</p>
<b>

<p>The Doctor:</b> Hi Rachel!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Hey!</p>
<b>

<p>The Doctor: </b>I'm Dr. Miller. Monica told me you were a little nervous, but don't
worry everything's gonna be just fine.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> So were done then!</p>

<p><b>Dr. Miller:</b> Almost! But first, we gotta start.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Dr. Miller:</b> This is a glaucoma test.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Uh-huh.</p>

<p><b>Dr. Miller:</b> Sit down.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Dr. Miller:</b> But your chin here. (She does so.) Now, you'll feel a small puff of
air in each eye.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (jerks back from the tester) What?!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> A small puff of air, now come on!</p>

<p><b>Dr. Miller:</b> Here we go.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> All right.</p>

<p><b>Dr. Miller:</b> 1&#133;2&#133;3! (Rachel jerks back on 3.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> I'm sorry. All right, I'll just stay in here this time. (Puts her head
back.) Okay.</p>

<p><b>Dr. Miller:</b> Ready?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Uh-huh.</p>

<p><b>Dr. Miller:</b> 1&#133;2&#133; (She flinches on 2 this time.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Y'know what, I'm gonna hold her head.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Dr. Miller:</b> That's okay.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay. (Monica backs off.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay. Okay!</p>

<p><b>Dr. Miller:</b> 1&#133;2! (She flinches again.) (Gives up.) Y'know what? You're
young; you probably don't have glaucoma.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (really excited) Great!! It was very, very nice to meet you sir--Ow!
Hey! What are you doing?! Are you crazy! (He took out that thing they use to look at
people's retinas and looked at Rachel's when she was shaking his hand causing her to
flinch and scream at him.)</p>

<p><b>Dr. Miller:</b> Okay. You've got a small, minor infection in that left eye. I want
you to take these drops three times a day and you'll be as good as new.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yeah, no, I don't-I don't put things in my eye.</p>

<p><b>Dr. Miller:</b> Okay then, I guess we'll see you back here in three months.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Great!</p>

<p><b>Dr. Miller:</b> And I'll fit you for a glass eye.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, just give me the damn drops! (Grabs them and storms out.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Dr. Miller? (She covers her right eye and reads from the chart) P E C F
D.</p>

<p><b>Dr. Miller:</b> Very good Monica! You know where they are.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I sure do! (She runs over to a drawer, opens it, and grabs a lollipop.)
(To Rachel) And you don't get one!</p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe, Rachel, Monica, and Joey are there.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Y'know, I-I gotta tell ya, those eye drops are a miracle. My eye is a
100% better.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> They're still in my coat.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Damn!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (entering) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey! You ready to go?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah, listen, how cold is it going to be there? Do I need a coat or
will all these sweater vests be enough? (Holds up 3 of them in different colors.)</p>

<p>(Monica stares at him.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I love you.</p>

<p>{There's another continuity error here. Before Monica says I love you, Chandler's
holding the vests so that you couldn't see the collar, you could see all three, and they
were folding nicely. After she says the line and the camera cuts back to Chandler, you can
only see two out of the three, you can see the collar of the top one, and it looks like it
was folded sloppily, unlike before. Hey, you notice things while spending this much time
on this!}</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Man, I wish Ross was coming with us! Y'know? I'm gonna miss him!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Thanks a lot! I just got that jerk out of my mind!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Hey, so where are we staying? Is the movie putting us up in a big
hotel suite?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Uh no, not really. It's an independent film y'know? So we don't have a
real big budget. I figured I'd just stay in your room.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I see, but once you get your first paycheck you'll be springing a big
hotel suite, right? I mean, lead in a movie, they must be paying you a lot?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Oh yeah! For every dollar Shutter Speed makes, one penny of it goes right
in Joey's pocket.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> So you don't get paid unless the movie makes money?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Did you not hear the plot of the movie? &quot;She's been dead for ten
years.&quot; I'm gonna be a millionaire!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (entering) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> I just wanna say good-bye to you guys <b>and</b> to see if you guys will
place a little bet for me, huh? Twenty bucks on black 15.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> You got it!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> All right!</p>

<p>(Joey nods to Chandler, no way!)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All right, bye-bye now!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Bye!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Bye you guys!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Bye-bye!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I wanna say good-bye at the car!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Anybody want to say good-bye to me at the car?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh honey, I'll say good-bye to you at the car if you don't mind the
puss.</p>

<p>(Pause.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> See ya! (Walks out.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, wait a minute! The puss is good! It means it's healing! (Runs
after him.)</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey Pheebs, what 'cha reading? (Phoebe ignores him) Pheebs? (Turns away)
Hello? (He sits down next to her and she moves over a bit.) Phoebe? (He moves closer and
she keeps moving away.) Phoe-Phoebe! (They end up hanging over the arm rest.) Come on! (He
grabs the magazine away from her.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, I'm sorry. I didn't see you there.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Phoebe, are you, are you mad at me, or something? 'Cause if are please,
tell me what it is I did!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, if you don't know I can't help you.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, I don't know.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Well, I can't help you.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well, whatever it is I'm-I'm very, very sorry. Okay?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Apology accepted.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay. So we're, we're good?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Uh-huh.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> All right. (Gets up.) I'll uh, I'll see you later, okay?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (quietly) Bye, fat ass. </p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> ALL RIGHT!! Phoebe now come on! Will you please tell me what it is I did
that mad you so mad at me!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I don't know! I don't remember!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Well if you can't remember, can't we just forget about this?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh no, I am mad at you. I know that much. But, I am sorry about the fat
ass thing. You actually have a very sweet little hiney. </p>

<p>(Ross isn't sure what to do with that comment.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Phoebe's cab, Joey and Chandler are headed across the George Washington bridge
on their way to Las Vegas. Joey is driving.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Man, I'm getting pretty tired. You're might have to take over soon.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> We've been driving for a half-hour, and you haven't looked at the road
once.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Don't worry, it's out there! (Just then a horn honks and Joey quickly
looks at the road.) I think I just need lunch.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> You wanna eat? (Pulls out the twenty) My treat!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Isn't that Ross's money?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah. Okay. Ross's treat! Where do you wanna eat?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I don't know.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Ooh, hey, I know how we can decide! All right, uh, I'm gonna ask you a
bunch of questions and then you have to answer real fast. Okay? So uh, clear your mind
Clear it right out! Clear it out! Clear!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Okay, uhh, would you rather be too wet or too dry?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Too dry.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Do you believe in ghosts, yes or no?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Is this movie gonna be my big break?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (shocked) What?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Yes.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Dude you said, &quot;No!&quot;</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I also said, &quot;Yes!&quot;</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> You don't think this is going to be a big break for me?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No! (Realizes) Ahhh!!!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I don't believe this!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Look Joe, I just, I just don't want to get your hopes up real high.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What are you talking about?! I'm the lead in a movie!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> They're not even paying ya! This doesn't even sound like a real movie!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Y'know what? I don't need this! Okay? I don't know why you're dumping all
over my big break.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Joe, I don't think this is going to be your big break.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Is that why you're on this trip, huh? Make me feel like a loser? 'Cause if
it is, I'll tell ya, I-I-I'd rather be alone.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, you don't want me on the trip?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Not if you're gonna be like this!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All right, I'll tell ya what, the next time you ask me a question like
that I'll lie.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah! I don't want you on the trip!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All right, fine! Fine! Why don't you pull over? I'll get out right
now!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Fine! (He slams on the brakes, stopping the car on the bridge to the sound
of numerous car horns.) Get out!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> You're not actually supposed to stop on the bridge.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Get out!!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> All right!! (Gets out and Joey speeds away.) Wait! Wait, there's no
sidewalk! Yeah, I'm gonna die here.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Commercial Break</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Central Perk, Ross, Phoebe, Rachel, and Monica are there. Ross is trying to
figure out why Phoebe's mad at him.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, are you mad at me because my hair gel smells?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Are you angry at me because I said your handwriting is childlike?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No that made me feel precious.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh, I know! Umm, is it because he's always correcting people's grammar?
Whom! Whom! Sometimes it's who!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Yeah? Sometimes it's&#133; (Does the fist thing.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh, did you beat him at a board game? He turns into such a baby when he
starts to lose.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Okay, <b>I'm</b> the baby. (Points at his eye.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Eh! Stop it!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (entering) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Chandler! What are you doing here?</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Joey kicked me out of the car on the George Washington bridge!</p>

<p><b>All:</b> Why?!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I don't know! He went crazy! Y'know, we were playing that game where
you-you ask a question and you answer it really fast.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> That game should not be played without my supervision. </p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Well, I don't know what mad him so mad, y'know? All I said was that
uh, I didn't think this wasn't gonna be his big break, that this movie wasn't going to do
anything for him, and that uh, y'know it didn't sound like a real movie--Okay, he
should've pushed me off of the bridge.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> What's in the bag?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, I figured you guys would all be mad at me. So I got you some gifts
that I found on the side of the road. (Looks into the bag.) Who wants the teddy bear with
one leg?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> I do!</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is trying to apply her eye drops while Monica looks
on.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay. (She tilts her head back and squeezes the eyedropper. The only
problem is, it's not over her eye.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Not even close.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, then y'know what? Help me! I need help! I can't do this!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay! All right! Let's do it!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> All right!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Sit down. (They sit down on the couch.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> All right.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Put your head back.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yes!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> All right.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Now, open your eyes.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay, they are. (No they're not.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> How many fingers am I holding up? (She's not holding any up.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (thinks) Four.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Oh my God, I was thinking four.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Really?!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yes! All right, y'know what? Why don't we start with a practice run?
Okay?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> No drops!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Great!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Okay.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> On three, 1&#133;2&#133;3! (Rachel turns her head on three to avoid the
drops.) Now my pillow's all wet! (She was trying to fool Rachel and squeezed the
eyedropper.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Well, well, you said it was practice!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Then why did you move?!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Because I knew you were lying!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> All right, come here! (She gets up and drags Rachel off of the couch by
her legs.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (as she's being dragged) What are you? Monica!! Stop it!! Oh my God!
Stop it! (Monica drags her totally onto the floor and on her back.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I am going&#133; I'm going--Turn it over! (Rachel rolled onto her
stomach and Monica rolls her back.) I'm&#133; I am going to get these drops in your eyes.
(She is holding Rachel down with both hands and has the eyedropper in her mouth.) </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh my God! You really are freakishly strong!</p>

<p>(Monica starts biting on the eyedropper, spraying the fluid all over. But Rachel keeps
turning her head back and forth and Monica keeps missing.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Monica! Stop it!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (spitting out the eyedropper) Damn! It's empty!</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Wow, y'know if Joey and Chandler walked in right now, we could make a
fortune! (Monica is straddling Rachel and holding her arms down. In a rather risqu pose,
at least for primetime TV.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, time lapse, Phoebe and Monica are playing cards as the
phone rings.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ooh that is definitely Chandler, Joey, or Ross. (Thinks) Or-or Rachel!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (answers the phone) Hello? (Listens.) (To Phoebe) It's Joey. (Phoebe's
proud of herself.) (To Joey) I'm so glad you called! Chandler told me what happened.
Y'know he's really upset about it.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (on a pay phone holding a box) Not as upset as he's gonna be when he finds
out what I did with his sweater vests!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What did you do to his sweater vests?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Let's just say there's a well-dressed pack of dogs in Ohio. Hey Monica
listen is-is Phoebe there? I gotta ask her something about the car.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Yeah, she's here. Hold on a second. (She hands the phone to Phoebe.)</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey, dude!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey Pheebs! Listen, this wooden box keeps sliding out from under the seat.
What-what is it?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh that's my grandma. (Joey holds the box away from him.) And thanks
Joey she's having a really great time. (Joey is happy now.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (who has just entered) Is that Joey? Is that Joey? Let me talk to him!
I wanna talk to him!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Okay Joey? Chandler's here, he was wondering&#133; (We hear the dial
tone as Joey hangs up.) Okay, I guess he ran out of change.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Y'know, he won't even talk to me. How am I going to apologize to him
if he won't even talk to me?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Well, maybe you should send him something. So that when he gets to Las
Vegas he'll know that you're sorry.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> That's a good idea. I wonder where I could (Pause) get a basket of
porn&#133;</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> No, don't-don't say I'm sorry with porn!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Really?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Y'know what you should send him? A cartoon of cigarettes. 'Cause that
why he could trade it for protection. No. That's prison.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> (entering) Okay Pheebs, I know how we're going to figure this out. Okay,
clear your mind and answer the first thing that comes into your head. Okay?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Uh-hmm.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> What do you like better flora or fauna?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Fauna.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Who would you rather be Simon or Garfunkle?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Garfunkle.</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Why are you mad at me?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> You said I was boring--Ohh!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> When did I say you were boring?!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh my God, I remember now! We were playing chess!</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Phoebe! You and I have <b>never</b> played chess!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, come on! Yes, remember that time on the frozen lake? We were playing
chess, you said I was boring, and then you took off your energy mask and you were Cameron
Diaz! (Realizes) Okay, there's a <b>chance</b> this may have been a dream.</p>

<p>[Scene: The desert outside of Las Vegas, Joey is arriving and we hear the song, <i>Name</i>.
Y'know, (singing) <i>I've been through the desert on a horse with no name! It felt good to
be out of the rain. In the desert, you can't remember your name, 'cause there ain't no one
for to give you no pain. La&#133;la&#133;la-la-la, la, la, la, la-la-la</i>. You get the
idea. Anyhoo, he pulls up and stops. As he gets out of the car, he spills a huge pill of
fast food containers out of the foot well.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey-hey! Stanley! Hey-hey! You're leading man is here! Let's get to work.</p>

<p><b>Stanley:</b> Umm, slight change of plans. We've shut down.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Wh-what?! Why?!</p>

<p><b>Stanley:</b> It's a money thing, we don't have any.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (laughs) You're kidding right?</p>

<p><b>Stanley:</b> No.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What?!</p>

<p><b>Stanley:</b> It-it's probably just temporary. We're hoping to get some more money
soon, so if could just uh, hang out.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Uh, hang out?! How long?</p>

<p><b>Stanley:</b> I don't know. A week? Maybe two? The money will turn up! People will
always wanna invest in movies! Hey, you're not rich are ya?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No!</p>

<p><b>Stanley:</b> Eh, worth a shot. (Gets into his car.) Look Joey, let me know where
you're staying, okay? (The car peels away.)</p>

<p>(I think one of the grips walk up to Joey, mainly because there's a credit for The
Grip. What the heck is a grip anyway?!)</p>

<p><b>The Grip:</b> Hey pal, are you Joey Tribbiani?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Yeah.</p>

<p><b>The Grip:</b> These got left for ya. (He hands him a bunch of helium balloons.)</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Thanks. (The grip walks away.) (Reading the card.) Congratulations on your
big break. </p>

<p>(The rest of the crew start to drive away leaving Joey sad, alone, and holding his
congratulatory balloons as the song comes up again. <i>La-la-la. See, I've been through
the desert on a horse with no name! It felt good to be out of the rain! In the desert you
can't remember your name, 'cause there ain't no one for to give you no pain. La-la-la, la,
la, la&#133;</i>)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the phone is ringing.]</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (answering it) Hello?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (on phone from Vegas) Hey Monica, it's Joey!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Hey Joey! Aww, you remembered even though you're a big star!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Aw, come on! It'll be years before I forget you!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Joey, what's it like on a movie set, huh? Do you have a dressing room?
Do you have a chair with your name on it?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Uh, well yeah-yeah, I've got all of that going on. Yeah, listen uh, I want
you to make sure you tell Chandler that he couldn't have been more wrong! Uh-oh! I gotta
go Monica, my uh, my sushi's here! </p>

<p>[Cut to Joey hanging up the phone in Vegas. He's wearing a Roman gladiator's uniform
and goes over to join a family to pose for a picture. You see, he's apparently taken a job
at <i>Caesar's Palace</i>.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (to the family) Sorry about that. Thanks for waitin'.</p>
<b>

<p>The Husband:</b> Okay!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Everybody smile! (The picture is taken) Okay, thanks a lot! Enjoy your
stay at <i>Caesar's</i>! We hope it's toga-rrific! (The family leaves.) Kill me. Kill me
now.</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Ending Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, The gang is surrounding Rachel at key positions.]</p>

<p><b>Ross:</b> Hey Rach, can you pass me the <i>TV Guide</i>?</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Yep!</p>

<p>(As she moves to get it, Monica yells&#133;)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Go!!</p>

<p>(Phoebe jumps to the floor as Ross tackles Rachel off of the couch. Chandler helps push
Rachel onto the floor by jumping over the back of the couch. Phoebe grabs Rachel's head to
hold it still and opens Rachel's eye as Monica jumps onto Chandler's back to administer
the torture--I mean medicine.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> What?!! Stop it! Stop it! Oh my God!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay! Okay! Okay! (She succeeds in getting the eye drops in and everyone
climbs off of Rachel.) We'll see you in about 3 to 4 hours.</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Oh! (She's trying to recover while still on the floor.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>End</strong></p>

<hr>

523<html>

<head>
<title>The One In Vegas </title>
<meta HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=windows-1252">
<meta NAME="GENERATOR" CONTENT="Microsoft FrontPage 3.0">
<meta NAME="Template" CONTENT="C:\Program Files\Microsoft Office\Templates\friends.dot">
</head>

<body bgcolor="#FFFFFF" link="#008000">

<h1 align="center">The One In Vegas</h1>

<hr>

<p align="left">Part I Written by: Andrew Reich &amp; Ted Cohen<br>
Part II Written by: Greg Malins &amp; Scott Silveri<br>
Transcribed by: <a href="mailto:Ericaasen1@aol.com">Eric Aasen</a></p>

<hr>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is sitting in the living room and Phoebe is
standing in the kitchen as the phone rings.]</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> Pheebs? Could you get that? Please?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Why? Just 'cause you're too lazy to get up off your touchie? </p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> No! No! It's just that all the people in the entire<b> </b>world that <b>I</b>
want to talk to are right here.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (smiles) Okay! (Goes to answer the phone.)</p>

<p><b>Rachel:</b> (under her breath) Sucker!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (answering the phone) Hello? (Listens) Hey Joey!</p>

<p>[Cut to Las Vegas, Joey is on the phone and wearing his gladiator costume.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hey Pheebs! Listen, uh can you do me a favor? I forgot the pin number to
my ATM card can, can you get it for me?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Sure! Where is it?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Uh, I scratched it on the ATM machine down on the corner.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ohh! So you're 5639?!</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> That's it! Thanks Pheebs!</p>

<p>[Cut to Monica and Rachel's]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (entering) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (to Joey) Ooh, do you want to talk to Chandler?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (To Phoebe) Is that Joey?! (She nods yes) Let me talk to him!</p>

<p>[Cut to Joey]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> No! (She nods no to Chandler) Because he didn't believe in my movie! Which
is a big mistake because it is real! Real!</p>

<p><strong>A Casino Boss:</strong> Hey! Tribbiani! Get back to work! Break time's over!</p>

<p>[Cut to Phoebe]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Who was that?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Uhh, my stunt double. Yeah, and y'know, he's getting a little too familiar
for my tastes.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (To Phoebe) Y'know what? I have been trying to apologize to him all
week! If he's not gonna let me do it on the phone, I'm gonna go down there and do it in
person.</p>

<p>[Cut to Joey]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Uhh Pheebs, I heard that. Can you put him on?</p>

<p>[Cut to Phoebe]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Yeah! (She hands the phone to Chandler.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (To Joey) Hey!</p>

<p>[Cut to Joey]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Don't come out here!</p>

<p>[Cut to Chandler]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No-no-no-no, I've supported you one hundred percent and I want to
prove that to you in person!</p>

<p>[Cut to Joey]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> I got that! I forgive ya! Don't come out here!</p>

<p>[Cut to Chandler]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Forgive me? You haven't been taking my calls in a week!</p>

<p>[Cut to Joey]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Well, I'm totally over it Chandler. Friends forever! Don't come out here!</p>

<p><strong>A Tourist: </strong>(To Joey) Would you mind doing a picture with us?</p>

<p>[Cut to Chandler]</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Uh, what was that?</p>

<p>[Cut to Joey]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Uh, <i>Entertainment Tonight</i>. [Cut to Chandler] Yeah, okay so, good
talking to ya and don't come out here. All right. (Hangs up the phone and poses for that
picture.)</p>

<p align="center"><strong>Opening Credits</strong></p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe is entering.]</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Monica! I'm sorry I'm late! (Starts looking around for her) Monica?
(Goes into Monica's bedroom.)</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> (entering) Phoebe? (Phoebe comes back into the living room) Oh, Phoebe,
I'm so sorry. Have you been here long?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> (saddened) It's okay. What the hell took you so long?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Okay, you can not tell Chandler. Okay? That I ran into Richard.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Which Richard?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> <b>The</b> Richard.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Richard Simmons?! Oh my God!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Noo! My ex-boyfriend Richard! Y'know the tall guy, moustache? </p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh! Okay, that actually makes more sense. So how was it?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> It was, it was really nice. We started talking and I-I ended up having
lunch with him.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> That is so weird! I had a dream that you'd have lunch with Richard.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Really?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> But again, Simmons. Go on.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> The strange part was, he was really nice, umm and he looks great, but I
didn't feel anything at all!</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Ooh! So now why can't we tell Chandler?</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> Because it would totally freak him out and tomorrow's our anniversary. I
just don't want anything to spoil that.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Oh, I can't believe you guys lasted a whole year!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I know.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Wow! I owe Rachel 20 bucks!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> What?</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> On a totally different bet.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (entering) Hey!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> I know. Can you believe it? One year ago today I was just your
annoying friend Chandler.</p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Awww! Now you're just <b>my</b> annoying friend Chandler.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Huh.</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I got you a present!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Oh, but it's not 'til tomorrow!</p>

<p><b>Monica:</b> I know, but you have to open it today! (Hands it too him.)</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Okay.</p>

<p>(He starts taking his time opening it. Finally Monica snaps.)</p>

<p>[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the scene is continued from where we left off before the

<p>[Scene: Las Vegas, we have the typical glamour shots of Vegas, the Strip, slot

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> Hey you guys wait! Guys! (Catches up to them.) This place is so much

<p><b>Monica:</b> Phoebe, you don't eat animals. </p>

<p><b>Phoebe:</b> For 99 cents, I'd eat you. (Sees the casino) Okay, I can totally settle

<p><b>Monica:</b> I'm so sorry.</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No-no, that's okay, apparently there's a new policy where we don't

<p>[Scene: <i>Caesar's Palace Casino</i>, Joey is approaching one of the blackjack tables

<p><b>Joey:</b> (to the dealer) Can I change a hundred? (He hands him his chip.)</p>

<p><b>Blackjack Dealer:</b> Changing one hundred! (Gives him the change.) Good luck sir.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> (betting all 100) Let's ride.</p>

<p><b>Blackjack Dealer:</b> (Deals the cards) 13.</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Hit me! (He does so.) Ohh man! (Joey busts and loses all the money, but

<p>[Cut to Chandler's room, Joey is relaying to Chandler his amazing discovery.]</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Chandler! You are <b>not</b> gonna believe this! I have found my identical
hand twin!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> (totally confused) What?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> What's an identical hand twin?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> What's it sound like? It's a guy with my identical hands! It was
incredible! Chandler, the dealer's hands were exactly like me! It-it was like looking at

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Are you sure you weren't (pause) looking at your hands in a mirror?</p>

<p><b>Joey:</b> Don&#146;t you see what this means?! I can forget about that stupid movie.
I'm gonna be a millionaire!</p>

Come on! Identical hands!</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> Again I must go back to, how?</p>

<p><b>Chandler:</b> No! No! I support you 100%! I just didn't, I didn't get it right away.

<p>(Joey starts to leave to embark on his genius moneymaking scheme, but is freaked out
